Characteristics: The church is made entirely of jackfruit wood, in Roman style combined with the stilt house architecture of the Ba Na people, completed in 1918.|||When visiting Kon Tum city, there's an address that tourists shouldn't miss: the unique and beautiful wooden main church that's nearly a century old.|||According to historical records, in the mid-19th century, there was a 120 km long road called the 'Salt, Ceramics and Gong' road from Quang Ngai to Kon Tum. This road was remote, rugged, and winding, starting from the Thach Tru intersection in Quang Ngai through Ba To, and Violac pass.|||It was a trade route for salt, ceramics, and gongs or other goods between the Kinh people and ethnic minorities in the area.|||At that time, French missionaries also used this road to begin their missionary work, building small wooden or bamboo and thatch churches to spread the faith.|||The first church was built in 1870.|||As the congregation grew, Father Joseph Decrouille was assigned to manage the Kon Tum parish.|||In 1913, he decided to build a larger church using ka chit wood.|||The construction of the church lasted until 1918, taking five years to complete.|||Despite going through many historical changes, the church remains intact and sturdy.|||The Kon Tum Wooden Church is a masterpiece designed in the Romantic architectural style, harmoniously combined with the traditional Ba Na communal house. It embodies the cultural and religious nuances of the highland people, from intricate patterns to distinctive details. The church complex is a self-contained structure comprising a church, reception house, exhibition house for ethnic and religious products, and a communal house. Additionally, it includes an orphanage, a sewing and weaving facility, and a woodworking shop.|||This structure was built with wood by skilled carpenters from Binh Dinh and Quang Ngai. The roof and walls of the church were made of soil mixed with straw, following the traditional house-building style of Central Vietnam. On the straw walls are colorful glass paintings of Jesus and the Virgin Mary that shine brightly when the highland sunlight shines through…|||The church's garden features a statue of the Virgin Mary holding the Infant Jesus made from a single piece of wood, carved in the rustic style of the ethnic groups in the Central Highlands. The cross and decorative statues outside and inside the church, such as the lambs and saints made from tree roots, create a space with a distinctively wild and primeval feel.|||You can visit the Kon Tum wooden church at any time. During the flower season, the roads leading to the church are lined with vibrant pink and white flowers, making Kon Tum even more beautiful.|||If you visit during Christmas, you'll find thousands of worshippers from different ethnic groups gathering at the church, often staying in the empty lot to the right for a week to attend the ceremony. These are the days when the church is lively and bustling with people shopping and selling.|||The market offers many handicrafts from local villages.|||On a typical day, the church is quiet, with rows of chairs used for prayer during services and sometimes as a place for students to study.|||The Kon Tum Seminary, built from 1935 to 1938 by the first bishop of Kon Tum diocese, is located not far from the Cathedral Church. It has a similar but larger architecture. As visitors enter through the gate, they feel relaxed surrounded by two rows of ancient sứ trees providing shade and a gentle fragrance. The second floor of the seminary has a tradition room displaying details about the missionary history in Kon Tum from the mid-19th century, including artifacts, notes... of priests on their mission, images, and documents related to the formation and development of Kon Tum diocese. All exhibited artifacts and maps in the seminary are valuable and meticulously carved in wood. This can be considered a small museum about daily utensils, agricultural tools, and cultural objects of ethnic minorities living in this province.

title: Tran Hung Dao Temple
description: Location: 36 Vo Thi Sau, Ward 4, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City. Characteristics: Among the many temples dedicated to the national hero Tran Hung Dao, this is the largest one in the South.|||The temple is situated in a spacious compound, which used to be the land of Van An Pagoda. In 1932, the Tran Hung Dao Temple was established within the old Van An Pagoda. In 1958, the temple was demolished and rebuilt into a larger and more magnificent one as it stands today.|||The temple has three gates facing Vo Thi Sau Street. At the entrance of the courtyard is a majestic cement statue of Tran Hung Dao in yellow and black. The temple is built in the shape of the character 'Dinh', covering an area of 200m2, with three consecutive rows of doors facing the courtyard. The main hall is adorned with many couplets and plaques praising the hero's talent, virtues, and remarkable achievements in the war against the Mongol Yuan at the end of the 13th century. The temple also honors other generals of the Tran Dynasty, such as Tran Quang Khai, Tran Khanh Du, Pham Ngu Lao, Yet Kieu, and Da Tuong. The main sanctuary features a 1.70m-high bronze statue of Tran Hung Dao in a sitting posture, cast by the Ngu Xa bronze foundry in 1957. On the left is an altar with the tablets of Tran Hung Dao's two daughters. On the right, four sons are worshiped. To the right of the temple courtyard is a small museum displaying artifacts, documents, maps, and excerpts from his famous proclamation.

title: Tuyen Lam Lake
description: Located about 6 km from the center of Da Lat city, Ho Tuyen Lam tourist area is likened to a green paradise with fresh climate, majestic nature and romantic scenery that can captivate any traveler visiting the flower city.|||A spiritual retreat on the windy highlands|||All travelers who have visited Tuyen Lam Lake agree that it's a picturesque scene with green mountains and blue waters, exuding an absolute serenity.|||Escaping the harsh sun and wind of the Central Highlands or the noise and dust of big cities, visitors here seem to step into a different world, where there is only an endless green of pine hills stretching along the mountain slopes, the chirping of birds every early morning, and the still lake shrouded in mist like a fairyland.|||As its name suggests, Tuyen Lam (Tuyen means stream, Lam means forest) has a majestic landscape with high mountains, dense forests, and intertwined streams, creating a romantic scenery. According to the five elements theory, Tuyen Lam is where all things begin to live, grow and flourish because water generates wood.|||Situated over 1,000m above sea level, Tuyen Lam Lake spans 360 hectares within a valley surrounded by lush green forests. The gentle breeze off the lake's surface brings a refreshing coolness to the air, making the atmosphere clean, pure, and spacious.|||In Tuyen Lam Lake tourist area, visitors can choose various ways to explore this place, such as taking a leisurely boat ride on the lake, fishing, elephant riding, mountain climbing, campfires, cultural exchange at the stilt house, or simply enjoying a hot cup of coffee by the lake to admire the beauty of Dalat.|||It's a miss to mention Da Lat without its colorful flowers. Nature has blessed Da Lat with a gentle climate, making it a paradise for flowers. From mimosa, buttercup, to cherry blossoms, they are all renowned flowers in the region. When spring arrives, delicate cherry blossoms with a touch of pink add joy and warmth to the scene. If you visit in autumn, around October to December, the paths leading to Tuyen Lam Lake are vibrant with the bright yellow of buttercups - a characteristic flower of the windy highlands.||||||As winter arrives, Tuyen Lam Lake, normally peaceful, becomes even more serene with floating white mist. For any traveler, the scenery around Tuyen Lam Lake is a picturesque natural painting that no camera lens or pen can fully capture.|||The first national tourist site in the country|||On February 15, 2017, the Prime Minister issued Decision No. 205/QD-TTg, officially recognizing Tuyen Lam Lake Tourism Area in Da Lat City as a National Tourism Area. This makes it the first National Tourism Area in the country.|||With an area of 2,900 ha, Tuyen Lam Lake tourist area currently has 10/36 projects implemented and put into use such as Edensee Resort, Datanla Waterfall tourist site, Tuyen Lam 18-hole Golf Course, Sacom luxury resort, Clay sculpture tunnel, Terracotta Dalat Resort, K'Lan eco-tourism spot, Binh An Village tourist spot, Truc Lam Zen monastery religious tourism spot, Thanh Quang orchid garden.|||Tourism and service activities at Tuyen Lam Lake Tourist Area are evaluated as rich and diverse, ranging from high-end resorts combined with conferences and seminars, entertainment, adventure sports to eco-tourism, spiritual cultural tourism… Alongside that, modernity, luxury and convenience are common features in all architectural constructions as well as services here.|||When visiting Tuyen Lam Lake, tourists can experience the climate of all four seasons in one day: a cool spring morning, a sunny noon like summer, a chilly autumn afternoon, and the cold of winter at night. Thus, traveling to Tuyen Lam Lake and Dalat city is like four-season tourism, no matter the day or month, Tuyen Lam Lake is always dreamy and beautiful like a precious gift that nature has given to this highland.

title: Truong Son Martyrs Cemetery
description: Location: The cemetery is built on Ben Tat hill, in Vinh Truong commune, Gio Linh district, Quang Tri province, about 38km northwest of Dong Ha town. Characteristics: This is the largest national martyrs cemetery, collecting tombs of youth volunteers, soldiers, and civilian workers who built and fought to protect the legendary Ho Chi Minh trail during the Vietnam War against the US.|||The construction started on October 24, 1975, and was completed on April 10, 1977. The cemetery covers 106ha, with 46ha for 10,327 martyrs' tombs divided into 5 zones. The central area on a 32.4m high hill has a towering white stone memorial, solemn and hollow with three missing sides, symbolizing immense loss. Four zones with martyrs' tombs are arranged by province and city on five hills. The tombs are interspersed with forests. The paths are paved with stone, brick, or cement, with flowers blooming year-round. Each zone has a memorial house with architecture reminiscent of different regions across the country.|||The cemetery welcomes around 20,000 domestic visitors annually to pay respects to the martyrs. Many foreign delegations travel thousands of miles to visit the Truong Son Martyrs Cemetery.

title: Pu Mat National Park
description: Located in Anh Son, Con Cuong and Tuong Duong districts, Nghe An province.|||The park covers an area of 91,113 ha and is considered to have the largest area of natural forest in Northern Vietnam, recognized as a national park by the state in 2001.|||Pu Mat National Park is evaluated by domestic and international scientists as one of the special-use forests with high biodiversity value in the North Central region and Vietnam. Pu Mat is not only a priority area for biodiversity conservation but also an attractive ecotourism destination with majestic and poetic landscapes that nature has bestowed upon Nghe An.|||The park has a very diverse and rich flora with 1,513 species of higher plants belonging to 159 families and 545 genera. There are 220 species of medicinal trees such as Chinese angelica, Vietnamese ginseng, cinnamon, and many timber species. The fauna includes 42 large mammal species, 20 small mammal species, and 295 bird species.|||Entering Pu Mat National Park, visitors seem to enter a heavenly land with numerous trees and plants. The park is suitable for developing ecotourism and adventure tourism, allowing visitors to explore and learn about the customs of ethnic minority groups.

title: Khai Doan Pagoda
description: Location: Khai Doan Pagoda is located at 89A Phan Boi Chau Street, Thong Nhat Ward, Buon Ma Thuot City, Dak Lak Province. Characteristics: It is a pagoda for Vietnamese people living in Dak Lak. The pagoda was built in 1951-1953 on a spacious and wide plot of land.|||The pagoda has a "tam" style architecture, with a three-gate entrance, a main hall in the middle, and an ancestral hall at the back. The three-gate entrance has two floors with three high 7m, wide 10.5m arches. The Quan Am Hall is built separately from the main layout of the pagoda, with a hexagonal shape and six decorative dragon cloud columns.|||The main hall is 320m², divided into two parts. The front part is built in the style of a Tay Nguyen long house with columns and a Vietnamese communal house. The rear part is built in a modern style. The main hall enshrines Sakyamuni Buddha. The pagoda has a 380kg bronze bell cast in 1954.

title: Ba Danh Pagoda - Ngoc Mountain
description: Location: Located on the banks of the Day River, in Dan Xa village, Ngoc Son commune, Kim Bang district, Ha Nam province, about 10km northwest of Phu Ly city. Characteristics: Ba Danh Pagoda is associated with the folk saying "Empty as Ba Danh Pagoda".|||From Hanoi, take National Route 1 or Phap Van highway for about 60km to Phu Ly city, then turn right through Hong Phu bridge into National Route 21 for about 10km, visitors will see Cam Son suspension bridge. Going through Cam Son bridge and turning up a section of the dike road is Ba Danh Pagoda with a gentle landing on the banks of the Day River. On both sides of the road leading to the pagoda are rows of ancient trees shading the way.|||Initially, Ba Danh Pagoda (also known as Bao Son Tu) was built with simple bamboo and rattan structures to worship the Goddess who helped the land have favorable weather, bountiful harvests, and a prosperous life. Therefore, the pagoda is named Duc Ba village Dan, commonly referred to as Ba Danh Pagoda. Due to its remote location, difficult transportation, and sparse population, the pagoda was rarely visited by pilgrims, leading to the folk saying "Empty as Ba Danh Pagoda". In the reign of King Le Hy Tong (1675-1705), the pagoda was rebuilt more beautifully and grandly. During the resistance war against France, Ba Danh Pagoda was a crucial gathering point for forces and supplies.|||The current structures of the pagoda were built in the 19th century, including main items such as Tien Duong, Trung Duong, Thuong Dien, Mau Temple, and To House… The Tien Duong has 3 compartments with 2 chaises, bitted gables, and a tile roof with a moon-shaped decoration. The system of pillars in Tien Duong is intricately carved with themes of four linh, five blessings, four precious things, eight fruits, and eight treasures… Trung Duong has 3 compartments with 2 chaises and a system of closed doors and shutters.|||The Thuong Dien is dedicated to the Three Jewels, Jade Emperor, and Thai Thuong Lao Quan. The Mau Temple worships Tu Phap (Phap Van - cloud god, Phap Vu - rain god, Phap Loi - thunder god, and Phap Dien - lightning god) and Ba Chua Danh. The statue of Ba Chua Danh is carved in a meditative posture on a black throne with a gentle face.|||The pagoda's grounds have various trees like areca, yellow orchid, sứ, and bưởi… along with ornamental pots harmoniously arranged, creating a serene and peaceful space.|||About 100m north of Ba Danh Pagoda is Ngoc Mountain, with an ancient ficus tree over a hundred years old. From the mountain peak, one can observe a scenic view of the landscape.|||Ba Danh Pagoda - Ngoc Mountain was recognized as a national historical and cultural relic in 1994.

title: ATK - Safe Zone of the War
description: Location: ATK is located in Phu Dinh commune, Dinh Hoa district, Thai Nguyen province. Characteristics: This is where President Ho Chi Minh and Party and State leaders lived and worked from 1947 to 1954 to lead the 9-year resistance war against the French colonialists.|||This historical site ATK was ranked as a national historical site by the State in 1981.|||Currently, ATK still has many relics of where the President lived and worked such as the house foundation, working tunnel, the bush tree planted by President Ho, the stone where he often rested... ATK is a place that records many important historical events of the nation. On December 6, 1953, at Ti Keo hill, the Politburo of the Central Party Committee held a meeting to approve the strategic plan for the 1953-1954 winter-spring offensive to win the famous Dien Bien Phu battle, successfully ending the long and difficult resistance war of the nation. Many important decrees of the Democratic Republic of Vietnam were signed and issued here, including the law on military service, the decree on general mobilization... on reducing land rent and land reform... ATK was also the capital where diplomatic activities took place.|||In 1990, a monument to President Ho Chi Minh was built on Ti Keo hill, Thai Nguyen province, a historical museum, a guest house... At the center of Phu Dinh commune, a traditional house was built, introducing and displaying many precious artifacts.|||Along with main historical sites such as Ti Keo hill, Khuon Tat, Na Nom... the ATK relic cluster has many other historical sites such as: De pass, Hong mountain, Mr. Cao Nhat's house - one of the first revolutionary bases of the North Vietnam Party in 1939-1945; Man forest - where the North Vietnam Party set up a communication station and opened a political and military training class, comrade Truong Chinh, the Party's General Secretary at that time and comrade Hoang Quoc Viet had come here to work; Mai Son pagoda - where the North Vietnam Party set up a special printing house, printing the Liberation Flag newspaper and many important documents; Kha Son communal house - where the first revolutionary government of the commune was established... All these historical sites have been ranked as national historical sites.|||Visiting ATK, tourists can return to a former war zone, to better understand the activities of Vietnamese people who dedicated their lives to the cause of protecting their beloved homeland.

title: Tra Que Vegetable Village
description: Located about 2km northeast of Hoi An ancient town center, between De Voong River and Tra Que pond, Tra Que Vegetable Village belongs to Tra Que village, Cam Ha commune, Hoi An city.|||Tra Que vegetables have been famous for a long time with many products grown on fertile land, fertilized with types of seaweed taken from the river, giving them a unique flavor.|||For a long time, Tra Que vegetable village has been famous for growing over 20 kinds of leafy vegetables and herbs, especially many types of vegetables that are not as fragrant and delicious as anywhere else, such as basil, perilla, and purple perilla. When mixed together, these vegetables provide a combination of 5 flavors: spicy, sour, sweet, bitter, and astringent.|||Thanks to its special flavor, Tra Que vegetables have contributed to making Hoi An and Quang Nam's distinctive folk dishes famous.|||Although the vegetable cultivation area is only a few dozen hectares, growing vegetables has become a main occupation of the villagers for generations. Since Hoi An tourism started to thrive, the village has also developed prosperously.|||Visiting Tra Que Vegetable Village, tourists can become real farmers, wearing farmer clothes, sandals, and conical hats, and being taught how to dig, plant, water, and care for vegetables. After bathing and resting, tourists can enjoy dishes made from Tra Que's unique vegetables and Quang Nam specialties such as banh dap, banh vac, mixed hen, tom huu, Quang noodles, and Hoi An cao lau.|||Every year, on the 7th day of the first lunar month, Tra Que people organize the Cau Bong festival to pray for favorable weather and a bountiful harvest.|||Tourists can reach Tra Que by bicycle, boat, or other means, and the village with its unique vegetables grown using clean vegetable technology is a new and attractive type of tourism, attracting many domestic and international visitors.

title: Hue Imperial City
description: Location: Hue Imperial City is located on the north bank of the Huong River in Hue City, Thua Thien - Hue Province. Characteristics: The Imperial City of Hue was built with Western architecture combined with Eastern citadel architecture in a skillful way.|||Hue has been chosen by the Nguyen Lords as the capital of the "Coastal Region" and officially became the capital under the Tay Son dynasty. For nearly 4 centuries, Hue has become a complex of architectural monuments and magnificent landscapes, and this ensemble of monuments has been recognized by UNESCO as a world cultural heritage.|||The Imperial City of Hue - the overall architecture of the ancient capital Hue was built on an area of over 500ha and bounded by 3 concentric walls: Kinh Thanh, Hoang Thanh and Tu Cam Thanh.|||The overall architecture uses Ngu Binh mountain as a front and the two small islands on the Huong River, Con Hen and Da Vien, as the feng shui elements of a dragon and a tiger (Green Dragon on the left, White Tiger on the right) to protect the ancient capital.||||||The Imperial City of Hue was built by King Gia Long starting in 1805 and later completed by King Minh Mang in 1832. The Nguyen dynasty kings constructed many walls, palaces and royal buildings there. After nearly 200 years, the imperial city remains largely intact with almost 140 structures of various sizes.|||The citadel is square with a perimeter of 10km, 6.6m high and 21m thick, featuring 10 gates. There are 24 fortresses established around and on the wall for defense. Additionally, there is a small gate leading to Tran Binh Dai called Thai Binh Mon.|||The Imperial City (Dai Noi): Located in the center of the citadel, it was the site of the highest authorities of the monarchy and the place of worship for deceased kings. The Imperial City has a nearly square shape, approximately 600m on each side, built with bricks, 4m high and 1m thick, surrounded by a moat and four gates. Only Ngo Mon gate was reserved for the king. Dai Noi comprises over 100 beautiful architectural works divided into several areas:|||From Ngo Mon Gate to Thai Hoa Palace: where major ceremonies of the imperial court were held.||||||Triet Mieu, Thai Mieu, Hung Mieu, The Mieu and Dien Phung Tien: Temples dedicated to the Nguyen royal family.||||||The Imperial Treasury: a warehouse storing precious items and a manufacturing workshop for royal family goods.||||||Co Ha Garden and Kham Van Hall: where princes studied and played.|||The Forbidden City: is the inner city wall located within the Imperial City, right behind the Thien Hoa Hall. The Forbidden City was exclusively for the emperor and his family. It was built in 1804. The wall is 3.72m high, built of bricks, 0.72m thick, with a perimeter of about 1230m, 324m in the front and back, and over 290m on the left and right. It includes nearly 50 large and small architectural works and has 7 entrances. Dai Cung Mon is the main gate at the front, reserved for the emperor. Can Chanh (where the emperor works daily). Can Thanh (where the emperor resides), Cung Khon Thai (the residence of the Royal Concubine). Duyet Thi Duong (a theater), Thuong Thien (a kitchen for the emperor), Thai Binh Lau (a library for the emperor)…|||In addition, Hue is also famous for the tombs of the Nguyen kings. The seven tombs, each with its own unique character, are remarkable feats of human creation, blending with the majestic, beautiful and poetic natural scenery of Hue.|||The ancient capital of Hue with the Huong River, Nguu Mountain and imperial palaces, tombs, temples, pagodas have had hundreds of years of history. Today, the Vietnamese people and the international community are contributing to restoring and preserving this cultural heritage site.

title: Hoi An City
description: Hoi An City is located in the lower reaches of the Thu Bon River junction in the coastal plain of Quang Nam Province, about 30km south of Da Nang City. The average annual temperature is 25ºC; the average annual humidity is 82%, and the average annual rainfall is 2,066mm. The residents are mainly Vietnamese (Kinh) and Chinese. In December 1999, UNESCO recognized Hoi An Ancient Town as a World Cultural Heritage.|||The city has 13 communes and wards (9 wards, 3 communes on land and 1 island commune). Residents in three communes on land mainly produce agriculture and fishing, while some communes have traditional crafts such as wood, bronze, and ceramics. Tan Hiep Island commune has a natural area of about 15km2, comprising seven islands, mostly mountainous, with Cham Island being the largest and famous for its special bird's nest product. Hoi An also has 7km of coastline, and Cua Dai Beach is one of the clean and beautiful beaches in Hoi An and Vietnam.|||From the 16th to the 19th century, Hoi An was an international trade center on the East-West trade route, a thriving commercial port of the Nguyen Lords in Vietnam, with trading ships from Japan, China, Portugal, Spain, the Netherlands, etc., coming to exchange and buy goods. Throughout its history, Hoi An has been known to the world by many different names, including Faifo, Haisfo, Hoai Pho, Ketchem, and Cotam. Archaeological sites and relics, architectural works, have proven that Hoi An is a convergence of many cultures: Cham, Vietnamese, Chinese, Japanese, etc., with the most significant influence of Vietnamese and Chinese cultures.|||To date, Hoi An Ancient Town has preserved nearly intact a cluster of ancient architectural relics, including many houses, assembly halls, temples, pagodas, wells, family shrines, ports, markets, and narrow streets running horizontally and vertically, forming a chessboard-like pattern. The scenery of Hoi An streets is generally characterized by a mossy, ancient look, like a living painting. The existence of an urban area like Hoi An is a unique case in Vietnam and rare in the world, considered a living museum of architecture and urban lifestyle.|||In addition to its cultural values through diverse architecture, Hoi An has also preserved a substantial intangible cultural heritage. The daily life of residents, with their customs, beliefs, folk art, and cultural festivals, is being preserved and promoted, along with the picturesque natural landscape, traditional villages, specialty foods, etc., making Hoi An an increasingly attractive destination for tourists.|||According to statistical documents, Hoi An has 1,360 relics and scenic spots, with 11 types of relics, including 1,068 ancient houses, 19 pagodas, 43 temples, 23 communal houses, 38 family shrines, 5 assembly halls, 11 ancient wells, 1 bridge, and 44 ancient tombs. In the ancient urban area, there are over 1,100 relics.

title: Trong Mai Island
description: Location: Hon Trong Mai is located in Sam Son town, Thanh Hoa province. Characteristics: The stone blocks have beautiful shapes and are precariously perched, associated with a legend about a faithful love.|||They are three large stones naturally arranged and standing there for generations. One large flat stone lies at the bottom like a pedestal. One stone with a pointed head lies on top, resembling a rooster. One smaller stone faces it, with a hen-like appearance.

title: Tri Nguyen Aquarium
description: Located on Bong Nguyen Island (also known as Hon Mieu) in Nha Trang Bay, Nha Trang City, Khanh Hoa Province, 5km south of Nha Trang city center. This tourist site is a collection of marine species in an open model.|||After about half an hour by motorboat from Ca Da Pier, visitors will arrive at Tri Nguyen Aquarium. Here, visitors can stroll around the lake or sit on the wooden dock, observe the activities of colorful marine species.|||The aquarium system is a sea lake separated by a coral stone wall high enough to keep the water level equal to the sea, divided into 4 areas, with an area of 150-200m², the largest lake and most fish species raised up to 3ha. The walkway between the lakes is paved with stone or concrete. Along the path around the lake, many types of trees are planted such as white sứ, hoàng lan, phi lao, bàng lá tròn...|||The first lake is an outdoor lake - where familiar fish like tuna, mackerel, and stingray are raised. Hidden in the rocky caves are squid, lobster, some weighing up to 3kg. The second lake is an indoor lake, raising small but valuable fish species. The third lake raises turtles and sea turtles, including turtles weighing over 100kg. The fourth lake is the largest, adjacent to the hill and sea, where various types of fish from small anchovies to several hundred kg are raised. This aquarium system also has rare and exotic species like seahorses, Japanese carp, Napoleon fish, Picasso fish… This place is like a mini ocean, not only providing visitors with relaxing and entertaining moments but also an opportunity to learn more about marine life.|||After visiting the aquarium system on the basement floor, visitors continue to the first floor to buy souvenirs or enjoy specialties at the restaurant on the second floor. Interestingly, all three floors of this tourist site are placed in a unique architecture designed like an ancient ship 60m long and 30m high. On the ship's deck, there is a model of a mast and a cannon. This is an ideal location for visitors to admire the scenery of Nha Trang Bay.|||A few hundred meters away from Tri Nguyen Aquarium is Soi Beach - a pristine beach with the sea in front and a forest with many ancient trees and dense vines behind. This is a suitable place for various recreational activities for visitors.

title: Tam Dao Tourist Area
description: Location: Tam Dao Tourist Area is located in Tam Dao town, Tam Dao district, Vinh Phuc province, 86km from Hanoi. Characteristics: The climate here is very unique, with four seasons in a day; the scenery is poetic and majestic. The best tourist season in Tam Dao is summer.|||Nature and the passage of time have gifted Tam Dao with a wonderful landscape: both poetic and majestic, with a mystical atmosphere amidst clouds, wind, and mist swirling around the mountain peaks and descending to the grasslands and houses on the mountain slopes. Summer is when Tam Dao is at its most beautiful.|||Tam Dao is a long mountain range approximately 80km long, running northwest-southeast, and 10-15km wide, making it an ideal mountain retreat in the North. Tam Dao covers an area of 253ha, situated at an altitude of 900m above sea level. From Vinh Yen town, Vinh Phuc province, after a 1-hour drive, you can reach Tam Dao. Another 20km of winding road through straight pine tree-lined slopes, shrouded in mist, will lead you to Tam Dao.|||Tam Dao mountain has three prominent peaks: the central peak, Ban Thach, standing at 1,388m; on the left is Thien Nhi peak (Sky Market) at 1,375m, featuring a 93m-tall television tower; and on the right is Phu Nghia peak at 1,400m.|||Tam Dao town spans over 300ha, nestled in a small valley of the Tam Dao range, and is also one of the largest national parks in the North. The climate here is very unique, with four distinct seasons in a single day. In the morning, it's cool like spring; at noon, it's warm like summer; in the afternoon, it's misty and windy like autumn; and at night, it's cold like winter. The town is small and charming, with winding roads, and a stream running through it all year round.|||In the early 20th century, the French built this place into a resort with 200 villas, hotels, restaurants, sports facilities, swimming pools, and dance floors.|||The road to Tam Dao mountain is a bit challenging but very scenic. Flowers like orchids, chrysanthemums, and various wildflowers bloom along the way, emitting a unique fragrance and displaying vibrant colors. Countless butterflies flutter around the flowers and people's hair, and fly alongside visitors in flocks, like Tam Dao's messengers welcoming guests. At the peak, with a panoramic view in all directions, one can see the vast expanse of sky, land, wind, and clouds.|||From the town center, taking a small path to the right down to a deep valley, Thac Bac (Silver Waterfall) hides in the mountain, mysteriously cascading down a stream of white water, shimmering with sunlight and reflecting a rainbow. A small stream about 30m high pours water down, blending with the wind, creating sounds of streams, forests, and leaves echoing off the stone walls, sounding ancient and profound. For the adventurous, a trip to Dinh Rung Rinh peak offers a landscape of trees and mountains that seems straight out of a fairy tale, with large trees wrapped in orchids, and birds singing vibrantly. Further on is Tam Dao 2, a former ideal summer retreat during the French era, now abandoned and wild, exuding a sense of solitude.

title: Dong Xanh Park
description: Location: Dong Xanh Park - A cultural space of the North Central Highlands, located in An Phu commune, Pleiku city, Gia Lai province. Feature: This is a place to rest, relax and explore the cultural identity of the Central Highlands.|||Dong Xanh Park - A cultural space of the North Central Highlands, invested and built by Gia Lai Culture - Tourism Joint Stock Company, located in An Phu commune, Pleiku city, Gia Lai province.|||From the center of Pleiku city, along National Highway 19 about 10km, visitors have arrived at Dong Xanh Park.|||With an area of about 8ha, Dong Xanh Park is situated on An Phu rice field with an area of about 14ha; in the distance are villages of Gia Rai and Ba Na ethnic groups with beautiful communal houses, long houses; suspension bridges over streams and the music of the forest is playing lively and melodiously.|||When coming to Dong Xanh Park, the first thing visitors see is a statue of two elephants made of stone - symbolizing the Central Highlands people's skill in taming wild elephants, located at the entrance. Going further inside, visitors can see a system of bungalow guesthouses built by the lake, flower garden to serve visitors who want to stay overnight, a water park and wave lake - the first in the Central Highlands, a lotus pond with beautiful rock arrangements, a garden with many birds and animals such as ostriches, deer, leopards, bears, crocodiles... Particularly, walking through Dong Xanh Park full of rare flowers and plants, visitors will see a fossilized tree over 1 million years old - the largest in Vietnam, found in Chư A Thai volcano mouth, Ajun Pa district, Gia Lai province; visit the King of Water statue (Pờ Tau Ia) and some other architectural works bearing the distinctive features of the Central Highlands.|||Besides, visitors can learn and explore the unique and mysterious features of the Central Highlands culture through the architectural model of communal houses, long houses; through legends combined with patterns and motifs on the Central Highlands scenery symbol; through the music of ethnic villages such as the sound of T’rưng water, rice mortar, the sound of gongs and drums... and join in the festive atmosphere of the Central Highlands festivals.|||With fresh, airy and poetic atmosphere, Dong Xanh Park is really an ideal tourist destination for visitors to come here to relax, explore and participate in exciting entertainment activities such as boat trips, duck riding, fishing...

title: Den Truc - Ngu Dong Son
description: Location: Den Truc - Ngu Dong Son is located in Quyen Son village, Thi Son commune, Kim Bang district, Ha Nam province. Characteristics: Den Truc - Ngu Dong Son Temple worships the national hero Ly Thuong Kiet. This scenic spot has a picturesque natural landscape, majestic mountains and hills, a temple situated in a poetic bamboo forest, and a unique system of caves.|||Located 8km from Phu Ly town, right on road 21A, there is a small mountain shaped like a lion, named Cam Mountain.|||The mountain holds a legendary tale, making it a well-known landmark. In the past, it was covered in lush green bamboo forests, with bamboo swaying gently in the wind. In 1089, General Ly Thuong Kiet's fleet sailed through Quyen Son village on a southern campaign. Suddenly, a strong gust of wind blew, snapping the mast and lifting the army's large flag to the top of the mountain.|||Ly Thuong Kiet then ordered the boats to stop, and together with his soldiers, went ashore to perform a ceremony to pray to heaven and earth for a great victory. After that great victory, Ly Thuong Kiet and his troops came here to hold a thanksgiving ceremony, reward the army and organize a festival for the villagers to celebrate the victory. The festival lasted for a month with all sorts of entertainment.|||The incident of the flag being blown away by the wind led Ly Thuong Kiet to name the mountain Cuon Son. Later, to commemorate the merits of the talented general, the villagers of Cuon Son built a temple dedicated to Ly Thuong Kiet at the very place where he held the festival.|||The temple was built in the middle of a large bamboo forest, so it's called Bamboo Temple. After nearly a thousand years, the bamboo forest is not as pristine as it used to be, but around the temple, there are still countless bamboo trees. The golden-bodied bamboo trees sway gently in the wind, making the scenery here even more poetic. Over time, the temple has only managed to retain some of its basic features.|||The temple is made of lim wood, over 6m high. The front house is a 5-room structure. The chevron system with variations in the form of a rường frame with con nhị appeared at the end of the 17th century and became popular at the end of the 19th century.|||The three rear rooms are built in the same style as the front house, with two butted ends, semi-circular roof tiles, built with thất bricks, and exposed trusses.|||The doors are carved with four precious themes.|||When visiting Truc Temple, don't forget to stop by Cuon Son (now called Cam Mountain) next door. Perhaps because of its association with a legendary auspicious event in the past, the mountain holds spiritual significance for the local people. That's why Cam Mountain still retains much of its pristine beauty with a rich ecosystem. On the peak of Cam Mountain, there is a naturally formed stone chessboard - a place where mythical immortals often gather to play chess, drink wine, and admire the earthly scenery. Right next to the chessboard is a square hole called the 'emperor's tomb'.|||Mount Cam features a unique cave system: 5 connected caves forming a continuous cave system called Ngu Dong Son. The caves' structures are diverse with many types of stalactites and stalagmites of various shapes, evoking rich imagination for tourists: shapes like a mother's milk, a steaming rice pot, an elephant, a turtle... Their colors, porosity, and texture also differ. Some stalactites hidden in darkness sparkle like jewels when lit by torches. Others resemble a lying drum, a hanging drum, or a set of clappers, and remarkably, when struck, they produce a realistic sound.|||The poetic and unique landscape of Cam Mountain has captivated many wandering poets and travelers, inspiring beautiful poems that have been passed down. Today, visiting Truc Temple and Ngũ Động Sơn, tourists will feel as though they've entered a mystical realm, and next year, they'll want to wander back again.

title: Lang Co Beach
description: Location: Lang Co Beach is about 10km long, located in Lang Co town, Phu Loc district, Thua Thien - Hue province, situated next to National Route 1A, near Hai Van Pass. Characteristics: Lang Co is the 30th member of the 'Club of the Most Beautiful Bays in the World' in June 2009.|||Lang Co is an ideal destination for sea lovers. Situated on the central coastal strip with many famous beautiful beaches, Lang Co with its gentle slope, white sand, clear blue water, and an average temperature of about 25°C in summer, is an attractive destination for domestic and international tourists.|||With enchanting natural scenery, stretching along the most beautiful coast of the country, Lang Co almost has everything that nature can offer: the green of tropical forests, strips of fine white sand, abundant sunshine, and cool, crystal-clear blue sea. This is the third bay in Vietnam, after Ha Long and Nha Trang, to be named in the list of the 30 most beautiful bays in the world.|||Lang Co has a stunning landscape and is very suitable for resort tourism. In the past, King Khai Dinh (Nguyen dynasty) built a retreat called 'Tinh Viêm Retreat' for the king and royal concubines to cool off in the summer. The French also left their mark here, related to the name of this land. Lang Co may originate from 'Lang Co' or 'L'An Cu' which was mispronounced by the French. Today, Lang Co attracts many large domestic and international tourism investors, and many modern resorts have been and are being built.|||Coming here, no one can resist the charming natural beauty of Lang Co town. This small and peaceful town offers tourists a wonderful time for relaxation and many beach activities. Besides, tourists can enjoy precious seafood, visit some famous sites like Chan May, Lang Co fishing village near the beach.|||Located on the 'Central Heritage Road', Lang Co is close to famous attractions such as Hue Imperial City, Hoi An Ancient Town, Son Tra Peninsula - where the Son Tra Nature Reserve is located, and many beautiful beaches. The beauty of Lang Co Bay, Hai Van Pass, Bach Ma National Park, and ancient fishing villages here always attracts tourists by the perfect harmony between humans and nature.|||Lang Co is 60km from Hue city center but only 40km from Phu Bai International Airport. If tourists come to Lang Co from Da Nang city through Hai Van Pass tunnel, it takes about 25km. However, the longer route over Hai Van Pass is still chosen by many adventurous tourists. They will have the opportunity to admire and capture spectacular and majestic scenery and especially admire the romantic Lang Co Bay from the high pass.

title: Hong Linh Mountain
description: Location: In Thien Loc commune, Can Loc district, Ha Tinh province. Characteristics: A mountain range with 99 peaks|||This place has around 100 temples and pagodas. There are ancient temples like Huong Tich or Chan Tien, where you can still see footprints of people and horses on the stone (linked to the legend of Immortals descending to earth). The majestic and poetic scenery of Hong Linh is also the birthplace of Vietnam's great poet - Nguyen Du, a world cultural celebrity.

title: Tam Coc - Bich Dong
description: Location: The cave is located in the Ngu Nhac Son mountain range in Dam Khe village, Ninh Hai commune, Hoa Lu district, Ninh Binh province.|||Features: The beautiful scenery of Bich Dong is dubbed the "Second most beautiful cave in the South".|||According to Mr. Pham Duy Phong, Director of Ninh Binh Tourism Information and Promotion Center, Tam Coc field is one of the most beautiful fields in the Red River Delta with stunning views from above. Therefore, from 2018 to present, on the occasion of the mid-May, Ninh Binh tourism organizes Ninh Binh Tourism Week, with the theme of Tam Coc golden season to attract tourists to Ninh Binh, experience the unique features and prominent values of local tourism resources, especially those of the World Natural and Cultural Heritage - Trang An Complex of Scenic Grottos.|||This year's Ninh Binh Tourism Week "Golden Colors of Tam Coc - Trang An" features various activities, including the "Photo Tour - Golden Season of Tam Coc" photography tour. Through this photo contest, Ninh Binh has many outstanding works to promote domestically and internationally. To ensure safety for artists and tourists taking photos during the Ninh Binh Tourism Week, the organizing committee conducted survey trips to rice fields and ideal photo spots to install stairs for "photographers" to easily conquer high points on the mountain.|||Based on the experience of photographers and the Organizing Committee, Ninh Binh has 4 best spots for aerial photography. They are: Hang Ca mountain peak for shooting in, Trai Bo mountain peak for shooting out, Chia Voi mountain peak for horizontal shooting, and Hang Mua mountain peak for shooting down.|||From the top of Hang Mua, visitors can see two rice fields with different colors. The rice in Tam Coc and Ngo Dong river fields is a short-day variety planted by locals to avoid floods, so it starts ripening in mid-May. Meanwhile, the rice in the field near Hang Mua tourist area is a long-day variety, and its harvest season begins in June.|||The best time to take stunning photos is between 9-11 am. If you arrive too early, the sky will still be misty and there will be few boats on the river. If you arrive too late, the sun will be high, and the photos will lack shadows to accentuate the field's contours.|||For those with a passion for photography and good health, they often choose the most beautiful spots on the mountain peaks to capture the panoramic view of the serene Ngo Dong River. The river winds its way through the golden rice fields, where busy farmers harvest their crops amidst joyful chatter. Small boats overflow with golden rice.|||All these elements come together to create stunning landscapes of Tam Coc during the golden harvest season that touch the heart.|||To preserve the natural landscape, environmental protection efforts in Tam Coc and Ninh Binh in general have received significant attention from authorities and locals. Through exchanges with local boat operators, they share that every year they receive guidance on the importance of maintaining a clean and beautiful ecological environment and a safe, friendly social environment.|||The local residents are aware that protecting the natural environment will preserve the beauty of the resources and landscapes sustainably, contributing to local tourism development, creating stable and long-term jobs and income. A safe and friendly social environment will make a good impression on tourists, making many people want to return to Ninh Binh and introduce others to Ninh Binh tourism. Therefore, local people are very proud of the scenery here and often remind each other to protect the environment, preserve the landscape and good cultural values of the ancient capital.

title: Datanela Waterfall
description: Location: Datanela Waterfall is located near Prenn Pass, about 5km from Da Lat city. Characteristics: Although Datanela Waterfall is not as majestic and loud as other waterfalls in Da Lat, it has a special charm that attracts those who love adventure and exploration.|||The name Datanela comes from the K'Ho language, 'Da-Tam-N'ha', meaning 'water under the leaves', related to the Cham, Lat, and Chil wars in the 15th-17th centuries. From National Route 20, take a 300m downhill path to a small valley, and visitors will find Datanela Waterfall with its attractive and pristine scenery.|||The waterfall cascades down from a 20m high cliff, winding through multiple layers of rock crevices and disappearing into the deep forest, creating a stream that appears and disappears, inviting and challenging travelers.|||The area features smooth, beautiful rocks, and legend has it that fairies from heaven used to come here to bathe, which is why it's also called Suoi Tien (Fairy Stream). Further down, visitors will encounter a deep and mysterious gorge known as the Valley of the Death God. This is a dangerous area where accidents can easily happen, and it's recommended that only professional units with proper safety equipment organize expeditions. Visitors should not recklessly explore the secrets of Datanela's Valley of the Death God.

title: Ba Den Mountain
description: Location: Thanh Tan Commune, Tay Ninh City, Tay Ninh Province, approximately 110km northwest of Ho Chi Minh City. Features: Ba Den Mountain is the highest peak in Southeast Vietnam with majestic natural scenery, a system of caves, and ancient temples.|||Mount Ba Den is also known as Van Son Mountain due to its year-round cloud cover.|||Mount Ba Den is associated with the legend of a beautiful girl named Ly Thi Thien Huong.|||She was loved by Le Sy Triet, from Quang Hoa (now Trang Bang district, Tay Ninh province), who was talented and ambitious, and had gone to serve Nguyen Hue to protect the country.|||On the occasion of Doan Ngo Festival, she followed a pilgrimage group to Mount Mot to pray for peace in the country and for her lover to return soon. However, she was surrounded and captured by the authorities with intentions to harm her. In her desperation, she jumped off the mountain to maintain her loyalty to her lover. That night, she appeared in a dream to the head monk of the temple on the mountain, asking him to bring her body back for burial. After her death, she became very spiritual and was believed to protect and bless the people, so a shrine was built for her on the mountain. When Nguyen Anh became king, known as Gia Long, he remembered the advice of the Lady that helped him escape and hid on the mountain. He then conferred upon her the title Linh Son Thanh Mau and had a black bronze statue made for worship. Since then, Mount Mot has been called Mount Ba Den.|||The Ba Den mountain complex covers an area of about 24km², consisting of 3 peaks: Heo mountain - Phung mountain - Ba Den mountain. With a height of 986m, from a distance, Ba Den mountain looks like an upside-down hat on the plain.|||To reach the summit, visitors can take various routes such as hiking, taking a cable car (the 1200m long cable line), or using the slide system.|||The slide system at Ba Den mountain is a closed system with two routes: the lift route (up) is 1190m long and the slide route (down) is 1700m long.|||Scattered from the foot to the top of Ba Den Mountain is a complex of architectural works including temples, pagodas, shrines, towers... reflecting the characteristics of Buddhist culture and folk beliefs. The highlight is Ba Den Pagoda (Linh Son Tien Thach Temple) also known as Thuong Pagoda and Ba Temple, where the bronze statue of Ba Den is located. Ba Den Pagoda was renovated and rebuilt in 1997. Notably, the pagoda still keeps two green stone pillars carved during the time of To Tam Hoa (1919) in the front hall, each 4.5m high, 0.45m in diameter, beautifully carved with winding dragons.|||Next to the pagoda is Ba Temple built into the mountain from a natural stone roof protruding out to form a cave. The roof of Ba Temple is 2.5m high and the artificial worship house in front is 8m long.|||In addition, on the mountain there are several other temples such as: Phat Temple with a reclining Buddha statue, Hang Temple (Linh Son An Phuoc Tu), Ha Temple, Trung Temple (Linh Son Phuoc Trung Tu), and Van Son Temple.|||Intertwined with the temple system are many caves that have been repaired by monks and Buddhists to serve as places of worship, including: Thanh Long Cave, Ong Ho Cave, Ba Co Cave, Ba Tuan Cave, Thien Thai Cave, Ong Ta Cave, Gio Cave...|||At the foot of the mountain is the Cultural Tourism Area of Ba Mountain with many entertainment areas, restaurants and hotels.|||Due to its special strategic location, during the two resistance wars against France and the US (1947-1975), Ba Den Mountain was a site of many fierce battles fought by our army and people against French colonizers and American imperialists.|||Currently, there are 3 display sites showing artifacts and images of the Liberation Army officers and soldiers: Kim Quang Cave, the Hang Temple area, and a museum at the foot of the mountain.|||Every year, on the occasion of spring, especially on the 15th day of the first lunar month, tourists from inside and outside the province gather at Ba Den mountain to go on pilgrimages, pay respects and visit.|||On January 21, 1989, Ba Den Mountain was recognized as a national historical and scenic site by the Ministry of Culture and Information (now the Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism).

title: Pho Hien
description: Location: Pho Hien is located in Hung Yen City, Hung Yen Province. Characteristics: Pho Hien is famous as a trading port from the 13th century. Today, Pho Hien still preserves a complex of ancient architecture and a renowned specialty, the Pho Hien - Hung Yen longan.|||Many Vietnamese people know the saying "The first is the capital city, the second is Pho Hien". The capital city is now Hanoi. Pho Hien is now a district town of Hung Yen Province, about 60km from Hanoi.|||From Hanoi, take road number 5, then turn onto road 39A, passing through corn and rice fields, and rows of lush longan trees to reach Pho Hien.|||Since the 13th century, Pho Hien has been a trading port. From the 15th century onwards, ships from China, Japan, Thailand, Malaysia, Indonesia, England, and France docked at Pho Hien.|||However, as the Red River receded, Pho Hien gradually gave up its position as a trading port to Haiphong, but retained its ancient cultural values. Today, Pho Hien still preserves a complex of ancient architecture with 60 historical sites, 100 steles, and many temples and pagodas. Pho Hien has a famous specialty nationwide, the longan (called longan because the longan tree bears many fruits, and people make a protective cage for the fruit cluster so that birds cannot eat it). The longan has a thick pulp, thin skin, and small seeds, and tastes sweet and refreshing like sugared water chestnut. In the past, Pho Hien longan was selected to be offered to the king. The ancient longan tree, dating back to the 16th century, still has lush branches and leaves.|||When visiting Pho Hien, tourists should not miss Pho Hien Market, a completely peaceful rural market like the calm surface of a half-moon lake in the center of Pho Hien.

title: Non Nuoc Marble Village
description: Location: Non Nuoc Marble Village is located in Hoa Hai Ward, Ngu Hanh Son District, Da Nang City. Characteristics: This is a famous place producing marble art products well-known domestically and internationally.|||It seems that no one visiting Ngu Hanh Son would miss Non Nuoc Marble Village. The village was formed in the 18th century by Huynh Ba Quat, an artisan from Thanh Hoa Province. By the 19th century, the entire village had adopted this profession.|||The raw material used to create these art products is marble, previously mined in Ngu Hanh Son Mountain. The mountain's marble features multi-colored patterns, exuding elegance and luxury, making it a sought-after material in construction and architecture. Artisans from the village have breathed life into the once inanimate stone.|||The process involves multiple stages, some of which are extremely laborious and tedious; however, the joy of creating a masterpiece and the admiration of those who appreciate it have strengthened the bond between the villagers and their work.|||The marble art products are quite diverse: Buddha statues, saint statues, human statues, animal statues…, smooth, colorful stone bracelets with intricate carvings. When visiting Ngu Hanh Son, tourists can comfortably select souvenirs crafted by local skilled artisans.

title: Thac Ba Lake
description: Location: The lake is located in Luc Yen and Yen Binh districts. Characteristics: This is one of the three largest man-made lakes in Vietnam, formed during the construction of Thac Ba hydroelectric dam.|||Thac Ba Lake is a man-made lake with an area of 23,400ha, featuring 1,331 islands with diverse vegetation and ecological landscapes. The lake water is clear and green, reflecting the surrounding old forests. Thousands of islands on the lake, with caves like Hang Hum, Hang Cau Cuoi, Bach Xa cave, and Thac Ba temple, create an attraction for tourists. The Cao Bien mountain range runs along the lake, making it a beautiful scenery. Thac Ba Lake is also a historical site, where the Tran Nhat Duat-led Thu Vat battle took place in 1285, defeating a Yuan-Mongol army.|||In the upper lake region, there are still some places that served as bases for central agencies during the resistance war against France. In the middle of Thac Ba Lake, there is Mong Son cave, where the Yen Bai Provincial Party Committee worked during the US war of destruction. Thac Ba Lake is a beautiful scenic spot, planned to become an eco-tourism center, combining lake entertainment with mountain climbing and forest exploration.

title: Chu Mom Ray National Park
description: Location: Chu Mom Ray National Park is located in Sa Thay and Ngoc Hoi districts, Kon Tum province, about 30km northwest of Kon Tum city. Characteristics: This place is considered to have an extremely rich and valuable forest capital, hard to compare with any other national park or nature reserve in Vietnam.|||Chu Mom Ray National Park was established on the basis of Chư Mom Ray Nature Reserve with an area of over 56,000ha. It has the highest biodiversity in the system of National Parks in Vietnam and is the only National Park in Vietnam bordering Laos and Cambodia.|||According to statistics, Chu Mom Ray National Park has nearly 1,500 plant species belonging to 154 families and 551 genera, including 131 rare and endangered species such as orchids, gymnosperms, dipterocarpaceae, and conifers. Besides, there are about 2,000 other rare plant species like: Kim giao, Thong tre, Trac, Cam lai.|||In addition to the rich flora, the fauna here is also very diverse with about 452 species, including 115 mammal species, 276 bird species, 44 reptile species, and 17 amphibian species. A notable feature of the National Park is that it has about 114 species listed in the Red Book of Vietnam and the world. Especially, Ja Book grassland - a valley with an area of over 9,000ha in Chu Mom Ray National Park has attracted many rare and endangered hoofed and carnivorous animals such as: Wild buffalo, tiger, Bovis mutus, elephant, Asiatic black bear, clouded leopard, and many other reptiles and amphibians.|||With high biodiversity and many precious gene sources, in 2004, Chu Mom Ray National Park was recognized as an ASEAN Heritage by the Association of Southeast Asian Nations.|||Coming to Chu Mom Ray, tourists not only have the opportunity to explore the rich natural resources but also visit some attractive tourist sites like: Truong Son road, H 67 - a historic site of the heroic Tay Nguyen army with Sac Ly hill, Phoenix airport, Bo Y international border gate, Yaly hydroelectricity and learn about the customs and habits of local ethnic people.

title: Dong Xam Silver Village
description: Location: Dong Xam silver village is located in Hong Thai commune, Kien Xuong district, Thai Binh province. Characteristics: It is a famous silver village with artistic products.|||Dong Xam silver village (formerly known as Duong Tham) is situated on the right bank of the Dong Giang river. Historical records show that the village was formed at the end of the Tran-Ho period, over 600 years ago.|||However, the silver engraving profession appeared much later. The village still has a shrine and a stone stele in the Duong temple (in today's Thuong Gia village). That is a literary stele of the ancestor of the profession (built in 1689). The stele mentions:|||"In the 10th year of the Chinh Hoa reign, ancestor Nguyen Kim Lau (...) from Bao Long, came to Dong Xam and established 12 guilds to teach the art of metalwork."|||Translated: In the 10th year of the Chinh Hoa reign (1689), ancestor Nguyen Kim Lau, who was a goldsmith in Bao Long, came to Dong Xam and established 12 guilds to teach the art.|||Nguyen Kim Lau lived in the early 17th century. Thus, the Dong Xam silver engraving profession has existed for nearly 400 years. Initially, it was a profession of soldering copper, making buckets and barrels, sharpening knives and scissors, fixing locks, making handles and spouts for water pots, pipes, etc. Later, it focused on making jewelry and engraving silver.|||Like many other high-end handicrafts, such as copper casting and metallurgy, the metalwork profession brings high income to the craftsmen, and the technique is very complex, so for centuries, the people of Dong Xam have kept the profession a secret. Today, this technique is no longer exclusive to Dong Xam craftsmen, but some technical and artistic skills are still kept secret. The old silver engraving guilds had strict rules in the village's regulations: anyone who taught the secrets to others, or made fake products to deceive others, would be heavily punished...either beaten in front of the ancestor's house or expelled from the guild.|||Dong Xam silver products are distinct and superior to those of other places in terms of unique shapes, decorative motifs, and artistic techniques. The characteristic of Dong Xam products is their mastery and perfection. The talent and meticulousness of Dong Xam silver artisans can meet the demands of even the most discerning customers.|||After many changes, the profession is still maintained and developed today.

title: En Cave
description: Located in the core zone of Phong Nha - Ke Bang National Park, Quang Binh Province, a UNESCO World Heritage Site.|||En Cave is considered the third-largest cave in the world, after Son Doong Cave (Vietnam) and Deer Cave (Malaysia).|||The cave was surveyed and announced in 1994 by the British Royal Caving Association (BCA).|||En Cave is a majestic wet cave, 1645m long, with a 120m high ceiling, 140m wide, and 170m at its widest point, with three entrances.|||The cave has a stable temperature of 20-21 degrees Celsius, even during the hot season.|||Inside the cave, there are two crystal-clear water lakes, one cold and one warm, perfect for relaxation after a long trek.|||The cave also features a large campsite that can accommodate hundreds of people, with natural light pouring in from the main entrance.|||Visitors to En Cave are awestruck by the massive 300-million-year-old stalactites and stalagmites.|||The cave was also a filming location for the movie 'Pan and the Neverland' directed by Joe Wright.|||En Cave serves as the only entrance to the world's largest cave, Son Doong.|||The best time to visit En Cave is during the dry season, from March to August.

title: Hoi An Ancient Town
description: Location: Belongs to Hoi An City, Quang Nam Province.|||The World Heritage Committee of UNESCO recognized Hoi An Ancient Town as a World Cultural Heritage at its 23rd session from November 29 to December 4, 1999, in Marrakesh, Morocco.|||Hoi An Ancient Town is a typical example of a traditional Southeast Asian trading port in the 15th-16th centuries. This trading port had early roots dating back to before the Common Era with the Sa Huynh culture, which continued to develop under the Champa Kingdom (2nd-15th century AD) and flourished during the Dai Viet and Dai Nam periods (15th-19th centuries). Along with archaeological sites and relics dating back over 2000-3000 years, there are numerous architectural monuments, mostly made of wood, dating back to the 17th-19th centuries.|||In 1999, 1360 relics and scenic spots were documented, including various types of structures such as communal houses, temples, tombs, shrines, wells, family temples, assembly halls, and houses. These are distributed along narrow traditional streets, bearing a strong local Vietnamese character while also reflecting significant cultural exchange and integration with Eastern and Western countries.|||Over many centuries, the traditional cultural values of the people of Hoi An, along with customs, daily activities, entertainment, and traditional cuisine, have been well-preserved and promoted.

title: Cham Islands
description: Location: Cham Islands are located in Tan Hiep island commune, Hoi An city, Quang Nam province, approximately 15km from Cu Dai and 18km from Hoi An ancient town to the east. Features: This is one of the few islands in Vietnam that still retains a relatively large vegetation cover, and is the habitat of many rare and precious onshore and offshore animals.|||Covering over 90% of its area with primeval forests, Cu Lao Cham preserves many rare gene sources of flora and fauna. The island is home to hundreds of medicinal plant species growing alongside ancient trees like goc mat, lim xanh, cho nau, and boi loi do, as well as other rare plants like lan nhung and tram huong.|||The diverse flora and vegetation on the island have become the habitat of hundreds of wild and rare animal species, including the long-tailed macaque and the swiftlet, which have been listed in the Red Book of Vietnamese Animals.|||The swiftlet nesting sites on the rocky islands, with openings high tens of meters, have become an interesting tourist attraction for visitors to Cu Lao Cham over the years.|||Coral reefs are a distinctive feature of tropical seas and a typical characteristic of the island sea area of Cu Lao Cham, representing a precious resource for Vietnam and the region. Therefore, while staying on Cu Lao Cham Island, activities such as swimming, snorkeling, and scuba diving to observe coral reefs are highly favored by tourists. In the crystal-clear water, visitors can freely observe, take photos, and record videos, capturing the vibrant and colorful images of coral reefs and various precious marine life.|||The Cham Islands not only boast diverse biodiversity but also possess unique cultural and historical values. These include relics from the Sa Huynh, Champa, and Dai Viet cultures, as well as sites linked to the residence of ancient inhabitants dating back 3,000 years. The islands are home to over 20 ancient architectural works built by both the Cham and Vietnamese people hundreds of years ago, such as Hai Tang Pagoda, village well, Ong Tomb, Ba Temple, and Yen Bird Nest Temple.|||The islands also feature intriguing natural landscapes like Ba Cave, To Vo Cave, Bao Gao Island, Tinh Spring, Mo Spring, which are attractive destinations for many tourists.|||When visiting Cu Lao Cham, tourists can immerse themselves in the fresh sea air with golden sandy beaches and crystal-clear waters. They can explore the simple local lifestyle and experience the warm hospitality of the fishing village residents. Visitors can join a bonfire night and enjoy local specialties like lobster, bird's nest, sea snails, stone crab, sea cucumber, and various types of clams and snails.|||Cham Island is not only known for its stunning eco-landscape, but also leaves a good impression on tourists with its unique features, such as being the first island to not use plastic bags, and having eco-labeled stone crabs. Additionally, the island also considers and implements tourism capacity research to satisfy the growing demands for sightseeing, entertainment, and relaxation of tourists.|||With its outstanding and unique natural and cultural values, Cu Lao Cham was recognized by UNESCO as a World Biosphere Reserve on May 26, 2009.

title: Huyen Tran Cultural Center
description: Location: at the foot of Ngu Phong mountain in Ngu Tay village, Thuy An commune (now An Tay ward), Hue city. Characteristics: a complex of architectural works with strong cultural, spiritual and historical significance.|||Located about 7km west of Hue city, the Xuan Tran Cultural Center covers an area of over 28ha. This place is not only a cultural and spiritual tourist destination but also a historical site, taking visitors back to the significant historical event of protecting and expanding the country's borders during the Tran dynasty in the 14th century.|||The story goes that King Jaya Simhavarman III of Champa (Che Man) gave two districts, O and Ly, to King Tran as a wedding gift to marry Princess Huyen Tran. Following the orders of her father, King Tran Nhan Tong, and her brother, King Tran Anh Tong, Huyen Tran put aside her personal feelings and sailed with her husband, establishing a peaceful relationship and expanding Vietnam's territory to the South. This marked the birth of Thuan Hoa - Phu Xuan - Thừa Thiên Huế, which has now been over 700 years. To commemorate the princess's merit, the Nguyen Dynasty (1802 - 1945) built the Dai De Vuong Temple in Lich Doi village, Duc ward, Hue city, to worship the national founding heroes, including Princess Huyen Tran. This temple no longer exists. On the occasion of the 700th anniversary of Thuan Hoa - Phu Xuan, in early 2006, the Huyen Tran Cultural Center was started to be built to remember the princess's contribution to expanding Vietnam's territory.|||The Huyền Trân Cultural Center is a cluster of traditional architectural structures surrounded by rolling hills and mountains, creating a serene and solemn atmosphere. Entering from the outside, visitors pass by four large pillars, at the foot of which are stone qilin serving as guardians. This leads to a spacious area with three broad steps made of Bat Trang tiles, accompanied by a pond and a bridge similar to the Trung Dao bridge crossing the Thai Dich lake in front of the Thai Hoa Hall of the Imperial City of Hue. Further in lies the tam quan gate, and at the heart of the complex is the temple dedicated to Princess Huyền Trân. All structures are aligned on a single axis. Inside the temple, there is a 2.37m high bronze statue of Princess Huyền Trân seated on a throne, crafted by renowned bronze artisans from the Duc ward, Hue city.|||The rear hall is dedicated to Đoàn Nhữ Hài, a historical figure known for helping King Tran Anh Tong escape the wrath of the former King Nhân Tông by drafting a petition. He was also the first Vietnamese official to take charge and pacify the people of the two districts of Ô and Lý when they rejoined Đại Việt.|||In the Xuan Tran Cultural Center's grounds, there are many other notable architectural works, particularly the 7m-tall Peace Bell Tower built on Ngũ Phong peak with a 1.6-ton bronze bell, 2.16m high, crafted by Duc ward artisans. The resonant bell chimes spread peacefully, offering people moments of serenity and calm.|||On the path to the Peace Bell Tower, you'll find a massive Laughing Buddha statue with a perpetual smile. The incense burner before the statue constantly emits fragrant smoke as visitors from all directions respectfully offer prayers, wishing for good fortune and smooth sailing…|||Alongside, to commemorate the founder of the Truc Lam Zen sect - King Tran Nhan Tong, the Huyentran Cultural Center is gradually being developed into a spiritual tourism and cultural site, a national Zen tourism destination. At the end of October 2008, a Tran Nhan Tong statue was initiated in Duc Hue ward. The 3m-high, 2-tonne statue made of pure red copper was cast according to a version from the Tran kings' temple in Nam Dinh. In addition, the center is investing in researching and building more items such as: Meditation hall; Calligraphy house; Orchid house; Library to preserve and study mainly documents about King Tran Nhan Tong, Tran Anh Tong, Princess Huyn Tran ... along with other heroic figures during the Tran dynasty; about Truc Lam Zen through dynasties, Hue culture and Champa architectural history along with some other supplementary services for literary creation, health exercises, yoga…|||To meet the needs of customers visiting, offering incense, worshiping, and commemorating, the Tran Van Hoa Cultural Center offers tourism services, souvenir shops, and documents related to the Tran dynasty era. Especially on holidays, traditional vegetarian meals are served at Trung Quang and Trung Hoa Halls within the Tran Nhan Tong Temple complex.|||Every year on the 9th day of the first lunar month, the Temple Festival of Huyền Trân takes place at the Center.|||It is attended by thousands of locals, national citizens and tourists to commemorate the ancestors who contributed to the country's expansion.

title: Thanh Ha Pottery Village
description: Location: Thanh Ha Pottery Village is located in Thanh Ha ward, Hoi An city, Quang Nam province.|||The products of Thanh Ha pottery have many unique shapes, colors, and durability. The pottery craft of the village originated from Thanh Hoa, after absorbing some pottery techniques from Quang land, it formed a craft village with pottery products serving daily life such as bowls, plates, jars, vases, flower pots... With the main material being clay, along with the skillful hands of artisans, the pottery products have many distinct features.

title: Tan Long Stork Garden
description: Location: This stork garden is located in Long Binh commune, Nga Nam town, Soc Trang province; 17km from Phu Loc town (following provincial road 42). Features: For nearly thirty years, this place has formed a bird sanctuary with thousands of storks living on familiar bamboo and coconut trees of Mr. Huynh Van Muoi's family.|||In recent years, Mr. Muoi has welcomed tourists to visit the stork garden. Here, he built an over 10-meter-high observation tower for visitors to admire the storks in his 1.5ha garden.|||The storks living here are of several species: white stork, oriental white ibis, black-necked stork, and more. Along with the opportunity to observe the real life of the storks, visitors can rest, relax, camp in the green campus or enjoy many local specialties.

title: Dambrri Waterfall
description: Visiting Lam Dong, tourists not only get to immerse themselves in the romantic space of vibrant flower beds or ripe strawberry gardens, but also experience the thrill of conquering Dambrri waterfall - one of the highest and most majestic waterfalls in the land of a thousand mountains.|||Dambrri Waterfall is part of the Dambri eco-tourism complex, located about 18km from Bao Loc city center, Lam Dong province. In the cool highland air, the over 60m high waterfall pours down day and night, creating tiny white foam and a misty, dreamy atmosphere. On sunny days, tourists have the chance to admire shimmering rainbows on the water's surface.|||There are two options for tourists to reach the waterfall: taking the stairs or the elevator. From the elevator, tourists can see the majestic Dambrri waterfall in all its glory, with rushing water creating a scene like a fairyland. For adventure-seekers, conquering the stairs designed along a gentle slope will be an interesting and unforgettable experience. Along this walking path, tourists can also stop to visit the Lady Buddha cave, rest at wooden pavilions, and breathe in the fresh air filled with the scent of trees and grass.|||The majestic scenery of the highlands is enhanced by a nearly 1,000ha eco-complex with diverse flora and fauna. The primeval forest here owns hundreds of precious wood species like sa, eucalyptus, and fragrant wood, as well as colorful flowers blooming all year round.|||What could be more wonderful than on hot summer days, immersing oneself in the cool nature, strolling across an old bridge covered in green moss to listen to the pure sounds of the primeval forest and admire the beauty of Dambrri waterfall, both majestic and romantic?

title: Chua Ong Temple
description: Location: 24 Tran Phu Street, Hoi An City, Quang Nam Province. Characteristics: Chua Ong Temple worships Quan Van Truong, a symbol of loyalty - faithfulness - integrity - righteousness, so it's also called Quan Cong Mieu.|||Chua Ong Temple was built in 1653 and has undergone 6 restorations in 1753, 1783, 1827, 1864, 1904, and 1906. The temple is built in the "Quoc" style with many houses combined. The tiled roofs have colored glaze, and the eaves are decorated with dragon and kylin figures made of colored ceramic pieces. The temple still preserves valuable artifacts such as royal decrees, 30 horizontal boards, over 10 sets of couplets, statues of Quan Cong, Quan Binh, Chau Thuong, and many steles. Chua Ong is a religious architectural relic of great value and a tourist attraction for domestic and international visitors.

title: Duong No Village
description: Location: Duong No village is located in Phu Duong commune, Phu Vang district, Thua Thien - Hue province, about 8km from Hue city. Characteristics: Duong No is a Vietnamese village that was built and developed quite early. As a child, Ho Chi Minh lived here with his father when teaching. The village currently preserves a memorial house and artifacts associated with the childhood of Ho Chi Minh.|||A few centuries ago, Duong No was a bustling and wealthy rural village with a tradition of literature and martial arts. The village communal house was built a long time ago. Duong No communal house is quite famous for its beautiful and impressive architecture, a typical relic of the traditional Vietnamese village model.|||In 1898, Nguyen Sinh Huy (Ho Chi Minh's father) was invited by Nguyen Viet Tuyen, an official of the Ministry of Justice from Duong No village, to teach his children for the imperial examination. During that time, Nguyen Sinh Cung (Ho Chi Minh's name at that time) followed his father to Duong No village. Here, he started learning Chinese characters with his father's students. His father and he were provided with a five-room house (three rooms and two wings) by the Nguyen Van Do family for living and teaching. Cung lived with his father in Duong No until 1900 when his father had to go to Thanh Hoa for the imperial examination.|||The house in Duong No faces southeast, about 30m from the Pho Loi river. The house was later damaged by fire and rebuilt into one gian two chái by Nguyen Van Do. After the southern region was liberated and the country was reunified, the local people maintained and restored it to its original architecture as a memorial site to show the nation's respect and admiration for Ho Chi Minh.|||Today, visitors to Duong No can revisit the house where Ho Chi Minh lived during his childhood, the ancient communal house, the river, the wharf, Am Ba shrine, and Bay ho communal house where he used to hang out and play with friends.

title: Vinh Trang Pagoda
description: Location: Vinh Trang Pagoda is located on Nguyen Trung Truc Street, My Phong Commune, about 3km from the center of My Tho City, Tien Giang Province. Characteristics: Vinh Trang Pagoda is the largest Buddhist pagoda in Tien Giang Province, recognized as a national historical and cultural relic in 1984. The pagoda features a blend of Asian and European architectural styles.|||Vinh Trang Pagoda was originally a small hut with a thatched roof and earthen walls. It was built by district magistrate Bui Cong Dat at the beginning of the 19th century as a place to cultivate his spirit after retirement. When he passed away, monk Hue Dang mobilized his followers to build it into a large temple.|||The temple was constructed in the style of Giac Lam Pagoda in Gia Dinh but on a larger scale with 178 pillars, two courtyards, and five halls. It was completed in 1849 and named Vinh Truong, inspired by a couplet: 'Vinh cuu doi son ha / Truong ton te thien dia'.|||Locals still call it Vinh Trang Pagoda. In 1907, monk Tra Chanh Hau renovated the main hall, blending Asian and European architectural styles. In 1930, monk Minh Dang restored the pagoda extensively to give it its current appearance.|||The temple was built in the form of the Chinese character 'Quoc', similar to Chinese temples, but Vinh Trang Temple features Renaissance-style patterns, Roman-style arches, French-style ironwork, and Japanese-style glazed tile flooring. The Chinese characters are written in ancient seal script, while the Vietnamese text is written in Gothic style. Overall, the temple's exterior architecture is a unique and harmonious blend of Asian and European styles. However, the interior architecture still retains traditional Vietnamese sculptural elements.|||The pagoda consists of four consecutive sections (front hall, main hall, ancestor's house, and rear house), covering an area of 14,000m², 70m long and 20m wide, built with cement and precious wood, on a 1m high foundation, surrounded by solid walls. The front of the front hall is built in a harmonious European-Asian architectural style with slender columns, arches and colorful motifs.
