That means: (25+25) + (20+30) = 100.|||In reality, if using the main axis of Dai Noi, which is Dung dao, to divide the layout of Ngu Phung Pavilion into two parts, we see that each side has 50 symmetrical columns.|||The philosophy of yin yang and five elements of Eastern philosophy is specifically reflected in the architecture of Ngo Mon. It is said that in our ancient architectural works, our ancestors have embedded many deep codes, cryptic messages, and profound intentions.|||Moreover, the empty space around the lower floor of the Ta Duc Lau and Huu Duc Lau reveals the slender rows of columns in the Ngu Phung Pavilion, creating a feeling of serenity, lightness, and pleasantness for the viewer.|||Overall, Ngo Mon Gate looks majestic and impressive from afar, resembling a magnificent castle. However, upon closer inspection, one can see that the architects during the reign of Minh Mang demonstrated exceptional skill in design and decoration. As a result, Ngo Mon Gate becomes a charming and lovely architectural work, blending harmoniously with the natural scenery and the soul of the people of Hue.|||Ngho Mon Gate is one of the most outstanding architectural works of the Nguyen Dynasty and Vietnamese ancient architecture.|||The architectural layout of the Ngu Phung Tower system perfectly matches the foundation platform system, as mentioned earlier, forming a welcoming gesture of the host stretching out to greet guests.

title: Vung Ro
description: Location: Vung Ro is located at the end of Phu Yen province, by the national highway, 25 km from Tuy Hoa city. Characteristics: Vung Ro is one of the famous beautiful bays not only of Phu Yen but also of the whole central coastal region.|||Vung Ro is sheltered by the Deo Ca, Da Bia, and Hon Ba mountains on three sides: north, east, and west. To the south is the sea gate with Hon Nua island, 105m high, like a fortress guarding the entrance and exit of ships.|||Along the coast of Vung Ro, there are many medium and small sandy beaches, some of which can form beautiful resorts and beaches such as Chua beach, Bang beach, Lau beach... In the sea of Vung Ro, there are many species of seafood, and under the sea floor are colorful coral reefs, very attractive for fishing, swimming, and diving tourism.

title: Van Mieu Dien Khanh
description: Location: Van Mieu Dien Khanh is located in Phu Loc Tay hamlet, Dien Khanh town, Dien Khanh district, Khanh Hoa province. Features: Built according to the traditional Confucianism, to honor those with talent and academic achievements.|||In 1803, King Gia Long issued a decree to establish Van Mieu in Phu Loc commune, Hoa Chau district - Binh Hoa town, now in Phu Loc Tay hamlet, Dien Khanh town, Khanh Hoa province.|||Van Mieu was built on a large scale from 1853 and basically completed the following year: in front is the bi dinh house, in the middle is the tien duong and chinh duong houses, high and spacious, made of wood and brick walls, with carved and gilded columns.|||Over time, Van Mieu has undergone four restorations in 1892, 1904, 1941, and 1959, but still retains its original architecture.|||Today, Van Mieu preserves two stone steles from Tu Duc 11 (1858) providing insight into the history, culture, and daily life of Khanh Hoa people and the completion of Van Mieu in 1854. There is also a Bai minh in Bai Duong hall that details the academic achievements of local scholars and officials from the Nguyen dynasty to Tu Duc.|||With its rich history, Van Mieu holds great value in the process of learning, acquiring knowledge, and expressing respect for teachers, adding to the treasure trove of national cultural heritage.|||The historical site of Van Mieu Dien Khanh has been recognized by the State as a national historical site, a source of pride in the tradition of literature and history of Dien Khanh people.

title: Bat Buu Buddha Tower
description: Located in Le Minh Xuan commune, Binh Chanh district, about 30km southwest of the city center. Features: The tower was built in 1959 and completed in 1961 on a plot of land over 1,000 square meters. The tower's architecture is octagonal, 3m high.|||The upper floor features a 7m-high statue of Sakyamuni Buddha weighing about 4 tons, carved by sculptor Nguyen Thanh Thu in 1957.|||Despite the war years that devastated the area with bombs and artillery, the tower and the Buddha statue remained intact, earning it the local name of Lonely Buddha.|||Today, Bat Buu Buddha Tower has been renovated and expanded within a 5-hectare area. With its unique architecture, harmonious decoration, and serene landscape, it attracts a large number of followers and tourists.

title: Hoa Lai Tower
description: Location: Hoa Lai Tower is located in Ba Thap village, Tan Hai commune, Ninh Hai district, Ninh Thuan province. Characteristics: The tower was built in the early 9th century, originally consisting of 3 towers, but only 2 remain, namely the North and South towers.|||The North tower has 4 decorated pillars with beautiful carvings at the base, featuring Garuda birds with outstretched wings. The pillars supporting the roof have ornate decorations. The fake doors are adorned with arches and seated figures. The South tower has simpler decorations, also with 4 pillars, roof decorations, and fake doors with large arches, but less intricate than the North tower. The towers have 3 roof layers, each with a decorative fake niche. After years of abandonment, the towers are now being restored and preserved.

title: Tuyen Linh Pagoda
description: Location: Tuyen Linh Pagoda is located in Minh Duc commune, Mo Cay district, Ben Tre province. Features: Tuyen Linh Pagoda was recognized as a national historical and cultural relic on July 20, 1994.|||On May 19th every year, a festival is held at the pagoda with various cultural exchange activities and a commemoration ceremony for President Ho Chi Minh's birthday.|||Tuyen Linh Pagoda was built in 1861, during the 14th year of Emperor Tu Duc's reign.|||Initially, the pagoda was named Tien Linh and was presided over by Zen Master Khanh Phong.|||It was originally made of bamboo and leaves to worship Madame Sam.|||In 1907, monk Le Khanh Hoa, dharma name Thich Nhu Tri, from Phu Le village, Ba Tri district, came to reside at this pagoda.|||He was a highly knowledgeable Buddhist master who lectured on Buddhist teachings and trained disciples.|||Thanks to his broad understanding, extensive travel, and knowledge of both classical and vernacular writing, he gained the trust of Buddhist followers and laypeople, with nearly 90% of the local population adhering to Buddhism.|||Le Khanh Hoa was also the founder of the Nam Ky Phat Hoc Hoi and Luong Xuyen Phat Hoc Hoi, which gathered many prominent Buddhist monks and laypeople in Nam Ky at that time.|||Additionally, he served as the editor-in-chief of the magazine Tu Bi Am and the director of the Phat Hoc Tung Thu.|||Tuyen Linh Pagoda was a place where Nguyen Sinh Sacc, the father of President Ho Chi Minh, often came to rest. He stayed here the longest from 1927 to 1929. During his stay at the pagoda, Nguyen Sinh Sacc opened a teaching class, examined and prescribed medicine for the local people, and discussed social and national issues with Abbot Le Khac Hoa. Here, Nguyen Sinh Sacc also met with Tran Van An, Huynh Khac Man, Le Van Phat, and some of them later became the first members of the Ben Tre Party Committee. In 1929, Nguyen Sinh Sacc fell ill and was tracked by French detectives, so Abbot Le Khac Hoa took him to Dong Thap. According to the elderly in Minh Duc commune, the pagoda's name was changed from Tien Linh to Tuyen Linh in 1930 at the suggestion of Nguyen Sinh Sacc. Tuyen means propaganda. Abbot Le Khac Hoa not only recited sutras but also encouraged Buddhists to participate in revolutionary and resistance activities. Due to old age and illness, Abbot Le Khac Hoa passed away on June 19, 1947. Before his death, he bathed, changed into ceremonial robes, faced north, and prayed for national independence, wishing President Ho Chi Minh good health, then recited Buddha's name and passed away.|||During the two resistance wars, Tuyen Linh Pagoda was a hideout and shelter for revolutionary cadres, and was therefore twice bombed and destroyed by the enemy using airplanes. The pagoda has been restored multiple times and rebuilt in 1999 on the old foundation, now standing grand and spacious. However, there are not many artifacts left from the pagoda's past.|||Comrade Viet Hung, Chairman of the Vietnam Fatherland Front Committee of Minh Duc commune and a member of the Tuyen Linh Pagoda relic protection board, said: "We are planning to build a museum at the pagoda. First, we will try to collect and gather artifacts associated with the pagoda and restore the steles of Buddhist master Le Khanh Hoa and Nguyen Sinh Sac to display at the museum. Besides, we will construct a traffic system to make it easier for people to visit the pagoda."

title: Chua Ha Tien
description: Location: Pho Chua Ha, Vinh Yen city, Vinh Phuc province. Features: This is a Buddhist temple and a Buddhist study center – a place to spread the knowledge of Buddhism to many generations of monks, nuns and laypeople over hundreds of years.|||The temple is situated on a hill with a beautiful position in the shape of "dragon holding jade" on 2B road to Tam Dao, covering an area of over 6.2ha.|||The temple was built in 1703, during the reign of King Le Hy Tong Duy Hiep.|||Legend has it that in the past, Mother Queen Tay Thien Lang Thi Tieu on her way to join forces with King Hung Vuong the 6th to fight against invaders, used this place as a venue to recruit and gather heroes.||||||The temple grounds now feature 5 ancient stupas (3-storey type) and an ancient banyan tree with aerial roots enveloping a 300-year-old stupa.|||These are historical witnesses to the period of flourishing Buddhism nearly a century ago.|||Enter through the Tam quan gate from the southeast to the Ta Huu Mon gate, then walk around the corridor to the Tam Bao, a 3-storey pagoda replica. To reach the temple's porch, climb 9 steps, known as the nine levels. The temple's roof curves upwards at the four corners, with a Lưỡng long chầu nguyệt on the ridge. Behind is the Ancestor's Hall, flanked by reception rooms and display rooms. Other facilities include a library, vegetarian hall, stupa garden, and jade well. The statues here represent the journey of Buddha Shakyamuni from enlightenment to teaching the Dharma to all sentient beings, along with Bodhisattvas and disciples. The complex also features replicas of famous temples worldwide and in Southeast Asia, allowing pilgrims to admire and meditate in a serene, otherworldly atmosphere, much like the Western Pure Land, with bamboo and pine forests, and a peaceful lake.|||The Buddhist hall and communal house tower high, majestic, and solemn, embodying eternity and serenity, as well as sanctity.|||The front of the hall features an entire wooden door made of four-piece cabinet, intricately carved.|||Above the door, a lattice grille is installed.|||Below, a bas-relief of the four seasons is carved.|||The roof panel runs along the entire front of the main hall, with five large characters, exquisitely and meticulously carved.|||The three fronts of the hall, left and right wings of the temple, have corridors and monolithic stone columns with delicate carvings.|||The names of benefactors are modestly inscribed at the base of the columns.|||All 10 stone pillars bear couplets.|||The Holy Mother Palace has three levels of steps.|||Outside the front hall, there are couplets on the four columns of the two middle rooms, carved in a gentle and elegant calligraphic style.|||The harmonious blend of a landscape environment, a fresh and serene space with distinct architectural components creates a majestic yet extremely airy complex. This is achieved using entirely traditional materials, designs, and techniques by modern craftsmen. Their intellect and skilled hands have been used to convey the traditional culture of our ancestors and nation to younger generations, allowing them to enjoy and preserve it.|||On December 13, 2006, corresponding to January 20, 2006, the temple was renovated and expanded to a more grandiose and beautiful scale.|||Ha Tien Pagoda is a notable landmark in Vinh Yen city, Vinh Phuc province.

title: Po Romê Tower
description: Location: Po Romê Tower is located in Hau Sanh village, Phuoc Huu commune, Ninh Phuoc district, Ninh Thuan province. Characteristics: Po Romê Tower is considered an imperfect replica of Po Klong Garai Tower. The structure consists of two towers: the main tower dedicated to King Po Romê and the smaller tower dedicated to the Queen.|||The Po Romê Tower is situated on a high hill, 15km south of Phan Rang - Thap Cham town. The tower was built in Champa in the late 16th or early 17th century. The main facade of the tower faces east, with a multi-layered arched entrance. The arches are decorated with Shiva and flame motifs, while the fake doors feature stone gods sitting with distinctly local facial features. The tower has three roof layers following ancient patterns, each with four corner towers adorned with stone lotus buds and decorative flames. Inside each fake niche is an image of a sitting god with hands clasped in prayer. The main tower houses a statue of King Po Romê made from an 8-armed Linga. Near the entrance, a statue of the bull god Nadin, carved from a black stone slab, is located. The structure behind the tower is a shrine dedicated to the Queen. The king's tomb is nearby, chosen by Po Romê himself. In 1992, Po Romê Tower was recognized as a historical site.

title: Tran Quy Cap Temple
description: Location: Tran Quy Cap Temple is located next to Song Can Bridge, in Dien Khanh Town, Dien Khanh District, Khanh Hoa Province. Characteristics: The temple was built on land known as Go Chet Chem (the hill got its name from when Tran Quy Cap passed away).|||Tran Quy Cap was a patriotic scholar of the Duy Tan movement, who bravely led the people against the French.

title: Nguyen Dinh Chieu Tomb
description: Location: Nguyen Dinh Chieu Tomb is located in An Duc commune, Ba Tri district, Ben Tre province. Characteristics: The tomb was built by people of Ben Tre to commemorate him.|||Nguyen Dinh Chieu was a famous patriotic poet from the South and all over the country. He was born in Gia Dinh (now Ho Chi Minh City). In 1861, when Can Giouc was defeated, he went to Ba Tri to live in seclusion and passed away there in 1888. His temple was built in 1969. Every year, on July 1st (his birthday), people in Ba Tri district and all over Ben Tre province, on behalf of people across the country, hold a solemn incense-offering ceremony to commemorate the poet.

title: Ho Chi Minh City Opera House
description: Location: 7 Lam Son Square, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City. Features: This is the only building in Ho Chi Minh City roofed with black stone tiles.|||The opera house was built over three years (1898 - 1900) in gothic flamboyant style, which was very popular in France in the late 19th century, with ornate patterns and sculptures in the style of Petit Palais museum and theaters in Paris. All construction materials, patterns and sculptures were brought from France. This was a typical and heavily invested cultural construction project in Saigon during the French colonial period.|||With one ground floor, two upper floors, and a modern sound and lighting system, the opera house became a performance center for singing, concerts and musicals exclusively for the French upper class at that time.|||In 1944, during the war against Japanese fascists, Allied planes dropped bombs, damaging the opera house. In 1955, it was repaired to serve as the National Assembly (later renamed the Lower House) of the government of South Vietnam. After April 30, 1975, the opera house resumed its original function. In 1998, on the occasion of the 300th anniversary of Ho Chi Minh City's founding, the city authorities decided to restore its original facade. From late 2007 to 2009, the opera house was renovated with some architectural changes (tiled roof, floor tiles, sculptures) and an upgraded seating system, lighting and sound equipment.|||Today, the opera house hosts traditional Vietnamese music and theater events, Western classical music and large events.|||On March 29, 2012, the Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism issued a decision recognizing the opera house as a national architectural and artistic monument.

title: Chua Ong Temple
description: Location: 32 Hai Ba Trung, Ninh Kieu District, Can Tho City. Features: The temple features a unique and characteristic Chinese architectural style.|||The temple was built by the Chinese community of Quang Chau and Trieu Khanh (Guangdong Province, China) who immigrated to Can Tho and started construction in 1894 and completed it in 1896 on a plot of land with an area of over 500m² for religious and spiritual activities. Therefore, the temple is also known as Quang Trieu Hoi Quan. The temple has a National-style architecture, consisting of two main sections: Tien Dien and Chinh Dien. Tien Dien worships Ma Tien Tuong Quan and his red horse (on the left) and Phuc Duc Chinh Than (on the right).|||The temple has two main festivals in a year: the festival of Thien Hau Thanh Mau (23rd day of the 3rd lunar month) and the festival of Quan Thanh De Quan (24th day of the 6th lunar month). During these days, many local people and tourists come to the temple to pray for blessings and peace in their lives.|||Besides the main festivals, the most anticipated festival at Chua Ong Temple is the lantern festival (bidding for 6-sided lanterns) which is held every 10 years in the main hall with the belief that the owner of the lantern will have good luck and success. Each side of the lantern has a landscape picture with congratulatory messages in Chinese characters such as 'Sinh y hung long', 'Hiep gia binh an', 'Tai lai loc tan'... The six corners of the lantern are decorated with golden dragon shapes. All the money from the lantern bidding is used for charitable activities, helping those in need in the city.|||The temple has been ranked as a national historical and cultural site in 1993.

title: A Glimpse of Vietnam Tourist Area
description: Location: Ben Bo Cap, Phu Binh hamlet, An Phu commune, Cu Chi district. Characteristics: A Glimpse of Vietnam is a complex of traditional craft villages.|||This tourist area is a 22.5-hectare complex of traditional craft villages, situated near Bo Cap canal and Saigon river. The area features 30 items, including a national temple, a sandbox model of Vietnam, a watchtower, and three representative areas for three regions of Vietnam. There is also a culinary culture area, a natural bird and animal farm, a handicraft market, a river market, a fruit garden, etc.|||Here, craftsmen, farmers, and artisans from various ethnic groups and regions work together in traditional professions such as weaving, silk and brocade weaving, ceramics, hat making, embroidery, paper making, woodcarving, stone carving, sugar production, rice cultivation, aquaculture, flower and ornamental plant cultivation, and livestock raising. Visitors to A Glimpse of Vietnam will have a deep impression of Vietnam.

title: Vietnam Museum of Ethnology
description: Location: Nguyen Van Huyen Street, Cau Giay District, Hanoi City. Features: The museum is a repository of materials, artifacts, and information on the daily life, culture, customs, and practices of 54 ethnic groups in Vietnam.|||The Vietnam Museum of Ethnology is situated on a 4-hectare site, constructed in late 1987 and inaugurated in 1997. This project was designed by architect Ha Duc Linh (Tay ethnic group) and French architect Veronique Dollfus, comprising three main exhibition areas: the Bronze Drum building, outdoor exhibition, and Southeast Asia exhibition.|||The Bronze Drum building, covering 2,500m² over two floors, is divided into nine themes: general introduction; Viet-Muong language group; Thai-Kadai language group; Mong-Dao language group; Han-Tibeto-Burman language group; Mon-Khmer language group; Malayo-Polynesian language group; Cham, Hoa, Khmer ethnic groups and cultural exchange; and integration among ethnic groups.|||The outdoor exhibition showcases characteristic architectural styles of Vietnamese ethnic groups' houses (longhouses of E De, Tay stilt houses, Mong houses with pơ-mu wood roofing, Kinh houses with tile roofing, Gia Rai mortuary houses, Ba Na communal houses, and Ha Nhi earth-walled houses).|||The Southeast Asia exhibition presents an overview of the rich cultural landscape of Southeast Asian ethnic groups under five themes: textiles, daily life, social life, performing arts, and religion and beliefs.|||With 15,000 artifacts, 42,000 color photos and films, 2,190 positives, 273 audio recordings, 373 video tapes, and 25 CD-ROMs, the Vietnam Museum of Ethnology is an attractive destination for domestic and international tourists to explore and experience the culture of Vietnamese ethnic groups. The museum frequently hosts craft demonstrations and traditional cultural performances from Vietnam, Southeast Asia, and other parts of the world.|||The reputable travel website TripAdvisor ranked the Vietnam Museum of Ethnology 4th among the 25 most appealing museums in Asia in 2014.|||Opening hours: 8:30 AM - 5:30 PM. Closed on Mondays and Tet Nguyen Dan.

title: Chua Hien Temple
description: Location: Chua Hien is located in Pho Hien Ha, now Pho Hien street, Hong Chau ward, Hung Yen town, Hung Yen province. Characteristics: Legend has it that the temple was built during the Tran dynasty by To Hien Thanh, a high-ranking official of the Ly dynasty. Chua Hien has a Chinese name “Thien Ung Tu” according to the reign title of Tran Thai Tong (1232-1250).|||The temple has an architectural layout of “noi cong ngoai quoc”, consisting of a front hall, a burning incense area, an upper hall, and three sides of corridors. In the center of the upper hall is a sitting statue of Quan Am Nam Hai with eight pairs of hands, arranged symmetrically. The head of the statue wears a flower-shaped hat, with lotus and chrysanthemum motifs. In front of it are four bodhisattva statues sitting on lotus thrones, with full and serene faces. These statues date back to the 19th century. The placement of the Quan Am and four bodhisattvas in the upper hall reflects the worship of a deity believed to have many powers to save people on rivers and seas. This is a distinct feature of Chua Hien compared to other temples.|||In front of the temple yard, there are two stone steles that preserve historical records of the development of Pho Hien trading port. The steles are “Thien Ung Tu - Tan Tu Trung Tu Thach Bi Ky” dated 1625 and “Thien Ung Tu - Bia Ky Cong Duc Trung Hung” erected in 1709.|||Chua Hien is also famous for its ancient longan tree, specifically a sugarcane longan tree with a beautiful shape, large fruit, thick pulp, and a unique flavor. During the longan harvest season, the fruit is often chosen to be offered to Buddha, gods, and local officials to present to the king. The main tree trunk has aged and decayed, but a branch has been nurtured to grow into a new tree, now standing as a symbol of the specialty longan of Pho Hien - Hung Yen.

title: Muang Ethnic Group
description: Location: The Muong people live in valleys surrounded by rice paddies, in Hoa Binh province. Characteristics: From Thung Mây at 1,200m above sea level, visitors can see a clearer picture of Muang land, especially its culture and lifestyle.|||The culture of Muang land is expressed through clothing like Muong skirt, through rituals in life such as weddings, funerals, and epic songs like "Đẻ đất, đẻ nước".|||In Muong music, drums and gongs still play an important role. During the "hội xuân" festival, "xuống đồng" ceremony, "mừng nhà mới" celebration..., visitors can enjoy a set of 12 Muong gongs. In the scenery of Muang land, amidst the valley, under the sound of flowing streams and rustling trees, the gong's sound is deeply resonant and unforgettable.|||When visiting a Muong village, strangers are often considered precious guests. Here, tourists have the opportunity to discover more bright and beautiful aspects of Muang culture.

title: Truong Bon Historical Site
description: Located in My Son commune, Do Luong district, Nghe An province, about 40km west of Vinh city. This site commemorates the victories and heroic sacrifices of our soldiers and people during the resistance war against America.|||Truong Bon is a 5km long steep mountain pass on strategic route 15A, also known as road 30, going through My Son commune.|||Thanks to its difficult terrain with many mountains along both sides of the road like Voi, Mong Ga, Cot Co..., the road through Truong Bon pass always ensures discretion, safety and is an ideal place to stop and hide.|||During the Vietnam War, Truong Bon had a particularly important strategic position, being a single route, connecting traffic arteries from the North to support the Southern battlefield.|||The imperial American forces continuously bombed and destroyed this strategic route after discovering the vulnerable spot of Truong Bon. From 1964 to 1968, they dropped 18,936 bombs of all kinds and tens of thousands of rockets on this land; destroyed 211 villages along the route, killed many local residents, and damaged hundreds of vehicles and cannons of our army. With the spirit of 'The road not yet open, no blood and bone spared,' officers, soldiers, and youth volunteers day and night stayed and cleared thousands of delayed-explosion bombs of all kinds; dug and filled millions of square meters of land and stone; brought thousands of vehicles through safely; transported and cleared millions of tons of goods; provided millions of white pine trees, bamboo stakes, and various anti-sinkage woods, and built bridges for vehicles to pass; mobilized thousands of trucks to carry goods across Truong Bon.|||To achieve those victories, it is necessary to mention the unity of all forces participating in and serving the battle at Truong Bon. Here, thousands of cadres, soldiers, youth volunteers, transport workers, and militia self-defense forces were wounded and many people bravely sacrificed.|||On January 12, 1996, the Truong Bon relic was recognized as a National historical site by the Ministry of Culture and Information (now the Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism).|||To commemorate and remember the sacrifice of the heroic martyrs, as well as to educate the younger generation about revolutionary traditions, on April 19, 2010, the People's Committee of Nghe An Province decided to approve the project to invest in the construction of a conservation and restoration project for the Truong Bon historical site.|||Construction started on October 27, 2010, and was completed in July 2015. The Truong Bon historical site spans 217,327m2, featuring various sections, notably the tomb and memorial house for 13 heroic martyrs who died in the intense bombing on October 31, 1968, at Truong Bon.|||The tomb is nestled beside an old pine hill, which used to be a hideout for youth volunteers. In front of the tomb is the exact spot where American forces launched severe attacks and where the 13 youth volunteers fell, returning to their homeland forever on the threshold of their dreams.|||The relic site also features a memorial house for the heroic martyrs who bravely sacrificed their lives in Truong Boon; a traditional exhibition house that recreates vivid and lifelike images of the struggle against the American war of resistance by the military and people in Truong Boon; a landscape and environmental regulation lake; a festival square with many structures and artifacts commemorating the sacrifice of young soldiers who died in Truong Boon.|||The site also restores 3 bomb craters near the tomb, a bell tower; a large bas-relief with intricate carvings, depicting the life, labor and fight of officers, soldiers and youth volunteers on the route; a memorial to heroes and martyrs with three incense sticks made from monolithic green stone, 27m high and over 1m in diameter.|||Surrounding the memorial are two groups of statues, 6 legendary pillars symbolizing the fighting spirit and heroic sacrifice of the youth volunteer force.|||The Truong Bon historical relic site is one of the notable attractions that draws a large number of locals and tourists whenever they visit Nghe An province.

title: Khe Sanh Military Base
description: Location: Khe Sanh is located on Highway 9 in Huong Hoa district, Quang Tri province, 63km west of Dong Ha town. Characteristics: In 1965-1966, the US Army and the Army of the Republic of Vietnam built Khe Sanh into the largest stronghold on Highway 9, considered an "impregnable" defensive line.|||Khe Sanh is situated in a 400m-high red soil valley surrounded by overlapping hills and mountains. It was one of the three "electronic eyes" (Khe Sanh, Lang Vay and Ta Con) of the McNamara electronic barrier. Major battles took place here during the 1968 Tet Offensive, and the 1971 Operation Route 9 - South Laos. US President Johnson once requested the Chairman of the US Joint Chiefs of Staff to sign a blood oath to hold Khe Sanh.|||The Ta Con base cluster with its airfield preserves many relics from the 1968 victory, including a museum, communication trenches, command bunkers, barbed wire fences, runways, aircraft, artillery, tanks and other infrastructure.

title: Nguyen Hue Walking Street
description: Location: Ben Nghe Ward, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City. Features: A modern pedestrian street combined with traffic.|||During the French colonial period, Nguyen Hue Street was actually the Cho Vai Canal, which led from the Saigon River (Bach Dang Wharf today) to the Xa Tay Residence (now the Ho Chi Minh City People's Committee headquarters). The Cho Vai Canal was a waterway for trading ships to supply goods to the old Ben Thanh Market and for military ships to enter the citadel easily. Along the two banks of the canal were two roads named Charner and Rigault. In 1887, the French filled in the canal and merged the two roads into Charner Boulevard.|||The street has been upgraded into a 670m-long, 60m-wide pedestrian street, divided into two parts connected by the Cay Lieu roundabout. The park features a 7.2m-high bronze statue of President Ho Chi Minh.|||The street will host parades, festivals, street performances, exhibitions, and sports events. The street is covered with free wifi 24/7.

title: Hoi Khanh Pagoda
description: Location: At 35 Yersin street, Phu Cuong ward, Thu Dau Mot city, Binh Duong province, 25km south of Ho Chi Minh City. Characteristics: Hoi Khanh Pagoda was founded in 1741 by Zen Master Dai Ngan.|||Initially, the pagoda was built on a high hill, but it was destroyed in 1861. Seven years later, it was rebuilt at the foot of the hill.|||The pagoda has been restored and renovated several times, but it still retains its traditional architecture. The lecture hall and East wing were rebuilt in 1917, the West wing in 1984, and the main hall in 1990-1991.|||The pagoda's grounds feature ancient trees, including four tall oil trees planted when the pagoda was first built.|||The total area of the pagoda is 700m², with a main hall, lecture hall, and East and West wings. The pagoda features wooden Buddha statues and intricate carvings.

title: Binh Thuy Communal House
description: Location: Binh Thuy Communal House, formerly known as Long Tuyen Communal House, is located in Binh Thuy Ward, Binh Thuy District, Can Tho City. Characteristics: Binh Thuy Communal House is an architectural work of value in the western part of the Mekong Delta, a newly reclaimed land with intricate carvings, decorative motifs, and wooden engravings that are very delicate and lively, bearing many ethnic architectural features.|||From the center of Can Tho City, visitors travel about 5km along Nguyen Trai Street, through Cach Mang Thang Tam and Le Hong Phong streets to reach the communal house.|||The communal house was built in 1844, initially made of bamboo and thatch. In 1852, it was granted a royal seal by Emperor Tu Duc. In 1909, it was rebuilt with a tiled roof, consisting of two areas: the main communal house and the "luc ap" area. The main communal house has five houses. Two square houses are the front and main halls, while three houses connect the two square houses. The "luc ap" area includes a theater and a preparation area for offerings. Outside the communal house, there are two large temples dedicated to the gods of Agriculture and Forest, and near the gate, there are two temples dedicated to the Forest God and the Canal Digger God.|||The communal house has a unique architecture different from those in the North: the front and main halls are square, each with six rows of columns, and each row has six columns. The columns in the main hall are carved with dragon and peony motifs. The main hall has three overlapping roofs in the "thuong lau ha hien" architectural style. On the roof, there are statues of people, qilin, and dragons. The communal house worships the local tutelary gods and national heroes such as Dinh Cong Trang, Nguyen Trung Truc, Bui Huu Nghia, and Vo Huy Tap.|||Every year, locals organize festivals to celebrate the beginning and end of the crop, with traditional games like releasing ducks, tug-of-war, and domestic skills competitions, which have been maintained to this day and attract a large number of participants.

title: Ang Temple
description: Location: The temple is 7km from Tra Vinh town center, nestled in an ancient forest surrounding Ba Om pond. It is situated on a 4ha site in ward 8, Tra Vinh town, Tra Vinh province. Features: Ang Temple is one of the oldest Khmer temples in Tra Vinh. The temple boasts a unique, harmonious architecture amidst natural scenery. It was recognized as a national cultural heritage site by the Ministry of Culture and Information.|||The temple gate features decorated statues of chants, fairies, and sacred birds in traditional style. The temple is surrounded by a deep moat and has a five-story stupa, which houses the remains of former abbots. According to legend, Ang Temple was built in the late 10th century. However, historical records show that the temple existed before 1715 and was renovated in 1842.|||The temple's foundation is 2m high with two levels. The main hall is the widest, showcasing representative artworks. The temple has doors facing east and west. Outside, six columns in front of the main hall feature carved fairies and sacred birds. The roof is tiled with three layers, supported by 12 quý wood columns. The top roof is steep and higher than the others. Each gable is closed with a triangular wooden panel, intricately carved with celestial beings and sunflowers. The eaves feature stylized dragon designs.|||Inside the main hall is a shrine dedicated to Buddha Shakyamuni, where Theravada Buddhist rituals are performed. The altar is nearly 30m² with four levels. The main Buddha statue stands 2.1m tall, surrounded by 50 smaller statues. The walls feature dozens of paintings depicting the life of Buddha. The ceiling has four large murals illustrating Buddha's birth, renunciation, enlightenment, and parinirvana.|||With its advantageous location, Ang Temple, adjacent to the Khmer Cultural Museum and Ba Om pond, forms a tourist attraction.

title: Nha Trang Bay
description: Location: Within the territory of Nha Trang city, Khanh Hoa province. Characteristics: Nha Trang Bay is a sheltered bay with gentle waves, crystal-clear waters and fresh air, making it an attractive tourist destination for both domestic and international visitors.|||With an area of approximately 507km², comprising 19 large and small islands, Nha Trang Bay is a rare natural model of a bay system in the world, gathering almost all typical and rare ecosystems of tropical marine areas such as coral reefs, mangrove forests, sea grass beds... With its diverse ecosystem, Nha Trang Bay has become an ideal living environment for many rare and valuable species of animals such as swiftlets, green turtles, red coral, golden pearl oysters, imperial sea snails, and oval abalone...|||The climate in the bay is divided into two distinct seasons: the dry season from January to August and the rainy season from September to December, with an average annual temperature of 26°C.|||Many islands in the bay have been exploited for tourism, such as Hon Chong, Bai Tru, Hon Tre, Bich Dam, Hon Mun, Hon Tam…|||Among them, Hon Tre - the largest island in the bay with an area of over 3,000ha, is the most attractive destination with a 5-star resort and golf course, Vinpearl Land entertainment park and the longest sea-crossing cable car at the time of its inauguration (March 2007) with a length of 3,320m.|||Visitors to Hon Tre not only have the opportunity to relax and swim but also experience food, shopping and entertainment services, sports such as aquarium, water music, water park, thrilling games, indoor games, surfing, water ball, water motorbike, scuba diving...|||Mun Island is a must-visit destination for tourists when coming to Nha Trang. The seabed in this area boasts high biodiversity, hosting a wide variety of marine species, especially coral with around 350 species, accounting for over 40% of the world's hard coral species. The waters of Mun Island have been designated as the first marine protected area in Vietnam. Here, visitors can snorkel or dive to admire the coral, take a glass-bottomed boat tour, or walk underwater to marvel at the stunning aquatic world of Nha Trang. Mun Island is also a popular spot for many couples to take underwater wedding photos.|||Hon Tam is also an ideal spot for entertainment, leisure and relaxation activities for tourists. The Hon Tam tourism site, built on the island, offers various villas with an Eastern style and a system of services for entertainment such as: parachuting, water motorcycle, surfing, sailing boat, speed motorcycle...|||The Tri Nguyen Aquarium is an interesting destination for those who love marine life. This is a sea-based lake separated by a stone dike system. The lake houses hundreds of precious and beautiful marine species, like a living marine museum.|||The Tri Nguyen Aquarium also features the Tri Nguyen Underwater Palace - a mini ocean with many rare fish and sea plants, designed as a fossilized ship covered in seaweed.|||Located just a few hundred meters away is Soi Beach, offering various fun and entertainment activities for visitors such as water motorcycles, parasailing, scuba diving, etc.|||Mentioning Nha Trang cannot be done without mentioning the specialty of bird's nest. Many islands in Nha Trang Bay are home to swallows, with Hon Noi being the most famous.|||Visiting Hon Noi, tourists can explore the Temple of the Bird's Nest Industry to learn about the history and development of the bird's nest industry. They can also climb the stone stairs to the top of Du Ha mountain, about 90m high, to take beautiful pictures of the island.|||Hon Noi also has Doi Beach, formed by a curved sandbar resembling two C's back to back. The sea here is calm, with emerald blue water. Tourists can enjoy swimming, admiring coral and colorful fish.|||After exploring Hon Noi, tourists can enjoy dishes made from bird's nest at the island's restaurant and buy products made from bird's nest as souvenirs, such as: original bird's nest, refined bird's nest, high-end Sanest bird's nest water, and ginseng bird's nest water.|||In June 2003, Nha Trang Bay became the 29th member of the club of the world's most beautiful bays.

title: Dao San Forest Market
description: Location: Dao San Forest Market is located in Dao San border commune, Phong Tho district, Lai Chau province, about 60km from Lai Chau town. Features: Visiting Dao San market, tourists will always have a feeling of interest and relaxation in the natural scenery and people of this land. Besides, tourists can enjoy some dishes that are characteristic of the Northwest mountain forest region.|||From Muong So junction, provincial road 132 looks like a silk ribbon across hundreds of mountain slopes and the final point is a high peak of nearly 2,000m; here appears a colorful scene with a very lively and bustling atmosphere, where everything seems to blend together…, that is the space of Dao San forest market.|||Dao San market is a market of ethnic people in 8 border communes of Phong Tho district - Lai Chau. The market takes place mainly on the days around Tet. Tourists coming to Dao San market not only admire the pristine and majestic mountain scenery, exchange and buy goods such as fabrics, clothes, agricultural products…, taste special dishes of ethnic people like shoulder pig… but also immerse themselves in the lively and cheerful atmosphere here: The image of Hmong girls in their distinctive traditional costumes gathered to go to the market, the image of Dao girls with engagement rings on their wrists waiting for Dao boys to send love… all are likely to leave a deep impression on tourists.

title: Binh Hoa Communal House
description: Location: Giong Trom town, Giong Trom district, Ben Tre province, 16km southeast of Ben Tre city. Characteristics: One of 20 large and beautiful communal houses in Ben Tre province and the oldest communal house in Bao islet (including parts of Chau Thanh district, Giong Trom district, Ba Tri district and Ben Tre city).|||The Binh Hoa communal house was built in 1831 using simple materials like wood and leaves. In 1903, the communal house's management board organized and mobilized the local people to contribute labor, money, and materials to rebuild the communal house on a larger scale, and it was completed after 10 years (1903-1913). The communal house is mainly made of precious wood, with a mortise and tenon structure. In 2012, the Ben Tre Department of Culture, Sports, and Tourism and the Giong Trom district People's Committee coordinated to restore and preserve the architectural and artistic value of the Binh Hoa communal house. After one year of construction, the project was completed on an area of 9,000m2, including main items such as the communal house, incense burning house, main hall, front porch, corridor, back house, and Quan Thanh temple.|||The highlight of the communal house's architecture is the unique and delicate woodcarving art, combining court art with religious art and folk art to a certain extent, featuring themes like clouds, dragons, turtles, phoenixes, birds, flowers, and leaves on beams, columns, and screens. All the woodcarvings and artworks in the Binh Hoa communal house are precious cultural heritage, serving scientific research and also a special tourist product attracting visitors to explore.|||The communal house currently keeps over 100 wooden artifacts, including horizontal boards, couplets, lanterns, bas-reliefs, incense altars, and ceremonial objects. Annually, a communal house ceremony takes place on the 15th day of the first lunar month and the 12th lunar month.|||The Binh Hoa communal house was recognized as a national historical-cultural monument by the Ministry of Culture and Information (now the Ministry of Culture, Sports, and Tourism) on January 7, 1993.

title: Mui Ne
description: Mui Ne is located in Mui Ne ward, Phan Thiet city, Binh Thuan province, 22km northeast of Phan Thiet city center. Mui Ne is known as the sleeping princess in the forest. The name Mui Ne is synonymous with unique sand dunes in Vietnam.|||Mui Ne is a fishing village and a familiar tourist destination. Along provincial road 706, from Phan Thiet city center to Mui Ne, there is a sequence of gentle hills and wide sandy beaches with beautiful coconut groves. The beach has shallow and gentle slopes, clean and clear water, warm sunshine all year round, and no storms, making it an ideal place for swimming and relaxation. Mui Ne has many pristine beaches, untouched by humans, with majestic scenery and fresh natural environment, such as Ong Dia beach, Truoc beach, and Sau beach.|||In Mui Ne, visitors can swim, relax, play sports, take a boat trip, go on a picnic, hunt, fish, play golf... In Mui Ne, there is also Cat Hill, which has been a theme for many photographers' works. Besides the beaches and sand dunes, this area also has many scenic spots like Tien spring, Ong Hoang tower, and Po Sha Nu Cham tower. Along the beach are tourist villages, hotels, villas, and many sports and entertainment facilities.

title: Qua Giang Clan Communal House
description: Location: The Qua Giang clan communal house is located in Qua Giang village, Hoa Phuoc commune, Hoa Vang district, Da Nang city. Characteristics: The communal house was built in 1821 to worship Quan Thanh and the ancestors of the four clans: Dinh, Le, Tran, and Nguyen - who contributed to the Nguyen Lords in the south and established Qua Giang village.|||The communal house is divided into two parts: the front hall and the main sanctuary. The front hall and main sanctuary are connected by two covered corridors, forming a closed rectangular architecture.|||The front hall is built in the traditional style with decorated pillars, and the roof is adorned with floral motifs. The main sanctuary is built in the traditional 'keo tam doan' style with three compartments and four roofs. The communal house features intricate wood carvings and sculptures.|||The locals hold two annual ceremonies on the 20th of February and the 12th of July in the lunar calendar to commemorate the ancestors who founded the village. The Qua Giang clan communal house was recognized as a national historical site by the Ministry of Culture and Information on February 1, 2000.

title: Chua Keo Temple
description: Location: Chua Keo is located in Duy Nhat commune, Vu Thu district, Thai Binh province. Characteristics: The temple is one of the most famous ancient temples in Vietnam. The bell tower of Chua Keo is a unique wooden architectural work.|||From Nam Dinh city, cross Tan De bridge, turn right, follow the Red River dike, about 10km to reach the pagoda. Located at the foot of the Red River dike in the plain, Keo pagoda with its bell tower like a lotus flower rising in the sea of lush green rice.|||According to the book Khong Lo Thien Su Ky Ngu Luc, the temple was originally named Nghiem Quang, built by Khong Lo in 1067 in Giao Thuy village (also known as Keo village) on the right bank of the Red River.|||After Khong Lo's death, the temple was renamed Than Quang Tu.|||Over time, the Red River eroded the temple's foundation, and in 1611, a major flood swept away the village and the temple.|||The people of Keo village had to leave their homeland: half moved to the southeast bank of the Red River and later built Keo - Hanh Thien temple (now in Nam Dinh province); the other half crossed the river to settle on the northeast bank and later built Keo - Thai Binh temple.|||The construction of the new temple began in 1630 and was completed in 1632, following the architectural style of the Le dynasty, thanks to the efforts of Lady Lai Thi Ngoc, wife of Tuan Tho Hau Hoang Nhan Dung, and Dong Cung Vuong phi Trinh Thi Ngoc Tho.|||The temple was restored multiple times in the 17th and 18th centuries and in 1941.|||The temple has a large architectural scale on a plot of land of about 58,000m². Today, the entire temple architecture remains 17 structures including 128 rooms built in the style of "Inner Vietnamese, Outer Western". From the tall 25m-high wooden flagpole at the outermost part, going through a stone-paved courtyard, visitors will come to the outer Tam Quan gate, lotus pond, and the inner Tam Quan gate with a set of dragon-chasing door wings (16th century). The Buddha hall is solemnly decorated. Behind the Buddha hall is a temple dedicated to Zen Master Khong Lo, who founded the temple during the Ly dynasty.|||The most famous architectural work of the temple is the bell tower. The bell tower of Keo Pagoda is a unique wooden art structure, representative of ancient Vietnamese architecture during the late Le dynasty. Built on a square brick foundation, the bell tower is 11.04m high, with 3 roof levels, constructed with stacked brackets. The first floor has a 1.20m long stone khanh, the second floor has a 1.30m high bronze bell with a diameter of 1m cast in 1686 during the reign of Le Hy Tong, and the third and upper floors have a small bell, 0.62m high and 0.69m in diameter, cast in 1796.|||When visiting the pagoda, visitors can see precious artifacts said to have belonged to Zen Master Khong Lo, including an ivory rosary, a large limestone container, and three shimmering conch shells that resemble gold. According to legend, these shells were picked up by Khong Lo while he was a fisherman and used as a cup for drinking water during his years of monastic practice.|||The pagoda was recognized as a national historical and cultural site by the Ministry of Culture and Information.|||Pagoda Festival|||Every year on the 4th day of the first lunar month, the people of Keo village in Duy Nhat commune hold a spring festival at the temple. Nine months later, on the 13th, 14th, and 15th days of the ninth lunar month, Keo temple again holds an autumn festival. This is the main festival, commemorating the death of Zen Master Khong Lo (1016-1094), the founder of the temple.|||In the festival, people organize a procession of palanquins, incense altars, dragon boats, and ceremonial objects. On the Tra Linh river in front of the temple, which flows into the Red River, festival-goers gather to watch boat racing, drumming and flute playing competitions, and traditional dances.|||Inside the temple, there is a competition of recitation and singing about the six offerings: incense, lanterns, flowers, tea, fruits, and food, very lively.|||Sacred statue|||Keo Temple preserves many precious artifacts and holds mystical secrets tied to the life of Zen master Khong Lo.|||According to the book Trung san Than Quang Tu Phat to ban hanh thien uyien ngu luc tap yeu, Zen Master Khong Lo was originally named Duong, born in a fishing family, and became a monk under Zen Master Loi Ha Trach.|||It is said that since his enlightenment, Zen Master Khong Lo had the ability to fly in the air, walk on water, and tame snakes and tigers.|||Legend also tells that before passing away, he transformed into a piece of agarwood, covered it with his robe, and the wood turned into a statue.|||This sacred statue is still kept in the rear palace, locked all year round.|||Every 12 years, the Keo village selects a host and four stewards to prepare and decorate the Saint statue. These individuals must follow a vegetarian diet and wear new clothes. They then transport the sacred statue from the forbidden palace, bathe it with a mixture of coconut water and grapefruit essence, and reapply vermilion. This process must adhere to a strictly defined ritual. The stewards are bound to keep confidential any details they encounter while embellishing the statue.

title: Ban Lac - Mai Chau
description: Location: Ban Lac is located in Mai Chau valley, Hoa Binh province. Characteristics: It's an ethnic village in Hoa Binh province with unique customs and practices.|||Ban Lac is nestled in Mai Chau valley, with rice fields stretching far and wide on both sides of the road leading to the village, and distant mountains rising up. Upon entering Ban Lac, visitors feel like they've stepped into a small, peaceful world, not just because of the clean paths, sturdy stilt houses that are rustic yet familiar, but also due to the many interesting attractions that set it apart from other tourist destinations.|||The stilt houses in Ban Lac are all elevated, about 2m off the ground, supported by solid wooden pillars. The roofs are covered with gồi leaves or mây. The large windows let in the breeze and provide a spacious area to hang decorative flower baskets. Nowadays, stilt houses used for business have been improved with modern materials and equipped with amenities, yet they retain their rustic charm.|||The locals' service attitude towards tourists, whether in terms of food, lodging, or selling souvenirs, is very friendly and professional. The goods on sale in Ban Lac are diverse, with many types, models, and reasonable prices. There are clothes, Thái skirts, scarves, small wallets, and even bows, arrows, flutes, and other items. Interested tourists can try them on the spot or rent them for photo shoots.|||To explore Ban Lac, visitors can choose to walk or rent a bike at a reasonable price. Taking a stroll around the village, admiring the scenery, and immersing oneself in the fresh and cool atmosphere, tourists are sure to feel their souls lighten and relax.|||In the evenings, Ban Lac becomes a space for dancing, singing, and folk performances by the village's artistic team. Tourists can gather around the flickering fire, breathe in the aroma of roasted corn and potatoes, savor the sweet flavor of rice wine, and let themselves get lost in the vastness of the night.|||Today, Ban Lac is a familiar community tourism spot for tourists near and far. Life here passes naturally, with a gentle familiarity that makes visitors remember it forever.

title: Van Mieu Hue
description: Location: Van Mieu faces south, situated on a low hill in Huong Long commune, Hue city, Thua Thien - Hue province. Characteristics: Van Mieu was established to honor the sages of Confucianism and also served as a place to train the country's talented individuals.|||Previously, the Nguyen Lords built Van Mieu at their capital and changed locations three times: in Trien Son village, Luong Quan village, and Long Ho village.|||In 1808, Gia Long and the royal court decided to choose a low hill above Thien Mu Pagoda, on the left bank of the Huong River, which is the current location, to build a new and majestic Van Mieu. The National College was also established here and operated until 1908 when it was moved to the inner city.|||The construction of Van Mieu started on April 17, 1808 and was completed on September 12, 1808.|||The main architectural works are built on a high ground about 3m above the surrounding soil. In front is the Huong River, behind is the village, and the mountains and hills stretching from the Truong Son range embracing Van Mieu. The structures of Van Mieu Hue are built on a square ground, each side about 160m. Surrounding is a wall built for enclosure. There are about 50 architectural works of various sizes, including 32 doctoral steles and 4 others. Van Mieu (the main temple dedicated to Confucius and Four Associates, twelve wise men), two houses of Dong Vu and Tay Vu (worshiping seventy-two wise men and former scholars), Than tru (kitchen), Than kho (storehouse), To cong house, Dai thanh mon, Van Mieu mon... All buildings are constructed of precious materials including lim wood. The architectural layout, decoration and interior and exterior embellishment all reflect symmetry, dignity and literature.|||Van Mieu has been renovated multiple times and additional structures have been built, especially during the reigns of King Minh Mang and Thieu Tri. During the reign of King Gia Long, the imperial court had not yet organized the Hoi examinations, and only regional examinations were held, so no doctorate steles were erected here. From the time of Minh Mang onwards (1820 - 1840), the Hoi examinations were opened, and doctorate steles were erected at Van Mieu to engrave the names of successful candidates. The 'secret steles of successful candidates' were erected in the Van Mieu courtyard from 1831 to 1919, the year of the last Hoi examination under King Khai Dinh...|||Over half a century, war and nature have devastated Van Mieu. Only 34 stone steles remain, which are the most valuable historical and cultural artifacts.|||Two steles in the Bi dinh house in the Van Mieu courtyard bear the edicts of Emperor Minh Mang and Thieu Tri. The left stele bears an edict by Minh Mang dated 17 March 1836, stating that eunuchs in the imperial palace are not eligible for promotion. The right stele bears an edict by Thieu Tri dated 2 December 1844, stating that the king's maternal relatives should not hold political power.|||32 steles of doctorates are arranged in two rows on either side of the courtyard facing each other. All 32 steles have tortoises on top and are made of green marble. The steles of doctorates here are not as tall as those in Hanoi's Van Mieu but are more uniform, with different designs and decorations...|||These 32 steles record the names, ages, and hometowns of 239 doctoral degree holders who passed the highest level of the imperial examinations during the Nguyen dynasty.|||The Hue Van Mieu is a precious historical relic. Visiting Van Mieu will help tourists understand more about the tradition of loving literature, respecting intellectuals and encouraging learning of our ancestors from ancient times.

title: Ban Den
description: Location: Ban Den is located in Ban Ho commune, Sa Pa district, Lao Cai province. Features: Here, tourists can explore the majestic nature, learn about the unique cultural nuances of the local people and experience the cozy and intimate atmosphere, blending between humans and nature.|||Ban Ho commune is about 30km southwest of Sa Pa town center. It is home to 5 ethnic groups: Mong, Dao, Tay, Giay, and Nung, with the majority being Tay people. Despite not being near the tourist center like other villages in Sa Pa, Ban Ho offers a majestic natural landscape, waterfalls, and unique cultural heritages. Ban Ho has become a destination for many tourists, especially foreigners.|||Upon arriving at Ban Ho, visitors will be mesmerized by the sea of green rice terraces stretching as far as the eye can see, surrounded by rolling hills and dotted with traditional ethnic minority houses along the banks of the stream. Ban Ho's center is Ban Den village, where the Muong Hoa and La Ve streams converge.|||According to legend, a young couple met on a romantic night market in Sa Pa. The young man was from Ban Den, an ethnic Tay, who had been orphaned since childhood. The young woman was from Ban Ta Van, an ethnic Giay. They fell deeply in love but the young man was too poor to afford the bride price. They would often meet by the Muong Hoa stream. One day, it was raining heavily, but the young man still went to meet his lover at Nam Na, at the end of Ta Van. They were together, unaware of the danger approaching. The water god suddenly appeared, swept the girl away from her lover's arms, and pushed her into the rushing water. The young man panicked and jumped in, but lost sight of his lover. Filled with grief and hatred for the water god, the young man started collecting stones from Hoang Lien Son mountain to fill the stream. The stone mountain, blocking the Muong Hoa stream, grew higher with the young man's longing and sorrow. The Muong Hoa stream was split in two, flowing around Ban Den, murmuring day and night like the lover's call, ever since.|||Unlike the Muong Hoa stream, which has to carry water to dozens of villages along its path, the La Ve stream flows to Ban Den from deep in the high mountains and forests. Perhaps that's why it's also more beautiful, mysterious, and clearer.|||In the Ban Ho area, besides the Muong Hoa and La Ve streams, there are many other streams and waterfalls such as Ca Nhay, Seo Trung Ho... that attract visitors with a passion for exploring the romantic nature. Seo Trung Ho waterfall is over a hundred meters high, and from a distance, it looks like a white silk strip across the middle of the mountain, and visitors can't wait to visit.|||Ban Ho is not for those without an aspiration to explore. The winding mountain roads are a real challenge for tourists. But once you get there, you will be captivated by the diversity of nature. Coming here, visitors can admire the picturesque scenery, poetic spaciousness, and unique architecture of wooden stilt houses that have been closely tied to the life of the ethnic people. They can also enjoy a friendly, warm tourism environment and participate in community activities.|||A typical example is Ban Den village of Ban Ho commune. The cultural potential of Ban Den villagers is expressed through ancient songs, dances and traditional rituals. For the Tay people, festivals like xuong dong, love singing, sap dancing, and xoè dancing are distinctive cultural features that truly captivate tourists. Traditional handicrafts have been restored and are tending to expand. Notably, cotton planting, sericulture, and brocade weaving are prominent. Ban Den's traditional brocade, woven by Tay women, creates beautiful costumes and decorative items for family and daily use. Brocade weaving not only produces unique souvenirs but also makes fabrics, blankets, and pillows for visitors to admire the skill of highland women.|||Over the past nearly ten years, homestay tourism has become one of the attractions of Ban Den. 29 large and beautiful stilt houses in Ban Den village have been selected to offer this service. Interestingly, an increasing number of people, including young Vietnamese travelers, are flocking to Ban Den to experience a night stay in the village.||||||Ban Den village is always bustling with traditional hill tribe tourism. The flavor of modern life is gradually spreading here, but at night, the village returns to its pure mountainous scent, serene and mystical.

title: Ba Na - Nui Chua
description: Location: In Hoa Ninh commune, Hoa Vang district, Da Nang city, about 30km southwest of the city center. Characteristics: Considered the "green lung" of Da Nang.|||Ba Na Mountain is nearly 1,500m above sea level, with a cool climate year-round, averaging 17-20°C.|||Visitors to Ba Na can enjoy the fresh air, experience four seasons in one day, and admire stunning natural scenery like Tien Waterfall, Mo Stream, and Nui Chua Peak.|||They can also visit spiritual sites like Linh Ung Pagoda, Linh Tu Temple, Nghinh Phong Tu Tower, and Ba Shrine.|||With its advantages, Ba Na Hills eco-tourism and resort was invested and built on Ba Na mountain to serve tourists, including a complex of hotels, restaurants, entertainment, sightseeing and shopping areas with international standards, notably a cable car system with 3 routes: Suoi Mo - Ba Na, Debay - Morin and Toc Tien Waterfall - L'Indochine.|||According to the World Cable Car Association, as of April 2013, Ba Na cable car system has set 4 world records: longest cable car cable in one way (5,801m); highest cable car in one way (1,368m); longest total cable length (11,587m) and heaviest cable car (141.24 tons).|||When visiting Ba Na Hills, tourists will be captivated by French-style architectural works such as Debay wine cellar, Morin restaurant, a romantic French village with a town square, church, hotel..., Le Jardin D'Amour flower garden featuring hundreds of typical cold-climate flowers, creating a romantic, airy space filled with scents and colors.|||In addition, visitors can enjoy relaxing moments with family and friends at Fantasy Park, one of the five largest indoor entertainment parks in Asia and the only indoor entertainment park in Vietnam and the world located on a mountain peak. With an area of 21,000m², Fantasy Park includes a soft play area for children; 3D Mega 360°, 4D, 5D cinemas; an adrenaline rush game zone, a wax statue exhibition… Along with Fantasy Park, visitors can also experience the double spiral slide or the mountain train system that appears for the first time in Vietnam. These unique forms of entertainment will bring unforgettable impressions to visitors.|||To provide visitors with a complete experience, Ba Na also offers a unique culinary service with a diverse system of restaurants serving traditional Vietnamese dishes and many Asian and European specialties such as Hoi An, Morin, Kavkaz restaurants…|||While Ban Na dazzles with its pristine beauty by day, it takes on a gentle and romantic aura at night. Experience a night at Ban Na with activities like campfires, hand-in-hand singing and dancing, and group games... to momentarily leave behind life's worries and cares.|||Every year, when summer arrives, the Ba Na summer festival is held with many special and attractive activities such as flower festival, street carnival, music and magic performances, wine festival…

title: Ta Cu Mountain Temple
description: Location: Ta Cu Mountain Temple is located on Ta Cu Mountain, in Tan Lap commune, Ham Thuan district, about 30 km southeast of Phan Thiet city. Characteristics: Ta Cu Mountain Temple has an ancient charm in the coastal region of Binh Thuan.|||Ta Cu Mountain is 649m high, and Ta Cu Mountain Temple is located halfway up the mountain at an altitude of over 400m. The temple was built in 1879, but a Buddhist temple with a thatched roof and earthen walls had existed there for many years prior. The temple was built under the supervision of monk Tran Huu Duc, who selected the site, where trees are lush, streams flow, and birds and monkeys roam around the temple. Later, another temple was built below, called Long Doan, while the older temple was renamed Linh Son Truong Tho. The two temples are collectively known as Chua Nui.|||The entire temple complex is an architectural ensemble comprising: Tam Quan gate, main hall, Buddha statue, stupa, monk's quarters, and more, all nestled under ancient trees that stay green year-round.|||The temple is located at the end of a winding path of hundreds of stone steps through the ancient forest.|||The air here is fresh and cool year-round, with a misty atmosphere emanating from the stone mountains, making it an attractive destination during the summer. The average temperature ranges from 18 to 22 degrees Celsius.|||The majestic and poetic landscape of the mountain forest adds to the fame of Chua Nui Temple.|||The temple also features a massive reclining Buddha statue called 'Thich Ca nhap niet ban', situated at the highest point about 100m from the temple. This statue is one of the rarest in Vietnamese Buddhist history and was the largest in Vietnam at the time.|||The work was led by engineer Truong Dinh Y in 1962.|||About 50m from the reclining Buddha statue is the Three World Buddhas group: Amitabha, Avalokiteshvara Bodhisattva, and Mahatathagata, all about 7m high.|||Ta Cu Mountain was once a volcano in the first geological era, so the soil contains gold ore and sulfur. The spring water contains active ingredients from medicinal plant roots like nguu gia bi, than xa, do trong bac... which are very good for treating some diseases.|||Ta Cu Mountain Pagoda is now one of the most popular tourist spots in Binh Thuan. The ancient temple, contemplative Buddha statue, and sacred relics of the founder from over a hundred years ago leave visitors in awe. Throughout the year, devotees from all over come to worship Buddha, admire the temple and mountain forest scenery, especially during Tet and the annual Hung Duc Ancestor's Day (5th day of the 10th lunar month).|||Ta Cu Mountain Temple along with the forests in the Nature Reserve has been ranked as a national scenic site by the State in 1993.|||This site now has a cable car system to conveniently take visitors up and down for sightseeing.|||The legend of Linh Son Ta Cu|||In the 33rd year of Tu Duc's reign (1880), the queen mother, Tu Du, was seriously ill and blind. The royal physicians and renowned doctors were powerless. The king called upon the people to find someone to cure his mother and promised a great reward. Due to the reputation of the venerable monk Huu Duc, the governor of Binh Thuan province wrote to the king. The king ordered an envoy to invite the monk to the palace to treat the queen mother. However, the monk had vowed not to descend the mountain, so he only gave the envoy herbal medicine and instructions.|||The medicine was remarkably effective; after taking it, the queen mother recovered from her serious illness and quickly regained her health. King Tu Duc honored the monk with the title 'Linh Son Truong Tho' for the place he founded and meditated.

title: Go Thi Thung Tunnel
description: Located in Xuan An commune, Tuy An district, Phu Yen province, about 45km north of Tuy Hoa city. Characteristics: The tunnel is a masterpiece of Phu Yen's military and people during the resistance war against the US.|||It was built on May 10, 1964, and completed in August 1965. The tunnel connects to the provincial revolutionary base through Son Long and Son Dinh communes (Son Hoa district). This strategic military location played a crucial role in the local resistance war.|||The tunnel complex includes a 2km-long, 4.5m-deep, and 0.8m-wide tunnel, with a sophisticated system of traps and defensive structures.|||On February 3, 2009, Go Thi Thung Tunnel was recognized as a national historical and cultural site by the Ministry of Culture, Sports, and Tourism.

title: Trang Kenh Scenic Spot
description: Location: Trang Kenh scenic spot is located in Thuy Nguyen district, 20km northeast of Hai Phong city center. Features: Trang Kenh is a cluster of limestone hills, caves, rivers, and lakes with poetic natural scenery.|||U Bo mountain is one of the hills in this cluster, legend has it that Tran Hung Dao stood here to command a naval battle against the invading Yuan - Mongol army. From U Bo mountain, visitors can admire the entire Bach Dang river. The serene river and mountain, the vast sky and water, and many legends make the scenery here even more captivating.|||Around Trang Kenh, there are many fascinating caves. Vua cave in Minh Tan commune is 18m high and 10m wide, with many alcoves and a year-round cool stream. It's called Vua cave because it's said that the 18th Hung King established his li cung here. A shrine to the king is located in the center of the cave, with a lifelike stone statue.|||Trang Kenh has been discovered by archaeologists to be a 4000-year-old jewelry-making workshop. During the resistance war against France, it was also a revolutionary base for the army and people of Hai Phong.

title: Den Dau An
description: Location: An Xa village, An Vien commune, Tien Lu district, Hung Yen province, about 12 km northeast of Hung Yen city. Characteristics: The temple is built in the architectural style of communal houses and temples in the Red River Delta, worshiping Jade Emperor, Ngu Lao Tien Ong and various heavenly and earthly immortals.|||From Hanoi, follow National Highway 5 for about 28 km east to Pho Noi town, then turn right onto National Highway 39 for about 20 km south to Gao market (Hung Yen city). From here, turn left onto Giao street and travel about 12 km more to reach Den Dau An.|||According to legends preserved at the temple, in the past, Cha Xa village (now An Xa) was a swampy and wild area with many wild animals. In the second year before the Common Era, the Jade Emperor sent heavenly and earthly immortals and Ngu Lao Tien Ong to the mortal realm to guide people to eliminate wild animals, reclaim the swampy land for rice cultivation, and build Thuy Ung Quan (Good Omen Pavilion) to pray for favorable weather. To commemorate the Jade Emperor's merits, Ngu Lao Tien Ong and the heavenly and earthly immortals, locals renovated and expanded the temple into Den Dau An to worship their predecessors.|||The temple is shaped like a Ding character, situated on a dragon-shaped land with an area of about 2.2 hectares, surrounded by trees and a pond. The temple consists of three main structures: Thuong den (main temple), Hoi dong den and Thanh Mau den. The main temple is a remarkable architectural work in the shape of a Ding character, comprising three buildings: Tien te, Thuong dien and Hau cung. Most of the temple's architecture is made of lim wood, while the first and second compartments of the Thuong dien are built with monolithic stone blocks featuring intricate dragon and phoenix carvings.|||Besides its ancient and unique architecture, Den Dau An preserves many ancient artifacts of artistic and spiritual value, including a 9-story clay pagoda built during the Ly - Tran dynasty with Champa cultural influences, such as lotus and Garuda motifs. This is a symbol of the nine cloud layers in Heaven, the intersection of heaven and earth, and the path for the Jade Emperor and immortals to ascend to heaven or descend to earth. The temple also features a clay incense altar (lotus-shaped) built during the Ly - Tran dynasty, a bronze bell from the 35th year of the Canh Hung reign (1774), an ancient stone khánh from the Le dynasty, and two stone steles from the Ly and Nguyen dynasties recording the temple's construction and restoration.|||Every year, from April 6th to 12th in the lunar calendar, locals in An Xa village organize the traditional Den Dau An festival to express gratitude to their predecessors. The festival features various activities, including traditional rituals (incense offering, palanquin procession) and folk games like cockfighting, Chinese chess, Quan họ singing, and a unique game called "đánh hổ" or "đánh bệt" with a strong traditional flavor.|||Den Dau An was recognized as a national historical and cultural site by the Ministry of Culture and Information (now the Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism) in 1998.

title: Tien Son Sports Center
description: Location: No. 3 Phan Dang Luu, Hai Chau District, Da Nang City. Features: The architectural design is considered the most modern in Southeast Asia.|||The center covers an area of over 94,000m², including an arena, field, garden, landscape, parking lot. The arena, built on nearly 10,500m², was designed with the idea of a giant flying saucer leaning towards the city center, reflecting the aspirations of the city's people. The design uses simple curved lines on the exterior, conveying a youthful, modern, and dynamic look. The roof structure uses modern materials with soft lines, giving the building an impressive and elegant appearance.|||The arena can accommodate 5,000 to 7,000 people, with 4 floors arranged to suit the functions of a sports center and facilitate event organization. The basement includes a club area and technical equipment management rooms. The first floor features a sports arena, lobby, media area, VIP zone, referee room, athlete room, and service area. The second floor includes a souvenir shop, general operation area, and a spectator area with 4 stands (A, B, C, D) and 6,500 seats. The third floor has retail counters, restrooms, corridors, and the fourth floor is a lounge area.|||The building has 7 staircases, 2 elevators, emergency exits, and a separate path for people with disabilities. All construction items were built with precise technical requirements to meet the demands of hosting events with modern facilities.|||Since its opening, Tien Son Sports Center has hosted numerous national, regional, and international events, such as the 2012 Miss Vietnam final, 2011 Asian schoolgirl volleyball championship, 2011 Robocon national final, and 2013 Robocon Asia-Pacific final.|||With its unique and modern architecture, Tien Son Sports Center is considered one of the most modern sports facilities in Southeast Asia, adding a new highlight to the city by the Han River and enhancing the urban landscape in a new development phase.

title: Ca Na Tourist Village
description: Located on the coast, Ca Na Tourist Village is 32km from Phan Rang-Thap Cham City and 114km from Phan Thiet City. The village is nestled at the foot of a mountain, facing the sea, making it easily accessible by road and rail.|||The air is fresh and cool, allowing visitors to travel by horse-drawn carriage to Ca Na's scenic spots, Mui Dinh, caves like Ong Phat, Ong Nong rock, Duc Well, and Bac Mountain. Guests can enjoy hiking, exploring the forest, swimming, or taking a canoe trip to admire the sea, sky, and landscape.|||A small, cozy tourist village with compact houses, each accommodating 2-4 people, has been built near the beach, forming Ca Na Tourist Village.

title: Phuoc Kieu Bronze Casting Village
description: Location: Dien Phuong Commune, Dien Ban Town, Quang Nam Province. Characteristics: Phuoc Kiều is a famous bronze casting village, especially known for its technique of casting gongs and cymbals.|||The bronze casting profession in Phuoc Kiều was formed by a man named Duong Tien Hien, who migrated from Thanh Hoa and taught the craft. In the late 18th century, two areas were formed here: Dong Kiều woodcarving ward and Phuoc Kiều bronze casting ward. By the early 19th century, the Nguyen dynasty merged the two wards into "Phuoc Kiều communal", also known as Phuoc Kiều bronze casting village.|||Like other bronze casting villages, to create a complete bronze product, Phuoc Kiều craftsmen have to carry out several stages such as making molds, painting molds, melting bronze and casting bronze. However, they have their own secret alloy recipes such as red copper, brass (copper alloyed with tin), green copper (copper alloyed with zinc), bronze (copper alloyed with gold)... In addition, Phuoc Kiều artisans must have the technique of sound testing to create products with resonance, suitable to the customs, habits and spiritual culture of each ethnic group. This requires Phuoc Kiều craftsmen to have sensitive ears, experience and a deep understanding of subtle sound perception.|||Previously, the village only cast traditional products such as gongs, bells, la, candlesticks, incense burners, household items... Notably, Phuoc Kiều's gongs and cymbals are present in almost all ethnic minority villages in the Central Highlands. Today, Phuoc Kiều artisans also create interior decoration products for tourist sites, villas or musical instruments on demand. In 2004, the village's artisans cast two bronze cannons with tin, according to the original model from the Nguyen dynasty. Each cannon weighs 100kg, 1.2m long, and 25cm in diameter.|||Visiting Phuoc Kiều bronze casting village, besides buying souvenirs and items, tourists can directly participate in the production stages and watch artisans perform musical instruments made by themselves. Moreover, with a favorable geographical position, located next to National Highway 1A and on the axis connecting two world cultural heritages, Hoi An Ancient Town and My Son Sanctuary, Phuoc Kiều bronze casting village has become one of the attractive tourist destinations in Quang Nam. Especially, in October 2006, Phuoc Kiều was chosen by the Vietnam National Administration of Tourism as a visiting point for Ministers of Tourism of APEC 2006.

title: Mộ Ông Ích Khiêm
description: Located in Hoa Tho communal cemetery, Hoa Vang district, Da Nang city, 10km southwest of the city center. Characteristics: Tomb of Ông Ích Khiêm was recognized as a national historical site by the Ministry of Culture and Information on July 12, 2001|||Ông Ích Khiêm, whose nickname was Mục Chi, was born on December 21, 1829, in Phong Le Bac village, Hoa Tho commune, Hoa Vang district. He passed the imperial examination in 1847 under King Thieu Tri and served as an official under King Tu Duc. He was known for his intelligence, integrity, and bravery as a general who defended Da Nang against French colonial invasion.|||Ông Ích Khiêm died on July 19, 1884, in Binh Thuan. His son, Ông Ích Thiện, brought his body back to his hometown and buried him in Phong Le village.|||The tomb is an octagonal structure with a total length of 13.8m; width of 6.1m; and a surrounding wall height of 0.72m. The tomb itself is 4.75m long; 3.5m wide; and 0.35m high. In front of the tomb is a stele house with a marble stele, 0.83m high and 0.54m wide, decorated with dragons, phoenixes, and floral patterns.

title: Dien Khanh Ancient Citadel
