description: Location: Dien Khanh Ancient Citadel is located in Dien Khanh town, Dien Khanh district, Khanh Hoa province. Features: The citadel was built by Lord Nguyen Anh in 1793, covering an area of approximately 36,000m2. It is a military architectural complex in the style of Vauban, a common military fortification model in 17th-18th century Western Europe.|||The citadel walls are hexagonal in shape with 6 unequal sides, built of earth, stretching approximately 2,694m in length and 3.5m in height. The outer wall is built almost vertically while the inner wall is built in a gentle slope with two levels of stairs for access. The corners of the citadel are built protruding outwards, allowing for observation on both sides. Each corner has a built-up area for troop accommodation. At each corner, a high mound of about 2m is built for placing cannons, known as a corner fortress, and the top of the wall is planted with bamboo or thorny trees. A moat 3-5m deep and of varying widths is dug outside the citadel, following the terrain. The moat usually has water flowing from the Cai River and has many obstacles.|||Initially, the citadel had 6 gates, but now only 4 remain: East, West, Front (South), and Rear (North) gates. Inside the citadel were formerly the Royal Palace, the Left and Right Military Headquarters, the Governor's Office, the Warehouse, and the Prison.|||Dien Khanh Ancient Citadel is one of the valuable relics for studying ancient fortifications and has been recognized by the State as a national historical site.

title: Nha Trang Stone Church
description: Location: situated on Mount Bong, 12m above the average elevation of the residential area, in the center of Nha Trang city, Khanh Hoa province. Characteristics: a Catholic church with a unique French-style architecture.|||Nha Trang Stone Church, officially known as Christ the King Cathedral, was started on September 3, 1928, by French priest Louis Vallet, who oversaw the construction with technical advice from architect Nesty. The church was consecrated and inaugurated in May 1933.|||The main construction materials are reinforced concrete and chiseled stone, creating a solid and sturdy structure with gradually smaller blocks rising from low to high. The highest point of the church is the bell tower, where a cross is placed (38m high). The bell tower also features a set of bronze bells made by the famous French company Bourdon Carillond and a large clock with four faces.|||The church covers an area of 720m2 and features Gothic architecture with distinctive curved vaults. The decorative patterns use straight lines, arranged harmoniously, creating a simple yet dignified beauty. Colored glass windows are installed in the vaults and rose windows to effectively utilize sunlight, creating a brilliant and majestic appearance.|||Along the path to the church on Mount Bong are small compartments containing the remains of the deceased. On the left side is a cluster of 14 Stations of the Cross, 12 apostles, Christ the King, and 24 saints, creating a rich and unique sculpture garden.|||Nha Trang Stone Church is the cathedral of Nha Trang diocese. It serves not only as a place for local Catholics to attend Mass and pray but also as a popular tourist destination.

title: Gia Long Tomb (Thien Tho Tomb)
description: Location: The Gia Long Tomb is located in the Thien Tho mountain range, in Huong Tho commune, Huong Tra district, Thua Thien - Hue province, 16km from Hue city center. Characteristics: The Gia Long Tomb is a complex of tombs for the royal family. The tomb's architecture is simple yet majestic.|||To visit the Gia Long Tomb, visitors can take a boat along the Huong River, about 18km, then dock at the tomb, or take the road about 16km, down to Kim Ngoc ferry, then go a few more kilometers to arrive.|||The entire tomb complex is a group of mountains with 42 large and small hills, among which Dai Thien Tho is the largest mountain, chosen as the front shield of the tomb and giving its name to this whole mountain range.|||The construction of the tomb began in 1814 and was completed in 1820. From the Perfume River to the tomb, there is a wide road lined with tall pine and sour orange trees, creating a cool and serene atmosphere. Two majestic stone pillars stand at the entrance, marking the tomb area.|||The royal tomb is situated on a large, flat hill. In front, there is Dai Thien Tho peak acting as a shield, and behind it are 7 mountains forming a support. On the left, there are 14 mountains creating the "left green dragon" and on the right, 14 mountains forming the "right white tiger". The overall tomb is divided into 3 areas:|||The center is the tomb of the king and the Thua Thien Cao Hoang Hau. Passing through the court yard are rows of majestic stone statues and seven levels of the altar yard is Buu Thanh at the top of the hill. In Buu Thanh, there are 2 stone tombs created according to the concept of 'Can Khon hiep duc' symbolizing happiness and loyalty.|||To the right is the mausoleum area with Minh Thanh Palace as the central temple dedicated to the first Emperor and Empress. Previously, Minh Thanh Palace contained many artifacts associated with the life and military campaigns of Gia Long.|||To the left of the tomb is Bi Dinh, now only a large stele with the inscription 'Thanh Duc Than Cong' by King Minh Mang, praising his father with delicate and refined carvings.|||There are also nearby tombs in this area such as Quang Hung tomb (second wife of Lord Hien Vuong Nguyen Phuc Tan), Vinh Mau tomb (wife of Lord Ngai Vuong Nguyen Phuc Tran); Toai Thanh tomb (second wife of Nguyen Phuc Luan and mother of Gia Long),...Thien Tho Huu tomb of Thuan Thien Cao Hoang Hau, mother of King Minh Mang, next to Gia Thanh temple for worship.|||The Gia Long Tomb is a magnificent picture where nature and architecture come together to create a majestic landscape.|||Biography of King Gia Long:|||Nguyen Phuc Anh, whose given name was Chung, was born in 1762, and was the third son of Nguyen Luan. In 1773, the Tay Son uprising took place; Nguyen Phuc Anh, then 12 years old, followed Lord Nguyen Phuc Thuan to Quang Nam. In the autumn of 1777, Nguyen Phuc Thuan was killed in battle; Nguyen Phuc Anh escaped alone to Tho Chu Island, then later fled to Siam to seek refuge.|||In July 1792, King Quang Trung passed away, and his son Quang Toan was still young. Nguyen Anh organized an attack and by July 1802, Nguyen Anh defeated the Tay Son dynasty and ascended to the throne as emperor, with the reign name Gia Long. He then moved the capital to Phu Xuan (Hue) and renamed the country Vietnam.|||For the first time, Gia Long managed a unified Vietnam from north to south, from Lang Son to Ha Tien. He divided the country into 23 districts and 4 military units. The area from Ninh Binh northwards was called Bac Thanh, consisting of 11 districts (5 inner and 6 outer districts). The area from Binh Thuan southwards was called Gia Dinh Thanh, comprising 5 districts. The central region consisted of independent districts: Thanh Hoa, Nghe An, Quang Ngai, Binh Dinh, Phu Yen, Binh Hoa, and Binh Thuan. The capital region had 4 military units: Truc Le Quang Duc Doanh (Thua Thien), Quang Tri Doanh, Quang Binh Doanh, and Quang Nam Doanh.|||To avoid abuse of power, Gia Long did not establish the position of Prime Minister. The court only had 6 ministries: Personnel, Finance, Rites, War, Justice, and Public Works, led by ministers with deputy ministers and assistants. Inside the palace, there was no Queen, only a Royal Concubine and other palace ladies.|||In 1815, the "Quoc trieu hinh luat" code, consisting of 22 volumes with 398 articles, was promulgated.|||On the Dinh Mui day of the 12th month in the Ky Mao year (1819), Gia Long passed away at the age of 59, having reigned as lord for 25 years and as king for 17 years.

title: Van Ho Bird Sanctuary
description: Location: Van Ho Bird Sanctuary is located in My Hoa and Tan Xuan communes, Ba Tri district, Ben Tre province, about 52km from Ben Tre town and 120km from Ho Chi Minh City by road, or 100km by water. Characteristics: Van Ho is a mangrove area with many wild plants growing into a forest, serving as a habitat for thousands of storks, egrets, and other bird species.|||The bird sanctuary is home to 84 species of birds, 35 families, and 12 orders. Over 2,000 visitors come to visit each year, with the peak season being from April to October of the lunar calendar.|||Van Ho is a mangrove forest with various wild plants. The high layer consists of coconut trees, palm trees, and mangroves, providing an ideal habitat for birds. The low layer has plants like aroid, kenoc, and sedge, which serve as a breeding ground for storks and egrets. Compared to other bird sanctuaries in the Mekong Delta, Van Ho Bird Sanctuary is relatively young, with birds migrating here in May 1986 from Cu lao Dat.|||Every day, around 4 or 5 pm, thousands of storks fly back to the forest, creating a spectacular sight. The forest comes alive with the sounds of birds, including the calls of hungry chicks and the loud voices of annoyed storks.|||As the sun sets, the egrets go out to hunt, while the storks return to their nests. The birds take turns guarding their homes. The staff at the Van Ho tourist area describe the nights with clear moonlight, where the egrets' wings spread wide, creating a poetic scene.|||In Van Ho, besides the stunning dance of thousands of storks and egrets, the language of the birds has a distinct tone, combined with the rustling of leaves and the calls of various wild birds, such as the cuckoo's call in the silent summer night, the bìm bịp's cry, or the duck's quack.|||During strong winds and thunderstorms, the birds fly up into the sky, covering a large area with an estimated 500,000 birds, mostly storks.|||During the breeding season, the trees are adorned with bird nests.|||Visiting Van Ho Bird Sanctuary, tourists can take a forest walk, paddle through the mangroves, explore the revolutionary base, cross rickety bridges, and relax in a hammock under the forest canopy.

title: Cho Ong Bac Temple
description: Location: Cho Ong Bac Temple is located on Pham Hong Thai Street, My Long Ward, Long Xuyen City, An Giang Province. Characteristics: The temple, also known as Quang Dong Tinh Hoi Quan, is a historical architectural work of Vietnamese people of Chinese descent with valuable ancient artifacts.|||The temple was built over 100 years ago by people from Guangdong Province (China) as a meeting and activity place. In 1887, Mr. Quang Thanh Loi and Hoa Mau Xuong, two wealthy Chinese in the region, mobilized their compatriots and believers to contribute money to renovate the temple. After 4 years of construction, in 1891, the temple was completed and became a beautiful and typical architectural work in Long Xuyen City.|||The temple covers an area of 400m², with an architecture in the shape of the Chinese character '国'. The temple's roof is tiled with green glazed tiles, and the edges are decorated with carvings of the Eight Immortals, elephants, dragons, phoenixes, fish, and other ancient patterns and motifs, blending Chinese and Nguyen Dynasty art. The main door frame is made of intricately carved green stone, with brick walls and a flower-tiled floor. The interior has a feng shui structure, with a high, airy ceiling and beautiful carvings, including a triple-level structure symbolizing the three realms: Heaven, Earth, and Human.|||The temple has three bells, a gilded altar, a bronze bell, and a bronze incense burner. On the side of the temple are three stone steles written in Chinese characters, recounting the history of the temple's construction.|||The main deity worshiped in the temple is Bac De, with Thien Hau to the left and Quan Cong to the right. Other deities, such as Buddha Shakyamuni, Di Tat Bo Tat, and Ngoc Hoang Thuong De, are also worshiped here.|||All of these combine to form a cultural identity of the Chinese people who have long been integrated into Vietnamese culture. The temple was recognized as a national historical-cultural monument in June 1987.

title: Tuy Loan Communal House
description: Location: Tuy Loan Communal House is located in Tuy Loan village, Hoa Phong commune, Hoa Vang district, Da Nang city. Characteristics: Tuy Loan Communal House is the only communal house that still keeps 15 imperial edicts from the reign of Minh Mang to Bao Dai.|||Built in 1889, it was constructed at the end of the 18th century. Similar to Nai Nam and Bo Ban communal houses, Tuy Loan Communal House worships the tutelary deity and the village's former and latter worthies.|||The communal house has an area of 110m², situated in a spacious compound of over 8,000m², with a view of the river, facing the mountain, and located near a major road, under the shade of an ancient banyan tree. The roof is tiled with yin and yang tiles, and the walls are made of bricks. The roof is decorated with two dragons welcoming the moon, and the two ends of the roof are adorned with curved dragon shapes made of ceramic tiles. The interior is divided into three rooms and two wings, with a rear compartment of 2.4m wide and 2.7m long, featuring four rows of columns made of mit wood, each row having six columns from 2.5 to 4.5m high.|||The structure of the truss and columns follows the 'chong ruong gia thu' style. The 'gia thu' are carved with stylized flowers and leaves, and the base of the 'gia thu' are decorated with gourd shapes. The two ends of the 'thanh trinh' are carved with dragon heads, and the columns at the two ends of the house are carved with dragon heads and cloud, chrysanthemum, and peony patterns, showcasing the talent of Kim Bong craftsmen.|||Every year, locals organize the Spring festival on the 14th and 15th of the 2nd lunar month and the Autumn festival on the 14th and 15th of the 8th lunar month at the communal house. The communal house was ranked as a historical and cultural relic by the Ministry of Culture and Information on January 4, 1999.

title: Chua Tram Pagoda
description: Located in Long Chau village, Phung Chau commune, Chuong My district, Hanoi. The pagoda has a beautiful location with small mountains around it like Ninh Son, Dong Lu, and Tien Lu.|||Chua Tram Pagoda, also known as Long Tien, was built in 1669 by a general who became a monk. The pagoda is named after the mountain it is based on, "Tu Tram son". The entire Tram mountain area was once a place where King Le and Lord Trinh set up a royal retreat to enjoy the scenery.|||Visiting Chua Tram Pagoda, tourists can admire a pagoda that bears the distinct mark of spiritual and cultural architecture of the Red River Delta. The pagoda is nestled at the foot of a mountain, facing a vast lotus pond, and surrounded by dense forest. Despite its small size, the pagoda exudes an ancient and sacred beauty. The spacious and flat yard in front and the surrounding ancient trees create a peaceful and serene atmosphere.|||The pagoda has undergone several restorations and still retains many Buddha statues from the 18th-19th century with intricate and delicate carvings.|||In addition, tourists can visit the Mother Temple located on the hillside, and three ancient towers that commemorate the merits of Governor Hoang Trong Phu, Lady Le Thi Tho, and many monks and Buddhist followers. Visitors can also explore the site where President Ho Chi Minh read the Call to Arms for the whole nation via Vietnam Radio in 1946.|||The Chua Tram Pagoda festival takes place on the second day of the second lunar month every year. People come to pray for favorable weather, a bountiful harvest, and a peaceful life. The festival features traditional folk games such as bamboo pole climbing, water puppetry, and Chinese chess. A unique tradition during the festival is the procession of Uncle Ho's portrait, symbolizing his return to Chua Tram Pagoda.

title: Dien Hai Citadel
description: Location: Dien Hai Citadel is located in Thach Thang Ward, Hai Chau District, Da Nang City. Characteristics: Dien Hai Citadel is a historical site commemorating the tradition of fighting against the French of Da Nang people and the whole country, determined to defend national independence and sovereignty.|||Originally a military outpost built in 1813 near Da Nang Bay. In 1823, it was moved inland to a higher ground and renamed Dien Hai Citadel in 1835.|||In 1840, Nguyen Cong Tru, a government official, suggested strengthening the defense system in Da Nang, including Dien Hai and An Hai citadels. In 1847, the citadel was expanded with a perimeter of 556m, 5m high walls and 3m deep moat.|||The citadel features a square design with a watchtower, storage facilities for food, ammunition and guns, and 30 large cannons.|||Currently, the western and eastern walls and corners are relatively intact, while the southern gate has been destroyed and the northern part has been damaged. Recently, the site has been restored and a statue of General Nguyen Tri Phuong has been erected to commemorate a heroic period in the city's history.|||Dien Hai Citadel played a crucial role in defeating the French invasion of Da Nang in 1858-1860. On November 16, 1988, it was ranked as a national historical site by the Ministry of Culture and Information and a commemorative plaque was installed on August 25, 1998.

title: Quan Am Pagoda
description: Location: 84/4 Rach Chua Street, Ward 4, Ca Mau City, Ca Mau Province. Features: The current architecture was built in 1936 by Reverend Thien Tuong and Thien Duc. The pagoda has a stele inscribed "Sac tu Quan Am co tu" and Reverend Tri Tam's stupa.|||The pagoda was initially built by Reverend To Quang Xuan around the mid-19th century as a small hermitage for meditation and treating people. Later, he moved to Kim Chuong Pagoda (Gia Dinh) and took the dharma name Tri Tam. In 1842, King Thieu Tri granted Reverend Tri Tam a title and bestowed the pagoda.

title: Suoi Mo Tourism Area
description: Location: Suoi Mo Tourism Area is located in Nghia Phuong commune, Luc Nam district, Bac Giang province, 30km from Bac Giang city via national highway 31 and provincial road 293 to the northeast. Features: Coming to Suoi Mo Tourism Area, visitors can feel the sacred and mystical atmosphere of the temples blended with the beautiful scenery, fresh and cool air|||Suoi Mo has long been one of the attractive destinations for tourists. Here, visitors not only can admire the flowing streams but also explore the wonderful natural scenery surrounded by long and majestic mountains.|||On the mountain slope, simple leaf-roofed houses are built, making an interesting stopover. At this place, visitors can drink the fragrant water, taste special fruits such as jackfruit, lychee, watermelon..., and especially observe the scenery from above, overlooking the whole Suoi Mo mountain and forest. Passing through the mountains, visitors will come across very clear and cool streams that make them forget the hot summer days. The streams have some sections like white silk ribbons on the rocks, while others resemble black buffalo sleeping and bathing... Suddenly, vertical cliffs stand with waterfalls pouring down, creating a misty veil with shimmering rainbow colors. Going higher, visitors will encounter the "Thac Chua" (Lord Waterfall), also known as "Thum Thum" waterfall, with water pouring down from a hundred-meter height, majestic and impressive, like thunder and ancient war drums. Besides Suoi Mo Temple, there are also temples and pagodas such as Hung Dao Vuong Tran Quoc Tuan Temple (the general who led the army to defeat the Yuan-Mongol invaders), Hon Trung Pagoda, Ho Bac Pagoda, and Xoan Communal House...If the hot weather on the way to Suoi Mo makes tourists feel tired, the fresh atmosphere of the mountain forest will bring them a feeling of relaxation and comfort. Following the winding road into the stream, tourists can admire a majestic mountain range with planted trees like pine, cypress, and fir. The road to Suoi Mo is paved with flat concrete, creating easy-to-walk stairs. Along this road, another path is created by many rock walls, suitable for adventure-seekers.|||Now, come to Suoi Mo Tourism Area to immerse yourself in the majestic natural scenery and the mystical temple incense, to feel like shedding worldly worries and finding peace. Besides enjoying the scenery given by nature, visiting Suoi Mo Tourism Area, tourists also seem to enter a fairyland with temples and pagodas lying still on the mountain peaks. Suoi Mo Temple includes Ha, Trung, and Thuong temples, located along the Suoi Mo stream, all worshiping Thanh Mau Thuong Ngan - Princess Que My Nuong, the daughter of the 16th Hung King.

title: Thien Duong Cave
description: Location: Son Trach commune, Bo Trach district, Quang Binh province, about 70km northwest of Dong Hoi city center. Features: Thien Duong is the longest dry cave in Asia, stretching 31.4km.|||Located 60km northwest of Dong Hoi city, Thien Duong Cave lies in the core zone of Phong Nha - Ke Bang National Park (Son Trach commune, Bo Trach district, Quang Binh province), a World Natural Heritage Site. Discovered in 2005, it's considered the longest dry cave in Asia, measuring over 31.4km in length, 30-100m in width, and up to 150m in some areas. The cave boasts a majestic, stunning, and mystical structure, evoking the idea of a heavenly palace on earth, hence its name 'Thien Duong'.|||Thien Duong Cave sits at an altitude of 360m above sea level, with a temperature difference of 9-10°C compared to the outside. It's divided into multiple compartments, with the widest one reaching 150m in width and 100m in height. The cave entrance is narrow, but inside, visitors enter a vast, shimmering space with a remarkably cool and pleasant atmosphere. A 1km-long wooden staircase winds through the cave, allowing visitors to admire the crystallized stalactites and stalagmites forming shapes like Tien Ong, Phat Ba, a communal house, terraced fields, and waterfalls.|||Thien Duong Cave stands out for its unique features, making it a top-ranked cave internationally for its aesthetic, scientific value, and breathtaking beauty. Many layers of stunning stalactites and stalagmites mesmerize visitors.|||For adventurous travelers, a 7km journey deeper into the cave offers an unforgettable experience. Along the way, visitors encounter shimmering stalactites and stalagmites, diverse in shape and form. In certain sections, kayak rentals allow visitors to explore the cave's underground streams and admire the stunning rock formations. The journey concludes at 'Ginht Troi' (Sky Well), a 30m-diameter sinkhole. Sunlight filtering through 'Ginht Troi' highlights the cave's mystical beauty.|||Come and discover Thien Duong Cave's natural wonders.

title: Tuc Dup Historical Site
description: Location: The Tuc Dup historical site is located in Tri Ton town, Tri Ton district, An Giang province. Characteristics: Tuc Dup was a solid base for the military and people of An Giang during the resistance war against America.|||Tuc Dup - known as Tuc Dup to Vietnamese people - in Khmer language means "night water". Tuc Dup is about 300m high and has a perimeter of approximately 2200m. From a distance, Co To mountain and Tuc Dup hill look like a phoenix, so it's also called Phung Hoang Son.|||The legend of Tuc Dup Hill|||Legend has it that in the early days of heaven and earth, fairies often stopped at the top of Co To peak to play, bathe, and frolic. One day, they started throwing stones down the mountain. The stones piled up to form a small hill. The stream they bathed in flowed through the pile of stones. From then on, the stream and the hill existed in the world, at the foot of Co To mountain in the majestic That Son region.|||One day, the pioneers came here. They encountered a dry season, extremely thirsty, couldn't sleep at night, and suddenly heard the sound of dripping water. They discovered a cool stream flowing through the dry hill. The name Tuck Dup (night water) originated from then, and the hill became a sacred place. On festive days, monks and village elders bring offerings to worship the gods, heaven and earth, and then fetch the stream water back to the village.|||The reality of the steel mountain road|||The Southwest region is a fertile land with abundant fish and seafood, where everything is favored by nature. Tuc Dup Hill is gifted by nature with a dense system of caves resembling a giant beehive, connected by numerous passages and narrow crevices. Since the 1940s, Tuc Dup has been a hideout for communist fighters. When being pursued, locals brought food to the cave entrance to worship Heaven and Buddha, but actually, it was to supply the revolution.|||Since 1960, Tuck Dup has been the base of Tri Ton district committee and An Giang provincial committee.|||It was a crucial bridge for northern military units to cross Truong Son to Cambodia and spread across the southwestern battlefield.|||Many weddings of soldiers and guerrilla fighters were organized here.|||Tuc Dup Hill was discovered as the headquarters of the revolutionary base. The US and puppet forces concentrated their attacks, trying to level the entire hill. Bombs rained down not only on Co To but also spread to many surrounding areas, turning the region into a desolate and tragic landscape. Under the bombing campaigns with various types of bombs, including cluster bombs, incendiary bombs, and explosive bombs, as well as artillery fire, Tuc Dup Hill was left barren, with no vegetation or wildlife surviving. It became a dead land. Yet, the revolutionary soldiers still persevered in holding onto the territory.|||Tuc Dup travel today|||It's been over 30 years since the guns fell silent at Tuc Dup, but the signs of fierce battles still linger on the rocky surface. Only the trees and plants have regained their vibrancy.|||Located 10km from the Cambodian border, Tuc Dup Hill is now a fascinating tourist spot. Four seasons of crystal-clear water and vibrant flowers create a fairy-tale ambiance. The path to the hill is paved with flat stones, leading to intact caves and numerous nooks and crannies that invite visitors.|||When visiting Tuc Dup, remember to dress lightly, wear sports shoes, and bring a flashlight as some parts of the caves are dark. Explore the military command center, political education center, women's association, medical center, and the cooling food hangar. Don't miss the C6 assembly hall that can accommodate over 150 people. Each cave boasts unique charm with ingeniously interwoven stone formations. The floor varies between stone, wood, and bamboo. The atmosphere remains refreshingly cool and airy, as if air-conditioned.|||After a few hours of sightseeing, you can exit via the old route and visit the museum. But with a bit of adventurous spirit, you can explore dozens of separate paths, cross many rocky outcrops. You'll reward yourself with the thrill of navigating through, discovering and finally standing on towering rocks like a commanding general surveying the surroundings. You can freely breathe in the fresh air and take in the breathtaking views that nature has generously bestowed upon Tuc Dup.

title: Lien Rwoa Waterfall (Elephant Waterfall)
description: Location: Lien Rwoa Waterfall is located in Nam Ban town, Lam Ha district, 25km southwest of Da Lat city. Features: Lien Rwoa Waterfall, also known as Elephant Waterfall, is one of the beautiful waterfalls in the majestic Central Highlands with a height of over 30m and a width of about 15m.|||The elderly K'ho villagers who have lived in this land for a long time tell the story that: In the past, the chief of Joi Bieng mountain had a very beautiful daughter. Whenever the mountain girl sang, the leaves of the forest stopped rustling, and the birds ceased singing to listen. Her lover was the son of the chief of a neighboring village. He was loved and respected by many not only for his strong physique and handsome face but also for his bravery and courage that few could match. They exchanged vows and became husband and wife, but the young man had to go to war and kill enemies, and many moon seasons passed without him returning. The girl, in her sorrow, went to a deserted mountain where they had previously made promises, and sang a passionate and melancholic song, hoping her beloved would return to their old haunt. Her song moved the B'ling birds. They flew far away to gather news and then came back to inform her that the young man had sacrificed his life on the battlefield.||||||However, the mountain girl still refused to accept that harsh reality. She kept singing until she was exhausted, collapsed and never got up again. The herd of elephants that had been listening to her sing for so long also turned to stone, mute.|||Suddenly, a loud explosion occurred, the earth shook and the mountain broke in half, and a waterfall suddenly flowed, foaming white.|||The roar of the waterfall blended with the rustling of the trees, the chirping of birds, as if continuing the song, the music of the beautiful and devoted mountain girl.|||The K'ho people then named the waterfall Lieng Rowoa Joi Bieng - the waterfall of the elephants that turned to stone in devotion to a passionate and steadfast love.|||It would be a pity if you come to Da Lat - Lam Dong without visiting the mystical and romantic Lieng Rowoa (Elephant Waterfall). This waterfall is associated with a legend about a devoted and tragic love story and has been recognized as a national scenic site. The crystal-clear water flows down the granite mountain slope, looking spectacular, especially when the sunlight shines down, creating a brilliant rainbow. To reach the foot of the waterfall, visitors must conquer 145 winding steps: some are natural stone steps carved into the steep cliff, while others are wooden boards of a charming suspension bridge beside the abyss. As far as the eye can see, there is a vast primeval forest with centuries-old trees, their trunks and branches entangled with vines. Amidst the vastness, layers of forest trees display a deep green color or are dotted with clusters of fiery red leaves, while golden or violet flowers bloom in stunning beauty.|||At the foot of the waterfall and in the old forest, there are large rocks that look like elephants. The roar of the waterfall makes visitors imagine a herd of elephants racing or playing with each other, spraying water.|||Behind the white waterfall, which is shrouded in mist, are mysterious deep caves. One of them is the Bat Cave, extending 50m underground, with strange rock shapes and colors. The roots and vines are intertwined, and the deeper you go, the darker and colder it gets, like a witch's den.|||The other is the Wind Cave, with a very narrow entrance but quite spacious inside, where the wind whispers through like the sound of a flute.|||Besides its charming beauty, Vo Waterfall was once a revolutionary base during the two wars against France and America. Recently restored as a tourist site in recent years, Vo Waterfall was quickly recognized as a national cultural and historical relic. A 2 billion VND investment project to upgrade the Lieng Rowoa scenic spot in 2003-2005 was also approved by local authorities. However, the most ardent wish of those who love Vo Waterfall is to be cautious and not to lose the pristine and mystical beauty of Lieng Rowoa.

title: Binh Tay Market
description: Location: 57A Thap Muoi, District 6, Ho Chi Minh City. Characteristics: This is a major wholesale market in Ho Chi Minh City, reflecting the daily life of the Chinese community in the city.|||Binh Tay Market was built by the Chinese community in the Eastern City area, Dinh Phien Chan (now in Districts 5, 6, 10, and 11, Ho Chi Minh City) in the 18th century. Compared to Vietnamese markets at that time, this market was larger and was called Cho Lon (Big Market). In 1928, to expand the market and meet the growing business needs of Chinese traders, Quach Dam funded the construction of a new Cho Lon on a 25,000m2 site in Binh Tay village (Eastern City) using modern French construction techniques with Chinese architectural style. After its operation, with a favorable traffic location and experienced traders, Cho Lon quickly became a major wholesale market across the country and neighboring countries (Laos, Cambodia, etc.). After 1975, Cho Lon was renamed Binh Tay Market. In 1992, the market was repaired and an additional floor was built.|||The market is adjacent to Le Tan Ke, Thap Muoi, Tran Binh, and Phan Van Khoe streets. It has 12 auxiliary gates and a main gate facing Thap Muoi highway, opposite Cho Lon bus station, facilitating transportation and goods delivery. The main gate's architecture resembles an ancient temple, with a yin-yang tiled roof, two floors, and a large clock on each of its four sides. The roof and gate peak feature raised dragon shapes. The front of the gate has a green ceramic mosaic depicting "two dragons playing with a pearl". The market has a central courtyard with a fountain, creating a cool space. A statue of Quach Dam is placed here, with the construction year inscribed on the pedestal. The pedestal is surrounded by four bronze lion statues holding pearls and four bronze dragon statues spouting water. The market's four corners feature small pavilions with Eastern-style roofs.|||Binh Tay Market has nearly 2,500 business stalls with over 30 different product groups. The goods are arranged rationally, concentrated in specific business areas to promote the strengths of each product group.

title: Lo Hanh Communal House
description: Location: Dong Lo commune, Hiep Hoa district, Bac Giang province. Characteristics: It is one of the ancient communal houses of the Kinh Bac region known as "The No. 1 Kinh Bac".|||Lo Hanh Communal House is a shared communal house of 5 villages: Cham, Chung, Khoat, Chua and Hanh, so it is also known as Ca communal house. The communal house was built in 1576, during the Sung Khang reign, and is dedicated to Cao Son Dai Vuong and Phuong Dung Tien Chua - two gods who contributed to the country and people during the Hung Kings' reign.|||Lo Hanh Communal House holds a unique cultural value with sophisticated and distinctive carving art featuring dragons, phoenixes, deer, flowers, leaves and human activities. The communal house still preserves many precious artifacts such as two son mai paintings "Bat tien" in the middle room before the back hall, a pair of 17th-century wooden nghes with lacquer and gold plating, a statue of Phuong Dung Tien Chua and a tablet of Cao Son Dai Vuong..., especially a carving of a fairy playing the dan day - evidence of the early birth and development of ca tru in Vietnam. Initially, Lo Hanh Communal House only had a single-storey main building in the shape of the character "nhat". After several restorations in 1694, 1850 and 1910, the communal house was added with a back hall and two side rooms. The main building is 23.5m long, 12.3m wide, 6.6m high from the roof and 2.1m from the eaves. It consists of 5 rooms, 2 chai and 8 pillars with 4 main columns and 2 lateral columns. The pillars have different structures; the middle ones follow the "chong ruong gia chieng" style while the side ones follow the "ke truyen gia chieng" style.|||On December 24, 1982, Lo Hanh Communal House was recognized as a national historical and cultural relic by the Ministry of Culture (now the Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism).

title: Ninh Kiều Wharf
description: Location: Situated at the confluence of the Hau River and Can Tho River, in Tan An Ward, Ninh Kiều District, Can Tho City. Characteristics: With its picturesque riverine beauty, Ninh Kiều Wharf has become an iconic symbol of Can Tho City, immortalized in poetry.|||Originally, Ninh Kiều Wharf was a riverbank landing at the beginning of Can Tho Market. In 1876, French forces occupied Can Tho, and the wharf was constructed with bricks and stones along the riverbank to prevent erosion, becoming a commercial shipping dock - a bustling trading hub. The French named it Quai de Commerce (Commercial Wharf), while locals called it Hang Duong Wharf due to the row of poplar trees along the riverbank or Le Loi Wharf, named after the nearby Le Loi Street. In 1957, Can Tho Province's leader, Đỗ Văn Chước, established a recreational wharf and landscape garden at Hang Duong Wharf. He later proposed to Ngo Dinh Diem (the President of South Vietnam) to rename the wharf and park Ninh Kiều, inspired by the historic Ninh Kiều site (now Chuc Son Town, Chuong My District, Hanoi City), which marked a significant victory of Le Loi and the Lam Son insurgents against the Ming invaders.|||Today, Ninh Kiều Wharf has been developed into a 7,000m² tourism park, attracting numerous locals and tourists who come to admire the scenery, take leisurely walks, and relax. From Ninh Kiều Wharf, visitors can see the Can Tho Bridge - a cable-stayed bridge with the longest span in Southeast Asia upon its completion (April 2010). The park features a 7.2m-high bronze statue of President Ho Chi Minh on a 3.6m-high pedestal, weighing over 12 tons. Le Loi Street along the river has been planned as a pedestrian street and the first night market in Can Tho. Here, every 100 meters, there are stalls selling various goods such as food, fruits, and souvenirs.|||To fully experience the charm of the Mekong River region, visitors to Can Tho should not miss a boat tour on Ninh Kiều Wharf. Every evening, from 7 PM to 9 PM, the boat will take guests on a cruise along the Hậu River, offering special local delicacies and captivating folk performances.

title: Ho Chi Minh City Museum of Fine Arts
description: Location: 97A Pho Duc Chinh, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City. The museum is responsible for researching, collecting, preserving, and exhibiting fine art materials, artifacts, and works from Vietnam and worldwide.|||The museum was originally the residence of Hoa-born merchant Hua Bon Hoa, one of the wealthiest and most famous people in Saigon in the early 20th century.|||The building was constructed on a total area of 3,514m² in the Art-deco style, a harmonious combination of Asian and European art. The roof is covered with red yin-yang tiles, and the eaves have green-glazed tiles. The windows are made of colored glass with European-style patterns. The floor is made of mosaic tiles with diverse designs, and the staircase is made of marble. The museum was the first building in Saigon to have an elevator, which is made of wood and decorated like a Chinese kiosk.|||The architecture of the building is highlighted at the main entrance on the first floor with a high ceiling and large columns. The main door is designed in a curved shape with a metal flower pattern bearing the initials H.B.H - the abbreviated name of Hua Bon Hoa.|||In 1987, the building was renovated by the Ho Chi Minh City People's Committee into the Museum of Fine Arts, which officially opened to visitors in 1989. Among the exhibited paintings is a large-scale lacquer artwork called 'Garden of Spring in North, Central, and South' by famous artist Nguyen Gia Tri, considered a national treasure.|||The museum has four floors, including one basement and three upper floors, with two longitudinal and two transversal houses creating a central courtyard. The basement is used for office work and art exhibitions. The first floor is for exhibitions, art business, and events. The second floor showcases sculptures and contemporary fine arts. The third floor exhibits ancient, modern, and traditional handicraft art collections. In 2011, the museum opened an additional exhibition area for oil paintings next to the main building.|||The museum is open daily from 9:00 AM to 4:45 PM.

title: Chuu Dong Tu Temple
description: Location: Chuu Dong Tu Temple consists of 2 temples: Đa Hòa temple in Đa Hoà village, Bình Minh commune, and Dạ Trạch temple in Yên Vĩnh village, Dạ Trạch commune, Khoái Châu district, Hưng Yên province. Characteristics: Both temples worship Saint Chuu Dong Tu and his two wives.|||Chuu Dong Tu temples are located in many places across Vietnam. In Khoái Châu district, Hưng Yên province, about 25km from Hanoi along the Hồng River dike, there are two temples dedicated to Saint Chuu Dong Tu. One temple is located in Đa Hoà village, Bình Minh commune, overlooking the Tự Nhiên beach where Princess Tiên Dung, daughter of the 18th Hùng King, met and fell in love with poor Chuu. The second temple is in Yên Vĩnh village, Dạ Trạch commune, where Chuu and his two wives ascended to heaven.|||Although both temples worship Saint Chuu Dong Tu and his two wives with traditional architecture, they have notable differences.|||The Đa Hoà temple (ranked as a cultural relic in 1962) is situated on a high, flat, rectangular area of 18,720m² with beautiful scenery. The main structure consists of 18 traditional houses like 18 boats, symbolizing 18 generations of Hùng Kings.|||The temple has a three-gate entrance, a large central gate for grand ceremonies, and two smaller gates for visitors. The complex includes Đại tế, Thiêu hương, cung Đệ Nhị, cung Đệ Tam, and Hậu cung. The Thiêu hương has a high, airy, and solemn architecture with intricate carvings and colorful decorations. The temple also features copper statues of Saint Chuu Dong Tu and his wives.|||The temple preserves many precious artifacts, including a pair of Bách thọ vases with 100 different characters.|||The Dạ Trạch temple, ranked as a relic in 1989, is located in a spacious area next to Dạ Trạch pond. Its main structure consists of a bell tower, a semi-circular pond, and a three-house worship area. The temple exudes an ancient and sacred atmosphere.|||The Chuu Dong Tu festival takes place from the 10th to 12th day of the second lunar month annually at both temples.

title: Den Tien La
description: Location: Den Tien La is located in Tien La village, Doan Hung commune, Hung Ha district, Thai Binh province. Characteristics: The temple worships Bat Nan general Vu Thi Thuc (also known as Thuc Nuong) - a female general of the Trưng Sisters who defeated the invading army from the North and was titled “Dong Nhung Dai Tuong Quan”.|||From Thai Binh City, take provincial road 223 about 30km to the northwest to reach Hung Ha town. From here, turn right and go 1km to the Tien Huong river dike, then turn left and follow the dike for about 3km to reach the Tien La temple.|||Tien La Temple was built on Kim Quy hill in Tien La village following the ancient architectural model of 'Tien nhat, Hau dinh', with columns, rafters and roof blades curved in the shape of Luong Long Chau Nguyet, on an area of nearly 6,000m².|||The front of the temple faces Tiên Hưng river, near the junction leading to Luộc river.|||It is surrounded by lush and green longan trees.|||The temple consists of main structures such as: outer tam quan, inner tam quan, Tien Te, Trung Te and Hau Cung. Through the outer tam quan, the temple yard leads to the inner tam quan, with Luau Cau and Luau Co on either side. Continuing on, you'll reach the Tien Te house (5 rooms), built with four-sided wooden architecture, featuring intricate carvings of 'Dragon - Ly - Turtle - Phoenix' interwoven with 'Pine - Bamboo - Chrysanthemum - Plum'. There are also large boards with content praising the Trung Sisters' dynasty and the virtues, talents of female general Bat Nan.|||Next is the Trung Te house, built in the style of a communal house, with an ancient architectural style. Notably, all building materials used are stone, including stone pillars, beams, and rafters. The system of pillars and rafters are intricately carved, with 4 main pillars featuring the four sacred animals, 12 military pillars with dragon clouds, and eight beams with 'Pine - Bamboo - Chrysanthemum - Plum' interwoven with 'Dragon - Ly - Turtle - Phoenix'.|||Going deeper inside, you'll reach the Hau Cung, built with four-sided wood, consisting of 3 rooms. The middle room has an altar with a throne and statue of General Bat Nan Vu Thi Thuc, surrounded by worshiping the generals of hers; the left room worships her father, and the right room worships her mother. Above the Hau Cung, a large board hangs with the four words: 'Van Co Anh Linh'. Legend has it that this is also the place where General Bat Nan's tomb is located.|||Along with its unique architecture, the temple preserves many artifacts and ceremonial objects from the Tran and Le dynasties, and royal decrees such as: Y Duc Doan Trang Thuc Cong Chua (reign of King Le Thanh Tong), Duc Bao Trung Hung Linh Phu Chi Than (reign of King Minh Mang), Duc Bao Trung Hung Linh Phu Thuong Dang Than (reign of King Khai Dinh).|||Every year, the Management Board of Tien La Temple organizes many major festivals (according to the lunar calendar) to serve the cultural and spiritual needs of people and tourists, including: on the 1st - 4th day of the first lunar month, the Upper Yuan festival is held; on the 10th day of the third lunar month, the Khai Hoi ceremony, procession of water is organized; on the 1st - 17th day of the third lunar month, the Tien La Temple festival is held (the main festival on the 17th day, coinciding with the day of Bat Nan general's death, on March 17, Quy Mao year); on the 15th day of the eighth lunar month, a grand birthday celebration is held; on the 10th day of the eleventh lunar month, a memorial ceremony is held to commemorate the day Bat Nan general led the army to rise up.|||The Tien La Temple festival is organized on a large scale, including various rituals, cultural, artistic, and sports activities such as: palanquin procession, water procession, dao throwing, bamboo flute playing, cock fighting, wrestling, dragon dancing, lion dancing, and cheo performance.|||Tien La Temple was recognized as a national historical and cultural site by the State on November 12, 1986.

title: Tham Mountain
description: Location: In Thanh Ba district, Phu Tho province. Characteristics: Tham Mountain, also known as Dragon Head Mountain, is about 4km long, running along Thanh Ba tourist area.|||On the top of the mountain, there is a small pond called Tien pond, with clear and never-drying water. Surrounding Tham Mountain are hundreds of gentle hills, close to each other, rising and falling like upside-down bowls. This hillside has been planned for industrial crops such as tea, lacquer, tung... Here, tea factories, cement factories, wine, phosphate and cattle farms have been built. Tham Mountain is not only a beautiful landscape but also an economic center of the midland region.

title: Dong Chau Beach Tourist Area
description: Location: Dong Chau Beach is located in Tien Hai district, 35km from Thai Binh city following the provincial road to Kien Xuong - Tien Hai. Features: Coming to Dong Chau Beach, visitors can enjoy the fresh air of the sea and the windy beach.|||The tourist area includes the coastline of Dong Minh commune; Lan Estuary; two sea islands, Con Thu and Con Vanh. The total area of the tourist area is tens of km2, the center of the tourist area is 5km long Dong Chau Beach, where a system of high-rise hotels and resorts has been formed to serve visitors to Dong Chau for sea bathing and relaxation. Interestingly, from Dong Chau Beach, visitors can take a boat or motorboat to visit and bathe at Con Thu and Con Vanh. Located 7km from the mainland, Con Thu and Con Vanh emerge like two green waves in the sea.|||Con Thu has a white sandy beach, pine forest, and green phi lao forest, with a romantic small beach, making it an ideal destination for visitors to go bathing, organize picnics, and relax by boat with various fun and entertaining activities at sea such as fishing, surfing, beach volleyball...|||Con Vanh is 15km2 wide, with a mangrove forest conservation area that is a stopover for rare bird species such as spoonbill, pelican, seagull... Every year, this place attracts many tourists who are researchers and travelers to visit the island.|||Coming to Dong Chau Beach, visitors can enjoy the fresh air of the sea and the windy beach, visit the Nha Ba Temple worshiping the wife of a king of the Song dynasty in China who helped the Tran dynasty defeat the Yuan-Mongol army and this is also the base of activities of the North Vietnam revolutionary organization before the August Revolution.

title: Cao Son Market
description: Location: Cao Son Market is located in Cao Son commune, Muong Khuong district, Lao Cai province, about 80km from Lao Cai city. Features: Here, visitors can exchange, chat and learn more about the daily life of ethnic people living in 4 largest villages of Muong Khuong district.|||To get to Cao Son Market, visitors can take various routes. However, if visitors want to take a boat trip on the river and immerse themselves in the poetic and picturesque natural scenery: above is the sky, below is the water and on both sides of the river are majestic green mountains and forests of Northwest, please join the river tour: Bao Nhai - Cao Son.|||From Lao Cai City, take National Highway 4D to Phong Nien commune, Bao Thang district, Lao Cai province. Then, follow Provincial Road 153 to Bao Nhai boat dock, at the foot of Bao Nhai bridge, Bao Nhai commune, Bac Ha district, Lao Cai province. From here, head up the Chay River to Cao Son market, about 31km north.|||Cao Son Market is a market for the Mong, Phu La, Dao and Black Han ethnic groups living in the 4 largest villages of Muong Khuong district.|||The market only opens once a week on Wednesday.|||When the market opens, from early morning, people from all the villages line up and head to the market. They travel in groups, pairs, or sometimes alone. Some carry goods on their backs, others use horses to transport goods, while some ride motorbikes or bicycles. The women wear elegant dresses and colorful hats with intricate patterns, creating a lively and charming scene.|||Cao Son Market becomes even more beautiful with people, goods, and natural scenery. In the vast and immense space of mountains and forests, everyone feels so small... They freely buy, sell, and exchange goods with each other. Some buy rice, others buy handicrafts, some buy vegetables, fruits, and others enjoy some special highland delicacies...|||Similar to some other highland markets, Cao Son Market is divided into several sections:|||Items with distinctive mountain flavors such as various fruits and vegetables, herbs, mushrooms, wood ear fungus, honey, corn wine, hill rice, household items, jewelry, etc. are concentrated in one area, arranged beautifully by type. Amidst this colorful scene, a stall selling handicrafts stands out with vibrant colors and lively patterns. These refined products showcase the skill and dexterity of Mong, Phu La, and Dao women in cultivating flax, spinning yarn, weaving fabric, dyeing, and embroidering flowers.|||However, the most attention-grabbing is the livestock and poultry trading area, featuring cattle, pigs, chickens, dogs, horses, and more. The atmosphere in this area is lively, with buyers and sellers standing, sitting, and negotiating purchases.|||Just a few hundred meters away is an area featuring ethnic minority cuisine. Here, visitors are easily overwhelmed by the enticing aromas of various dishes, such as the rich smell of thang co made with buffalo, horse, and beef from the Mong people, or the strong, slightly spicy flavor of ethnic wines like Coc Dam and Coc Ngu corn wine.|||In this lively and tempting atmosphere, visitors can't help but stop, sit down, and join the locals in savoring their traditional food.|||Visiting Cao Son market offers tourists a chance to experience the cultural exchange of several ethnic groups living in villages along the Song Chay river, in Muong Khuong district. Besides, tourists can take a boat trip on the Song Chay river and admire the scenery on both banks.

title: Dan Nam Giao
description: Location: Dan Nam Giao is located in Thuy Xuan commune, Hue city, Thua Thien - Hue province. Characteristics: It is an outdoor altar, an architectural model that carries both religious and political significance of the Eastern monarchic system.|||Right after ascending to the throne (1802), King Gia Long ordered the construction of an altar in An Ninh village in 1803. A few years later, the royal court abandoned that location and built another altar in Duong Xuan village, south of the imperial city of Hue (a relic that is now preserved).||||||The Heaven Worship Altar was started construction on March 25, 1806.|||In early 1807, the Gia Long imperial court held the first Giao ceremony here.||||||The Nam Giao altar is an outdoor altar. This architectural model carries both religious and political meanings of the Eastern monarchy. The Nam Giao altar is associated with the Heaven's Mandate theory of Confucianism. The altar's structure describes the limited universe concept of previous dynasties: Round sky, square earth.|||The Nam Giao altar faces south. The stone wall surrounding the altar has four empty gates, one for each direction. A large screen is built in front of each gate: 12.5m wide, 3.2m high, and 8.8m thick.|||During ceremonies, a large flag with a different color is placed in front of each gate: black for the North gate, red for the South gate, green for the East gate, and white for the West gate.|||The altar is structured into three tiers, large at the bottom and smaller at the top, stacked on top of each other, symbolizing the Three Resources: Heaven, Earth, and Human. Each tier has a distinct shape and color: the sky is round, the earth is square, and the heaven is blue while the earth is yellow.|||The top tier is a circle called the Circular Altar, representing the sky, surrounded by a blue-painted railing.|||On the day of the ceremony, a conical hut covered in blue fabric, called the Green Hut, is erected on this tier.|||The next tier is a square called the Square Altar, representing the earth, with yellow-painted railings on all four sides.|||During the ceremony, the royal court sets up a square hut covered in yellow fabric, smaller than the one above, called the Yellow Hut.|||The bottom tier is also square, with red-painted railings symbolizing humanity, where 128 civil and martial students perform dances during the ceremony.|||The three tiers together stand at a height of 4.65m.|||The Nam Giao altar applies the principles of Yin-Yang and the Five Elements of the I Ching.|||Since the time of Gia Long (1802 - 1819), the Giao ceremony was held in the upper week of the second lunar month every year. From 1880, the court of Thanh Thai changed the ceremony to be held every three years in the years of Ty, Mao, Ngo, and Dau. The Ministry of Rites and the Ministry of Public Works had to prepare for the ceremony several months in advance. On each occasion, the king came and stayed at Trai Cung for 3 days, later reduced to one day during the Bao Dai era. From Dai Noi, the king went to Trai Cung with a procession called Ngu Dao, consisting of 1,000 to 5,000 people, all wearing ceremonial robes and brilliant adornments. The king sat on the Ngu Lien carried by Loan soldiers in the middle of the road. The grand ceremony officially began at 2 am and lasted nearly 3 hours.||||||The sacrificial altars of the Ly, Tran, and Le dynasties have all disappeared. The Nam Giao altar of the Nguyen dynasty in Hue is the only remaining relic that is relatively intact.|||Visiting this place, tourists have the opportunity to learn more about many aspects of cultural and spiritual life in the feudal court of Vietnam.

title: Lai Thieu Fruit Garden
description: Location: Lai Thieu Fruit Garden is located in Lai Thieu town, Thu An district, Binh Duong province, about 20km north of Ho Chi Minh City. Characteristics: For centuries, Lai Thieu has been famous for its excellent fruit garden with a total area of 1,230ha of planted trees and has become a suitable green tourist destination for all ages.|||Lai Thieu garden is formed by a river flowing from Ho Chi Minh City to Thu An district of Binh Duong province, then branching into two streams, creating an island. The land and trees here are constantly nourished and watered by these two streams.|||Visiting Lai Thieu, tourists can walk along the small path into the garden to breathe the fresh air of the countryside. Walking through the garden full of green trees, tourists will enjoy the cool air with morning sunlight and a gentle breeze, blowing through the fertile fields and the cool river of the Mekong Delta, immersing themselves in the romantic scenery to hear the rustling of leaves and the gentle lapping of the river water against the garden. The special charm of this garden is the blended fragrance of dozens of fruit trees: durian, mangosteen, jackfruit, sapoche, custard apple... competing to emit their fragrance, enticing and lingering.|||If tourists want to take a boat trip to feel the floating sensation on the water, there are already available boats at the wharf. Tourists will meet boats carrying fragrant fruits and young men and women of Lai Thieu, still bearing the rustic features, inviting you to buy goods.|||If you want to stay and enjoy the unique flavor of the region's fruits, tourists can rest on the available chairs under the trees and admire the golden-yellow jackfruits, sweet and fragrant, or the spiky durians weighing several kilograms, containing sweet and fragrant pulp. The fruits here have a very unique flavor, and anyone who has tried them once will never forget.

title: Dong Khoi Historical Site
description: Location: Dinh Thuy commune, Mo Cay district, Ben Tre province. Characteristics: Preserves relics of the Dong Khoi movement, which sparked the revolutionary struggle in southern Vietnam in the early 1960s|||From Ben Tre city, cross Ham Luong bridge along National Highway 57 for over 10km to Moc Cay Nam town, then turn left for about 4km to reach the Dong Khoi historical site. The highlight is the Dong Khoi Traditional House, inaugurated on January 17, 2000. The house, covering nearly 5,000m2, was built on the site of the former provincial governor's mansion, featuring a ground floor and an upper floor. It displays images, artifacts, and relics related to the historic Dong Khoi movement and the glorious revolutionary struggle of the people of Mo Cay district and Ben Tre province, such as coconut shell drums, machetes, homemade guns and bombs, and model battlefields. On the roof of the traditional house stands a 12m-high, 4.5m-diameter torch symbol, representing the three-pronged attack by the military and people's forces and the uprising of the people in three island clusters in Ben Tre. To the right of the traditional house is a red stone with eight golden letters bestowed by President Ho Chi Minh: 'Anh dũng Đồng Khởi, thắng Mỹ diệt ngụy' (Brave Dong Khoi, defeat America and destroy the puppet regime). The premises are decorated with various ornamental plants, creating a fresh and airy space.|||The site also features the Rắn communal house with many mysterious legends. Previously, the house was a habitat for many snakes, hence its name. Since the August 1945 Revolution, Rắn communal house has been a secret meeting place for revolutionary cadres and a departure point for many armed attacks. In 2005, it was restored on a 1,000m2 site, built in a single-story style with two sections: the communal house and the front. The annual communal festival takes place on the 14th, 15th, and 16th days of the fifth lunar month.|||The Vàm Nước Trong fort, located by the Hàm Luông River, is another must-visit destination. With its shady coconut groves and pristine, tranquil riverbanks, the site witnessed glorious victories of the military and people during the two resistance wars against France and America.|||At Dong Khoi, visitors can enjoy and exchange in traditional music performances by the Hàm Luông River and taste famous local delicacies such as fermented shrimp paste with boiled pork, grilled snakehead fish, and various sweet and sour soups.|||The Dong Khoi historical site was recognized as a national historical site by the Ministry of Culture and Information (now the Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism) on January 7, 1993.

title: Nhi Chau Pagoda
description: Located on Pho Hien Street, Hong Nam Commune, Hung Yen City, Hung Yen Province. Nhi Chau Pagoda is closely associated with Nguyen Thi Ngoc Thanh, wife of King Le Dai Hanh.|||The pagoda's literary name is 'Thuy Ung Tu' (Swallow Pagoda), built during the Dinh dynasty (10th century). According to legend, Le Hoan, who stationed his troops in Nhi Chau to fight against the invading Song dynasty, had a pagoda built. He declared that the pagoda would belong to the village that could afford to pay the workers. Thanks to the help of Nguyen Thi Ngoc Thanh's family (from Nhi Chau village), the villagers could pay the workers, and the pagoda belonged to the village from then on.|||Le Hoan was impressed by Ngoc Thanh's beauty and made her his wife. During this time, she contributed significantly to Le Hoan's army in defeating the Song invaders. When Le Hoan became emperor, Ngoc Thanh chose to stay in her hometown to care for her elderly parents rather than follow the king to Hoa Lu. After her death, the king built a temple opposite Nhi Chau Pagoda and honored her as 'Ngoc Thanh Royal Concubine'.|||The pagoda has undergone several restorations and renovations, most recently in 2005 as part of the second phase of the Pho Hien ancient site restoration project. The pagoda was rebuilt according to its original structure in the 'Nội công ngoại quốc' style, featuring several sections, including the main hall, the upper hall, and two corridors.|||The main hall is 15m long, 5m wide, and consists of 7 compartments, built with a simple beam structure. At both ends of the main hall, there are two 3.5m-high stone pillars with two nghê statues on top. Above the main hall, the three Chinese characters 'Thuy Ung Tu' are inscribed. The decorative patterns on the main hall feature intricate carvings of dragons and flowers.|||The upper hall, measuring 12m long and 5m wide, has a similar architectural style to the main hall. Inside, there are beautifully crafted statues, including the notable Tam The and Tuyet Son statues. The Tam The statues, made of wood, depict the Buddha sitting in meditation on a lotus throne. The walls of the lotus throne are carved with floral patterns and Buddhist stories. The Tuyet Son statue, carved in a contemplative pose, is an ancient relic from the Le dynasty, representing the Buddha during his ascetic practices on Tuyet Son Mountain.|||The two corridors of the pagoda are symmetrical and house hundreds of statues, showcasing various Buddhist stories.|||In 1992, Nhi Chau Pagoda was recognized as a national historical and cultural site by the Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism.

title: Vinh Moc Tunnel
description: Location: Vinh Moc Tunnel is located in Vinh Linh district, Quang Tri province, 13km east of National Route 1A, 6km north of Cua Tung. Characteristics: The tunnel is nearly 2km long and consists of three underground levels. This was a steel fortress of North Vietnam during the 7 years of resistance against the US imperial destructive war.|||Moc Bay was the first place to be destroyed by US bombing during the aerial war against North Vietnam.|||The Vinh Moc tunnels are one of the attractions of the famous DMZ (demilitarized zone) tourist route, attracting many domestic and international tourists, especially American veterans.|||They come to admire this unique monument, a typical testament to the sacrifice, endurance and bravery of the people of Vinh Moc in particular and Vietnam in general. Thousands of comments from foreign visitors express their admiration for the intelligence and willpower of the Vietnamese people.|||The Vinh Moc tunnel system was dug and completed within 2 years, involving approximately 6,000m3 of soil and rock. The tunnel system has a total length of nearly 2km, divided into 3 layers: the first layer is about 13m underground; the second layer is about 15m; and the third layer is over 23m deep. It consists of 13 entrance and exit points that also serve as ventilation shafts (seven leading to the sea and six leading to the hills).|||The tunnel was designed as an underground village with 94 family units, including a freshwater well to support daily life, a meeting hall that can accommodate about 60 people, a notice board, a maternity hospital, a restroom, an operating room, a Hoang Cam stove (a type of stove that can be used underground with limited smoke emission), a rice storage area, a telephone station, an observation post, a guard station, and a bomb shelter.|||A strong impression when stepping into the Vinh Moc relic site is the large quote in the gallery: "To be or not to be", from Shakespeare's famous work Hamlet. This quote takes on greater meaning and evokes emotions in visitors when placed beside photographs: one taken in February 1965 showing a prosperous rural landscape with dense houses; another of the same village, but completely destroyed by enemy bombs; a photo of 11 children born in the darkness of war now gathered in the light of victory; and a picture of four female guerrilla fighters in white shirts, optimistic and singing in a tunnel, and then in military green, appearing on the surface to operate cannons against the enemy.|||The harsh reality of war here made people want to survive in only two ways: either leave or hide underground. The people of Vinh Moc chose the second option. "To exist or not to exist" was answered by the people of Vinh Moc by having 17 citizens born right in the tunnels in 1967-1968.|||Today, when visiting Vinh Moc tunnels, surrounded by lush rubber and pepper gardens on the fertile basalt soil, with the serene landscape of sea, sky, clouds, and harmonious water, few people can imagine that over three decades ago, this place was a steel fortress in the North of Vietnam, fighting against the intense destructive war of the American Empire for seven years (1966 - 1972). Vinh Moc was not only the frontline of the North but also a strategic location for gathering food and weapons to supply Con Co island, which is crucial for guarding the Vinh Linh sea area, 28km away. Therefore, the US dropped tens of thousands of tons of bombs and ammunition on this land. The invaders declared: "We must bring this land back to the Stone Age!" A destructive war was waged with the goal of "extending the US border to the 17th parallel - the boundary between the two sides of Hien Luong bridge". It's estimated that in one day, a local had to endure the equivalent of 500 heavy artillery shells.|||In 1976, the Ministry of Culture and Information recognized Vinh Moc tunnel village as a national historical site and listed it among the most important relics. To ensure visitor safety, the local authorities have restored and reinforced the tunnel sections that had collapsed with concrete and installed lighting along the passageways.|||

title: Dalat Cathedral
description: Location: Dalat Cathedral is located on Tran Phu Street, Dalat City, near Novotel hotel. Characteristics: Dalat Cathedral is one of the most typical and ancient architectural works of Dalat.|||This is the largest church in Dalat City, also known as the Cathedral Church, or commonly referred to as the Chicken Church due to the large chicken statue on top of the bell tower.|||The church was built from 1931 to 1942, measuring 65m in length, 14m in width, and 47m in height. From this height, the church's bell tower can be seen from many places in the city. The upper part of the wall is fitted with 70 stained glass panels bearing the mark of medieval European church architecture.|||On Christmas occasions, this is where many people, both within and outside the church, gather for Mass and sightseeing. Besides, in Dalat, there are many smaller churches, including Domaine de Marie and Cam Ly church, each with its own unique features.

title: Cam Nam - A Garden Tourism Area
description: Location: South of Hoi An city, Quang Nam province.|||Features: Cam Nam is famous for its delicious and sweet boiled corn.|||Cam Nam is also known for its mussel scooping profession and unique mussel dishes.|||The locals affectionately call this place 'Con Hen'.|||From the ancient town of Hoi An, looking across the bridge, Cam Nam is like a beautiful island surrounded by green bamboo groves. According to the family genealogy and stories from elderly villagers, Cam Nam (previously known as Cam Pho village) was established relatively early compared to other areas of Hoi An city. In the late 14th century, this barren land in the middle of the Hoai River was where migrants from the North came to settle. They made a living by growing rice, crops and fishing. The names Xuyen Trung, Chau Trung, Trung Tin, and Nam Ngan appeared during the process of land reclamation and settlement by the founders of Tran, Huynh, Le, and Nguyen families from the late 15th to the 17th century.|||Since then, despite going through many ups and downs, the locals have managed to preserve many of their traditional ways of life. The thatched houses with bamboo walls and earthen floors still retain their original appearance, surrounded all year round by the shade of coconut and betel nut trees.|||Visiting here, tourists feel like stepping into a peaceful countryside with thatched houses shrouded in the smoke of the evening, filled with the fragrant scent of blooming betel nut flowers in lush gardens.|||Tourists will also see boats loaded with freshly picked corn, still fragrant with the smell of milk, being ferried back by village girls, their Ao Dai fluttering in the wind.|||Following them, visitors can explore the corn-cooking stoves, which only light up when night falls.|||The rustic dishes such as mixed mussels, stir-fried mussels with rice paper, crushed rice paper dipped in fish sauce, and Cam Nam corn pudding... have made many people away from home nostalgic and eager to return.|||Cam Nam is trending to become a garden house tourist area, symbolizing the rural countryside of Central Vietnam. An investment project to build a garden house tourist area along the Hoai River, located west of Cam Nam Bridge, named "Vietnamese Countryside" is taking shape on an area of 12,000 - 15,000m2. The "Vietnamese Countryside" tourist area includes structures with a strong rustic character, from the architecture to the building materials (three-room houses, thatched roofs, earthen walls...), combined with some wooden frame architectures, tile roofs, bearing the mark of ancient village communal houses. Along with the creation of the space, the project will almost completely recreate the daily activities of a Vietnamese rural village in production: water scooping; waterwheel; plowing and harrowing by buffalo and cow; rice planting; harvesting; or other activities such as: silk spinning, weaving, rattan weaving, wood carving, rice pounding, rice milling... Especially, to create a unique impression of Hội An port in the 20s, activities such as rickshaw, black and white photo taking with a camera covered in fabric, will also be introduced in "Vietnamese Village". Even, at the entrance of the village, there will be a water stall serving typical rural dishes like green tea, bean paste water, coconut water...|||Along with the ancient town of Hoi An, tourism in Hoi An city now has a new product - eco-tourism in garden areas.

title: Cape Ca Mau
description: Location: Cape Ca Mau is located in Ngoc Hien district, Ca Mau province, 118km from Ca Mau city by waterway. Characteristics: Cape Ca Mau is the only place on Vietnamese mainland where tourists can see the sunrise over the East Sea and sunset over the West Sea.|||The land of Cape Ca Mau - the southernmost point of Vietnam - is an area that was reclaimed in the late 17th and early 18th centuries, associated with the lives of three ethnic groups: Vietnamese, Chinese, and Khmer. Therefore, there is a blend of cultural traits, reflected in many rich and unique customs and practices.|||With a fertile alluvial land and flooded forests; under the forest canopy, there are many species of birds, animals, and aquatic products living, creating a unique landscape of Ca Mau with its own characteristics of a young, pristine, and exotic land. First of all, there is the mangrove forest with a rich ecosystem. Especially, the tidal flats of Cape Ca Mau are an area where the East Sea and West Sea tides meet, naturally expanding the land area into the sea by hundreds of hectares each year. The mắm, bần, and đước trees grow and expand the mangrove forest area, bringing a huge source of shrimp, fish, and other aquatic products.|||Deeper inland are freshwater forests with tràm trees and seasonal flooded grasslands. With 239 species of ancient tràm and mangrove forest plants, 36 species of mammals from 17 families, 194 species of birds, 260 species of fish, and many amphibians and reptiles, including rare species such as long-tailed monkeys, smooth-coated otters, catfish, fire-sculpted squirrels, and saltwater crocodiles...|||Cape Ca Mau - the southernmost point - invites travelers to visit. When you arrive, you will see đước trees all around, the sea in front of you; standing on the land, feeling the country's gentle rhythm, 300 years of history, where the Lạc people and their descendants settled and named Cape Ca Mau.|||From Cape Ca Mau, you can see the Hon Khoai island group on the sea, about 20km from the mainland. This is a beautiful island group including Hon Tuong, Hon Sao, Hon Kho, Hon Lon, and Hon Doi Moi. The largest and highest island is Hon Khoai, covering about 4km², with a peak of 318m, and an important lighthouse in the East Sea and Gulf of Thailand.

title: Thung Nham Bird Garden Eco-Tourism Site
description: Located in Ninh Hai commune, Hoa Lu district, Ninh Binh province.|||This is the habitat of thousands of bird species.|||Thung Nham Eco-Tourism Area, also known as Thung Chim, is located in the heart of Trang An Complex, about 5km south of Tam Coc - Bich Dong and 12km west of Ninh Binh City. Thung Nham is surrounded by lush green mountains. At dawn, the thin mist in this pristine space creates a magical atmosphere, making visitors feel like they are in a fairyland. Gently paddling on the calm water, the boat driver will take you to explore the interesting spots in Thung Nham.|||The first stop is the bird garden, home to 46 bird species with nearly 50,000 individuals, including common species like egrets, herons, and munias.|||This place is also habitat for many rare birds listed in Vietnam's Red Book, such as the giant ibis, little egret, pink flamingo, and golden pheasant.|||In the serene atmosphere, the chirping and calling of various birds create a natural symphony, lively and joyful.|||Staying in Thung Nham until around 5-6 pm, visitors can witness flocks of birds flying back to their nests, covering the flooded area.|||The boat continues downstream to take visitors to explore caves located within limestone mountains, such as But Cave, Tien Ca Cave, Ba Co Cave, Thuy Cung Cave, Vai Gioi Cave... At each cave, visitors can admire the stalactites of various shapes hanging from the ceiling and listen to legends associated with the formation of the caves.|||As visitors disembark and step onto the shore, they have the opportunity to explore a thousand-year-old banyan tree growing on a large rock, boasting a unique shape and form considered one-of-a-kind in Vietnam. A must-see attraction in Thung Nham is the 'moving' fig tree at Den Goi Dai Temple. This tree belongs to the Ficus genus and according to scientists, every 300 years or so, its position changes due to the growth of new aerial roots.|||Thung Nham also features a primeval forest with diverse ecosystems, home to 109 plant species and 150 animal species, including many rare ones that require conservation. The area also has an orchard with various tropical fruits such as guavas, apples, starfruits, mangoes, custard apples, and persimmons.|||After exploring the beauty of Thung Nham, visitors can rest at stilt houses nestled under the green forest canopies; enjoy rustic countryside dishes like shoulder pig, hill chicken, lake fish, deer meat, burnt rice, vau bamboo shoots... in a serene, peaceful, and quiet space of the mountains. This is also a suitable spot for activities like hiking, camping, fishing, and weekend relaxation.|||With its beautiful scenery, Thung Nham is an attractive destination for both domestic and international tourists. Late summer to early autumn is the ideal time for visitors to admire the stunning natural scenery of this picturesque land. From Thung Nham, tourists can also combine their visit to other attractions such as Bich Dong Pagoda, Tam Coc scenic spot, Thien Ha cave…

title: Ba The Mountain
description: Location: This is a mountain located in the Long Xuyen quadrilateral region, in Oc Eo town, Thoai Son district, An Giang province. Characteristics: Ba The Mountain was originally named Hoa The Son. During the Minh Mang reign, due to the taboo of the surname of Queen Ho Thi Hoa, Hoa The Son was renamed Ba The Mountain.|||Visiting Ba The Mountain, tourists will have the opportunity to admire a beautiful landscape that nature has bestowed. Standing on the peak and looking out at the surrounding area, you will see vast fields stretching out, with Rach Gia sea in the west and the majestic That Son range in the southwest.|||There is a small concrete path that winds around the mountain to the peak, only about 2km long. On both sides of the path are dense forests, stone walls, and deep abysses. On the peak, there is an ancient temple called Son Tien Tu built in 1933. In front of the temple, there is an 8m-high statue of Quan The Am Bodhisattva standing on a lotus flower, wearing a red robe, majestic and serene, overlooking the world. On the peak, clouds float by, bringing cool mist, and lush greenery surrounds the area. Many birds sing and chirp everywhere. Occasionally, the sound of the temple bell echoes through the mountains, making people feel nostalgic and moved. Next to the ancient stupa, there is a memorial stone recording the glorious victory of the Ba The - Thoai Son liberation forces, who completely destroyed the enemy's stronghold on Ba The peak on May 6, 1968.|||There is a strange relic that sparks tourists' curiosity. It is a 3m-high granite stone, as big as a giant tree trunk that four or five people can hug, located beside the main hall of Son Tien Tu. On the surface of this huge stone, there is a human footprint larger than usual. People believe it is the 'fairy's footprint'. The monks on the mountain tell the story that in the past, when the mountain was first formed, the stone was soft like clay, and a fairy pressed their foot on the stone to leave a mark...|||Going down the mountain slope about 100m from Son Tien temple, tourists will see a display house of artifacts and relics related to the history and culture of Ba The - Oc Eo (the capital of the Funan Kingdom). Notably, this structure has an architectural style very similar to that of temples in South Asian countries, bearing the mark of Hinduism through its vaulted roof architecture. The surrounding walls have statues of Ganesa, a deity with a human body and an elephant head, sitting in a solemn posture, appearing to be in meditation or guarding the area. The display house is square-shaped, with a triple-level entrance facing east, which is believed to be the dwelling place of gods according to Hinduism. The balustrade surrounding the yard is decorated with small statues.|||In the north of Ba The Mountain, there is a stone that looks like a giant sword, 320cm long, 71cm wide, and weighing about 2.5 tons.
