Locals call it Thach Dai Dao, a precious object of heaven and earth, used to punish evil people.|||Standing on Ba The peak, looking out at the distant plain shrouded in the mist of the evening, you will feel your soul calm down, and your heart soar with a sense of detachment, surrounded by the harmonious landscape.

title: Dong Tu Thuc Cave
description: Location: Nga Thien commune, Nga Son district, Thanh Hoa province, about 50km northeast of Thanh Hoa city. Features: This cave is a famous and beautiful site in Thanh Hoa, associated with the legend of "Tu Thuc marries the fairy".|||It belongs to a limestone mountain range stretching from Tam Diep (Ninh Binh) to Than Phu - Nga Son (Thanh Hoa). Previously known as Bich Dao cave, it is linked to the story of Tu Thuc, who was sent by the king to be the district magistrate of Tien Du, Bac Ninh province.|||During a festival, Tu Thuc met a beautiful girl whose single lotus branch had been broken. He took her place and was later on offered to marry the girl, Giang Huong, who turned out to be the girl he saved. They were happy for a year until Tu Thuc wanted to return home.|||Giang Huong then gave him a letter and a magic carriage. However, when Tu Thuc returned to his homeland, many years had passed. The magic carriage had disappeared and he only found a farewell letter from his wife.|||The cave was named after Tu Thuc. Two chinese poems were engraved near the entrance. The cave has a small temple called Son Than temple.|||The cave is divided into two parts. The outer cave has a beautiful stone formation. The inner cave has many stunning stone formations. There are paths leading to the fairy realm and the underworld.|||In 1992, Dong Tu Thuc was recognized as a national scenic site by the Ministry of Culture - Information (now the Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism).

title: Perfume River
description: Location: A romantic river flowing through Hue City, Thua Thien - Hue Province. Characteristics: The Perfume River is beautiful from its source, winding and twisting through mountains and forests, carrying the scents of tropical forest herbs.|||With a length of 80km, the Perfume River is formed by two rivers, Ta Trach and Huu Trach, originating from the Truong Son mountain range. The main stream is the Ta Trach river with a length of about 67km, flowing through Bach Ma National Park and Nam Dong town, then merging with the Huu Trach branch, about 60km long, at Bang Lang junction. This is where the two rivers meet and create the Perfume River.|||The Perfume River is likened to a soft line that makes Hue more romantic and poetic. Visitors who want to explore and admire the river should take a dragon boat ride, ideally during autumn or spring, when the weather in Hue is pleasant. If you take a boat on a sunny day, the river has different beauties. During the day, the river has a jade green color, sparkling under the sun and rippling when boats pass by. At sunset, the Perfume River turns orange and yellow, and this is also when the river is most beautiful. Many people come to Hue, watching the Perfume River at sunset and compare the whole ancient capital city to a 'sad city'. As night falls, Truong Tien Bridge lights up, and the quiet river reflects the light, making it an ideal spot for a romantic evening. Taking a boat ride at night to admire the Huong Giang scenery, releasing flower lanterns, and listening to Hue royal court music on a quiet night is a unique experience.|||Hue's rain also has its own charm. Sitting on a dragon boat, visitors can see a melancholic Hue. On rainy days, the river scenery seems even more mysterious. The double rows of green trees on the riverbank, draped in a silvery gray coat. Truong Tien Bridge is empty of travelers. The Thien Mu Pagoda, leaning against the mountain, appears even more majestic and tranquil. The distant chimes of the pagoda, falling quietly onto the river, bring a sense of peace and calm, washing away all worries. For a long time, the Perfume River has inspired many poets and musicians to create beautiful works. The Perfume River is the 'soul' and 'spirit' of Hue and is a captivating destination for tourists.|||The Perfume River holds a very special value for Hue, especially in the field of tourism. Many famous landscapes, architectural works, and cultural heritages are concentrated along the river and on its banks. Therefore, when coming to Hue, tourists should combine visiting famous tourist spots in Hue such as the Imperial Citadel, tombs, Thien Mu Pagoda... and don't forget to enjoy the quintessential cuisine of the ancient capital.

title: Hương Son Scenic Spot
description: Location: Huong Son Scenic Spot is located in Huong Son commune, My Duc district, Hanoi. Characteristics: This place has a picturesque landscape, featuring "Nam Thien de nhat dong" (the most beautiful cave in the South).|||From Ha Dong district, go to Van Dinh, then stop at Ben Duc to transfer to a boat, cruise down Yen stream about 3km to reach the scenic Hương Sơn.|||The Hương Sơn scenic spot includes a complex of mountains, rivers, villages, pagodas, caves... located around the Hương Tích mountain range, north of the Trường Sơn mountain range, covering an area of thousands of hectares. The Hương Sơn scenic spot is formed by three main routes:|||Hương Tich Route: Includes Yen Stream, Trinh Temple, Hoi Bridge, Thanh Son Pagoda, Huong Dai, Thien Tru, Hinh Bong, Tien Pagoda, Giai Oan, Cua Vong Temple, Huong Tich Cave.|||Yen Stream:|||In the scenic Huong Son, the streams and mountains here have created a "poetic landscape" like a dream, especially Yen Stream. Yen Stream has a gentle beauty, flowing between two mountain slopes. The stream is about 3km long with straight and winding sections, giving the feeling that this stream is endless. During the festival season, the gentle stream suddenly becomes lively with boats carrying customers to admire the scenery and visit the pagoda. Taking a boat from Duc Wharf, following Yen Stream, tourists can relax and let their souls blend with nature. On the left is Dun Mountain, looking like a pile of rice; near Dun Mountain is Soi Mountain, resembling a qilin, also known as Lan Mountain; next to Soi Mountain are Ai and Phuong Mountains with wide wings, and the head and beak of Phuong are Thanh Son Pagoda and cave; a little further is Doi Cheo Mountain, shaped like a large snake swimming on the water; nearby are Bung and Vo Mountains with interesting legends. Huong Son has ninety-nine mountains turning their heads to Huong Tich Cave, and only one mountain, shaped like an elephant, turns its head out and its backside in. Overwhelmed, Ho Phap took his sword and hit the elephant's backside, and now Vo Mountain is still missing a piece. Past Vo Mountain is Mam Xoi Mountain. On the right, from outside in, is Ngu Nhac Mountain with Trinh Temple. Tourists stop for a few minutes to visit and offer incense to the mountain god. Continuing is Deyo Mountain, Phong Su Mountain, Son Thuy Huu Tinh Cave, Trau Cave, Hoi Bridge, Thung Dau... And the last point of Yen Stream is Vai Forest and Nha Lang Lao Tac Mountain. From here, tourists get off the boat and start choosing their own travel itinerary.|||Thien Tru Pagoda|||The temple is also known as Cho Tro temple, originally a small hut established by Monk Van Thuy Thien Thien Tran Dao Vien Quang. During the resistance war against France, the temple was destroyed. After 1954, it was rebuilt. In 1991, the Tam Bao Thien Tru was reconstructed to its current beauty. To the right of the temple is the stupa garden, where the ashes of the venerable monks are kept. Behind the temple, on the side of the mountain, there is the Thien Thuy Thap tower, and to the left is a half-moon shaped lake.|||After visiting and praying at the temple, tourists take a rest to regain their energy for the next part of their journey.|||Tien Son Pagoda:|||Turn right from Thien Tru (Outside Pagoda) and follow a small path along the mountain slope for over 1km to reach Tien Son Pagoda. The pagoda is located on a high mountain. The pagoda is small and charming with a tall three-gate entrance that seems to be flying up. Inside the pagoda is a cave called Tien Mountain Cave, where Lady Buddha Quan The Am is worshiped.|||The cave has stalactites hanging down in various shapes.|||Some of the stalactites produce a pleasant sound like a flute when tapped.|||Temple of Atonement:|||Still on the way to Trong Pagoda, turn left and you will find Giai Oan Pagoda. The pagoda was founded by Zen Master Thong Dung with the dharma name Cuong Truc of the second generation. It is located halfway up Long Tuyen Mountain, initially just a small hut made of bamboo and wood. The pagoda has been renovated in 1928 and 1937. In 1995, Tu Van hermitage was added and the pagoda yard was reinforced with a wall.|||The temple is a place of worship for the Bodhisattva Avalokiteshvara. Today, Tu Van Pagoda still preserves the Four-Armed Avalokiteshvara statue cast in the 18th century.|||The temple has a clear and never-drying well named Thanh Tri. According to legend, this is where the Third Lord (Bodhisattva Avalokiteshvara) used to bathe and cleanse before entering the realm of Buddha.|||From then on, this well was called Gien Oan (Well of Wrongs), and visitors often scoop water to drink, praying to be free from all injustices in life.|||The Temple of Expiation of Wrongs boasts harmonious architecture, nestled in serene natural surroundings that enhance its majestic and mystical aura. Visitors can drink from the cool waters of the Thanh Tri well, seemingly washing away life's worries as they seek spiritual solace.|||Hang Huong Tich|||From Giai Oan Pagoda, visitors continue their 2.5km journey to Huong Tich Cave (also known as Trong Pagoda). The path to the cave is winding, with steep ups and downs. As you get closer to the cave, the slope becomes steeper. Standing at the highest stone steps, looking down, visitors will see a wide and deep cave entrance, which resembles the mouth of a dragon, that is Huong Tich Cave.|||Through the gate, going down 120 stone steps leads to the cave. Right in the middle, near the entrance, there is a stalactite called the "rice dump". Going deeper in a bit, there is a path up to Heaven and one down to Hell. In the cave, the stalactites and stalagmites hang down, creating countless shapes, and people in the past used their imagination to name them: silkworm nursury, cocoon steamer, pigpen, duck pond, golden tree, silver tree, maiden's head, young man's head... Alongside these natural sculptures are man-made ones, most notably a green stone statue of the Goddess of Mercy carved during the Tay Son period.|||Hương Tich is a beautiful and famous cave. Lord Trinh Sam (17th century) personally inscribed five Chinese characters on the cave entrance: "Nam Thien de nhat dong" (The most beautiful cave in the South).|||Long Van Route: Includes Long Van cave and pagoda, Tien cave, Ancestral cave, Cay Khe pagoda, and Hinh Bong Temple.|||Long Van Pagoda:|||After visiting and offering incense at the Tran Temple, take a boat to continue the journey. Visitors will see a fork in the stream, with the path to Huong Tich on the right and the cave and Long Van Pagoda on the left.|||The pagoda is located on the slope of a mountain, half hidden behind An Son Mountain, the other half surrounded by lush green trees and white clouds that swirl around it all year round. The pagoda was built in 1920.|||Long Van Cave was also created during this time.|||Although the cave is small, the smoke and incense that constantly waft through it give visitors a feeling of mysticism and escape from the mundane.|||The Snow Pagoda route: Includes Phu Yen Presentation Temple, Tuyet Son Pagoda, Cha Ca Pagoda, Bao Dai, Mother Temple, Thuong Temple, Ngoc Long Cave...|||Tuyet Son Pagoda:|||After visiting Thien Tru Pagoda, follow the small path along the mountain slope, turn left, and head south for about 4km to reach Tuyet Son area. This is the second most beautiful site after Huong Tich Cave. Tuyet Stream is small but has clear and green water, winding and twisting like a dragon crawling deep into the towering mountain range.|||The first stop in this tour is to burn incense and offer ceremonial items at Trinh Phu Yen Temple. Then, visit the ancient Bao Dai Pagoda to worship Buddha and listen to sutras. Bao Dai Pagoda has a serene and peaceful landscape. Inside the pagoda, there is a Nine Dragon tower with high artistic value.|||Continuing on, you'll reach Ngoc Long Cave. Ngoc Long Cave is not very large but has its own unique charm. Inside the cave, the soft, diffused light highlights the stalactites and stalagmites that hang down like dragons' nests.|||The most beautiful sight is the statue of Bodhisattva Quan The Am carved directly into the stone wall with a very compassionate and benevolent face.

title: Con Son Historical Site
description: Location: Con Son historical site is located in Cong Hoa ward, Chi Linh town, Hai Duong province, about 80km east of Hanoi. Characteristics: This is the place associated with the lives of many Vietnamese celebrities, most notably Nguyen Trai. This is also one of the Buddhist centers of the Truc Lam Dai Viet Zen sect founded by Dieu Ngu Giac Hoang Tran Nhan Tong in the 13th century.|||Con Son is a place with a romantic and picturesque natural landscape, featuring harmonious mountains, forests, streams, and lakes. To the north of Con Son is Ngũ Nhạc mountain, standing at 238m, on the peak of which is the "Ngũ Nhạc linh từ" temple dedicated to the mountain god. Right next to it is Kỳ Lân mountain (also known as Con Son mountain) at 200m high, on the peak of which are Bàn Cờ Tiên and the ruins of Am Bạch Vân. The forest in Con Son is primarily pine, vast and lush.|||Con Son stream flows from north to south, sounding like the melody of a zither echoing through the vast mountains and forests… Crossing the stream to the north is the Thấu Ngọc bridge - a breathtakingly beautiful work that has been immortalized in poetry and historical records. Every morning, a misty fog envelops the mountain peak, and by noon, Con Son dons a fresh green cloak, exuding a fragrant scent.|||The beauty of Con Son has long been a source of inspiration to poets and travelers. No wonder, six centuries ago, Con Son was described as a fairyland by Nguyen Phi Khanh (Nguyen Trai's father) in 'Thanh Hu Dong ky: "The misty mountain top, the island's rosy glow, a brocade display/ Flowers along the stream, red and blue grasses swaying/ Shaded spots to rest, quiet spots to sit, fragrant scents to smell, and beauty to behold..." . To Nguyen Trai, Con Son is a charming place, as expressed in his poem 'Con Son Ca': 'Con Son's stream flows gently/ I hear it like the sound of a lute beside my ear…'.|||Con Son not only boasts stunning natural scenery but is also a land blessed with talented and remarkable individuals.|||Over a thousand years ago, Dinh Quoc Cong Nguyen Bac, the ancestor of the Nguyen Trai family, established a base in Con Son to defeat Pham Phong At, one of the 12 rebel warlords at the end of the Ngo dynasty (10th century), helping Dinh Tien Hoang unify the country.|||In the 13th century, King Tran Nhan Tong, Phap Loa, and Huyền Quang, who founded the Truc Lam Zen sect, came to Con Son to preach and built Con Son Pagoda into a spiritual center, a large Zen monastery of the Tran dynasty, and entrusted Huyền Quang with the management.|||Tran Nguyen Dan, a Grand Tutor, poet, and calendar expert of the Post-Tran period, came to Con Son and built Thanh Hu Dong for his retirement.|||Le Thanh Tong (1460-1497), a wise king and the head of the Tao Dan poetry club (during the early Le period), and the poet Cao Ba Quat (1808-1855) (during the Nguyen dynasty)... all visited this place, made poems, and left valuable works.|||In February 1965, President Ho Chi Minh visited Con Son scenic spot. There, he read the inscription at the gate of Con Son Pagoda with respect, sacredness and a special sense of connection with former scholars.|||Con Son is closely associated with the names of many Vietnamese celebrities. However, when referring to Con Son, people think of the national hero, global cultural icon Nguyen Trai - who spent his entire life and career here. Indeed, in Con Son, every object and monument sparkles with the brilliance of Nguyen Trai – Sao Khue.|||This relic site currently preserves many cultural and historical relics of value, notably:|||Con Son Pagoda (also known as Ky Lan Pagoda or Hun Pagoda) is located at the foot of Ky Lan Mountain (Hun Mountain). The pagoda's ceremonial name is Thien Tu Phuc Tu. According to legend, in 1304, monk Phap Loa built a small temple at the foot of Ky Lan Mountain and assigned Huyen Quang to take care of it. In 1329, the pagoda was renovated and expanded into Con Son Thien Tu Phuc Tu, one of the centers of the Truc Lam Zen sect.|||During the Le dynasty, the pagoda was further renovated and expanded to include 83 rooms and 385 statues. However, due to historical events, the pagoda was downsized to its current architecture, which is in the shape of the character '工', consisting of three buildings: Tien Duong, Thieu Huong, and Thuong Dien.|||The Thuong Dien worships Buddha, including 3-meter-high Buddha statues, which are typical of the art style of the Le dynasty.|||Along with its unique architecture, the temple also preserves a 600-year-old Bodhi tree, 4 steles, notably the "Thanh Hu Dong" stele erected during the Long Khanh era (1373 - 1377) which still keeps the handwriting of King Tran Due Tong and the hexagonal stele "Con Son thien tu bi phuc tu" which was read by Chairman Ho Chi Minh when he visited the relic on February 15, 1965.|||The temple was ranked as a national historical site by the Ministry of Culture and Information (now the Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism) in the first phase in 1962 and as a particularly important historical site in 1994.|||The Ancestor's House is located right behind Con Son Pagoda, where the statues of the Three Patriarchs of Truc Lam (King Tran Nhan Tong, Phap Loa and Huyen Quang), Tran Nguyen Dan and his wife, Nguyen Trai and his second wife (Nguyen Thi Lo) are enshrined.|||Nguyen Trai Temple, also known as "Uc Trai Linh Tu", is located on an area of 10,000m² at the foot of Ngu Nhac Mountain, within the Thanh Hu Dong area and near the former temple dedicated to Tran Thi Thai, mother of Nguyen Trai. The temple has its back against To Son, with two sides leaning against the Ngu Nhac and Ky Lan mountain ranges, forming a beautiful landscape. The temple's Minh Duong faces Con Son Lake, where Phuong Hoang and Chuc Thon mountains stand. Con Son stream flows from north to south, winding from right to left and embracing the temple.|||The temple consists of 15 items: main temple, left and right pavilions, inner and outer gateways, Thau Ngoc bridge, Giai Oan altar, Nhan Nghia lake, stele house, incense burning am, garden system... The main temple is built on an area of about 200m², in the Cong character shape, with the architectural style of the late Le dynasty, comprising 3 rooms: Tien Te, Trung Tu and Hau Cung. In the Hau Cung, Nguyen Trai bronze statue, 1.4m high, weighing 600kg and his parents' statues are placed.|||It still preserves large horizontal boards and paired sentences showing Nguyen Trai's soul, character, talent, and great merit, as well as the people's respectful and grateful hearts towards him.|||The Tran Nguyen Dan Temple was built in 2004, near the upper source of Con Son Spring, at the site where over six hundred years ago, Tran Nguyen Dan built a house to rest and enjoy his old age.|||In 1385, Tran Nguyen Dan brought his wife and 5-year-old grandson Nguyen Trai to live in Con Son. Here, he and his wife planted pine forests and built the Thanh Hu cave complex. This large-scale project blended harmoniously with nature and became a famous landmark, immortalized in poetry and historical records.|||Ngoc Well is located on the slope of Ky Lan Mountain, under the Dang Minh Bao Thap. Legend has it that on a full moon night in July, Zen Master Huyen Quang dreamed of a shining gem on the slope of Ky Lan Mountain. The next morning, the Zen Master and the monks went to the site, and after clearing the bushes, they discovered a crystal-clear well. The water tasted sweet and refreshing, and it invigorated those who drank it. The Zen Master then held a ceremony to thank the gods for granting the temple this precious source of water and requested permission to deepen and reinforce the well. From then on, it was called Ngoc Well, and the monks would often use its water for ceremonies.|||The well was once overgrown with vegetation, but in 1995, it was renovated and restored with stone walls and a paved courtyard to create a scenic spot for tourists visiting Con Son.|||The tomb tower is located near the Ngoc Well. Here, King Tran Minh Tong erected the Dang Minh stupa made of green stone, three stories high, inside which are the relics and statue of Hyen Quang after the Zen master passed away.|||Ban Co Tien: From Ngoc Well, follow a stone-paved path of over 600 steps with two sides of towering pine trees to reach the top of Ky Lan Mountain (200m high). The peak is a flat area with a fairly wide stone slab, known as Ban Co Tien. Here, there is a remaining relic of the foundation of Am Bach Van - a structure built during the Tran dynasty (14th century), where the third patriarch of Truc Lam, Xuan Quang, practiced and lectured at Con Son Pagoda with eight sloping roofs and a surrounding railing, for senior monks to practice, lecture and preach to their disciples.|||In 1992, the Ministry of Culture and Information (now the Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism) built a two-story, eight-roofed traditional "Vong giang dinh" (commemorative house) to commemorate the national hero Nguyen Trai, right next to the ruins of Am Bach Van. There is a stone stele here that records the life, career of Nguyen Trai and the history of Con Son relic.|||From Ky Lan mountain peak, visitors can overlook a vast mountainous and forested area. Looking northeast for 10km, Bai Vong mountain features a lotus-shaped hill with lush vegetation. This is where Nguyen Phi Khanh, Nguyen Trai's father, is buried.|||Thach Ban are two weathered sandstone rocks, relatively flat, located about 100m apart, next to Con Son stream.|||The large Thach Ban rock is commonly called the "5-room rock", measuring 28.5 x 6m. Legend has it that this is where Nguyen Trai often sat to admire the scenery, compose poetry, and ponder the country's fate. The smaller Thach Ban rock is where President Ho Chi Minh stopped to rest and admire the scenery during his visit to Con Son.|||Every year, two major festivals are held at Con Son, associated with the Kiep Bac temple (Hung Dao commune, Chi Linh town). The spring festival of Con Son - Kiep Bac takes place from 14th to 17th of the first lunar month to commemorate the death anniversary of the Third Patriarch, Huyền Quang tôn giả.|||The festival features various rituals and folk performances such as Le Mong son thi thuc, a ceremony to offer food to the spirits, a ritual to worship heaven and earth at Ngu Nhan linh tu, a water procession, boat racing on the Luc Dau Giang river, cockfighting, human chess, and wrestling.|||The autumn festival of Con Son - Kiep Bac is held from 15th to 20th of the eighth lunar month to remember the death anniversary of Tran Hung Dao and the national hero Nguyen Trai.|||The festival features rituals such as a procession of offerings to Tran Hung Dao, a military parade on the Luc Dau river, a prayer for peace and a lantern festival on the Luc Dau river, and a ceremony to distribute Tran Hung Dao's orders.|||There are also various folk activities like wrestling, boat racing, and duck catching…|||In recent years, Con Son has been renovated and upgraded with many new structures. The roads leading to Con Son from various directions have been improved and paved with asphalt. Visitors here at any time of the year can still enjoy the cool and fresh atmosphere, a poetic space imbued with a humanistic touch.

title: Chieu Trung Temple
description: Location: Chieu Trung Temple is located in Thach Ban commune, Thach Ha district, Ha Tinh province. Here, visitors can enjoy the beautiful natural scenery and learn more about Vietnamese history.|||From Ha Tinh city, following National Route 542, through Thach Kim commune, visitors will arrive at Chieu Trung Temple.|||Chieu Trung Temple, also known as Vo Muc Temple, worships the famous general Le Khoi, built on Long Ngam mountain, the last peak in the Quynh Vien mountain range (Nam Gioi).|||The mountain is called Long Ngam because it resembles a dragon's forehead; on both sides, there are two rocks like the dragon's eyes, and at the foot of the mountain, there is a large and deep open pond, like a dragon's mouth, surrounded by thick grass and mud.|||According to historical records, five centuries ago, Le Khoi, a close relative of Le Loi and a high-ranking military officer, was stationed in Nghe An and led a campaign against Chiem Thanh, capturing the king of Chiem, Bi Cai. On his way back, he fell ill and died on May 3, 1446, at the foot of Nam Gioi mountain.|||The court held a state funeral and buried him on Long Ngam mountain, building a temple there. In 1487, King Le Thanh Tong awarded Le Khoi the title 'Chiêu Trưng Đại Vương'.|||From a distance, Chieu Trung Temple looks majestic and serene, situated in a vast space with the Le Khoi tomb behind it; on the right are two plots of land, said to be where Chu Dong Tu and Tien Dung practiced.|||The temple complex consists of three buildings constructed in 1477 and has been restored several times while maintaining its original appearance.|||To reach the temple, visitors must climb 23 stone steps with trees lining the path. After passing the temple gate, which records the year of construction and restoration, visitors enter the Ha (Lower) Temple, a spacious area used for welcoming guests.|||Proceeding further, visitors arrive at the Trung (Middle) Temple, where local elders discuss festival and restoration matters. This temple showcases intricate carvings, blending art and creativity. Researchers note that the carvings reflect the early 17th-century art style, well-preserved to this day.|||On both sides of the Trung Temple are narrow side doors; visitors must bow their heads to pass through to the Thuong (Upper) Temple. There, a beautifully decorated altar and a wooden statue of Le Khoi are displayed.|||Every year on the 1st, 2nd, and 3rd of May in the lunar calendar, the Chieu Trung Temple festival takes place. Locals believe that before the main day, a rain shower usually occurs in the afternoon or evening, 'washing the statue' and 'cleansing the temple' to welcome visitors.

title: Canh Duong Beach
description: Location: Canh Duong Beach is located in Phu Loc district, Thua Thien - Hue province. Features: Canh Duong Beach is one of the most beautiful beaches in Hue.|||Canh Duong Beach is 8km long, 200m wide, and shaped like a crescent moon, situated between Chan May Tay and Chan May Dong capes, offering very attractive scenery. The beach has a gentle slope, white fine sand, clear and green sea water, and is relatively sheltered from the wind, making it very favorable for organizing various types of tourism and sports.

title: Ham Ninh Fishing Village
description: Location: Ham Ninh commune, Phu Quoc district, Kien Giang province, 20km northeast of Duong Dong town.|||Ham Ninh is an ancient village with pristine beauty and a peaceful, rustic life.|||No one knows exactly when Ham Ninh fishing village was established, but it is believed that when Phu Quoc island was still uninhabited, some residents from afar came to exploit seafood and then settled down here. When Duong Dong port was bustling, Ham Ninh was a quiet and safe anchorage for boats.|||The village is situated on the east coast of Phu Quoc island, nestled at the foot of Ham Ninh mountain, with a picturesque landscape, 300m high mountain behind and clear blue sea in front.|||Before entering the village, visitors will see a romantic image of a temporary dock at Bai Vong port. In the morning, sitting here watching the sunrise, visitors feel like stepping into a heavenly world. In the afternoon, the golden light of the sunset covers the peaceful sea.|||Deeper in the village, visitors will see a familiar image of a coastal village with thatched houses, bamboo walls, boats in front of the house, old and young people playing together... The friendly smiles of the villagers will make you want to stay forever.|||Visiting Ham Ninh fishing village, tourists not only immerse themselves in a peaceful and charming space but also have the opportunity to go to sea with locals, learn about their lives and try seafood like fresh crab.

title: Den Dai Cai - Hac Y Mountain
description: Location: The Den Dai Cai relic complex is located on provincial road 134, in Tan Linh commune, Luc Yen district, 80km from Yen Bai city. - Characteristics: This relic cluster includes Den Dai Cai, Nha Bau citadel, and Hac Y mountain.|||Den Dai Cai is located at the foot of Vua ao den mountain, with the Song Chay river on the right and Dai Cai stream in front. Legend has it that the temple was built over 300 years ago to worship Vu Thi Ngoc Anh, a female general with both literary and martial arts skills under the Le dynasty. She was granted the title of Tong binh by the imperial court and later became a female general. She built fortifications to fight against the Mạc invaders and established a market for the local people.|||The temple has a beautiful architecture, with complete worship objects such as bronze incense burners and gold-plated altars. Notably, the stone pedestals for the pillars are carved with images of the moon, lotus flowers, and leaves, each weighing over 100kg. The temple also has a bronze chieng, a bronze bell, and royal decrees from the Cảnh Phong and Tu Duc kings.|||In 2001, the temple was ranked as a national historical site. Every year on the 16th day of the first lunar month, the Den Dai Cai festival is held.|||Standing at Den Dai Cai, you can see Hac Y mountain, which has a garden, a fish pond, and a fairy chessboard… Legend has it that General Hac Y, a Trần dynasty general, was wounded in battle and 'died' here.|||The complex also includes Nha Bau citadel, which consists of earthworks, horse stables, and a place for military training.

title: Xuan Thanh Beach
description: Location: Xuan Thanh Beach is located in Xuan Thanh commune, Nghi Xuan district, Ha Tinh province, about 13km east of Vinh city (Nghe An) and 40km north of Ha Tinh city. Features: Here, tourists can immerse themselves in a fresh, cool and pristine natural scenery.|||From Vinh city, following National Route 1A, passing Ben Thuy bridge - a bridge over Lam river connecting Nghe An and Ha Tinh provinces, tourists will arrive in Nghi Xuan district. From here, going another 5km east, tourists will reach Xuan Thanh beach.|||Xuan Thanh beach stretches over 5km with a gentle slope. The seawater here has a moderate salinity, clear, green and very clean. This place has been invested and built with some small resorts and restaurants serving tourists but still on a small scale; therefore, tourists can still admire a vast and original natural scenery: mountains, forests and endless sea...|||Especially, there is a freshwater river named My Duong originating from Hong Linh mountain and flowing parallel to the length of the beach. The river is not deep but the water never runs dry. Both banks of the river are covered with lush vegetation.|||From Xuan Thanh beach, if tourists want to admire the natural scenery in the protective forest against storms and floods for the inland residential area; tourists have to cross a bridge over My Duong river.|||One thing that makes Xuan Thanh beach attractive is that after a walk on the beach, soaking in the waves and admiring the island system: Ngư island, Mat island...; tourists can enjoy seafood dishes made from fresh seafood: crabs, shrimps, squids, blood clams, horse mackerel... at reasonable prices.|||If you have a chance to visit Xuan Thanh beach, besides enjoying the beauty of the sea, tourists can participate in a tour to visit some other cultural relics such as: Nguyen Du memorial site, Nguyen Cong Tru memorial site, Co Dam singing village... These relics are all located in Nghi Xuan district and very close to Xuan Thanh beach.

title: Lung Cu Flagpole
description: Location: Lung Cu commune, Dong Van district, Ha Giang province.|||It is a historical site marking the sovereignty of Vietnam.|||From Ha Giang city center, traveling approximately 160km northeast, visitors will reach the Lung Cu flagpole in Lung Cu commune - the northernmost point of Vietnam. The flagpole is built on Rong mountain (also known as Long Son), at an altitude of nearly 1,700m above sea level.|||Lung Cu Flag Tower has a long history. According to historical records, in the 11th century, after defeating the invading Northern army as far as Ung Chau (China), General Ly Thuong Kiet planted a flag on the Dragon Mountain peak on his way back to gather his troops and said that this land belongs to our ancestors, and this place is the flesh and blood of our homeland, we must preserve it.|||During the Tay Son dynasty, after the great victory against the Qing army, King Quang Trung placed a large bronze drum in this area and every hour, it would sound three times, echoing far away, as if affirming the country's sovereignty.|||Therefore, Lung Cu also implies "Long Co", meaning the king's drum; or in Mongolian, "Long Cu", the dwelling place of the dragon.|||In 1978, the Lung Cu border post built a flagpole over 10m high made of sa mộc wood, with a 1.2m² flag at the top.|||After several renovations and upgrades, in 2010, after nearly 200 days of construction, the new Lung Cu flagpole was completed, standing at 33.15m high, with a base of 20.25m, a flagpole of 12.9m, and an outer diameter of 3.8m.|||The flagpole has an octagonal shape, with 8 faces at the base and pedestal featuring green stone reliefs with intricate designs mimicking the patterns on Đông Sơn drums, historical events of Vietnam, and cultural practices of ethnic groups in Ha Giang.|||At the top of the flagpole is a national flag with an area of 54m², symbolizing the 54 ethnic groups living in Vietnam.|||At the foot of the flagpole is a memorial house displaying tools, clothing, and cultural products of ethnic groups in Ha Giang.|||From afar, Lung Cu flagpole appears majestic in an area with 3/4 rocky terrain, surrounded by a landscape of rugged yet poetic and lyrical mountains. At the foot of Rong Mountain, visitors continue to conquer 389 stone steps leading to Lung Cu flagpole, and are amazed by the breathtaking natural scenery. The vast Dong Van rocky plateau unfolds like a masterpiece of nature, dotted with simple villages nestled beside mountains. In the distance, rice terraces wind across hillsides, shrouded in a veil of white mist.|||Looking down at the foot of Dragon Mountain, visitors will see two large lakes nearly symmetrical on either side of the mountain, which locals refer to as the 'dragon's eyes' associated with an ancient legend, forming a unique painting.|||On one side of the lake is Lo Lo Chai village, mainly inhabited by Lo Lo people, and on the other side is Then Pa village, where Mong people reside with a rich and diverse cultural identity.|||However, this is not the highest viewpoint on the Lung Cu flag tower as there is a 140-step spiral staircase inside. Following the narrow passage with faint light through small windows, visitors seem to be drawn up high by the windy gust on top. The opening above expands gradually, bringing a new view, with scenery appearing to shrink and hide behind the misty veil. At this moment, one's heart seems to calm down to the sound of the red and yellow Vietnamese flag waving in the wind. The journey to conquer Lung Cu flag tower is surely a special experience, stirring national pride and encouraging the young generation to follow their predecessors, protecting and building a prosperous and thriving Vietnam.

title: Pa Khoang Lake
description: Pa Khoang Lake is located in Muong Phang commune, Dien Bien city, Dien Bien province, about 20km from Dien Bien Phu city, along National Road 279 connecting Dien Bien Phu city to the command center of the campaign in Muong Phang. At an altitude of over 1,000m above sea level, covering an area of over 600ha with a capacity of nearly 40 million m3 of water, Pa Khoang Lake supplies water to two hydroelectric plants (Na Loi, Thac Bay) and ensures irrigation for the Muong Thanh field. It is not only a source of water but also an ideal destination for tourists visiting Dien Bien.|||Pa Khoang Lake, locally known as Pa Khoang, is situated in a natural area with serene and picturesque scenery. The lake's surface is calm, peaceful, and clear, reflecting the surrounding mountains, clouds, and green forests. In winter, the mist covers the area, creating a mystical atmosphere, with distant mountain ranges and quaint villages.|||The Pa Khoang tourist area spans 2,400 ha, including 1,320 ha of forest, 300 ha of agricultural land, 150 ha of basic construction land, and 600 ha of water surface with a capacity of 37.2 million m3 of water. The lake is surrounded by diverse geography, rich vegetation, and a favorable climate for relaxation. The forests around the lake are home to various wildlife and numerous orchid species.|||There are 11 villages around Pa Khoang Lake with traditional stilt houses. Within the lake area, there are Thai and Khmu villages that preserve their customs and unique traditions of the Northwest ethnic groups. The image of Thai girls in traditional attire, along with tourists, is reflected on the lake's surface. The scenery and people make Pa Khoang even more charming.|||During the summer, the weather here is pleasant, with gentle southern breezes. Recently, Pa Khoang Lake's eco-tourism area has become a popular weekend destination for people in Dien Bien Phu city, Dien Bien district, and an interesting choice for travelers.

title: Nam O Beach
description: Location: Nam O Beach is located in Hoa Hiep ward, Lien Chieu district, Da Nang city, 17km northwest of the city center. Characteristics: The beach has a moderate slope, along the foot of the mountain, with a picturesque landscape.|||According to locals, the name Nam O means south of the ancient Chau O. Nam O Beach has been around since the early 1960s, primarily serving the local community. The beach has some stilt houses built to serve tourists.|||From Nam O Beach, visitors can take a short trip up the mountain to Son Tra peninsula and Da Nang city, or take a boat ride west along the Cu De river, on an eco-tour, visiting a Ka-Tu ethnic village in Hoa Bac commune, Hoa Vang district.

title: Phu Ninh Lake
description: Location: Phu Ninh Lake is located 7km south of Tam Ky city, in the districts of Nui Thanh and Phu Ninh. Characteristics: Phu Ninh Lake is a large-scale hydraulic structure, with a water surface area of 3,433ha and 23,000ha of protective forest, along with 30 small islands and peninsulas.|||In the past, the widest area of Phu Ninh Lake was called Na Bong, a vast and fertile land. In 1927, the French attempted to build the lake but failed. In 1954, the revolutionary government continued this intention but was unable to proceed due to technical limitations. In 1977, with the assistance of central experts, Quang Nam province launched a campaign to contribute resources and after 9 years of excavation and dredging, tens of millions of cubic meters of soil and rock were moved, and Phu Ninh Lake was constructed and inaugurated on March 29, 1986.|||Today, Phu Ninh Lake has become a major hydraulic project in the Central region, with advantages for developing irrigation, fisheries, hydroelectric power, agriculture and forestry, as well as providing clean water. Phu Ninh Lake is also an attractive eco-tourism destination for visitors to explore and relax. With its picturesque natural scenery, poetic landscapes, fresh and clean air, and natural mineral water sources, the lake offers a perfect getaway from daily worries.|||From above, the lake resembles a giant bowl of water with many small islands, surrounded by mountains, dikes and green forests of pine and eucalyptus trees. Within the lake area, there are nearly 30 large and small islands, creating a beautiful landscape; among them are some large islands such as Ong So, 61, and Turtle islands, all similar to a mini Ha Long Bay. The local flora and fauna are extremely diverse, with around 142 families of plants, including many rare medicinal herbs; and approximately 148 species of animals, with 14 listed in the Red Book. Notably, Phu Ninh Lake also features a valuable natural hot mineral water source with many beneficial microelements for drinking and treatment.|||Visiting Phu Ninh, boat trips across the calm lake can take visitors to explore the scenery, islands and hot mineral water springs. Additionally, about 5km from the main entrance, a turn to the left on a gentle slope surrounded by trees leads to comfortable lodges, restaurants, cafes, paddle boats and excellent fishing spots. Fishing in Phu Ninh seems easier than elsewhere, with released fish species like tilapia, and catfish; or sitting on a boat heading to small islands in the middle of the lake, visitors can catch fish in rocky crevices and prepare their favorite dishes amidst the natural scenery.|||Phu Ninh, with its numerous islands, lush vegetation and vast water expanse, has become an eco-tourism destination offering a variety of activities such as sightseeing, fishing, boating, swimming, entertainment, sports, relaxation and even health treatments, attracting visitors from near and far.

title: Krong Kmar Waterfall
description: Location: About 3 kilometers from Krong Bong district center towards Chư Yang Sin mountain range, you will encounter the beautiful Krong Kmar waterfall in Dak Lak. Features: Originating from the highest peak of the majestic Chư Yang Sin mountain range, known as the roof of the Central Highlands, Krong Kmar stream flows down to the foot of the mountain, creating the Krong Kmar waterfall with a pristine and romantic appearance that anyone who visits will surely remember.|||About 3 kilometers from Krong Bong district center towards Chư Yang Sin mountain range, you will encounter the beautiful Krong Kmar waterfall in Dak Lak. Originating from the highest peak of the majestic Chư Yang Sin mountain range, known as the roof of the Central Highlands, Krong Kmar stream flows down to the foot of the mountain, creating the Krong Kmar waterfall with a pristine and romantic appearance that anyone who visits will surely remember.|||At the source, from the top of Chư Yang Sin, water flows down to create connected waterfalls. The Krong Kmar stream pours down the rocky steps, creating a white foam, producing a loud, rumbling sound that resonates throughout the primeval forest. Next to the waterfall's columns, there are many large, flat rocks like tables for tourists to stop and admire the scenery or organize light gatherings by the stream.|||From here, those who like to explore the mountainous landscape can walk along the waterfall stream towards the upper source and reach the beginning of Krong Kmar stream. You will be amazed to find a wide, deep, and clear water lake in the middle of a pine forest on the high mountains of Chư Yang Sin, accompanied by the gentle songs of various forest birds. Unlike the lower area with constant waterfall roars, this place is very quiet and close to those who seek a peaceful and poetic scene amidst wild nature.|||Visiting Krong Kmar waterfall, you will admire impressive scenes that nature has gifted to humans, immerse yourself in wide bathing areas with clear and cool water, and see each pebble clearly. Strolling and sightseeing by the waterfall will give you a feeling of relaxation and refreshment, dispelling fatigue after a series of stressful working days.|||Another interesting experience is riding an elephant of the Ede people to conquer Chư Yang Sin peak or savoring the unforgettable flavor of Central Highlands rice wine...|||After a period of neglect, in recent years, Krong Kmar waterfall has become a familiar tourist destination for many. During festive occasions or weekends, this scenic spot is crowded with visitors from across the province and many tourists from other provinces who come to visit.

title: Dong Mo Golf Course
description: Location: Dong Mo International Golf Course is located in the Van Mieu - Dong Mo tourist area, Son Tay, Hanoi. Features: This is the first 36-hole international standard golf course in northern Vietnam, one of the most beautiful golf courses in Southeast Asia, built on an area of 350ha of land and 1500ha of lake surface with rolling hills and mystical scenery along the Dong Mo lake, creating a beautiful position for the golf course. Dong Mo Golf Course is owned and managed by Thung Lung Vua Company.|||The golf course consists of two 18-hole golf courses: Lakeside Golf Course and Mountain View Golf Course, a Clubhouse, an 80-room hotel, 50 villas, a driving range, water sports activities, a beach, supporting facilities, and related infrastructure.|||The Lakeside Golf Course started operating in 1993. This is a standard 72-par golf course (7,100 yards) designed by Pacific Coast Design Pty.Ltd of Australia.|||The Mountain View Golf Course was opened and put into operation in 2004, surrounded by majestic mountains. The Mountain View Golf Course is designed on natural terrain, taking full advantage of the beautiful scenery of the lake and the distant mountains and surrounding forests. Particularly, the difficulty of the golf course will be a challenge for any golfer.|||The highlight of Dong Mo Golf Course is located on a romantic island, a land of legends associated with the myth of Son Tinh and Thuy Tinh. Coming to Dong Mo Golf Course, visitors will enjoy a relaxing atmosphere and immerse themselves in a vast natural landscape. Here, golfers have the opportunity to challenge themselves and overcome their limits at challenging holes. Dong Mo Golf Course is considered by designers and members to be one of the most beautiful golf courses in Southeast Asia.

title: Chua nui Chau Thoi
description: Location: Chua nui Chau Thoi is located in Binh An commune, Di An district, Binh Duong province. Characteristics: This is one of the famous ancient temples of Gia Dinh.|||According to the Nguyen dynasty records, the temple was built by Zen master Khanh Long in the 17th century. The current architecture was built in 1954, and the Tam Quan gate was constructed in 1970. The Buddha hall features three ancient stone Buddha statues. Every year, many visitors come to visit the temple and worship Buddha. The temple is situated on Chau Thoi mountain, offering a peaceful and solemn atmosphere. From here, one can admire the beautiful scenery of the surrounding areas.

title: Son Tra Nature Reserve
description: Location: Son Tra Nature Reserve is located on Son Tra Peninsula (also known as Son Cha) in Son Tra District, Da Nang City. Features: This is a beautiful forest and sea complex located next to the city, recognized as a national nature reserve in 1980.|||Son Tra Nature Reserve has both coastal wetland ecosystems and primeval tropical rainforests. It is protected under the national forest protection regime. The total natural area is 4,439 hectares, of which 4,180 hectares are forest and forestry land, and 3,431 hectares are forested land (2,806 hectares of natural forest and 625 hectares of planted forest) and 748 hectares of non-forested land.|||The primeval forest on the peninsula is where two typical animal and plant systems of the South and North meet, comprising 298 species of high plants belonging to 271 genera, 90 families, 64 types of large wood, 107 precious medicinal trees and many species of orchids.|||It is famous for its spectacular vegetation; the gene source of tropical vegetation of Son Tra is very diverse and rich with a large number of individuals capable of providing native tree species for afforestation such as: chò chai, dẻ cau, dầu lá bóng...|||Son Tra is home to over a hundred species of animals, including several rare species listed in the world's Red Book of conservation, such as the red-headed pheasant, reticulated python, and aquatic species; among which the white-throated langur is considered a endemic species of Indochina that needs protection. The reserve is home to over 400 white-throated langurs, also known as the 'Queen of primates', along with many other monkeys such as long-tailed macaques and golden monkeys (which is why Son Tra is referred to by Americans as Monkey Mountain).|||Right at the foot of the mountain, visitors can reach the poetic Da Stream, immerse themselves in the cool sea water, admire the surrounding beaches with clean and smooth sand, and see the stacked stones along the shore, worn and polished by the regular tides. The entire area of But Beach, Rang Beach, Nam Beach, Om Beach, Bac Beach... will satisfy visitors. Stop at the peaceful But Beach with small cute houses to listen to the waves, watch the swallows flying to their nests on the rugged rocks or rest at Tien Sa Beach, a legendary spot with enchanting beauty that attracts even heavenly fairies to bathe. Another attraction is the stunning and colorful coral reefs here. Hiking through the forest to explore the natural beauty of Son Tra mountain with rich tropical flora and fauna, visitors can see firsthand ancient trees nearly a thousand years old and observe groups of monkeys foraging on the tree layers or by the stream.|||At the peak of Ban Co (at 625m high), visitors can enjoy the cool and fresh air of the sea and mountains, and admire the breathtaking view of downtown Da Nang, Ngu Hanh Son, Ba Na range - Nui Chua...|||This idyllic forest and sea area is only about 5km from Danang city centre, accessible via the Thuan Phuoc bridge that spans the Han River, connecting Hai Chau district to Son Tra peninsula.|||Son Tra mountain forest is waiting to welcome visitors to explore and immerse themselves in the majestic yet romantic, expansive and beautiful scenery of a picturesque peninsula.

title: Hau Lau
description: Location: Situated behind the Kinh Thien Palace in the Central Heritage Area of Thang Long Imperial Citadel - Hanoi, on Hoang Dieu Street, Ba Dinh District, Hanoi. Features: Hau Lau has an architectural style that is a blend of Eastern and Western influences|||Hau Lau was built to the north of the palace to serve as a guard tower and to create a sense of peace (according to feng shui), hence it is also known as the Tinh Bac Tower or Hau Lau (rear tower). It is also called the Princess Tower because it was used as a resting place for royal concubines accompanying King Nguyen on his visit to the Bac Thanh. During the French destruction of Hanoi, Hau Lau was damaged and later rebuilt by the French as a barracks. Thus, the current architecture of Hau Lau is a mix of Vietnamese royal and French 18th-century styles.|||Overall, Hau Lau is a three-story tower. The ground floor is built in a box-like shape with three separate rooms. The two end rooms have doors on the front. Behind these rooms is a corridor leading to the central room. The central room has no door and gets natural light from two arched windows at the back. Two staircases lead to the second floor. The second floor is also divided into three rooms, but the central room is more spacious with three doors on the front. The rooms on the second floor have large doors opening to the east and west. The rooms on this floor have roofs modeled after royal palace architecture. A staircase behind the central room leads to the third floor. The third floor has one room with nine doors opening to three directions. It is an ideal spot to enjoy the scenery. This floor has a two-tiered, eight-roofed architecture with dragon head decorations.|||The most distinctive French architectural feature is the thickness of the walls, keeping the rooms cool in summer and warm in winter. Meanwhile, the Vietnamese royal architectural style is evident in the tower's design and the many reliefs on the walls, depicting musical instruments, bronze cauldrons, dragons, phoenixes, and the four plants representing the four seasons. The blend of Eastern and Western architectural styles makes Hau Lau unique.|||Currently, Hau Lau is used to display some archaeological artifacts found in the surrounding area, as well as images of Hanoi through various historical periods.

title: O Loan Lagoon
description: Location: at the foot of Quan Cau Pass, Tuy An District, Phu Yen Province, 22 km north of Tuy Hoa City.|||According to legend, Loan was a beautiful but mischievous fairy. She borrowed a magpie to fly down to the earth. When she passed Tuy An, the magpie was exhausted and landed on the Tu Bi mountain range. The locals combined the names of the magpie (O) and the fairy (Loan) to name the lagoon.|||The brackish lagoon is rich in seafood. Visitors can enjoy the natural scenery and local seafood.|||With over 1,500 ha of water surface, O Loan Lagoon is a peaceful and serene destination. From Quan Cau Pass, visitors can see Tu Bi mountain and the winding Tu Bi stream flowing into the lagoon, creating a poetic scene. The surrounding area features Dong Chay mountain, Cam mountain, and An Hai cove with rocky outcrops.

title: Ngi Lang Ancient Fortress
description: Location: The fortress is located in Pho Rang valley, Bao Yen district, Lao Cai province. Characteristics: Ngi Lang ancient fortress was built in 1527 - 1533, it was a major economic and political center of the Song Chay region in the early 16th century.|||Many historical remains still exist today. To the east lies the Song Chay River, a natural moat with rushing waters. From Ngoi Lu to Ngoi Rang are sections of ancient ramparts with dense bamboo.|||The fortress has a commanding tower, a weapon forge, a tile kiln, barracks, and a market and school system.|||Notably, the fortress contains the Phuc Khanh pagoda, the largest in the region. The pagoda is situated on a hill, and its foundation with many stone pillars remains. A large stone stele with a turtle-shaped base and the inscription "Phuc Khanh Tu" is still preserved.|||To the northwest lies a lotus pond, a scenic spot for the Lord, surrounded by ancient kilns. Thousands of square meters of hillside are scattered with ancient ceramic relics, mostly ancient tiles from the Le Trung Hung period.|||At the Cam Veo outpost, a bronze command gun was discovered, bearing the inscription "Ngi Lang hand protection". This is a command gun with the serial number 29, belonging to the unit defending Ngi Lang fortress.|||The "Dai Nam Nhat Thong Chi" records: "The Lord's trees are lush green, on quiet nights, locals often hear the sound of drums and gongs, and see flashes of fire".|||Although history has moved on, the heroic legacy of the Lord's regime remains deeply ingrained in local tradition.

title: Dai Lai Lake
description: Location: Dai Lai Lake is located in Ngoc Thanh and Cao Minh communes, Phuc Yen town, Vinh Phuc province, 50 km north of Hanoi.|||Characteristics: Dai Lai is an artificial lake, an attractive resort destination.|||From Hanoi, follow Highway 2 to Phuc Yen town, then turn right and travel about 12km to reach Dai Lai Lake tourist area. Dai Lai Lake is an attractive resort destination for tourists.|||Dai Lai Lake is a 525 ha lake. To the north of the lake is the Tam Dao mountain range. In the distance are lush green forests, interspersed with natural valleys, hills and rugged mountain coves creating bays and wild peninsulas. The harmonious combination of lake and mountain creates a spacious and poetic landscape for the entire tourist area.|||During the rainy season, rivers and streams in the southern basin of the Tam Dao mountain range, including Vuc Tuyen, Ton, Ba Ha, Dong Cau and Dong Chao, all flow into the lake, causing the water level to rise up to 21m. Hills and mounds surrounding the lake are connected by sturdy earth dams, forming a strong wall that retains water for the lake.|||Visit Dai Lai lake resort in winter or summer, and tourists can enjoy a mild climate. The cold north wind is blocked by Tam Dao mountain range, so the average temperature of Dai Lai resort in summer is only 28.9°C, and 16.8°C in winter.|||This temperature creates favorable conditions for tourists to have relaxing weekend getaways.|||After swimming in the lake and admiring the scenery around Dai Lai Lake, visitors follow the asphalt roads to the bat cave and pine forests. What's fascinating is that in the middle of the vast lake, there's a 4.8-hectare bird island with lush vegetation. In winter, hundreds of bird species gather here, creating a rich and vibrant natural scene. The bird island attracts visitors with its natural charm and vibrant life. The resort owners have arranged wooden benches, peacock gardens, artificial lakes, stone statues, and more. In recent years, many rare bird flocks have flocked to the island, confirming the pristine ecological environment. Visitors can enjoy local delicacies like hill chicken, bamboo rice, grilled fish, and more.|||Visitors to Dai Lai lake tourist area can also connect their tour to some nearby destinations. They can travel north, pass through Nhe pass to Thai Nguyen or turn to Mo Qua mountain to try climbing the steep cliffs. From above, they can see Xa Huong lake, Lang Ham lake, Gia Khau lake... hidden among the green forests, and the ancient citadel of Nguyen Danh Phuong, who once built his own territory and fought against the Le-Trinh regime for ten years.|||To make Dai Lai lake a more attractive tourist destination, several large-scale projects are being implemented. It is planned to build three-star and four-star hotels here; alongside villas that will attract artists to attend creative retreats. Additionally, there will be an 18-hole golf course with a modern horse racing track, large dance halls, and souvenir shops serving tourists.

title: Phong Nha - Ke Bang Natural World Heritage
description: Location: Phong Nha - Ke Bang is located in Quang Ninh, Bo Trach and Minh Hoa districts, Quang Binh province. From Dong Hoi, turn left from Highway 1A after about 5km, follow Truong Son road to Son Trach commune, then take a boat on Son river for about 30 minutes to get there. Characteristics: Phong Nha - Ke Bang was recognized by UNESCO as a World Natural Heritage Site.|||This is a part of the oldest limestone area in Asia, formed over 400 million years ago, associated with the major tectonic cycles and development of the Earth's history. The area of Phong Nha - Ke Bang limestone in Quang Binh province, Vietnam is about 400ha. The Phong Nha - Ke Bang limestone complex also extends to the territory of Khammouane province, Laos, forming one of the largest and oldest tropical karst areas in the world with outstanding geomorphological and geological features of global significance.|||Phong Nha - Ke Bang retains the imprints of geological processes that have taken place and are still taking place, affecting the formation of landforms and geomorphological features. Located in a complex terrain, Phong Nha - Ke Bang is also home to Phong Nha - Ke Bang National Park. The total area of the national park is over 343,000ha (core area is 123,300ha and buffer zone is 220,000ha), of which 83.74% is primary forest. Scientists have recorded 2,400 species of higher plants, including 208 species of orchids, many of which are rare and listed in Vietnam's Red Book and IUCN. In addition, there are 140 species of mammals, 356 species of birds, 97 species of reptiles, 47 species of amphibians, 162 species of fish, and 369 species of insects, many of which are listed in Vietnam's Red Book and the world, such as sao la, Hatinh langur, and mang thu.|||Phong Nha - Ke Bang also has a system of caves with a total length of about 80km (as discovered so far), with dozens of large and small caves. The caves are 10 to 40m high. Many caves have only been discovered and marked on the map, but not thoroughly surveyed. Only a few caves have been developed for tourism, such as Phong Nha, Tien Son, and Hang Vom. The caves are diverse, with beautiful and mysterious stalactites.|||According to a scientific report by the Royal Geographical Society's expedition team (UK), the determined length of Phong Nha cave is 7,729m. Phong Nha cave is evaluated with '7 superlatives': the most beautiful underground river; the highest and widest cave entrance; the most beautiful sandy beaches and underground bars; the most beautiful underground lake; the widest and most beautiful dry cave; the most fantastic and magnificent stalactites; and the longest water cave.|||Phong Nha - Ke Bang National Park was twice recognized by UNESCO as a World Natural Heritage Site in July 2003 and July 2015.

title: Song Be Golf Course
description: Location: In Lai Thieu town, Thuan An district, Binh Duong province, about 22km from Ho Chi Minh City. Features: This is the first international-standard golf course in Vietnam.|||Opened in 1994, the golf course spans 100ha with over 10 lakes and fairways lined with green trees.|||With over 6,000m in length and 18 holes, Song Be Golf Course is officially recognized by USGA/SGA (United States Golf Association and Singapore Golf Association).|||Other amenities include: driving range, pro shop, tennis court, locker room, restaurant, villa, playground, swimming pool, gym, sauna, library and function rooms.

title: Thach Dong Scenic Spot
description: Location: Adjacent to Highway 17, 3km from Ha Tien town. Features: Thach Dong is a giant green stone hill, 80m high, shaped like a cavalryman's helmet, standing alone in an area of soil.|||Thach Dong is also known as Thach Dong Thon Van (the cave that swallows clouds) because it is 50m high. At dawn, white, fluffy clouds float by and are blocked by the cave. The clouds stop, then gradually surround the cave entrance, giving the impression that the cave is swallowing clouds.|||From the south, the rugged rocks of Thach Dong resemble the face of a general wearing a feathered hat, so the French named it 'Bonnet à Poil'. Thach Dong has a car road leading to the stairs into the cave. The cave is quite spacious, with rainwater seeping through the rocks, creating unique stalactites.|||Standing before the cave, Thach Dong resembles an eagle spreading its wings, looking majestic. Around Thach Dong, there are rocks protruding like an eagle's head.|||Inside the cave, there is a Buddhist temple. To the southwest, there is a shrine to Ba Chua Xu. To the east, standing on the rocky wall, one can see a passageway to the top, which the ancients called the 'path to heaven'. In the cave, there is a mouth that seems bottomless.|||Many curious people have descended but never returned. Later, someone threw a dried coconut with a mark into the cave, and it was later found floating on the sea surface, indicating that the cave is connected to the sea. Currently, the cave mouth has been sealed to prevent accidents.

title: Nuoc Mooc Spring
description: Location: Phuc Trach commune, Bo Trach district, Quang Binh province.|||Nuoc Mooc spring, with its pristine nature and fascinating scenery, offers many exciting activities.|||Surrounded by lush forests and towering limestone mountains, Nuoc Mooc spring brings a refreshing breeze to the Phong Nha - Ke Bang forest. Visitors can enjoy the cool, clear water and explore the UNESCO World Heritage Site of Phong Nha - Ke Bang National Park.|||From Dong Hoi city, follow the eastern branch of the Ho Chi Minh Road northwards for about 60km, then turn at the Khe Gat junction and continue on the western branch for 5km to reach Nuoc Mooc spring.|||The spring is a natural, turquoise-colored water source that emerges from the foot of a mountain, forming a 90m² pool before flowing into the Chay River.|||This unique natural phenomenon features a cool stream with a temperature of 16-18°C in the summer, winding through the mountains with numerous underwater rocks, rapids, and waterfalls.|||The lower reaches of the stream have many natural stone beaches, such as Tam Hop and Dao Tien.|||The Phong Nha - Ke Bang National Park administration has developed a tourist area with various attractions.|||Visitors can stroll along wooden bridges, admire the lush scenery, and enjoy the serene atmosphere.|||They can also swim, kayak, or try jumping off the bridge.|||Local cuisine, including grilled eel and chicken, is available at "bird's nest" restaurants suspended from ancient trees.|||The area is home to various flora and fauna, including the Ha Tinh langur, a primate listed in Vietnam's Red Book.|||Nuoc Mooc spring is an ideal destination for those seeking to relax and connect with nature.

title: Thien Tuong Temple and Lake
description: Location: Thien Tuong Temple is located in Trung Luong commune, Hong Linh town, on Thien Tuong mountain.|||Characteristics: Built during the Tran dynasty, it was originally a beautiful scenic spot, and many famous poets have visited and left behind famous poems.|||Ha Tinh is known for Hong Mountain with 99 majestic peaks. In 1836, Hong Mountain was engraved on Anh Dinh, symbolizing Vietnamese nature.|||Around Hong Linh lies a treasure trove of mystical and captivating stories.|||Legend has it that King Kinh Duong Vuong established his first capital here and married a beautiful girl from Ngan Hong, giving birth to Long Vuong, also known as Lac Long Quan...|||One of the scenic spots of Hong Linh is Thien Tuong Pagoda and Lake, which was ranked by the Ministry of Culture and Information as a national scenic spot.|||Pham Su Manh (14th century) in the poem "Son Hanh" wrote:|||Houng Tuong is a tall gate in the north|||Dong Long vast sea for the southward conquest||||||This means:||||||Houng Tuong is a high mountain with a temple, it is the northern gate of the land|||Dragon crossing the sea supports the southward conquest|||King Thieu Tri visited the temple when he went north and wrote a poem engraved on a stone stele.|||Nguyen Huy Oanh, a successful candidate in the royal examination (18th century), wrote when he visited the temple:|||Explore the world across three thousand|||This is Hill One, the place known as Tượng Thiên|||Birds sing sweetly, echoing with chanting voices|||The sound of the stream is heard, revealing a tranquil forest|||At the beginning of the 19th century, Thien Tuong Temple was still a beautiful and serene place.|||However, in 1885, after the incident in Hue, King Ham Nghi fled to Son Phong, and the Can Vuong movement was launched, making the Hong Linh region a site of anti-French colonial activities, resulting in the temple being burned and destroyed by the French.|||In 1901, the Governor of An Tinh, Dao Tan, oversaw the reconstruction of the temple.|||Thien Tuong Temple has upper and lower areas, with Luu Duc and Thach Son towers. The temple has a Great Bell and many valuable Buddha statues. The temple grounds cover around 150,000 m2, bounded by two large streams originating from Thien Tuong peak. The path to the temple is paved with stone steps. From the temple, the view of Hong Linh town is like a painting.|||From Thien Tuong pagoda, flying southeast about 2 km, you will reach Thien Tuong Lake in Bac Hong ward. The lake is at an altitude of 100m, formed from the water of Suoi Tien. Thien Tuong Lake is beautiful, 650m long, 180m wide, and 8m deep on average, with the deepest point at around 15m. The lake's surface area is over 100,000 m2 with a capacity of 800,000 m3 of clean natural water. The east and west sides of the lake are steep cliffs, surrounded by green pine trees reflecting on the calm lake surface, creating a unique and pristine painting between a young and developing town.|||Ho Thien Tuong is not only a beautiful scenic spot, attracting tourists, but also a place to soothe the soul, a "temperature regulator" and provides a fresh water source for the people of the town.|||Below Thien Tuong Lake is Suoi Tien,传说这是一个仙女沐浴的地方，石头上留下了仙女的脚印。 Suoi Tien flows gently all year round, creating a soothing melody next to Thien Tuong Lake amidst the green mountains and pine trees.|||The people of Ha Tinh have been doing their best to protect and exploit the values of the monument in the best way to serve the development of economy, society and tourism.

title: Nui Ngu Binh
description: Located in Hue city, Thua Thien-Hue province, about 3km from Hue citadel. Ngu Binh has a trapezoid shape, with a flat top, serving as a natural screen for Hue citadel.|||According to "Dai Nam Nhat Thong Chi" by Quoc Su Quan Trieu Nguyen, it is described as rising abruptly from the flat land.|||Ngu Binh is 105m high, symmetrical, and majestic. On both sides of Bang Son are two smaller mountains, called Ta Bat Son and Huu Bat Son.|||The Nguyen dynasty chose Ngu Binh as the front screen for their citadel and renamed it Ngu Binh.|||Together with the Perfume River, Ngu Binh is a precious gift from nature, creating a picturesque landscape.|||It has become a symbol of Hue's natural beauty, often referred to as the land of Huong Ngu.|||For generations, it has been a favorite spot for nature lovers.|||On a clear day, from the top of Ngu Binh, one can see the entire city, with its palaces, ancient temples, and the winding Perfume River.|||Nearby is Vong Canh hill, another famous scenic spot in Hue, overlooking the Perfume River and Ngu Binh mountain.

title: Ke Go Lake
description: Location: In Cam Xuyen district, Ha Tinh province, 70km south of Vinh city.|||Features: The lake is a man-made beauty spot among hills.|||Ke Go was originally the name of an ancient village in My Due commune, now part of Cam My commune, Cam Xuyen district, Ha Tinh province, about 20 km south of Ha Tinh city. Ke Go was located along the banks of the Rao Cai river (also known as Ngan Mo river). Rao Cai is a river that converges with hundreds of streams and creeks from the Truong Son mountain range.|||In the dry season, Rao Cai river is dry, but in the rainy season, it flows too quickly and strongly, becoming a disaster for the southern region of Ha Tinh. Since the early 20th century, the French considered building a dam to control this river. They designed and began constructing some items, but World War II and the subsequent First Indochina War broke out, so it was abandoned. Until March 26, 1976, when the country was unified, the project was designed and constructed by Vietnamese hydraulic engineers and was named Ke Go Lake. On February 3, 1988, the project was put into operation.|||The Ke Go Nature Reserve has a natural area of 35,159ha. Ke Go Lake is located in the territory of 3 districts: Cam Xuyen, Ky Anh and Huong Khe. The lake is a major irrigation project with a water capacity of 350 million m3, irrigating nearly 17,000 ha of rice and other crops in the areas of Thach Ha district, Cam Xuyen, Ha Tinh town and the north of Ky Anh district.|||With a length of over 30 km, the lake is also a rich source of food for the local population.|||In particular, Ke Go Lake plays an important role in improving the ecological environment and natural scenery of a large area, becoming a valuable nature reserve and an interesting ecological tourist destination. The climate in Ke Go is cool all year round. What's fascinating is that when you take a boat on the lake, you'll be able to enjoy the beauty and poetic scenery of the vast waters and endless forests. At night, under the moonlight and starlight, the mysterious space becomes even more mysterious with the sounds of waves, forest winds, and the roars, howls, and calls of various animals and birds blending together…|||Ke Go Nature Reserve is covered by a closed forest with many tree species listed in the Vietnam Red Book, such as green lim, Sen mat, Gu, Lau, Vang tam, Agarwood, Song mat, Lat hoa, Com bach ma, Chum bao Trung bo, Boi loi vang, etc. This is a rich flora characteristic of many plant species from the native flora of north Vietnam - south China, Indonesian - Malaysian flora, and Himalayan flora. So far, 364 species of vertebrates belonging to 99 families have been discovered in Ke Go Nature Reserve. The white-tailed pheasant, one of the three endemic pheasant species of Vietnam, is endangered, and many other rare species are found here. Of the 47 mammal species here, 18 species (21%) are listed in the Vietnam and global Red Books. Ke Go forest is also home to beautiful and precious orchids such as Que huong, Tai tuong, Tai trau, Duoi chon, Nghinh xuan, Phuong vi...|||Amidst the fast-flowing waters, there are still trees that grow and provide shade. The lake's surface is also dotted with small islets, each a world of its own mystique.|||For a long time, Ke Go has been visited and researched by many scientists from home and abroad.|||Ha Tinh tourism is promoting investment projects in infrastructure and services to develop this area into a comprehensive eco-tourism destination with various entertainment activities such as boat racing, surfing, mountain climbing, fishing, and sports facilities like tennis, badminton, volleyball, as well as building a zoo, bird sanctuary, and a garden. Ke Go always holds a deep affection for those who have gone away and leaves a lasting impression on whoever visits.

title: Saigon Zoo
description: Location: 2B Nguyen Binh Khiem, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City. Features: This is the largest conservation site for flora and fauna in Vietnam.|||Originally a botanical garden built by the French in 1864, based on the layout of the Imperial Louis XIII botanical garden. Initially 12ha, it was expanded to 20ha in 1865.|||In 1924, the garden was expanded by 13ha. In 1926, a memorial monument was built near the main gate. In 1927, a bridge was built across the Thi Nghe canal, and the Blanchard de la Bross museum was constructed.|||In 1956, the garden was rebuilt and renamed Saigon Zoo. From 1984 to 1989, it underwent major renovations.|||The zoo now houses over 590 animals from 125 species, 1,800 trees from 260 species, and various other plants. It also has an entertainment area for children.|||Saigon Zoo became a member of the Southeast Asian Zoos Association in 1990.

title: Thai Binh Lau Pavilion
description: Location: Thai Binh Lau is located within the Forbidden City, Hue Imperial City, Hue City, Thua Thien Hue Province. Characteristics: Thai Binh Lau, also known as Thai Binh Ngu Lam Thu Lau, was a place for the king to rest or read.|||In 1821, Minh Mang built a house on the west side of Thieu Phuong Garden, named Tri Nhan Hall. During Thieu Tri's reign, it was renovated and renamed Thanh Ha Thu Lau (a house for literature). In 1887, Dong Khanh demolished it and built a new pavilion called Thai Binh Ngu Lam Thu Lau. The pavilion featured intricate ceramic mosaics.|||To the west, the pavilion overlooks a square pond with a non-bo mountain made of stacked stones, creating a picturesque natural scenery. To the left, Lau Tu Phuong Vo Ngu was built, and to the right, Hoa Nhat Thu Truong corridor was constructed. Further to the left of the Bat Phong pavilion, a small tower called Luc Tri Than Thong was built, and to the right, a room called Than Tu was constructed. North of this room, a hexagonal pavilion was built, and to its left, a structure called Trạch Trung was built. In front, a house called Duc Vien was constructed. The bridges and corridors are connected, and the pond's water flows through, creating a poetic scenery.

title: Tran Hung Dao Forest Historical Site
description: This special national historical site is located at the foot of Slam Cao mountain, spanning across Tam Kim and Hoa Tham communes in Nguyen Binh district, Cao Bang province, about 50km southwest of Cao Bang city.|||It preserves a system of historical sites closely associated with a significant period in Vietnamese revolution history, now a revered destination.|||The Tran Hung Dao forest historical site is where the Vietnam Propaganda Liberation Army (Vietnam Liberation Army) was established and operated, the precursor to the People's Army of Vietnam.|||This is also associated with the life and revolutionary activities of General Vo Nguyen Giap, an outstanding student of President Ho Chi Minh.|||The complex includes 5 important sites: Tran Hung Dao Forest historical site (including the site where the Vietnam Propaganda Liberation Army was established, Rest hut and kitchen, water mine for daily use, Slam Cao peak); Tham Khau cave (Tam Kim commune) - used as a communication station and served meals to revolutionaries; Phai Khat outpost (Tam Kim commune) - the site of the first battle of the Vietnam Propaganda Liberation Army (December 25, 1944); Na Ngan outpost (Hoa Tham commune) - the site of the second victorious battle of the Vietnam Propaganda Liberation Army (December 26, 1944); Va Pha historical site (Tam Kim commune).|||With these historical values, in 2013, the Prime Minister decided to rank the Tran Hung Dao Forest historical site (Nguyen Binh district, Cao Bang province) as a special national monument.|||Since then, the local authorities have paid special attention to preserving, restoring, and promoting the value of the site by upgrading the road from Cao Bac pass and the road from provincial road 34 to the monument, and building visitor centers and memorial houses.|||In particular, the exhibition house in the historical site, after being completed and put into use, has contributed to honoring and paying tribute to the previous generation, while preserving and promoting the value of the historical site. The artifacts here are displayed in a concentrated manner, ensuring scientific and historical authenticity, according to 3 main themes: Cao Bang - Land, people and traditions; The formation, birth and activities of the Vietnam Propaganda Liberation Army Team; The heroic and glorious army tradition.|||Visiting the Tran Hung Dao Forest Special National Relic Site, visitors can not only learn about the glorious historical tradition with many relics, but also explore and admire the beauty of the primeval forest.|||Spanning over 201.7 ha, Tran Hung Dao Forest remains pristine with fresh air and is a destination for thousands of domestic and international tourists.|||Under the ancient trees lies the stele commemorating 34 soldiers of the Vietnamese National Liberation Army Team.|||The resting hut and kitchen are replicas of the simple daily lives of the soldiers.|||Along a 50m small slope is a natural spring, which was the water source for the soldiers.|||After many years, it still produces cool and clear water.|||In Tran Hung Dao forest, a 300-year-old ancient tree that was closely tied to the daily lives of the Vietnamese National Liberation Army Team was recognized as a Vietnamese Heritage Tree.|||After 75 years, the remnants from the early days of the Vietnam Propaganda and Liberation Army are cherished and preserved by the ethnic communities in Cao Bang province, contributing to the education of patriotism and revolutionary traditions for the younger generations. The vast primeval forest spreads its canopy, enveloping the sacred historical sites during the challenging revolutionary period of General Vo Nguyen Giap and the Vietnam Propaganda and Liberation Army.

title: Lo Go - Xa Mat National Park
description: Location: Lo Go - Xa Mat National Park is located on the territory of 3 communes: Tan Lap, Tan Binh, Hoa Hiep, Tan Bien district, Tay Ninh province, about 30km northwest of Tay Ninh city.
