Characteristics: Lo Go - Xa Mat National Park has a rich flora and fauna, especially rare waterbirds, located in the western part of the lowland region of the Southeast, mainly primeval forest, quite flat terrain.|||With an area of 18,765ha, lying at an altitude of 5-10m above sea level, it is the largest forested area in Tay Ninh province, divided into three sub-zones. The strictly protected area is 8,590ha, ecological restoration area: 10,080ha, and the rest is an administrative service area.|||Lo Go - Xa Mat has a mosaic vegetation between semi-deciduous forest, lowland deciduous forest, and narrow strips of evergreen forest along rivers and streams, and Melaleuca forest. Near the border with Cambodia are wide strips of grassy wetlands with sedge vegetation.|||The rich flora has valuable species such as Dipterocarpaceae: oil trees, sao den, candle tree, and some species listed in the Red Book such as cate, giang huong, mac sua.|||The bird fauna in this national park is characteristic, with many rare waterbirds recorded in wetland habitats, such as lesser adjutant, lesser fish eagle, and wire-tailed swallow, red junglefowl, and silver pheasant. In addition, Lo Go - Xa Mat is also a stopover for the eastern sarus crane on its migratory route to breeding grounds in Cambodia. Lo Go - Xa Mat has been recognized as one of the important bird areas of Vietnam.|||During the war against the US, Lo Go - Xa Mat was the base of the Liberation Radio Station of South Vietnam, and also a revolutionary base of the liberation army. Therefore, this area is also important in terms of history.|||Lo Go - Xa Mat National Park, where the Vam Co river originates from Cambodia, has an important role in protecting the river's headwaters. Many households living in the area depend on the aquatic resources of this river.

title: Ganh Rang Tien Sa
description: Location: In Ganh Rang ward, Quy Nhon city, Binh Dinh province, about 3km southeast of the city center.|||Features: Ganh Rang is a series of rocky beaches that wind along the curve of Xuan Van hill and is considered the most scenic spot in Binh Dinh province.|||From Quy Nhon city, follow Highway 1D about 3km southeast, visitors will arrive at Ganh Rang scenic spot.|||Ghenh Rang at night has a mystical beauty. The sky is as delicate as a cloak woven from velvet. At the foot of the mountain, waves shine with a soft, shimmering light, blending with the lights of distant fishing boats, creating a dazzling display against the rocky shore. The sound of the waves is gentle. From here, the road to Quy Nhon - Song Cau is visible, with the headlights of vehicles forming a long, shining line along the coast, seemingly stretching endlessly. The area is filled with rocks, forming caves, reefs, and ridges, playing with the waves all year round. When passing through this area with many reefs, sailors must reduce the wind in their sails to slow down. This maneuver is called 'rang'. Over time, the name stuck, and this area was called Ghenh Rang. Besides this familiar name, the place is also associated with a legend. It is said that in the past, there was a beautiful and gentle girl in Bong Son, known for her virtue. She was secretly in love with a young man from the village. However, her beauty caught the attention of a county official, who sought to possess her. To keep her loyalty to her lover, she tearfully bid farewell to her parents and the young man, then fled to Quy Nhon. Upon hearing this, the county official sent his men to pursue her. When they reached Ghenh Rang, a storm arose, with thunder and lightning, and the mountain cracked open, and she disappeared. The young man, heartbroken, searched everywhere for her. He climbed from rock to rock, calling out for his beloved. His cries echoed through the mountains and the sea. However, in the darkness, he only saw glimpses of his lover's figure, sometimes on the forest, sometimes on the waves, as if beckoning him. Since then, whenever lightning flashes over Ghenh Rang, people in the area look up to see the figure of the girl appearing faintly. Thus, the place is also known as Ghenh Rang Tien Sa.|||Ghenh Rang was ranked as a national scenic spot by the Ministry of Culture and Information in 1991.|||After passing the Mong Cam slope, turn into the staircase path to visit the resting place of poet Han Mac Tu, with a garden of tall casuarina trees and the soothing sound of sea wind. Due to a serious illness, he spent his last years at Quy Hoa Leperosy Hospital and passed away at 28, leaving behind immortal poems. To fulfill his wish, his family and friends brought his remains to Ghenh Rang in 1969. The tomb is built on a hill, backed by a mountain and facing the sea, attracting many visitors. It's not just a beautiful architecture but also a place to commemorate a great poet. Here, visitors can also admire the art of writing poems with a 'fire pen' by artist Dzu Kha. With a welding rod and skilled hands, he brought Han Mac Tu's romantic poems to life on pine wood, leaving visitors with a memorable keepsake.Ghenh Rang is not only beautiful due to its legend but also a picturesque landscape. From the top, visitors can see the city and the sea in all four directions. To the southwest, the mountains stretch towards the sky. To the north lies the bustling city of Quy Nhon. Facing east is the vast blue sea, embracing the yellow sandy beach. In the northeast, the Phuong Mai peninsula guards the Thi Nai estuary like a giant screen. Along the winding path on the hillside, visitors can admire beautiful sculptures created by nature. There are rocks shaped like human faces or lions. Lying on the ground are stone elephants guarding the sea. Notably, there are two large rocks stacked on top of each other, called Hon Chong. Despite appearing fragile, Hon Chong has stood firm against storms for centuries. From Hon Chong, visitors can walk north along the rocky coast and find magnificent and mysterious caves formed by stacked rocks.|||On the way back, don't forget to stop at Trung beach with numerous unique pebbles polished smooth by the sea.|||It was once reserved for Nam Phuong Hoang Hau whenever she came to relax.|||Therefore, it's also known as Hoang Hau beach.

title: Thanh Tan Hot Spring Resort
description: Location: Thanh Tan Hot Spring Resort is in Phong An commune, Phong Dien district, Thua Thien - Hue province. Features: This is an ideal resort. At the source, hot mineral water reaches 68ºC, hot enough to cook eggs.|||During the resistance war against the US, wounded soldiers were treated here and recovered quickly. Dr. Duong Quat, one of the doctors who treated wounded soldiers with hot mineral water, shared this experience.|||Now, Thanh Tan Natural Mineral Water Company has developed this hot spring into a resort. On summer days, thousands of tourists from all over the country come here to relax. Besides the natural hot spring system, there are swimming pools and bathing lakes hidden among orchid gardens. On the lakes, there are rest houses made of thatch and solidly built houses serving tourists' needs. After bathing, tourists can participate in gymnastics, exercise, and steam bathing programs. There's also a kitchen serving food on the spot and for long-term stays for tourists who want to rest and recuperate.

title: Pu Luong Nature Reserve
description: Location: Pu Luong Nature Reserve is located in the northwest of Thanh Hoa province, in Quan Hoa and Ba Thuoc districts. Characteristics: Established in 1999, it has rich natural landscapes with diverse flora and fauna.|||Pu Luong Nature Reserve has an area of over 17,600 ha with a rich variety of flora and fauna, including hundreds of species listed in Vietnam's and the world's Red Books. Visitors can hike through the core area.|||Visitors will be amazed by the picturesque beauty of terraced fields along the mountains and hills, traditional houses at the foot of the mountains, and lush green forests. Especially at dawn, when the fog has not yet cleared, Pu Luong appears mystical like a fairyland.|||It's a great place for hiking or cycling along the roads surrounded by fields, immersing in nature, and enjoying the fresh air.|||Visitors can also visit Dơi Cave, Hiêu Waterfall, Dan Long Waterfall, Muon Waterfall, Mường Ký fish cave, Ba Thước hydropower lake, and traditional craft villages like embroidery, weaving, and herbal medicine. For adventurous travelers, conquering Pu Luong peak at 1,700m, rafting on the river, or kayaking on the stream are unique experiences.|||The best time to visit Pu Luong is from May to October, with May and June being ideal for green rice fields, and September and October for golden ripe rice fields. Visitors can come at any time to relax and enjoy the cool, misty atmosphere.

title: Ho Chi Minh Museum
description: Located at 01 Duy Tan Street, Da Nang city.|||Opening hours: Open daily: Morning: 7:30 to 11:00 Afternoon: 13:30 to 16:00|||Ho Chi Minh Museum consists of 2 parts: Ho Chi Minh's stilt house model. In 1975, the South was completely liberated. On September 12, 1976, according to the wishes and feelings of compatriots, cadres and soldiers of Region 5 towards Uncle Ho, the stilt house model was built to the exact 1/1 scale (similar to Ho Chi Minh's stilt house in Hanoi) at the center of Da Nang city. Outside is a garden with trees, fish pond... creating a beautiful and airy campus, attracting many visitors to the city. Ho Chi Minh Museum has 4 exhibition rooms, introducing the life and revolutionary career of the hero of national liberation, world cultural personality Ho Chi Minh. The museum displays many precious artifacts showing the loyalty and devotion of compatriots, cadres and soldiers of Region 5 towards Uncle Ho and Uncle Ho's deep affection for compatriots and soldiers of Region 5.

title: Mau Temple
description: Location: Bai Say Street, Quang Trung ward, Hung Yen city. Characteristics: Worships Lady Duong Thien Hau (Concubine Duong).|||Mau Temple is a beautiful scenic spot in Pho Hien "First-class Pho Hien". The temple was built on "Nga Long" land, looking out on Ban Nguyet Lake, creating a "Son Dieu Thuy" pose. The temple worships Lady Duong Qui Phi, revered as Duong Thien Hau. According to historical records, she was the wife of King Tong De Binh. In 1279, the Yuan army invaded the Tong dynasty, and the king and his family fled south. On the way, they were captured by the Yuan general Truong Hoang Pham. King Tong and some concubines refused to surrender and jumped into the sea, and Duong Qui Phi's body was washed ashore and buried by the locals.|||From the Tam Quan gate to the yard, there is a 700-year-old banyan tree and a fig tree, intertwined and shaded, adding to the solemnity. The Dai Bai hall is built in the style of eight roofs with dragon-scale tiles, and the eaves are curved like a dragon. The rungs, sen pillars, and columns are carved with flowers, dragons, and phoenixes. Two sides of the Dai Bai hall are Luu Ly and Quang Han pavilions. Through the dynasties, the temple was renovated and awarded many times. In the 8th year of Thanh Thai, the temple was restored on a large scale and has the architecture as it is today.|||The Tam Quan gate was built in the style of two-tiered, eight-roofed architecture with curved eaves. The gate is arched, with two pillars on top, adorned with two crocodiles facing the gate. On the arch are several plaques with inscriptions. Inside the Tam Quan gate are several large characters "Hoa Duong Dong" and "Van Co Huong".|||The front hall consists of three rooms, with a lavishly decorated architecture, with plaques, couplets, and ritual objects. The roof is adorned with "Luang Long Chau Nuyet", and the eaves are curved like a dragon.|||The rear hall is connected to the front hall, with five rooms built in the style of con nhi, with 12 columns, and carved with flowers and leaves. Under the dim light of candles and incense, the space becomes even more solemn and mysterious.|||Mau Temple was ranked a national historical and cultural relic on March 30, 1990. The temple is a beautiful architectural work, a historical and cultural relic that is both majestic and ancient, and close to the people. The Mau Temple festival is held solemnly from March 10 to 15 every year, attracting people from within and outside the region.

title: Hai Van Pass
description: Location: Hai Van Pass is located along the Hai Van mountain range, between Thua Thien - Hue province and Da Nang city. Characteristics: It is the highest pass (about 500m above sea level), very hazardous and is the last peak of a Truong Son mountain range that runs to the sea.|||Hai Van Pass is on one side surrounded by mountains and forests, and on the other side by the sea, with clouds surrounding the top all year round, hence it is also known as 'Cloud Pass'. In Phu Bien tap luc, Le Qui Don once commented: Hai Van is right by the sea, on top it touches the clouds, and is the boundary between the two regions of Thuan Hoa and Quang Nam. Previously, in the 13th century, this region belonged to the O and Ri districts of the Cham kingdom, and was given by the Cham king Che Man as a dowry to marry Huyen Tran princess of the Tran dynasty. On the top of the pass, there are still remains of the past: gates and fortifications. The gate facing Thua Thien province has the inscription 'Hai Van Quan', and the gate facing Quang Nam province has the inscription 'Thien ha de nhat hung quan' (given by King Le Thanh Ton).|||On the journey through the central region, Hai Van Pass has become an ideal stop for travelers going south or north. From Da Nang, following highway 1A northwards, after passing Nam O region, travelers start to ascend Hai Van Pass. The pass winds and twists along the mountain slope, like a silk ribbon across the sky. The wind is like a galloping horse, and the clouds seem to pour down from above. Sometimes the clouds cover the entire pass, making travelers feel like they are in a different world, shrouded in mist. From here, on a clear day, travelers can see the entire city of Da Nang, Tien Sa port - Son Tra peninsula, Cu Lao Cham... and the long sandy beaches embracing the green sea.|||What nature has given, through time and human touch, becomes a cultural value. To come to Hai Van Pass is to be at the intersection of two regions, to satisfy the desire to conquer the heights, to be immersed in the echoes of the past, and to reminisce about the deep past of the central region.

title: War Remnants Museum
description: Located at 28 Vo Van Tan, District 3, Ho Chi Minh City.|||The War Remnants Museum was established in September 1975. It is a member of the International Council of Museums (ICOM). The museum preserves and displays artifacts and documents about the consequences of war.|||The museum's area is 5,400m2, with 4,522m2 of exhibition space. The ground floor includes a ticket counter, a multi-purpose room, and an exhibition room.|||The museum stores over 20,000 artifacts, including tanks, planes, and documents. It also has a collection of photos "Vietnam - War and Peace" by Japanese photographer Ishikawa Bunyo.|||The museum regularly organizes mobile exhibitions in many localities, including remote areas and islands, to promote the consequences of war and the aspiration for peace of the Vietnamese people.|||The museum was awarded the Third-Class Labor Order (1995) and the Second-Class Labor Order (2001).

title: Tam Giang Lagoon
description: Location: Tam Giang Lagoon is bounded to the north by the O Lau River mouth and to the south by the Huong River mouth, connecting to the sea through Thuan An inlet, spanning across 12 communes in three districts: Quang Dien, Phong Dien, and Huong Tra.|||Characteristics: Tam Giang Lagoon and Cau Hai are the two largest and most typical brackish water lagoons in Vietnam.|||The Tam Giang - Cau Hai lagoon is the largest brackish lagoon system in Southeast Asia with 21,600 ha of water surface, accounting for 48.2% of Vietnam's coastal lagoon area. It stretches for around 27 km from the mouth of the O Lau river to the mouth of the Huong river, located in three districts: Phong Dien, Quang Dien, and Huong Tra, in Thua Thien Hue province.|||According to researchers, the Tam Giang - Cau Hai lagoon system is one of the few remaining representatives of tropical coastal ecosystems with complex and diverse environments. It contains a delta region, open shallow waters, grassy buffer zones, river mouths, and branches surrounded by sand dunes. As a result, Tam Giang - Cau Hai has very high biodiversity, worthy of being a water and biological museum. Recent surveys have recorded a total of 1,296 species in this area, including 41 rare species, comprising 295 phytoplankton species, 50 higher plant species, 73 seaweed and aquatic plant species (including 7 seagrass species), 119 zooplankton species, 215 benthic species, 361 fish species, and 137 bird species.|||The road to Tam Giang lagoon is easy and convenient, only about 15km from Hue city center. Visiting Tam Giang takes just one day, but you can also try staying overnight for a unique experience. When you arrive, don't overthink it - just grab your camera or phone to capture the amazing moments you can't miss. The most exciting experience is drifting on a boat, crossing the lagoon system, and being overwhelmed by the pristine beauty, or admiring the sunrise or sunset. The sunset is probably the most spectacular scene on Tam Giang, and many tourists and photographers try to capture the perfect shot of the evening falling on this vast river landscape.|||was removed as there was no '|||' in the original description to preserve, so the description is translated as a whole.|||When you travel here, Thai Duong Ha fishing village, Ru Cha mangrove forest, floating market... are the places you must visit. Thai Duong fishing village is a small, ancient island surrounded by water on all sides, giving a sense of serenity. The locals here mainly make a living by fishing. The traders on the floating market are fishermen living in fishing villages like Thai Duong Ha, Ngu My Thach. Ngu My Thach floating market has existed for a few hundred years. The floating market on Tam Giang lagoon is always quiet but lively, with diverse sellers, showing the unique culture of this land that has been around for a long time and has become a habit of fishermen on Tam Giang. Not only is it formed for trading, this market is also a place for exchange and socializing for people living on the river, with many interesting things.|||Ru Cha is a rare primeval forest of the Tam Giang lagoon. To explore Ru Cha, you must take a boat to go deep inside. It's a cool and peaceful space with mangrove trees like su, vet, mam... You feel like you're completely separated from the outside world. Moreover, going by boat into Ru Cha also helps you escape the scorching heat of the summer days. Here, you can stroll along the small concrete road with a few short branches, or follow the dirt paths to admire the mystical roots of the trees, the branches curving and intertwining like a cathedral, making it a spot for many couples to capture memorable moments.|||After a boat ride along the lagoon, nothing is more fun than stopping by a restaurant at the dock or visiting the stilt houses on the water, having a drink and waiting for the fishermen to pass by. Fresh seafood like shrimp, fish, and crabs are only available here. Steamed fish is delicious, and clams are also sweet and flavorful, although smaller than those from the sea. Crabs are particularly small, about three fingers wide, but sweet and tender, and surprisingly affordable, priced half as much as those from the sea.|||Just one day of experience here, you'll be able to feel the beauty of the lagoon area, and love this land even if you just stop by once.

title: Bo Ban Communal House
description: Located in Bo Ban village, Hoa Phong commune, Hoa Vang district, Da Nang city. The communal house was built in the early 19th century using bamboo at the Tam Vi shrine.|||Bo Ban Communal House was established to worship the tutelary god and the predecessors of the village, and it serves as a venue for annual festivals. In 1852, it was relocated to the center of the village.|||The house has brick walls and a yin-yang tile roof, divided into 3 compartments and 2 wings, measuring 14.5m in length and 9.7m in width, with 36 columns made of mit and kien kien wood. The beam and column structure follows the overlapping beam style, with dragon heads carved on the trusses, and motifs of plum blossoms, bamboo, pine trees, and orchids on the beams. Additionally, various birds and animals, such as sparrows and monkeys, are intricately carved, creating unique and artistically valuable sculptures.|||The communal house was ranked as a historical and cultural relic by the Ministry of Culture and Information on January 4, 1999.

title: Vinpearl Safari Phu Quoc Park
description: Location: Ganh Dau commune, Phu Quoc island, Kien Giang province.|||Features: Vietnam's first zoo built in the style of a global wildlife park.|||Vinpearl Safari Phu Quoc wildlife conservation park spans nearly 500ha, built in a semi-wild model, where rare animals are cared for and conserved in an open natural environment. In phase 1, covering 380ha, Vinpearl Safari Phu Quoc is divided into two main areas: Open zoo and Safari park, featuring around 3,000 individuals representing 150 rare species from around the world.|||The open zoo area is currently nurturing and conserving about 40 rare indigenous species along with many wild animals from distinct biogeographic regions around the world such as South Africa, Europe, India, and Australia. Built on a modern model, the homes for Vinpearl Safari's residents are designed semi-open with a surrounding water moat, creating a harmonious living environment with nature, and providing visitors with a realistic and vivid observation experience.|||Here, visitors will explore the Primate World with the presence of Silvered Langur, Pile Gibbon, Red-faced Macaque, Ring-tailed Lemur...; Asian elephants strolling leisurely by the stream; the area for hoofed animals, typically represented by Arabian Oryx, Scimitar-horned Oryx, Blackbuck, Gaur...; or stop to admire the majesty of White Bengal Tiger, African Lion...; the playfulness of Dromedary Camel, Striped Hyena, or the lovable laziness of Bear species... Meanwhile, with 3 bird gardens themed around Peacock, Stork, and Myna, and the charm of the Flamingo Lake, visiting the open zoo is a special journey that takes visitors back to nature to explore the vibrant lives of various animals.|||Spanning a large area, the Wild Animal Park meets the strict requirements of the world's Safari model. Each area in the park is a different ecosystem, ensuring suitability for the biological characteristics of each species. Without cages, over 40 rare animal species are raised and developed freely in the wild. Visitors will travel through the Indian Tiger Conservation, African Rhinoceros Conservation, Kenya Giraffe Conservation, Congo River Basin... of the Wild Animal Park by specialized bus, following the interesting concept of "people caged, animals free", providing vivid and authentic experiences about the natural life of various species.|||What's more interesting than witnessing lions playing with each other beside dry grass, a giraffe herd leisurely crossing the road, rhinoceroses enjoying themselves in the mud, or waterbucks suddenly perking up their ears when they hear the roar of the "King of the Forest"?|||The open living space here allows animals to freely express their natural behaviors and gives visitors a realistic experience of their wild lives.|||In addition to the two main areas, Vinpearl Safari Phu Quoc has other functional areas such as: quarantine and isolation area, souvenir shopping area and the largest veterinary hospital in Southeast Asia. With the goal of caring for and conserving animals not only in Vietnam but also in the region, Vinpearl Safari's veterinary hospital now gathers many leading veterinary experts and wildlife caregivers from South Africa, Australia, India...|||Visitors can experience various regular performances, such as watching shows and taking photos with animals, taking photos with mascots, making clay figurines with artisans, and face painting.|||has been removed as there was no|||in the original description, the sentence has been simplified|||In the near future, Vinpearl Safari Phu Quoc will continue to welcome more rare animals from around the world, promising to expand in terms of species and individual numbers.|||The birth of Vinpearl Safari Phu Quoc has added an impressive highlight to Phu Quoc tourism, helping to make Phu Quoc a famous island destination in the region and the world.

title: Truong Tien Bridge
description: Located in Hue city, Truong Tien Bridge spans the Huong River, connecting Phu Hoa ward to Phu Hoi ward. It is one of the first bridges in Indochina built using Western techniques.|||Under King Le Thanh Tong (1460 - 1497), the Huong River had a bridge made of tightly bound bamboo called Cau May. Later, it was rebuilt using lim wood. In 1897, the bridge was rebuilt with steel according to the design of French architect Gustave Eiffel.|||Completed in 1899, the bridge was named Thanh Thai (after the Nguyen dynasty king at the time). It was 401.1m long and 6.2m wide, with 6 steel arches. After being damaged in a storm in 1904, it was repaired in 1906.|||In 1907, when King Thanh Thai was exiled, the French colonial government renamed it Clemenceau. In 1937, under King Bao Dai, the bridge was widened for bicycles and pedestrians. During the wars against France and the US, the bridge was destroyed multiple times and repaired. After reunification (April 30, 1975), it was renamed Trang Tien. In 1991, it was renovated again, and in 2004, it was renamed Truong Tien.|||Having endured for centuries, Truong Tien Bridge has become a part of the history of the land. It remains an iconic symbol of Hue, even with other bridges like Bach Ho and Phu Xuan. Since the 2002 Hue Festival, the bridge has been equipped with modern color-changing lighting, making it a stunning sight at dusk.

title: City Bird Sanctuary
description: Location: The bird sanctuary is located in the Cultural Park (also known as 19/5 Garden), in Ca Mau City, Ca Mau Province, about 2km west of the city center. Characteristics: The city bird sanctuary is home to many bird species.|||The cultural park covers an area of about 18.2ha, featuring entertainment areas, monuments, gardens, and a fish pond. It is also home to various species typical of mangrove forests: crocodiles, monkeys, monitor lizards, snakes, turtles... Notably, the bird sanctuary is the most popular area. Every afternoon, thousands of birds return to the approximately 2ha forest within the park. Over time, other bird species such as ducks, teals, and waterfowl have also made this place their habitat and breeding ground. The forest area for birds has been expanded to 6ha, fenced off as a separate ecological zone, featuring ponds, lush vegetation, and shrubs around the lake, where birds gather, breed, and thrive.

title: U Minh Thuong National Park
description: Location: U Minh Thuong National Park is located in U Minh Thuong district, Kien Giang province, about 50km south of Rach Gia city.|||Characteristics: This is a national park with a unique value for its melaleuca forest, a type found in Vietnam and worldwide.|||The Trem River divides the U Minh forest into two areas, upper and lower. U Minh Thuong is in Kien Giang Province, while U Minh Ha is in Ca Mau Province.|||Due to various factors, the forest is more concentrated in U Minh Thuong, where the majority is primary forest.|||From Rach Gia city, visitors can reach U Minh Thuong by road or waterway. If traveling by water, visitors cross Tac Cau - Xeo Ro ferry, then take a boat on the Cai Lon river to U Minh Thuong National Park. If traveling by road, follow highway 61 for about 37km, visitors will reach the Cai Lon river, from here it takes about 15 minutes by boat on the Cai Lon river to arrive at U Minh Thuong National Park.|||From the entrance, U Minh Thuong National Park exudes a unique charm of a forest in a freshwater wetland, featuring a mixed Melaleuca forest on peat soil (the peat layer is 1-3m thick) of the acid sulphate soil ecosystem. Here, Melaleuca trees, about 20m tall, are the most characteristic species, with sparse canopies, small leaves, and a very fragrant scent.|||Continue for a few dozen meters and visitors will arrive at Hoa Mai lake tourist area. Here, visitors can relax on hammocks while admiring the scenery with flowers, birds, or participate in the entertaining fishing service provided by the resort.|||In the cool, airy space, surrounded by the chirping sounds of birds, visitors can treat themselves to a delicious meal with grilled fish served with specialty vegetables such as rau choai shoots, ao buds, red diêu rau, and spicy me fish sauce,…|||From Hoa Mai lake, visitors can also visit other points in the national park, such as the bat plain and bird plain. The bat plain covers about 15 hectares and is home to thousands of bats and crows. A recent survey showed that this colony of bats often forages in Can Tho and returns to roost here. Standing 3-4 meters away, visitors can see bats hanging from trees like clusters of fruit. The bats here include several species, with the Thai horseshoe bat being the rarest.|||The most interesting part is probably the journey from the egret area to the bird sanctuary. To get here, visitors must travel by "vỏ lãi" (small boat), under a layer of sharp-pointed duckweed, so thick in some places that you can't see the water.|||The bird sanctuary in the national park is vast, with hundreds of thousands of birds gathering in flocks.|||The birds include waterbirds, songbirds, fruit-eating birds, and insectivorous birds, creating a colorful spectacle. According to statistics, U Minh Thuong has the largest number of birds among the bird sanctuaries in the Cuu Long delta region.|||U Minh Thuong forest is not just a rare wetland forest in the world, but also a historical forest. During the resistance wars against France and the US, U Minh Thuong was a base for the Central Committee of the Southern Region. It was a place where many comrades, such as Le Duan, Le Duc Anh, Vo Van Kiet, and Nguyen Tan Dung, operated and fought.|||The area is also home to relics of the Oc Eo culture, including Canh Den, Den Vua, Keo Mot, and Nen Vua.

title: Christ the Savior Parish
description: Location: The church is located at the end of Nguyen Hue street, Hue city, Thua Thien - Hue province. Characteristics: Christ the Savior Parish combines Western and Eastern architecture harmoniously.|||Construction began in 1937 and was completed in 1942.|||A notable feature of the church's architecture is its wide doors and lack of walls. The porch is designed to be spacious, allowing those outside to feel as if they are inside the church during crowded events.|||The main altar is made of pink marble, measuring 3.6m long, 1.25m wide, and 28cm high. There are also two smaller altars made of the same pink marble. The church also features traditional Asian drums and gongs.|||Outside the hallway, there's a small room for storing cremated remains in small urns, a practice for Christian families.|||The bell tower has four bells controlled electrically.|||Christ the Savior Parish has a spire that reaches towards the sky, with a tiled roof, blending Western and Eastern architectural styles. It's considered one of the beautiful churches in Hue city.

title: Duong Lam Ancient Village
description: Located in five villages: Mong Phu, Cam Thinh, Dong Sang, Doai Giap, Duong Lam commune, Son Tay town, about 47km west of Hanoi.|||This is the only village that has preserved the original structure and way of life of an ancient Vietnamese village in the northern midlands.|||Duong Lam is known as the land of two kings as it is the homeland of Phung Hung and Ngo Quyen, two national heroes who repelled northern invaders in the 8th and 10th centuries.|||This is also the homeland of envoy Giang Van Minh, an outstanding diplomat (late 16th early 17th century) who bravely sacrificed himself on a diplomatic mission to protect the nation's dignity.|||Today, Duong Lam still preserves most of the characteristics of a traditional Vietnamese village with village gate, banyan tree, water dock, communal house yard... The old houses from the 17th - 18th centuries, with moss-covered roofs, are associated with yards, gardens, wells, and lie along roads arranged in a fishbone pattern. Houses in Duong Lam are built with traditional materials of the Doai region such as: laterite stone (ensuring coolness in summer and warmth in winter), bamboo, wood, thatch, rammed earth, rice husk, mud, sawdust, lime, sand, slag, straw. The houses are arranged in a structure of 5 rows of columns, with 5 or 7 compartments and 2 wings. The roof curves down like a kite, tiled with curved tiles in a style of overlapping and interlocking like dragon scales. The ridge beam has an engraved date; the trunks and door arches are adorned with intricate carvings. The central compartment, occupying the largest area, is where the ancestral altar is placed along with horizontal boards, couplets, and ancient paintings... Below the altar is a wooden bed and a long chair for sitting. On the table of each house, there is a tea urn for serving green tea to guests or a pipe for smoking tobacco.|||In addition to ancient houses, Duong Lam village has a system of clan temples, communal temples, pagodas, and other structures, surrounded by a lively environment with 36 hills; 18 deep ditches; 49 ponds, lakes, and pools. The rolling fields, hills, and slopes of Duong Lam are always attractive to photographers during the golden harvest season or when the young green crops are thriving.|||When visiting Duong Lam, don't miss the chance to enjoy or buy as gifts local specialties like grilled meat, gai cake, water-fried cake, te cake, lam tea, kho tea, peanut candy, sesame candy, doi candy, and soy sauce...|||On November 28, 2005, the ancient village of Duong Lam was ranked by the State as a national architectural and artistic monument.|||This is the first ancient village in the country to be ranked as a national monument.|||To serve the needs of tourists visiting Duong Lam village, the Duong Lam Ancient Village Tourism Information Office organizes tours such as: historical and cultural relic tours, ancient house architecture tours, agricultural experience tours (growing vegetables, harvesting vegetables - roots - fruits, fishing, cooking, irrigation, plowing, rice planting, tea picking, tea roasting, harvesting rice...), traditional craft experience tours (making peanut candy, sesame candy; making Vietnamese rice cake).|||was removed as there was no '|||' in the original description to preserve, the rest was translated accordingly.

title: An Giang Museum
description: Location: An Giang Museum is located on Thoai Ngoc Hau street, My Long ward, Long Xuyen city, An Giang province. Characteristics: An Giang Museum is a place to display documents, artifacts and images reflecting the history, culture and development process of An Giang province.|||The museum has a large yard with many ornamental plants and the scent of frangipani flowers, creating a pleasant atmosphere for visitors.|||Upon arrival, visitors are introduced to exhibition rooms by theme:|||Room 1 displays nearly 200 images and artifacts about the life and revolutionary career of President Ton Duc Thang, a steadfast fighter for the national liberation cause.|||Room 2 showcases archaeological artifacts such as tombs, statues, and labor tools from the Oc Eo culture from the 2nd to 7th centuries, excavated at the Ba The - Oc Eo di site. The room displays around 300 images and artifacts, giving visitors an idea of a major cultural center of an ancient city.|||Room 3 helps visitors review the historical stages of the revolutionary struggle of the people of An Giang.|||Room 4 is themed "Achievements in Building and Protecting the Socialist Fatherland of An Giang Province".

title: Yaly Hydropower Plant
description: Location: Yaly hydropower plant is located on the Se San River, in Chu Pah district, Gia Lai province. Characteristics: This is the third largest national key project after Hoa Binh and Son La hydropower plants.|||The once famous Yaly waterfall has been replaced by the beauty of the dam, spillway, and a large, green lake in the midst of Tay Nguyen mountains.|||With a surface area of 64.5km² and a capacity of 1.03 billion m³, the Yaly hydropower plant was built here with an installed capacity of 720MW and an average annual electricity output of 3.7 billion kWh. The construction and operation of the Yaly hydropower plant have greatly impacted the economic, cultural, and social life of Tay Nguyen in general and Gia Lai in particular. The electricity generated has brought light to many villages, contributing to the improvement of the local people's living standards.|||In the future, four more hydropower plants are expected to be built upstream and downstream of Yaly: Se San 3, Se San 4, Plei Krong, and Thuong Kon Tum. Se San 3 and Se San 4 are located downstream of the Yaly hydropower plant.|||Today, Yaly waterfall remains an interesting tourist destination, where visitors can visit the hydropower plant, visit Gia Rai ethnic villages, and take a boat trip upstream on the Se San River to admire the scenery and enjoy the fresh mountain air of Tay Nguyen.

title: Son La Province Prison Historic Site and Museum
description: Located on Khau Ca hill, To Hieu ward, Son La city, Son La province, along Nam La stream. It is a special cultural and historical site aimed at educating patriotism for all generations.|||The Son La prison and museum complex includes two architectural components: the prison and the Son La museum. The Son La prison was built by the French in 1908 on an area of 500m2 to detain patriotic communist fighters. In 1940, the prison area was expanded to 1,700m2 with a solid stone and brick wall 4m high and half a meter thick. The beds for prisoners were made of concrete with a foot clamp system along the length of the floor. In the summer, the cells were like furnaces due to the Lao wind, and in the winter, they were freezing due to the harsh border climate. The French turned the prison into a hell to detain, torture, and extinguish the will to fight of communist fighters. Between 1930-1945, the prison held 1,007 revolutionaries and patriots. This dark prison forged outstanding leaders for the country, including: Le Duan, Truong Chinh, To Hieu, Van Tien Dung, Xuan Thuy, Tran Huy Lieu, Nguyen Co Thach, Mai Chi Tho, Tran Quoc Hoan, Hoang The Thien…|||Before withdrawing from Son La in 1952, the French colonialists bombed the prison area to erase evidence of their crimes.|||In 1965, the US bombed and destroyed much of Son La prison.|||To educate the young generation about the tradition of patriotism, a part of Son La prison has been reconstructed. At the Son La prison historical site, visitors can see the underground cells, diagonal cells, ward 2, ward 3, and special cells as small as 1.2m2, along with hundreds of artifacts that are living evidence of the brutal crimes committed by the French colonialists, such as handcuffs, iron chains, and sharp clamps.|||Visitors are also moved when standing in front of the peach tree planted by comrade To Hieu, the Secretary of the Son La Prison Party Committee from May 1940 to October 1941, on the rocky wall of the prison. The peach tree has become a symbol of the will and unbreakable spirit of the communist prisoners.|||Located next to the Son La prison historical site is the Son La Provincial Museum, which stores and displays thousands of artifacts reflecting the unique cultural characteristics of ethnic groups in the province.|||The first floor displays artifacts from the prehistoric period, including stone, iron, and bronze tools dating back thousands of years, as well as artifacts from the Chieng On and Pac Ma sites (Quynh Nhai district) and the Da River reservoir area.|||The second floor is a display room featuring Uncle Ho with the ethnic groups of Son La Province.|||On the third floor, visitors can explore a display of artifacts showcasing the cultural, production, and daily life of the 12 ethnic groups living in the province, including pottery, jewelry, embroidery frames, and traditional clothing.|||Notably, the museum has collected over 700 ancient Tai books of varying sizes written with a brush on paper, including paper made from mulberry bark, fabric, and tree bark, as well as over 30 books recording Muong laws, local customs, production experiences, and traditional medicine, along with instructions on making arrows, gunpowder, and traps for hunting wild animals.|||In 1962, the Son La province prison relic and museum was ranked a national historical and cultural monument.|||Each year, the site welcomes hundreds of thousands of visitors for sightseeing, research, and study.

title: Bach Ma National Park
description: Location: Phu Loc and Nam Dong district, Thua Thien Hue province.|||Features: Bach Ma National Park has beautiful natural scenery, cool and fresh climate, with rich and diverse flora and fauna.|||From Hue city, follow highway 1A about 40km south to Cau Hai town (Phu Loc district), then turn right for 19km to reach Bach Ma National Park.|||Located at the end of the North Truong Son mountain range stretching from the Vietnam-Laos border to the East Sea, at an altitude of 1,450m above sea level, Bach Ma mountain area has a cool and refreshing climate and is considered by foreign experts to be one of the most pleasant mountainous regions in Indochina.|||Within 22,031 hectares of natural area, Bach Ma National Park has up to 16,900 hectares covered by pristine forest. The forest is home to 1,406 plant species, including many valuable timber trees like tro chi, kien, giẻ hương, gõ, tùng... (many trees have diameters of 80 - 100cm) and over 300 species of medicinal plants such as ba gạc, bình vôi, lá khôi, cây 7 lá 1 hoa...|||Bach Ma has 931 species of fauna, including 83 mammals, such as bears, leopards, tigers, and sao la...; 333 species of birds, 31 species of reptiles, 21 species of amphibians, 39 species of fish, 218 species of butterflies, 178 species of leaf-eating beetles, 28 species of termites.|||Bach Ma is particularly notable for being a habitat for rare birds like the silver pheasant and the white-eared pheasant.|||Visiting Bach Ma National Park, visitors can explore interesting natural trails, such as the Tri Sao trail leading to Tri Sao waterfall - a habitat for many tri sao birds; the Do Quy En trail leading to Do Quy En waterfall, which is surrounded by white foam pouring down into streams; the Ngu Ho trail leading to 5 lakes connected by a large stream; the Vong Hai Dai trail leading to a scenic lookout on Bach Ma peak. From here, visitors can see the entire Hai Van pass, Tuy Van mountain, Cau Hai lagoon, Tu Hien estuary, Chan May bay along the East Sea, and the serene, mystical atmosphere of Hue city and Da Nang city at night. Additionally, visitors can explore a 300m trail through a black chò forest, where many ancient trees with diameters over 1m and heights over 30m can be found. Bach Ma National Park also has an orchid garden - a collection of hundreds of orchid species with diverse colors and unique shapes.|||In 1932, the French built a large resort at Bach Ma, located at an altitude of 1,000 - 1,444m above sea level. The resort had 139 villas, a market, bank, post office, swimming pool, tennis courts, and a 19km road system connecting National Highway 1A to the center of Bach Ma.|||Currently, the villa area has been restored by Bach Ma National Park Management Board to become a resort for tourists, named Do Quyen, Sao La, Kim Giao... These villas still retain French-style architecture, usually only two stories high, with spiral staircases and quite wide corridors, large windows facing the mountain peak creating a spacious, both ancient and modern space.|||The best time to visit Bach Ma is in the summer and early autumn because the air is cool and even a bit chilly, making the journey more enjoyable.|||was removed as there was no '|||' in the original description, so: The best time to visit Bach Ma is in the summer and early autumn because the air is cool and even a bit chilly, making the journey more enjoyable. Scenic spots and historical sites blend together to create a unique charm.

title: Cua Lo Beach
description: Location: Cua Lo Beach is in Cua Lo town, Nghe An province, 18km from Vinh city. Characteristics: Cua Lo is one of the most beautiful beaches in Vietnam, situated in the cultural and tourist hub of Nghe An.|||Cua Lo beach is over 10km long with white sand, clear and clean water, and a gentle slope. The area is surrounded by green forests and rows of casuarina trees. The sea water is salty and calm, making it an ideal destination.|||Visitors can enjoy water sports like jet-skiing, flying boats, paragliding, and surfing. The experience of night squid fishing with local fishermen is unforgettable.|||Cua Lo offers quality tourist services at reasonable prices, rich seafood, and local specialties like grilled squid, 7-dish fish, snail porridge, eel porridge, and more.

title: Thap Ba Ponagar Tower
description: Located on a small hill, by the Cai River and National Highway 1A, in Vinh Phuoc ward, north of Nha Trang city, Khanh Hoa province. Thap Ba Po Nagar is a typical Cham architectural and sculptural work, existing for over 10 centuries.|||Thap Ba Po Nagar is less than two kilometers from the city center, nestled by the beautiful Cai River, next to Xom Bong Bridge, in a crowded commercial area. It is a must-visit destination for tourists in Nha Trang.|||On a hill over 20m high, according to researchers, under the Panduranga dynasty, the capital was relocated, and a complex of 5 towers was built. Now, one tower is lost, and the first towers were destroyed in wars.|||In 774, King Satysuaman rebuilt the complex, which was later destroyed again. The current complex was built in 965 by King Jaya Indravarman I. The main tower, 22.5m high, houses a stone statue of Goddess Po Nagar, replacing the original golden statue that was looted. The 2.6m-high statue has 10 arms, sitting on a 1.5m-square Yoni.|||The Cham people's construction techniques, used 10 centuries ago, still baffle researchers, who can't understand how they stacked bricks without any binding material. The complex has withstood natural damage for 10 centuries.|||The restoration of Thap Ba, completed between 2000 and 2003, has made it a cultural highlight and a must-visit destination in Nha Trang.|||A new internal road was built under Thap Ba, allowing visitors to stroll and enjoy the Cai River views. The fence around the complex was also completed, and the stairs to the main tower were restored. Thap Ba is a unique Cham tower destination, located at the gateway to Nha Trang city.

title: Tan Trao Historical Site
description: Location: Tan Trao is in Son Duong district, Tuyen Quang province, 41km northwest of Tuyen Quang city, 200km from Hanoi.|||Features: Tan Trao was a revolutionary base before the August Revolution.|||Tan Trao historical site - where President Ho Chi Minh and central agencies stayed and worked during the pre-uprising and resistance period against French colonialism, located in Tan Trao, Minh Thanh, Trung Yen, Binh Yen, Luong Thien communes (Son Duong district); Kim Quan, Trung Son, Hung Loi, Trung Minh, Dao Vien, Cong Da, Phu Thinh (Yen Son district). It is also a border area between Thai Nguyen and Bac Kan provinces.|||The total natural area of the entire zone is 561.1km2, with 18 representative monuments and monument clusters, which have been ranked as national monuments:|||Na Lua historical site complex includes: Na Lua hut - where Ho Chi Minh lived and worked from late May to August 22, 1945, located on the west slope of Na Lua mountain; Security hut, 20m west of Na Lua hut, was where the security guards stayed to ensure Uncle Ho's safety; Radio hut - where the information link between the Viet Minh Front and the Allies (in Côn Minh - China) was; Allied hut - marking the cooperation between the Viet Minh Front and the Allied Mission; hut where the National Party Conference was held, 20m north of Na Lua hut, was built to serve the Party's National Conference, which took place for 3 days (from August 13 to 15, 1945).|||Tan Trao Banyan Tree historical site: On August 16, 1945, at this location, Vo Nguyen Giap read the First Military Order on behalf of the National Uprising Committee and commanded the troops to march towards Hanoi.|||Tan Trao communal house: Tan Trao communal house is where the National Congress meeting was held (on August 16 and 17, 1945) - a meeting known as the second Dien Hong Conference in our nation's history.|||Hong Thai communal house: This is the first stop for Ho Chi Minh on his way from Pac Bo to Tan Trao (May 21, 1945).|||This location also served as the headquarters of the Safety Protection Committee and the supply department, and welcomed delegates to the Party's conferences.|||Nguyen Hue Sub-region Headquarters historical complex: In March 1945, the Nguyen Hue Sub-region Committee was moved to Ao Buc hamlet, Trung Yen commune. The Committee decided to establish a revolutionary government on March 10, 1945, and formed the Temporary Committee of Tu Do Zone - the first revolutionary government in the country on March 16, 1945.|||The complex of the Chairman of the Presidential Office - Office of the Prime Minister: This is where Chairman Ho Chi Minh and the Government discussed and decided important issues of the country during this period, in the fields of domestic affairs, economy, finance, culture and society...|||Central Organizing Committee historical site: The Party Affairs Committee and the Central Party Committee (later renamed the Central Organizing Committee) resided and worked here in late 1949 and from April 1951 to late 1953.|||Central Agricultural Department historical site: In May 1952, the Central Agricultural Department moved to work at Ao Rum area, Tan Lap village, Tan Trao commune, Son Duong district.|||Central Propaganda Department historical site: The Party's Propaganda Department (later renamed Central Propaganda and Training Department) once lived and worked on a hill in Thia village.|||Vietnam News Agency historical site: for over two years (since 1952), Vietnam News Agency was based in Hoang Lau village, Trung Yen commune, Son Duong district to propagate and encourage people to fight hunger and illiteracy and provide communication services for the Dien Bien Phu Campaign.|||The Ministry of Internal Affairs historical site: In 1948, the Ministry of Internal Affairs moved to Yen Thuong village, Trung Yen commune, Son Duong district and directed the work of protecting the safety of the Party Central Committee, Uncle Ho and the Government.|||The tunnel and safe house of President Ton Duc Thang: Ton Duc Thang lived and worked in Chi Lien village, Trung Yen commune, Son Duong district from late 1952 to July 1954.|||During this time, he chaired the Joint Conference between the Standing Committee of the National Assembly and the Lien Viet Committee (February 1953), the National Conference of the Lien Viet Committee (November 1953), the Third Session of the First National Assembly (from December 1 to 4, 1953) and many other important meetings...|||Historical site of the Vietnam General Confederation of Labor: from mid-1952 to August 1954, the Vietnam General Confederation of Labor was based in Cau village, Minh Thanh commune, Son Duong district.|||The Ministry of Foreign Affairs' historical site: for a short period at the beginning of 1947, the Ministry of Foreign Affairs moved to work in Han village, Kim Quan commune, Yen Son district. Then, the Ministry moved to Don hamlet, Minh Thanh commune, Son Duong district.|||Public Security Office historical site: In April 1947, the Central Public Security Office moved from Phu Tho to "Mr. Nha's house", Dong Don hamlet, Minh Thanh commune. This was the first and longest驻扎 location of the Central Public Security Office during the resistance war against France.|||Nha Thong Tin historical site: Located in Moi village, Minh Thanh commune, Son Duong district in 1951.|||News, poems, and revolutionary songs were broadcast on the radio, reflecting the spiritual life and war situation of the country and promoting the resistance policy of the Party and Government to the people.|||The Ministry of Justice historical site: from late 1949 to September 1950, the Ministry of Justice was located and worked in Moi village, Minh Thanh commune, Son Duong district.|||Kim Quan historical site cluster, Khuon Dien hamlet, Kim Quan commune, Yen Son district includes: historical sites of Ho Chi Minh's living and working hut and safe tunnel; safe tunnel of the Government; safe tunnel of the Party Central Committee; historical site of the Party Central Committee's office.|||In addition, the historical site is now the venue for many cultural activities of the ethnic communities, where many artifacts related to the revolutionary activities of President Ho Chi Minh and the Central Committee are preserved during the pre-uprising period and the resistance against the French colonial period...|||Due to the historical, cultural, and scientific significance of this site, the Prime Minister has designated the Tan Trao Historical Site (in Son Duong and Yen Son districts, Tuyen Quang province) as a special national monument (Decision No. 548/QD-TTg, dated May 10, 2012).

title: Ha Tien Scenic Land
description: Location: Ha Tien is a border town, Kien Giang province, 90km from Rach Gia city by road. Characteristics: Ha Tien is a convergence of many scenic spots, with pristine natural beauty: caves, mysterious grottos, many rocky islands; rivers, lakes, pagodas, tombs and many beautiful beaches.|||Ha Tien town was formed nearly 300 years ago, associated with the Mac family.|||Poetic Dong Ho|||The bustling and poetic Ha Tien town lies between the mountains of Kim Du, Lang (Binh San), Ngu Ho and Dong Ho. To admire the whole scene of Ha Tien, it's best to climb to the top of To Chau mountain, a small and charming hill in front of the town.|||From the top, visitors can admire the Dong Ho landscape, a 3km-long and 2km-wide lake, at the mouth of Giang Thanh river. Dong Ho is most beautiful on moonlit nights, hence the name "Dong Ho an nguyet" or Dong Ho reflecting the moon.|||Near To Chau mountain, there was once a small island called Tieu Kim Du, now attached to the foot of this mountain. Facing Tieu Kim Du is Dai Kim Du, near Ha Tien market, named "Kim Du lan dao" or the island that blocks the wind and waves.|||Mac family's tomb|||From Kim Du, going west for a few kilometers, you'll reach Lang mountain, also known as Binh San. The Mac family named it "Binh san diep thuý". On Lang mountain, there are over 40 tombs, with stone steles. Mac Cuu's tomb is the most impressive, occupying the highest position.|||From the Mac family's tombs, visitors can visit Phu Dung pagoda nearby. The pagoda was built by Mac Thien Tich for his wife to practice Buddhism.|||Strange and wondrous rocks|||From Ha Tien market, going towards the border for about 3km, you'll reach Thach Dong. This rocky cave is 98m high, shaped like a British royal guard's hat, both beautiful and exotic.|||Going 2km further, you'll reach Da Dung mountain, a limestone peak 83m high, with a flat top and many caves filled with sparkling stalactites, like jade. The Mac family named it "Chau nham lac lo" or the mountain of jade, where birds often rest.|||Along the coast, 4km from the town, lies Mui Nai, a 100m-high cape with a 19th-century lighthouse. From afar, Mui Nai juts out to sea, resembling a deer's head gazing at the waves. The most famous and beautiful spot is Hon Phu Tu, a symbol of Ha Tien's poetic and charming landscape. Hon Phu Tu consists of two rocky pillars, one large, one small, emerging from the sea, like a father and child embracing each other, weathering the elements for millions of years in the clear blue waters... A truly fascinating and impressive destination for visitors to Ha Tien.

title: Phung Hiep Floating Market
description: Location: Phung Hiep Floating Market is located in Nga Bay town, Hau Giang province, where the market takes place at the Phung Hiep seven-way intersection. Characteristics: The floating market on the river has a diverse range of goods.|||The vast Phung Hiep seven-way floating market. Here, the river's surface is vast, branching out in seven directions. From all directions, boats gather here. The floating market has everything that a traditional market has, from needles and threads to clothes, food, and meat, as well as countless types of fruits. From the floating market, visitors can dock and visit the Snake Market. The Snake Market in Phung Hiep is well-known to international tourists. Visitors can drink snake wine and watch daring snake dance performances. The Phung Hiep market is always stocked with snakes, turtles, birds, squirrels, and monitor lizards for tourists.

title: Cu Lao An Binh and Binh Hoa Phuoc
description: Location: Cu Lao An Binh and Binh Hoa Phuoc are located in the middle of the Tien River, opposite Vinh Long town. The island includes four communes: An Binh, Binh Hoa Phuoc, Hoa Ninh, and Dong Phu, belonging to Long Ho district, Vinh Long province. Characteristics: The island is about 60km2, with fertile land and abundant water, and is known for its fruit trees such as rambutan, mango, longan, durian, and sapodilla.|||Tourist attractions on the island include:|||Mr. Sau Giao's Bonsai garden in Binh Thuan hamlet, Hoa Ninh commune, featuring hundreds of ornamental plants.|||Ong Muoi Day's stilt house: a wooden stilt house on Ninh Hoa canal, with a garden of longan, grapefruit, and sapodilla behind it.|||Ong Hai Hoang's old house, built in French architecture, with a large yard and a garden of rambutan and longan behind it.|||Other specialty fruit gardens include Mr. Chin Hoan's rambutan garden, Mr. Chin Can's rambutan garden, Mr. Tam Ho's longan garden, and many other fruit gardens.|||A grapefruit garden on My Hoa island, Binh Minh district, 30km from Vinh Long, specializing in 'nam roi' grapefruit, a famous variety in the Mekong Delta.

title: Hang Gon Ancient Tomb
description: Location: Hang Gon Ancient Tomb is 250m above sea level, west of Provincial Road 2 (from Long Khanh to Ba Ria), 80km from Bien Hoa city, in Hang Gon commune, Long Khanh town, Dong Nai province. Characteristics: Hang Gon Ancient Tomb is a ranked cultural relic, typical of the ancient culture that appeared about 2,500 years ago and is the largest in Vietnam still preserved today.|||Discovered in 1927 by French engineer Bouchot J. while opening Provincial Road 2 connecting Long Khanh and Ba Ria.|||The tomb has an architecture consisting of two rows of stone pillars surrounding a tomb chamber. There are 10 stone pillars, 2.5-3m high. The tomb chamber is a rectangular box, 4.2 x 2.7m in size and 1.6m high. The ancient tomb is notable for being made of granite slabs weighing tons, with the tomb lid estimated to be around 10 tons. The large, flat stone slabs are arranged symmetrically and precisely, demonstrating the civilization of ancient people. This tomb is one of the typical relics of its kind in Southeast Asia.|||Since 1992, Hang Gon Ancient Tomb has been restored and surrounded by a protective wall, with tiles around the tomb chamber to prevent erosion and many trees planted around it.

title: Cat Tien National Park
description: Location: Cat Tien is located in a bend of the Dong Nai River, within the territory of three provinces: Dong Nai, Binh Phuoc, and Lam Dong.|||Legend has it that this was where a fairy often descended to enjoy the cool waters, hence the name "Nam Cat Tien". This is a valuable archaeological site with significant cultural, historical, and religious importance, helping to confirm the existence and origins of a forgotten kingdom over 1,300 years ago.|||Cat Tien National Park has a total area of 70,548ha, including 39,108ha in Dong Nai, 26,969ha in Lam Dong province, and 4,469ha in Binh Phuoc province.|||The headquarters of Cat Tien National Park is located in Tan Phu district, Dong Nai.|||The garden has diverse natural scenery: hills, riverside areas, large flat plains, and sloping streams. In the rainy season, gentle streams become waterfalls, with water pouring white over large rocky slopes. Many sections of the waterfall twist and turn, creating wide yellow sandy areas like natural beaches.|||Cat Tien not only has a spectacular landscape, it is also located in the transition zone between the mountainous and plain climate, so it has a unique climate. The terrain is surrounded by rivers and streams, making the old forest preserved and becoming a gathering place for most of the forest types in the southern region. This is a typical primeval forest representing the lowland tropical wet forest ecosystem. The forest has many ancient trees such as Lagerstroemia, red wood. The flora has more than 1,362 species of higher plants, over 440 species of valuable timber trees, hundreds of medicinal plants, 133 species of orchids...|||There are 62 species of mammals and 121 species of birds, including rare species such as the red junglefowl, white-shouldered ibis, one-horned rhinoceros, elephants...|||Archaeologists have discovered a shrine of the Pham Nam culture on the top of A1 hill (Quang Ngai commune, Cat Tien district, Lam Dong province) at the source of the Dong Nai river. The shrine was built with rough bricks, stone pedestals, door frames, and pillars made of green granite with intricate carvings.|||The site includes Linga made of gold or gold plated with silver, a 2.1m high Linga-Yoni with a diameter of 0.7m made of polished green stone, one of the largest in Southeast Asia. More than a hundred gold pieces were also found, featuring scenes of life at that time: dancing girls, warriors, elephants, bulls, lotus flowers...|||Cat Tien National Park is about 150km from Ho Chi Minh City along Highway 20.|||Cat Tien is an attractive ecological and cultural tourist destination in the Southeast region with various types of tourism such as hiking, bird and wildlife watching, camping, boating, adventure tourism...|||In the middle of the wide river, there are islands that stretch along the watercourse. On the islands, ancient trees grow among vast grasslands, making ideal campsites for nighttime camping and bonfires. Along the riverbank, to the left of the main road lies a diverse range of old-growth forests with precious tree species such as gõ, giáng hương, trắc, cẩm lai, and gụ. To the right of the forest road is Thác Trời, the most fascinating waterfall in Cat Tien. Continuing through the forest and across deep valleys brings you to Bau Sau, the largest water body in the heart of Cat Tien National Park. The lake is home to various fish species, including freshwater crocodiles. The lake's shores are a haven for large flocks of birds like peacocks, pheasants, junglefowl, cranes, ducks, and more.

title: Quan Ba Twin Mountains
description: About 40km north of Ha Giang city, visitors come across the stunning Quan Ba Twin Mountains (also known as the Twin Mountains of the Fairy Women) along Highway 4C, in Tam Son town, Quan Ba district. The two mountains, shaped like rounded breasts, have stood for millions of years, creating a unique landscape amidst the rolling hills and terraced fields of northwest Vietnam. Each season brings a new charm: spring with blooming flowers, summer with lush green rice fields, autumn with golden ripe rice, and the pink hue of buckwheat flowers. The ideal times to visit are January to March and August to September. At the Quan Ba Heaven Gate, 1,500m above sea level, visitors can take in the breathtaking view of Tam Son town and the mystical Quan Ba Twin Mountains.|||The Quan Ba Twin Mountains are not only a natural wonder but also a testament to a touching legend about love and motherly devotion, tied to the formation of this unique mountain. The legend tells the story of a H'mong man with a talent for playing the mouth harp, who captivated a fairy named Hoa Dao. They fell in love and had a child, but their happiness was short-lived as the Jade Emperor discovered their union and ordered Hoa Dao to return. Before leaving, she left behind two milk-filled breasts that turned into the twin mountains.|||Tears from Hoa Dao formed the Mien River, which flows gently through the rocky terrain. It is said that the region's pleasant climate and fertile land, ideal for growing various fruits and crops, are thanks to the fairy's milk.|||The Quan Ba Twin Mountains offer a unique and memorable experience for travelers exploring Ha Giang.

title: Dong Van Karst Plateau Geopark
description: Location: Spans across 4 districts in Ha Giang province, including: Quan Ba, Yen Minh, Meo Vac, Dong Van.|||Key features: Dong Van Karst Plateau is Vietnam's first geopark recognized by GGN as a member of the Global Geoparks Network.|||From Ha Giang city, tourists travel along Highway 4C for about 43km to reach Quan Ba. Continuing on this highway through the challenging Can Ty pass, through vast pine forests, and along winding roads that twist like silk, tourists will successively arrive at Yen Minh, Dong Van, and Meo Vac to explore the stone plateau.|||Located at an average height of 1,000 - 1,600m above sea level, covering nearly 2,350km², Dong Van plateau is one of the country's special limestone areas, containing typical marks on the Earth's crust development history.|||Up to 80% of Dong Van's area is limestone, formed under different environmental conditions and development stages.|||According to a survey by scientists at the Institute of Geology and Mineral Resources, the Dong Van rocky plateau has gone through all stages of the Earth's development, from the Paleozoic, Mesozoic to Cenozoic with 13 geological formations, including Chang Pung, Lut Xia, Si Ka, Bac Bun, Mia Le, Si Phai, Toc Tat, Lung Nam, Bac Son, Dong Dang, Hong Ngai, Song Hien, and Lan Pang, with Chang Pung being the oldest formation, dating back around 540 million years.||||||To date, scientists have identified 139 geological heritage manifestations in Dong Van, including 15 international, 68 national, and 56 local geological heritages.|||In the sedimentary rocks of different ages in Dong Van, paleontologists have discovered many fossils belonging to 19 groups. These fossils have helped scientists complete the picture of the geological history of the Dong Van plateau and the geology of the northeastern Vietnam - southern China region.|||The Dong Van plateau has diverse geology and a changing climate, resulting in a varied karst landscape with "stone gardens" and "stone forests". For example, the Khau Vai stone garden in Meo Vac has stone peaks resembling flowers, while the Lung Pu stone garden has stone formations shaped like coiled dragons. The Van Chai stone garden has rounded stone slabs stacked together, resembling seals resting on a beach. However, the most common feature is the pyramid-shaped mountains with sharp peaks and steep slopes, creating a majestic landscape. The plateau also features a system of caves, such as the Rong cave in Sang Tung, Dong Van, the Kho My cave in Tung Vai, Quan Ba, and the En cave in Van Chai, Dong Van, which are fascinating tourist attractions.|||Dong Van Plateau is considered by scientists to be a unique and diverse geo-ecosystem. The primary forest here is relatively intact, with many precious trees, forest products, and medicinal plants such as nghien, red pine, brown-streaked deodar, pine tre la ngan, and royal cypress.|||Especially on the rocky desert of Dong Van Plateau, there are over 40 species of orchids, typically lady slipper orchids. Dong Van Plateau is also home to over 50 species of wild animals, birds, and reptiles such as serow, hatchetfaced monkey, deer, wild boar, civet, squirrel, jungle fowl, thrush, and other birds, creating a natural and vibrant beauty of the rocky plateau.|||Besides geological and landscape values, Dong Van plateau has rich cultural values of 17 ethnic minorities such as Mong, Dao, Lo Lo, Tay, Nung. People here live intertwined with rocks: they clear rocks to build houses and farm; dig rocks to find fresh water. Rocks are used to build fences around villages, retain water and soil for terraced fields, and build fortresses to protect the country's border. Here, you see jagged rocks below and a gray rock landscape above. Yet, amidst the gray rocks, there's green corn and yellow rice. Corn grows on rocks, clinging to them to produce cobs.|||The highland markets like Pho Bang, Dong Van, Lung Cu, and Sa Pin, along with ethnic customs and festivals, have captivated many visitors.|||The best time to visit Dong Van is in the spring, when mustard flowers bloom yellow at the foot of the mountains, and peach blossoms redden the old tile roofs. From the deep valleys, the sound of Mong flutes calls out, awakening pear and plum blossoms to bloom white across the forest. The rolling hills of rocky mountains and endless stone fields, normally gray and cold, are now vibrant with the fresh colors of spring. Everything blends together, forming a beautiful picture at the northernmost tip of Vietnam.|||On October 3, 2010, in Lesvos (Greece), the Global Geoparks Network (GGN) Advisory Council officially recognized Dong Van Karst Plateau as a member of the Global Geoparks Network, based on its outstanding values in: landscape; paleontology and stratigraphy; geological and geomorphological history; and the rich cultural traditions of the local community.|||

title: Phu Minh Pagoda
description: Location: Phu Minh Pagoda is located in Tuc Mac village, Loc Vuong commune, outside Nam Dinh city, about 94 km from Hanoi, 4 km northwest of Nam Dinh city center. Characteristics: This is a place of worship for high-ranking officials and nobles of the Tran Dynasty, arranged in an inner-outer style and clearly showing the harmony of the three religions Confucianism-Buddhism-Taoism.|||The pagoda was originally built during the Ly Dynasty and expanded by the Tran Dynasty in 1262.|||Inside the pagoda, there is a Thuy Ta house, a lotus pond, and many ancient trees. In front of the pagoda, there is a bronze urn weighing over 7 tons and a large bell with the inscription "Phu Minh dinh tu". The pagoda once had a large cauldron in front (Phu Minh cauldron), one of the "Four Treasures of An Nam", but it is no longer there. The pagoda has a statue of Tran Nhan Tong entering Nirvana, statues of Truc Lam Tam To (Tran Nhan Tong, Phap Loa, Huyen Quang) and nearly 60 other Buddha and Saint statues, all gilded and beautifully decorated. After many renovations, the pagoda's scale has been reduced compared to before. However, many Tran Dynasty architectural elements remain: 96 stone pedestals carved with lotus flowers, many stone pillars, and two pairs of stone dragons in front of the worship hall.|||Notably, there is a tower built in front of the worship hall in 1305, a 13-tiered lotus-shaped tower, 21 meters high. The base and first tier are made of finely decorated blue stone, while the upper tiers are made of brick, topped with a stone finial. The tower is cone-shaped, with a square base, each side 5.2 meters long. The tower's weight is about 700 tons on a small area of 30m² in a low-lying area, yet it has stood firm for 7 centuries.

title: Xuan Thuy National Park
description: Location: Giao Thien commune, Giao Thuy district, Nam Dinh province Characteristics: Xuan Thuy National Park is an interesting eco-tourism destination for those who like to learn about the life of migratory birds and live with wild nature.|||Xuan Thuy National Park, with a total area of 12,000 ha in the Red River Delta, is mostly located in Giao Thien commune, Giao Thuy district, Nam Dinh province, stretching across Con Lu, Con Ngan, Con Xanh. It is the first Ramsar site in Vietnam.|||Xuan Thuy is chosen as a stopping point for thousands of migratory birds on their way to the south in late November and back to the north in late February and early March.|||The mangrove forest is home to many species of birds, sea cats, sea foxes, otters... The water is home to various types of shrimp, fish, crabs, snakes, clams, mussels... providing a rich food source for birds. During the mangrove flowering season, the fragrance attracts a swarm of honey bees.|||Visitors to Xuan Thuy can experience the vast space of land, sky, and water; breathe fresh air, and watch flocks of birds: cranes, storks, pelicans, geese, ducks, and many other species busily foraging or flying.|||Xuan Thuy is about 160km from Hanoi, an interesting eco-tourism destination for those who like to learn about the life of migratory birds and live with wild nature.

title: Ao Chau Lake
description: Location: In Ha Hoa district, 50km from Phu Tho town, 70km from Viet Tri city. Feature: Ao Chau Lake is considered a Ha Long on Phu Tho land. It is a promising tourist potential of the land of King Hung.|||Ao Chau Lake is located in Ha Hoa town and Y Son, Am Ha and Phu Khanh communes, Ha Hoa district. Visitors can travel by road, rail or water to Ao Chau conveniently. By rail, Ao Chau is on the Hanoi - Lao Cai line and will be the future Asian railway, connecting countries in the region with Van Nam province, China. By road, this scenic spot is on National Highway 2 - the most important road connecting Hanoi capital with the Northwest provinces. By water, many large rivers flow through such as the Red River, Da River, Lo River...|||Ao Chau has a water surface area of about 2km2 and has about 100 large and small islands covered with dense and rich vegetation, the highest peak is 177m above sea level, with 99 waterways winding into the mountains. Notably, the water level in the lake is always about 3m deep, some places are up to 35m deep and never dry. Thanks to this, the water surface of Ao Chau is clear, not polluted and has many aquatic animals: turtles, golden turtles, soft-shell turtles... In addition, local people also grow many fruit trees such as jackfruit, pomelo, longan, lychee... making Ao Chau more attractive.|||Ao Chau has very favorable conditions to develop into an eco-tourism area with tourism types such as resort, boating, fishing, mountain climbing..., meeting the needs of domestic and foreign tourists, especially Chinese tourists. Along with this tourist area, tourist resources in other localities such as traditional festivals, cultural and historical relics, the cave system of Xuan Son National Park, Ao Gioi - Suoi Tien, Thanh Thuy hot spring resort, cultural activities of ethnic minorities in Thanh Son, Yen Lap... will create a tourist triangle with different flavors and diverse tourism types.|||Ao Chau tourist area is becoming an attractive eco-tourism destination, promoting the development of a region in terms of economy, culture and society. In addition, the formation and development of this tourist area will also promote the development of traditional craft villages, production industries, consumption of goods, especially local export of many goods, souvenirs as well as other services.

title: Au Co National Mother Temple
description: Location: The temple is built on Oc Son mountain, also known as Van mountain, 147m above sea level. It is within the Hung Temple relic area, Hy Cuong commune, Lam Thao district, Phu Tho province. Features: The Au Co National Mother Temple is designed based on a unique architectural style bearing the mark of Dong Son culture. The temple worships Mother Au Co, a legendary and sacred mother who pioneered the country's expansion.|||The overall architecture includes: Ta Vu house, Huu Vu house, stele house, pillar, four pillars, triple gate, reception house, ritual house, yard, garden, staircase system, and parking lot.|||The path from the foot of the mountain to the temple gate has 553 stone steps, with a rest house along the way. The triple gate is 5.8m high with three entrances, the main entrance being 2.2m high, with curved roof tiles and carved motifs simulating Lac birds. The highlight of the temple's front is the stele made of stone, with one side engraved with Nom characters and the other with Vietnamese language recording the construction period with contributions from compatriots nationwide.|||The temple is built in traditional architecture with wooden columns, frames, and walls; the roof is tiled with curved tiles, and the walls are made of Bat Trieu bricks.|||The main temple area includes a main worship hall and two side houses, Ta Vu and Huu Vu, in a 'dinh' character-shaped architecture. The railing is carved with motifs of Lac birds and folk cultural activities during the Dong Son period. The interior includes a statue of Mother Au Co and two statues of Lac Hou and Lac Tuong cast in bronze, weighing about 2 tons. The statue of Mother Au Co is based on the statue worshiped at Au Co Temple in Hien Luong commune (Ha Hoa district - Phu Tho), with some adjustments.|||The materials used are carefully selected and of high quality. The incense tables, altars, couplets, and bell stands are made of precious wood and gilded. The two side houses have two reliefs depicting 50 children following their father to the sea and 50 children following their mother to the mountain, made of copper.|||Due to its location on a high mountain with a large elevation difference, the garden and yard are built quite elaborately, with three layers of stone surrounding the main temple: an inner layer of reinforced concrete, a middle layer of stone, and an outer layer of stone from Son Vi village, Thanh Dinh commune, Lam Thao district (Phu Tho).|||The project used over 8,000m³ of stone, 5,300 tons of sand and gravel, 68,000 tons of cement, and 250m³ of lim wood.|||The Au Co National Mother Temple was completed during the Hung Temple festival - National holiday in 2005.

title: Xuan Son National Park
description: Located at the end of the Hoang Lien Son range, Xuan Son National Park is in Xuan Son commune, Thanh Son district, Phu Tho province. With a total area of 15,048 ha and a buffer zone of 18,639 ha, of which 9,099 ha is a strict protection zone, Xuan Son is the only national park with primary limestone forest (2,432 ha).|||Xuan Son has high ecological and biological diversity, with diverse terrain that creates varied landscapes. Initially, 726 species of high-grade plants were recorded, including re, de, soi, and moc lan. Other notable species include tau muoi, tau la duoi, sao mat quy, cho chi, and nghien.|||The park is home to 365 animal species, 46 of which are listed in Vietnam's Red Book and 18 in the world's Red Book. Notable species include vooc xam, vuon cho, and son duong.|||Xuan Son has many natural wonders, including three peaks above 1,000 m: Voi, Ten, and Can mountains, with hundreds of caves and many waterfalls over 50 m high.|||The park has 16 natural caves formed by weathering and hydrothermal processes, with diverse and beautiful stalactites.|||Dien is a 10 km long cave with a ventilation shaft that creates a cool and fresh atmosphere. The cave's lake has many exotic fish species.|||Xuan Son's climate changes with the four seasons in one day.|||With its great tourism potential, Xuan Son is a popular destination for domestic and foreign tourists.||||||

title: Ly Son Island
