The special feature of this area is that while watching 3D images, the hydraulic system will move in multiple directions according to the content on the screen.|||This movement, combined with the effects of wind, sound, and lighting in the theater, will create a very interesting multi-dimensional experience for viewers.|||In addition, the park features water music performances, laser shows, and daily dolphin and seal circus performances at the 7,000-seat amphitheater|||Bao Son Paradise Park is a project with a strong imprint of Vietnamese culture and ancient architecture combined with modern technology. This project has added to Hanoi a vibrant and attractive cultural destination for the weekend.

title: Van Phuc Silk Village
description: Location: Along the banks of the Nhue River, Van Phuc ward, Ha Dong district, Hanoi, about 10km from the city center.|||Characteristics: Van Phuc is the most famous and oldest silk weaving village in Vietnam.|||Legend has it that about 1,200 years ago, Lady Lã Thị Nga - wife of General Cao Bien of the Tang Dynasty - accompanied her husband to govern Giao Chau (then the name of Vietnam). While living in Van Phuc, she taught the people how to raise silkworms and weave silk. To commemorate her, the villagers revered her as the tutelary deity of their village, worshiping her at Van Phuc village communal house. They took the 10th day of the 8th lunar month (her birthday) and the 25th day of the 12th lunar month (the day she passed away) as the annual commemoration and ancestor worship days.|||was removed as there was no second sentence, the separator|||was kept in the same position|||Van Phuc silk products are masterpieces of art that achieve perfection. Plain silk is smooth, soft, and luxurious. Embroidered silk has vibrant colors, elegant patterns, and intricate designs. To create these exquisite silk products, artisans follow a complex production process involving several stages: spinning, warping, weaving, dyeing, and drying. The process begins with selecting and processing raw silk threads to ensure they are white, smooth, and even. Only then can the threads be warped and woven using a loom. For plain silk, two types of heddles are used. For embroidered silk, artisans draw patterns on paper before weaving.|||The weaving process involves two people: one weaves, and the other installs patterns. The weaver plays a crucial role, while the other person assists by pulling the heddle. This technique is called double weaving to distinguish it from single weaving for plain silk. Not all silk is dyed; some is left white or given a subtle yellow hue. Some fabrics, like gấm and vóc, are dyed during the thread stage, while others, like lĩnh and the, are dyed after weaving.|||Silk weaving requires not only a complex production process but also creativity and skill from the artisans. The art of decorating silk with patterns is considered a model for the style of creating shapes on thin materials. The artisans have used traditional decorative themes from the national art treasure but with creativity, not stereotyping, to adapt to the weaving material, such as Ngu Phuc (five bats around the character for longevity), Long Van (dragon and cloud), Tho Dinh (incense burner and character for longevity), Quan Ngu Vong Nguyet (herons watching the moon), Hoa Loc (flowers on green shoots)... In general, the patterns woven on silk are symmetrically arranged, with lines that are not complicated but always soft, free, and decisive.|||Van Phuc silk products are diverse in color and rich in variety, including gấm, lụa, the, sa, xuyến, băng quế, lĩnh, đoạn, đũi, sa tanh, and more. Historically, Van Phuc silk was used for national costumes and was particularly popular during the Nguyen dynasty.|||It first appeared on the international market at the Marseilla fair (1931) and was praised by the French for its fine craftsmanship. Since 1990, Van Phuc silk has been exported to many countries, including France, Poland, Switzerland, and Cambodia.|||Now, Van Phuc has become a familiar destination in traditional craft village tours. Visitors can not only buy authentic Ha Dong silk products but also witness the production process by skilled artisans, especially at artisan Trieu Van Mao's workshop, which is the only one with traditional Van silk looms. Van silk is a famous, nearly lost, traditional silk type. It is a thin silk with embossed and debossed patterns. The embossed patterns are shiny, while the debossed ones are only visible when held up to light. Next to the workshop is a showroom with hundreds of silk products in various colors, such as scarves, clothing, handbags, and ties. The Van Phuc silk brand is a source of pride for the locals and helps preserve a part of Vietnamese culture.

title: Ho Chi Minh Museum
description: Located at 3 Ngoc Ha, Ba Dinh district, Hanoi. Exhibits: Preserves artifacts and images reflecting the life and work of President Ho Chi Minh.|||The Ho Chi Minh Museum is located near Ba Dinh Square, behind the President Ho Chi Minh Mausoleum, facing Hung Vuong Street, 260m from Hung Vuong Street. The museum was inaugurated on May 19, 1990, on the 100th anniversary of President Ho Chi Minh's birth. The museum, together with the President Ho Chi Minh Mausoleum and the Presidential Palace Historical Site, forms a complex of architectural, historical, and cultural monuments dedicated to the beloved leader of the Vietnamese people, a prominent figure in the national liberation movement and international communist movement.|||was removed as there was no second sentence to translate, the original had only one sentence.|||This is a 20.5m high building with 4 floors and a total usable area of 10,000m². The structure is designed to resemble a blooming lotus flower, symbolizing the noble and pure qualities of Ho Chi Minh. The Ho Chi Minh Museum has a storage facility that meets all technical requirements, with display floors and exhibition areas. The museum also has a specialized library for research on Ho Chi Minh and a 400-seat auditorium for meetings and screenings of documentaries about Uncle Ho.|||The museum's exhibition area spans nearly 4,000m2, showcasing over 100,000 original artifacts and images that reflect the life and career of President Ho Chi Minh, linked to significant historical events in Vietnam and the world from the late 19th century to the present.|||The exhibition floor consists of three main spaces: a solemn hall, a display of his biography, and an expanded thematic section.||||||The main room (the first room) is the center of the building, solemn and simple. Here is a bronze statue of President Ho Chi Minh standing with his hand raised as if greeting visitors. The statue is 3.5m high, placed on a 60cm high pedestal.|||Behind the statue on the wall are reliefs depicting the historical and cultural traditions of the Vietnamese people.|||To the right of the main hall, we can visit the exhibition on the life of President Ho Chi Minh. The exhibition begins with a wooden relief on a screen, illustrating the artistic theme of the saying by President Ho Chi Minh "The Hung Kings built the nation".|||Symmetrically opposite the main hall is a second screen representing the idea "We, grandchildren and great-grandchildren, must work together to protect the nation".|||The biography section is a unified whole, comprising: the biographical ring and the figurative spatial complexes.|||The biography section displays documents and artifacts reflecting the life and revolutionary career of President Ho Chi Minh, covering 9 main topics:|||Theme 1 (1890-1910) introduces the homeland, family and early life of President Ho Chi Minh.|||Topic 2 (1911-1920) introduces Ho Chi Minh's journey through various countries.|||It covers his life and research process in finding a path to national liberation.|||Topic 3 (1920-1924) introduces the international activities of President Ho Chi Minh in France and the Soviet Union, and his theoretical contributions to the issue of nationality and colonies.|||Topic 4 (1924-1930) introduces the contributions to propagating Marxism-Leninism and the activities of President Ho Chi Minh in preparing the political and organizational ideologies to found the Communist Party of Vietnam.|||This is not present so removed '|||'|||Topic 5 (1930-1945) introduces the activities of President Ho Chi Minh in building and training the Communist Party of Vietnam.|||It covers the founding of the Viet Minh front and the Vietnam Propaganda Liberation Army, and the successful leadership of the August 1945 revolution, establishing the first democratic state in Southeast Asia.|||The topic also highlights the hardships faced by President Ho Chi Minh during his imprisonment in Hong Kong by the British and in Guangxi by the Nationalist Party.|||Topic 6 (1945-1954) introduces the activities of President Ho Chi Minh and the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Vietnam. Through correct and ingenious strategies, they built and consolidated the young government, then led the Vietnamese people to carry out a brave and just resistance war against the French colonial invasion.|||Theme 7 (1954-1969) introduces the activities of President Ho Chi Minh in various fields, including building North Vietnam, fighting for the liberation of the South to unify the country, and building solidarity and cooperation with socialist brother countries and friends worldwide.|||Episode 8 ends with a sorrowful event: the days when the whole country mourned Chairman Ho Chi Minh and the world shared the grief with our people.|||Theme 9, with the idea that Ho Chi Minh's spirit lives on in the people's cause, introduces the revolutionary career of the Vietnamese people following Ho Chi Minh's sacred testament: "drive the Americans out, topple the puppets", liberate the South, unify the country, and reunite the North and South to "unite and strive to build a Vietnam that is peaceful, unified, independent, democratic, and strong".|||Along the biography trail, visitors can also watch 8 historical documentaries introducing vivid images of President Ho Chi Minh's activities.|||has been removed as there was no '|||' in the original description, the sentence has been kept as is for natural translation|||Each section ends with artistic symbols that invite viewers to reflect on the significance of each historical period. These are also key milestones in the life of President Ho Chi Minh and the Vietnamese revolution: discovering the path to save the country in 1920, the birth of the Communist Party in 1930, national independence in 1945, the glorious victory at Dien Bien Phu in 1954, the sorrowful days in 1969, and the liberation of South Vietnam in 1975.|||Thematic spatial complexes are an integral part of the exhibition on biography. In the tour cycle, we encounter 6 thematic spatial complexes: Ho Chi Minh's hometown - Xo Viet Nghe Tinh - Land of Revolution (Pac Bo) - Land of Combat (1945-1954) - Funeral (1969) - Unified Vietnam.|||The display floor also includes expanded topics and sections (referred to as special exhibits) displayed in 8 rooms surrounding the biography section with the following content:|||Room 1: The situation in the world and Vietnam from the mid-19th to the early 20th century|||Room 2: The significance of the great October Revolution and its influence on the Vietnamese revolution|||Chapter 3: The struggle against fascism|||Room 4: The formation and development of the global socialist system.|||Room 5: Vietnam in the struggle for peace, national independence and social progress.|||Room 6: Ho Chi Minh with the world's revolutionary movement|||In addition, there are 2 topical issues:|||Room 7: Ho Chi Minh with the young generation|||Room 8: Vietnam today|||Since its inauguration, the museum has welcomed millions of visitors, both domestic and international, to visit, research, and learn. As a cultural institution, Ho Chi Minh Museum has become a center for research and introduction to the life of a 20th-century great man, a person who devoted his entire life to the cause of national liberation, social liberation, and human liberation; a person complete in thought, morality, and style, living nobly and rich in compassion.

title: Thoai Ngoc Hau Tomb
description: Location: Thoai Ngoc Hau Tomb is located in Vinh Te Commune, Chau Doc City, An Giang Province. Features: Thoai Ngoc Hau Tomb is one of many historical sites at the foot of Sam Mountain. The tomb of Thoai Ngoc Hau, a famous general of the Nguyen dynasty, and his two wives were built in the 1930s. He was born on November 25, 1761, in Dien Phuoc, Quang Nam Province.|||The solemn atmosphere of the tomb evokes a sense of nostalgia for the past and the contributions of the predecessors. The tomb is surrounded by a courtyard. The two wives are buried on either side, with the husband's tomb in the center.|||The tomb complex includes a Long Đình with replicas of the "Thoai Son" and "Vinh Te Son" stele. The site is a testament to the historical significance of Thoai Ngoc Hau, who was instrumental in the exploration and development of An Giang Province. He oversaw the construction of the Thoai Ha and Vinh Te canals, which were remarkable feats of engineering at the time.|||Visitors can pay their respects to Thoai Ngoc Hau and appreciate the historical significance of the site.|||

title: Tay An Pagoda
description: Location: Tay An Pagoda is located in Vinh Te commune, Chau Doc city, An Giang province. Characteristics: Tay An Pagoda has the appearance of Indian temples, with harmonious architecture and natural scenery, creating a majestic beauty. The pagoda is one of the cluster of historical sites at the foot of Sam Mountain.|||Tay An Pagoda (Tay An Co Tu) was built by a Nguyen dynasty official during Minh Mang's reign (1820) - Governor Nguyen Nhat An - following his vow to build a pagoda to worship Buddha at the foot of Sam Mountain if he succeeded in his mission to Cambodia. After the pagoda was built with bamboo, he invited the first monk, Nguyen Van Giac, with the dharma name Hai Tinh, to be the abbot. In 1847, the pagoda invited another monk named Doan Minh Huyen, with the dharma name Phap Tang, to be the abbot. The latter monk was not only a practitioner but also a skilled doctor who effectively treated people's illnesses, so after his passing, the people revered him with the title 'Phat Thay Tay An', which is still used today.|||The pagoda has been repaired many times over the years under the tenure of various abbots. The pagoda's architecture is in the Indian style, using durable materials like brick, tile, and cement. The main hall is 18m high, housing the statue of Sakyamuni Buddha, while the two sides are the bell tower and drum tower. In front of the pagoda are three viewing gates: the middle gate worships the statue of Guanyin, and the two side gates have plaques with 'Tay An Co Tu' written on them. Inside the triple gate is a courtyard with a 16m high flagpole. Under the pagoda's stairs are white and black statues, with two deities carved on the sides, sitting on a crescent moon. The two sides are corridors for male and female devotees. The pagoda follows the Mahayana tradition and houses 11,270 large and small wooden statues. The 15th day of the 1st, 7th, and 10th lunar months are the busiest days for worshippers.

title: Nguroum Ngao Cave
description: Nguroum Ngao Cave is located in the heart of a mountain in Gun village (Dam Thuy commune, Trung Khanh district, Cao Bang province) about 5 km from Ban Gioc waterfall. The cave was discovered in 1921, opened to tourism in 1996 and recognized as a national monument in 1998.|||The cave is called Nguroom Ngao, which means "Tiger Cave" in Tay language. According to legend, the cave was once home to many fierce tigers that preyed on the livestock of local villagers. The villagers eventually caught the tigers and lived in peace.|||Another legend says the roaring sound, similar to that of tigers, was actually caused by the flowing water in the cave, leading to the cave being named Nguroom Ngao.|||Ngườm Ngao is a priceless gift from nature to Cao Bang. The cave is 2144 meters long and has 3 main entrances: Ngườm Ngao, Ngườm Lồm, and Bản Thuôn.|||According to scientists, this limestone cave was formed around 400 million years ago. In the summer, the temperature inside the cave is cool, and in the winter, it's warm.|||Upon entering the cave, the natural scenery with many peculiar limestone formations will astonish visitors. Countless stalactites hang from the high ceilings, and stalagmites rise from the ground, reflecting light in a mystical way. Notably, the limestone here has a different color compared to other local caves due to the calcium mixed with many impurities. The inanimate rocks spark human imagination, allowing it to soar with shapes resembling people, trees, animals, a maiden combing her hair, a lotus bud, a mother's breast...|||The two most attractive spots for tourists to take photos are the upside-down lotus platform and the lonely stone pillar. According to legend, a Buddha sat on a lotus platform meditating but never achieved enlightenment. Feeling disheartened, he turned the lotus platform upside down and turned himself into a stone pillar standing beside it. It is said that if you catch the drops of water that fall from the Buddha's hand and rub them on your face, you will be lucky.|||The deeper you go into the cave, the more enchanting and captivating it becomes. Many narrow passages can only fit one person, or there are sections where stalactites suddenly block the path, requiring you to duck down to pass through. The unique feature that makes Ngườm Ngao a standout destination is the terraced fields formed by the limestone floor being eroded and weathered over millions of years. Sometimes, visitors will come across small streams inside the cave, and the sound of gently flowing water is very pleasant.|||Completely natural, untouched by human hands, making Nguro Ngao Cave even more captivating with its majestic and grand beauty.|||Although Cao Bang province has only developed about 1km for tourists to explore, Nguro Ngao Cave remains a must-visit destination when traveling to Cao Bang.

title: Pac Bo Historical Site
description: Pac Bo is located in Truong Ha commune, Ha Quang district, Cao Bang province, 55km north of Cao Bang city. Pac Bo is a famous revolutionary site where Ho Chi Minh worked and directly led the Vietnamese revolution. The name Pac Bo also means 'mouth of the source'.|||Pac Bo has Coc Bo cave, which Ho Chi Minh chose as his residence after returning to Vietnam (February 8, 1941) to lead the revolution.|||The site includes:|||- Bo Bam cave, Co Rac field, Coc Bo cave|||- Lenin Stream, Marx Mountain.|||- Nam Stream: Where Ho Chi Minh trained cadres and held important meetings with the Central Committee.|||Walking on the rocky shore along the stream, where Ho Chi Minh often sat working and fishing, you'll reach a wooden bridge crossing the Coc Bo stream. This is the source of the Lenin Stream. Pac Bo cave is located on the hillside. Standing outside the cave, you can see on the rocky wall the words written by Ho Chi Minh: 'February 8, 1941', the day he arrived at the cave. The cave is small, humid, and cold, located deep in the mountain.|||About 1,000m from the cave, there's a small hut on the hillside of Khuoi Nam. Here, Ho Chi Minh convened the 8th Party Congress, making resolutions to prepare for the armed uprising, establishing the Viet Minh and the revolutionary zone. A few steps from the hut is the Vietnam-China border, marked by pillar 108. Here, Ho Chi Minh hugged and kissed the soil of his homeland after years of exile, at the age of 50, with his hair graying.|||Visiting this historical site, tourists gain a deeper understanding of Ho Chi Minh's great life, and in their memory, the optimistic revolutionary poetry of 'Sáng ra bờ suối, tối vào hang|||Cháo bẹ rau măng vẫn sẵn sàng|||Bàn đá chông chênh dịch sử Ðảng|||Cuộc đời cách mạng thật là sang' will live on.

title: Buon Jun Village
description: Located in Lien Son town Lak district Dak Lak province. Features: Sitting by the serene and picturesque Lak Lake Buon Jun embodies the pristine and gentle beauty of the Central Highlands villages preserving traditional characteristics passed down through generations.|||Visiting Buon Jun seeing the traditional stilt houses of the Central Highlands people nestled under green trees and watching the diligent young women weaving on looms visitors will feel as if they are traveling back in time to a tranquil poetic scene steeped in legend once etched into ancient epic songs.|||Despite historical upheavals Buon Jun has preserved and promoted traditional cultural features and ancestral customs. The lifestyle and daily activities of the local people maintain a unique characteristic shaped over centuries.|||Visiting Buon Jun travelers can ride elephants to admire the mountains villages and the vast gently lapping waters of the lake. If staying overnight in Buon Jun what better than sitting by the stilt house door watching the moonlit nights as beautiful as fairy tales with the cool breeze from Lak Lake brushing the skin. Gathering around the communal rice wine with the elders visitors can hear legends and myths of this land in its ancient days. The intoxicating and euphoric feeling from the rice wine will lull visitors into a gentle sleep without noticing.|||Another enjoyable activity here is rowing on Lak Lake enjoying bamboo tube rice and local specialties like fish eel snails and other rustic dishes full of highland flavors.|||If visiting Buon Jun during the festival season travelers can immerse themselves in the lively atmosphere with the sounds of gongs and traditional songs full of lyricism and romance.|||Buon Jun is an impressive tourist destination for those wishing to explore the cultural beauty of the traditional Central Highlands villages. Invite travelers to visit Buon Jun as many interesting experiences await.

title: Hoa Lo Prison Historical Site
description: Located in the traditional ceramic village of Vinh Khanh, Vinh Xuong commune, Thu Xuong district, Hanoi, where the French colonialists chose to build Hoa Lo Prison in 1896.|||Hoa Lo Prison, known in French as 'Maison Centrale', meaning 'Central Prison' or 'Hanoi Prison'. This was where the French colonialists imprisoned and tortured both the spirit and body of patriotic fighters and revolutionaries. Many Party and State leaders were once held here.|||Today, Hoa Lo Prison is at No. 1 Hoa Lo Street, Hoan Kiem District, Hanoi. It's a central area so transportation is convenient. The initial construction area of Hoa Lo Prison was about 12000 square meters, the largest and most fortified prison in Indochina. Now, it is over 2400 square meters, preserved for tourism and those wanting to see a colonial prison.|||- Areas A and B: held prisoners under investigation, unimportant prisoners or those violating prison rules.|||- Area C: for French or foreign prisoners.|||- Area D: for prisoners awaiting execution.|||Hoa Lo Prison now displays documents and artifacts showing the brutal torture and harsh lives of Vietnamese political prisoners when held here. You can visit the Memorial to the patriots who sacrificed their lives at Hoa Lo Prison for Vietnam's independence and freedom.|||Hoa Lo Prison is a historical site marking many sorrows and heroes' sacrifices. If visiting Hanoi, spend time here to better understand. Also, visit Quan Su Temple and Hoan Kiem Lake nearby.

title: Tourist Site National History Museum
description: Established under Decision No. 1674/QD-TTg dated September 26 2011 by the Prime Minister of Vietnam on the basis of merging the Vietnam History Museum and the Vietnam Revolution Museum; The National History Museum is a cultural site located in the central area of Hanoi near many sacred historical sites of the capital such as Thap Ru - Ho Goum; The Huc Bridge - Den Ngoc Son - But Thap... The museum preserves displays and introduces Vietnamese history from prehistoric times to the present through an extensive and valuable system of documents and artifacts many of which are National Treasures.|||Vietnam National Museum of History is a public institution under the Ministry of Culture Sports and Tourism leading the system of historical and social museums in Vietnam with functions of scientific research archaeological excavation collection preservation inventory management conservation display promotion of historical documents and artifacts related to Vietnamese history organization of training consulting appraisal evaluation management and service exploitation within the museum s scope. Vietnam National Museum of History has legal entity status with its own seal separate account and independent accounting. International transaction name Vietnam National Museum of History (abbreviated as VNMH)|||The National History Museum currently preserves and manages approximately 200000 historical and cultural artifacts of Vietnam including nearly 110000 documents and artifacts from the Vietnamese history period from prehistory to 1945 which include relics antiques and 19 National Treasures many of which are among the most valuable collections compared to similar museums in the country and region such as archaeological artifacts from the early stone age to the early bronze and iron ages Dong Son culture ancient Vietnamese ceramics bronze items from the Le Nguyen period Champa stone carvings and foreign decorative arts from China Japan India and other Southeast Asian countries The period from the mid 19th century to the present contains over 80000 documents and artifacts related to the history of the Vietnamese revolution the Communist Party of Vietnam Ho Chi Minh and other leading figures of the Communist Party of Vietnam throughout different eras|||The National History Museum maintains 2 permanent exhibition systems at 2 locations: No. 1 Trang Tien - Hanoi displaying Vietnamese history from Prehistoric times to the end of the Nguyen Dynasty (1945); at No. 216 Tran Quang Khai - Hanoi displaying history from mid-19th century to present. With the concern of the Party and the Government of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam, in the near future the National History Museum will be constructed as a modern advanced facility meeting the functions of a modern regional and international scale museum at Tay Ho Tay urban area, Hanoi. This project has been initiated for many years and is currently continuing implementation.||||||The National History Museum is a member of the International Council of Museums (ICOM) and a founding member of the Asian Association of National Museums (ANMA). It regularly exchanges professional experience implements cooperation programs and expands exchanges with nearly 30 museums in the region and internationally. In 2013 the National History Museum hosted and chaired the 4th ANMA Conference (held in Hanoi in October 2013)|||The National History Museum has been honored with many prestigious awards presented by the Party and the State including 1 Ho Chi Minh Order 3 Independence Orders 5 Labor Orders…|||Visiting the National History Museum visitors can experience many fascinating things and gain a deeper understanding of the long cultural history and the brave resilient traditions of struggle in the Vietnamese peoples efforts to build and defend their nation

title: Hong Van Ornamental Plants Village Tourism Site
description: Hong Van Ornamental Plants Village is located to the east of Thuong Tin district about 20 km south of Hanoi's center. Situated in the suburban area and green belt of Hanoi Hong Van embodies the pure peaceful beauty of a rural village near the capital characterized by the agricultural features of the Red River Delta plains.|||Famous for its flower and ornamental plant cultivation since the 1980s with many valuable artistic tree works and a team of skilled young artisans. When visiting Hong Van Ornamental Plants Village tourists can explore unique artistic tree works and interact with local artisans. Additionally tourists can participate in the One Day Artisan experience where they collaborate with artisans to create prune shape and name their own ornamental plant products.|||Tourists can stroll along the Red River embankment enjoying the serene and picturesque scenery. A vast green expanse stretches out with lush green vegetable fields in the distance and vibrant flower villages showcasing over 50 types of premium foreign roses lined by straight rows of ornamental trees along the roadside. There are also farms for animal husbandry and fruit cultivation where visitors can taste local agricultural products from the alluvial plains near the Red River.|||Besides strolling tourists can take electric carts or bicycles around the village to explore the craft village chat with artisans and locals and participate in activities like gardening flower care pruning fishing and folk games. Tourists will experience the friendliness of the rural farmers and immerse themselves in the farming process like real farmers. They can also enjoy local delicacies at food stalls take photos at flower gardens tree rows and scenic spots within the commune and gardens.|||In addition to visiting and enjoying local specialties and interacting with locals during the tour tourists can taste and purchase local products like flowers fruits processed agricultural goods and handicrafts at gardens and shopping centers. Visiting Hong Van Ornamental Plants Village tourists will feel the openness hospitality sincerity and attentiveness of the locals learn skills in flower and ornamental plant crafts and take home products from this land and its people.

title: Bao Son Paradise Park
description: Opened in 2008 with an initial investment of up to 100 million USD Bao Son Paradise Park is a part of the overall project to build and develop the new urban area in An Khanh Hanoi. The new An Khanh urban area will be a highlight of Northern Vietnam in the future with unique architectural structures harmonious feng shui honoring Vietnamese culture and meeting international standards for conditions environment and security.|||Located on a spacious and airy area just 6 km from the National Convention Center along Thang Long Boulevard Bao Son Paradise is the only entertainment area combining both economic and tourism fields harmoniously blending tradition and modernity in the selection of excellence and convergence Bao Son Paradise preserves the beauty of traditional culture is a paradise of culture art technology ecology entertainment and cuisine. The park combines poetic beauty skillfully blending nature and artificial structures ancient and modern architecture. The fresh air here will bring extremely refreshing and peaceful moments for visitors.|||Aiming to become Hanoi's tourism gateway a destination for domestic and international tourists visiting Hanoi to explore survey and study Vietnamese culture and traditions. Bao Son Paradise Park is built as a multifunctional entertainment and leisure site utilizing modern technology. It has become a core business sector and a flagship brand of Bao Son Corporation.

title: Traditional Mother-of-Pearl Inlay and Lacquer Craft Village Tourist Site - Chuyen My
description: Chuyen My Commune Phu Xuyen District has long been famous for traditional mother-of-pearl inlay craft. The commune has 7 villages all of which are recognized as mother-of-pearl inlay lacquer and mother-of-pearl material processing craft villages. The traditional mother-of-pearl inlay craft has and continues to create breakthroughs bringing high economic benefits to the local people.|||Visiting Chuyen My craft village when its production facilities, artisans, and locals are finalizing the final stages of mother-of-pearl inlay and polishing products for display at the Traditional Village Festival honoring Van Tu village's com le tailoring reveals the skill, delicacy, and meticulous craftsmanship of the local artisans.|||Production facilities and shell-inlay artisans are working diligently to create exquisite high-artistic-value works. Mr. Vu Quoc Thuong – Deputy Party Committee Secretary – Chairman of the People's Committee (PCC) of Chuyen My commune stated At the 2019 Traditional Com Le Weaving Village Commendation Festival in Van Tu commune Chuyen My commune had 19 facilities registered to participate in displaying and introducing traditional shell-inlay products. For several days now the facilities and artisans have been actively preparing to bring the most beautiful and distinctive products to the festival.|||According to the temple records of Chuon Ngo village the shell inlay craft here appeared around the 11th century reaching its peak in the 13th century. The current ancestor of the craft venerated in the village is Mr. Truong Cong Thanh a versatile scholar-official under the Ly dynasty (1009 - 1225).|||According to legend, Truong Cong Than was a talented deputy general under King Ly. After repelling the invading forces, he was greatly rewarded by the king. In his later years, he lived a luxurious and refined life, often traveling the mountains and rivers.|||While accidentally going to the stream bank he picked up pieces of shell and snail shells that were brightly colored and very unusual. He then took them home to study tried assembling those materials and created very dynamic pattern details.|||Gradually he pioneered for the local people creating the shell-inlay craft for the residents of Chuon Ngo and the craft village has been widely developed throughout the entire Chuyen My commune today.|||Chuyen My artisans mainly made horizontal scrolls and couplets for temples and ancestral halls decorated details on lacquered wooden beds and tea cabinets or crafted wall paintings inspired by the legends of the Three Kingdoms sets of pine bamboo chrysanthemum plum ...|||Over time and with the trend of integration the local shell-inlay artisans have gradually improved their skills to create more intricate and technically advanced artwork such as landscape scenes portrait carvings…|||The main materials used to create the products are cleaned shells and snail shells that are cut split smoothed and flattened.|||These lifeless shell and snail shell pieces through the hands of inlay artisans are attached to objects and paintings becoming masterpieces of high artistic value.|||As the owner of a shell inlay workshop in Chuon Thuong village, young artisan Vu Ngoc Oanh is always proud to be part of a new generation continuing the traditional craft of his ancestors. According to Mr. Oanh: To create a shell inlay product, the craftsman must go through many steps. Each step requires the craftsman to be very careful and meticulous.|||"To develop the village industry, Chuyen My commune has and is implementing the development of traditional village crafts combined with tourism at the craft village site. Establish an infrastructure upgrading project to serve craft village tourism, better meeting tourism demands; strengthen trade promotion and tourism promotion," said Mr. Vu Quoc Thuong, Chairman of the Chuyen My Commune People's Committee.|||Despite many ups and downs, the shell inlay craft in Chuyen My has been passed down and developed by many generations of people. The number of skilled and experienced artisans and craftsmen in the craft villages is increasing.|||Currently shell-inlay artisans in Chuyen My are gradually improving their skills creating many exquisite high-technical shell and mother-of-pearl products not only famous domestically but also reaching internationally gradually making Chuyen My one of the craft village tourism destinations in Phu Xuyen district.

title: Van Tu Tailoring Village Tourist Site
description: Van Tu is a commune located in the southwest of Phu Xuyen district Hanoi city. Once a lowland rural area where the main occupations were agriculture and animal husbandry today Van Tu commune has become a renowned craft village.|||Van Tu commune has 10 hamlets two of which are the main centers for tailoring suits and jackets Tu Thuan and Chung hamlets. Currently the commune has about 1500 households with approximately 70-80% engaged in tailoring which is the main source of income for Van Tu residents.|||What's special is that tailoring suits and jackets are both the main job for primary workers and additional work for secondary laborers from adults the elderly to children can participate in the production processes of suits and jackets.|||The tailoring trade has spread throughout the commune. Thanks to their diligence and skill building upon the foundations left by their ancestors the traditional tailors of Van Tu have designed and crafted modern products while retaining traditional elements that satisfy even the most discerning customers. Van Tu suits have built a brand and gained trust from domestic and international customers in several countries.

title: Trang Trinh Nguyen Binh Khiem Historical Site
description: The Nguyen Binh Khiem Temple (Top Scholar Temple Trang Trinh Nguyen Binh Khiem Temple) located in Trung Am hamlet Ly Hoc commune Vinh Bao district Hai Phong city is closely associated with the life and career of Nguyen Binh Khiem a Top Scholar of the Mac dynasty. The Nguyen Binh Khiem Temple has a special historical mission serving both as a place to honor the contributions of a historical figure and as a venue for cultural and religious activities of the local people.|||Tran Trinh Nguyen Binh Khiem (also known as Van Dat, Hanh Phu, and Bai Yun Hermit), born in the year Tan Hoi (1491), was from Trung Am village, Vinh Lai district, Hai Duong town (now Trung Am hamlet, Ly Hoc commune, Vinh Bao district, Hai Phong city). In the At Mui year of the Mac Dang Dang era (1535), he became the First Scholar (Trang Nguyen), appointed as Dong Cac Hieu Thu, later promoted to Huu Thi Lang and Dong Cac Dai Hoc Si. He was listed among the top meritorious subjects, granted the title Trinh Tuyen Hau, then promoted to Thượng thư Bộ Lại, Thai Bao, and Trinh Quoc Cong. In 1542, after submitting a petition to execute 18 corrupt officials which was not approved, he resigned and returned to his hometown, built Trung Tan shop, established Bai Yun hermitage as a school, composed poetry, and adopted the name Bai Yun Hermit. The hermitage became a center for training national talents, producing notable figures like Phung Khac Khoan, Luong Huu Khanh, Giap Hai... Although Nguyen Binh Khiem no longer participated in state affairs, the Mac dynasty still respected him, often seeking his advice on major matters. He died on the 28th of November in the At Dau year (17/01/1586), at age 95. His students posthumously honored him as Tuyet Giang Phu Tu.|||Trạng Trinh Nguyen Binh Khiem was a patriotic scholar and a great scholar of Confucian philosophy respected by scholars. Historical records and folk traditions document his ability to predict future events (rhyming predictions). He was also a renowned poet who left over 1000 poems (620 in Chinese characters 153 in Nôm script) including notable collections like "Bach Van Am Poetry Collection" (Chinese characters) and Bach Van National Language Poetry Collection (Nôm script). Nguyen Binh Khiem's poetic works have high artistic value with refined writing styles addressing various aspects of life such as love for homeland and country and satirically criticizing corrupt officials.|||According to some sources, the Nguyen Binh Khiem Temple was built after his death and completed by the end of 1586. According to the Tu Vu Bi Ky... inscription established in the second year of Vinh Huu (1736), currently preserved at the site, the temple was built after his death. By 1735, villagers from Trung Am hamlet, Thuong Am commune, contributed labor and resources to renovate and restore the temple for worship. In 1928, the temple was further renovated with a ding-shaped architectural style, characteristic of the Nguyen period. In 1991, to commemorate the 500th anniversary of Nguyen Binh Khiem's birth, the site was restored, expanded, with a monument, plaza, and half-moon pond constructed, as seen today.|||The Temple of Nguyen Binh Khiem is located in a vast open space facing East with a lake in front to the north are the embankment and Tuyet Giang River to the east faces the vast sea to the south are villages to the west are green rice fields and tobacco fields. The Temple of Nguyen Binh Khiem has a total area of 91500.7m2 (Area I 3137.5m2 Area II 88327.2m2) including the following structures The Temple of Nguyen Binh Khiem the Temple of Ancestral Parents Nguyen Binh Khiem Bich Van Hermitage Trung Tan Pavilion Kinh Thien Pen Tower the tomb of Nguyen Van Dinh plaza and monument.|||1. Nghi Men Nguoi: carved in stone, the tops of the two central pillars are stylized with dang deng fruit; the tops of the two side pillars are carved with a pair of nghê facing inward toward the gate. The lantern-shaped blocks on the pillars are carved with four mythical creatures in the positions of holding scrolls, carrying scrolls, curling scrolls; the pillar bodies are rectangular blocks carved with Chinese couplet verses; the base of the pillars is designed in a narrow waist and wide base style.|||2. Inner Ceremonial Gate: a two-story structure with eight eaves, curved edges on all four sides adorned with dragon and phoenix motifs; gate pillars and body feature carved Chinese couplets and large inscriptions. The outer side has the inscription "Trung Am Tu", the inner side has the inscription "Trinh Quoc Cong".|||3. Ho Thai At and Ho Thai Nhâm: these two lakes are located in front of the Nguyen Binh Khiem Temple. In the middle of the lake is a small island connected to the shore by a blue stone bridge with five spans the bridge's body is carved with soft water wave patterns. On the island is a stone tablet recording the reconstruction of the Nguyen Binh Khiem Temple.|||The temple follows a layout shaped like the character "dinh" with a Front Hall consisting of three bays and two side wings and a Rear Hall with two bays.|||- Main Hall: three bays, the central bay is 3.17m wide, two side bays each 2.80m wide, and two side rooms each 2.10m wide. The load-bearing frame consists of four trusses and 22 ironwood columns. The roof structure features a 'overlapping beam and ridge beam' system. Decorative motifs on the beams and pillars include leaf curling patterns, lotus petal carvings, and an inscription indicating the temple was repaired in 1928 during Emperor Bao Dai's reign. The four corners are carved with hollowed-out dragon motifs in the Nguyen dynasty style of the early 20th century. The two sides of the side trusses are densely and meticulously decorated with themes of dragons combined with clouds, leaf curls, waves, cloud patterns, lotus flowers, water motifs, carp, and dragon-scale patterns.|||- Rear Palace: built with closed eave walls, the load-bearing frame consists of two truss systems, the roof truss and the side truss, both connected with interlocking wooden joints. Decorative patterns on the trusses include two dragons facing the sun, plum trees, lotus branches, turtles, and mythical horses. The second truss system features a variant overlapping bracket system. Within the forbidden palace are the tomb and statue of Nguyen Binh Khiem.|||Construction began in 2010.|||The main layout is in the shape of the character "Cong" and includes: Front Hall, connecting corridors, Rear Hall, two wings (Left/Right Mạc), and South-North gates.|||All structures follow traditional architecture with wooden frameworks using "stacked beams and bracket systems", "stacked beams with hidden columns", "interlocking wooden joints", fish-scale roof tiles, and decorative motifs featuring vines, leaves, and lotus flowers.|||Am Bach Van: was built after Nguyen Binh Khiem resigned and returned to his hometown.|||The old Am served as the residence and school of Tran Trinh. Here he received envoys from the Mac Trinh Nguyen dynasties to consult on military and state affairs.|||Through the ups and downs of history Am Bach Van was damaged and collapsed. In 2004 the Am was restored with a layout in the shape of the character one three bays frame system built on four trusses 24 pillars.|||Decorative motifs include themes such as lotus shaped column heads flipped leaf patterns on beam edges eave edges and stylized dragon leaf patterns on the eaves.|||7. Trung Tan Quan: Built after Nguyen Binh Khiem left the government to return home and teach. In 1742 Vu Phuong De visited Trung Tan Quan and noted: "The old stele remains but the characters are too faded to read." By 1777 La Son Phu Tu Nguyen Thiep visited Trung Am village and wrote a five-character verse stating: "The hermitage and stele are all gone/ The Xuyen Giang River flows silently." Thus between 1742 and 1777 Trung Tan Quan no longer existed. In 2001 Trung Tan Quan was rebuilt near Han Ferry with three bays covering a total area of 905.5 m².|||8. Kinh Thien Pen Tower: total area is 845.5m², legend has it that the tower was built over 400 years ago by students of Nguyen Binh Kiem to praise their teacher's talent as a pillar holding up the sky (Kinh Thien).|||Over time the land eroded and the Kinh Thien Pen Tower collapsed until it was rebuilt during the Nguyen period in a two-story eight-eave style with couplets carved on the tower gates and an empty interior housing an incense tray.|||Nguyen Van Dinh was the father of Nguyen Binh Khiem with the style name Cu Xuyen Xien Sinh who was granted the title Tai Bao Nguyen Quan Cong by King Mac. During his lifetime he taught and studied at the Imperial Academy. Upon his death he was buried at his hometown with the tomb located in the middle of the field at Trung Am village behind the current historical site.|||10. Square, monument, and relief sculpture.|||The statue of Scholar-Official Nguyen Binh Khiem is carved from granite, 5.7m tall, 8.5 tons heavy, in a seated posture with the right hand holding a pen, the left hand holding a book, and wearing scholar's attire. Two relief panels on each side, each about 5m high and over 20m long. The right panel depicts the life and career of Nguyen Binh Khiem; the left panel depicts historical phases of the locality (from the French colonial invasion to the present). In front of the Nguyen Binh Khiem monument is a large plaza, which is the site for annual festivals of the historical site and also the area for major events of Hai Phong city, mainly related to the education sector.|||Đền thờ Nguyễn Bỉnh Khiêm còn lưu giữ được một số cổ vật, có giá trị, niên đại từ thế kỷ XVII đến đầu thế kỷ XX, như: bản chúc, bát bửu, long ngai, bài vị, câu đối, đại tự.., trong đó đáng chú ý là Bia đá “Từ vũ bi kí...” thời Lê Trung Hưng, năm Vĩnh Hựu thứ hai (1736) đã bị mờ khá nhiều chữ, không đọc được toàn văn, nội dung bia nhắc đến việc dựng lại đền Nguyễn Bỉnh Khiêm vào năm 1736; Bát hương gốm men vàng nâu (thế kỷ XVIII)... Ngoài ra, trong đền còn lưu giữ một tảng đá xanh hình khối chữ nhật, khắc 3 chữ Hán “Trường Xuân Kiều” (Cầu Trường Xuân), tương truyền do đích thân Nguyễn Bỉnh Khiêm viết khi khuyến khích nhân dân địa phương xây dựng cầu.|||Nguyen Binh Khiem Temple preserves distinctive intangible cultural values reflecting its significant role in the consciousness and spiritual life of the local people. The Trang Temple Festival is held from 27–29 November (lunar calendar) annually with rituals like Moc Du Ceremony Van Ruoc Ceremony Cao Yet Ceremony and cultural activities from localities including wrestling chess lion dances boat racing land fireworks swing games water puppetry and shadow puppetry. Additionally Hai Phong City organizes a Ceremony to Honor Outstanding Students and Students on the first day of the new academic year at Nguyen Binh Khiems Temple creating a new cultural tradition that emphasizes respecting teachers and educators while inspiring youth to pursue academic and career success through the exemplary legacy of Nguyen Binh Khiem|||With its exceptionally significant values the historical site of Nguyen Binh Kiem Temple (Vinh Bao district Hai Phong city) has been classified as a national special historical site by the Prime Minister (by Decision No. 2367/QD-TTg dated December 23 2015 ).

title: Tien Lang Hot Mineral Spring Eco-Tourism Area
description: Tien Lang Hot Spring is an excellent place where you can relax and take care of your health. This place is always worth visiting as a must-see destination in Hai Phong tours.|||For every resident of Hai Phong, Thien Lang hot spring has become a familiar name for many years. It is a famous ecological, leisure, health, and beauty resort located in Phac Xuyen hamlet, Bach Dang commune, Thien Lang district, about 20 km from the center of Hai Phong city.|||Tien Lang Hot Spring Tourist Area is built on a land area of about 10ha divided into different zones.|||Everything is arranged and organized harmoniously delicately blending with the fresh poetic and romantic natural scenery making anyone who visits fall in love instantly.|||The hot spring water at Tien Lang mineral spring is naturally exploited from a depth of approximately 850 meters underground. The average temperature of the water here remains consistently stable at 54°C making it very suitable for bathing and relaxation. Moreover the hot spring water at Tien Lang contains many natural mineral components beneficial to health and has been recognized as one of the five most precious and best mineral springs in Vietnam currently.|||The hot mineral spring in Tien Lang district was discovered and explored by Russian experts in 1965. However it was not until 1982 that this water source was officially put into use for tourism development.|||Tien Lang Hot Spring Tourist Area was built in 2004 and invested by Phu Vinh Limited Liability Company. After months of construction an area of nearly 10 hectares with a beautiful lush green garden interspersed with modern architectural structures was completed. Each year the area welcomes hundreds of thousands of visitors for relaxation leisure and health care.|||The first experience that anyone must try when visiting Tien Lang hot spring is immersing themselves in the clear and extremely warm water.|||According to experts the hot water here contains mineral salts that are very beneficial for human health especially for those with bone or cardiovascular diseases.|||In addition to hot spring baths visitors can also experience many other services such as mud baths swimming pools with hydraulic massage systems steam rooms equipped with modern imported equipment from France facial and body massages or acupuncture.||||||With a 3-star standard accommodation system equipped with full modern amenities Tien Lang Hot Spring Tourist Area will certainly meet all the dining accommodation and relaxation needs of every tourist.|||When it comes to tourism and relaxation cuisine is certainly not to be missed.|||The restaurant area within the Tien Lang Hot Spring Area is a great place to enjoy delicious local specialties.|||All dishes are prepared by professional chefs with extensive knowledge of regional cuisines promising to offer visitors meals that are not only flavorful but also visually appealing.

title: Garden Estate of Lương Quan - Nguyet Bieu
description: Lương Quan - Nguyet Bieu Garden Estate in Thuy Bieu Ward, Hue City, Thua Thien Hue Province was recognized as a provincial tourist site by Decision No. 2791/QD-UBND issued on December 21 2018.|||With convenient transportation accessible by road and water, only 7km from Hue City center along the riverbank leads to the lush and picturesque Lương Quan - Nguyet Bieu garden estate.|||Thuy Bieu Ward today is a merger of two ancient villages Nguyet Bieu and Lương Quan. Key features include traditional Hue garden houses like Mr Ho Xuan Dang's garden, Mr Dang Van Thanh's garden, Mr Ho Xuan Doanh's garden, Mr Ton That Phuong's garden, Hue Ecologde, Hue Riverside Boutique Resort & Spa. These sites offer tourists accommodation, wellness services, local cuisine experiences with food safety standards, and display areas for handicrafts and specialties like incense, printed cakes, wood carvings, bronze casting at Hue Ecolodge; Thuy Bieu Homestay offers Thanh tra marmalade and Thanh tra wine. The Lương Quan - Nguyet Bieu area also contains notable Nguyen Dynasty cultural heritage sites unique to Southeast Asia like Ho Quyen and Dien Voi Re, plus scenic attractions Vang Canh Hill and Doan Bau Ho, and cultural village facilities like Lương Quan Temple, Nguyet Bieu Temple, ancestral houses etc.|||Though located in Hue, this place retains a peaceful rural atmosphere with neat orderly gardens connected without fences guiding visitors toward nature. Mentioning Thuy Bieu cannot overlook its famous specialty Thanh tra fruit - once royal tribute - cultivated by the gentle Huong River, producing small but uniquely sweet juicy fruits recognized as one of Thua Thien Hue's Asian record-breaking specialties.|||Visit Lương Quan - Nguyet Bieu Garden Estate once, ride bicycles through tree-lined roads, and visit gardens to:|||...When walking through village roads,|||When entering each alley,|||Or standing in the garden,|||Smelling the fragrant breeze.

title: Thanh Toàn Tiled Bridge
description: Thanh Toàn Tiled Bridge is located approximately 8 km southeast of Hue city in Thuy Thanh commune, Huong Thuy district, Thua Thien Hue province.|||The bridge spans a stream flowing from the beginning to the end of Thanh Toàn village (during the Thieu Tri era, the name coincided with the emperor's taboo name, so the king changed it to Thanh Thuy). Thanh Thuy village was established in the late 16th century. The first clan leaders of the village were people from Thanh Hoa who followed Lord Nguyen Hoang to clear land and establish settlements. A granddaughter of the 6th generation of the Tran family (one of the clans who cleared land for Thanh Thuy village), Mrs. Tran Thi Dao, donated money to the village to build this bridge.|||Thanh Toàn Tiled Bridge is a wooden bridge built in the 'Thuong Gia, Ha Kieu' style (house above, bridge below). The bridge is 43 wooden feet (approximately 18.75 meters) long and 14 feet (approximately 5.82 meters) wide, with two rows of wooden benches and railings on both sides for resting. The bridge has a roof covered with glazed tiles, divided into seven sections, with the central section dedicated to worshipping Mrs. Tran Thi Dao (the person who funded the bridge's construction). Thanh Toàn Tiled Bridge has undergone multiple restorations (in 1847, 1906, 1956, and 1971), with slight changes in size and construction materials, but the architectural style has been preserved.|||Thanh Toàn Tiled Bridge is an ancient architectural relic of great historical and cultural value. It is one of the rare and highly artistic bridges in Vietnam.|||Thanh Toàn Tiled Bridge has been recognized as a national heritage site under Decision No. 575/QD dated July 14, 1990 by the Ministry of Culture and Information (now the Ministry of Culture, Sports, and Tourism).

title: Huyen Tran Cultural Center
description: Centuries ago the people of Hue built a temple to honor Huyen Tran Princess at a site south of Hue City. However due to war and historical changes it no longer exists today.|||On the 700th anniversary of Thuan Hoa - Phu Xuan - Thua Thien Hue (1306 - 2006) the provincial leadership allowed Huong Giang Travel Company (now Huong Giang Travel Joint Stock Company) to build the Huyen Tran Cultural Center located in the southwest of Hue City about 6 km from the Nam Giao Altar.|||This is a cultural and tourist site with historical and spiritual significance, rooted in the sentiment and moral values of 'Remembering the source when drinking water and the planter when eating fruit' of our nation. Within the center are the temples dedicated to King Tran Nhan Tong and the Temple of Princess Huyen Tran, which are very mystical. At the summit of Ngũ Phong Mountain, 108 meters high, the Hoa Binh Bell Tower is constructed, with a pure bronze bell weighing 1.6 tons and standing 2.16 meters tall. The bell's resonant sound spreads through the serene silent realm to pray for World Peace and Human Happiness.|||King Trần Nhân Tông (1258–1308) was the third emperor of the Trần dynasty, a national hero, a master of both civil and military affairs, and an outstanding statesman and diplomat who twice led the people to defeat the invading Mongol forces (1285 and 1288). These victories not only elevated Đại Viet to a new height in the region but also contributed to the liberation of Southeast Asian countries from Mongol Empire domination in the late 13th century. After defeating the invaders and stabilizing the nation, he abdicated in favor of his son King Trần Anh Tông, became Emperor Emeritus, and dedicated himself to Buddhist studies and teaching the people. In 1299, he became a monk at Yên Tu Mountain with the title Hương Van Dai dau Da (often called Truc Lam Dai Sy), founded the Truc Lam Zen sect, and became its first patriarch. In 1301, he traveled throughout the country and to Champa to strengthen diplomatic ties and spread Buddhist teachings. He was the father of Huyen Tran Cong Chua, a national heroine who played a significant role in expanding the nation's territory, including the modern-day Thua Thien Hue province.|||In addition, to commemorate the founding patriarch of the Truc Lam Zen sect - King Tran Nhan Tong, the Huyen Tran Cultural Center is gradually completing its construction to become a Cultural and Spiritual Tourism Area, a national Zen tourism destination. The site is currently being invested in for research and construction of additional facilities such as the Zen Hall, Calligraphy House, Orchid House, and a Library to preserve and study mainly documents related to King Tran Nhan Tong, King Tran Anh Tong, Huyen Tran Cong Chua, and other heroic figures from the Tran dynasty era regarding the Truc Lam Zen sect across dynasties, Hue culture, and the history of Cham architectural culture, as well as other supplementary services for cultural creation, qigong, yoga, etc.|||To meet the needs of valued guests visiting, offering incense, worshiping, and commemorating at Huyen Truc Cultural Center, the center provides tourism services, souvenir stalls, and some documents related to the Tran dynasty era.|||Particularly on holidays, traditional vegetarian meals are served at Trong Quang Palace and Trong Hoa Palace within the temple grounds of King Tran Nhan Tong.|||On the 9th day of the first lunar month each year, the Huyen Trân Temple Festival will be held at the Center, with the participation of thousands of local residents, visitors, and tourists.|||This event aims to honor the ancestors who contributed to the region's development.

title: Traditional Craft Village of Thanh Tien Paper Flowers – Sinh Village Folk Painting
description: The People's Committee of Thua Thien Hue province has issued Decision No. 949/QD-UBND regarding the recognition of the tourism site Traditional Craft Village of Thanh Tien Paper Flowers – Sinh Village Folk Painting.|||The Traditional Craft Village of Thanh Tien Paper Flowers – Sinh Village Folk Painting is located in Phu Mau commune Phu Vang district Thua Thien Hue province with an area of 49.054 ha. Sinh Village is 8 km from the center of Hue city surrounded by Huong River and Loi Pho River. This tourism site has 3 historical and cultural relics including 1 national-level relic the memorial house of Nguyen Chi Dieu and 2 provincial-level relics the Sinh Village communal house and the temple of scholar Dang Tat. The traditional crafts are Thanh Tien Paper Flowers and Sinh Village Folk Painting. The transportation system is convenient easily accessible by road and water. There is a 24/7 security team at the Nguyen Chi Dieu memorial house paper flower production sites and folk painting workshops.|||Based on the tourism site recognition request dossier from the Thua Thien Hue Department of Culture Sports and Tourism and the actual assessment results at the Traditional Craft Village of Thanh Tien Paper Flowers – Sinh Village Folk Painting Tourism Site the People's Committee of the province recognizes the Traditional Craft Village of Thanh Tien Paper Flowers – Sinh Village Folk Painting as a tourism site.|||To be recognized the Traditional Craft Village of Thanh Tien Paper Flowers – Sinh Village Folk Painting Tourism Site met all 3 conditions for tourism site recognition under the 2017 Tourism Law including having tourism resources defined boundaries on a topographic map confirmed by an authorized agency the map scale depends on management requirements and regional topography having necessary infrastructure and services to serve tourists meeting security order social safety and environmental protection conditions.|||This is the second tourism site recognized by the People's Committee of Thua Thien Hue province after the Huyen Tran Cultural Center.

title: Dam Chuon Eco-Tourism Site
description: Located 6 km from Hue City center in the northeast of Phu An commune, Phu Vang district, Dam Chuon is one of Thua Thien Hue province's important wetland systems. It is a brackish water lagoon within the famous Tam Giang Lagoon system, known for its peaceful beauty, vast waterways, and affordable yet delicious local specialties.|||The beauty of Dam Chồn is most striking at dawn and dusk when the red, yellow, and purple hues of the sky reflect on the small boats gliding through the vast waterways, creating a scene reminiscent of a watercolor painting. This makes it an endless source of inspiration and a captivating subject for renowned photographers. Annually, it attracts hundreds of thousands of tourists for sightseeing, dining, and relaxation, contributing significantly to the local economy and providing employment for hundreds of residents.|||The unique attraction of this area is its floating stilt house system. After touring Dam Chồn, visitors can rest and enjoy local specialties at these floating stilt houses located in the middle of the lagoon and along the western embankment.|||Visitors to Phu An can admire the serene, expansive beauty of Dam Chồn with its floating stilt houses and participate in fishing using traditional nets from local aquaculture households. They can also enjoy free rowing experiences on the vast, scenic Tam Giang Lagoon and capture beautiful sunset photos. The tourism offerings here are diverse, including traditional specialties like crab-stuffed bánh xèo, shrimp-stuffed bánh khói, bánh tét, and fresh seafood such as shrimp, fish, and squid, all highlighting the lagoon's essence.|||Dam Chồn Eco-Tourism Site was officially recognized as a tourist destination of Thua Thien Hue province by Decision No. 951/QD-UBND issued on April 16, 2019.|||Tourist attractions: Dam Chồn, the historical An Truyen village temple, and Truyen Nam palm leaf hat.|||Recreational services: Visitors can tour the Dam Chồn system by boat and experience hands-on fishing using traditional nets from local aquaculture households.|||Currently, there are five restaurants operating on Dam Chồn, offering local specialties: Dam Chồn An Phu, Dam Chồn Huong Quan, Dam Chồn Hoai Ngo, Tam Giang Logon, and Thuy Trieu Quan.|||Homestay services: After visiting and dining at the Dam Chồn Eco-Tourism Site, visitors can stay overnight with local families offering homestay services in Dinh Cu hamlet.

title: Phuoc Tic Ancient Village
description: 40 km north of the center of Hue city is Phuoc Tic Ancient Village showcasing the pristine beauty of a Vietnamese countryside village. The village is surrounded by the clear green gentle O Lao River. According to historical records Phuoc Tic was established in 1470 under King Le Thanh Tong covering an area of about 49 hectares.|||Phuoc Tic Ancient Village is the second village in Vietnam recognized as a national heritage site in 2009. With dense clusters of ancient three-bay two-flank and one-bay two-flank wooden houses a delicate wooden architecture system intricately carved tables chairs trang ky (traditional Vietnamese furniture) and altars a system of historical sites communal houses temples pagodas ancestral halls and Cham cultural relics a network of roads and greenery naturally and vividly connected All of these reflect the strong religious beliefs of the Hue people After nine years of recognition Phuoc Tic Ancient Village has made strong and comprehensive transformations in all areas The tourism landscape is becoming increasingly professional and the system of tangible heritage has been restored and renovated|||Currently Phuoc Tich Tourism has 9 types of tourism services with 40 people participating in activities including visiting traditional wooden houses accommodation catering bicycle rentals guides ceramics demonstrations baking cultural exchanges etc. The system of ancient wooden houses has 11 households participating in welcoming visitors 4 households operating accommodation 4 points serving catering services. Most services are served with care enthusiasm and hospitality helping to meet the needs of cultural exchange and local culture exploration by tourists. Therefore the image of Phuoc Tich Tourism has been widely promoted through media making Phuoc Tich an increasingly attractive destination for tourists visiting and exploring the ancient village of Phuoc Tich. Annually many tour groups and researchers visit and study the ancient village of Phuoc Tich. The total number of visitors welcomed in 2018 is estimated at 37800|||Phuoc Tich Ancient Village was recognized as a tourist site of Thua Thien Hue province by Decision No. 2186/QD-UBND issued on September 9 2019. Phuoc Tich Ancient Village tourist site has cultural resources such as ancestral family temples; traditional wooden house systems and dozens of communal houses temples pagodas shrines like Trung Village Communal House Phuoc Bao Pagoda Cay Thi Shrine Doi Shrine Quang Te Shrine (worshipping Yoni and Linga of the Cham people) and other shrines like Am Hon Con Cop Ba Giang (Cham people) Van Than Temple. Doi Shrine honors Hoang Minh Hung the pioneer who was enshrined as the Village God. Entering the village are spacious gardens with lush ancient trees including a golden orchid tree over 100 years old in front of Me Trang's house that smells fragrant||||||In addition, there are traditional crafts such as pottery, famous for over 500 years using rice straw firing techniques, creating renowned products compared to the verse "Om Phuoc Tic rice is fit for the Emperor, Ha Tri lotus is precious to Phu Xuan's body" and the craft of making cakes,|||In addition there are complete dining and shopping services local specialty restaurants a dedicated food service team catering to tourists ensuring food safety and hygiene along with 01 souvenir stall serving tourists shopping needs|||Visiting the village visitors have the opportunity to discover and experience the peaceful life of a tranquil countryside that is warm and welcoming a harmonious blend of sky land and people.|||To get more detailed information visitors can contact:|||Phuoc Tic Ancient Village Architectural Art Relic Management Board Address: 31 Pho Trach Street Phong Dien Town Phong Dien District Thua Thien Hue Province. Phone: 02343.771055

title: Nhi Ho Waterfall
description: Nhi Ho Waterfall is a beautiful waterfall generously gifted by nature, located in the Bach Ma mountain range. It is a central point situated in a triangle between Hue City, Bach Ma, and Lang Co, about 45 km south of Hue City's center and nearly 4 km from National Highway 1A.|||With many natural advantages, it is a tourist spot featuring hills, valleys, and Cau Hai lagoon. It has Tu Hien coastal gate adjacent to the sea and is close to the buffer zone of Bach Ma National Park. For a long time, Nhị Hồ has been famous and attracts many tourists for sightseeing, tourism, and leisure.|||Located among untouched primitive forests, the natural scenery here is as beautiful as an ink painting. Visitors only pay 5,000 VND for parking and 10,000 VND for entry to play and explore. The waterfall is over 7 meters high, with fresh water flowing down from the mountains, cascading over rocky outcrops. The water flows strongly year-round, creating white foam and a cool atmosphere. Wildflowers in purple, red, and yellow surround the area, making the space look romantic and poetic. The waterfall isn't too steep, with a moderate slope allowing tourists to climb up or relax in the water.|||Nhị Hồ consists of a system of two clear water pools, each about 30x30 meters. The lower pool has water depth of 1.5 meters, while the upper pool is about 2.5 meters deep. The waterfall has small paths leading up to it, where young people often climb to take automatic beautiful photos. Tourists often choose this place as the hottest destination in summer to cool down and escape Hue's summer heat. Annually, an estimated 35,000 domestic and international tourists visit for sightseeing and relaxation. Here, besides swimming and playing, visitors must try the local traditional dishes at very affordable prices, especially the delicious free-range chicken.|||Nhị Hồ Waterfall was recognized as a tourist site by Thua Thien Hue province under Decision No. 2867/QD-UBND issued on November 9, 2019. Nhị Hồ Waterfall is one of the ecologically significant tourist attractions. Impressions of natural scenery, river bathing, service quality, and cuisine have brought many benefits to tourists visiting Nhị Hồ. However, to meet the growing demand for accommodation, Nhị Hồ needs more investment to further develop its ecological tourism.

title: Truoi Lake
description: Truoi Lake has been a notable tourist destination in Hue since its creation.|||From Hue City, it is about 30 km south along National Highway 1A, followed by an additional 10 km to reach Truoi Lake. This site is the largest water conservation project in Thua Thien Hue, constructed in 1996 with a capacity of 60 million cubic meters and a 50-meter spillway.|||Truoi Lake has long served as a refreshing destination for locals and travelers. Visitors can rent a large boat operated by local guides to enjoy the tranquil beauty of this peaceful place.|||Surrounding Truoi Lake are towering mountains, with the distant Bach Ma mountain range encircling the vast lake. The water of Truoi Lake is remarkably clear and cool, and rowing on the lake feels like leaving behind daily worries.|||Stopping at rocky beaches along the streams that feed into Truoi Lake. Immersing in the cool, clear streams or hiking to discover the natural beauty here creates unforgettable memories during the journey.|||Embarking on an adventure to explore the secluded beauty at the base of Thanh Long Mountain. On the return journey to the boat dock, visitors can visit Truc Lam Bach Ma Zen Monastery. Whether visiting only Truoi Lake or combining it with nearby attractions, the experience truly leaves lasting memories of the area's scenic beauty and serene atmosphere.

title: YesHue Eco Eco-Tourism Site
description: YesHue Eco is located in Xuan Phu hamlet, Huong Phu commune, Nam Dong district, Thua Thien Hue province, 65 km from Hue city in Nam Dong. Mo Waterfall - Nam Dong is formed by water sources originating from the Bac Ma mountain range, over 1,400 meters above sea level. Mo Waterfall has been known to the local and surrounding communities for a long time due to its beautiful natural scenery, with lush green forests covering the clear, cool water.|||Located on the main trail leading up to the local mountain ranges and further to the overlapping Bac Ma mountain range, Mo Waterfall serves as a highlight amidst the vast, majestic beauty of Hue's mountainous landscape.|||YesHue Eco utilizes the natural and pristine scenery of Mo Waterfall, making the most striking feature upon arrival the three high waterfalls with four natural swimming pools of depths ranging from 1-3 meters; YesHue Eco Eco-Tourism Site has arranged food service areas and souvenir stalls to meet visitors' needs. There are two on-site guides who provide explanations and guidance for visitors.|||On January 21, 2020, the People's Committee of Thua Thien Hue province recognized YesHue Eco as a tourism site under Decision No. 257/QD-UBND.|||To be recognized as a tourism site according to the Tourism Law, YesHue Eco Eco-Tourism Site met all three conditions for recognition: having tourism resources, defined boundaries on topographic maps confirmed by authorized agencies. The map scale depends on management requirements and the area's topography; having necessary infrastructure and services to serve tourists; and meeting security, order, social safety, and environmental protection conditions.|||With its beautiful natural space and fresh ecological environment, YesHue Eco Eco-Tourism Site brings new colors to the region, offering new experiences and enjoyable moments for visitors arriving in Hue.

title: Hoang Sa Exhibition Hall
description: The Hoang Sa Exhibition Hall was organized for groundbreaking construction on Hoang Sa Street (Son Tra District, Da Nang City) by the Hoang Sa Island District People's Committee (Da Nang City) on December 7 2015. The Hoang Sa Exhibition Hall was designed by WRIGHT Architecture Company (Japan) and constructed on an area of 1296 m² consisting of 1 ground floor 3 above-ground floors 18 meters high with a total floor area of 1824 m².|||After completion and operation on March 28 2018 the Hoang Sa Exhibition Hall displays dynamic and static image materials supported by technical and multimedia art techniques like video combined with map systems and overview models of the natural and administrative geography of Hoang Sa focusing on introducing materials about Hoang Sa under various themes Geographical position and natural conditions Hoang Sa in Vietnamese ancient documents before the Nguyen Dynasty Hoang Sa in Vietnamese ancient documents during the Nguyen Dynasty Chinese and Western materials proving Vietnam's sovereignty over Hoang Sa Vietnam's sovereignty over Hoang Sa from 1858-1954 Vietnam's sovereignty over Hoang Sa from 1954-1974 state management documents from 1975 to present Hoang Sa and the world - the world and Hoang Sa Hoang Sa and historical witnesses.|||The Hoang Sa Exhibition Hall is a cultural and historical institution with special political significance. It is a place to display promote and inform the Vietnamese people and international friends about vivid valuable information and materials about Vietnam's exploration establishment and protection of sovereignty over Hoang Sa. It is also strong evidence of truth and justice in Vietnam's struggle to protect sovereignty over Hoang Sa and Paracel Islands as well as the East Sea through historical and legal evidence.|||On December 19 2019 the Hoang Sa Exhibition Hall was recognized as a tourist site by Da Nang City People's Committee.

title: Ho Chi Minh City History Museum
description: The Ho Chi Minh City History Museum is a large museum with a long history of development in the southern region of Vietnam. Located in the city center at No. 02 Nguyen Binh Khiem Street Ben Nghe Ward District 1 the museum is a popular destination attracting a large number of domestic and international visitors.|||History|||The Ho Chi Minh City History Museum was previously called the Blanchard de la Brosse Museum (named after the governor of South Vietnam) established in 1929 and was the first museum in southern Vietnam. Since 1956 the museum was named the Vietnam National Museum of Fine Arts in Saigon displaying ancient art from several Asian countries. On August 23 1979 the museum officially changed its name to Ho Chi Minh City History Museum according to Decision No 235QĐ-UB of the Ho Chi Minh City People's Committee.|||In 2012 the Museum Building was recognized as a National Architectural and Artistic Heritage Site. An architecture that strongly features the East combined with the West creates a sturdy harmonious and symmetrical structure that blends well with the surrounding landscape.|||Currently the museum owns over 40000 artifacts with many unique and valuable collections originating from various countries and ethnic groups materials and forms are extremely diverse and rich The collections introduce the history and culture of Vietnam from prehistoric times to 1945 and present the unique cultural aspects of southern provinces and some countries in the Asian region|||The museum is also a workplace for many experts and researchers specializing in Vietnamese history culture and society as well as regional and global cultures. The staff are qualified and experienced.|||Architecture and Design|||On a 6,057m² site, the History Museum - Ho Chi Minh City is an architectural complex consisting of two buildings: The front building was constructed in 1927 and the rear building in 1970.|||The building was originally the old Blanchard de la Brosse Museum designed by architect Auguste Delaval with an old-fashioned architectural style. The building is 70 meters long 30 meters wide with a total usable area of 2100 square meters. The overall layout includes an octagonal tower in the center as a focal point and also serves as the axis of symmetry for the two rows of buildings on either side. Overall the architecture of this building clearly features the Indochinese style.|||The decorative patterns used in the museum's architecture, though made from various materials (wood, iron, cement), are common and similar to many contemporary ancient architectural works. Each detail has a different meaning, but overall they all carry auspicious intentions. This is the intangible cultural heritage hidden within the building, specifically in the architectural decorative details. These patterns also demonstrate the Vietnamese-French cultural exchange, contributing to the museum's architecture having an Eastern style yet also a Western influence.|||Overall the architecture of the building has designs suitable for a museum function such as high foundation thick walls for moisture resistance and good load-bearing capacity high ceilings with windows near the ceiling to utilize natural light for the rooms... It can be said that the Ho Chi Minh City History Museum building has been used in accordance with its original design function until today. By 2012 the Ho Chi Minh City History Museum building was designated by the Ministry of Culture Sports and Tourism as a National-Level Architectural Art Heritage Site.|||The rear building designed by architect Nguyen Ba Lang was built adjacent to the previous building. This U-shaped building with an area of 1,000m² was designed harmoniously with landscaping adapted to fit the ancient architecture of the previous building.|||The decorative patterns used in the museum's architecture though made from various materials (wood iron cement) are common and similar to those in many contemporary ancient architectural works. Each detail has a different meaning but overall they all convey good wishes. This is the intangible cultural heritage embedded in the building specifically in the architectural decorative details. These patterns also reflect the Vietnamese-French cultural exchange contributing to the museum's architecture having an Eastern charm while also being very Western.|||Overall the architecture of the building has designs suitable for a museum such as raised foundation thick walls to resist humidity and provide structural strength high ceilings with skylights to utilize natural light for the exhibition rooms etc. It can be said that the Ho Chi Minh City History Museum building has been used appropriately according to its original design until today.
