In 2012 the Ho Chi Minh City History Museum building was designated as a National Architectural Heritage Site by the Ministry of Culture Sports and Tourism.|||Ho Chi Minh City History Museum|||Address: No. 2 Nguyen Binh Khiem, Phuong Ben Nghi, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City|||Phone: (84) (028) 3829 8146/Guided tour registration: (84) (028) 3829 0268|||Opening hours: 8:00 - 11:30/ 13:00 - 17:00|||Entrance fee: 30000 VND per visit|||Email: bt.ls.svhtt@tphcm.gov.vn|||Website: http://www.baotanglichsutphcm.com.vn/

title: Ben Thanh Market
description: Located in District 1 Ho Chi Minh City adjacent to Le Loi Street to the south Phan Boi Chau Street to the east Phan Chu Trinh Street to the west and Le Thanh Ton Street to the north Ben Thanh Market is the largest retail market in the city offering a wide range of products from everyday items to luxury goods and is a must-visit destination for tourists coming to Ho Chi Minh City.|||Initially built with bricks wooden frames and thatched roofs it was situated next to Ben Thanh River dock near Gia Dinh Citadel now Ho Chi Minh City hence the name Ben Thanh. In February 1859 French colonizers captured Gia Dinh Citadel completely destroying the market. In 1860 the French rebuilt the market at the same location. Later due to deterioration the French demolished the old market and chose a new site to accommodate the bustling trade. In 1912 construction of the new market began on the site of a swampy pond near My Tho train station now Saigon Bus Station. The inauguration ceremony in 1914 called "Tan Vuong Hoi" by contemporary media was a large-scale event with fireworks lasting three days and attended by over 100000 people.|||In 1985 Ben Thanh Market underwent a large-scale renovation covering over 13000m² with four main gates and 12 side gates facing all four directions. A four-faced clock tower was installed above the southern main gate.|||The market is divided into seven large halls in the center and six smaller halls on the sides with nearly 1500 stalls. The southern area sells fabrics and dry goods the northern area sells fresh flowers fruits fresh food and delicacies the eastern area sells cosmetics and snacks and the western area sells shoes handicrafts and souvenirs. Along the surrounding corridors are shops selling various consumer goods for tourists especially souvenirs ready-to-wear clothes silk fabrics handicrafts embroidered paintings and traditional textiles.|||In 2012 the market was voted one of the top 10 destinations with the most appealing street food by the American Food and Wine magazine.

title: Ma Pi Leng Pass
description: Ma Pi Leng Pass or also known as Ma Pi Leng (meaning "horse's nose") is called the king of mountain passes in the Northwest region. It is a challenging 20km pass road located in Pa Vi and Pai Lung communes of Meo Vac district and Ta Lung commune of Dong Van district.|||The peak of Ma Pi Leng Pass is at 1200m elevation in the Dong Van Karst Plateau on the Happiness Road connecting Ha Giang city with Dong Van and Meo Vac districts. From the peak of Ma Pi Leng Pass visitors can enjoy panoramic views of the Dong Van Karst Plateau. The majestic mountain scenery features steep cliffs on one side and deep emerald-green Nho Que River on the other. Visitors can visit Ma Pi Leng from January to March when peach apricot and mustard flowers bloom April for the Khau Vai love market September for the rice harvest in Hoang Su Phi or November-December for the three-cornered millet flowers.|||Ma Pi Leng is unique challenging yet breathtakingly beautiful worth conquering for travelers visiting the beautiful Ha Giang region.

title: Sloping Wharf - Unnumbered Ship Wharf
description: Sloping Wharf was built by the French colonists with the intention of invasion but became the site where the last French soldier left the city. A long time has passed yet Sloping Wharf still stands marking a milestone in the nation's history of resistance against foreign aggression|||In December 1946 French colonialists returned to attack and occupy Do Son. At that time the French colonialists received support from the United States in various aspects such as money weapons and military equipment leading to their plot to expand the war intensify suppression sweep and terrorism to crush the people's resistance. To serve their long-term war plans besides using other ports built previously in 1950 they constructed a military ship dock at Do Son to accumulate and transport war materials such as weapons tanks amphibious vehicles from the open-sea cargo ships into storage therefore they built a sloping dock from the shore down to the water's edge to facilitate transportation and the locals commonly called it Bến Nghiêng (Sloping Dock).|||The people of Do Son have witnessed amphibious vehicles (called xe coc by them) from open-mouthed ships swimming from the sea into Ben Nghiep. Because Ben Nghiep was a shallow military port that could not accommodate large ships but was part of De Cat's plan, the French colonialists also planned to dredge channels to allow large ships to enter and exit. However due to fierce resistance from guerrilla units and military forces this plan of the French colonialists did not come to fruition. After the defeat at Dien Bien Phu under the Geneva Accords Hai Phong and Do Son were designated as 300-day assembly areas for French troops and on May 15 at Ben Nghiep a French military transport ship was already waiting to receive the defeated troops from Indochina. From then on Hai Phong and the North were free of enemy troops and from that day Ben Nghiep became a historical site commemorating the victory of the anti-colonial war against the French. Many elderly people in Do Son who witnessed that moment still vividly remember the image of the defeated troops with backpacks on their shoulders slowly stepping off the pier onto the ship marking the end of 80 years of French invasion of Vietnam.|||During the years of fighting against American invaders, especially the war against the blockade at Hai Phong ports, Ben Nghe played a crucial role in supplying oil and goods to Hon Dau lighthouse, which is considered the precious eye of the sea every night illuminating and guiding ships into Hai Phong port. Recognizing Hon Dau's importance, US imperialists intensified attacks to extinguish the guiding lighthouse, but from Ben Nghe, regular ship voyages continued to transport supplies to Hon Dau, and the Hon Dau lighthouse remained lit. After national reunification, Ben Nghe resumed its role in supporting production, fishing, and now serves as a tourist pier transporting visitors to Hon Dau, Cat Ba, Ha Long... Over its 50-year existence, Ben Nghe marked the development of Do Son through various periods, containing significant values in the historical progress of the land and people of the eastern coast of the Fatherland.|||Today Ben Nghieng has become a hub for a new tourism route in Do Son.|||This is an eco-tourism cultural and religious tourism route combining Ben Nghieng and Hon Dau.|||From Ben Nghieng tourists will board a tour boat after just over 20 minutes on the sea enjoying gentle waves visitors will set foot on the island.|||Hon Dau is serene and solemn.|||Visiting Hon Dau Island tourists will visit the Nam Hai Dai Vuong temple and the lighthouse on the island.|||Climbing the spiral wooden staircase of about 100 steps to the lighthouse corridor gazing out to sea visitors will see the distant mountains of Do Son.|||With this tourism route Do Son attracts thousands of tourists and the Ben Nghieng-Hon Dau route is the starting point of the coastal tourism line in Do Son.

title: Red Temple (Linh Do Tu)
description: Located in the heart of the red flame tree city, situated on Le Lai street, deep within a secluded alley and surrounded by residential areas, Red Temple (Linh Do Tu) is a spiritual destination that delights visitors. In the past during wartime, the king went to war in this area. The temple's stove suddenly turned bright red, which the people found strange and named the temple Red Temple. When King Hung Dao Wang passed away, people built two shrines next to the temple to honor him.|||After several renovations and repairs, the Red Church has become increasingly spacious and modern as it is today. Before the anti-French resistance, this temple was considered the most beautiful in the area and the city map was engraved there. However, after the war, the temple suffered heavy damage.|||The temple has the most unique architecture that few other temples possess. With ancient interlocking bracket architecture featuring three tiers and twenty eaves. The temple's structure also consists of three main parts: the Front Hall, Central Hall, and Rear Palace. The Front Hall, Central Hall, and Rear Palace are connected to each other and designed with two intersecting roofs. This combination makes the temple even more beautiful, grand, and majestic.|||The ideal height of the Red Temple reaches up to 26m. The roof of the main hall is designed with a 7-story tower 5m high the base of the tower is 1.2m high above the tower there is a lotus inside the lotus there is a 5m flagpole for hanging flags during festivals.|||The Central Hall features a row of lime flowers carved with double lotus leaves in green glaze running along the temple's roof. Each double lotus leaf has the temple's symbol.|||The rear palace features two-tiered curved roofs. Atop the roof is placed a Bodhi leaf (1.20m high) resembling a flickering flame symbolizing the purity and brightness of Buddhism of monks nuns and Buddhist followers who seek to do good alleviate suffering and rescue those in need.|||Surrounding the roof are double Bodhi leaves made from special materials decorated with many surrounding lights that are illuminated during major festivals.|||Blue stone is the main material used for the main face of the temple. The temple columns are decorated with dragon motifs reflecting the artistic style of the Ly-Tran period. The main hall consists of four stone pillars with a diameter of about 50 cm, 4.2 m high, carved with coiled dragons and phoenixes symmetrically arranged on both sides. Between the pillars are stone railings carved with pine, bamboo, chrysanthemum, and plum motifs in dragon forms. The base is inlaid with stone carvings of clouds and blooming lotus flowers, and the temple is built on a giant lotus symbolizing the Lotus Realm.|||The Buddha statue of Lord Buddha Sakyamuni is a masterpiece of art and the largest wooden statue in Vietnam. The statue is 5.5 meters tall sitting on a 2.90-meter-high lotus throne composed of 500 gilded and lacquered lotus petals carved with floral motifs from the Tran dynasty. Behind the statue is the 11-meter-high Ten Thousand Buddha Wall consisting of 1111 small gilded and lacquered Buddha statues situated within banyan leaves joined together to form a border symbolizing the boundless Dharma realm. This temple has the most colossal architecture and is visited by many people each year serving as the spiritual center of Buddhism.|||At the beginning of the year, city residents often come here to light incense and pray for a peaceful new year. Pilgrims from all over travel from distant regions to visit the temple and pray for a safe and lucky year. Tourist tours are organized and choose this place as the most revered center during the beginning of the year.

title: Pho Chieu Temple (also known as Pha Chieu Temple, Chieu Temple)
description: Pho Chieu Temple is located on a large area in Du Hang Kenh Ward, Le Chanh District, Hai Phong City. Not only is it a place for spiritual and religious activities for the city's residents but it is also an attractive cultural and tourist site for visitors from all over. Currently the temple still preserves some ancient artifacts made of baked clay and stone.|||In the "Buddhist flower garden" of Hai Phong city Pho Chieu Temple is not as famous grand or ancient as Red Temple (Ngô Quyền district) Thap Tuong Long Temple (Do Son district) Trang Keng Temple (Thuy Nguyen district) Du Hang Temple (Le Chanh district) and Cao Linh Temple (An Duong district)|||Even in terms of its historical origins this temple was established relatively late. In 1953 Master Ngo Chan Tu from Cao Mai village Kien Xuong district Thai Binh province came to the site and opened the gate built the temple and served as its first abbot. Initially the temple was called Tam Giao Duong a hall dedicated to the Three Teachings Buddhism Confucianism and Taoism.|||This is a common feature in Vietnamese temples, reflecting religious harmony (Tam Giao Dong Nguyen) and ethnic unity.|||Although the temple was established less than 60 years ago, it already exudes the essence of a grand serene profound and ancient monastery with architecture deeply rooted in the traditional style of an ancient temple.|||According to the temple's history, after one year of construction in 1954 Master Thich Thanh Quang of the Lam Te Zen sect from Vong Cung Temple in Nam Dinh province became the abbot. Master Thich Thanh Quang renovated the Tam Giao road into a Buddhist temple and renamed it Pho Chieu Temple. Over time and due to natural disasters and war the old temple has deteriorated with many structures damaged.|||In 1985 Pho Chiếu Temple underwent a major restoration. Especially since Venerable Thich Thanh Giac became the abbot they expanded and built more so that the temple has a grand and majestic appearance as it is today.|||Both locals and visitors who visit have the shared impression that this is a beautiful temple with unique architecture. The temple is built on a wide plot facing East arranged in an I-shaped architectural layout consisting of 5 bays in the front hall 3 bays in the middle section and 3 bays in the rear hall. Currently in addition to the I-shaped architecture of the main temple the temple has also added left and right wings.|||The highlight of the temple is a small temple built in the middle of a pond, modeled after the One Pillar Temple in Hanoi. The four corners of the pond feature raised dragon-shaped structures appearing to rise from the water and face the small temple, making the temple's scenery both solemn and modern in appearance. Every year during Buddha's Birthday (15th of the fourth lunar month), New Year's Day (15th of the first lunar month), and Vu Lan (15th of the seventh lunar month)... as well as the 15th and 1st of each month, Pho Chiếu Temple attracts a large number of devotees and locals seeking blessings.|||Here, Venerable Thich Thanh Giac organizes monthly Buddha recitation practice sessions, teaches Buddhist doctrines to various Buddhist communities, and spreads the Dharma to thousands of Buddhist followers.|||This is also where numerous charitable activities are organized, creating merit for thousands of devotees, business owners, and generous donors with both virtue and means who sow good karmic connections, relieve suffering, and alleviate disasters.|||When visiting Pho Chieu Temple visitors dont forget to walk to the pagoda garden to light incense in memory of the senior monks who once resided here The pagoda garden is located to the right of the temple where the ashes of the senior monks are kept To the left of the temple stands the 9story Cuu Pham Lieu Hoa pagoda with a wine jar on top symbolizing the Cam Lo water of the Quan Am Bodhisattva placed on a lotus pedestal|||On the eaves of the front hall is a large wine jar. On both sides of the front gable are square brackets, each with 5 small wine jars representing the "harmony" of the three religions Buddhism - Taoism - Confucianism.|||Like many temples in our country, during the two national defense wars, Pho Chiao Temple was a revolutionary site, helping to hide and support resistance fighters.|||Therefore this temple besides being a place of worship and a religious activity site for the people is also a site with many historical marks of Hai Phong city during the nation's resistance period. With its beautiful serene landscape and unique architecture along with tourists and Buddhist devotees photographers and amateur camera enthusiasts also visit Pho Chieu Temple as a beautiful and attractive spot to find creative inspiration and capture unique artistic photo angles.

title: Green Island
description: Green Island is a small island belonging to Nhon Chau commune Quy Nhon city Binh Dinh province located 24km northwest of Quy Nhon coast Green Island also known as Van Phai Island is considered one of the most beautiful islands in Central Vietnam a pristine location with great tourism potential.|||Green Island impresses visitors immediately with its absolute greenery as its name suggests from the sky sea to the vegetation on the island Even the pier area where many boats and fishing villages are concentrated is clean and rarely has trash washed up on the shore.|||The first attraction visitors often choose when arriving at Green Island is the Green Island Lighthouse This ancient lighthouse built entirely of stone by the French over 100 years ago stands 119m above sea level with a light visible up to 50km Standing atop the lighthouse visitors can admire the entire Green Island as a harmonious seascape.|||Opposite the lighthouse is the Thanh Nien Flagpole also known as the National Flagpole made of granite built in 2015 by the Ho Chi Minh Communist Youth Union and Vietnamese Student Association with a height of over 22m engraved with the islands name latitude and longitude.|||From the lighthouse and flagpole looking afar is Thao Nguyen Rock Beach a natural rock formation with various shapes and colors appearing strange yet harmoniously The scattered or stacked rock slabs are also habitats for rare bird species like gulls and swiftlets Along with Cua Cang Port Muoi Hoang Bang Tien Well and Thao Nguyen Beach with its majestic yet romantic beauty these spots are popular check in locations for visitors to Green Island.|||Besides attractive destinations Green Island has beautiful beaches like Bai Nho Bai Dong and Bai Nam Though small these beaches have white soft sand clean turquoise water and are spacious and quiet ideal for swimming and relaxation Besides swimming visitors can choose exciting activities like snorkeling night fishing campfires and overnight stays on the beach or try thrilling water sports like jet skiing wakeboarding and stand up paddleboarding.|||During the exploration of Green Island visitors should not miss the delicious specialties with rich flavors like stone crabs moon snails shrimp fritters seaweed soup sim berry wine and wild pineapple wine.|||The most suitable time to visit Green Island is from February to September annually when Green Island has sunny weather calm seas and clear water ideal for swimming snorkeling and sightseeing If visitors want to experience the cultural and spiritual traditions of the islanders they can visit Green Island during the Cau Ngu Festival held from the 12th to 16th day of the third lunar month.

title: K50 Waterfall
description: Located in Kon Churang Nature Reserve (Binh Dinh hamlet Son Lang commune K Bang district Gia Lai province) straddling the border between Gia Lai and Binh Dinh provinces K50 Waterfall is likened to a princess hidden among the Central Highlands mountains due to its pristine and pure beauty.|||K50 Waterfall is over 50 meters high and considered one of the most beautiful waterfalls in the Central Highlands. It is also called Hang En Falls because behind the waterfall is a large cave home to thousands of wild swallows.|||To reach K50 Waterfall visitors must conquer a long winding path through small forest trails crossing streams and rocky rapids to witness this magnificent waterfall. Because few people visit K50 Waterfall retains its original untouched beauty.|||Although the name is simple just K50 once visitors see the waterfall they will change their minds. K50 Waterfall has a primitive and magical beauty appearing from afar like a shimmering silver ribbon against the lush green of the jungle. The cool refreshing mist from the cascading white foam creates a breathtaking scene. At the base are uniquely shaped rocks stacked into distinctive steps forming a vivid and impressive natural landscape that evokes indescribable emotions and awe.|||January to June is the best time of year to visit K50 Waterfall with dry weather and little rain. If you love nature and adventure try the journey to experience this invaluable gift of nature in this region.

title: Xep Beach
description: Visitors to Xep Beach in Phu Yen can admire the stunning natural scenery with golden sun blue sea and soft white sand stretching out to the horizon.|||Located 14km north of Tuy Hoa City the road to Xep Beach An Chan Commune Tuy An District is easy to access.|||From afar Xep Beach offers a mysterious yet untouched beauty. This area includes a 500m long beach with two rocky formations at its ends Gheng Ong being the most famous due to its appearance in the film I See Yellow Flowers on the Green Grass which authentically captures its simple yet vibrant beauty.|||Phu Yen has two distinct rainy and dry seasons. Each season brings a new look to Xep Beach. From February to August with little rain and gentle sunshine Xep Beach displays its rustic charm through the green of cacti reaching toward the sea the yellow of dry grass and the white of soft sand in the distance. During the rainy season the vegetation becomes lush covering Xep Beach in a fresh vibrant green. Each season offers a different beauty so visitors should choose their visit based on their preferences.|||One popular activity at Xep Beach is snorkeling in the crystal clear waters where you can see the seabed. The waves are not too strong and there are small thatched huts built by locals on the beach for visitors to relax. Don't forget to enjoy seafood dishes made from the fresh local catch.|||Perhaps because of its simplicity yet unforgettable charm the land and people of Phu Yen have inspired many poets and writers. These works urge everyone to visit Xep Beach and Phu Yen where nature and the kind-hearted locals will warmly welcome you with their mysterious beauty.

title: Tuong Long Tower Temple
description: Do Son Tourist Area in Hai Phong is famous for its ideal beaches and picturesque scenery. However few people know that on the summit of Long Son (Ngoc Xuyen Ward) the first of nine mountains running along the Do Son Peninsula there is a historical and cultural site over a thousand years old—the Tuong Long Tower.|||Tower History|||Tuong Long Tower (also called Do Son Tower) was built during King Ly Thanh Tong's reign. This Buddhist architectural structure was built on a 2000 m² plot in Van Son Ward Do Son Town. All four corners of the tower lean inward at 190.|||Tower Features|||The tower's interior is hollow and houses a statue of Amitabha Buddha. The structure was built using bricks and stones of various sizes. In addition to construction bricks there are decorative bricks on the tower's exterior with unique motifs like lotus flowers chrysanthemums and citron blossoms. This decoration style represents the typical Ly Dynasty art.|||According to the "Dai Viet Su Luoc" in the year Mau Tuat 1058 King Ly Thanh Tong after traveling across the Ba Lo Sea stopped here to build the tower. Afterward he had a dream of a golden dragon and named the tower Tuong Long meaning "Golden Dragon Appears" to commemorate the auspicious omen. Some believe that the Do Son Sea Gate was one of the cradles that received the construction of this tower for Buddhist worship. In the past this site might have also been an observation post in the "transmission lamp" system. Whenever there was a crisis coastal observation stations would burn dry grass to send smoke signals to the capital as warnings.|||Tower Through Time|||From remaining artifacts it's evident that Tuong Long Tower was built contemporaneously with the Bao Thien Tower in Thang Long Imperial City (now the area of the Hanoi Opera House). According to the "Dai Nam Nhat Thong Chi" the old Do Son Tower was 100 chi tall built on a 1000 m² site with nine tiers and a west-facing entrance. One chi is 0.45 meters so the tower was approximately 45 meters tall. Located on a mountain 100 meters above sea level it was the tallest tower in Vietnam at that time. Tuong Long Tower was restored and renovated during the Tran and Le dynasties but in the third year of Gia Long (1804) the Nguyen court dismantled the tower to use its bricks for building Hai Duong Citadel. This shows that the ancient Tuong Long Tower was exceptionally grand and massive.|||From the Tuong Long Tower's location one can see the sea with boats heading out to sea to catch fish bringing fresh seafood for tourists as well as the Do Son Town with its villages and lush fields understanding how skillfully the ancients chose this site for the tower.|||Visiting Do Son without stopping at Tuong Long Tower would mean never forgetting the image of the majestic and splendid temple-tower regarded as the "descending golden dragon" tower.

title: Hon Nua
description: Standing on the majestic Cả Pass and looking into the distance, there is a small island resembling a green dinosaur sleeping peacefully in the vast sea, this is Hon Nua. Though not loud, its beauty makes every adventurous heart want to visit once, to explore.|||Hon Nua lies at the foot of Cả Pass, bordering Phu Yen province (north half) and Khanh Hoa province (south half) with a peak 105m above sea level. The island retains its pristine nature, promising a new beach paradise in Phu Yen.|||To reach Hon Nua, visitors stop at Bai Huong, Vung Ro to park personal vehicles (if any), then rent local boats to visit the island. As there are no residents on the island, visitors should consider a day trip or prepare necessary items for overnight camping.|||The fascinating aspect of Hon Nua is that the southern half is covered with lush green vegetation. Meanwhile the northern half has vertical rock formations, the highest peak reaching 80m above sea level with many cross-cutting paths. This creates ideal conditions for thousands of swiftlets to nest here annually.|||The ideal time to visit Hon Nua is from March to July. During this period, the weather is pleasant, dry and calm. Boats travel smoothly and island exploration activities are easier.|||For many young people, Hon Nua is a favorite spot for camping and enjoying fresh air. Visitors should not miss swimming in the clear blue water, walking along the white sandy beach, or listening to the waves. They can also bring fishing rods, sit on the rocks, and wait for fresh fish after a spontaneous fishing session. At sunset, quietly admire the magnificent natural scenery of clouds, mountains, and sea from the lighthouse on Hon Nua's peak.|||Additionally, around Hon Nua are other small islands all retaining their pristine nature. If time permits, visitors can rent boats to explore nearby islands and capture beautiful moments with Phu Yen's sea and sky.|||With its favorable geographical location and poetic beauty, Hon Nua is always an attractive destination for visitors during summer. The green island of Phu Yen welcomes you with the most natural, untouched, and authentic experiences. Each visit will create beautiful memories about the land and people of Phu Yen.

title: Yen Island
description: Yen Island offers a pristine and tranquil beauty, promising visitors relaxing moments with exciting experiences. Visitors can admire Yen Island's scenery while walking on white sand dunes and listening to the wind through rows of phi lao trees. Especially during low tide, visitors can witness a dazzling, colorful world of vibrant and enchanting coral reefs.|||Blessed by nature, along the country's length from North to South, there are many impressive coral reefs like Mun Island (Nha Trang), Cau Island (Binh Thuan), or Cham Island (Quang Nam)... However, Yen Island (Phu Yen) has a unique coral character rarely found elsewhere.|||On the 15th of each month, when the tide recedes, stunning coral reefs stretch over 12.7 hectares. At that time, visitors standing on the shore can fully enjoy their vibrant, lively beauty.|||Yen Island's corals come in various shapes and colors, resembling dancers performing a lively sea ballet under clear blue water. Occasionally, small fish schools leisurely swim among the coral canopies. With careful observation, visitors might also spot sea cucumbers, sea urchins (or sea urchins), and starfish clinging to the beautiful coral reefs. Before such a captivating scene, it's no wonder Yen Island always attracts visitors annually, as everyone wishes to witness the magical beauty bestowed by nature on this "land of golden flowers and green grass."|||Some journeys return not just once. Some people, once met, are unforgettable. And Phu Yen is just such a place! A land of beauty and kindness, home to the "land-based coral paradise - Yen Island" will satisfy any traveler who visits.

title: Dai Lanh Beach
description: Visiting Dai Lanh Beach (Khanh Hoa), visitors can explore one of the famous landmarks renowned for its skillfully intertwined beauty of mountains and sea.|||Dai Lanh Beach lies between Phu Yen and Khanh Hoa provinces, 80km north of Nha Trang city. The ideal time to visit Dai Lanh Beach is from January to September, when the weather is dry and pleasant, suitable for sightseeing and experiential activities.|||The beach is surrounded by two mountain passes: Deo Ca in the north and Deo Co Ma in the south. Perhaps for this reason, even on days with high waves and strong winds, Dai Lanh Beach remains exceptionally calm and gentle. The most impressive feature for visitors is the crescent-shaped white sand beach with lush green coconut trees surrounding it. In the distance, the vast sea is so clear that it seems as if you can see to the bottom.|||After snorkeling in the cool, clear sea, visitors can experience water motor racing, kayaking, or joining fishermen on boats to fish at sea. For visitors who prefer more relaxed activities, don't forget to check in with the colorful wooden houses located by the beach, adding a playful and charming touch to the otherwise tranquil, untouched blue sea.|||The coastal fishing villages of Khai Luong, Dam Mon are also great suggestions for visitors wanting to explore the lives of coastal people and taste local delicacies. Another must-visit is Vung Ro Port, renowned for its numberless ship dock during the anti-American war. Experiencing the site firsthand and listening to the heroic historical stories of our ancestors is a meaningful experience that makes the trip even more memorable.|||If visiting Khanh Hoa, travelers should come to Dai Lanh Beach to personally discover the natural beauty gifted here, to be mesmerized by the serene scenery of clouds, trees, and grass that is both peaceful and deeply touching for visitors.

title: Yang Bay Waterfall
description: When mentioning Nha Trang many tourists imagine a place with white sandy beaches and blue sea. However not far from the city lies a clear waterfall with a pristine and rich ecosystem promising many experiences in the green mountainous space.|||The Yang Bay Waterfall system is divided into 3 main areas with Yang Bay Waterfall as the main waterfall over 80m high Yang Khang Stream right next to it and Ho Cho subsidiary waterfall. The uniqueness of Yang Bay Waterfall lies in flat rock slabs resembling a chessboard scattered within the waterfall. During the rainy season waterfalls flow like a fairy’s hair cascading down creating white foam. On sunny days sunlight dances on the clear water forming sparkling golden sand-like reflections.|||Compared to the main waterfall Yang Khang Stream is more gentle with slow flowing streams. Meanwhile Ho Cho (mother) Waterfall offers its own distinct charm with multiple large water branches divided into two main streams one hot and one cold. The two streams flow into one riverbed at the waterfall’s base creating an intriguing hot spring pool that always attracts visitors.|||Yang Bay Waterfall is located in an ecological tourism area offering many exciting activities that visitors never want to miss. First is the train tour service suitable for families with children. Sitting on a colorful train children can enjoy the fresh greenery of the mountains listen to birds singing in the trees and the sound of waterfalls echoing nearby.|||Most anticipated is the moment of soaking in the cool clear water where the bottom of Yang Bang Waterfall is visible. Leisurely enjoying the scenery on both sides with shady tree canopies and blooming flowers by the stream in full bloom.|||Additionally visitors have the chance to immerse themselves in the culture of the Raglai people through special art programs. Dancers in traditional costumes gracefully perform dances of their homeland. Musical instruments made from stone bamboo and rattan combined with the skilled hands of Raglai artists create harmonies that are lively and pleasant or deep and whispering as if guiding listeners into mountain melodies.|||Visiting Yang Bay through natural cultural and local culinary experiences visitors will gain deeper insights into a different Nha Trang. This place not only has vast seas but also ancient forests high waterfalls flowing day and night towards the sea and warm-hearted people... certainly creating unforgettable memories for visitors.

title: Binh Hung Island
description: Binh Hung Island is famous for its pristine beauty with soft white sand beaches and emerald-green clear water. Perhaps for this reason, Binh Hung always attracts visitors who come to Khanh Hoa province.|||Binh Hung Island is also known as Hon Ty or Hon Cut, located in the Cam Ranh deep-water bay, Khanh Hoa province. Hiding beneath the foot of the mountain pass along the Binh Tien – Vinh Hy coastal route, Binh Hung is a small island with an area of less than 2 km². The islanders mainly rely on fishing and especially lobster farming for their livelihood.|||The island is renowned for its long, wide beaches and peaceful, fresh atmosphere. The shallow, gently sloping sea is ideal for swimming and snorkeling. Beautiful beaches worth visiting include Binh Tien Beach and King Beach. Particularly around the beaches, there are many rocks of various shapes and vibrant colors, making them ideal spots for visitors to explore and take photos.|||Additionally, Hon Cut Lighthouse is a must-visit for adventurous travelers. By following a small path leading up to Hon Bu Hill, visitors will reach the century-old lighthouse. From here, visitors can enjoy the magnificent view of Khanh Hoa's sea and sky. In the distance, cargo ships and small fishing boats create a lively scene amidst the tranquility.|||If time permits, visitors should visit Hang Tau, one of the storm shelters for boats. However, it is also the nesting site of swiftlets, hence its other name, Yen Island.|||Being a small island, visitors can explore Binh Hung Island on their own within half a day. The hospitable locals will share many stories about their fishing profession and life on the island. This will be an interesting experience that deepens visitors' understanding and affection for the small island of Binh Hung.|||The best time to visit the island is from March to August, when the warm, sunny weather is pleasant for beach activities, relaxation, and exploring around the island.

title: Binh Ba Island
description: Nature has gifted Binh Ba with a pristine beauty featuring white sandy beaches untouched by human footsteps. Perhaps it is this natural genuine charm that has captivated many travelers who wish to visit Binh Ba at least once in their lifetime.|||Binh Ba along with Binh Hung island Binh Lap beach and Binh Tien is one of the Four Binh of Khanh Hoa. This small island with an area over 3 km² belongs to Cam Binh commune Cam Ranh city. Famous for its untouched beauty Binh Ba is also affectionately compared to the Maldives of Vietnam.|||Regarding the name Binh Ba many locals explain that the word Binh means peace reflecting the hope for a happy and warm life here. Alternatively Binh also reminds people of ancestors from Binh Dinh who came here to settle and cultivate land as a way for descendants to never forget their ancestors contributions. Thus the name Binh Ba to the local people is meaningful and beautiful just like the island itself.|||What impresses travelers about Binh Ba is its long beaches. The most beautiful beach is Chuong with clear water and many rocks of strange shapes. Next is Nom beach with a gentle slope suitable for both locals and travelers to swim. Then there is Nha Cu beach considered an excellent spot for snorkeling. However Nha Cu beach has many sea urchins so to conveniently view coral travelers can rent boats from local residents to go to more distant waters.|||Life on this remote island surrounded by sea allows locals to develop lobster farming. Visiting Binh Ba travelers will easily spot many fish and shrimp cages. Therefore dishes made from lobsters are considered specialties on the island. The lobsters here are fresh and delicious with affordable prices combined with the locals skillful cooking techniques making the dishes even more flavorful.|||With its spacious and fresh natural environment abundant cuisine and friendly people Binh Ba Island is a must-visit paradise island for travelers this summer.

title: Diep Son Island
description: Diep Son Island is compared to the “emerald gem” of Van Phong Bay with the famous sea walking path connecting the islands. This place promises to be one of the attractive sea island paradises for tourists visiting during the summer.|||Diep Son is an archipelago with three small islands: Hon Bip, Hon O, and Hon Ca - names symbolizing the three bird species: Bim Bip, the owl, and the crow. The island is famous for its pristine, mysterious beauty with the “Diep Son waterway” that only appears when the tide recedes.|||To experience the unique path in Van Phong Bay, departing from Van Gia after about an hour of sea travel, the boat will stop at the middle island. From here visitors can experience walking on the white sandy path winding like a silk ribbon across the vast ocean. Besides the excitement there is also a hint of nervousness as the path is only about 1 meter wide, 0.5 meters above sea level, and nearly 500 meters long. On sunny days with clear sea water visitors can also admire schools of fish leisurely swimming in the blue sea. Breathing in the cool breeze mixed with the salty sea air helps to dispel all worries.|||Diep Son is most beautiful from December to June, with calm seas and clear skies ideal for sightseeing and exploring the simple life of the fishermen's village. About 80 households live on the island primarily engaged in fishing. Therefore when visiting Diep Son tourists can easily see fishermen pulling their nets at dawn or dusk. To quietly admire the peaceful beauty of the green island surrounded by sea.|||If time permits tourists can rent local boats to explore nearby small islands. The most notable is Hon Mot only 15 minutes by boat away. Most of the islands here are very pristine and quiet besides the blue sea they also have grassy fields ideal for tourists to take photos and capture wonderful moments of Van Phong Bay.

title: Khe Kem Waterfall
description: Khe Kem Waterfall is located about 25 km from Con Cuong town (Con Cuong district, Nghe An province), considered a gift from nature to Pu Mat National Park.|||Khe Kem Waterfall is also called Kem Waterfall or Bo Bo, according to the Thai ethnic group's name meaning a white silk strip. As the waterfall drops from a height of over 500m, a slope of about 80°, through three tiers, it looks from afar like a white silk strip floating on the deep green of the forest.|||The path leading to Khe Kem Waterfall is winding, meandering, evergreen and cool throughout the year due to the ancient trees on both sides. Visitors can choose to travel by motorbike to experience and immerse themselves in the natural scenery and admire the beautiful landscape along the way.|||Upon arrival, the white foam of Khe Kem Waterfall will surely amaze visitors. Above and around the waterfall is a rich vegetation with lush greenery and hundreds of flower species blooming all year round. Different plants flowering in each season create the feeling for visitors as if they are in a wildflower garden.|||At the base of the waterfall is a long stream with flat stone slabs like large tables for visitors to rest. At the foot of the waterfall visitors will also see small ponds of varying depths, the clear water allowing visibility to the bottom, creating a wonderful natural landscape.|||In summer, the temperature at the waterfall area is about 20°C, making it very cool, so Khe Kem Waterfall is an ideal destination for visitors wanting to escape the scorching summer heat and immerse themselves in nature, enjoying the refreshing and cool atmosphere.|||Additionally, visitors can follow the trail to the top of the waterfall to enjoy the mountain scenery. From here, they can also go upstream to Khe Bu Valley or hike up Pu Loong Mountain – a high peak in Pu Mat National Park (the round-trip takes about 6-8 hours).|||During the exploration of Khe Kem Waterfall, visitors will experience the unique cultural and culinary heritage of the Thai ethnic group. The specialty dishes of the Thai people are prepared uniquely and delicious, including bamboo sticky rice, purple sticky rice, honey-glazed grilled chicken, Giang River Mat fish, stream shrimp, grilled pork, grilled frog, grilled crab with lemongrass...|||Khe Kem Waterfall is expected to become an attractive eco-cultural tourism destination with its magnificent mountainous scenery, connecting the unique cultural spaces of ethnic minorities. Every time visitors come here, they can immerse themselves in the pristine natural beauty of the mountains, regain mental tranquility, and achieve balance in life.

title: Tea Island Thanh Chuong
description: Located about 50 km northwest of Vinh City (Nghe An) Thanh Chuong Tea Hill (Thanh An Commune Thanh Chuong District Nghe An Province) has a total area of over 420 hectares and is also called "Tea Island" due to its unique characteristics that distinguish it from anywhere else.|||Thanh Chuong Tea Hill has a total area of over 420 hectares consisting of many small islands surrounding the Cau Cau Dam. Each tea island covers about 1 hectare and is cultivated in terraced winding patterns. From above they resemble fingerprint ridges that define the unique character of this land.|||Perhaps Thanh Chuong Tea Hill is one of the few tea hills where visitors must use boats to tour. Sitting on a small boat weaving through the green islands visitors can experience the unique beauty of the tea hill enjoy the extremely fresh and pleasant air with a faint scent of tea especially in the early morning when the sky is still misty and the scenery hasn't been awakened yet.|||Stopping by the small huts on the tea islands visitors can enjoy a crisp Cu Do candy and savor a cup of green tea with a sweet and bitter taste lingering on the tongue. Additionally visitors can stop by floating restaurants or visit local homes to taste famous local specialties such as Thanh Chuong jackfruit paste Gianh River fish Chua Market bamboo shoots La Mac sweet potatoes and hill chicken cooked in a clay pot...|||Unlike many tea hills that have seasonal cycles Thanh Chuong Tea Hill remains green cool and beautiful throughout the year. Therefore visitors can visit Thanh Chuong Tea Hill anytime to experience its serene and clear beauty and admire the lush poetic scenery of the tea islands.

title: Phong Nha Cave
description: Located within the Phong Nha – Ke Bang UNESCO World Natural Heritage Site, Phong Nha Cave is ranked among the most beautiful caves globally with criteria including the most beautiful underground river; highest and widest cave entrance; most beautiful sand and stone beaches; widest and most beautiful dry cave; most magical and grandest stalactites; longest water cave; and most beautiful underground lake.|||Phong Nha Cave is in Son Trach Commune (now Phong Nha Town), Bo Trach District, Quang Binh Province, about 45km northwest of Dong Hoi City. After arriving at Phong Nha tourist center, visitors take a boat along Son River for 30 minutes to reach the cave entrance. On the boat, visitors admire the scenery along both banks of Son River, where clear green water seems to touch the bottom, winding around limestone mountains to create a poetic landscape.|||Phong Nha Cave is 7,729 meters long with 14 caves and a 13,969-meter underground river. The cave entrance is about 10 meters high and 25 meters wide. From above, stalactites dripping down resemble giant dewdrops melting. Legend says the stalactites at the cave entrance contributed to the name "Phong Nha," meaning "Wind passes through the teeth."|||Phong Nha Cave has two sections: dry cave and water cave. The dry cave is 200 meters high. Geologists believe the underground river dried up long ago, leaving only white stone arches and emerald-green pillars. Stalactites in Phong Nha Cave formed over millions of years from karst limestone, dissolved by rainwater seeping through the cave ceiling to create unique formations like lions, golden thrones, and Buddhas. Rainwater continues to drip to the cave floor, depositing calcium to form stalagmites. Stalactites, stalagmites, and underground rivers in various shapes create a dazzling, majestic scene.|||Exploring Phong Nha Cave, visitors visit three representative caves: Co Tien, Bi Ky, and Cung Dinh. Each cave has distinct beauty. For example, Co Tien Cave has golden stalactites resembling a maiden's flowing hair. Cung Dinh Cave features stalactites shaped like the golden throne of an emperor.|||April to August is the best time to explore Phong Nha Cave due to less rain, making travel convenient for cave visits.|||After visiting the cave, try local specialties like canh porridge, brown rice crêpes, grilled snakehead fish, cassava flour dumplings, river shrimp, grilled eel, etc. Sticky yam and dried seafood are also popular souvenirs.

title: Jumping Stone Beach
description: Renowned as a masterpiece of sea sculpture, Jumping Stone Beach is a stunning destination you must visit when coming to Quang Binh.|||From National Highway 1A, heading north about 25km from Dong Hoi City, visitors will be amazed to see the natural rock formations right by the road. This is a cluster of rock mountains right at the beach, at the foot of Da Nhap Pass (also called Ly Hoa Pass, located in Thanh Trach Commune, Bo Trach District). Visitors can enjoy various recreational activities such as rowing, rock climbing, walking through pine forests, relaxing, and swimming in the cool, clear waters with gentle waves.|||What makes Jumping Stone Beach unique compared to its long coastline, golden sand, and emerald waters is the rock formations eroded by seawater over time, taking on unusual shapes like frogs, lying bulls, roosters and hens, kneeling tigers, crouching elephants, playfully dancing with the waves…, truly a masterpiece of nature.|||Especially notable is a well (locally called Coc Well) amidst the countless rock formations swaying in the sea waves, adding a unique charm to the place. Named Coc Well because a large rock resembling a frog sits over the well's mouth. The well is deep inside a cave; to fetch water, one must crawl into the 'frog's belly' to scoop it out. The water in Coc Well is very clear and clean, warm in winter and cool in summer, used by fishermen for rituals at the nearby Nam Hai Dai Vuong Temple.|||Jumping Stone Beach has coral reefs that provide a rich habitat for seafood like shrimp, squid, crabs, and various fish, making it an excellent spot to enjoy fresh seafood. Additionally, fish porridge with spicy mustard and mushrooms is a dish not to be missed here.|||Alongside the World Natural Heritage Site Phong Nha-Kẻ Bàng and other tourist attractions in Quang Binh, Jumping Stone Beach will be an ideal stop, offering visitors a comfortable experience and leaving a lasting positive impression.|||The best time to visit Quang Binh is from the beginning of the year until May. From June to August, the weather is quite sunny and hot, while from September onwards it's the rainy and cold season.|||With its unique characteristics, especially the diverse topography and cool climate combining forests, sea, mountains, and rocks, Jumping Stone Beach increasingly attracts many tourists for sightseeing and relaxation. Its enchanting beauty has left a mark in the hearts of travelers and has been recognized as a National Heritage Site.

title: Ba De Temple
description: The temple enshrines Lady De - the wife of Lord Trinh Giang.|||The temple was visited by King Tu Duc who bestowed the title Dong Nhac De Ba - Trinh Chua Phu Nhan.|||The temple has a simple yet elegant and graceful structure nestled against the mountain facing the vast sea creating a unique natural wonder that rivals Nam Thien De Nhat Dong - Chua Huong Temple.|||Like many temples in Vietnam this site originated from a legend. According to tradition in 1718 a Dao family in the eastern part of Ngoc Do Son had no children for twenty years. They practiced virtue and prayed to heaven for a child. Heaven moved by their sincerity granted a dream to the wife who became pregnant. After nine months Dao Thi Huong was born with a fragrant aura and radiant light following her everywhere. As she grew more beautiful she became renowned for her singing which could silence birds and waves.|||Lady De was exceptionally skilled and diligent in all tasks. She sang while tending cattle and cutting grass her voice echoing through mountains and forests. It was said her songs could stop birds from singing and waves from crashing.|||In 1736 Lord Trinh Giang visited Do Son and sailed on a dragon boat. Moved by her singing he ordered soldiers to find the singer. Upon meeting her he was captivated by her beauty and could not leave her side.|||When she became pregnant she feared for her safety and waited daily for his return. The village head demanded a fine they could not afford. Stripped of money they took her to Doc Mountain and drowned her.|||Before dying she cried to heaven I am a lonely woman who loved my husband but never betrayed my parents or neighbors. If my death is unjust let me rise three times from the water.|||Indeed she rose three times terrifying everyone. A month later his boat arrived to take her away. Learning of her injustice Lord Trinh Giang built this temple to clear her name. The temple was later visited by King Tu Duc who bestowed the title Dong Nhac De Ba - Trinh Chua Phu Nhan.|||People admired her loyalty and many scholars composed poems praising her:|||A heart as pure as ice heaven and earth know|||Sincere devotion ghosts and gods understand|||Empress De's incense and fire through the ages|||To resolve earthly grievances.|||Since then visitors from all directions flock to Ba De Temple to seek fortune and especially to resolve their own injustices.

title: Mạc Dynasty Memorial Site
description: According to the Complete Annals and Đại Việt General History, Mạc Đăng Dung (1483–1541) was from Co Trai village, Nghi Duong district, Kinh Mon district, Hai Duong town (now Co Trai village, Ngũ Doan commune, Kien Thuy district, Hai Phong City). He was the seventh-generation grandson of Top Scholar Mạc Đĩnh Chi from the Trần dynasty. Born in a coastal area, in his youth Mạc Đăng Dung worked as a fisherman but possessed exceptional intelligence and courage.|||In the martial arts competition during the reign of King Le Uy Muoc at Giang Vo Duong in Thang Long he passed the First-Rank Martial Arts Scholar exam and was appointed as a military officer in the Tuc Viet guard. During this period the Le dynasty weakened as generals formed factions and fought each other while peasants rebelled Mac Dang Dung was assigned to defend Hai Duong. King Le Chieu Thong in Thang Long was threatened by the rebellion of Nguyen Kinh Mac Dang Dung led troops back to the capital to rescue the king quelled the rebellion alone and was appointed Minister of State Affairs for Military and National Affairs Ta Pho Nhan Quoc Cong...|||In 1527 he was appointed as An Hung Wang by the Le dynasty. In June 1527 he was enthroned as king by Le Cong Hoang establishing the Mac dynasty with the era name Minh Duc. Following the Tran dynasty's example he ruled for two years. In 1529 he abdicated in favor of his eldest son Mac Dang Dinh (later Mac Thai Tong) becoming the Taishang Huang and established the Mac capital in present-day Hai Phong.|||Under the Mac dynasty, Vietnam achieved many economic, cultural, and social accomplishments recognized in history. It was a prosperous era for markets and bustling ports, with flourishing folk culture. Security and order were maintained with strict discipline. Economically, the Mac dynasty implemented agricultural promotion policies, prioritized land allocation for soldiers, and focused on land reclamation, village establishment, and dike construction. Unlike the early Le dynasty's 'agriculture-focused, commerce-suppressed' policy, the Mac dynasty adopted open policies for domestic and foreign trade, developing commodity production and connecting domestic markets with foreign ones. Mac dynasty's Hoa Lam ceramics from Bach Trang and Nam Sach were unique and exquisite, exported to many countries in the region. Crafts such as sculpture and bell casting were encouraged to develop.|||The Mac dynasty always emphasized examination policies and talent cultivation for the country (including for women). An assembly examination was held every three years. A total of 22 examination sessions were conducted, awarding 477 doctors, 11 top scholars, 12 honor scholars, and 19 special scholars (second only to the reign of King Le Thanh Tong). Notable among them was Trang Trinh Nguyen Binh Khiem, the "bright star" of the 16th century. At that time, Mac Dang Dung built Duong Kinh at Co Tai, his hometown, with an extensive system of palaces, towers, and schools such as Cac Duong Tu, Tuong Quang and Phuc Huy Halls, Quoc Hing Office, Leng Tomb, military forts, and grain warehouses. To make Duong Kinh become "a coastal city in the East", the Mac dynasty constructed commercial ports on the shore and under ships for domestic and international trade, such as Lu Minh Thi, An Quy, Do Nha, while also building, restoring, and renovating many historical sites, especially temples in Co Tai and surrounding areas.|||The Mac Dynasty existed for 65 years before being overthrown by the Trinh feudal forces under the pretense of supporting the Le in Thang Long in 1592.|||The Mac Dynasty had 5 kings: Mac Dang Dung (1527 - 1529), Mac Dang Doanh (1530 - 1540), Mac Phuc Hai (1541 - 1546), Mac Phuc Nguyen (1547 - 1561) and Mac Mau Hop (1562 - 1592).|||Recognizing the rightful status of the Mac Dynasty and Yang Kinh in 2004 the Ministry of Culture and Information decided to classify the site recognizing "The Mac family's ancestral hall in Co Trai Kien Thuy district Hai Phong city is a National Historical and Cultural Site".|||Due to historical events, the Ma Family Temple has endured over 400 years, the only original structure dedicated to Lord Ma Thai To and Lord Ma Thai Tong, preserved on this sacred land, the ancestral homeland of the dynasty, built by the descendants of Ma Co Trai and the local people over a hundred years ago.|||Today, the structure is cramped, small, and simple, with leaks and a risk of collapse at any moment.|||Carrying forward the ancient development thread through the strength of unity and creative thinking the people of Duong Kinh and Kien Thuy continue to preserve and promote traditions Building this place into an address that attracts not only Mạc clan branches nationwide but also visitors from all over who come to offer incense and commemorate the Mạc dynasty kings contributing to the education of patriotic traditions for future generations

title: Viet Hai Fishing Village
description: Viet Hai Fishing Village is a small village located deep within Cat Ba National Park, in Cat Hai district, Hai Phong province. Because it is deep in the forest with winding roads, few domestic visitors came here before. However, nowadays Viet Hai Village is attracting many foreign tourists, especially as a popular destination for cycling tours.|||In the past, Viet Hai was almost completely isolated from the outside world. Because of the wild, deserted mountains and forests whenever the road was flooded during the rainy season the locals would casually go naked to wade through the water. Mr. Hoang a resident of Cat Ba confessed that he had been living in this village for over 10 years due to the naked incidents. On one occasion he brought herbal medicine to sell to the villagers and when he reached the middle of the stream he encountered a girl in the same state as himself. The girl shy and embarrassed threw her clothes and belongings into the water. After that he voluntarily lent her his clothes to wear temporarily. They became acquainted fell in love and eventually got married.|||The people of Viet Hai still maintain a life with a 'primitive' character as from ancient times. The entire village has over ten old Chinese motorcycles from the wealthiest families in the village used to drive around a few kilometers on the newly opened concrete road.|||After running, this person abandoned the car in a corner by the roadside leaving the key in the car. Anyone who wants to take the car can do so then return it to its original place. The house is open day and night even if the owner is away for a few days no one steals the belongings. If this house has something to attend to there is no need to report it the whole village comes to help. The belongings of this house can be freely used by others if they need them. Because of this the entire village has only two police officers who mainly handle administrative tasks. Viet Hai is almost completely free of all types of social evils.|||Viet Hai is currently the most remote and difficult commune of Cat Hai district. However the local people seem quite satisfied with their poor material but rich in sentiment life. Living together sharing without calculation or profit-seeking thriving amidst mountains forests and the sea. Party Secretary of the commune Dinh Van Thuy revealed that it is precisely this cultural aspect that has attracted an increasing number of foreign tourists. In recent years tens of thousands of tourists have crossed streams and climbed over mountains to visit. They have heard of a pristine land located within the world biosphere reserve and Cat Ba National Park.|||The Viet Hai people have also shown keen sensitivity when starting to engage in tourism. The village decided to send a group to Hanoi, even to Ho Chi Minh City, to learn tourism methods to apply to the village. There is also a 'forest people' tourism company launching operations in this remote mountain hamlet, run by local residents. Mountain bikes bought from Hai Phong via boat to the village serve Western tourists cycling to view the village and climb mountains. Some people also work as farmers while serving as motorbike taxi drivers to take tourists around the village.|||A few stilt houses and small restaurants serving tourists have just opened. Foreign visitors come here after touring the mountains and forests stopping at the restaurants where locals prepare meals using food they grow and raise such as chickens ducks and fresh vegetables Many village elders and youth volunteer to act as 'tourist guides' for visitors the elders have also selected nearly a dozen local young men and women to send to Cat Ba to 'update' their common English The people of Viet Hai are eager to develop tourism with the dream of transforming their village into a unique 'tourist island' in the future.

title: Cat Ba Archipelago
description: Located about 60 km from the city center, Cat Ba Archipelago is a destination in Hai Phong that attracts many people. This archipelago is adjacent to Halong Bay, off the coast of Hai Phong City. In addition to island tourism, Cat Ba is the only place in Vietnam to hold three national and international titles: Cat Ba National Park, marine conservation area, and a UNESCO Biosphere Reserve.|||Today, Cat Ba Island has developed strongly in tourism thanks to its beautiful landscapes. The area has hundreds of large and small islands, numerous attractive natural beaches, and a pristine forest with rare flora and fauna. Visiting Cat Ba, you'll immerse yourself in the pristine and enchanting beauty of blue sea, white sand, and golden sun, enjoying the harmonious seascapes with nature's perfect color palette. And one thing you mustn't forget is to taste the fresh, nutritious seafood from the sea here!|||Attractions and activities on Cat Ba Island:|||Overall, the Cat Ba Archipelago is quite large, so most tourists who visit here want to return to discover more. As the island is quite far from the mainland, to have a complete trip, you should go on a tour or with experienced guides!

title: Flower Shop
description: Compared to many other cities in the country with a long history such as Hanoi Nam Dinh Hue Hoi An Ho Chi Minh City Hai Phong is a young city.|||The foundation of Hai Phong city was originally a fishing village near the river mouth with a market boat dock customs station and coastal guard outpost.|||As early as 1885 based on the Lach Liem Khe Consul Bonnan ordered the excavation of a canal connecting Tam Bac River with Cam River named the Bonnan Canal. Along this canal there were many bridges crossing it. Later due to the need for urban development and expansion the French filled in the Bonnan Canal leaving only a part as the current Tam Bac Lake. On the filled section of the canal commercial buildings markets and flower gardens were constructed.|||Pon Dume Bridge connects Pon Dume Street now Cau Dat Street with Saratsi Street now Quang Trung Street and is also located in the filled section of the canal. In 1944 the flower shop was built at this location and still exists today.|||According to existing documents the Hai Phong flower shop was led by Director Luyxiani and designed technically by Chief Engineer Gochie. To construct the building they had to select from dozens of design proposals by architects nationwide to ensure the structure harmonized with the surrounding architectural complex while maintaining Eastern artistic style.|||There are a total of 5 flower shops each with an area of nearly 20m² height of nearly 4m spaced 6m apart covering a total area of 300m². The shops were designed with four lim wood pillars stone bases and lim wood beam systems with four tiled roofs. After several renovations the overall architecture of the five flower shops has been somewhat simplified but still retains their original form.|||According to elderly accounts after the flower shop inauguration in August 1944 before the Japanese coup against the French each flower shop then had two women in modern ao dai standing to sell fresh flowers to everyone.|||The flower shops still exist today though the curved eaves of the templestyle roofs the patterned floral edges on the shop roofs the stone flower bases and the two flower displays of tigon and lanh tieu at the beginning of the row facing Nguyen Duc Canh Street have been destroyed by time.|||Today at this location the old tradition is still maintained most flower sellers are young the sales style has changed but there are now more varieties of flowers much more beautiful than before.|||Along with dozens of other sites named after shops in the city that still exist today the flower shops serve as a highlight in Hai Phongs central urban area creating a unique and graceful charm for the Port City.

title: Lan Ha Bay
description: Lan Ha Bay is located to the east of Cat Ba Island and adjacent to Halong Bay to the south. Lan Ha Bay covers an area of over 7000 hectares including a relatively pristine archipelago with about 400 large and small islands densely packed to form a vast enchanting landscape.|||The unique feature of the bay is that many islands have sandy beaches at their foot making the beauty even more vibrant allowing tourists to dock their boats to play on the sand or swim at these pristine beaches. In Lan Ha Bay is the floating village of Cai Beo where over 200 households live in houses built on rafts and the village with a history spanning thousands of years is being studied by both local and foreign archaeologists. Tourists often rent boats for 3-4 hours with a schedule from Ben Beo port - Cai Beo Bay - visiting fish farms (if buying fish ask the price carefully) or visiting Ba Trai Dao Island - returning to swim rest and refresh at Khi Island before returning to Ben Beo port.|||Unlike Halong Bay Lan Ha Bay has up to 139 small charming and secluded golden sand beaches like green straits inviting tourists to explore. Many of these beaches stretch between two rock mountains quiet without large waves truly ideal for swimming. Under the clear blue water are colorful coral reefs like Van Boi Beach Van Ha Beach Calm sea areas like Sen Island Cu Island Khi Island are where tourists can snorkel to see corals.|||Thanks to its natural pristine and tranquil beauty Lan Ha Bay is now developed as a popular tourist resort destination for both domestic and international visitors second only to Halong Bay. Although not yet widely known among tourists Lan Ha Bay is considered one of the most beautiful bays in Vietnam. When the weather turns to autumn it's the most beautiful time for Lan Ha Bay with gentle sunlight not too hot and the cool ocean breeze allowing tourists to comfortably enjoy the refreshing and peaceful experience while boating to admire the bay.|||On the bay tour the group will visit Khi Island - here visitors have the chance to meet playful monkey troops making it ideal for families with children. Khi Island also has Cat Dua Beach the most beautiful satellite beach of Cat Ba Island with crystal-clear seawater. In front of the beach are undulating mountain ranges creating a unique bay edge. However to reach the island one must cross a 2 km sea stretch as the crow flies. You can also book a room at Monkey Island Resort and stay overnight at this resort to experience island life close to the fresh natural environment.

title: Cat Ba National Park
description: Cat Ba National Park was established on March 31 1986 under decision number 79/CP of the Vietnamese Council of Ministers (now the government). Includes marine ecosystems terrestrial forest ecosystems and mangrove forest ecosystems. The entire Cat Ba National Park consists of a rugged mountainous area with high elevation.|||Cat Ba National Park has an area of 26,240 hectares including 17,040 hectares of island land and 9,200 hectares of sea surface. This is a place where various ecosystems converge: mangrove forest ecosystem limestone mountain forest ecosystem marine forest ecosystem with coral reefs. There is a diverse flora and fauna including 2,320 species of flora and fauna of which 282 species of animals live in the forest 538 species of animals live at the seabed 196 species of sea fish 771 species of terrestrial plants 23 species of mangrove plants 75 species of seaweed 177 species of coral|||Cat Ba Archipelago has up to 60 rare endemic species listed in Vietnam's Red Book such as: White-headed Langur White-cheeked Gibbon Spotted Nutcracker Black Squirrel...; plants include Tho Phuc Linh Lat Hua Kim Giao Sen Mat. Particularly in Trung Trang area there is a Kim Giao forest a unique tree species growing in clusters covering dozens of hectares in the center of the garden. According to recent surveys Cat Ba currently has only over 60 White-headed Langurs the only endemic species in the country and the world.|||When visiting Cat Ba, you should rent a motorcycle to go anywhere you want; there are many accommodation options. The most beautiful are the hotels nestled against the mountains, facing the sea. Cat Ba has over 60 hotels with 1,000 rooms concentrated along the coastal street near the bay's edge. Room prices vary, starting at around 150,000 VND per room per night. Visitors to Cat Ba will be captivated by the sea's beauty, discovering limestone mountain ranges with fascinating caves, interspersed with pristine, soft white sand beaches. The limestone mountains have an average height of 150m, with the highest peak, Cao Vong, reaching 322m above sea level.|||The sunset over Cat Ba Archipelago is a multicolored spectacle. The horizon glows bright golden while the sea turns deep indigo. At the fishing port thousands of boats anchored there light up creating a mystical starry night! You will be invited to floating restaurants on the water where lanterns welcome guests. You can enjoy specialty dishes like waterfall fish salad sour red fish soup and especially grilled tu hai with its smoky aroma. Tu hai is a type of sea clam with an egg-shaped slightly tapered shell about 10cm long. When stimulated it ejects a strong jet of water hence its name meaning child's beard. In Vietnam only Cat Ba has tu hai which typically appear in December their breeding season. Today tu hai are farmed year-round to supply restaurants across Hai Phong and Cat Ba.|||The allure of Cat Ba lies in its sea. After a day of mountain climbing or exploring caves you can refresh yourself in the crystal-clear waters and lie on the soft white sand. At night Cat Ba's space is vast majestic and breathtakingly beautiful. Spending the night here is a wonderful experience with the cool air and gentle sea breeze carrying a salty scent into the forest on the rocky mountains creating a rustling sound that lulls visitors into a peaceful sleep.

title: Vinh Hy Bay
description: One of the most popular tourist attractions in Ninh Thuan Vinh Hy Bay must not be missed. Nature generously bestows it with a magnificent and pristine landscape with vast blue sea on one side and towering mountains on the other.|||Vinh Hy Bay is about 42 km northeast of Phan Rang – Thap Cham city. The winding road leading to the bay occasionally reveals white salt fields or lush vineyards inviting tourists to visit. The special feature of Vinh Hy Bay is that it is surrounded by mountains on the East West and North sides adjacent to Nui Chua National Park with the sea to the southeast.|||When visiting Vinh Hy tourists should not miss the chance to swim in the clear blue sea and snorkel to see the stunning coral reefs. Currently there are convenient glass-bottom boat tours on the bay especially suitable for non-swimmers who want to enjoy the colorful coral reefs and schools of fish swimming leisurely beneath the blue sea. It is known that Vinh Hy has over 300 coral species including 50 newly discovered in Vietnam.|||Vinh Hy Bay also captivates tourists with its friendly and simple fishing village residents. Chatting with them helps tourists better understand their lives and listen to ancient legends about the area's early days. All these factors make Vinh Hy Bay a must-visit destination for any tourist visiting Khanh Hoa.

title: Hang Rai
description: Hang Rai is one of the most beloved spots for tourists due to its pristine natural scenery with the sea's clear blue color the majesty of the mountains and the mystery of the uniquely shaped rocks... like a picturesque fairyland.|||Hang Rai is located to the south of Vinh Hy Bay at the foot of Nui Chua National Park about 35km from Phan Rang city. The name Hang Rai comes from the fact that this area is home to many species of fish-eating dolphins which tourists may spot in groups searching for food or returning to their caves. The second explanation comes from the presence of many rai trees a type of tree used to extract oil for coating boats to prevent water seepage during sea voyages.|||Hang Rai is most beautiful from November to February when the rocky shore is covered with green moss resembling a soft fur carpet.|||Visiting Hang Rai the most striking feature for tourists is the rocky shore with peculiar shapes rising from the sea. It is known that this area was once an ancient coral reef that has calcified forming a two-tiered rock formation. The lower tier lies just a few centimeters below sea level with flat wide surfaces while the upper tier is 2m higher featuring hundreds of sharp stone spires 20–30cm tall and rounded hollows.|||With each tide waves surge up the rocks then recede like small waterfalls on the sea surface. This rugged yet mysterious beauty makes the rocks at Hang Rai a magnet for photographers seeking to capture dynamic natural scenes.|||Hang Rai's charm changes throughout the day. At dawn morning light filters through the rock crevices dancing on the blue sea creating a gentle yet vibrant scene. But at dusk the area takes on a melancholic romantic atmosphere reminding visitors to relax and quietly savor this moment leaving behind daily worries.

title: Nam Cuong Sand Dunes
description: One of the most striking impressions for visitors mentioning Ninh Thuan is the golden sand dunes stretching endlessly into the horizon. When the wind blows, the sand on the dunes transforms constantly, taking on different forms that require keen observation to notice the subtle and delicate beauty.|||Located in Ninh Phuoc district, 8km from Phan Rang-Thap Cham city, Nam Cuong Sand Dunes are close enough for visitors to reach from the city center. With an area of about 700ha and a height of 10-20m, this spot is ideal for visitors to run freely or experience the thrill of exploring the dunes in jeeps.|||Ninh Thuan is a land of sun and wind, so the ideal time to visit Nam Cuong Sand Dunes is at dawn. When the first rays of sunlight rise on the horizon, the interplay of light and shadow creates a magical and ethereal scene.|||The image of Cham girls walking on the smooth sand, morning sunlight dancing on their shoulders, and the full moon glowing in the sky is one of the most beautiful moments at Nam Cuong Sand Dunes. Contrasting the vast dunes are the graceful and charming beauty of Cham girls in traditional attire. From afar, they resemble fairy dancers performing a moonlit "moon-picking" dance.|||Standing on the highest dune, visitors can see the majestic Chà Bang mountain range in the distance. From April to June each year, locals hold a solemn Pô Nai worship ceremony on this mountain to pray for peace and good fortune. Visiting Nam Cuong Sand Dunes allows visitors to witness and understand more about the beauty and spiritual culture of the Cham people.|||Perhaps it is this elegance and subtle mystery that makes Nam Cuong Sand Dunes an attractive destination not only for visitors exploring but also for artistic photographers. Like Nam Cuong is an enigma, constantly urging travelers to come and experience, to personally witness the raw and mysterious beauty of nature.

title: Co Thach Sea
description: Belongs to the territory of Binh Thanh commune (Tu Phong district, Binh Thuan province), Co Thach Sea is blessed by nature with an attractive landscape.|||Co Thach is famous for its extremely unique landscapes like outer space, rock formations with shapes hard to find elsewhere, Hang Temple, and the Seven-Color Rock Beach, which delight many tourists.|||Located in the central coastal province with year-round sunshine and wind, Co Thach can be visited almost all year round, but tourists should avoid July and August due to rough seas and black jellyfish making the sea water less clear.|||Most adventurers and photographers choose to visit Co Thach in March, which is also the season for moss hunting in Co Thach. At that time, all large and small rocks at Co Thach Sea are covered with dark green moss, like putting on a new strange layer. Then, when the sun rises, the green color gradually turns into a bright yellow.|||Seven-Color Rock Beach (Ca Dua Rock Beach): This can be said to be the most attractive spot of Co Thach, one of the unique landscapes of Vietnam. Located in the Co Thach tourist area, the Seven-Color Rock Beach is close to the sea, including many rocks with various shapes and colors.|||Not only colorful rock beaches, Co Thach Sea also attracts tourists with large rocks with very unique shapes. Some look like a squid curling its tentacle to spray water, some look like an ostrich soaking in the sea, some look like a clenched hand.|||Hang Temple: Co Thach Temple, also known as Hang Temple, is an ancient stone temple over 100 years old. The temple is currently located in the Co Thach tourist area, in Binh Thanh commune, Tu Phong district, Binh Thuan province.|||Mineral mud bath at Vinh Hao: A location near the Co Thach tourist area, Vinh Hao's mineral water has long been famous. If you have the chance to visit Co Thach, don't miss the opportunity to soak in mineral mud or relax in the warm mineral water. The mineral water here not only helps you relax, relieve stress and fatigue, but also beautifies the skin and improves blood circulation.

title: Cu Lao Cau Island
description: Cu Lao Cau is also known by fishermen as Hon Cau because it has many sea grapes. This island belongs to Binh Thuan province located about 8 km from the mainland and 110 km northeast of Phan Thiet city. Surrounding it are thousands of limestone rocks in various shapes and colors forming fascinating caves.|||Cu Lao Cau is a new rising "paradise" that's causing a buzz among travel enthusiasts. Wild mysterious and interesting are the highlights Cu Lao Cau offers to those who have set foot here. Cu Lao Cau is suitable for those who love exploring the beauty of the sea and enjoy adventurous feelings.|||The best time to visit the island is from the 4th to 8th lunar months when the sea is calm the breeze is gentle and the sea is blue and enchanting.|||Cu Lao Cau is a small island with an area of about 1.5 km so visitors can easily explore the entire island in a day with many fascinating scenic spots.|||San Ho Beach has beautiful coral reefs. This area concentrates many species of coral in various shapes and colors. When visiting San Ho Beach visitors can experience exciting activities like snorkeling to see the corals. Snorkeling here is an unique experience with a primitive coral reef over 2 km long containing nearly 234 types of coral.|||Ba Hon Cave is also a popular tourist spot in Cu Lao Cau. The name Ba Hon originated from three large upright rocks forming strange and eye-catching shapes.|||Besides exploring nature discovering caves and snorkeling in the clear blue water organizing an overnight camp on the island is also an interesting experience. In the evening visitors can organize a small party light a bonfire sing and dance. At night they can lie under the sky watching the sparkling stars feeling the soft waves and enjoying the beautiful natural scenery.|||Visiting Cu Lao Cau visitors can enjoy seafood specialties like vú nàng snails moon crabs and clam meat. Additionally other seafood here is also abundant and reasonably priced.

title: Gianh River
description: Perhaps when mentioning Quang Binh - a land of white rice and clear water one cannot fail to mention the Gianh River which has been part of the nation's history for generations. The Gianh River (whose literary name is Dai Linh Giang) is one of the five major rivers of Quang Binh province. The river is located over 40km from the provincial capital of Dong Hoi crosses National Highway 1A 5km northwest of Cua Gianh and has a deep riverbed with strong water flow.|||Gianh River originates from four sources: Son, Nan, Tro, and Nai.
