The Gianh River has a deep riverbed and strong water flow, starting from the rugged Truong Son mountains, navigating through mountains and forests, creating many rapids and waterfalls before flowing into the East Sea. With a length of 152 km and a width of up to 900 m in some areas, it passes through the lands of four districts: Minh Hoa, Tuyen Hoa, Bo Trach, and Quang Trach. The river has five small islets, with the longest island approximately 3.8 km and the widest about 0.8 km. When the Gianh River reaches the estuary, it narrows slightly and merges with a smaller river called Rao Chua, also known as Rao Bo Khe and Thanh Trach on the southern bank.|||Along both banks, from the river mouth to the upland rice fields, cassava terraces, and mulberry groves, a vivid green color prevails, with lively and bustling villages. Along the river are villages, some purely agricultural, some craft-based, some cultural. Villages like La Ha, Thanh Thuy, and Hoa Ninh have produced countless heroes and outstanding talents. Numerous village names, landform names, and mountain names along the Gianh River evoke ancient legends and historical tales: Con Rong, Trooc, Tien Le, Thi Dan, Le Son. Just these names alone reveal much about the life, history, and culture of the villages that the Gianh River winds through day and night. In the 17th century, the Gianh River was the frontline of the Trinh-Nguyen war. Many bloody battles were fought here between the armies of the North and South. During the Trinh-Nguyen war, the Trinh forces occupied Deo Ngang, but the actual North-South boundary was the Gianh River. The northern bank had Ba Dung market where the Trinh forces bought food and traded goods. The southern bank had Nguyen dynasty fortifications built by Dao Duy Tu, such as Thay Fort (18km long) and Truong Duc Fort (10km long). During the anti-French and anti-American wars, the Gianh River became a 'coordinate of fire and bullets', bearing the scars of war with bombs and mines, filled with heroic feats and historical evidence.|||The ups and downs of history have passed; discover the beauty of Gianh River today. This place is also known as where earth and sky harmonize a fairyland-like realm. When the tide rises waves crashing against the rocky cliffs create a fascinating and mysterious beauty that no other river possesses. If you have the chance to cruise along the Gianh River you'll experience the serene enchanting beauty that captivates the heart. Perhaps the grandeur and poetic beauty of Gianh River have become a source of inspiration for poets and literati.|||In the nation's sacred resistance war Gianh River Ferry Landing became a famous historical site. Since the large bridge was built across the Gianh River transportation along the North-South highway has become more convenient. The Sông Gianh Victory Memorial Gianh Port Gianh Bridge... today stand tall and majestic under the blue sky serving as evidence of the transformation and progress of this land connecting both banks of the legendary river.

title: Lan Co Bay
description: Lan Co Bay is located in Phu Loc district, Thua Thien Hue province, adjacent to National Highway 1A, right at the foot of Hai Van Pass, about 60 km from Hue city center and 20 km from Da Nang city. The bay is 42.5 km long, with the Lan Co beach having a beautiful, smooth white sand beach over 10 km long, clear blue sea water, and many resort areas.|||Lan Co Bay is a nearly pristine sea bay with picturesque mountain and water scenery and is one of the famous tourist attractions of Thua Thien Hue. The name 'Lan Co' is believed by some to be a mispronunciation by the French of 'An Cu', originally a fishing village in the southern part of the lagoon. Others believe that in the past, there were many herons in Lan Co, so it was called 'Lang Co', which was later mispronounced by locals as Lan Co.|||Considered one of the ideal resort destinations because the bay is nestled between a branch of the Truong Son mountain range extending to the sea, with Hai Van Pass on one side and Phu Gia Pass on the other, Lan Co appears as a beautiful sand dune stretching along tropical forests, winding mountain roads, and curved rock mountain ranges, offering exciting adventures into the jungle and sea; experiencing various types of beach tourism such as swimming, diving, or relaxing.|||The ideal time to visit Lan Co is in summer, from April to July, when visitors can easily enjoy a wonderful vacation. Additionally, the cuisine in Lan Co is rich and diverse with fresh, delicious seafood. The most special is the oysters. Oysters in Lan Co have a rich, salty sweetness mixed with a unique creamy flavor.|||With its convenient location and beautiful natural scenery along with many famous resorts, Lan Co Bay – one of the most beautiful bays in the world – is an ideal destination chosen by many tourists for their summer trips.

title: Bach Ma Mountain
description: From Hue City, following National Highway 1A about 40km south to Cau Hai town (Phu Loc district), then turning right about 19km, visitors will reach Bach Ma National Park. Located at the southernmost part of the Northern Truong Son range extending from the Vietnam-Laos border to the East Sea, at an elevation of 1,450m above sea level, Bach Ma mountain area has a fresh cool climate and is rated by foreign experts as one of the most pleasant mountain regions in Indochina.|||Within its 22,031 hectares of natural area Bach Ma National Park has up to 16,900 hectares of primary forest coverage. The forest has 1,406 plant species including precious wood types such as tro chi kien ghe huong go tung (many trees with diameters of 80-100cm) and over 300 species of precious medicinal plants such as ba gac binh voi la khoi and the seven-leaf-one-flower tree|||Bach Ma has up to 931 animal species including 83 mammal species such as bears tigers saola; 333 bird species 31 reptile species 21 amphibian species 39 fish species 218 butterfly species 178 leaf-eating hard-shelled insects 28 termite species. Bach Ma is home to rare birds like trisao and blue crested pheasant.|||Visiting Bach Ma National Park visitors can explore fascinating natural trails such as the Trí Sao trail leading to Trí Sao Waterfall home to many Trí Sao pheasants; the Do Quyen trail leading to Do Quyen Waterfall where white foam cascades year-round into stream gullies; the Ngũ Hồ trail leading to five interconnected lakes formed from a large stream; and the Vong Hai Dai trail leading to the viewing platform atop Bach Ma Mountain. From this vantage point visitors can admire the full view of Hai Van Pass Tuy Van Mountain Dam Cau Hai Thuy Phien Gate and Cham Mu Bay along the East Sea coast as well as the mystical atmosphere of Hue City and Da Nang City at night. Additionally visitors can explore a 300m trail through the blackwood forest featuring many ancient trees with diameters over 1m and heights exceeding 30m. Furthermore Bach Ma National Park also has an orchid collection garden housing hundreds of orchid species in unique colors and shapes.|||In 1932, the French built a large resort in Bach Ma at an altitude of 1,000 - 1,444 meters above sea level. The resort included 139 villas, a market, bank, post office, swimming pool, tennis court, and a 19km road system connecting National Highway 1A with the central Bach Ma area.|||Currently, the old villa area has been restored by the Bach Ma National Park Management Board into a resort named Do Quyen, Sao La, Kim Giao. These villas still retain the French architectural style, usually only two stories high with spiral staircases and wide corridors. Large windows face the mountain peak creating a spacious atmosphere that is both ancient and modern.|||The best time for visitors to enjoy Bach Ma is in summer and early autumn when the weather is cool and even slightly cool, making the exploration and adventure more enjoyable.|||Here, scenic spots and historical sites blend together to create a unique and highly attractive charm.

title: Cao Linh Temple
description: Cao Linh Temple has an area of 49000 square meters and is located at the western gateway of Hai Phong city. The temple was built in a high dry and spacious area in Ha Lien now known as Bac Ha hamlet Bac Son commune An Duong district Hai Phong city.|||The temple is about 12 km from the city center next to National Highway 10 connecting the provinces of Quang Ninh – Hai Phong – Thai Binh – Nam Dinh – Ninh Binh.|||Behind is National Highway 5 connecting Hai Phong – Hai Duong and the capital Hanoi.|||According to historical records the temple may have been built by the Le Van family in Ha Lien village the stone tablet inside the temple records the last renovation during the Later Le dynasty over 300 years ago Cao Linh Temple has an area of about 49000m2 In front of the temple is the Thien Van mountain range in Kien An and behind it is the Ha Lien River|||Initially, the temple was built with three rooms in the front hall, two rooms in the rear chamber, five rooms for ancestral halls, and three low-roofed kitchen rooms, primarily serving as a place for pilgrims from all directions to worship and rest. During the anti-French resistance years, the temple participated in anti-French activities alongside the communists. The temple was burned by the French colonialists, losing 20 rooms. It wasn’t until 2001, through the grace of the Buddhas and the merits of the Buddhist leaders, and with the approval of the local government, that the temple was entrusted to Venerable Thich Thanh Giac, Deputy Chairman of the Hai Phong Buddhist Council and abbot of Pho Chieu Temple in Hai Phong City, to serve as abbot. The abbot and the monks and laypeople devised a restoration and renovation plan to achieve the current appearance.|||Cao Linh Temple boasts a magnificent and grand architecture, blending the ancient Eastern charm with the modern Western architectural style. The temple features a massive three-tier system with curved roofs adorned with dragon motifs and seated figures. The temple wall is decorated with a relief of Amida Buddha surrounded by clouds, creating a vibrant and solemn beauty.|||At the center of the three-tiered structure are the Three Western Saints intricately carved with great skill. On top of the highest roof of the three tiers is the image of the Dharma wheel symbolizing reincarnation above which is the无忧 lotus representing endless purity. Beyond the three tiers lies the vast and solemn courtyard with both sides of the path to the main hall lined with upright Buddha statues arranged in straight rows and a central incense altar filled with burning incense all arranged with meticulous precision.|||In addition the temple also has many beautiful and impressive structures such as stupas housing the ashes of the abbots of Chua Cao Linh a 3.2-ton bronze bell and a stone screen with six principles considered the core teachings of the temple. However what makes visitors and Buddhist followers feel their minds become peaceful and light is the garden where Buddha Shakyamuni taught his main disciples.|||The central circular area is a fountain, alongside a statue of Buddha Shakyamuni seated in the Dharma wheel-turning pose with his main disciples solemnly listening, creating a respectful atmosphere for worship and forgetting worries.|||Each courtyard and area of the temple has been arranged skillfully and scientifically by the abbot and builders with their virtue and talent to maintain solemnity, reverence, and adherence to basic rules.|||With unique architectural features and rich Buddhist cultural heritage, The Temple is a center for religious activities for Buddhist followers throughout the city.|||This is a popular tourist attraction that draws both local and international visitors and is a standout feature in the scenic landscape of the famous Nui Vo tourist area.

title: Ta Nang Trekking Route
description: Ta Nang Trekking Route is famous for its rich and diverse vegetation, stunning and poetic natural landscapes. To explore this area, you must descend from 1,100m to 500m above sea level, crossing rivers, climbing over mountain passes, and traversing dense green forests. The challenging terrain attracts many adventure enthusiasts seeking to conquer it.|||The Ta Nang – Phan Dung trekking route starts in Ta Nang commune, Duc Trong district, Lam Dong province, and ends in Phan Dung commune, Tuy Phong district, Binh Thuan province, with a length of approximately 50km. June to December is the best time for this trekking route.|||On this route, travelers will cross rivers, climb mountain passes, traverse dense green forests, and pass through various terrains and ecosystems: rice fields, coffee hills, pine forests, grassy hills, and dry forests. Throughout the journey, there are many magnificent landscapes.|||Currently, there are two main routes: the Do Linh route and the Yaly Waterfall route. The Do Linh route is approximately 40km long, with vegetation on both sides, gentle slopes, making it easier to travel, and takes 2 days and 1 night to conquer. The Yaly Waterfall route is about 50km long, with slippery and winding paths, many slopes, mostly tall pine trees, and takes 3 days and 2 nights to conquer. The trekking route has many consecutive slopes requiring participants to exert effort to reach the hilltops.|||Typically, trekking groups set up camp at Hai Cay Thong Hill Campsite for overnight stays. The campsite is located on a high hill with a wide view. Here, travelers can witness both the magical sunset and sunrise.|||To trek safely and fully appreciate the pristine, majestic beauty of nature along the entire Ta Nang – Phan Dung route, travelers need to be well-equipped with necessary skills. Since venturing deep into the forest, there is almost no phone signal, and at night temperatures drop with strong winds, so prepare clothing, heating devices, sleeping bags, etc. For easier and more convenient travel, people should hire portage services to transport belongings to the hilltop.|||According to local advice, travelers should avoid trekking this area during the middle of the rainy season because even though the first part of the route doesn't pass through many rivers or waterfalls, the wet soil and stones will be extremely slippery. Conversely, trekking during the dry season or the end of the rainy season, following experienced guides, ensures safety and allows enjoying the stunning scenery along the entire route.|||This is a challenging trekking route, but precisely because of that, it attracts many adventurers who love nature and enjoy exploring. In return, all the wonderful experiences gained from the journey will surely not disappoint travelers.

title: Elephant Mountain Heritage Site
description: Elephant Mountain is located in An Lao district, 20 km from the city center. Elephant Mountain - Xuan Son is a complex of limestone and soil mountains, interspersed with each other, undulating through the areas of Truong Thanh, An Tien, and An Thanh communes in An Lao district, Hai Phong city.|||Elephant Mountain has many beautiful caves: Họng Voi Cave, Chieng Cave, Carp Cave, Bể Cave... The southern side has Nam Tao Cave, the northern side has Bac Dao Cave. Inside the caves are numerous stalactites and stalagmites in various shapes such as dragons, tigers, elephant heads... On the summit of Elephant Mountain is a relatively flat area called the Chessboard of the Immortals.|||Not only fascinating with the natural beauty of the landscape, Elephant Mountain also sparks curiosity for those who love exploration because it is the cradle of prehistoric and early historical people. French archaeologists have proven Elephant Mountain to be an archaeological site with artifacts dating back about 3000 years such as stone axes, stone adzes, stone weights, stone grinding stones; or bronze weapons like bronze spears, bronze daggers.|||In addition, the Elephant Mountain heritage and scenic complex is also famous for its ancient cultural architecture like Chi Lai Temple. The temple worships Cao Son Dai Vuong, a loyal general of Hung Duyet Vuong (the 18th Hung King).|||It has become a tradition that the Elephant Mountain Festival in An Lao district, Hai Phong city, with the cultural color of the coastal people, takes place from the 12th to the 14th of February. This is an opportunity for visitors to learn about this ancient land with a rich history and participate in unique cultural activities. During the anti-French and anti-American wars, Elephant Mountain became legendary with the image of female militia members hanging on cliffs, mid-sky watching planes fall.|||With its rugged terrain, large caves, and surrounded by two major rivers Lach Tray and Da Do, providing convenient water and land transportation, Elephant Mountain was chosen by many historical figures as a base for operations. Female General Le Chan selected Elephant Mountain as a site to recruit soldiers and store supplies, evade enemies, and build a base to fight. Here, the Mac dynasty built fortifications, trained troops, dug trenches, and built barriers.|||Today, Elephant Mountain still has remnants of Chua Ca Gate, Chua Thuong Gate, and the dug river. Names like Thanh Uy Cave (Party Committee Cave), Hai Quan Cave (Naval Cave), Chan Cave (where supplies were stored), and Gia Vi Cave evoke memories of difficult yet heroic years of the anti-French and anti-American resistance. Particularly during the anti-French resistance, Elephant Mountain was an important air defense site protecting the northwest gateway of Hai Phong.

title: Pongour Waterfall
description: Pongour is a beautiful and famous waterfall, one of the most magnificent in the Central Highlands, cascading from a height of nearly 40m and spanning over 100m through a multi-tiered rock system. The surrounding area features a primary forest with diverse and rich vegetation.|||Pongour Waterfall is located about 50km from the center of Da Lat city, in Duc Trong district, Lam Dong province.|||Pongour Waterfall was named Nam Thien Dai Nhat Thac by Emperor Bao Dai, meaning the most magnificent waterfall in the southern sky, when he visited the waterfall in the previous century. Locals often call it the 7-tier waterfall because the water flows down through seven tiered rock steps.|||Pongour Waterfall originates from the mighty Da Nhim River. To visit this wonderful Da Lat tourist destination, there are two paths to reach the base. The main path is long and gently sloped, making it easy to walk without tiring. The second path is shorter but steeper, suitable only for adventurous travelers seeking an exciting experience.|||At the base of the waterfall, visitors will be overwhelmed by the stunning beauty of Pongour Waterfall. The water roars down from above into a large pool, creating white foam.|||Pongour Waterfall is beautiful and full of water in every season. During the rainy season (July to September), the waterfall flows strongly into the pool, creating white foam and a majestic scene.|||In the dry season (October to July), the water flows gently, cascading down the rock tiers like soft silk ribbons over green mossy rocks, creating a breathtaking and enchanting view. Visitors can also climb onto the stone steps to closely observe and touch the clear water, mossy rocks, and take unique photos at this Da Lat tourist spot. Visiting in October offers the added beauty of wild chrysanthemum flowers blooming along the roadside.|||Pongour is a French transliteration of the local K’Ho name Pon-Gou, meaning master of the white clay land, or rhinoceros horn in the local language.|||Pongour Waterfall is associated with a K’Ho legend about a beautiful female chieftain named Kanai, who tamed four giant rhinoceroses and cleared land for farming, helping the village prosper. This brought the villagers a peaceful and happy life.|||Every year on the 15th day of the first lunar month, the Pongour Waterfall hosts a spring festival featuring folk games and traditional cultural rituals, attracting thousands of tourists from all over.

title: Linh Son Vien Giac Temple
description: Kien Thuy is a land of outstanding people and spiritual energy producing outstanding individuals. A heroic village with Kim Son resisting the Japanese and Duong Kinh under the Mac dynasty famous in their time with hardworking persevering studious and creative people in labor and production gradually leading to a life of continuous development prosperity and peace. Meanwhile Kien Thuy is also a land rich in spiritual cultural traditions. Many temples were built in the villages across the district along with many cultural festivals held here contributing to enriching the national identity of the homeland and the country.|||Since humans first settled and established villages in the Kien Thuy area it has been unknown when the Da Do River began to meander through every village bringing fresh clear water as a gift to people. Nearby in the center of the district towers the Do Son mountain carrying within it a legendary myth creating a beautiful and harmonious landscape.|||The story is about a girl named Che who fell in love with God Do Son. Every year on March 10th they meet then part. That year God Do Son gave Miss Che two precious stones. She carried them home but when crossing Da Do River a storm arose thunder and lightning cracked suddenly the pole broke. She ran home for another pole. When she came out two mountains stood facing each other and she vanished. The villagers called these mountains Che Mountain and Doi Mountain located in the center of Kien Thuy district Hai Phong today.|||To meet the religious needs and long-standing aspirations of the local people, Buddhist followers, and monks and nuns in the district, in 2006 with the approval of Hai Phong City People's Committee, Kien Thuy District People's Committee, and relevant departments they invited Venerable Thich Tu Hanh - Chairman of the District Buddhist Association's representative board, representing the monks and nuns of the district - to construct and build the Buddhist Zen gate at Nui Doi and transform Nui Doi into the district's Buddhist center aiming to spread Buddhist teachings to every rural area and countless sincere followers of the faith.|||In 2010 Linh Son Vien Giac Temple was constructed with essential facilities completed. The temple was built in the traditional style with curved eaves dragon-phoenix motifs two dragons facing the moon and located on the top of Doi Mountain. Visitors can enjoy the view of Kien Thuy district and Dossan Bay. To the east flows the Da Do River winding like a silk ribbon providing fresh cool water to Kien Thuy district Duong Kinh district and Dossan district to the west are Van Mieu Xuan La and the Mo Temple to the south is the Mac Dynasty and far to the north is Thien Van Mountain.|||Visitors to the temple make offerings to the Buddha at the Lower Temple, then go to the right to worship the Saint Mother for wealth before ascending the mountain to worship the Buddha. From the Saint Mother's hall to the left, hundreds of stone steps lead up to the Upper Temple. The Upper Temple has a hall with hundreds of green stone-carved Arhat statues, each with different appearances and emotions but sharing a common theme of blending human suffering with the indomitable spirit of the teacher. The Avalokiteshvara Pavilion is built like a lotus tower, with a stone corridor around the pond. A bronze Avalokiteshvara statue with a thousand eyes and hands weighing about a ton is placed inside. Behind it is a Chinese-character inscription of the Great Compassion Mantra of Avalokiteshvara. Next to the Avalokiteshvara Pavilion is a garden with statues depicting the Buddha turning the Dharma Wheel for the first time to his five disciples, the Kauṇḍinya brothers, very vividly.|||Annually at Linh Son Vien Giac Temple major festivals take place such as the Lantern Festival (10th of the first lunar month)|||Commemoration of the meeting between Dô Son deity and Co Che (9th of the third lunar month)|||Vu Lan Reunion Festival (15th of the seventh lunar month)|||Lantern Festival (29th of the ninth lunar month)|||Year-End Ceremony (17th of the twelfth lunar month) attracting many local residents and visitors from all over.|||On February 12 2011 Linh Son Vien Giac Temple received the UNESCO Vietnam Cultural Heritage Endorsement Certificate Linh Son Vien Giac Temple in the future will become a center of spiritual worship and a destination attracting tourists from all over the country to visit

title: Ta Dung Lake
description: Amidst the vast expanse of water the hills stand tall like emerald islands formed from red basalt glowing across the lake like a giant mirror. With its serene beauty in the open natural landscape the unique cluster of over 40 islets of various shapes gently rising from the water Ta Dung is often compared to Halong Bay in the Central Highlands.|||Ta Dung Lake is a mountain freshwater lake within the Ta Dung Nature Reserve in Dak Nong province. It is also known as Dong Nai 3 hydropower reservoir as it serves as the main water storage for this hydropower system.|||The lake covers approximately 22000 hectares during the dry season and can expand to nearly 50000 hectares at the end of the rainy season with an average depth exceeding 20 meters. Scattered throughout are numerous large and small islands with lush green vegetation making Ta Dung resemble a miniature Halong Bay in the Central Highlands with its pristine and poetic natural scenery.|||The ideal time to visit Ta Dung Lake is during the filling season from July to December when the water rises high and rains make the island vegetation lush creating a picturesque natural scene.|||Here visitors can travel by boat to admire the landscape created by countless large and small islands emerging from the tranquil lake like small dragons winding through mountains and breathe in the fresh air. At night visitors can camp by the lake to enjoy the sunrise at Ta Dung.|||Sunrise is the most beautiful natural moment of the day. Tourists will witness clouds of all shapes flying swiftly or lingering over mountain ranges and islands. The omnipresent clouds create the feeling of being in a fairyland.|||The Ta Dung Ecotourism Area also features a 50 meter glass bridge for visitors to stroll on. Additionally there are numerous ideal photo spots including the eagle nest angel wings staircase to heaven and flower gardens with vibrant flowers like red velvet daffodils mimosa orchids hydrangeas etc. in the fresh highland atmosphere.|||In the journey exploring the South Central Highlands visiting Dak Nong the Ta Dung Lake destination is popular among tourists for its majestic scenery the preserved natural wilderness and the enduring legends of this picturesque region.

title: Ngoc Linh Mountain
description: Ngoc Linh Mountain is a high majestic mountain range stretching across four provinces Kon Tum Quang Nam Quang Ngai Gia Lai. With a height of over 2600 meters above sea level it is considered the roof of the Central Highlands. From afar the majestic mountain is shrouded in mysterious dreamy clouds. Not only does it boast magnificent breathtaking natural scenery but Ngoc Linh is also home to an extremely rare type of ginseng.|||Ngoc Linh Mountain is part of the Truong Son mountain range with its highest peak Ngoc Linh located in Tu Moc Roong district Kon Tum province. To reach the summit visitors must undertake a challenging journey lasting about 6 hours. However visitors will be surprised and delighted by the layers of forest canopy covering the path with wild orchids and with thousands of pure white rhododendron flowers along the way. As one ascends higher the air becomes cooler and clouds envelop the treetops creating a pleasant sensation for visitors.|||The moment of standing on the summit and taking in the entire view leaves visitors truly awestruck by the majestic natural scenery. The ancient forests covered in green moss are very captivating perhaps similar to scenes from movies or fairy tales.|||If you plan to visit Kon Tum be sure to experience this place once it will surely be an exciting and appealing trip for everyone.|||The best time to conquer this peak is during the dry season from December to March. However since Ngoc Linh Mountain is within a special use forest strictly protected by forest rangers visitors must obtain a permit from the relevant authorities. The path to the summit is quite difficult so for safety visitors should hire local guides familiar with the terrain.

title: Tea Lake
description: Located on the northern shore of the lake, it is called Tea Lake because it combines a reservoir with vast tea fields. The tea hills here are about 13 km from Pleiku city, located in Chư Pah district.|||The natural scenery and air in this area are very fresh. To reach Tea Lake, visitors will pass through a road lined with pine trees on both sides. Upon arrival, visitors will be captivated by the fresh green tea fields under the sun, providing soothing and relaxing feelings.|||Visiting Tea Lake at any time of the year is convenient. However, the two best times to visit the tea hills are in late December when yellow flowers bloom along the roads of the Central Highlands; and in February-March annually when the coffee hills are in bloom with white flowers that will surely delight visitors.|||Besides the green tea hills, a must-visit place here is Bửu Minh Temple. Located in the heart of the tea hills, Bửu Minh Temple has been connected to the tea hills for over 50 years. The temple carries the spirituality of generations of tea growers and their harvest seasons. This place is very serene. With a main hall area of over 500m2 and a height of nearly 50m, Bửu Minh Temple is a pride of the local tea hill community and Pleiku people in general.

title: Chu Dang Ya Volcano
description: Chu Dang Ya Volcano is located in Chu Dang Ya Commune, Chu Pah District, approximately 30 km northeast of Pleiku City (Gia Lai Province) and 20 km from the Bien Ho tourist site.|||Chu Dang Ya is a volcano that has been inactive for millions of years, with a funnel-shaped volcanic crater elevated about 500 meters above sea level. Chu Dang Ya Volcano is hidden within the vast, majestic green forest.|||Visiting Chu Dang Ya, tourists can witness the vibrant color changes with each season. During the dry season, Chu Dang Ya Volcano is covered in the bright yellow of thousands of wild sunflowers competing to bloom. Particularly in November, when hundreds of thousands of wild sunflowers bloom, covering roads and hills in golden hues.|||In recent years, Gia Lai Province has organized the Wild Sunflower Festival to promote the local tourism image to both nearby and distant visitors. The festival features various cultural and experiential activities such as gong performances, traditional weaving, woven crafts, wood carving, mountain climbing experiences, paragliding over Chu Dang Ya Volcano, agricultural fairs, cuisine and local specialties.|||During the rainy season, Chu Dang Ya is soaked in the red of wild ginger flowers spreading around the volcano. The wild ginger plant is also known as the banana tree or taro tree, with flowers blooming from July to October each year.|||The yellow of wild sunflowers and the red of wild ginger flowers are among the attractions that draw tourists and photographers from all over to seek a peaceful and serene space and capture unforgettable photos.|||Visiting Chu Dang Ya, you'll feel a sense of inner peace far removed from the city's noise. Chu Dang Ya is surrounded by pristine natural landscapes with dense green vegetation typical of the Central Highlands.

title: Ke Ga Lighthouse
description: Located about 20 km south of Phan Thiet city Ke Ga Lighthouse the oldest lighthouse in Vietnam with rich history unique architecture and picturesque scenery has become an unmissable destination for travelers exploring Binh Thuan.|||Ke Ga Lighthouse was built by the French in 1897 and completed in 1899 in an octagonal architectural style using entirely stone materials. The lighthouse stands 65 m tall including a 35 m tall light tower. At the top is a large 2000W bulb capable of illuminating a radius of 22 nautical miles (equivalent to 40 km). With an age over 100 years Ke Ga Lighthouse is also known as the oldest lighthouse in Southeast Asia.|||According to content creator Fly Around Vietnam from above Ke Ga Lighthouse stands strong and prominent amidst the vast and serene sea. Shaped by nature the island where the lighthouse was built features hundreds of colorful rock formations with unique shapes stacked together impressively. The emerald green of the sea the golden color of granite rock slabs and the soft green of trees on the island create a pristine tranquil and enchanting natural landscape.|||When visiting Ke Ga Lighthouse travelers should not miss the moment to take photos beside the stone steps covered in moss and flanked by beautiful white orchid trees. These flowers were planted by the French when the lighthouse was built and have since grown into ancient shade trees providing ideal resting spots for visitors after conquering Ke Ga Point.

title: Aranhut Temple
description: Located in Long An A hamlet Cai Tac town Chau Thanh A district Aranhut Temple is identified as the oldest Khmer temple in Hau Giang and one of the oldest Khmer temples in the Mekong Delta.|||Around 1632 local Khmer people planned to build a temple for religious worship and spiritual activities during festivals Thus Aranhut Temple was built with the consensus of everyone Over the years Aranhut Temple has become a spiritual pillar for generations of Khmer people here.|||During the anti-French and anti-American wars Aranhut Temple was a hiding place for revolutionary cadres in the area Because of this the temple was attacked multiple times by enemies The worst attack was in 1968 when the US bombed the main hall area nearly destroying the temple completely.|||Later Buddhists from all over donated funds to rebuild the temple After several renovations and repairs Aranhut Temple is now much more spacious and well-maintained featuring one main hall three monks quarters etc on an area of over 12000m² Like other Khmer temples Aranhut Temple has a unique architectural style with distinctive carvings and sculptures typical of southern Khmer temples.|||Today Aranhut Temple continues to serve as a place for religious activities for local and distant Buddhists During Khmer festivals and holidays many Khmer and Kinh people from the hamlet and surrounding areas visit the temple to light incense and pray for their families good fortune Taking advantage of the large number of Khmer people visiting the temple management always strives to promote the Party and State s correct policies to ensure the community understands and follows them well.

title: Ho Chi Minh Shrine
description: The Ho Chi Minh Shrine was built in 1990 on land in the northern area where Long My II and Nam Can meet located in Hamlet 3 Luong Tam Commune Long My District 21 km from Long My town and 78 km southwest of Can Tho City. The shrine now belongs to Luong Tam Commune Long My District Hau Giang Province.|||Due to its small scale the temple could not accommodate local people and visitors visiting Ho Chi Minh during festivals. Therefore the Provincial Party Committee and People's Committee of Can Tho (old) expanded the shrine area to nearly 2 hectares 50 meters away from the old temple. Completed in 1996 the project included 7 items with national architecture solemn and dignified serving as a cultural sports and patriotic education site for youth while helping visitors better understand the career and life of the respected father figure.|||On 07-01-2000 the Ho Chi Minh Shrine was recognized as a National Historical and Cultural Site. Every year during major festivals like September 2nd April 30th May 19th New Year and Lunar New Year people from Hau Giang and neighboring provinces gather here for pilgrimage.

title: Special National Historical Site of Chuong Thien Victory
description: The Special Historical Site of Chuong Thien Victory records the ups and downs of Hau Giang province's history during the war with the losses and sacrifices for peace prosperity and happiness of the people. The Chuong Thien Victory Site has been ranked as a Special National Historical Site and has become an unmissable destination in Hau Giang's tourism journey.|||Previously the site was known as the Victory Site of 75 Enemy Platoons of Zone 9's Army and People. Currently the site is located at two points Phuong V (Vinh Thanh City) and Vinh Vien Commune Long My District recording the historical marks of Zone 9's military and people.|||Chuong Thien was established by the Saigon government in 1960 as an important transportation hub for Can Tho Soc Trang Bac Lieu U Minh Rach Gia. The 1973 Chuong Thien Victory defeating 75 enemy platoons set the stage for the South's revolutionary shift leading to the Spring General Offensive and Uprising in 1975.|||In Vinh Thanh City the Chuong Thien Victory Site was inaugurated and put into use in 2014 becoming an ideal destination for tourists wanting to learn about the brave struggles of the Southwestern region's people.|||The site covers 144000m² in Phuong 5 Vinh Thanh City Hau Giang province with facilities artifact display area outdoor display statue cluster ceremony area and some supporting facilities.|||The Site has many related artifacts including over 100 photos of battles destroying Cai Nai sub-district Quang Phong weak area Rocc Dua Cai Son Cai Cao 117 items including weapons military equipment tanks planes have been received and preserved in the Hau Giang Provincial Museum's artifact storage.|||Here besides images and artifacts of the anti-foreign invasion war it also displays many important historical milestones in Hau Giang province's development.|||Most notable is the statue cluster depicting 3 armies 3 attacking fronts and other significant people's war events behind the statues is the stylized coconut leaf symbol of Hau Giang and neighboring provinces.|||Alongside Xa No Bridge Xa No Embankment and the Provincial People's Committee Complex the Chuong Thien Victory Site stands out with unique architecture harmonizing with the surrounding environment making it convenient for tourists to visit.|||During events like New Year Tet April 30th Victory President Ho Chi Minh's Birthday National Day on September 2nd and the Vietnamese People's Army Founding Day the Chuong Thien Victory Site is always bustling with visitors exploring history and honoring the great contributions of previous generations.

title: Lung Ngoc Hoang Nature Conservation Area
description: Lung Ngoc Hoang Nature Conservation Area is located in Phu Hung district Hau Giang province about 40km from Vi Thanh city. With an area of over 2800 hectares stretching from the west of the Hau River to the U Minh region not only known as the 'green lung' of the Mekong Delta Lung Ngoc Hoang is also the most unique biodiversity conservation site in the country today.|||In the local language, “lung” means a wild swampy lowland area. Lung Ngoc Hoang loosely translates to “The swampy lowland of Heaven’s Emperor.” Folklore says that long ago, many elephant herds (symbolizing elephants) moved and foraged from one place to another, their movements sinking the land and creating swamps, pools, ditches, and shallow lakes. Occasionally, Ngoc Hoang descended from heaven to travel here, gradually giving this area the name Lung Ngoc Hoang!|||Lung Ngoc Hoang is a wetland area with a wild mysterious atmosphere existing for a very long time.|||In the past this place was called the land of the dead with water covering it all year round and tall wild grass growing abundantly. Getting lost in this area makes it hard to find a way out due to its vast terrain dense vines and remote quiet nature.|||According to the book Can Tho Gazetteer (2003) over 120 years ago people came to cultivate Lung Ngoc Hoang. Before 1945 many landlords hired people to clear land for farming and fish.|||Later due to war Lung Ngoc Hoang became wild and turned into a revolutionary base during both the anti-French and anti-American resistance periods. Previously this area was entrusted to Phuong Ninh Forestry Company to invest in planting mangrove trees exploiting aquatic resources and protecting the environment.|||In 2002 the Lung Ngoc Hoang Nature Reserve was officially established becoming the most prominent destination for Hau Giang tourism.|||This area is known as a wetland and is home to hundreds of rare animal and plant species with hundreds of thousands of mangrove trees growing next to each other reaching nearly ten meters high|||Researchers have found that Lung Ngoc Huang Natural Reserve has over 330 plant species across 224 genera and 92 families. Among these 56 species are newly discovered. Lung Ngoc Huang is a diverse ecosystem with various plant communities belonging to different wetland ecosystems. These include climbing plants growing at the base or on the trunks of mangroves reeds cattails water hyacinths etc. Terrestrial species are also abundant such as tram san ngai long mua guo etc.|||Lung Ngoc Hoang also gathers many rare animal species, including those listed in Vietnam's and the world's Red Data Book such as otters, box turtles, king cobras... With a diverse and pristine swamp system combined with strictly protected mangrove forests, Lung Ngoc Hoang is a suitable habitat for countless amphibians, fish, and shrimp. It has been compared to the fish belly of the western region of the Hau River.|||With its unique and rich natural conditions, this nature reserve becomes an ideal destination for those who love eco-tourism and nature exploration. The best time to visit the mangrove forest is from 7 a.m. to 9 a.m. when you can witness and admire many bird species gathering here to play, dance, and sing. Later, from 4 p.m. to 6 p.m., you can climb the 20-meter-high watchtower to watch flocks of birds returning to their nests.|||To explore the mangrove forest you must purchase tickets to rent narrow boats (also called vo lai). Entering Lung Ngoc Hoang visitors feel as if entering a fairy-tale world peaceful and wild like Lung Sen Lung Tran Lung Chuoi Nuoc.|||At Lung Ngoc Hoang you can take a boat ride through the dense mangrove forest and see the massive mangrove trunks with roots spreading out like a unique swamp. Visitors will encounter vast wild fields stretching to the horizon with flocks of herons and white egrets flapping their wings. As you go deeper the scenery becomes more wild and poetic. More interestingly you can go fishing and be guided on how to use traps nets and other traditional methods to catch fish just like a farmer.|||From the 21m high observation tower located at the center of Lung Ngoc Hoang visitors can enjoy the panoramic view of the endless mangrove forest and winding canals creating a refreshing feeling when immersing oneself in the lush green and fresh natural surroundings|||You can visit the restaurant area with small huts to enjoy delicious dishes such as grilled snakehead fish braised eel smoked duck and boneless catfish a famous specialty of Hau Giang. A meal filled with the rich flavors of the Mekong Delta and the rustic charm of this picturesque forest setting will surely be an unforgettable experience for tourists.|||With a diverse and rich lung trung system fertile alluvial soil and vast green forests that are strictly protected Lung Ngoc Hoang retains a strong sense of wilderness leaving a strong impression on those who have set foot here To fully explore the beauty of Lung Ngoc Hoang contact Tham Hiem MeKong for consultation and support

title: Provincial Party Committee Base Area (Ba Bai Base)
description: During the general offensive and uprising in the spring of 1975 across the entire southern region members of the provincial party committee's executive committee departed from here to lead the attacking forces towards Can Tho Vithanh and other key points of 'Tactical Zone IV' capturing Tra Noc Airport and the Can Tho provincial governor's residence. At 11:30 AM on April 30 1975 the first voice of the revolutionary People's Committee was broadcast on Can Tho radio station.|||The historical site includes: a meeting hall where important conferences of the Can Tho provincial committee took place 151m² in size constructed mainly from materials like bamboo mangrove wood and other local resources. Inside the hall is the office of the standing committee and the Party Secretary.|||Since 1980 this building has been used to display artifacts related to the site. Additionally there were dozens of huts belonging to subordinate agencies but they are no longer preserved due to the temporary nature of the construction materials which quickly deteriorated.|||In 1986 the old Can Tho province restored the historical site. All the pillars of the meeting hall and two bomb shelters were reinforced with reinforced concrete but their appearance color and specifications remained identical to the original.

title: Tam Vu Eco-Tourism Area
description: Located in Tan Phu Thanh Commune, Chau Thanh A District, Hau Giang Province, Tam Vu Eco-Tourism Area has the unique cultural and traditional features of the local area, many rare animal species, and a rich tropical fruit ecosystem. It is also the historical revolutionary site of Tam Vu.|||In the vast space of lotus ponds, ornamental gardens, fruit orchards, and mangrove forests, you will feel the tranquility and cool atmosphere of this place. Here, you can enjoy a variety of recreational services such as boat rides, fishing, leisurely strolls, listening to traditional folk music, and visiting the monkey island.|||Additionally, visiting Tam Vu Eco-Tourism Area offers the opportunity to learn about national history through statues and walls carved with images of the historical Tam Vu battle.

title: Betel Leaf Village Vi Thuy
description: Vietnamese people are familiar with the saying "A betel leaf is the beginning of a story." In the daily lives of the people, betel leaves and areca nuts have become part of legends and poetry, closely tied to rural life in a warm and familiar way. This rural charm is still preserved in Betel Leaf Village Vi Thuy and has been passed down through generations.|||Betel Leaf Village Vi Thuy is considered the only remaining village specializing in betel leaf cultivation in the Mekong Delta. Betel Leaf Village Vi Thuy is located in Vi Thuy Commune Vi Thuy District Hau Giang Province this craft has been closely tied to the local people for a long time and has become a distinctive feature whenever Vi Thuy Commune is mentioned|||Currently Vi Thuy district has nearly 40 hectares of betel leaf with Vi Thuy commune considered the Betel Leaf Kingdom concentrating nearly 200 betel gardens covering about 32 hectares. Only in this freshwater area of Vi Thuy along the Hau River does betel leaf grow with rich flavor and delicious taste that stains lips red. Visitors to Hau Giang who come here are always impressed by the betel gardens with hundreds thousands of straight betel shoots green leaves slightly tinged with golden hues creating a beautiful sight.|||Trau Vi Thuy is golden betel with a spicy flavor that is popular among many people. After 3-4 months of planting, the betel vine will start producing leaves, and they are harvested once every half a month. Usually, traders come directly to the house to purchase the betel, transport it to various places, and deliver it to customers in the western provinces.|||To obtain a bundle of betel leaves (40 leaves), growers must go through several steps: purchasing seedlings, selecting trees for grafting, digging ditches, grafting, watering, harvesting betel leaves, and then arranging them into bundles called lien trau. This involves grouping the leaves into dozens (which can be 10 16 or 20 depending on the region) then into hundreds and thousands before delivering to traders.|||Speaking of planting methods, Nguyen Thi Nam, a betel leaf farmer, explains: whenever she sees a plump healthy betel shoot she buries it in the loose soil of the betel bed. After a short period when the betel vine takes root she cuts it and attaches it to a new stake. Betel is easy to grow grows quickly and requires minimal care. As it is a leaf crop if there is enough manure and water betel can be harvested after 3-4 months. Especially betel prefers natural green (organic) fertilizers and is not suitable for chemical fertilizers. Using traditional fertilizer (green manure) makes the betel leaves slender and shiny green with a slight hint of yellow making them more attractive.|||Betel nut growers state that saplings must be made from tram trees as the bark of tram trees adheres firmly to the trunk creating conditions for the roots of betel nut plants to attach and develop well. People usually harvest betel nuts early in the morning. When the leaves are ready for harvest betel nut harvesters select the shiny smooth leaves that are just ripe and golden while the remaining leaves will be harvested in the next batch about 10 days after the previous one. Growers must also build platforms to harvest leaves from above. When the tips exceed the platform they are cut off...|||Vị Thủy betel is both a traditional cultural element and serves the needs of many people in daily life and during festivals weddings etc. In addition to being consumed and used in religious ceremonies during festivals betel is also a medicinal herb studied for essential oil extraction applied in pharmaceutical and cosmetic production. Recently Vị Thủy betel has also been exported to several Asian countries generating significant profits for betel growers.|||Today, few people still chew betel nut, so the images of betel nut trees and betel leaves have gradually faded.|||But in Vi Thuy betel nut village, there are still lush, golden betel nut gardens that enchant visitors.

title: Vi Thuy Mangrove Forest - Viet-Australia Ecotourism Area
description: Vi Thuy Mangrove Forest is one of the most prominent destinations in Hau Giang specifically and in the Western region generally. The ecotourism area of Vi Thuy Mangrove Forest is located in Vinh Tuong commune Vi Thuy district Hau Giang province about 9 km southeast of Vi Thanh city covering an area of approximately 145 hectares.|||Vi Thuy Mangrove Forest is considered to have the most unique freshwater wetland ecosystem in the Mekong Delta region alongside the Lung Ngoc Hoang Nature Reserve. It was previously managed by the Co Do Agricultural Farm. In 2007 it was handed over to the Viet-Australia Company for investment and development into an attractive ecotourism area hence the name Viet-Australia Ecotourism Area was established.|||The highlight of the Viet-Australia Ecotourism Area is a 10-hectare natural bird garden featuring typical birds of the Western water region such as the sarus crane white stork heron kingfisher and wild ducks the wildlife breeding area includes wild boars pythons and honey bees the canals are stocked with various local fish species like catfish tilapia snakehead and carp. This serves as a source of fish for visitors to experience activities like fishing setting traps and netting as well as enjoying fish in their natural environment.|||Vi Thuy Mangrove Forest is not just a tourist attraction but also embodies the cultural beauty of the people and waterways of the Mekong Delta. Visiting Hau Giang you can take a boat ride along the canals under the dense green canopy of the forest and enjoy the surrounding scenery. In this tranquil space flocks of birds chirp and fly around as if welcoming visitors.|||The best time to visit Vi Thuy Mangrove Forest is in the early morning or late afternoon when you can spot more birds as they prepare to forage or return to their nests. Especially during the season various bird species come to nest here. If lucky you might encounter many rare bird species listed in the Red Book.|||At the Viet-Australia Ecotourism Area in Hau Giang visitors have various accommodation options including luxury resorts wooden stilt houses with thatched roofs or staying in rooms on moving cruise ships along the canals.|||Currently the tourism area has completed landscape restoration fruit orchards fish farming and wildlife breeding. Some functional zones are under construction such as the Management and Operation Zone the Resort Area the Freshwater Aquaculture Zone combined with supporting services dining fishing trap setting and boat tours.|||Once completed the Vi Thuy Mangrove Ecotourism Area will be an ideal tourist destination in Hau Giang for both domestic and international visitors. It will also create many job opportunities for the local community in Vi Thuy district and neighboring areas. This is the largest investment project in the tourism sector to date in Hau Giang province setting the stage for developing the province's potential in ecotourism water-based tourism and rural tourism in the future.

title: Truc Lam Zen Monastery Hau Giang
description: Truc Lam Zen Monastery Hau Giang is located at Vinh Tuong Intersection Binh Tan area Vinh Tuong Ward Long My Town Hau Giang Province. This is a place for practicing the Truc Lam Yen Tu Zen sect and a spiritual center for monks nuns Buddhist followers and local residents.|||Truc Lam Zen Monastery Hau Giang will be a place for religious activities of over 250 clergy monks and nuns and the main venue for the Buddhist Council of Hau Giang Province. It is also a cultural and spiritual tourism highlight for visitors from all over.|||The entire structure features tiled roofs limewood frames brick walls and porcelain-tiled floors and pathways. Besides the main hall the monastery includes Ancestral Hall Bell Tower Drum Tower Triple Gate rest house open-air Avalokiteshvara statue Mother Au Co shrine lecture hall dining hall abbot's residence guest house library Monks' quarters Nuns' quarters.|||Entering the courtyard visitors feel a spacious cool solemn space with bright tiles and tiles. The serene beauty is highlighted by a large pond with blooming lotus flowers.|||Inside the main hall red-tiled floors and wooden pillars on gray cloud-patterned stone bases with stylized lotus carvings. With architecture reflecting Vietnamese feudal dynasties the monastery offers a peaceful atmosphere and attracts tourists to Hau Giang.

title: Ba Khan
description: Ba Khan is a newly discovered destination in Hoa Binh province suitable for all tourists visiting sightseeing and picnicking on hot summer days.|||Ba Khan is a commune in Mai Chau district Hoa Binh province located right at the foot of Thung Khe Pass permanently shrouded in mist and fog.|||With its romantic mountainous scenery undulating and overlapping peaks Ba Khan is compared to a terrestrial Halong Bay.|||Ba Khan was an old commune now the Son Thuy commune in Mai Chau district Hoa Binh province located right at the foot of Thung Khe Pass permanently shrouded in mist and fog.|||In the early morning Ba Khan becomes ethereal as clouds blanket the valleys winding and merging into the overlapping hills and mountains.|||Creating a sense for observers that the scenery resembles a fairyland.|||The winding meandering roads along the mountain slopes with one side being limestone mountains and the other the Son Da River reservoir.|||On clear weather days the clouds mountains and water create a romantic poetic scenery that captivates visitors.|||Along the road by the Son Da River reservoir are large and small cat's ear-shaped rocks undulating creating highlights for young people to freely take photos and capture memorable moments of the trip.|||And almost the entire reservoir surface is ripple-free nearly still with only a few boats gliding lightly and aimlessly on the water.|||As a flat vast land situated between the rocky mountains and the Son Da River reservoir Ba Khan possesses a sky and water mountainous landscape with magical beauty that can captivate anyone.|||It would be even more wonderful for your weekend getaway if you combine visiting Ba Khan with a stay at the nearby Mai Chau town.

title: Museum of Mông Cultural Space
description: The “Mông Cultural Space Museum” is an artistic structure. It originates from the deep inspiration of a young painter with the aspiration to recreate the entire living space of the Mông people.|||After 10 years of collecting and nearly a year of construction. On December 16 2007 the “Mông Cultural Space Museum” was inaugurated with the first gong strike by National Assembly Chairman Nguyen Phu Trong and officially opened.The museum is located on a hill in a small narrow limestone valley covering 5 hectares. 80 km west of Hanoi 7 km from the center of Hoa Binh city towards Son La (on the new road named Tay Tien Road).|||The Mông Cultural Museum is located on a hill in a small narrow limestone valley covering 5 hectares 7 km from the center of Hoa Binh city. With an area of over 2 hectares the Mông Cultural Space Museum has showcased the distinctive features of Mông culture - an ethnic group with a rich cultural heritage in the Vietnamese ethnic family.|||From the entrance visitors encounter water wheels reminding them of the rice cultivation techniques next to traditional Mông stilt houses. Visiting the Mông Cultural Space besides exploring the cultural and architectural aspects of the Mông people visitors also have the opportunity to enjoy authentic Mông cuisine right there.

title: White Stone Pass
description: White Stone Pass is also known as Thung Khe Pass. It is located on Highway 6 connecting Mai Chau and Tan Lac (Hoa Binh). Recently this mountain pass has become a popular check-in spot for adventurers.|||The unique feature that attracts visitors to White Stone Pass is the fact that all the rocks here are white due to limestone formations. The white rocks covering the area and the snow-capped mountain peaks blending into the clouds create an illusion of standing in a cold European winter.|||At White Stone Pass you can experience all four seasons in a single day. Mornings are clear and bright, afternoons are sunny and hot, evenings have gentle sunlight, and nights are shrouded in fog requiring careful travel.|||Although not as famous as northern mountain passes, White Stone Pass leaves a strong impression with its winding roads through green valleys and peaceful ethnic villages.|||At over 1000m above sea level, visitors can enjoy panoramic views of the small and green Mai Chau valley from above.|||Another special feature attracting many travelers is the small market located directly on the pass. These simple roadside stalls sell local specialties like sticky corn, bamboo rice, moss, wild vegetables, and traditional herbal medicines from ethnic communities.

title: Printing Press Factory Historical Site
description: With historical value, it is the first printing press of the Vietnamese revolutionary government - a place that twice welcomed President Ho Chi Minh for visits, recognized as a national historical site, the Printing Press Factory historical site in Phu Nghia commune (Lac Thuy) has become an essential stop in the tour of Lac Thuy's heroic land, especially at the beginning of the year.|||The first printing press of the Vietnamese revolutionary government (1946–1947) was chosen by the government, Ministry of Finance, and President Ho Chi Minh to be located at Chi Ne Plantation, now in Phu Nghia commune. This site was ranked a national historical site by the Ministry of Culture, Sports, and Tourism under Decision No. 03/2007/QD-BVHTTDL on August 27, 2007. In May 2019, the Memorial House for meritorious individuals and staff of the printing press at Chi Ne Plantation, Lac Thuy district, was officially inaugurated, a source of pride for local officials and people as well as the finance sector nationwide, honoring the great contributions of President Ho Chi Minh, the Do Dinh Thiện family, and those who contributed to the revolutionary cause in the early stages of establishing the national finance sector. Here, the first 100-dong banknote, also known as the "green bull" note, was born, carrying a historically significant mission to fight enemy currency and protect national independence, becoming a weapon in the economic-financial-currency warfare.|||Strategically located, Chi Ne Plantation was honored twice to welcome President Ho Chi Minh for visits, work, and stays. During his visit to Lac Thuy, he advised: "This is our printing press; you must carefully preserve it. Strive to produce more currency for the nation's use in the resistance war. Staff and workers must unite, support each other, and diligently protect and conserve the people's money." Today, the Chi Ne Plantation treasury, the house of Mr. Do Dinh Thiện's family where President Ho Chi Minh stayed on February 21, 1947, and the bunker he occupied are preserved intact, becoming attractions for domestic and international tourists.|||In recent years, Lac Thuy district has focused on preserving and promoting the site's value. It serves as a red educational site for revolutionary traditions for today's youth. To allow people and visitors to pay homage and remember the great contributions of President Ho Chi Minh, heroes, martyrs, and meritorious individuals, many visitors come to the printing press at the beginning of the year to purchase the "green bull" note for wishes of wealth, luck, and success. Currently, along with other local attractions, the Printing Press Factory and Chi Ne Plantation connect with historical sites and scenic spots in neighboring provinces, forming cultural-historical-spiritual-leisure tours between Chua Huong Temple, Hanoi, Tam Truc Temple in Ha Nam province, Van Long Ecotourism Park in Ninh Binh province, and others.

title: Silver Stone Cave
description: Located in the heart of Cóc Mountain (Da Bac hamlet, Lien Son commune, Luong Son district, Hoa Binh province), Silver Stone Cave boasts a fascinating beauty that attracts many tourists.|||From Hanoi's center, follow National Highway 6 about 33km west to Xuan Mai town (Quoc Oai district) then follow National Highway 21 about 5km south, tourists will reach Cóc Mountain.|||Silver Stone Cave was discovered by a local in 1990. With a length of nearly 70m, the widest part is 22m, the highest is 15m, the cave consists of three smaller caves: Co Tien, Long Tien and Mau. Through the main entrance (about 1m wide, 2m high), tourists step up a few stone steps to reach Co Tien Cave. This area has rock formations shaped like toads, turtles, terraced fields and stalactites hanging from the ceiling like stone curtains. When gently tapped, the stalactites produce sounds resembling gongs and cymbals. Notably, there is a small pond formed by water seeping and flowing down from the ceiling over many years. Near the pond is an altar with a Cóc statue.|||After Co Tien Cave, tourists reach Long Tien Cave – where stalactite formations resemble a palace. Sunlight can enter Long Tien Cave through a small gap in the ceiling. Mau Cave at the back has stalactites shaped like fairies, next to Thach Sanh sitting under a banyan tree, opposite is Thanh Giong on a metal horse, holding a bamboo stick flying up. There is a tower holding 7 ancient relics offered by locals.|||A unique feature of Silver Stone Cave is the orchid flowers with tiny white petals resembling threads blooming on the cave walls. Each flower has a small glowing gem at the tip. These are considered sacred flowers bringing good luck.|||With its unique beauty, Silver Stone Cave enriches the tourism system in Hoa Binh.

title: Hoa Tien Cave
description: The Hoa Tien Cave historical site is located in the middle of the limestone mountain range, Nui Ba Mountain, in Xom Nguoi hamlet, Suoi Hoa commune, Tan Lac district, Hoa Binh province. About 1km to the east of the site is a wide clear blue lake called Ho Tien Tam by the local people.|||From the mountain base following stone steps for about 100m leads to the first cave entrance with an arch 20m high and 50m wide filled with countless large and small stalactites. Giant stalactites rise upward like a Buddha seated on a lotus throne while smaller Buddha-like formations shimmer beside them.|||Going deeper to the left you'll find clear still pools. Soft stalactite curtains hang down like steps creating a beautiful sight and when struck they produce an echoing sound like ancient gongs and bells from the dawn of time. Beside the lake a strip of pretty smooth multicolored pebbles stretches to the cave walls.|||After about two hours of exploring you'll exit via a different path. As you're on a boat heading back to Hoa Binh city gazing at the scenic lake you'll remain enchanted by the magical Hoa Tien Cave.

title: Hydrangea Field
description: Spreading over a vast area the Dalat Hydrangea Garden (Lam Dong Province) is becoming a new attractive destination that draws many tourists to visit and check-in at the city of thousands of flowers.|||Originally planted for harvesting after many tourists visited local growers expanded the scale and developed these areas into spots for filming and photography. Dalat City has many hydrangea gardens with the largest one located in Xuan Tho Commune about 15km from the city center.|||Situated among tall pine hills the garden covers over 2000 m² with rows of hydrangeas stretching down to the hill's base. After careful care for over three months the vibrant hydrangea blooms fully open creating a lively colorful scene. Due to the suitable soil and climate the hydrangeas here have strong healthy stems and leaves with flowers reaching 35-40cm in diameter.|||A unique feature of hydrangeas is their continuous color change during the blooming cycle shifting from pure white to soft green or from sweet pink to dreamy purple. Beyond their captivating beauty hydrangeas symbolize gratitude and sincere emotions.|||Strolling among the poetic hydrangea rows enjoying the fresh cool air and taking commemorative photos with friends and family are unforgettable experiences not to be missed while exploring the city of thousands of flowers.

title: Thien Long Cave
description: Thien Long Cave is also one of the must-see attractions when visiting Hoa Binh. The cave is part of a complex of historical sites in Yen Thuy district consisting of a main cave (main hall) and two smaller side caves (left and right halls).|||Going deeper into the cave you will see a stone shelf. Looking up countless stalactites form layers that look soft like cloud steps and hanging stalactites resemble a curtain. As you approach the curtain opens revealing a truly unique world. These strange stalactites seem to embody the vibrant wild life from millions of years ago captivating visitors and making them want to stay.|||Nature has created and bestowed upon Thien Long Cave these strange stalactites embodying the vibrant wild life from millions of years ago. These natural masterpieces captivate visitors urging them to stay.

title: Long Lanh Pass
description: Long Lanh Pass is also known by names such as Omega Pass Hon Giao Pass Bidoup... located in Lac Duong district Lam Dong province. With its rare natural beauty and spectacular pass route Long Lanh Pass has become one of the favorite destinations for tourists especially those who love to explore.|||The road leading to Long Lanh Pass is a winding path between two rows of tall pine trees casting cool green shade. When the pine forests thin out the entire Long Lanh Pass appears before tourists like a stunning natural painting.|||Long Lanh Pass is over 30km long with many winding turns but thanks to the new flat road with moderate slope it has become a gentle route for tourists traveling from Nha Trang (Khanh Hoa) to Da Lat (Lam Dong). When reaching the summit at 1700m tourists are overwhelmed by the majestic and romantic beauty of Long Lanh Pass. The winding roads resemble a soft silk ribbon stretching across the layered mountain landscapes sunlight piercing through the misty veil creating an ethereal and sparkling scenery.|||While Mimosa Pass impresses tourists with the golden hue of the Mimosa flowers and Song Pha Pass – connecting Phan Rang (Ninh Thuan) to Da Lat (Lam Dong) – is hidden under rows of ancient trees Long Lanh Pass as its name suggests is both vibrant under the morning sun and gently warm always ready to welcome the footsteps of adventurers coming to the City of a Thousand Flowers.

title: Lung Van
description: Lung Van is a famous landmark of one of the four largest and oldest cultural cradles in the Muong land of Hoa Binh (Muong Bi, Muong Vang, Muong Thang, Muong Dong). Lung Van is compared to the rooftop of the Muong land due to its beautiful, majestic natural scenery and the preservation of many traditional Muong customs.|||Lung Van is located about 40 km from the center of Hoa Binh city. Although situated deep within the Hoa Binh - Moc Chau route, the path is extremely rugged with high mountain passes and steep, winding roads stretching 13 km, Lung Van has a strange allure with its ethereal clouds resembling a fairyland.|||Lung Van is located at an altitude of 1,200 meters above sea level, covered in clouds throughout the year, and surrounded by Tru Mountain, Po Mountain, and Tien Mountain, earning it the name Cloud Valley. The thin layers of clouds drift gently, as if dancing with travelers. The cool air, due to the mountainous surroundings, makes the mist even more illusory.|||Visitors to Lung Van can tour, stay overnight in Muong stilt houses, work alongside locals on daily tasks, or participate in community cultural activities. There is a single market in Lung Van, located at the center of the commune, held once a week on Tuesdays, where visitors can learn about the beautiful cultural heritage of the Muong people.

title: Nam Cat Tien National Park
description: Nam Cat Tien Forest is known as a famous wilderness nature reserve. With activities like biking trekking canoeing and exploring the lives of ethnic communities this place has become an attractive and ideal destination for weekends.|||Nam Cat Tien National Park is located in three provinces Dong Nai Lam Dong and Binh Phuoc 150 km from Ho Chi Minh City. Characterized by tropical moist forest the ecosystem here is extremely diverse with varied terrain including vast primary forests and unique ancient trees. Green trees cover over 50% of the area of Nam Cat Tien Forest 40% is bamboo forest and the remaining 10% is farmland.|||Nam Cat Tien Forest is home to many animal species such as horse deer bear banteng elephant black footed civet and muntjac. Bird species include white winged duck black eagle and large hornbill. It is also the habitat of over 40 species listed in the Red Data Book with the most notable being the one horned rhinoceros.|||The best time to explore Nam Cat Tien Forest is from December to May when there is little rain the forest is dry and it is convenient for travel.|||Visiting Nam Cat Tien Forest tourists can participate in activities like biking through the forest exploring wildlife at night watching sunrises and sunsets and kayaking. Don t forget to try famous specialties like snakehead fish grilled in soup stewed water spinach soup river fish hotpot and wild vegetables. When exploring Nam Cat Tien Forest visitors must follow the regulations of the National Park Management Board such as not disturbing wildlife disposing of trash properly and preserving the clean green ecological environment.

title: Thai Cultural Artifacts and Relics Exhibition Hall
description: In addition to its distinctive community-based tourist villages like Lac Village and Pom Coong,... Mai Chau is also known for the Thai Cultural Artifacts and Relics Exhibition Hall. It is one of the few places preserving the traditional culture of the Thai ethnic group in Hoa Binh province.|||The Thai Cultural Artifacts and Relics Exhibition Hall is located in Chienh Chau Commune, Mai Chau. Mr. Kieu Van Kien, the museum founder, is a Kinh ethnic person who moved to the picturesque Mai Chau area, married, and established his career there.|||Currently, the exhibition hall houses over 1,000 artifacts collected by Mr. Kien from various regions across the country. Among them, the most precious items include more than 10 Thai script books, especially three family genealogies of the Thai ethnic group dating back over 200 years.|||From Hanoi, visitors travel by car or personal motorcycle for 140km to reach Mai Chau town first.|||From the center of Mai Chau town, visitors ask locals for directions and travel an additional 4km to reach the Thai Cultural Artifacts and Relics Exhibition Hall. The route here is very close and easy, convenient so visitors don't have to worry too much.|||Visitors can visit the Thai Cultural Artifacts and Relics Exhibition Hall at any time of the year whenever they visit Mai Chau. However, the best time to combine visiting these sites is in Spring and Autumn.|||In Spring, visitors can experience unique cultural aspects while in Autumn, they can capture beautiful photos of the golden terraced fields.|||When visiting here, tourists usually tour and admire culturally valuable artifacts in the daily life of the Thai people such as bowls, plates, teapots, household tools, Thai script books, and family genealogies of the Thai ethnic group over 200 years old.|||Additionally, visitors can listen to the touching love story of the owner with his late Thai ethnic wife.

title: Mai Chau Valley
description: Mai Chau Valley is a landmark in Hoa Binh province, located 140 km northwest of Hanoi. Mai Chau is stunning; it is a vibrant depiction of mountain life shaped by various elements. Whenever you visit Mai Chau Valley, you'll experience the unique charm of its mountain life. It offers a serene and pure living environment, with a mesmerizing view of the mountains, houses, and people, creating a vibrant valley landscape.|||Mai Chau captivates at any time with its natural beauty of rice fields, forests, traditional houses, and the warm hospitality of the locals. The cool climate year-round makes visitors feel relaxed and free from daily stresses.|||Viewing the entire Mai Chau Valley from Dau Rong Mountain is unparalleled. From the height, you'll witness the majestic, layered mountains encircling the valley, with the entire landscape resembling a colorful painting.|||The valley features green and golden rice fields, pink houses, and green foliage. In the early morning, the valley is shrouded in mist, creating a gentle atmosphere. In the afternoon, drifting mountain clouds across the sky and over the peaks create a mystical and poetic ambiance.|||Notably, Mai Chau's Ban Lac tourist area is renowned for its appealing and convenient homestay services. Guests stay in charming stilt houses with all necessary amenities. The area is extremely safe, with families often not locking doors at night. The food and drink services are excellent and reasonably priced.

title: Thung Nai
description: Thung Nai là một xã lòng hồ trên sông Đà thuộc huyện Cao Phong, tỉnh Hòa Bình, nằm cách trung tâm thành phố Hòa Bình khoảng 25 km. Với vẻ đẹp kỳ thú, Thung Nai được nhiều du khách trong và ngoài nước yêu mến gọi là “Vịnh Hạ Long trên núi". Nhờ hệ thống núi đá vôi rất đặc trưng của Hòa Bình, khi ngập nước, Thung Nai chẳng khác nào một Hạ Long thu nhỏ.|||Ở Thung Nai có rất nhiều địa danh để tham quan, khám phá như bản Mu, lòng hồ thủy điện Hòa Bình, đền Bà Chúa Thác Bờ, chợ nổi, hang Trạch, động Thác Bờ... Cảnh quan tại Thung Nai đẹp và hoang sơ với những đảo đá trên hồ hay những khu rừng rậm rạp. Ngoài tìm hiểu các nét văn hóa đặc sắc của người dân địa phương, du khách còn có dịp thưởng thức những món ăn ngon như cá thiểu hồ sông Đà hun khói, lợn Mường,...|||Thung Lai đang là điểm đến thú vị của nhiều du khách gần xa. Đến Thung Nai, khi ngồi trên con thuyền nhỏ len lỏi giữa những đảo đá, chúng ta sẽ càng cảm thấy tự hào về những cảnh đẹp nên thơ của dải đất hình chữ S.|||Không chỉ đẹp vào mùa nước nổi mà đến mùa cạn Thung Nai còn khoác trên mình một vẻ đẹp vô cùng độc đáo và khác lạ làm lay động lòng người, khiến bất cứ ai cũng cảm thấy như bị mê hoặc trước vẻ đẹp yêu kiều thơ mộng ấy. Đến đây du lịch vào những ngày cuối tuần, bạn sẽ cảm thấy tâm hồn được lấp đầy bởi những cảm xúc ngọt ngào và bỏ lại sau lưng những mệt mỏi ồn ào của nhịp sống sôi động nơi thị thành.

title: Thac Voi Waterfall
description: Thac Voi or Nokrop Waterfall is located in Dong Nai commune Bu Dang district Binh Phuoc province a must visit tourist site eagerly sought by many adventurers in their journey to discover the hidden beauty of the mountains and forests gifted by nature to the people of Binh Phuoc.|||Visitors to Thac Voi in Binh Phuoc province can immerse themselves in the wonderful Bu Lac grassland admire the majestic natural scenery and breathe in the fresh air. To reach Thac Voi travelers follow National Highway 14 Ho Chi Minh Road towards Di Linh highlands a challenging and thrilling route with hairpin turns and winding paths through the hills.|||Adventurers can walk through cool smooth mountain rocks to fully admire the waterfall and rows of trees shedding leaves and straight pepper trees in the surrounding gardens.|||During the rainy season the season of waterfalls and photographers wandering through the mountains and forests to immerse themselves in the waterfalls experience the deep and mysterious wilderness. They return to the hidden stream and waterfall in the deep forest to hear the songs of birds. If lucky they might see red-faced silver monkeys leaping through branches hear the flutes of the S Tieng people and the calls of friends going up the terraces.|||Invite visitors to visit Dong Truong Son to satisfy their passion for waterfalls and you will become more tender learn to love more wisely and carry both dreams and aspirations to conquer other fascinating destinations on this beloved S shaped land.

title: Sa Dec Flower Village
description: Visitors to the Mekong Delta cannot forget Sa Dec Flower Village, a famous tourist destination in Dong Thap province located between the Hau River and Tien River.|||According to legend, when Lord Nguyen established the town of Sa Dec, he brought many servants who stayed to teach local residents skills like weaving, making cakes, making nem (spring rolls), and most importantly, flower cultivation.|||Sa Dec's strategic location as an island surrounded by the Tien and Hau Rivers provides fertile alluvial soil, a pleasant climate, and abundant natural resources. The dense network of canals and streams forms an extensive waterway transportation system. Flowers from Sa Dec spread throughout the Mekong Delta regions like Vinh Long, An Giang, Ha Tien, Kien Giang... Conversely, flowers from other areas also gather in Sa Dec, such as Cai Mon, Lac, Thanh Phu, Ba Tri. This diversity adorns Sa Dec with countless colors of flowers.|||During lunar December, many tourists are attracted because this is when the simple, colorful beauty of the Mekong Delta becomes fully visible. The beauty is part of daily life, not extravagant or elaborate, but simple—like trays of kumquat trees, baskets of chrysanthemums, and flower arrangements neatly arranged on racks, casting reflections into the fertile red river. Young women in ao ba (traditional dresses) can be seen carrying baskets of flowers down to boats.|||Visitors should stay in the village to fully experience the charm and beauty of the land and its people. Here, every household grows flowers; some have a few acres, others have several. Flowers stretch along hamlets, canals, pathways, and layers, following boats to all corners of the country.

title: Thap Muoi Lotus Field
