The monument complex also includes cool waiting houses for visitors; and large stones carved with poems about the Heroic Vietnamese Mother.|||The skillful carvings make visitors feel moved and touched by the image of the Mother towards her children - the brave soldiers and wholeheartedly devoted to the country during the intense struggles. Everyone's heart is stirred, lingering, and deeply emotional with a love for the Mother when coming here.

title: Bay Mau Coconut Forest
description: Bay Mau Coconut Forest in Cam Thanh, Hoi An, is an attractive destination for visitors to explore. The forest got its name because it originally had around 7 mau of coconut trees that grew freely. Today, it has grown to over 100 hectares, but locals and tourists still call it Bay Mau Coconut Forest because the name has become familiar and dear to them. Located in brackish water, it's ideal for coconut trees to thrive.|||Here, visitors can explore the forest entirely by boat in a Southwestern style. However, what sets this coconut forest apart from others in the Mekong Delta is that instead of using common boats, locals use basket boats.|||It's recommended to visit in August of the lunar calendar to see the coconut trees in season and enjoy delicious coconut rice with sesame. Avoid visiting in November and December as rain may trap you indoors and spoil your trip.

title: O O Waterfall
description: O O Waterfall, located in Tien Chau commune, Tien Phuoc district, has a length of over 7km, formed from three streams originating from high mountains such as Bang Lim, Nong Cuom, and Cay Giay. The cool water flows through rocky crevices and forest canopies, then merges and joins the Tien River, following the Thu Bon River to the sea.|||Right at the foot of the waterfall is a clear and green pond, visible to the bottom, an ideal place for visitors to soak in the cool water or let the waterfall spray 'massage' their bodies to cool off on hot summer days. Between O O Waterfall and O Dieu Waterfall is Vuc Ban with a charming space, a perfect stop for rest, relaxation, and taking memorable photos. Above is a wide rocky area under a shaded tree canopy. Below is a clear and cool pond, home to many mountain crabs and stream fish swimming freely...|||O O Waterfall is an ideal place for young people to swim and enjoy the water, with the main waterfall splitting into smaller streams on both sides, each with its own unique beauty. A must-do experience here is taking a bath under the waterfall stream.|||Not only an attractive and impressive tourist destination, visiting O O stream, tourists also have the opportunity to explore many interesting intangible cultural values of this peaceful land, with simple, honest, and hospitable locals.

title: Da Nang Museum of Fine Arts
description: Located at 78 Le Duan, Thanh Thang Ward, Hai Chau District, Da Nang City, the museum is preserving and exhibiting over 1000 modern art pieces and folk art artifacts as well as traditional handicrafts.|||The Da Nang Museum of Fine Arts was established on 29/7/2014, with the function of preserving, exploiting and promoting the value of artistic heritage of Da Nang and the region.|||Notably, many sculptors, painters, and collectors in the city and surrounding areas have donated valuable works or left their entire collections to the museum. Therefore, the Da Nang Museum of Fine Arts is not only a place to preserve, promote, and honor the value of artworks but also reflects the warm and intimate exchange between Vietnamese and international artists.|||The Da Nang Museum of Fine Arts consists of 3 floors, with a total exhibition area of 1,185.5m2 on a land area of 1,875m2, which was formerly the old base of the Da Nang Museum of History. The outer wall is built in square blocks with right angles. The garden is planted with many flowers and plants, creating a relaxing and comfortable feeling for visitors during their visit.|||The first floor includes a grand hall, a short-term exhibition area and an art exploration space for children.|||The main hall is the most solemn space of the museum, used to welcome and provide necessary information to visitors about the tour route.|||It also features a 5m x 3m copper relief, skillfully crafted by artisans with themes on the development process of Da Nang's art and Central - Central Highlands region.|||The short-term exhibition space is one of the attractive art spaces of the Museum because the theme, content, and form of display are always changed, with at least one new exhibition taking place here every month.|||Additionally, the art display and exploration space for children is an attractive place where they can enjoy high-quality artworks that have won prizes in city and national children's drawing competitions.|||The second floor introduces 5 special themes on modern art of Da Nang, the region and the whole country, including artworks of typical artistic value in the collection of the Museum such as lacquer, oil paintings, silk, graphics, sculptures… and themes of revolutionary struggle.|||The works here are quite unique and creative, with many abstract pieces that can be challenging to understand at first glance, sparking curiosity in viewers.|||Moreover, this is also a popular check-in spot among young people due to its elegant and extremely artistic space.|||The 3rd floor displays and introduces ancient art, folk art and many traditional handicraft products of Da Nang and the Central - Highland region such as the art of creating patterns on fabric, jewelry, ethnic costumes; wood carvings, worship paintings, statues, worship artifacts; folk art of house sculptures of the ethnic groups in Truong Son - Tay Nguyen, a collection of Tuong masks and traditional applied art such as stone art, ceramics, woodwork…|||The Da Nang Fine Arts Museum is a cultural address for the people of Da Nang, a must-visit destination for domestic and international tourists, and a place for artists to gather and exchange.

title: Museum of Buddhist Culture
description: Vietnam's first Buddhist museum is located within the 700m2 grounds of Quan The Am Pagoda, Ngu Hanh Son District, Da Nang City. The museum houses hundreds of ancient Buddhist artifacts and has become a new attraction in Ngu Hanh Son since January 2016.|||The museum currently displays over 200 artifacts that embody unique cultural values, including: statues of Bodhisattva Quan Yin, Bodhisattva riding a dragon fish, ancient sets of deities such as Shakyamuni, Medicine Buddha, Maitreya, Bodhisattva of Esoteric Buddhism, Avalokiteshvara, Champa, Amitabha, bronze bells, an octagonal set of scepters, etc. In addition, the pagoda also preserves many artifacts such as Buddha statues, wooden Buddhist scriptures, ancient bronze incense burners, ceremonial objects, etc. dating from the 7th to the late 19th and 20th centuries.|||One of the unique and singular antiques not to be missed in the displayed collection is the Bodhisattva Quan Yin sitting on a dragon's head and a fish's body. The 50cm-high, 7kg bronze statue was discovered and gifted to the pagoda a few years ago.

title: Linh Ung Son Tra Pagoda
description: Linh Ung Pagoda is located in the But But area, Son Tra peninsula, about 10km northeast of Da Nang city center. The pagoda was started on July 4, 2004, and inaugurated on July 30, 2010.|||The pagoda is situated on a solid terrain, offering a vast landscape: mountains behind and sea in front, a rare and beautiful natural scenery.|||The Linh Ung - But But complex is built on 20 hectares, featuring main structures such as the main hall, ancestor's hall, monk's quarters, lecture hall, guest house, and various other buildings.|||Upon entering through the Tam Quan gate, 18 La Han statues stand guard in two rows leading to the main hall. The main hall is a place of solemn worship, with the statue of Buddha Shakyamuni in the center, and statues of Bodhisattva Avalokiteshvara and Bodhisattva Ksitigarbha on the sides.|||The most striking feature of this architectural complex is the Bodhisattva Avalokiteshvara statue, a unique spiritual art piece that required significant resources.|||Initially designed to be 32m tall, the statue stands at 67m, with a 35m diameter lotus base.|||This is considered the tallest Avalokiteshvara statue in Southeast Asia (recognized by UNESCO). The statue has 12 floors, each with an altar, and features 12 different manifestations of Bodhisattva Avalokiteshvara.|||Linh Ung - But But Pagoda has long been a favorite spiritual destination for Buddhists and international tourists visiting Da Nang.|||The pagoda boasts a majestic natural scenery, steeped in legend, making it an attractive site for visitors. Here, guests can explore Buddhist culture, natural landscapes, and unique ecosystems.

title: Asia Park
description: On its opening day, Asia Park entered the Guinness World Records for having the Sun Wheel, one of the top 10 tallest Ferris wheels in the world at 115m high (equivalent to a 25-storey building). From that height, Da Nang offers a breathtaking view with a wide open sight. The name 'Da Nang View' probably originated from here.|||Asia Park is called the "park of records" because it has gathered many of Vietnam's firsts: Monorail - the most modern elevated train; Queen Cobra - the largest suspended roller coaster in Vietnam with 5 continuous 360-degree spiral loops at a height of 34m; Golden Sky Tower - the highest free-fall tower in Vietnam at 47m, equivalent to a 13-storey building...|||Japan, India, Cambodia, Indonesia, Singapore, Thailand, South Korea, China, Nepal, Vietnam - 10 Asian countries are miniaturized in Asia Park, featuring architectural works that showcase the cultural characteristics of these nations.|||A gate with the features of Ngo Mon - Hue depicts the image of Vietnam.|||Seeing the Merlion statue spouting white water jets means you have arrived in Singapore.|||The monorail station mimics the distinctive chalet-style architecture of Lumbini, Nepal, the birthplace of Buddha.|||Paradise Fall brings ancient Korean architecture to Da Nang.|||In the Japan area, see hundreds of lanterns, especially the carp lanterns that symbolize the strength and courage of Japanese men.|||The exposed tree roots, stone walls, moss-covered colors, and cracks of time... it feels like the famous Angkor Wat of Cambodia has been here for centuries.|||But perhaps the most unique architectural work here is the 9-face Clock Tower, with an area of 550m2 and a height of 29m. Each clock face is an architectural symbol of a country. The domes of Indian mosques, the multi-story towers, the mystical small roofs of Nepal, the characteristic royal palace architecture of China... So much passion, so many special impressions from travels through Asian countries, Bill Bensley - top 5 world-renowned architects, who directly designed this work, seems to have encapsulated them all into this Clock Tower.|||Asian culture is still palpable in the frequent festivals held at Sun World Danang Wonders. At the Colorful Night Festival, visitors will be enchanted by the famous Manipuri dances from India. During the Mid-Autumn Festival in the Asian park, visitors enjoy watching the carnival performances of elaborately costumed characters in the style of the Masskara Festival of Smiles in Bacolod city, Visayas island, Philippines…|||Thus, the journey of exploring the miniaturized Asia in Asia Park becomes increasingly unique each year as iconic structures are completed and spectacular festivals are held.|||As soon as you step into the gate, every step feels like you're about to fly, accompanied by lively music. There's a whole kingdom of games for kids and families, featuring the Festival Carousel, Dino Island, Tree house Playland, Happy Choo Choo, Angry Motors… There are hundreds of exciting games to enjoy together at Soft Play or Sun Blaster - the largest indoor shooting game in Vietnam, covering an area of 250m2…|||In Japan area, Kabuki Truck takes kids on a thrilling car racing adventure. Fireflies Forest offers an exhilarating experience with rapid loops on a super-speed roller coaster designed for children.|||Come to Korea to enjoy the romantic feeling with Love Lock - a game inspired by love locks. In China Town, Fairy Tea House offers a fun experience with 'colorful tea cups'. The Flying Kirins takes tourists on an adventurous journey to conquer the ocean on a pirate ship.|||Queen Cobra - the largest suspended roller coaster in Vietnam, designed with the image of a King Cobra in Kerala, India. It tempts players to get on the 34m high hanging seat and free-fall at 80km/h, then twist through continuous 360-degree loops.|||Meanwhile, the Golden Sky Tower, the highest free-fall tower in Vietnam, offers a different thrilling experience. It lifts players off the ground to a height of 47m, allowing them to gaze at the city from above for a moment before suddenly plunging back down to earth at a rapid speed of 67.7km/h.|||But perhaps the most thrilling experience of all is the Singapore Sling – ranked among the top 10 best roller coasters in the world. The sensation of flying upside down, spinning 360 degrees, and then free-falling at a speed of 65km/h makes anyone feel proud to have overcome a great challenge in life. Every second at Asia Park is equal to millions of joyful moments and relaxation.|||When visiting Asia Park, you will encounter many small families, groups of friends, and school classes choosing this place for an outing with many interesting experiences. It's because, in the heart of the city, the park offers green spaces where you can shake off the noise, chaos, and stress.|||Over 5,000 trees of many species, including phoenix, sưa, muong anh dao, muong hoang yen, byng lang, hoa vo uu, loc vung... Some special types like Tùng la hán, typically found in Japanese noble gardens, make Asia Park a unique botanical garden for explorers.|||Visiting Asia Park is also a fun trip through the three regions of Vietnam, with hundreds of delicious specialties at the restaurants on site, indoors and outdoors.|||Discover a spectacular Asia in each cultural zone, indulge in experiences and challenges with world-class games, and enjoy the feeling of being pampered while strolling through lush green paths, breathing in the fresh air of a green oasis, forgetting all worries and treating your taste buds to irresistible delicacies. Just come to Asia Park for a perfect vacation in Da Nang.

title: Hai Chau Village Communal House
description: Over 500 years ago, 43 families from Hai Chau village, Tinh Gia district, Thanh Hoa province followed King Le Thanh Tong to the south to clear land and establish Hai Chau village. The communal house of Hai Chau village was built in 1806 during the reign of Gia Long to worship the village's guardian deity and the previous and subsequent sages of the village.|||The Hai Chau communal house is one of the harmonious, large-scale, and beautifully architectured communal houses in Da Nang today. In front of the communal house is a rectangular pond with a fake mountain and a large banyan tree.|||The communal house features a main building, a front house, two corridors, and a main hall. All architectural units are made of wood, with tiled roofs and brick walls. The Tam Quan gate still clearly displays the name 'Hai Chau Chanh Xa' in Chinese characters.|||The communal house preserves many artifacts, horizontal boards, and couplets in Chinese characters, gilded and aged several hundred years. A bronze bell, 1.3m high and 0.7m in diameter, is also preserved. The bell features two dragons coiled around each other and Chinese and Nom characters.|||In 2009, the Hai Chau district People's Committee restored the Hai Chau Village Communal House festival to educate people about gratitude and tradition. The festival has been organized three times and become a cultural and attractive tourist product.

title: Lai Thieu Eco-Tourism Area
description: Lai Thieu Eco-Tourism Area is a natural and serene getaway, surrounded by trees, flowers, and greenery. Located just 40km from Da Nang city, it offers a peaceful retreat from the hustle and bustle of urban life. Spanning over 50ha, the area boasts fresh air and a vast expanse of greenery. Lai Thieu is an ideal destination for tourists to visit the zoo, go on outings, entertain, relax, enjoy food, and organize events.|||The eco-tourism area was built to be a green, clean, beautiful, and fresh space, meeting the demands of Danang residents and domestic and international tourists for a relaxing getaway with a rural charm.|||The area has been collecting, preserving, and maintaining unique fruit trees from all regions of the country, including some rare and precious species. After over 10 years of collection, Lai Thieu Eco-Tourism Area now has over 120 different fruit tree varieties.|||Notably, the area features a traditional wooden house and a stilt house of the Co-tu ethnic group, aimed at preserving their culture and identity.|||Visiting Lai Thieu, tourists can experience the fresh air, lush greenery, and crystal-clear streams. The area is dotted with ancient houses, trellises, and poetic scenery. It's like stepping back to childhood, with a chance to explore, learn, and savor the flavors of rare and exotic fruits.|||Here, tourists can observe, explore, and learn about the various fruits, as well as taste their delicious flavors.

title: Ho Chi Minh Museum in Thua Thien Hue
description: Thua Thien Hue, the land that nurtured the childhood of President Ho Chi Minh during his time living, studying, and participating in patriotic activities with his family from 1895-1901 and 1906-1909. This place helped shape his patriotic thoughts, which inspired him to find a way to save the country and its people.|||Ho Chi Minh's heritage in Hue, in terms of physical remnants, consists of a system of historical sites he left behind. There are approximately 20 historical sites and memorials in Thua Thien Hue, including 4 national-level historical sites: the Ho Chi Minh Memorial House at 112 Mai Thuc Loan (new address 158), Quoc Hoc Hue School, the Ho Chi Minh Memorial House in Duong No village, Duong No communal house, and 5 provincial-level historical sites. As for intangible heritage, there are thousands of written and oral documents about Ho Chi Minh, stories about him, and his own recollections of his time in Hue, as well as his affection for Thua Thien Hue and the province's love for him.|||The legacy that Ho Chi Minh and his family left in Thua Thien Hue is a source of pride and an invaluable asset. The Ho Chi Minh Museum in Thua Thien Hue has the honor and heavy responsibility of preserving, restoring, and promoting its value, contributing to integrating Ho Chi Minh's thoughts and example into daily life, encouraging people to strive for a rich, strong, democratic, equal, and civilized society, and building Thua Thien Hue with a thriving economy, vibrant culture, and robust national defense and security.

title: Tu Dam Pagoda
description: Located in Truong An ward, Tu Dam Pagoda is one of the four largest and oldest pagodas in Hue city.|||The pagoda was originally named An Ton and built in 1695. In 1841, King Thieu Tri of the Nguyen dynasty renamed it Tu Dam, meaning "auspicious cloud".|||Over 300 years of formation and development, Tu Dam Pagoda has become a spiritual tourist attraction for domestic and international visitors, with significant historical and cultural values.

title: Vong Canh Hill
description: If you have a chance to visit Hue, don't miss Vong Canh Hill – the spiritual eyes of the ancient capital. Vong Canh Hill in Hue is a perfect combination of natural beauty, rivers, and mountains that nature has favored Hue with.|||With its peaceful and romantic scenery, this is a great destination for both locals and international tourists. Vong Canh is a gentle hill, only 43m high, located beside the gentle Huong River. It belongs to Thuy Xuan village, 7km southwest of the city, on the way to Tu Duc Tomb.|||The view from here is mesmerizing. From Vong Canh Hill, you can see the poetic beauty of Hue, especially the tombs of the Nguyen kings and the Huong River flowing through the city.|||Vong Canh Hill may not be as beautiful as Nui Ngu Binh, but it lives up to its name as it offers a stunning view of Hue's poetic landscape. It's considered the angel eyes of the ancient capital because it's the best place to admire the entire scene of the Huong River like a soft silk strip under the hill.|||From Vong Canh Hill, visitors can see the green orchard of fruits such as coconut, longan, orange, tangerine, thanh tra… interspersed with pine trees, gray-tiled temples, ancient tombs, and a few village roofs like Huong Ho, Hai Cat. You can also see Hon Chen Temple and other wonderful scenery.|||It's best to visit Vong Canh Hill at sunrise or sunset to fully appreciate the poetic and artistic beauty of the hill, the river, and the sky of Hue. All become shimmering and magical as if in a fairyland.|||For travel teams, motorbike groups, and photographers, there's no better place than Vong Canh.|||At Vong Canh Hill, you'll enjoy fresh and peaceful air. Visitors who come here at sunrise or sunset will deeply appreciate the poetic beauty of the hill, a river bend, and a corner of the Hue sky. The hill has a spacious area, suitable for team activities, and is a great spot for photographers to capture perfect moments.|||Vong Canh Hill is located on the route of traditional villages of Hue, including villages famous for incense and conical hats. It's also close to Tu Duc Tomb and Dong Khanh Tomb, making a motorbike an ideal vehicle for exploring.

title: Ho Tinh Tam Lake
description: Ho Tinh Tam Lake was originally known as Ky Te Lake and was rebuilt by King Minh Mang in 1822 as a recreational spot.|||The lake is also known as Bac Ho (Northern Lake) because of its location in the north of Dai Noi. King Minh Mang built many pavilions, towers, and gardens around the lake, making it a beautiful scenic spot in the imperial city.|||The lake has a circumference of over 1,400m and is surrounded by a 2.50m high brick wall with four gates: Dong Hy (North), Ha Huan (South), Xuan Quang (East), and Thu Nguyet (West). The lake features three islands: Phuong Truong (North), Bong Lai (South), and Doanh Chau (West).|||On Phuong Truong Island, the main architectural work is Nam Huan Cac, a two-story building with yellow glazed tiles, facing south. Other notable structures include Tinh Tam Lau, Thien Nhien Duong, and Duong Tanh Hien.|||On Bong Lai Island, the main structure is Dien Bong Doanh, a three-room building with a double-roofed design, facing south.|||The lake is a refreshing and attractive spot in the heart of the ancient capital city of Hue and among the people of Hue.|||Ho Tinh Tam Lake was ranked as a national historical site by Decision No. 99/2004/QD-BVHTT on December 15, 2004.

title: Phu Cam Church
description: When it comes to Hue, many people think of famous landmarks like the Imperial City, Thien Mu Pagoda, etc. But few remember that Hue also has many other places to explore, like Phu Cam Church. One of the most beautiful architectural churches in Hue. If you travel to Hue without visiting Phu Cam Church, you will surely feel like something is missing.|||Located on Phuoc Qua hill in Phu Vinh ward, Hue city, Phu Cam Church has a modern architectural style. It is also one of the largest, most famous, and oldest churches in Hue.|||After going through the ups and downs of history and three bishops, Phu Cam Church only took 40 years to be built and now looks as it does today. The church's architecture is quite unique and rich in expression. Overall, the church looks like a dragon rising straight up to the sky. It exudes a strong yet gentle and elegant beauty.|||Inside the large church, which can accommodate about 2,500 people, there are a series of stained-glass windows on both sides, keeping the church full of natural light. Phu Cam Church has a modern architectural style, combined with Western classical style. There are columns cast against the wall, gradually moving forward as they rise. Then, they are connected in pairs by a conduit on top. It looks like two hands clasped together in prayer.|||More specifically, the sanctuary is built on a higher level. With a circle of 3 steps symbolizing Heaven in the middle. The altar is carved from a single block of marble from Non Nuoc stone village (Da Nang).|||Despite going through the ups and downs of history, the beauty of this Hue church still exists. On every Christmas occasion, Phu Cam Church is a popular destination for people to celebrate. Every day, the church radiates its own beauty, and on Christmas Eve, Phu Cam Church becomes even more beautiful. With colorful electric lights decorated skillfully, it attracts passersby.|||Today, Phu Cam Church is not only a familiar destination for Catholics. But it is also an address for young people and tourists to visit. A church in Hue that is both majestic and elegant, contributing to making Hue city more attractive and unique.

title: Cua Viet Beach
description: Located in Cuu Viet town, Gio Linh district, Quang Tri province, Cua Viet beach is 15km east of Dong Ha city, about 1km north of the Asian crossroad (Song - Cuu Viet). The convenient traffic and roads make it easy to find. In recent years, Cua Viet beach has been changing to wear a new and more beautiful look, ready to be an ideal stopover for those who want to find a "healing spot" to rest and relax.|||The best time to visit Cua Viet is from April to September. During this period, Quang Tri often has hot weather due to the impact of the Laos wind. Therefore, the sea is one of the top choices for a destination.|||When visiting Cua Viet, you will immerse yourself in a masterpiece of nature. Cua Viet has a different beauty at each time of day. Early in the morning, the sea is covered with a misty fog. In the clean and cool atmosphere, those who come to Cua Viet at this time will have a moment of silence to stop and merge with the vast space of the sea.|||The most beautiful moment is when the sun rises. The sunrise over the sea is always a magnificent scene that nature gifts us. With its pristine beauty, Cua Viet's early morning sea is definitely a great spot to relax and capture stunning photos.|||However, the most vibrant time at Cua Viet beach is in the afternoon. When visiting here, you must soak in the clear blue water of the sea once. In the afternoon, Cua Viet has a clear blue sky, vast sea stretching out before your eyes with white waves washing over the shore. The cool breeze and salty smell make you feel relieved.|||As you immerse yourself in the cool and clear water and the vast space of the sea and sky, you can forget all your worries and let the waves take your troubles far away.|||In the late afternoon, the sea takes on a dreamy, mysterious purple hue. The purple color makes people slow down, wanting to stand still and let the wind gently caress their hair; to quietly listen to the wind and the sound of waves crashing onto the shore.|||At night, Cua Viet Beach also possesses its own unique beauty. On the dark, vast sky, nights with a full moon are perfect for a stroll and taking in the scenery.|||Cua Viet Beach has changed a lot, with shops now neatly arranged and much cleaner. Along the beach, shops are densely packed, offering a variety of fresh seafood dishes.|||From sweet grilled shrimp, grilled fish, or squid with ginger fish sauce, all are sold at reasonable prices and boast an exceptionally great taste.|||Cu Viet is indeed an ideal stopover. Whether you are a group of friends looking for a place to hang out, a family seeking relaxation, or a soul in need of a place to unwind… During these hot summer days, Cu Viet beach is the perfect getaway for all of us.|||Not only is it a source of pride for the locals, Cu Viet beach is also a key driver of economic and tourism development for the hometown; it is a special attraction in Quang Tri province.

title: Con Co Island
description: Located on the 17th parallel, Con Co Island is not only a strategic island protecting national sovereignty but also one of the rare beautiful islands in Central Vietnam.|||Con Co Island, approximately 30km from Cua Viet Port, Gio Linh District, Quang Tri Province, is also known as Hon Co, Con Ho, or Hon Me. Formed by volcanic activity, the island offers geological and ecological value, like a natural museum with unique basalt rock formations along the coastline, and pristine beaches created from coral, shells, clams, and sand.|||Covering around 2.3 km², with over 70% being primeval forest, Con Co Island is one of the few places in Vietnam that still preserves a nearly intact three-layer tropical forest ecosystem. A must-try experience on Con Co Island is exploring the primeval forest, enjoying the fresh air, and discovering the rich flora and fauna.|||When visiting Con Co Island, don't miss the Island's Traditional House, which keeps historical relics and artifacts, and the Memorial Monument honoring brave soldiers who sacrificed their lives for the country's seas and islands. You can also explore other attractions like the National Flagpole, Con Co Lighthouse, Ben Nghe, and Ben Tranh.

title: Brai Cave
description: Brai Cave is located near the Vietnam-Laos border, in A Soc village, Huong Lap commune, Huong Hoa district, Quang Tri province. It's a popular tourist destination known for its pristine beauty. Many travelers are captivated by the stunning stalactites and stalagmites that are hundreds of years old.|||During the war, Brai Cave served as a shelter for local residents and soldiers to avoid bombings. There are two routes to the cave. Visitors can take the Western Ho Chi Minh Road from Kim Thuy commune (Le Thuy district, Quang Binh province) for about 40km to Brai mountain or from Dong Ha town (Quang Tri province) via National Highway 9 to Khe Sanh town (Huong Hoa district, Quang Tri province), then continue on the Western Ho Chi Minh Road for about 60km to the foot of the mountain. From there, a 100m hike up the hill brings you to Brai Cave.|||The cave entrance is a wide triangle-shaped opening, hidden behind thick vines. Upon entering, visitors are immediately struck by the impressive colorful stalactites and stalagmites with unique shapes hanging from the ceiling. Notably, about 350m from the entrance, there's a stunning stalactite formation resembling a natural painting on stone with vibrant brushstrokes. Some other formations have been smoothed by dripping water, giving them a shiny, glazed appearance.

title: Bich La Ancient Village
description: The 500-year-old Bich La Village in Triet Dong commune, Triet Phong district is renowned for its rich history and notable figures. It is the hometown of numerous talented individuals, including Le Duan.|||Visiting Bich La Village, you'll uncover fascinating stories not found in books or newspapers. The Bich La communal house festival, held on the 2nd and 3rd days of the Lunar New Year, is a cultural experience worth exploring.|||Recently, the village has seen 12 to 15 students graduate from university each year, with over 50 students currently studying across the country. Some notable alumni include the internationally recognized painter Le Ba Dang.|||Bich La Village is not only a hub for talented individuals but also a unique tourist destination in Quang Tri, featuring a cluster of special historical sites. The village is home to numerous spiritual architectural works and hosts a famous annual festival, attracting visitors from afar. Traditional games and activities like Bai Choi, poetry recitation, and calligraphy are still preserved here.|||Bich La Village is a treasure trove of folk cultural values. This peaceful land has become a favorite destination for tourists seeking to rediscover ancient traditions and values.

title: Mui Tro
description: Located in Vinh Kim commune (now Kim Thach commune), Vinh Linh district, Quang Tri province, Mui Tro is 40km north of Dong Ha city center and 20km west of National Route 1A. At 30m above sea level, it features white sand and poetic sunshine. This spot is popular among young travelers but remains pristine, surrounded by a mix of forest and sea. It's an ideal destination for travelers, especially young adventurers looking to explore new lands.|||Traveling to Mui Tro is an experience for those who love to explore the beautiful landscapes of the country, a must-see destination when visiting Quang Tri at this time.|||Standing over 30m high, you will be mesmerized by the pristine beauty of the ocean, and realize that we have missed out on many wonders of life that nature has bestowed upon the people of this land. Come to Mui Tro, temporarily leave behind the hustle and bustle of everyday life, and immerse yourself in the vast and endless ocean, and capture the stunning moments at this place to treasure as youthful memories.|||If you're visiting Mui Tro for the first time, you'll be mesmerized by its pristine beauty. Standing on Mui Tro, gazing out at the distance, you'll see just how vast and majestic the landscape is.|||Being lost in the vast blue ocean, surrounded by the emerald sea and the image of sea wanderers, makes you feel small compared to the vastness of the ocean world.|||Mui Tro is also a popular spot for tourists to come and camp on weekends. It's a favorite spot for couples to 'check-in' on their most important day.|||This place has gifted Quang Tri land with majestic things that not many other places have.|||Although it has not been invested in exploitation, Mui Tro still retains its natural beauty. It is a name mentioned in the list of impressive tourist spots in Quang Tri.|||On weekends, Mui Tro becomes an ideal outdoor travel spot for those who love to explore, mostly young people.|||Right behind Mui Tro is a 5-7ha primeval forest with many precious wood trees and rich biodiversity.|||The road to Mui Tro is lined with lush green grass and beautiful wildflowers.|||Standing on the rocky slope, visitors can feel the excitement and adventurous spirit. Besides, tourists can immerse themselves in nature, sea and sky, and enjoy the fresh air. Below is the beach with beautiful sand stretching about 4km from Vinh Thach commune to Vinh Thai commune of Vinh Linh district. You can camp overnight and have a bonfire to have fun with friends on weekends.||||||Mui Tro is a place of untouched nature, featuring a diverse range of natural landscapes, including vast forests, rocky shores, and beautiful beaches. Come to Mui Tro. Let's set up camp together to watch the sunset and wake up early in comfortable sleeping bags to catch the first rays of sunshine in a pristine and romantic land.

title: Chenh Venh Waterfall
description: Chenh Venh Waterfall is located in Huong Phung commune, Huong Hoa district, Quang Tri province. From Dong Ha city, following National Highway 9, up to Khe Sanh, then turning into the Western branch of Ho Chi Minh Road about 27km, Chenh Venh Waterfall is right under the foot of Sa Mu pass, making it an ideal spot for rest, camping, and picnics for tourists, especially on weekends.|||Currently, there are no directional signs to Chenh Venh, so many people find it difficult to determine the stopping point. From the foot of Sa Mu pass, going about 2km, you will see Team 9, Agricultural and Forestry Regiment 52 on the left. From the production team, just go another 150m - 200m to reach the path to Chenh Venh Waterfall. Previously, there was no parking lot, but now locals have set up a shelter and look after vehicles for tourists. The path to the waterfall has also been cleared and widened, making it easier to walk.|||As you walk through the coffee garden, following the path about 100m, you can hear the sound of the stream flowing in the distance. If you pay attention, you can also hear the forest birds singing under the shaded trees.|||When you arrive at the waterfall, you will immediately see large rocks lying scattered in the middle of the stream. The stream water has flat and calm sections, as well as turbulent stretches, winding through small and large stone mounds. On both sides of the stream are 'walls' made of stone with numerous clusters of dense vegetation. We find flat rocks to sit and rest before exploring the mother waterfall. Although it's sunny, being immersed in the forest and mountainous space, with the sound of the stream flowing, feels truly comfortable and relaxing. The scenery here will mesmerize you with its majestic, pristine beauty, giving you a feeling of escaping the noisy and crowded world to find peace and quiet.|||To reach the mother waterfall, you have to climb over a large rock blocking the stream or follow the rocky slope along the sides. At the foot of the mother waterfall is a wide, deep, and blue-green pond. Looking closely at the water, you can see small fish swimming underneath. Being immersed in the clear water on a hot day is unbeatable. The mother waterfall is nearly 20m high, pouring white water down into the pond. From a distance, the waterfall's flow seems moderate, but up close, you realize the water pours down strongly into the green pond, so if you want to experience this 'strong sensation,' remember to bring a life jacket when swimming.|||Around the pond, there is a comfortable area of land, very suitable for camping or setting up a barbecue. Chenh Venh Waterfall has only recently been discovered, but it has attracted not only locals but also travel companies and out-of-town tourists.|||Since there are no restaurants or services around, visitors to Chenh Venh usually bring their own food and drinks. When you visit Chenh Venh Waterfall, remember to clean up before leaving to preserve the beauty of this pristine waterfall in the mountains of Quang Tri.

title: Ta Puong Waterfall
description: When it comes to Huong Hoa in Quang Tri province, people often think of Khe Sanh coffee, with its lush green coffee hills stretching as far as the eye can see and captivating the attention of tourists who set foot in this rustic and simple land. Huong Hoa is a place where you can catch the faint, gentle scent of coffee beans roasted with a rich fragrance. And especially, when mentioning Huong Hoa, tourists can't miss Ta Puong waterfall - one of the most beautiful waterfalls in Quang Tri province, a refreshing spot on hot summer days.|||Ta Puong Waterfall is an attractive destination for adventure-seekers, offering a chance to experience the hospitality and unique culture of the Pa Co and Van Kieu ethnic groups. Ta Puong Waterfall, located in Trang Ta Puong village, Huong Viet commune, Huong Hoa mountainous district, is one of the top choices for tourists when visiting Quang Tri.|||Gifted with majestic scenery by nature, Ta Puong waterfall has been attracting many tourists, especially adventure-seekers who choose it as a stopover to relax during their vacations and weekends.|||With its stunning scenery, the hospitality and unique culture of the Pa Co and Van Kieu people, it is also one of the factors that helps Quang Tri province develop strongly in tourism, particularly in exploration and experiential tourism.|||Ta Puong Waterfall is about 100km from Dong Ha city. If you crave adventure and exploration, take National Highway 9, then turn into Ho Chi Minh trail, about 50km to reach Huong Viet commune center. Here, you will experience the pristine beauty, majestic grandeur, and vertical cliffs that are both challenging and enticing for thrill-seekers.|||Located about 1.5km downstream from Ta Puong waterfall is Ta Puong 2 waterfall, a 20m high cascade that flows straight from the mountainside down through rocky cliffs, enticing adventure-seekers. This spot also offers visitors a chance to rest, admire the scenery, breathe in the fresh and cool air, and immerse themselves in the clear and cold water.|||Ta Puong Waterfall is a favorable spot for developing experiential tourism with fascinating natural scenery, featuring a mild and cool climate, and a rich cultural space of ethnic minority groups.|||The area boasts unique festivals such as the new crop celebration and traditional weaving festival of the ethnic minorities, making it ideal for community-based tourism, cultural experience tourism, and eco-tourism combined with relaxation and rejuvenation.|||Traveling to experience and explore is a trend among young people nowadays, with untouched and novel destinations being a magnet for visitors from near and far, especially the young who love to explore and go on adventures. That's why Ta Puong waterfall is an attractive destination in the hot summer days like now.|||Another advantage for tourism development in Huong Hoa is its revolutionary historical sites like Lao Bao Prison, Ta Con Airport, Lang Vay Stronghold..., which are popular stops for DMZ tours, allowing visitors to reminisce about the old battlefields and their comrades. Additionally, some individuals and organizations have planted daisy and sunflower fields, creating new spots for sightseeing and photography that attract many domestic and international tourists. You can also explore nearby scenic spots such as Brai Cave, Sa Mu Pass, Lao Bao special economic and commercial zone... So, what are you waiting for? Let's enjoy the summer with Quang Tri tourism and breathe the cool fresh air here.

title: La Vang Sanctuary
description: La Vang is the most important and largest site for Vietnamese Catholics. Every year, millions of pilgrims come to this sacred place to pay homage to the Virgin Mary.|||The origin of La Vang has two legends. The first theory is that it comes from 'la vang', which means 'la vang leaves', written without diacritics. This type of leaf is abundant in the area. When the locals were struck by an epidemic, the Virgin Mary appeared and instructed them to find the la vang leaf, which would cure their illness when consumed. This leaf is good for health and is still widely used today.|||Throughout the history of La Vang Sanctuary, priests had built a few small chapels for worship and to honor the Virgin Mary. However, it wasn't until February 11, 1924, the Feast of Our Lady of Lourdes, that the priest of Co Vu, Morineau, announced the construction of a large church in La Vang, designed by architect Carpentier, with a minimum budget of 20,000 dong. After four years of construction, the grand La Vang Sanctuary was completed in 1928, except for the bell tower.|||Today, La Vang in Quang Tri has transformed from a remote area over 200 years ago into a major Catholic pilgrimage center with many impressive structures built to honor the Virgin Mary, where devotees can stay and pray for days.

title: Hang Tom Bridge
description: The old Hang Tom Bridge, once famous as the most beautiful suspension bridge in Northwest Vietnam, connected Muong Lay (Dien Bien) and Phong Tho, Sin Ho of Lai Chau. The bridge got its name from the abundance of shrimp in this stretch of the river. About 50m from the bridge, there was a very cool water spot where shrimp from the Da River would come to lay eggs, making the river thick with them. Locals would take turns catching them, but there was an unwritten rule that each household could only fish for about an hour before passing it on to the next house.|||The construction of Hang Tom Bridge started in the late 1960s with the help of Chinese experts and workers. However, in 1968, due to the Cultural Revolution in China, they withdrew, leaving only the completed cable-stayed parts.|||The bridge was finally inaugurated in 1973, marking a grand celebration for thousands of people from Northwest Vietnam. Many came from afar, walking for days to see and cross the long-awaited bridge.|||Hang Tom Bridge became a highlight of the Northwest region. Its majestic and pristine beauty attracted tourists, especially after the rise of backpacking tourism.|||In November 2012, the Son La hydroelectric dam filled with water, submerging the old Muong Lay town, including the historic Hang Tom Bridge, ending its 40-year operation. A new bridge was built near the old one's location, 70m higher.

title: Muong Thanh Bridge
description: The Muong Thanh Bridge, also known as 'Prenley' by French forces, spans the Nam Rom River. Today, it's just about 300m from the intersection of road 279.|||This historic bridge is known as a key route for the Vietnamese People's Army. Muong Thanh is now a protected historical site, preserved and restored as a tourist destination. After over 60 years, the bridge remains largely unchanged and forever linked to the term 'advance bridge'. Muong Thanh Bridge is a crucial military structure within the central stronghold of Dien Bien Phu province.|||On the morning of May 7, 1954, 34 soldiers from Company 360 bravely captured Muong Thanh Bridge. The battle was intense, with fierce fighting for every inch of land. Timely artillery support from DKZ 57 helped secure the victory, and the bridge was crossed to advance towards the enemy's stronghold. By 5 pm that day, soldiers from Regiment 209, Division 312, had arrived to cross the bridge and head straight into the enemy's command center.|||Within 30 minutes, General De Castrie and other enemy forces at Dien Bien Phu were captured alive. The sight of nearly 10,000 defeated soldiers waving white flags is unforgettable.|||Today, Muong Thanh Bridge no longer serves as a regular crossing but stands quietly on the gentle Nam Ron River, connecting historical moments with the present. It recounts the heroic moments of that year for visitors and those returning to the ancient battlefield.|||The government and state have preserved and protected Muong Thanh Bridge as a tourist site. Over 60 years have passed, but the bridge remains largely intact and forever holds its historical significance.

title: Pe Rang Ky Cave
description: Pe Rang Ky Cave is located at an altitude of over 1,000m above sea level. The cave is over 800m long, hidden under a cliff, amidst a majestic mountainous region, creating a picturesque landscape with layered mountains. The cave consists of 3 compartments with different sized entrances, possessing a mystical beauty that strongly impresses visitors.|||Standing under the cave, visitors feel like they are in an ancient castle, with a grandiose yet romantic architecture. Visitors come here not only to admire the cave's beauty but also to explore the pristine beauty of Ta Phin mountainous area, view terraced fields, and majestic mountains; participate in the famous Toa Chua highland market; enjoy local specialties like Toa Chua mountain goat, black chicken, Mong pe wine, ancient san tuyet tea, and immerse themselves in the melodies of Mong ethnic minority's flutes and songs.

title: Tham Vang Cave
description: From Dien Bien to Muong Ang, where a system of limestone mountains are scattered across the valley of Xuan Lao communal field, is also home to a deep cave called Tham Vang, which takes at least three hours by car to get there.|||Tham Vang cave is a new and unfamiliar name even to locals around Xuan Lao, Muong Ang. According to local descriptions, Tham Vang cave is a limestone cave system with an entrance at the mid-mountain slope. From there, you can descend into the depths, navigating through narrow passages and hazardous crevices to reach the Nam Hua stream that flows around the fields of Chieng Xom, Pha Hun, Mon Ha, and Chieng Lao villages.|||In the local Thai dialect, Tham means 'cave', while Bang or Vang means 'to leave'. Long ago, when couples in the area had marital problems, the husbands would leave their wives and take refuge in Tham Vang cave to cool off. The name Tham Vang cave was derived from the idea of couples separating. Due to its unflattering connotation and the challenging path to the cave, locals rarely visited this cave, as it might be misinterpreted that their family had marital issues.|||It's the rainy season, and a trip to a cave in the forest isn't exactly ideal, but I'm already here. When I arrived at Tham Vang Cave, the valley at the foot of the mountain was deserted and empty. The small trail leading to the foot of the mountain could only fit one person. The rain had left the path muddy and slippery. I walked for a while and finally reached a lush coffee farm, where I met Mr. Phan Nhat, the owner. When he heard I was heading to the cave, he kindly offered to guide me. I brought a machete and had a mix of excitement and nervousness as a traveler. The path became increasingly overgrown with grass, leaves, and debris after we left the coffee farm.|||The journey to Tham Vang now has another fearsome obstacle: la nang Hai. Fortunately, I had encountered this "snack" before in the caves of Phong Nha - Ke Bang, so I knew how to avoid it. La nang Hai looks dazzling, with a soft white downy covering on one side and a delicate green leaf on the other, growing to the size of an outstretched hand and covering the pathways. If you accidentally brush against it while trekking through the forest, the pain is like a burning fire. The initial wound appears as a slight red mark, then the itching starts, and the more you scratch, the more it spreads. The sensation of burning becomes unbearable, and it takes a couple of days to heal.|||Besides the deadly Nha Hai, the path to Tham Vang also boasts a swarm of mosquitoes as dense as the Yuan army. The climb is exhausting, but no one dares to stop for fear of becoming a target for the mosquitoes' grand feast.|||As you continue on, the vast cave entrance finally opens up before you. Fortunately, it's a dry cave, so the stalactites and limestone have been weathered, covered in moss and lichen, taking on mysterious shapes.|||Hanging from the cave ceiling, estimated to be over 50m high, are nearly a dozen giant bee nests, heavy with honey, swaying gently in the breeze.|||Phan Nhat says that every season when the bees are full of honey, the Thai people from the valley will bring bamboo and rattan, insert them into the rocky cliffs and climb up to collect honey. Looking at the steep cliffs, where some bamboo sticks from previous honey-gathering seasons still remain, I honestly can't imagine the dangerous work that involves risking one's life for the honey. With limited equipment, I ventured deeper into the cave, only about a hundred meters in, and all connection with the outside world was cut off, including the light. The darkness was immense, shrouded in mystery among ancient stone pillars that stretched from the cave ceiling to the floor, rugged and enigmatic. My guide, Phan Nhat, said that only about ten people in the area, all experienced climbers, are capable of navigating the entire cave.|||Standing from inside the cave looking out at the Xuan Lao field, one suddenly notices the familiar sight of Tham Vang with the entrance to Hang En cave (Quang Binh). Many geological structures in the cave such as rice terrace-like stalactites, sinkholes, and geological fractures ... are similar to the Phong Nha - Ke Bang cave system like Son Doong, Hang Tien, Hang Tu Lan ... The only difference is the eerie silence. The sound of mosquitoes buzzing, the echo of dripping water into the stone wall, and occasionally the lost cry of a swallow, while outside the cave, the evening light gradually fades, creating a scene that easily evokes feelings of loneliness and melancholy. Exploring the interesting nooks and crannies of Tham Vang, one only sees bats flying and the footprints of monkeys hiding in the cave, with no signs of local people who might have left their homes to live in the cave, perhaps reconsidering their decision, returning to their warm homes rather than befriending loneliness.

title: A1 Martyrs Cemetery
description: The A1 Martyrs Cemetery is located a few hundred meters south of A1 hill, in Dien Bien Phu city. It was built in 1958 and has been upgraded and repaired several times.|||In 1994, the government invested 10 billion dong to upgrade and repair the cemetery. It is the final resting place of 644 soldiers, all of whom were military officers and soldiers who died in the Dien Bien Phu campaign, but most of them are unknown. Only four graves have names: Tran Can, To Vinh Dien, Be Van Dan, and Phan Dinh Got.|||The cemetery has been protected and cared for since its completion, with incense being offered all year round. On important holidays, locals come to pay their respects and remember the great sacrifices made by these national heroes. The cemetery is characterized by its peaceful and serene atmosphere, cool mountain air, and beautiful green surroundings. It is open daily from morning to evening, welcoming thousands of domestic and international visitors. In 2016, there were 26,985 visitors, and in the first six months of 2018, there were over 10,000 visitors.|||The existence of the A1 Martyrs Cemetery serves as a clear historical witness, reminding future generations of the sacrifices made by national heroes and the tradition of patriotism. It is also a tourist destination for visitors from around the world to learn about the history and culture of Vietnam. The cemetery is an important stop on tours of Dien Bien and a reflection of Vietnamese values, specifically the proverb 'drink water and remember its source'.

title: Northwest Flower Garden
description: Located about 18 km from the center of Dien Bien Phu city, Northwest Flower Garden covers an area of over 3ha, with carefully designed landscapes and invested in planting and caring for various flowers to serve the needs of locals and tourists. This garden is an ideal destination for young people and flower enthusiasts to visit, take photos, and enjoy wonderful moments with nature.|||The garden boasts a diverse range of beautiful flowers with vibrant colors, including roses, chrysanthemums, cornflowers, dahlias, sunflowers, and notably butterfly flowers, jasmine, and yellow rapeseed flowers. The garden's scenery, such as walkways through the flower garden, riverside pavilions, and rest stops, is designed to be harmonious and rustic, allowing visitors to take many beautiful photos without getting bored.|||Visitors to Dien Bien will have unforgettable moments, mesmerized by the vibrant colors of various flowers at the Flower Garden.

title: Chiang So Tower
description: The Chiang So tower relic belongs to Na Muong village, Chiang So commune, Dien Bien Dong district, Dien Bien province. This is a unique architectural monument that demonstrates the solidarity and friendship between the people of Vietnam and Laos. According to legend, Vietnam and Laos are brotherly nations, and to prove their solidarity, the two nations together contributed to building a common spiritual work for the local people.|||To date, there is no specific historical document confirming the exact construction date of the tower, but research results indicate that it was built around the 15th-16th century.|||The Chiang So Tower is an architectural artwork that clearly demonstrates the ingenuity and artistic creativity of the people of Vietnam and Laos.|||The tower is architecturally designed in the shape of a wine pot, with a larger base and a smaller top.|||The tower stands at 10.5m high, with four sides around the base featuring two elephants at the front and two dogs at the back.|||The tower is constructed from bricks and mortar made from honey.|||The bricks used for construction come in two types: large, thick ones for the base and smaller, thinner ones for the upper parts and top of the tower.|||The base of the Tower is built in a square shape with multiple layers stacked on top of each other, making the tower's appearance more solid. The brick exterior is plastered with a layer of mortar, and there is no decorative pattern around it.|||The body of the Tower is decorated with intricate patterns, notably a six-tiered lotus flower supporting the tower, along with subtle carvings of animals, flowers, and leaves, arranged in a harmonious composition.|||The tower is also adorned with coiled dragons, their heads and tails meeting to form the number eight. These dragons have a distinctive pattern of scales, unlike any other depiction throughout Vietnamese history.|||They resemble small snakes, similar to those revered in Hindu culture.|||All these decorative elements are balanced around the tower to highlight its beauty, creating an attraction that captivates viewers of this architectural monument.|||From the main part of the tower up, it is built in a hexagonal tube-shaped architecture, surrounded by tangent lines and lotus petal patterns running continuously around the tower body. The entire tower body has 3 layers, each face of each layer is built and plastered flat in a hexagonal shape without decorative patterns, and the middle part of each layer is built to bulge out, resembling young lotus buds. The joints between each layer are decorated with patterns, which are stylized and pre-cast before being attached, such as lotus petals, spearheads, suns, and other floral patterns; inside the lotus petals and spearheads are small mirrors that reflect sunlight and emit a halo when the sun shines on them. The top layer (the tower spire) is decorated similarly to the lower layers, only differing in size, being smaller to create a soft and elegant appearance of the tower.|||Chiang So Tower holds many architectural, historical, and cultural values that still exist today. Firstly, it is an artifact of high artistic value in terms of architecture. The tower's design combined with intricate patterns shows that it is an ancient cultural heritage that embodies creative thinking, artistic intentions, and reflections on life of those who directly built the tower, as well as the people of the two Vietnamese and Lao nations in general.|||On the second day, Cheing So tower holds significant historical value as it helped researchers discover and confirm the long-standing solidarity between the Vietnamese and Lao nations.|||Thirdly, cultural value: with ingenious creativity, our ancestors have left for future generations a cultural heritage - a magnificent ancient Tower, which embodies the cultural beauty of Vietnam and Laos, jointly conceived and built. The existence of this Educational Tower inspires younger generations to look at the relic as if reflecting in a large mirror, witnessing the achievements of our forefathers' labor, with their passion, talent, and unity. All these efforts reveal the goal our ancestors aimed for: 'Truth - Goodness - Beauty'.

title: Muong Lay Town
description: Muong Lay is the northern gateway of Dien Bien Province, connecting with Lai Chau Province, and a land that has gone through many historical ups and downs. Today, despite still bearing some of the pain of the past due to the unintentional destruction of nature, Muong Lay is changing rapidly with the resettlement project of Son La Hydroelectric Power.|||In recent years, Muong Lay has been developing and has taken on the appearance of a riverside town. Muong Lay lies on both banks of the Da River, connected by long bridges, with the large hydroelectric lake creating a picturesque landscape. In the future, Muong Lay deserves to become a northern tourist hub of Dien Bien Province, an ideal stopover for the Northwest arc tour for all travelers.|||Since the Son La hydroelectric project was completed, the water level of the lake has risen about 213m, and the area of approximately 100ha has created an extremely attractive eco-tourism landscape for Muong Lay, with mountains above and a lake below, likened to a Ha Long on land.|||With the cool and fresh climate of the Northwest mountains and forests, Muong Lay is where the land and sky, mountains and rivers, past and present meet. The once ferocious Da River has now become gentle, calm and vast, creating a feeling of comfort and serenity for visitors, as if they are in harmony with nature, land, sky, and country.|||When visiting Muong Lay, don't miss the opportunity to take a boat trip on the lake, to immerse yourself in the vast natural scenery of rivers and water, majestic mountains and forests, and to hear stories with a rich mythological color about the fierce Da River in the past. Along the way, you can stop by Lai Chau to visit and learn about the Deo Van Long mansion, and visit the local fish cage model. This place is also always attractive to those who like to explore and adventure with activities such as fishing on the Da River, climbing mountains to explore the Hang ban Bac cave, or hiking through the forest to visit remote villages hidden beside the mountain cliffs.|||Muong Lay is not only attractive with its romantic natural scenery, but also captivates people with the diverse and unique culture of 9 ethnic groups living here. Each ethnic group has its own cultural identity, creating a rich and diverse cultural picture with characteristic tangible and intangible cultural values. The most typical cultural aspect in Muong Lay is the culture of the White Thai people. Muong Lay is considered the stronghold of the White Thai people in Dien Bien, and is one of the cradles of the elegant dances such as the fan dance, bottle dance and hat dance that have become part of people's subconscious and poetry.|||To better understand the cultural identity and daily life of the locals, you can visit traditional craft villages such as weaving and fabric-making, ethnic musical instrument crafting in Na Lay ward, wood production and processing in Song Da ward, or rattan and bamboo weaving in Lay Nua commune. At night, stop by traditional stilt houses and enjoy local specialties like bitter bamboo shoots, flower ban salad, fish salad, lap, pa pinh top, especially the famous Song Da river fish dishes like lăng and chiên fish, and river shrimp. Amidst the sweet aroma of corn wine, you can get drunk with the locals and join in the xoe dance, swaying to the sweet singing of Thai girls. You can also live and interact with local families to learn about their customs and experience what it's like to be a 'Thai ethnic person'.

title: The Monument of Soldiers Pulling Guns
description: The lyrics “High mountains ahead, but our determination is even higher. Deep valleys below, which one can compare to our hatred...” Those immortal lyrics in the song “Hò kéo pháo” by composer Hoang Van, somehow recreated the difficulties of our army when pulling guns into battlefields during the historic Dien Bien Phu campaign 66 years ago. Today, the road where the guns were pulled has become a legendary one.|||Pha Din Pass was the most difficult starting point of the journey to pull guns by human power of Dien Bien soldiers back then. Starting from here, through many passes, slopes and deep valleys, the guns were pulled to the battlefields, so that the cannonballs were fired, heading to Him Lam outpost, Doc Lap hill, A1 hill, De Castries Bunker.... From Pha Din Pass to Dien Bien Phu, the road where guns were pulled can’t be measured by its physical length but by difficulties, hardships, dangers, sweat and blood.|||On that road, there was a special section, completed in just 20 hours, with a length of 15km, from Na Nham forest edge, through Pha Song peak at 1,150m high, down to Ban Tau, Ban Ngiu, now part of Na Nhann commune. On that section, our soldiers pulled guns weighing over 2 tons solely by human power, overcoming steep mountain slopes and treacherous high passes. It was on that route that hero To Vinh Dien used his own body to block the gun wheel, so that the gun wouldn’t roll down the deep valley.|||Overcoming countless hardships and difficulties, hundreds of guns and mortars eventually made it to the battlefields. And on March 13, 1954, they simultaneously fired at Him Lam resistant center, marking the beginning of the Dien Bien Phu battle.|||The road to pull guns into Dien Bien Phu battlefields has now become a legendary one. And here is a monument cluster of manually pulling guns, weighing 1,200 tons, honoring the artillery squad of hero To Vinh Dien on Bo Hom hill back then.

title: Nhật Lệ Beach
description: Nhật Lệ Beach boasts pristine beauty with long stretches of white sand and crystal-clear waters.|||Located at the mouth of the Nhật Lệ River flowing into the East Sea, Nhật Lệ Beach offers a unique experience for all visitors.|||Nhật Lệ Beach in Quảng Bình Province was voted one of the top 10 most beautiful beaches in Vietnam.|||The beach has a dreamy, untouched beauty with fine white sand stretching endlessly, standing out against a bright blue sky. The sea water is clear and calm, perfect for various beach activities.|||The beach is gently sloped and very safe, with a refreshing breeze and soothing waves.|||Visitors can enjoy the sunrise or sunset over the ocean, and at night, the beach is like a fairy tale city with twinkling lights.|||The best time to visit Nhật Lệ Beach is during the summer months from May to August, with pleasant weather and minimal rain.|||The beach comes alive at dawn and is bustling with activities, from swimming and sunbathing to trying local seafood.|||Guests can indulge in a variety of fresh seafood, including oysters, mussels, and various fish, prepared by local restaurants or street vendors.

title: Ngang Pass
description: Standing at the peak of Ngang Pass, visitors can perceive the primeval and majestic scenery of mountains and forests. Looking down, one can see a vast expanse of small houses, long flowing rivers, and herds of buffalo grazing. Ngang Pass is also home to remnants of Canh Son Quan from ancient times, which locals call the 'Gate of Heaven', exuding an air of mystique.|||Along the North-South highway, Ngang Pass marks the natural border between Quang Binh and Ha Tinh provinces. Historically, it was the border between Dai Viet and Chiem Thanh. Ngang Pass is a strategic point on the highway, cutting through the Hoanh Son mountain range. It's famously featured in Ba Huyen Thanh Quan's poem 'Qua Deo Ngang', with verses that have become ingrained in the hearts of many Vietnamese people.|||While not the most treacherous pass in Vietnam, Ngang Pass has become a source of inspiration for many poets due to its scenic beauty. Like other passes, it has its share of mountains, forests, cliffs, and clouds. Yet, there's something about Ngang Pass that draws people in with its poetic and romantic charm. Visitors are encouraged to come and experience it firsthand, standing at Hoanh Son Quan to admire the scenery and find their own answer.

title: Hang Va - Nuoc Nut Cave
description: Hang Va is a unique and special place, featuring a system of stalactites and stalagmites with around 1,000 blocks of remarkably uniform size. The formations appear to grow from the ground up. These stalactites and stalagmites are considered extremely valuable and nearly unparalleled globally.|||Hang Va - Nuoc Nut Cave shares a water system with Son Doong Cave. Additionally, both caves boast stunning underwater limestone formations and stalactites. Some people believe the stalactites here are even more beautiful than those in Son Doong Cave. You'll experience this firsthand when you visit and explore naturally.

title: Canh Duong Painting Village
description: Canh Duong is a coastal commune with a picturesque landscape, located next to National Route 1A, about 10km from General Vo Nguyen Giap's tomb. The commune has nearly 375 years of history. This land is considered a sacred place with many talented people, one of the "eight famous villages" of Quang Binh province. It is a village with a rich tradition of literature and a famous fighting village during the resistance war against France with the slogan "village fence fighting", and was twice awarded the title of Hero of the People's Armed Forces.|||With the unique product of a "painting village", visitors will be amazed by the mural road starting from the Ancestor's Temple to the coastal road.|||The unique wall paintings and 3D paintings are drawn to tell the story of the formation and development of the village, its heroic traditions in the resistance war, and the simple beauty of this prosperous coastal village.

title: Memorial House of General Vo Nguyen Giap
description: Originally in his hometown of An Xa village, Loc Thuy commune, Le Thuy district, Quang Binh province, the old house where the General lived was destroyed by American bombs, leaving only a pile of rubble. In 1978, Le Thuy District Party Committee decided to build a memorial house on the land where the General's family once lived.|||The District Party Committee searched for documents and images of the old house, mobilized funds and labor to build the memorial house. When the plan was announced, the cadres and people of Le Thuy district were enthusiastic and actively responded. Some people donated money, while others contributed labor, and the memorial house was completed in a short time. At the inauguration ceremony, the General couldn't attend due to work commitments, but his sister, Vo Thi Lai, attended on his behalf. The General sent a telegram to thank the leaders and people of Le Thuy district for building the memorial house, a precious gift to his family.|||In 1999, the General returned to his hometown and discussed with Le Thuy District Party Committee to renovate the house. In 2000, the house was renovated, keeping only the wooden frame, and the stone and marble floor was replaced with a cement floor. The interior was restored to its original state.|||In 1978, although the memorial house was completed, there was no one to take care of it, and only a few incense sticks were placed to worship the General's parents. The General then asked his nephew, Vo Dai Ham, to take care of the house. Vo Dai Ham recalled: 'The General told me to take care of the house and provide accurate information to visitors. If I didn't know something, I should promise to find out.' Vo Dai Ham followed the General's instructions to this day.|||After the General passed away, the memorial house became a significant place for educating young generations about patriotism, just as the General had instructed. Many delegations of leaders and people from the province and outside came to visit the memorial house, light incense, and pay respects to the General. Students from nearby areas were taken to the memorial house by their teachers to learn and pay respects to the General. Representatives of the delegations wrote their feelings in the memorial books placed at the General's altar.

title: Lan Na Nua
description: Lan Na Nua, located in Tan Lap village, Tan Trao commune, Son Duong district, Thai Nguyen province, is where Uncle Ho lived and worked from late May to August 22, 1945, to lead the August Revolution, gaining power across the country. This is where Uncle Ho said: "At this time, the opportunity has come, no matter how much sacrifice is required, even burning the entire Truong Son mountain range, we must resolutely fight for independence."|||Lan Na Nua is in the Na Nua forest, part of the Hong mountain range (the location was chosen directly by Uncle Ho). Lan Na Nua is hidden under dense tree canopies, ensuring secrecy and meeting Uncle Ho's requirements: near water, near people, far from national highways, advancing conveniently, and retreating easily. The hut was built in the style of a mountainous house. Around the hut, there are walls made of woven bamboo, with the upper half having small openings for light. On the west side, there is a floor (called "thich" by the Tay people) with two water pipes. The floor is made of woven bamboo. Below, at the front of the hut, there is a wide, flat stone where Uncle Ho often sat to work and type on his typewriter when it was dark.|||Also at Lan Na Nua, Uncle Ho instructed the establishment of the Free Zone including 6 provinces: Cao Bang, Bac Kan, Lang Son, Ha Giang, Tuyen Quang, and Thai Nguyen; and unified the armed forces into the Liberation Army.

title: Tuyen Quang Provincial Museum
description: Tuyen Quang Provincial Museum, previously known as Ha Tuyen Provincial Museum, was established after Tuyen Quang and Ha Giang provinces were separated.|||The Tuyên Quang Museum today was built and put into use from July 2010. The Tuyên Quang Provincial Museum building is located at group 19, Phan Thiet ward, Tuyên Quang city. The land area used according to the approved planning is 18,318m2. The project includes many items: the museum building with 3 floors, a construction area of over 1,200m2; auxiliary works: soil erosion prevention wall around the main yard; museum house access road, bridge connecting the museum house with the Memorial area; gardens, traffic roads. The architectural structure of the museum building is expressed in the form of ancient architecture, including 1 main roof in the middle and 4 sloping roofs at 4 house corners, strong and healthy, arranged in a square shape with 4 cut corners to create space for all viewing directions from the park lake.|||The Tuyên Quang Museum not only preserves and exhibits tangible and intangible cultural heritage, historical and cultural relics, and scenic spots, but also conducts scientific research to reflect the province's development in various aspects. From the perspective of historical and cultural tourism, the museum is a destination for the people of Tuyên Quang, the whole country, and international tourists. The interior and garden displays are designed according to a detailed plan, eliminating unnecessary and repetitive details to create an attractive experience for visitors, from the exterior to the historical and cultural artifacts.|||The museum has an exhibition area of 1,600 m2 divided into 4 parts: The main hall and 3 large themed exhibition spaces.|||The Khanh Tiet gallery begins with the central display space of the museum, where the first stop of the tour is marked by a striking 100m2 wooden relief featuring Na Nua hut, the banyan tree of Tan Trao, and Tan Lap village - an iconic representation of the "Capital of the Liberation Zone". This section also showcases beautiful landscapes, historical and cultural images of Tuyen Quang.|||Topic 1: Structured into subtopics on natural conditions - economic potential of Tuyen Quang province and characteristics of cultural features of ethnic groups in Tuyen Quang.|||Theme 2: Exhibiting artifacts and groups of artifacts about Tuyen Quang during the prehistoric and ancient periods; the history of building and defending the homeland.|||Theme 3: Tuyen Quang - Capital of the Liberation Zone - Capital of the Resistance and the path to building socialism.|||With its unique display of artifacts and artistic architecture, beautiful space, the museum has attracted many visitors and historians to explore. Notably, the museum is displaying fossilized remains of primitive humans from around 12,000 years ago, remarkably well-preserved. These remains were excavated at Phia Vai cave (Na Hang). What's special about these remains is the unique burial practice with two seashells placed in the eye sockets. Along with the primitive human remains are a ceramic vessel from the Ly Dynasty (11th-12th century) and two bronze drums of type Hegen 1.|||With its diverse, rich, and unique collection of artifacts, the Tuyên Quang Museum is considered to have a large scale and number of exhibits within Vietnam's museum system. This is also what attracts and captivates visitors.|||Alongside its exhibition activities, Tuyen Quang Provincial Museum has also inventoried 426 intangible cultural heritage items and compiled dossiers for 7 heritage items to be included in the national list of intangible cultural heritage. The museum has developed political and exhibition outlines, plans for provincial museum displays, and several projects aimed at collecting, preserving, and restoring documents and artifacts. It has conducted archaeological excavations at 30 sites, implemented the project to restore the Bao Ninh Sung Phuc Temple, and gradually completed its infrastructure to display artifacts for the public.|||The museum currently holds dossiers and manages 376 out of nearly 560 historical sites in Tuyen Quang, including 93 national and 189 provincial-level sites. Over the past 30 years, it has collected, preserved, and stored 21,500 documents and artifacts, including 14,000 artifacts. It has curated 11 artifact collections, with 90% of its holdings scientifically inventoried. The museum has had one artifact recognized as a national treasure by the Prime Minister and has compiled a dossier for one Vietnam Heritage Tree.|||After 30 years of construction and development, Tuyen Quang Provincial Museum has made many efforts to preserve cultural heritage in the province. Recently, the Department of Culture, Sports and Tourism of Tuyen Quang Province announced and awarded the decision of the Provincial People's Committee to rank the museum as a grade II museum.

title: Tuyen Quang Ancient Citadel
description: Tuyen Quang Ancient Citadel is located in group 8, Tan Quang ward, Tuyen Quang town. The citadel was built in 1592 during the Mạc dynasty and renovated in the early Nguyễn dynasty (19th century). It holds a strategically important military position, guarding the Lo River and situated on a convenient water and road traffic axis, associated with many significant historical events of the revolutionary homeland of Tuyen Quang.|||The construction of the citadel has left many legendary tales. It's said that the citadel was built overnight. The citadel has a square structure, with each side of the wall being 275m long, 3.5m high, and 0.8m thick, covering an area of 75,625m².|||There is a semicircular bulwark in the middle of each side of the citadel, with a gate in the middle, and a tower with a tiled roof built above it.|||Inside the wall, there is a small path around the citadel used for ammunition transportation. The citadel is surrounded by a deep moat filled with water, following the medieval defensive style of 'high walls and deep moats'.|||The bricks used to build the citadel are much larger than regular bricks, made from iron-rich soil, which is a characteristic of bricks from the Le dynasty.|||At the beginning of the Nguyen dynasty, the citadel was repaired and reinforced with smaller bricks.|||In the northeast of the citadel lies Tho Son (Thổ Sơn - a soil hill) that is 50m high, with a steep slope, and 193 stone steps leading to the top.|||Tho Son was also built overnight, and it lies entirely within the citadel, providing a wide range of control.|||The eastern gate dominates the only road and the Lo River, which was an important waterway before the use of motorized vehicles on land.|||According to preserved documents, during the Mac dynasty and Ly dynasty, Tuyen Quang was called Tam Ky or Tam Co, a highly developed commercial center with merchants from many places coming and going. From the Le dynasty onwards, all dynasties stationed troops in the ancient citadel of Tuyen Quang.|||The ancient citadel of Tuyen Quang also witnessed many important historical events of the revolutionary homeland of Tuyen Quang, from the heroic fight of the Kinh, Tay, Dao, and Cao Lan ethnic groups against the French colonialists in 1884, to the fierce and boiling atmosphere of the August 1945 uprising, which forced the Japanese fascists to surrender and completely liberate Tuyen Quang town. During the resistance war against the French colonialists, the ancient citadel of Tuyen Quang witnessed two more defeats of the French army in 1947 and 1949.|||On March 20, 1961, for the first time since the Government of the Democratic Republic of Vietnam moved from the Capital of Resistance (Tan Trao, Son Duong, Tuyen Quang) to Hanoi, officials, soldiers, and people of various ethnic groups in Tuyen Quang province were honored to welcome Uncle Ho back to visit his revolutionary hometown.
