He had a talk with the whole people at the northern sports ground of Tho Son in the ancient city.|||The ancient citadel of Tuyen Quang was largely intact until the end of the 20th century and was ranked as a national historical and cultural relic. During the construction and development of Tuyen Quang town, some roads were built through the ancient citadel, causing it to be fragmented. Only the north and west gates remain. A single section of the wall, less than 100m long, still stands at the corner of Binh Thuan street and Cong Lap gate.

title: Thach Hai Sea
description: From the beach, tourists can walk along the coastline, stroll through the pine forest or take motorized vehicles on the plastic road to visit attractive tourist spots within the resort complex.|||Head north to visit the Quynh Vien eco-tourism site, featuring numerous streams, caves, and scenic spots such as Mui Doung Stream, Tam Pond, Ong Duong Cave, Lon Cave, Hop Cave, and Le Khoi Temple.|||Beyond Quynh Vien lies the temple dedicated to Chieu Trung Dai Vuong, a renowned cultural and artistic relic recognized by the state.|||Visitors can admire the unique architecture of Le Khoi Temple built in the 15th century (1447) and explore other temples like Lieu Hanh and Ca Ong, as well as Long Ngam Cape, set amidst a harmonious blend of sea, sky, green hills, blue waters, ancient temples, and poetic landscapes.|||In this forest garden, tourists can engage in leisure activities such as hiking, fishing, and sightseeing.|||Head south to visit Thien Cam beach and explore the ancient archaeological site of Thach Lac. At night, witness the "city of light" created by hundreds of lanterns lit by fishermen at sea. For the curious, take a boat with fishermen out to sea for a new and exciting experience of night fishing and squid catching.|||Thach Hai tourist area not only attracts visitors by its natural beauty but also by its convenience for all types and objects of tourism.|||Thach Hai beach is 10 km from Ha Tinh city.|||That distance is ideal, not too close to the urban area to lose its rustic and pristine beauty, and not too far for travel and exchange needs.|||From Ha Tinh city, it only takes over 10 minutes by motorbike or car to reach this poetic beach.|||Nearby guests can take their families by motorbike to swim, eat fish porridge, grilled squid with rice crackers in the afternoon after work.|||Guests from afar can come here to swim, eco-tourism and enjoy the night atmosphere in the spacious houses hidden under the phi lao forest.|||Luxury tourists can stay at Dien Luc guesthouse with modern amenities, swim, enjoy seafood, play tennis, badminton, volleyball, ...|||Those who are only familiar with urban life can stay at hotels in the town and travel back and forth in just a few tens of minutes.|||For the residents of Ha Tinh city and nearby areas, Thach Hai is an ideal relaxation spot for families during weekend breaks or even daily visits throughout the summer. Therefore, despite being newly opened, this eco-tourism site has attracted over 50,000 visitors from within and outside the province to enjoy the beach and tourism during each summer season.|||A coastal tourist area with mountains, forests and a cluster of historical sites, clean and beautiful beaches, and convenient transportation like Thach Hai, which are not many in Vietnam. Therefore, after years of being neglected, Thach Hai has been properly evaluated for its position and potential. The approval of the general planning for Thach Hai coastal eco-tourism area by the Provincial People's Committee in February 2002 brought this coastline into the sight of investors.|||Along with urban development in the city and the iron ore industrial zone of Thach Khe and the future development of social life, the potential of Thach Hai sea eco-tourism area has been awakened with the accumulated strength of thousands of years to become one of the most attractive tourist destinations in the future.

title: Chua Huong Tich
description: Chua Huong Tich is located on the Hong Linh mountain range, in Thien Loc commune, Can Loc district, Ha Tinh province. It is renowned as "Hoan Chau's premier scenic spot". This ancient pagoda has been ranked as a national historical site and is a popular spiritual tourist destination, attracting over 150,000 visitors annually to worship and pray.|||Huong Tich captivates people not only with its rare beauty but also as a sacred Buddhist site linked to the story of Princess Dieu Thien who practiced Buddhism and became a Buddha. According to legend, around 500 years before the Common Era, King Trang Vuong of the State of Chu had three daughters. When they grew up, the two elder sisters obeyed their father's will and married officials in the royal court. However, when it was the turn of the youngest princess, Dieu Thien, her father forced her to marry a cruel and ruthless military officer. Feeling desperate, she turned to Buddhism. The officer set fire to the temple but Dieu Thien and the monks were saved by Buddha's protection. Traveling south, Dieu Thien stopped at Huong Tich Cave, on Thieu Linh Mountain (now known as Hong Linh) in Viet Thuong land, and built a hermitage. She became renowned for her compassion and kindness. Meanwhile, King Trang Vuong fell seriously ill; the doctor advised that the king needed the eyes and hands of a volunteer to cure his disease. Hearing this, Dieu Thien showed compassion and donated her eyes and hands to save her father. When King Trang Vuong recovered, he sent someone to thank Dieu Thien but discovered it was his own daughter. Moved by Dieu Thien's heart, Buddha used magic to restore her eyes and hands. Dieu Thien achieved enlightenment and transformed into the Thousand-Eyed and Thousand-Handed Goddess of Mercy.|||According to historical records and archaeological research, as well as opinions of some scholars, the original Huong Tich Pagoda on Hong Linh mountain was built during the Tran dynasty, 13th century.|||The Huong Pagoda in former Ha Tay (now Hanoi) is a meaningful replica. According to the book Huong Son Thien Tru Thien Pha, a Buddhist monk was ordered by Lord Trinh to determine the site and build Huong Pagoda in Hanoi during the reign of Le Huy Tong under the name Chinh Hoa (1680-1704).|||Bui Van Nguyen, former General Secretary of the Vietnam National Documentation and Information Center, explained that during the Le - Trinh period, most Le kings and Trinh lords had their hometown in Thanh land.|||The imperial concubines and beauties were mostly chosen from Hoan Chau. Every year, the concubines and beauties from Thanh - Nghe often went to Huong Pagoda on Hong Linh mountain on the 18th day of the 2nd lunar month by boat through Hoi Thong gate.|||The long trips made Lord Trinh worried, so he decided to build a second Huong Tich Pagoda in Ha Son Binh to make it easier for them to visit.|||Thanks to Lord Trinh's initiative, Vietnam now has two Huong Tich Pagodas.|||The landscape and architecture of Huong Tich Pagoda, recorded in the 17th-19th centuries, no longer remain intact due to multiple fires. In 1885, the pagoda caught fire, and in 1901, An Tinh Governor Dao Tan led the effort to rebuild it. In 2003, the pagoda underwent further restoration, being rebuilt on the old foundation to be higher and more solid.|||The Huong Tich Pagoda complex includes many structures. From the foot of the mountain to the main pagoda, the distance is nearly 3km. Along the way to enlightenment, visitors will pass by several historical sites such as Duong Well, Co Temple, Heavenly Market, Tam Bao Front Hall, Dieu Thien Hermitage and Trang Vuong Ruins...|||The Co Temple is where Princess Dieu Thien once passed by. She sat down to rest and admire the scenery. People built a temple to worship her. Next to the temple is the Huong Tuyen stream, with clear water all year round.|||Visitors often stop here to rest, wash their hands in the stream to cleanse themselves before visiting the pagoda. The pagoda is about 900m from Co Temple.|||Previously, visitors had to continue their journey by road, but since 2012, a cable car system has been built to serve tourists.|||The cable car line starts from Co Temple Station and ends at Huong Tich Station, taking about 4 minutes to travel, making it easier to visit the pagoda.|||Hop on the cable car, then pass Bai Cho Troi area, just a short walk further and you will arrive at the main area of the pagoda, which is Thuong Pagoda or Tam Bao - Tien Duong. Like other shrines in the Huong Tich complex, Thuong Pagoda was originally built in Trang Vuong cave above, but due to frequent fires, it was moved down to the middle of Huong Tich mountain. The pagoda is built in a north-south direction with two compartments. The inner compartment is used for Buddha worship with wooden Buddha statues. The outer compartment contains ceremonial objects and is where monks perform rituals and recite Buddhist scriptures. The Tam Bao houses 54 precious wooden statues created from the Tran - Le - Nguyen dynasties, arranged in rows, with many horizontal steles and couplets.|||From behind the temple, climbing about 28 stone steps leads to Huong Tich cave, also known as Quan Am or Phat Ba. The entire structure remains intact in its original form. Inside the cave, there is a deep cavern with a sitting statue of Quan The Am on a lotus throne and several statues of mother and child holding willow branches… The people consider Phat Ba Am a sacred place and it is here that Princess Dieu Thien practiced and became a Buddha.|||500m from the temple is an old stone foundation, commonly known as Trang Vuong. When Dieu Thien offered her eyes and hands to make medicine, King So Trang Vuong's illness was completely cured. Later, the king built Nganh Hong Temple to pray to heaven and earth, worship the Thousand-Handed and Thousand-Eyed Goddess of Mercy, and express gratitude to his filial youngest daughter. Today, only some remains of Trang Vuong, such as stone and broken bricks, are visible under the overgrown grass and reeds. The scenery here is cool and serene. In autumn, Trang Vuong and Huong Tich Temple are shrouded in mist, ethereal and mysterious, like a spiritual realm.|||Coming to Huong Tich Pagoda, especially during the festival season, visitors will feel the atmosphere:|||Green shoots appear in February|||I'm coming back from the Huong Pagoda festival, I'm waiting for you|||The land and sky of Can Loc are poetic|||The path up, smoke and incense fade into the distance|||(Duy Thao)|||The Huong Tich Pagoda Festival starts after the Lunar New Year and lasts until the end of the third lunar month. The main festival takes place on the 18th day of the second lunar month every year, marking the day Princess Dieu Thien becomes a Buddha. The festival has become a traditional cultural feature of the local people and Buddhist tourists, with various cultural, artistic, and traditional folk sports activities organized on a large and attractive scale.

title: Hai Thuong Lan Ong Temple
description: Le Huu Trac's communal house is also known as Hai Thuong garden, located in Bao Thuong village, Son Quang commune (now Quang Diem), Huong Son district - a land area situated beside the Ngan Pho river.|||This place was once a remote and secluded area but now features a harmonious landscape where locals live in peace with one another surrounded by traditional houses made of bamboo and thatch.|||The Le Huu Trac communal house is located near Gia Mountain and Sen Lake, which are situated close to each other in the garden's corner. The Sen Lake, shaped like a half-moon, embraces the foot of the mountain on the northwest side. It was here that Le Huu Trac often observed the wind direction to examine and treat patients. This spot was also where he expressed gratitude and spent time with friends, watching the moon, enjoying the breeze, drinking wine, playing chess, reading books, and reciting poetry.

title: Hai Thuong Lan Ong Le Huu Trac Historical Site
description: Le Huu Trac, also known as Hai Thuong Lan Ong, was a renowned national physician and author of the valuable medical book 'Y Tong Tam Linh'. The historical site is located in Huong Son district, stretching over an 8km route, and features a tomb, monument, Le Huu Trac temple, Tuong Son pagoda, and Hai Thuong eco-tourism area.|||This site is an attractive destination for sightseeing, cultural activities, and spiritual retreats for locals and tourists alike.|||Le Huu Trac's real name was Le Huu Huan, also known as Hai Thuong Lan Ong. He was born on November 12, 1720, in Van Xa village, Lieu Xa commune, Duong Hao district, Thuong Hong prefecture, Hai Duong province (now Yen My district, Hung Yen province).|||He was the seventh child of Le Huu Muu and Bui Thi Thuong, and was also called Cau Chieu Bay.|||His family had a tradition of producing scholars; his grandparents, uncles, and cousins all passed the imperial examinations and held high-ranking positions.|||His father, Le Huu Trac, passed the third-ranked imperial examination and served as a Deputy Minister of Public Works in the Le Du Tong dynasty, and was posthumously honored as a Minister.|||In 1739, at the age of 20, Le Huu Trac lost his father and returned home from the capital. He took care of his family and studied hard. He then took the imperial examinations but did not pursue them further.|||In 1739, a large-scale peasant uprising against the feudal government began. A year later, the rebels led by Hoang Cong Chat approached his district. The young scholar Le Huu Trac had to leave to study elsewhere.|||From then on, he studied historical texts and military strategy. The wars caused suffering and death for many families and brought nothing but harm to the people and the country. This made Le Huu Trac disillusioned and want to leave the army. He declined several promotions offered by the Trinh generals.|||During this time, his mother, Bùi Thị Thường, took her children to live in Que Ngoai, Huong Son. In 1746, after his brother in Huong Son passed away, Le Huu Trac used the excuse of taking care of his elderly mother and young nephew to leave the army and pursue a new path.|||He lived in Que Me (now Son Quang commune, Huong Son district, Ha Tinh province) until 1791 when he passed away at the age of 71.|||Hai Thuong Lan Ong was not only an excellent doctor and a great thinker, but also a prominent scientist, educator, and master writer of Vietnam. He always conducted research, treated patients, and wrote poetry. He authored many valuable books, including Hai Thuong y tong tam linh and Thuong kinh ky su. He collected and supplemented many valuable remedies that have been passed down through folklore, leaving a legacy for future generations. His life and career serve as a shining example for generations of Vietnamese medical professionals to follow.|||The relic complex of Hai Thuong Lan Ong Le Huu Trac is located in Hai Thuong village, Son Trung commune, Huong Son district, Ha Tinh province, stretching over an 8km route, including the tomb and monument of the great doctor in Son Trung commune, Tuong Son pagoda in Son Giang commune and the Temple of Hai Thuong Lan Ong in Son Quang commune.|||The relic site preserves historical and cultural values of great significance associated with the great doctor Hai Thuong Lan Ong Le Huu Trac.|||Legend has it that during his lifetime, he often flew kites on Gia Mountain and Sen Lake. Before he passed away, he instructed his descendants to bury him where the kite fell. The spot where the kite landed is now his tomb, located in the Canh Dieu mountain range at the foot of Minh Tu Mountain, Son Trung commune.|||The tomb is situated on a plot of land near the foot of the mountain with a 30-degree slope, facing the highest peak of Minh Tu Mountain, and aligned with the Truong Son mountain range.|||About 0.6 meters southwest of the tomb, a small bamboo grove was planted to mark the spot where the kite fell, reflecting Le Huu Trac's upright and noble character.|||Standing on the mountain peak, the scenery looks like a beautiful ink wash painting, with Nuoc Can stream flowing gently to the right, and the serene Ngang Pho River in front, surrounded by poetic hills, villages, and countryside.|||The Le Huu Trac Monument is located on a high mountain and is constructed with over 1,600 tons of marble. The monument features the inscription 'Duc - Luu - Quang' carved on a single block of stone weighing over 17 tons. Behind the monument are two reliefs with engravings of the great doctor's teachings on medical ethics and techniques.

title: Vu Mon Waterfall
description: From a height of nearly 1,300m above sea level, Vu Mon Waterfall cascades down to the foot of Giang Man Mountain in the Truong Son mountain range (in Gia, Huong Khe, Ha Tinh).|||This place has become mystical and majestic due to the legend of carp transforming into dragons.|||Locals say that the White Stone River, originating from Laos, flows down to Giang Man Mountain, creating Vu Mon Waterfall. The waterfall stands over 1,280m above sea level, with a height of over 200m.|||Vu Mon Waterfall has four levels, each with a unique shape, and a significant height difference between them. The waterfall is 27.5m wide and flows abundantly all year round.|||Nature has arranged large stones at the foot of the waterfall, forming caves and pools. The water flows through the rocks, creating beautiful whirlpools.|||At the top of the waterfall, there is a branch of the White Stone River, with gentle slopes on both sides, covering an area of about 70ha each.|||Standing here, Vu Mon Waterfall resembles a soft white silk ribbon across the mountain, with a serene atmosphere and majestic natural scenery. Vu Mon Waterfall is a promising destination for tourism development.

title: Vu Quang National Park
description: From Ha Tinh city, follow National Route 15A west for 32km to Phuc Dong junction (Hương Khê), then take the Ho Chi Minh trail for 25km to Vu Quang town, continue west for 15km to reach Vu Quang National Park.|||Vu Quang National Park is located in Vu Quang district, in the northwest of Ha Tinh province, covering a total area of 52,882 ha, of which 96.7% is natural forest, with an average elevation of 800m and a slope of 25-35 with many streams and rivers. The primeval forest has 61% closed subtropical and tropical evergreen forest, with a very rich vegetation of 307 species of higher plants, belonging to 236 genera and 99 families. The fauna here is also very rich: 60 species of mammals, 187 species of birds, 38 species of reptiles, 26 species of amphibians and 56 species of fish, including 26 species of mammals, 10 species of birds and 16 species of reptiles. Notably, there are 3 endemic species: the brown langur, Ha Tinh langur, and golden-faced monkey, and 2 rare species: the saola and the long-sung deer and large muntjac. This park also has the historical relic of Phan Dinh Phung base, ranked by the State in 1995. Due to its high biodiversity, Vu Quang National Park has become an attractive tourist destination.|||From Vu Quang National Park, following the Ho Chi Minh road south is Vu Mon Waterfall - a place associated with the legend of 'The catfish turning into a dragon'.

title: Mỹ Lam Mineral Spring
description: When thinking of Tuyen Quang, people often recall the Hong Thai communal house, the Tan Trao banyan tree, or the Na Lua hut. However, few know about the Mỹ Lam mineral spring, one of the few best mineral water sources in Northern Vietnam.|||Located 179km from Hanoi, 72km from Phu Tho, 69km from Yen Bai, and 99km from Thai Nguyen, My Lam mineral spring is nestled in a peaceful mountainous landscape, making it an ideal resort destination for travelers.|||These days, when the weather is not too hot yet, it's an ideal time for a travel adventure to explore the Northeast region of our country and soak in the hot mineral water that nature has generously gifted this land.|||Mỹ Lâm mineral spring is located in Phu Lam commune, Yen Son district, about 15km from Tuy Quang city, along National Highway 37.|||This underground water source was discovered by French geologist C. Madrolle in 1923, with a temperature of up to 67°C.|||The water circuit lies at a depth of over 150m, making Mỹ Lâm mineral water very clear and drinkable.|||With a high sulfuahydro content of 5mg/liter, this mineral spring is also known as the "sulphur spring".|||It is considered one of the few good mineral water mines in Northern Vietnam.|||After nearly 100 years of discovery, the water source here is still very abundant.|||Since the 1940s, experts have tested, analyzed and confirmed that My Lam water contains many minerals that have healing effects, especially in treating muscle, bone and joint diseases.|||In 1976, the Ministry of Health built My Lam Mineral Water Hospital, which is now handed over to Tuyen Quang province for management.|||Every year, My Lam mineral spring attracts thousands of visitors from near and far to bathe and treat illnesses.|||According to assessments, after treatment at My Lam mineral spring, conditions such as high blood pressure, skin issues, joint problems, spinal calcification, sciatica, neurasthenia, bronchial asthma, bronchitis, colitis, etc. have a cure rate of 78-90%.|||The healing principle of mineral water is to act on the body to mobilize compensatory mechanisms and stimulate increased resistance.|||Currently, services around My Lam mineral spring tourist area are still underdeveloped. However, this place still attracts visitors with its peaceful and picturesque natural scenery, gentle and hospitable locals.|||After bathing, visitors should not miss the chance to enjoy the freshly baked com lam, served with the sweet and savory flavor of black sesame. Com lam in My Lam has become a specialty that attracts tourists not only because of the fragrant sticky rice but also due to its unique preparation. In other regions, people usually put rice in bamboo tubes and boil them like banh chung, then lightly roast them until the shell is charred. Here, tourists can watch as the bamboo tubes are roasted over fire until the rice is perfectly cooked and fragrant.|||There's nothing more relaxing than soaking in warm water, then leisurely enjoying the soft, fragrant flavor of rice lam tubes. You breathe in deeply, feeling invigorated, and watch the evening smoke drifting through the air. It's a bit melancholic, but it easily brings back memories of childhood...

title: Na Hang Hydroelectric Plant
description: This key national project is becoming a must-visit destination for tourists in Na Hang. Once visited, tourists will be amazed by the majestic scenery of the artificial dams surrounded by mountains.|||The Tuyên Quang Hydroelectric Plant (also known as Na Hang Hydroelectric Plant) is located on the Gam River basin, in Vinh Yen commune (old), Na Hang district, Tuyên Quang province.|||The Tuyên Quang Hydroelectric Plant was officially connected to the national grid in 2008. Over 11 years, the project has enhanced the landscape of the mountainous area.|||With a water surface area of about 8000 hectares, the Tuyên Quang Hydroelectric Plant has created a large lake on the Gam and Nang rivers. This project not only helps prevent floods in Tuyên Quang city but also participates in reducing floods during the rainy season and provides a water source during the dry season for the Red River Delta. It also helps create a large Na Hang lake, supporting the development of tourism services, aquaculture, and fishing for local people.|||If visitors come to the hydroelectric plant at the right time of the year, they can witness the majestic scene of the plant's flood discharge. At night, visitors can admire the beauty of the hydroelectric plant under the shimmering light of high-voltage lamps on the clear Na Hang sky, reflecting on the Gam River.

title: Pac Ta Temple
description: Pac Ta Temple (Na Hang) is a spiritual tourist attraction in the Na Hang - Lam Binh eco-tourism area. The temple honors the fiancée of General Tran Nhat Duyat. This historical site is a remnant of the second resistance against the Yuan - Mongol invasion in 1285: General Tran Nhat Duyat, a brilliant military leader, was stationed in Tuyen Quang.|||The temple is situated on high, flat ground at the foot of Pac Ta Mountain, the highest peak in Na Hang district. Originally, the temple was made of straw, bamboo, and leaves. Over time, it deteriorated and collapsed. Later, locals built a small hut for worship. In 2008, the temple was rebuilt and ranked as a National Historic Site in 2009.|||The temple follows a rectangular architecture with three rooms and two gables. The structure is made of wood, with dragon-scale tiles, a roof with a pair of dragons, and four curved dragon-shaped corners. The interior is finely carved. The main statue is of 'Duc Thanh Mau'. Above the altar is the inscription: 'Sacred Pac Ta Temple'.|||The temple is about 2km from Na Hang town center. Visitors must take a boat through the Na Hang eco-lake, home to the Tuyen Quang Hydroelectric Plant, one of Vietnam's largest power plants.|||The temple holds two major festivals a year: a prayer ceremony at the beginning and a thanksgiving ceremony at the end. During these events, locals gather to pray for favorable weather, a good harvest, and a prosperous life.|||With its cultural and historical significance, Pac Ta Temple attracts tourists from afar.

title: Thuong Lam Scenic Spot
description: If you ever visit Tuyen Quang, make sure to add Thuong Lam scenic spot to your itinerary. This is one of the major attractions that draws visitors to this northern mountainous province.|||Today, this tourist destination has become a favorite among many domestic and international tourists. Besides its stunning natural beauty, Thuong Lam also captivates visitors with its unique cultural charm. There are many exciting things to explore and experience here.|||In recent years, Thuong Lam has invested heavily in developing its tourism industry. As a result, there are numerous cultural and tourist activities for visitors to participate in.|||This area boasts many famous historical sites recognized as national scenic spots. Therefore, it has become a popular destination for highland tours.|||The first impression that anyone can see and feel when arriving here is the majestic green mountains and forests. The long-standing cultural values preserved and promoted by the locals also spark curiosity. Perhaps that's why spiritual tourism is now driving the growth of Tuyen Quang's tourism industry.

title: Sunflower Field
description: When it comes to tourist spots in Nghe An at the end of the year, people immediately think of the sunflower field with bright yellow flowers blooming.|||The 100-hectare sunflower field is located at the 19/5 farm, Nghia Son commune, Nghia Dan district, Nghe An province. Every flower season, when the vast field blooms, it becomes an interesting stop for tourists.|||The last days of December are also the best time for the flowers to bloom, making it a favorite destination. From Hanoi, you can take a bus from Giap Bat, My Dinh... to Nghe An for around 200,000 VND. When you arrive at Nghia Dan district, take another bus or hire a motorbike taxi to Nghia Son commune to see the sunflower field.|||The sunflowers here have been agriculturally adjusted to a reasonable height, so you don't need to rent a ladder. But if you want to observe the beauty, you can rent a ladder for around 30,000 VND per hour.|||In the dry land of Central Vietnam, a brilliant flower field appears beside the poetic Sao River, creating a perfect natural picture. Besides the sunflower field, this year, the organizer also plants a beautiful butterfly flower field.|||The flower field is open for free, and visitors can take photos and play freely. But don't forget to protect the scenery, don't pick flowers, push and shove, or trample on the flowers.

title: Hoang Tru Historical Site
description: The Hoang Tru historical site in Kim Lien commune, Nam Dan district, covers an area of approximately 3500 m2. It is the maternal homeland of President Ho Chi Minh and the place where he was born.|||1. The Hoang Xuan family branch worship house|||Hoang Duong (maternal grandfather of President Ho Chi Minh) was the 18th generation descendant of the Hoang Xuan family. He built this family shrine to worship his great-grandfather, grandfather, and father - Hoang Cuong.|||Hoang Duong passed away in 1893. His posthumous name written by Nguyen Sinh Sac was also enshrined here.|||The house was completed in 1881, made of teak wood in the four-pillar style, with three rooms and a small entrance. It was initially thatched, but was later repaired and tiled in 1930.|||President Ho Chi Minh lived here during his childhood. He often accompanied his father to offer incense, flowers, and sacrifices to honor their ancestors.|||According to family chronicles, the Hoang Xuan family has a tradition of love for learning and many descendants with noble spirits and contributions to the country.|||In 1927, Mac Dang Dung usurped the throne from the Le dynasty and established the Mac dynasty. Their descendants supported the Le and destroyed the Mac. The 6th generation of this family had a man named Hoang Nghia Kieu (1540-1587) who was bestowed the title of Thai Bao Hong quoc cong by King Le. He is the earliest recorded ancestor of the Hoang family in Hoang Tru village.|||2. House of Mr. Hoang Duong - Mr. Hoang Duong was the maternal grandfather of President Ho Chi Minh.|||The house consists of 5 rooms and 2 wings, with the first 3 rooms connected to the worship house, creating a very airy space.|||The bench in the first room is where Professor Duong taught.|||The second room has a bamboo bench and a wooden desk with teaching tools like brushes, ink wells...|||The third room has a bench used as a resting place for the teacher and students.|||The remaining two rooms are used for Mrs. Duong to rest and for family activities.||||||At the end of 1883, Mr. and Mrs. Hoang Duong organized a wedding ceremony for their children, Hoang Thi Loan (the mother of President Ho) and Nguyen Sinh Sac (the father of President Ho Chi Minh) at this 5-room wooden house. They then built a 3-room thatched house on the west side of the garden for the young couple to live separately.|||The house in Hoang Tru village is where Mrs. Hoang Thi Loan was born and raised. It was also the first classroom where Mr. Nguyen Sinh Sac nurtured his talents.|||This is also where President Ho Chi Minh left his fond childhood memories.|||This is the birthplace of President Ho Chi Minh.|||The 3-room thatched house in the western corner of Mr. and Mrs. Hoang Duong's garden is where President Ho Chi Minh was born and lived here until he was 3 years old. The outer room has a desk with an inkwell, a box of brushes, two square chairs, and two bookshelves with books on sages.|||In this house, Mr. Hoang Duong often came here to discuss literature and characters with Mr. Sac.|||The middle room has a small bed made of zan wood and woven bamboo, with a simple mat and a brown fabric curtain. This was where Mr. Sac and Mrs. Loan rested.|||Next to the bed is a small wooden chest used to store food and family valuables.|||The loom placed in the third room is the working tool of Mrs. Loan used to weave fabric and silk to support her family. Mrs. Hoang Thi Loan used to weave fabric while singing lullabies to her children so that her husband could focus on his studies. There is also a simple rattan hammock where President Ho Chi Minh used to sleep.|||President Ho Chi Minh's childhood was nurtured by his mother with folk songs that conveyed beautiful dreams and deep hopes.

title: Sen Village Relic Complex
description: Sen Village, formerly known as Kim Lien Village, is located in Kim Lien commune, Nam Dan district, Nghe An province. This is the homeland of President Ho Chi Minh, where many relics, artifacts, and memories of his childhood are preserved.|||The village was home to President Ho Chi Minh and his family from 1901 to 1906, and was also visited by him in 1957 and 1961.|||Sen Village features a system of significant historical relics including the homes of Vice Royal Secretary Nguyen Sinh Sac, Nguyen Sinh Nham, Nguyen Sinh family altar, Bachelor Vuong Thuc Quy's house, old Dien forge, Coc well, banyan tree, stadium, and Sen village temple. Additionally, there is a memorial area, display house, souvenir garden and many other public facilities. All of these constitute the Sen Village Historical Site.|||1. The house of Mr. Pho Bang Nguyen Sinh Sac:|||In the 1901 imperial examination, Nguyen Sinh Sac earned a Bachelor's degree under the Nguyen Dynasty, marking the first time Sen Village had a successful candidate. The villagers pooled their resources to buy a 5-room wooden house on a 4.14 sao plot of communal land to celebrate. Once the house and garden were complete, the people of Sen Village invited Mr. Nguyen Sinh Sac, along with his children Nguyen Thi Thanh, Nguyen Sinh Khiem, and Nguyen Sinh Cung, to move to Sen Village from Hoang Tru Village.|||In Sen village, Nguyen Sinh Sac lived a simple and warm life. He wrote some Chinese characters on the beam of his house: "Do not take the style of a mandarin's family as our own style". He sent his two sons to study with Master Vuong Thuc Quy.|||Visitors to Mr. Pho Bang's house were often patriotic scholars of the time, and as a result, his children were early exposed to and aware of social issues, as well as a sense of patriotism and compassion for the people.|||In 1906, he went to Hue to work as a mandarin, bringing his two sons along. He handed over his house, garden, and trees to his daughter Nguyen Thi Thanh to take care of.|||Later, Nguyen Thi Thanh and Nguyen Sinh Khiem were arrested for participating in patriotic activities. In 1914, the house and garden were handed over to Nguyen Sinh Moi and Nguyen Sinh Xuong from the same family to take care of.|||In 1915, Nguyen Thi Thanh was released from prison and sold her house to a person from Nam Hung commune, who then sold it to another person from Nam Giang commune.|||In 1956, the Provincial Party Committee and People's Committee of Nghe An Province decided to restore the historic site of President Ho Chi Minh's hometown. The house was bought back and rebuilt on the old garden to welcome visitors.|||After over 50 years away from his homeland, on June 16, 1957, President Ho Chi Minh returned to visit his old house. He said to everyone: "This is the house of Mr. Pho Bang". When going out to the yard, someone suggested to Uncle Ho that they ask permission to plant flowers in the garden to make it more beautiful. Uncle Ho said: "Sweet potato flowers are also beautiful". He meant that planting sweet potatoes would provide tubers to eat and also have flowers to admire.|||2. House of Nguyen Sinh Nham - paternal grandfather of President Ho Chi Minh:|||This historical site marks the place where Nguyen Sinh Sac, the father of President Ho Chi Minh, lived and passed away at the age of 14.|||This is the place where all patriotic activities took place and where weapons were hidden during the secret activities of Nguyen Thi Thanh and Nguyen Sinh Khiem, the brother and sister of President Ho Chi Minh.|||This monument is the birthplace of international martyr Ly Nam Thanh (Nguyen Sinh Than), who bravely sacrificed his life during the Soviet Union's war of national defense.|||3. Nguyen Sinh Family Communal House:|||The historical site was built in 1843 on a land area of 500m2 in Phu Dam hamlet, now Sen 3 village, Kim Lien commune, Nam Dan district, to worship the ancestors of the Nguyen Sinh family.|||During his childhood, Chairman Ho Chi Minh's siblings often accompanied their father to burn incense to honor their ancestors at the family altar on annual ancestor worship days and Tet holidays.|||The relatives of President Ho Chi Minh are brought back to the family shrine for worship after passing away.|||Thus, the Nguyen Sinh family house is also a place of worship for the parents and siblings of President Ho Chi Minh.|||On June 16, 1957, during his first visit back to his hometown, President Ho Chi Minh followed the old path to the communal house to light incense and pay respects to his ancestors.|||He then spoke to his relatives, saying: 'Due to busy work, I couldn't visit every family in the clan, but coming to the communal house means I'm visiting all of you, and I hope you understand.'|||4. Residence of scholar Vuong Thuc Quy, a teacher of President Ho Chi Minh (1901-1902):|||Mr. Vuong Thuc Quy was the teacher of President Ho Chi Minh when he was young in Sen village.|||His natural intelligence, sense of compassion and patriotism had a profound influence on his student Nguyen Sinh Cung.|||Here Nguyen Sinh Cung learned and understood many things about history and current events, which later fueled his determination to save the country.|||On June 16, 1957, during his first visit back to his homeland, President Ho Chi Minh mentioned Mr. Vuong Thuc Quy. He said: "Mr. Vuong Thuc Quy was my teacher when I was young."|||5. Co Dien Blacksmith:|||Co Dien Forge was a place to make farming tools for farmers in Sen village. When he was a child and lived in Sen village, President Ho Chi Minh often came here to play and helped Co Dien with the bellows and hammering.|||The profound memories of his youth spent at Co Dien forge have left a lasting impression on his memory.|||After 50 years away, on June 16, 1957, when returning to his homeland, as he walked out of his house, he pointed forward and asked the people beside him: "Is there still a forge by old Dien, is it still operating?". At that moment, old Dien's son, his childhood friend, came out of the gate, and the two old friends met with great joy. President Ho Chi Minh said emotionally: "You look healthy, have you continued forging lately?". Mr. Dien replied: "Lately, I've let my first son do it". He encouraged Mr. Dien: "Yes, continue forging so people have farming tools to produce"|||6. Coc Well:|||This well was dug in 1708 by Nguyen Danh Coc, a resident of Phu Dam village, to provide water for his family. Later, villagers came to draw water from here. As a token of gratitude to the well digger, it was named Coc Well.|||While living in Sen village, Nguyen Sinh Cung often came here to fetch water for his family.|||The Coc well also holds many memories of his youth.|||On June 16, 1957, while returning to visit his homeland, President Ho Chi Minh asked the locals on his way out, "Is Coc Well still there? The water at Coc Well is clear and sweet, perfect for making delicious green tea and tasty tương."|||7. Relic of the Banyan tree, stadium, Sen village temple:|||The Bodhi Tree, stadium, and Lang Sen Temple have gone down in history as the places that witnessed Ho Chi Minh's two visits to his hometown, the first on June 16, 1957, and the second on December 9, 1961.|||Here, he had an intimate conversation with local cadres, party members, and Kim Lien villagers.|||He inquired about everyone's health, urging them to strive for good production, unity, and mutual care to build a happy and prosperous life.|||8. Mount Chung: This is where, during his childhood, Ho Chi Minh and his friends often went to herd buffalo, fly kites, play make-believe battles, and admire the scenery of their homeland. Mount Chung is located in the center of Kim Lien commune, Nam Dan district, Nghe An province. All seven villages of Kim Lien commune: Sen village (Kim Lien), Chua village (Hoang Tru), Say village (Mau Tai), Gao village (Nguyet Qua), Trai village (Tinh Ly), Dinh village (Ngoc Dinh), and Ke Mong village (Van Hoi) are all situated around Mount Chung.|||Chung Mountain originally had 9 peaks, but due to natural and human impacts, it now has only 5 peaks, including 3 main ones. Locals refer to the peaks as caves. The first peak, located to the east, near Van Hoi village (Ke Mong), is called Mong Cave.|||The second highest peak, nearly 50m, behind Tinh Ly village is called Bo cave. This place has a small altar to worship Mr. Bo. The people of Tinh Ly village avoid the word "Bo", so they call a cow a "me".|||To the northwest, at the foot of Bo Cave, is the tomb of Lieutenant General Le Giac (also known as Le Doc), a general from the late Le dynasty, with a training ground for Tu Tai Vuong Thuc Mau and a place where President Ho Chi Minh often played and practiced mock battles as a child.|||Next is the third peak called Den Cave. This is where concentrated temples, pagodas and communal houses of Lam Thinh commune. This spiritual cultural site features magnificent houses, temples and palaces.|||9. Chung Son Temple - A temple to worship the ancestors of President Ho Chi Minh|||Located on Chung Mountain, Chung Son Temple was recently inaugurated after 8 years of construction, coinciding with the 130th anniversary of President Ho Chi Minh's birth.|||This is a sacred place, a temple dedicated to ancestors, a monument that honors and forever remembers the contributions of President Ho Chi Minh and his family members.|||Located in the Kim Lien historical complex, Nam Dan (Nghe An), in 1991 Chung Mountain was ranked as a national historical site.|||Chung Mountain is situated in the center of Kim Lien commune, Nam Dan district, Nghe An province.|||All seven villages of Kim Lien commune: Sen village (Kim Lien), Chua village (Hoang Tru), Say village (Mau Tai), Gao village (Nguyet Qua), Trai village (Tinh Ly), Dinh village (Ngoc Dinh), and Ke Mong village (Van Hoi) are all located around Chung mountain.

title: Hoang Thi Loan Tomb
description: Hoang Thi Loan's tomb is located on the slope of Dong Tranh mountain, in Dai Hue range, Nam Giang commune. The tomb is made of granite, with a sloping roof, and a black stone stele in front, recording her biography and merits.|||In Sen village, there was a tomb of Hoang Thi Loan, the mother of President Ho Chi Minh. In 1942, Nguyen Sinh Khiem, his brother, brought her remains to be buried at Dong Tranh mountain, 5km from Sen village. Climbing about 300 stone steps from the foot of the mountain is her tomb, which was rebuilt by the people of Nghe An in 1985. The roof is made of concrete, stylized as a loom - which her mother used to weave to raise her children.

title: Tham Nang Man Cave
description: Tham Nang Man Cave is a limestone cave located in Na Pha village (Na Pha means a paddy field at the foot of a limestone mountain), Yen Khe commune, Con Cuong district (Nghe An).|||Tham Nang Man was formed by a weathering process hundreds of millions of years ago with an area of about 1800m2. It has a vaulted structure with an underground cave system, waterways and beautiful stalactites.|||On December 28, 2017, the People's Committee of Nghe An Province ranked Tham Nang Man as a provincial scenic spot.|||This will be an attractive and must-visit destination for tourists when traveling to the western part of Nghe An.|||The story goes that, a long time ago, in this land, there lived Nga La, the youngest daughter of Chau Din, a wealthy lord. She was incredibly beautiful, like a wild flower, gentle, skilled at embroidery and weaving, with a sweet singing voice and graceful dancing.|||Legend has it that when she sang, the forest birds stopped flying, and when she went to the stream, the shrimps and fish swam around her delicate ankles.|||Nang La fell deeply in love with a poor young man who had no parents. He was strong, kind, diligent, and skilled in hunting, trapping birds and animals, as well as doing farm work and taking care of the fields and gardens.|||Chau Din knew the relationship was not socially suitable and fiercely opposed it. Despite his objections, the couple continued to secretly meet in remote areas, making vows to be together. She then became pregnant with the poor young man.|||Upon hearing the news, the father chased the young man out of the village and ordered someone to capture his daughter and lock her into a rocky cave far from the village to hide the fact that she was pregnant, to avoid bringing shame to the village.|||Trapped alone in a dark cave with a pregnancy and limited food left by her father, she eventually went into labor on a stormy night.|||She gave birth alone in a night of heavy rain and strong winds.|||She managed to deliver the baby on her own.|||In the cold and desolate mountain cave, she and her mother felt lonely and bitter, day and night, longing for the day her lover would return. Her tears flowed like a stream, seeping through the stone wall and out to the river.|||She cried for her own fate, for her lost love, and for the child who was left fatherless. She cried until she and her child were exhausted, and then she turned into stone, forming a statue of a mother holding her child.|||The image of her and her child still lingers, to this day, gazing down at the Na Pha field, waiting for her husband. It's unknown if the young man returned to find her, but now the Thai people have settled in Na Pha, building villages and cultivating the land to create the fertile "Muang Trong" (Con Cuong district) fields, known for their high yield.|||The Thai people here consider Tham Nang Man a spiritual and cultural gathering place for the community. They believe that young couples who come here to pray for good fortune and love will be blessed by the spirits of Nang and her children.|||The Nang Man meeting point consists of stalls introducing and selling local characteristic products such as brocade, rice wine, Con Cuong oranges, medicinal herbs, rattan and bamboo products, and agricultural products and cuisine of the Thai ethnic group.|||Notably, Nang Man meeting point also features a free cultural exchange program with art performances, gongs and traditional wine for local people and tourists to enjoy and interact.|||This is a weekly event, a playground and meeting point for cultural and artistic exchanges among the local community, young people, and tourists who want to learn about and explore the tourism and culture of Con Cuong in general, and Tham Nang Man in particular.

title: Khuoi Nhi Waterfall – An Attractive Destination
description: Lamb Binh, a highland district, is not only known for its vast hydroelectric lake and primeval forests with rich ecosystems, but also for its stunning natural waterfalls. Among them, Khuoi Nhi Waterfall stands out as a must-visit spot for tourists.|||Located in the Tuyên Quang hydroelectric lake area, in Thuong Lam commune, Lamb Binh district, the waterfall stretches about 3km, consisting of multiple tiers and small streams, with clear and green water that helps regulate and distribute water. The area features ancient forests with valuable wood, dense vines, and diverse flora and fauna, including many species of birds and butterflies.|||From a distance, Khuoi Nhi Waterfall appears as a white streak across the mountainous landscape. Visitors can enjoy the pristine and romantic scenery, and as they climb to the top, they will be mesmerized by the breathtaking beauty. The waterfall's soft, white tiers cascade down the mountain, resembling a gentle stream of white silk. Additionally, visitors can interact with the fish swimming in the clear water, feeling refreshed and rejuvenated.|||This natural wonder attracts tourists with its impressive scenery, where they can immerse themselves in the clear water and admire the stones. With its stunning natural beauty, Khuoi Nhi Waterfall welcomes thousands of visitors each year.|||Currently, various organizations and individuals have invested in providing food and beverage services for tourists visiting the waterfall.

title: Discover Song Long Cave
description: Na Hang ecological lake, Lam Binh has many beautiful landscapes associated with famous landmarks such as Mo Waterfall, Khuoi Nhi Waterfall, Pac Ta Mountain, Coc Vai,... And Song Long Cave is also a must-see tourist destination on the journey to explore the stunning beauty of this place.|||Song Long Cave is surrounded by 99 legendary mountains in Khuon Ha commune (Lam Binh). It takes only about 3 hours of travel from Na Hang water pier to reach this extremely beautiful cave.|||The cave is about 200m high above the lake surface, over 200m long, and has an average height of 40m, with the widest part being over 50m. Exploring Song Long Cave, visitors will be amazed by its beauty. The first impression is the "stone pillar touching the sky" in front of the cave entrance, which locals call Coc Vai Pha. Through Coc Vai Pha, visitors can walk and explore the entire majestic beauty of the cave.|||The cave is divided by partitions, each of which looks like an art gallery of sculptures, with each piece being a masterpiece of nature, perfect in every detail. There are towering stalactites, carefully crafted and refined, creating strange shapes that spark the imagination of visitors. Some people compare them to chandeliers hanging upside down, emitting different colors; others think they resemble ancient tree trunks with unique wood patterns...|||Song Long Cave attracts visitors not only by the shape of its stalactites and stalagmites but also by its unique and strange colors. Natural light filtering through the cracks in the rocks illuminates the cave, combining with the stalactites to create a shimmering, mystical, and captivating scene. Especially, the air inside the cave is very fresh, cool, and quiet, which is also a plus that makes Song Long Cave a popular destination for tourists.|||Anyone who has the chance to return to this captivating ecological lake should not miss Song Long Cave.

title: Phuc Lam Pagoda – A Buddhist Legacy in the Mountains
description: Phuc Lam Pagoda (also known as Phuc Lam Tu, meaning granting blessings to the forest) is located in Na Tong village, Thuong Lam commune, Lam Binh district. This ancient pagoda has become familiar and close to generations of people in and outside the district. Although it is a small pagoda, Phuc Lam holds remnants of a proud ancient culture and reflects the spiritual practices of highland residents.|||Phuc Lam Pagoda is located on a high, wide, airy and flat piece of land at the foot of a mountain. The pagoda is built facing west-southwest, overlooking the fields of Ban Na Tong village. Further away lies a range of majestic mountains, shrouded in mist and white clouds all year round. This landscape is linked to the legend of 99 mountains and a flock of Phoenix searching for a place to build a capital.|||Next to the pagoda is Co Tien Mountain with its mystical and magical appearance. Behind the pagoda stands a towering mountain, which the locals call the ancient Turtle Mountain. This mountain is associated with the legend of the "magic bridge" and adds to the mystique of the pagoda and the Thuong Lam valley.|||Like other historical sites, Phuc Lam Pagoda has been heavily impacted by time, leaving only remnants that exude an air of mystery. According to researchers and the pagoda's caretakers, the former grounds of Phuc Lam Pagoda were very spacious and magnificent, covering about 600m². Today, the original architectural layout still exists on the old foundation. The base has a Ding-shaped layout, consisting of two architectural units: the Tien Duong and Thuong Dien buildings.|||Phuc Lam Pagoda worships not only Buddha but also local deities, directly connected to the daily life of the local people, which is also a unique and characteristic spiritual activity of a highland pagoda.|||In the old compound of Phuc Lam Pagoda, researchers have discovered a set of terracotta tower fragments including: tower roof, tower body, tower base and architectural decorative reliefs with themes such as: dragons, phoenixes, and tower pieces decorated with stylized lotus petals at the base.|||The dragon-shaped reliefs have characteristics of dragon paintings during the Tran Dynasty such as: reversed flowing mane curved up to the top of the head, big open eyes, three-clawed feet...|||The artifacts are shaped vigorously, with clear carvings.|||Notably, a corner of the terracotta tower has a decoration of Garuda, a divine bird, in a lively pose, with two hands raised to support the tower roof.|||The most obvious remains of the pagoda's existence are the green stone blocks used for pillar bases and the stone slabs used for statue pedestals.|||Based on these findings, researchers have determined the scale of the ancient pagoda.|||Studies by experts show that the pagoda features architectural and sculptural styles from the 13th-14th century Tran Dynasty, reflecting the long history of settlement and rich spiritual life of the local ethnic communities.|||Phuc Lam Pagoda, a spiritual destination in Lam Binh mountainous district.|||Every year, during the Lunar New Year celebrations, especially on the 15th day of the first lunar month, people and tourists from near and far come to Lam Binh to visit Phuc Lam Pagoda to pray for peace, prosperity, and a bountiful harvest.|||This will be an attractive destination for locals and tourists during Tet, opening up new opportunities for tourism development in Lam Binh district.

title: Hong Thai Terraced Fields
description: If you have a chance to visit Tuyen Quang province, come to Hong Thai to admire the vast and endless terraced fields with clouds weaving through the mountains in Northwest Vietnam.|||Hong Thai terraced fields are located in Hong Thai commune, Na Hang district, Tuyen Quang province.|||From Hanoi, travel about 300km to Vinh Yen city, then follow National Highway 2 to Tuyen Quang city, continue on National Highway 2 to km31, turn right to Chiêm Hóa and arrive at Na Hang town. From here, go 40km northeast to Hong Thai commune, where the vast terraced fields are located.|||Visitors can come here at any time of the year. In spring, white plum and apricot blossoms bloom. Summer brings lush green fields. Autumn brings ripe golden rice. Winter brings a mystical atmosphere with clouds weaving through houses and forests. The best time to visit is September or October, when the rice is ripe and the Hong Thai Terraced Field Festival takes place.|||The terraced fields in Hong Thai commune are 127m above sea level. Visitors can enjoy the cool climate, admire the golden rice fields on the hillsides, and explore the unique culture of local ethnic groups such as Dao, Mong, and Tay.|||The locals will share the story of how the terraced fields were created. According to them, it was the Tay people who built these fields about 200 years ago, by clearing and terracing the hillsides, and irrigating the fields with water from nearby streams.|||Here, visitors can admire the 82-hectare terraced fields, considered the most beautiful in Tuyen Quang province, and see the different stages of rice growth. They can also participate in rice planting and harvesting with the locals.

title: Chua Tau Pagoda
description: Chua Tau Pagoda, located in Xuan Truong commune, Tho Xuan district, has the ceremonial name Hoi Long Tu, also known as Xuan Pha Pagoda.|||The pagoda is situated on a relatively high and flat piece of land at the beginning of the village, about 100m from the Chu river dike.|||The pagoda's grounds cover an area of 2696m2.|||Chua Tau Pagoda was recognized by the state as a national historical and cultural relic in 1993.|||According to legend, Tau Pagoda has a history of construction dating back thousands of years. It is said that during the Ly Dynasty, this pagoda was built with bamboo and thatched roof in Lang Trang village. Some accounts claim it was built in the Canh Thin year of the Dinh dynasty, when Buddhism was widely practiced in our country. This is believed to be the oldest pagoda in the right bank of the Su River (also known as Chu River).|||The pagoda was originally called Lang Pagoda, located in Chấp village, on the banks of the Su River. Over time, the river changed course, and during the Ly and Tran dynasties, a dike was built along the Su River. The pagoda was then moved inside the dike, on the Tạu village land (in Xuan Pha village). The pagoda still faces southwest, towards the temple of Đại Hải Long Vương. The pagoda and the temple form a cultural complex in Trang Xuan Pho.|||At that time, most of the local people followed Buddhism, and the villagers avoided using the name of the village's tutelary deity (Long), so they called it Tau Pagoda. Every year, on major festivals such as the 8th day of the 4th lunar month, the birthday of Buddha Shakyamuni, monks, nuns, and Buddhists from the village and surrounding areas gather at Tau Pagoda to worship and pray. Buddhists from four streets of Tho Xuan, including Van An, Dong Nam, Tay Bac, and Khach (the Chinese street), also come to the pagoda to worship.|||Xuan Pha village has directly managed this pagoda for over 1000 years. Although many monks and nuns have come to cultivate at the pagoda, none have stayed until the end of their lives; it was not until after the August Revolution in 1945, around 1954, that Reverend Thich Thanh Cat from Co Phap village - Bac Ninh passed away at the pagoda.|||The stone stele in Chinese characters at the pagoda records: the T'au pagoda has undergone 7 restorations and renovations. These were in the following years: Binh Tuot Quang Hung (1586) by a general during the Le Trung Hung era, Hoai Vien Hau, also known as Thieu Chinh, who led the repair; the second time also by Thieu Chinh; the third time by local residents and devotees; the fourth time in 1925 when the Sanctuary of Saint Mother was built; in 1937 the Sanctuary of Saint Mother was renovated; in 1940 the Ancestor Buddha Hall was built; and in 1943 the entire pagoda was renovated, establishing a completely new place of worship as it is today.|||Overall, Tau Pagoda showcases a distinct architectural style from the late Nguyen Dynasty. The pagoda's structure follows the 'chui vo' or 'chu Dinh (T)' style, comprising a 5-room worship hall measuring 15m in length, 6m in width, and 90m2 in area; the architectural frame is of the 'gia chien' type. The rear sanctum is 3 rooms in size, 8.2m in length, 6m in width, and 49.2m2 in area. The pagoda is constructed from wood, bricks, and curved roof tiles. The front porch features 4 rows of Lim columns, with 3 columns in each row, and the rear sanctum has 4 columns, all made of stone; in total, there are 16 columns supporting the entire pagoda. The front porch has 6 frames, including single frames at both ends and 'gia chien' style frames; the frames adjacent to the front porch and rear sanctum are cast into 3 consecutive arches; the roof-supporting wood is solid. The horizontal beams and purlins are made of squared Lim wood; 3 lattice door frames consist of 12 wings that open and close in 3 rooms; the 2 front gables are built with flower-patterned walls. The eaves are 2m wide with 3-level stone and brick steps. On the 'dai bo' (roof ridge), two decorative 'con kim' are made of mortar and face each other. In front of the pagoda's yard, there are two square stone columns taller than the roof ridge, aligned with the two front gables; next to them is a stone plate engraved with the pagoda's renovation and the list of donors' names.|||Like other temples in the region, it primarily worships Buddha, featuring a system of statues of Shakyamuni Buddha, Amitabha Buddha, Avalokiteshvara Bodhisattva, Maitreya, and Jade Emperor. On either side of the main hall, adjacent to the rear sanctum, there are statues of Long Thần, four Bodhisattvas, eight Vajras, two guardian deities protecting the temple, and a statue of the Patriarch who attained enlightenment at the temple. The temple currently preserves a 200kg bronze bell with a dragon-shaped handle, cast in 1943 during a major renovation of the entire temple.|||The temple features large inscriptions and couplets. The large inscription in the main hall reads "cam ung dao gia". The couplet in the main hall reads:|||Bao Pham Trung Hung Quang Phat temple|||The general family fortune certificate is a constant mind.|||In addition, there are two couplets at the two ends of the corridor; the couplet at the eastern end reads:|||May the three friendships and four gratitude inspire the soul to a peaceful dream|||The mystical door of the seven ancestral spirits has a serene soul emanating from it.|||The couplet on the west pediment reads:|||The heavenly sages' wisdom and virtues are eternal and complete|||Enjoy a peaceful and serene life for a hundred years.|||After the August 1945 revolution, due to the country's war situation, the temple's maintenance was nearly abandoned. After 1975, when peace was restored, Tho Xuan district allowed Tau Pagoda to revive its ceremonies. The People's Committee of Xuan Truong commune established a Management Board to take care of and prevent deterioration; from August 1984, they mobilized people to contribute to preliminary repairs, allowing the Buddhist temple to temporarily stabilize. In 2000, the government allocated funds to restore Tau Pagoda to its current state. In 2020, the provincial People's Committee issued Decision No. 47, recognizing Tau Pagoda in Xuan Truong commune, Tho Xuan district, Thanh Hoa province, as a cultural and historical tourism site.|||Proudly home to the TAu Pagoda and Xuan Pha communal house, recognized as National Cultural and Historical Relics; and Xuan Pha performance, a National Intangible Cultural Heritage, Xuan Truong commune continues to implement measures to preserve and promote the value of these precious relics and heritage, worthy of the tradition of the thousand-year cultural homeland of Xuan Pha - Xuan Truong.

title: Le Hoan Temple
description: Le Hoan Temple is located in Trung Lap village, Xuan Lap commune, Tho Xuan district (Thanh Hoa). It is a special national historical site and considered the oldest temple in Thanh region.|||The Le Hoan Temple is located in a centuries-old village, where the founder of the Tran dynasty - Le Dai Hanh, the great emperor, was born. Today, the temple dedicated to the king still stands at the end of the village, renowned as one of the oldest and most historic temples in Thanh province and recognized as a special national historical relic.|||According to historical records, Le Hoan was born on July 15, 941, in Ke Xop village, Di Phong district, Chau Ai (now Trung Lap village, Xuan Lap commune, Tho Xuan district, Thanh Hoa province) to a poor peasant family. His father was Le Mych and his mother was Dang Thi.|||At the age of 6, Le Hoan became an orphan, and was adopted by Le Dot in Ke Mia village (now Phong My village, Truong Xuan commune, Tho Xuan district, Thanh Hoa). Growing up, Le Hoan enlisted in the army to help Dinh Tien Hoang quell the 12 warlords, establishing many merits and was appointed as Thap Dao Tuong Quan. He was devoted to his duty and contributed to helping King Dinh bring peace to the people and stability to the country.|||In the winter of 979, Emperor Dinh Tien Hoang and his eldest son, Nam Viet Vuong Dinh Lien, were assassinated by Do Thich. Le Hoan was appointed regent, helping the young Lord of the Dinh dynasty maintain the country's borders and quell internal rebellions. He was then given the imperial robe by Empress Duong Van Nga.|||In 980, Le Hoan ascended to Emperor, setting the era name as Thien Phuc. He defeated the Song army, secured the country's borders, and gradually asserted national sovereignty by subjugating Chiem Thanh. He also had Thien Phu currency minted and focused on developing agriculture, handicrafts, transportation, and trade.|||Le Hoan then passed away on March 8, 1005, in Co Do Hoa Lu, Ninh Binh province. He was buried in Son Lang, Truong Yen district. He ruled for 24 years, lived 65 years, and was posthumously named Dai Hanh Hoang de.|||After King Le Dai Hanh passed away, to commemorate his merits, the people built a temple on the land where the King and his mother had lived. Initially, the temple was simple, but during the Hong Duc era, King Le Thanh Tong ordered its reconstruction and granted 67 mau of land for worship purposes.|||After going through historical events and harsh natural conditions, the temple has been restored and renovated many times but still retains its ancient architecture. The temple dedicated to King Le features a unique architectural style with a 'Cong' shaped roof in the traditional Vietnamese manner, a characteristic system of pillars and beams including gia chieng, chong ruong, con nhi, supported by columns and beams... creating a solid structure for the temple along with intricate carvings, showcasing the high aesthetic sense of ancient people.|||Notably, the temple still preserves ancient artifacts and documents such as steles, imperial edicts, orders, couplets, horizontal boards, incense altars, shrines, statues, ceramics from the Ly and Tran dynasties, the Ming period, and a stone dish said to have been gifted by the King of Song to the King of Le.|||At the current temple, there are 2 steles built in the early 17th century. The first stele was erected in the 2nd year of Hoang Dinh (1602) during the reign of King Le Kinh Tong. The stele is 1.22m high, 0.79m wide, 0.22m thick, with a square base 0.28m thick, and four sides carved with lotus petals. The stele was written by Phung Khac Khoan, a royal official.|||It mentions that in the 15th year of Hong Duc (1484), King Le Thanh Tong allocated 67 mau of land to Trung Lap village for worship at the temple of King Le Dai Hanh.|||The second stele was erected in 1626 during the renovation of the temple, at the request of the local people. The stele was written by Le Bo Ta thi lang Phuong lan hau Nguyen Thuc. The stele is 1.65m high, 1.17m wide and 0.21m thick. The base is a rectangular shape, 0.28m thick, with intricate carvings. The top of the stele has 8 large characters: "Le Dai Hanh Hoang de dien mieo bi.|||The stele consists of two parts: the "self" and the "inscription"; The self part mentions the legend of Mrs. Dang Thi dreaming of a lotus flower giving birth to the King and the coronation of King Le in accordance with the will of Heaven and the hearts of the people, recording the military achievements of King Le defeating Song and pacifying Chiem, building the country of Dai Co Viet to be independent, self-reliant and strong, forcing the Song dynasty to recognize the Le dynasty. The Inscription has a paragraph:|||The people worship, the country makes offerings|||Pray and you will feel it, respond and you will be enlightened|||To ward off evil and eliminate disasters|||To make the people strong and wealthy|||Silently help bring prosperity to the country|||Eternal and boundless|||Le Hoan Temple is considered the oldest temple in Thanh region.|||It was recognized as a national historical site in 1990.|||In 2018, it was designated as a Special National Historical Site by the Prime Minister.

title: Nui Dum - Cong Troi Tourist Site
description: With fresh and cool climate, Nui Dum - Cong Troi eco-tourism area in hamlet 15, 16, Trang Da commune (Tuyen Quang city) is likened to 'Tam Dao' in the heart of the city by many tourists. On hot summer days, taking advantage of the weekend, many families come here to relax and escape the sweltering heat.|||The Nui Dum - Cong Troi eco-tourism area covers over 2,000 hectares with rich and diverse flora, playing the role of a green lung for the city. It features beautiful caves such as Ba Cun, Doi, Nga Vo, and several hills like Ong and Ba. Among them, Doi Cave is the most beautiful, attracting many visitors.|||Nui Dum - Cong Troi attracts many young travelers with its stunning waterfalls like Dat Tu Khang, Cam, and Cong Troi. During this season, the water flowing from above creates a mesmerizing beauty that captivates anyone who visits. Taking advantage of the pristine water source, many households have built swimming pools at the foot of Nui Dum, attracting tourists during the hot summer.|||Standing on Cong Troi, visitors can see Tuyen Quang city, a large and beautiful valley, with the Lo River flowing poetically around it. Within Cong Troi, there is a small valley of about a few dozen hectares, surrounded by mountains and protective forests. The area around Cong Troi extends to Dong Quan village, Tan Long commune; Dang village, Tan Tien commune (Yen Son); and Dùm hamlet, Nong Tien ward (Tuyen Quang city).

title: Temple of Le Dynasty Kings
description: Thọ Xuân, Thanh Hóa is known as a land of "martial and literary heroes", the " thang moc" land of the two Le dynasties, Tiền Lê and Hậu Lê. Today, it honors three kings from the Le Trung Hung period.|||About 3km south of Thọ Xuân town is Ban Thạch village, which existed in the 15th century. According to elderly villagers, Ban Thạch, formerly Xuân Quang commune (now Xuân Sinh commune, Thọ Xuân district, Thanh Hóa province), was chosen for its beautiful landscape and spiritual energy as the burial site for three Le Trung Hung kings.|||The name Ba Lăng was given to this land by locals, specifically at Bai Trach village, Xuân Giang commune, Thọ Xuân district, where King Lê Dụ Tông's tomb is located. In Xuan Quang, there are tombs of King Lê Mẫn Đế and King Lê Hiển Tông.|||Thanh Hóa province, particularly Thọ Xuân district, lacks a temple dedicated to the Le Trung Hung kings. Based on the discovery of royal tombs, the local people, with the desire to honor their ancestors and show gratitude, decided to build a temple.|||With the approval of relevant authorities, in 2010, the Le family and locals, along with benefactors, built the Temple of Le Trung Hung kings at a cost of over 12 billion VND.|||The temple currently honors three kings: Lê Dụ Tông, Lê Hiển Tông, and Lê Mẫn Đế, along with a separate area for the queen mothers and royal concubines. It hosts spiritual activities such as the festivals in honor of King Lê Dụ Tông on the 20th of the first lunar month and King Lê Hiển Tông on the 17th of the seventh lunar month. On full moon days, Tết, and local events, descendants of the Lê family, locals, and tourists visit, offering incense and flowers for national prosperity.|||According to the Thanh Hóa Department of Culture, Sports, and Tourism, since January 2020, the Temple of Le Trung Hung kings has been recognized by the provincial People's Committee as one of four tourist sites.

title: Kim Son Cave
description: Kim Son Cave, located in Vinh An commune, Vinh Loc district, is a scenic area with a harmonious landscape of mountains and water, covering approximately 150 hectares, of which 80 hectares are lakes and ponds. To enter the cave, visitors must take a boat through a narrow passage, similar to the way into Phong Nha Cave in Quang Binh province.|||Inside, there are many caves, rock formations, and large lakes, as well as open-air caves and a bridge known as Tien Bac Bridge. A large cave is said to be where King Tran hid during the war against the Yuan-Mongol army. Notably, during the two resistance wars against French colonialism and American imperialism, this site served as a military weapons production workshop and a shelter for the local people. Kim Son also features numerous steles, poems, and inscriptions carved into the cave walls.|||The area is rich in products: in the water, there are shrimp, fish, and soft-shelled turtles; on the mountain, there are parrots and other birds. The specialty here is the prickly water lily root, which is pointed like two horns, with a rich and buttery flavor. Behind the cave is a mountain called Mu Thieu, where legend has it that a woman with magical powers could turn objects into stone, but was prevented by six fairies.

title: Hiêu Waterfall
description: At the end of Canh Nang town (Ba Thuc district), cross the La Han bridge over the Ma river towards Co Lung commune about 25 km on both asphalt and dirt mountain roads, you will arrive at Hiêu Waterfall.|||Hiêu Waterfall is located in Lang Hiêu, Co Lung commune (Ba Thuc district, Thanh Hoa), within the core of Pu Luong natural reserve. This is a favorite destination for backpackers and foreign tourists who love to explore, with a 25 km road from Canh Nang town to Lang Hiêu being very beautiful with rice terraces on both sides of the stream. After crossing a wooden suspension bridge, you enter the village. The water from Hiêu Waterfall has many limestone properties, creating a particularly clear stream, but also forming deposits on the ground and sides of the stream. During heavy rain, the water turns white with limestone powder. This unique characteristic causes plants and objects in the stream to petrify.|||The source of the Hiêu stream comes from a cave in a limestone mountain range of Pu Luong - Cuc Phuong, an important global sample of Karst ecosystem, the only remaining lowland limestone forest habitat in Northern Vietnam. According to locals, the stream flows all year round and never dries up.|||During the rainy season, the waterfall roars loudly, and the water changes from green to cloudy white like rice water. As the limestone mountain is eroded by water, non-stones crumble and create a large amount of liquid limestone. On calm days, the stream is gentle with clear water. Some areas have a soft gurgling sound, while others have a thundering waterfall, creating a poetic ambiance.|||The waterfall is about 800m long. From the top, the stream flows down and splits into two branches at the mid-mountain, pouring down in two different directions and merging at the end.|||Right outside the foot of the waterfall, there is a natural "swimming pool". After exploring the waterfall, visitors can come here to bathe. The water level is just over 1m deep, with sand underneath, so those who love adventure can jump and play freely.|||This place has formed a tourist spot with stilt houses for visitors to rest. Lying on the stilt house with a few pillows, visitors can admire the mountain scenery and enjoy wonderful moments of relaxation.

title: Mây Waterfall
description: In the midst of the dense mountains and forests of the Truong Son range, Mây Waterfall appears like a pristine white cloud. According to legend, its beauty is so captivating that it lured 9 fairies to come down and bathe...|||Mây Waterfall is located in Dang Thuong village, Thach Lam commune (Thach Thanh district, Thanh Hoa), about 100 km from Thanh Hoa city and about 10 km from the Ho Chi Minh trail by car. Although not well-known, Mây Waterfall is considered the most beautiful in Thanh Hoa.|||Thach Lam is a mountainous commune located in the northwest of Thach Thanh district, mainly inhabited by the Muong ethnic group.|||This area is also part of the buffer zone of Cuc Phuong National Park, so the primeval forest ecosystem is well preserved.|||In the midst of the dense mountains and forests of the northern Truong Son range, there is a beautiful waterfall named May Waterfall.|||The name of the waterfall is associated with its mystical beauty, as it is about 100m long, with water flowing in layers all year round, white and misty like clouds.|||Mây Waterfall is also known as the Nine-step Love Waterfall. Nature has gifted this place not only a year-round water source but also created 9 connected waterfalls. Local people have a legend about 9 fairies coming down to bathe in the waterfall.|||Legend has it that May Waterfall is a gentle, crystal-clear stream surrounded by ancient trees. One day, nine fairies happened upon the waterfall's beauty and stopped to bathe. However, they were suddenly summoned back to Heaven by the Jade Emperor, and in their haste to leave, they left behind nine footprints, forming nine consecutive tiers from high to low.|||Locals believe that couples who bathe together in the waterfall will have a deeper and more loving relationship, and eventually get married. That's why the waterfall is also called 'Nine Steps of Love'.|||Mây Waterfall has water all year round, but it's most abundant and beautiful from July to October. Unlike other waterfalls, which usually pour down heavily and violently, Mây Waterfall has a gentle and calm flow in the lush green space of the mountains and forests, like a white cloud in the clear blue sky.|||From the foot of the mountain, visitors only need to climb about 50m to see the Nine Steps of Love unfolding before their eyes. There is a small path that winds through the rocks and forest trees; following this path, visitors can fully enjoy the beauty of the waterfall.|||After being captivated by the beauty of May Waterfall, on hot summer days, visitors can swim here in the crystal-clear water. Under each waterfall level, there is a small pool large enough for a dozen people to bathe together.|||While bathing, visitors can also gaze out at the scenery of Dang Thuong village, which still preserves dozens of traditional stilt houses of the Muong people, over 200 years old.|||Thac May waterfall is within the cultural space of Muong people, offering visitors many unique cultural experiences, such as Muong singing, traditional dancing, gong performances, courtship singing, boat racing, and throwing a ball. Traditional dishes include sticky rice, grilled chicken, braised buffalo meat with lôm leaves, Ngang river fish, wild boar meat, bitter leaf soup, stone snail, and bitter bamboo shoots…|||In early October 2019, Thanh Hoa Provincial People's Committee decided to recognize May Waterfall as a provincial tourist site.|||Thach Thanh District People's Committee also organized seminars to gather opinions from experts and those with experience in tourism development, so that in the near future, May Waterfall - Chin Bac (Nine Steps) waterfall will become a must-visit destination for tourists when visiting Thanh Province.

title: Ban Ba Waterfall
description: Ranked as a National Scenic Spot in 2007, Ban Ba Waterfall is one of the most famous scenic spots in Chiem Hoa and Tuyen Quang.|||Ban Ba Waterfall is located on the slope of Phieng Khang mountain, in Trung Ha commune, Chiem Hoa district, 70 km from Tuyen Quang city. The 25 km road from Chiem Hoa to the waterfall winds through the old forest, surrounded by green nature and majestic mountains.|||The beauty of Ban Ba Waterfall lies in its chain of connected waterfalls, with three main tiers: Tat Cum, Tat Cao, and Tat Gio, all pouring water straight down from dozens of meters high into the waterfall pool, accompanied by smaller waterfalls around.|||The first tier, Tat Cum, is the most majestic and romantic. At the foot of the waterfall is the "Dragon's Abyss" (called "Vang Tang" or "Vang Luong" in Tày language), where a stone wall resembles a coiled dragon, and a hidden water source sprays out, creating a rainbow-colored spectacle with sunlight.|||The second tier, Tat Cao, is divided into two branches that flow down like two white silk ribbons flying through the forest. Under the waterfall is a clear and green pool called "Quyên Abyss", ideal for bathing and relaxation. On the bank of this tier are stone slabs resembling a dragon lying down, adding to the wild and mysterious charm.|||The third tier flows along limestone slabs into a deep pool called Linh Abyss. Here, visitors can swim in the clear and cool water, listen to the sound of the waterfall, and the singing of forest birds.|||Visiting Ban Ba Waterfall, tourists can also explore ancient forests with centuries-old trees, various precious wood species, and dense creepers. At the foot of the waterfall, lush fields create a picturesque natural scenery. The stilt houses of local ethnic people are ideal for resting and trying local delicacies like dón leaves, hill chicken, grilled fish, and rocket pork.|||The pristine and poetic beauty of Ban Ba Waterfall makes it an ideal spot for relaxation and rejuvenation during hot summer days.

title: Linh Phuoc Pagoda
description: Linh Phuoc Pagoda is located at Kham Tu Phuoc, Ward 11, Da Lat City.
