It was built in 1949 and recently renovated on a large scale from 1990 to 1998.|||The pagoda's distinctive feature is its intricate decoration of dragon statues made from ceramic, porcelain, and glass tiles, following the ancient carving technique found at Khai Dinh Tomb in Hue. The main hall houses a 4.9m high sitting Buddha statue under the Bodhi tree and the tallest concrete Quan The Am Bodhisattva statue in Vietnam.|||Adjacent to the pagoda is the unique Long Hoa Vien with a dragon-shaped Tam Quan gate and a 49m long dragon curving through the garden.

title: Sculpture Tunnel
description: The clay tunnel, also known as the sculpture tunnel or red clay tunnel, is a new and unique tourist attraction in Da Lat. Located near Datanla waterfall and Truc Lam Da Lat Zen monastery.|||The clay tunnel is a creative and unique architectural work, built by excavating the mountain and shaping with local basan soil. The tunnel features replicas of famous architectural works, reflecting the history and culture of the beautiful city of flowers.|||Despite its small size, the tunnel's details are remarkably accurate. Using diverse materials and cultural references, the tunnel tells many small stories that connect seamlessly. As visitors walk through the tunnel, they can clearly see and feel the origins, history, and development of Da Lat city.

title: Cu Lan Village
description: Cu Lan Village is a small, beautiful, and romantic village nestled in the primeval forest at the foot of Langbiang mountain in Lat commune, Lac Duong district, Lam Dong province, about 25km northwest of Da Lat city.|||There are many explanations for the origin of the name Cu Lan Village, but the one told by the villagers is the most widely circulated.|||In the early 20th century, a young man from the plain went to the mountain and forest with a dream to collect stones to build a paradise in the forest to give to his loved one. Perhaps, with the dream of "collecting stones to mend the sky" and his foolish way of doing things, people called him Cu Lan. The legend of Cu Lan collecting stones to build a paradise on the mountain, in the deep forest, to give to his loved one spread to the girl's ears. She left her town and went to the mountain and forest. Overwhelmed by the majestic beauty of nature, moved by Cu Lan's sincere love, she stayed in the deep forest with him. They couldn't build their dreamed paradise, but they built a small village by the stream amidst green hills and wildflowers. From then on, people called the village Cu Lan Village.|||Today, the villagers still tell their story through songs: THANG CU LAN, TRAI TIM CU LAN, CU LAN MƠ, and LANG CU LAN.|||Seen from above, Cu Lan Village looks like a beautiful village in the mountains and forests, with each house covered with a layer of dry pine leaves, as if the village wants to hide in nature. Visitors can choose their mode of transportation. They can walk, hike, and enjoy the scenery. Or they can take a jeep ride on winding roads, through the forest, across shallow streams, and admire the unexpected scenery that unfolds after each hill, watching the purple flowers reflect in the stream.|||The village center has a large green lawn where team-building activities, camping, and campfires are organized. The village has many places to explore, such as the fire hill, suspension bridge, wooden statue museum, wooden houses with standard interiors but still showing wildness, flower-filled paths, stone-paved roads, ancient communal house, painting room, and especially K'Ho hamlet. This is a small village with a few houses, gongs, dried corn hanging, wooden boat, wine pot... The journey ends at Chom Ho Homm Market. Chom Ho Homm Market is actually a stilt house displaying souvenirs, many strange items like a tomb model, tree bark, gourd, dried gourd... Here, the best-selling item is Cu Lan plush toys, and visitors to Cu Lan Village must buy one as a souvenir.|||Come to Cu Lan Village to immerse yourself in the wind's whispers in the green of the mountains and forests or sit by the lake to relax, dispel the fatigue, and toan of everyday life.

title: Gougah Waterfall
description: On National Highway 20, heading from Dalat to Ho Chi Minh City, about 8 km past Lien Nghia town (Deu Trong district), take a left turn and travel 800 m on the concrete road to reach Gougah Waterfall.|||The Da Nhim River flows along the outside of Tung Nghia town to Phu Hoi commune, where it meets a geological fault line and drops from about 30m high to form Gougah Waterfall. Located in a windy highland area, this waterfall exudes a majestic and pristine beauty.|||There are several theories about the origin of the waterfall's name. One story relates to Queen Nafulut, a Vietnamese woman who married a Cham king (some accounts say she was Princess Huyen Tran). After the king's defeat, the queen fled south and became seriously ill, but was helped by local residents who took her to the waterfall to rest and recover. When she asked them what the place was called, they replied 'Gougah'.|||The waterfall is also known as O Ga Waterfall. Before 1975, visitors noticed that the stream split into two flows: one was reddish-yellow and the other was white and foamy, resembling a broken egg in a 3-sided gray stone wall, hence the name O Ga Waterfall.|||Gougah Waterfall has been developed with reforestation, a path down to the waterfall, and reconstruction of the area's landscape. Various facilities have been built, including rest houses, viewing platforms, refreshment stalls in a rustic highland style, a restaurant with a capacity for over 150 people, karaoke services, and family apartments for 2 or 4 people. Visitors can also stay in tents, enjoy stargazing, and listen to the enchanting sounds of the Tay Nguyen mountains and forests.

title: Prenn Waterfall
description: Located just 10km south of the city center, Prenn Waterfall lies at the foot of Prenn Pass. With a prime location at the gateway to the city, Prenn Waterfall is a popular spot for tourists visiting Dalat.|||The waterfall is easily accessible, situated at the entrance of the city, and the journey is quite convenient for visitors. Just follow Highway 20 and the Lien Khuong expressway, and you'll find the Prenn Waterfall tourist area at the foot of the majestic Prenn hill.|||The name 'Prenn' sparks curiosity in many people. Legend has it that in the 15th-17th centuries, the area where Prenn Waterfall is located was a border zone for warring tribes. The name 'Prenn' comes from the Cham language, meaning 'invading region,' referring to invaders who came to the local Chi, Sré, and Lat ethnic groups.|||However, contrary to the war-related legend, elderly villagers claim that the waterfall was originally named 'Prềnh,' meaning 'bitter coffee,' because many bitter coffee plants grew around the area. The two explanations for the name suggest the waterfall's attractive beauty - both majestic and gentle.|||Unlike other waterfalls in the Central Highlands, Prenn Waterfall has its own unique charm. While Dalat has a majestic Dambri and a strong Pongour, Prenn boasts a subtle beauty with its gentle and peaceful atmosphere. The waterfall stands nearly 10m high and 20m wide, creating a soft, gentle sound that is both soothing and calming.|||Visitors often compare Prenn Waterfall to a young girl's hair, flowing naturally in the sunlight. Tourists can touch the soft, living 'hair' and feel the coolness and moisture, which is sure to delight. The small water droplets create a misty veil, splashing onto visitors and leaving them feeling refreshed and cool, as if in a fairyland.|||The natural scenery combines the gentle sound of the waterfall, the chirping of birds, and the rustling of leaves, creating a sense of relaxation and tranquility. Visitors can freely explore the trails, stone stairs, and visit the zoo, orchid garden, or spacious pine forest. The pristine beauty of the vast wilderness makes visitors eager to take stunning check-in photos.|||During its development, Prenn Waterfall has introduced various services to cater to tourists, such as sports boating on the Prenn stream, suspension bridges, and cable car rides through the waterfall. Visitors can not only enjoy the scenery but also experience traditional games of the local ethnic groups.

title: Nam Rut Waterfall (Mua Roi)
description: Thai Nguyen is a province located next to Hanoi, featuring a terrain of hills, mountains, rivers, and streams alternating with small plains. This terrain has created many unique landscapes, including Nam Rut Waterfall, located 30km from Thai Nguyen City, in Than Sa commune, Vo Nhai district.|||Nam Rut Waterfall, affectionately known as "Rainfall Waterfall" by the Tay people.|||A unique hidden scenic spot. It got this name because on dry days, only a small stream flows from the high cliff down to the Than Sa River.|||If you have a chance to visit here, from 80m away from the waterfall, you can already hear the gentle gurgling sound of the water, echoing off the cliff, like a forest melody. The fresh and cool atmosphere makes this place look mystical and pristine, similar to Sa Pa or Da Lat. When the water droplets hit your face, it feels like you're surrounded by misty fog.|||In the summer, Ram Rut waterfall appears like a "Green Forest Princess" for a couple of days, then hides itself in the mountain wall. The waterfall has a mystical charm due to the interweaving of many large and small streams spraying water from the rock crevices like a shower of water from a flower, adding to the serene beauty. The fresh and cool atmosphere enhances the pristine beauty of the mountain girl with a forest melody found only at this waterfall on rainy days.|||Under the sunlight, the waterfall is refracted into countless colorful rainbows shining down on the crystal-clear Than Sa River. The gentle babbling of the water blends with the echoing sound of the rocky cliffs, creating an interesting forest melody.|||The section of Than Sa river at the beginning of the waterfall has fine sand beaches mixed with rocky and pebble beaches, ideal for sunbathing and swimming. Along the riverbank where the waterfall cascades down, there are high and low rocks resembling tables and chairs, perfect for sitting, enjoying the scenery, or fishing.|||About 700m from Nam Rut waterfall is Nam Rut village of the Mong people. Here, visitors can be invited by the locals to drink corn wine and savor traditional ethnic dishes such as men men, boiled corn, cat's eye vegetables, grilled wild chicken, or shoulder-picked pork…|||5km northeast of Nam Rut Waterfall is the Than Sa archaeological site, dated 40,000 to 23,000 years ago, which has been nationally protected since 1982.|||In the late 20th century, archaeologists conducted several large-scale excavations and discovered tens of thousands of tools, including hand axes, chipped pebble tools, edge choppers, double-edged tools, horn-shaped tools, and 3 ancient human skeletons.|||Notably, on the 30m high and 60m wide Da Ngum roof, located on the slope of Ngum mountain in Trung Son village, archaeologists have discovered 4 cultural strata: Bac Son, Hoa Binh, Son Vi and Ngum. The archaeological findings in Than Sa have provided compelling scientific evidence to confirm that this place was inhabited by many generations of ancient people. Therefore, Than Sa holds a special position in understanding the evolution of primitive human history in Vietnam and Southeast Asia. Additionally, visitors to Than Sa can admire the beauty of cultural activities and traditional Tay and Nung stilt house architecture.

title: Dat Dang
description: Dat Dang is located in Phu Xuyen commune, Dai Tu district, Thai Nguyen province. From the center of Thai Nguyen city, follow National Highway 37 connecting Thai Nguyen and Tuyen Quang, it takes about an hour to reach Phu Xuyen commune by motorbike, then continue on a 2km dirt path to the foot of Dat Dang. After parking and hiking about 2km through streams, rocky terrain, and green hills, Dat Dang waterfall appears in layers, surely worth the effort for travel enthusiasts and explorers.|||Dat Dang is quite far from the national highway, which is why the appeal of this place is the feeling of immersing oneself in nature, getting lost in the lush primeval forests, in a fresh and cool atmosphere, and the flowing waterfalls.|||To enter Dat Dang, visitors must walk through bamboo groves close to the ground and climb over narrow mountain paths. The reward is a breathtaking panorama of lush greenery, with natural grasslands and a serene atmosphere, perfect for a rest stop after a tiring hike. Lying on the grass, taking a deep breath, and feeling the distinctive scent of the forest, one can experience a refreshing and peaceful ambiance. Listening to familiar and unfamiliar sounds, and opening one's eyes to the vast sky. Standing here, visitors can gaze out at pristine nature, beautifully unusual. The green landscape stretches far and wide, dotted with red and yellow wild bananas. Red flowers bloom underfoot, seeming to emerge from the earth, offering a sense of relaxation, as if one's soul is in harmony with nature.|||After a hike up the hill and across the stream, visitors arrive at the first point of Dat Dang. The scene before them is a series of silver waterfalls cascading down, white foam swirling, but this is only the first tier, the lowest level of Dat. Dat Dang has 11 tiers, each connected and rising like stairs. The temperature inside Dat is quite cool, always about 4 to 5 degrees Celsius lower than outside. In the summer, Dat Dang welcomes many groups of tourists, especially students who love nature and exploration, like a festive gathering.|||Entering Dat Dang, you feel like stepping into a completely new world, away from the noise and chaos of the city. Breathe in the fresh air and listen to the sounds of the forest surrounding you. A waterfall cascades down from above, creating a misty veil, flowing through narrow rock crevices and into deep pools. The water from the mountain spring is crystal clear and refreshing. On a hot and sunny summer day, immersing yourself in this cool, clear stream is pure delight.|||As you continue to ascend, you'll reach level 2, level 3, and then level 11, with each level gradually increasing in height and offering its own unique charm, making the experience increasingly fascinating for visitors. The higher you climb, the cooler the temperature and the fresher the air.|||As we leave, we all feel a sense of regret. Dat Dang Waterfall is one of the places worth stopping to admire the scenery, especially for young adventurers and backpackers. Hopefully, one day we'll return to Dat Dang.

title: Tan Cuong Tea Hill
description: Not only famous for its special delicious tea, Thai Nguyen region is also known for its vast green tea hills. The breathtaking view attracts visitors to experience the unique flavor. Getting lost in the green scenery is a must-do.|||Tan Cuong Tea Hill is located in Tan Cuong commune, about 10 km southwest of Thai Nguyen city center, within a 1,300 ha tea plantation. At sunrise, the green land comes alive.|||The day starts with simple activities of tea farmers. The morning air is fresh and cool. Gentle sunshine falls on the cup-shaped tea hills stretching to the horizon. People are busy harvesting and tending to the tea plants. Hands move swiftly to collect plump tea buds. Nature has gifted this land with special tea that is hard to forget.|||Picking green tea leaves and processing tea like a real artisan can be an interesting experience. You will see the effort that goes into creating the unique flavor.

title: Chua Hang Temple
description: Chua Hang Temple is located in the center of Chua Hang town, Dong Hy district, Thai Nguyen province, 3 km north of Thai Nguyen city, on the left of National Route 1B, heading from Thai Nguyen to Lang Son. The temple has many characteristics of a mountainous region, and has been selected for the collection of 100 typical Vietnamese temples first published in 2011. According to legend, this is an ancient temple dating back to the 11th century and has been ranked as a national scenic site in 1999.|||Chua Hang, also known as "Kim Son Tu" or "Tien Lu Phat Dong". This scenic site features three large, independent stone mountains on flat land. The middle mountain, named "Huyen Vu", is tall and sturdy. On either side are the "Thanh Long" and "Bach Ho" peaks, rising majestically. The three mountains are connected by a 1000m-long saddle-shaped ridge, with a total area of approximately 2.7ha at the foot of the mountains.|||Legend has it that Hang Temple originated from the Ly Dynasty (11th century), a period of great prosperity for Buddhism. The story goes that one spring morning in the year of Nham Tuat, King Ly Thanh Tong woke up and told his queen, Phi Y Lan, about his dream. In the dream, the King was led by Buddha to a spiritual land in Dong Hy, Thai Nguyen. The Queen immediately organized a trip to the site and was impressed by the beautiful scenery, majestic mountains and vast caves. She then decided to build a temple in the cave to worship Buddha. This is possibly how Kim Son Tu Temple came to be, but locals simply call it Hang Temple because it is located inside a cave.||||||Passing through the Tam Quan gate and entering the temple, on both sides you will see the statues of Ho Phap Khuyen Thien and Trung Ac, riding an elephant and a tiger respectively, exuding an air of authority. As you go deeper, the cave expands, and the stone stalactites on the ceiling appear to be "old clouds entwined with strange rocks, playing in the air". Many large stone pillars stand tall, supporting the ceiling like heavenly pillars. The cave walls feature numerous stone stalactites protruding to form altars and various strange shapes that captivate visitors. The cave has many nooks and crannies, with paths leading up to heaven and down to the underworld, as well as front and rear exits, creating a refreshing atmosphere within the temple. The temple remains cool in summer and warm in winter, with a perpetual mist of incense that adds to its mystical ambiance.|||Hang Temple - Kim Son Pagoda is associated with the legend of "Dong Tien Lu", a stunning landscape painting that has captivated the hearts of many famous poets and scholars from the Le dynasty to the Nguyen dynasty.|||Many stone steles with poems and writings in Chinese still remain on the cave walls, praising this naturally formed wonder.|||According to the plan, Hang Pagoda will be constructed and restored in 5 areas, including a conservation area of 2.7ha with the entire cave and rocky mountain; a spiritual axis with 8 structures: Tam Bao Main Hall, Ancestor Worship Hall, Hoang Phap Dharma Lecture Hall, Stupa, Bell Tower, Drum Tower, Inner and Outer Tam Quan gates; a meditation area on the right side of the pagoda; a social charity center; and a festival area. The total investment is around 500 billion VND from social resources.|||With all the historical values here and the wishes of the abbot and people, over the past 3 years many monks, units, and businesses have contributed to building the temple. The entire temple complex is surrounded by a wall and encased in a natural landscape. Behind the temple are mountain ranges, and in front is the winding Cau River. The main structures, including the Tam Bao, Tam Quan gate, bell tower, and drum tower, are being completed and will soon be finished, preserving a spiritual cultural heritage and enhancing the value of a beautiful scenic spot like a painting, a poetic and idyllic place.|||As an envoy of the Buddha, the venerable Thich Nguyen Thanh, the abbot of Hang Pagoda, calls upon compassionate Buddhists, philanthropists, businesses, and entrepreneurs at home and abroad to contribute to the early completion of Hang Pagoda. With its great value as a beautiful historical site from a thousand years ago, after being restored and expanded, Hang Pagoda - Kim Son Tu will become a major Buddhist center of Thai Nguyen province and an attractive spiritual tourism destination.

title: Ghanh Che Lake
description: Ghanh Che Lake is located in Binh Son commune, Song Cong city, covering an area of approximately 40ha. It is surrounded by vast forests of pine and eucalyptus. With its captivating scenery, fresh air, and proximity to the city, Ghanh Che Lake has become an eco-tourism spot attracting many visitors to relax and fish.|||On the way to the lake, visitors will pass by the beautiful Ba Van horse farm, reminiscent of Mongolia's highlands, and experience the fresh air and picturesque countryside. The area features herds of buffalo and horses grazing peacefully. Visitors can stop to admire the scenery and take photos.|||Ghanh Che Lake appears before visitors as a vast, green and fresh waterbody, with many small and large islands dotting the surface.|||Taking a motorboat ride around the lake, visitors can immerse themselves in the expansive natural scenery, leaving their worries behind. After about 30 minutes, they will reach the lake's center, where they can admire blooming water lilies and lotuses.|||At Ghanh Che Lake, visitors will feel an extremely pleasant and peaceful atmosphere. The more they explore, the more they want to stroll around to admire the sky, clear water, and wildlife, and listen to the birds singing. Along the way, they may encounter local residents removing fish from their nets, their sparkling eyes reflecting joy and hospitality.

title: Khuon Tat Waterfall
description: Khuon Tat Waterfall is a scenic spot in Thai Nguyen. The waterfall is located in Tin Keo hamlet, Phu Dinh commune, Dinh Hoa district, about 70km from Thai Nguyen city center.|||Khuon Tat Waterfall is part of the ATK Dinh Hoa historical site, a key base area of Viet Bac and the headquarters of the leadership during the long resistance war led by President Ho Chi Minh against the French colonialists (1946-1954). Khuon Tat Waterfall was ranked as a national scenic spot in 2002.|||The waterfall is situated amidst wild and quiet mountains and forests, surrounded by many ancient trees. The waterfall has 7 tiers, with water cascading down from the top, creating a white mist, and forming a stream at the bottom. According to local legend, wild animals in the area used to come here to drink water. On clear days, with the sun shining, and clouds floating above the mountain peaks, fairies would descend from heaven to bathe at the waterfall.|||From the top of Deo De pass, you can look down at Khuon Tat Waterfall with its seven tiers, resembling the stairs of a mountainous house. The height from the top to the bottom of the waterfall is over 20m. The bottom tier is the most beautiful, about 12m high and 15m wide. The other tiers above have a height difference of about 2 to 3m, with decreasing width towards the top. Visitors can climb up the tiers, each with shady trees and a natural pool at the base. The waterfall has a clear water source and many flat rocks.|||At the foot of Khuon Tat Waterfall, the water creates a natural bathing pool, about 2 to 3m deep, gradually shallowing out towards the outside, forming a stream. The stream flows about 100m outside the waterfall, with a small sandy beach and natural stones in the shape of animals, such as a whale, a turtle, or a buffalo. The two sides of the stream have flat and green grass, ideal for camping, setting up tents, and resting for tourists.

title: Ho Vai Mieu Lake
description: Located in Ky Phu commune, Dai Tu district, Thai Nguyen province, Ho Vai Mieu Lake appears as a beautiful and poetic natural landscape, promising to be a potential tourist destination of Thai Nguyen province.|||Built in the late 20th century, Ho Vai Mieu Lake is not only a water reservoir serving agricultural production for thousands of households in the south of Dai Tu district but also an attractive tourist spot for visitors from all over.|||On hot summer days, take a boat to move around the lake, admire the rocky areas submerged in the clear water, blended with the green of Tam Dao, creating a magical scenery, surely making you feel peaceful and relaxed.|||The feeling of standing on the boat, stretching your arms to welcome the gentle breeze, or sitting on the boat, touching the waves created by the boat, is also wonderful. It's even more interesting if you open your heart to immerse yourself in the vast natural landscape of the lake, with tea pickers and firewood collectors in the distance.|||Ho Vai Mieu Lake is also an interesting spot for those who love fishing. The fish here are diverse in species, such as tilapia, carp, and snakehead fish, ranging from small to large, even up to several kilograms. A poetic lake day, enjoying the grilled fish created by your own hands, with soft music, will help dispel all the worries of life.|||Take a boat deep into the lake, you'll encounter a small stream with a gentle flow, and a wild and majestic natural landscape. Sitting here by the stream, together having fun, making fire to grill meat, chicken, fish, and sweet potatoes… will surely be an unforgettable experience in your journey to discover the beloved land of Thai Nguyen.

title: Ba Van Horse Farm
description: Thai Nguyen is famous for its vast tea hills and beautiful Nuoc Coc Lake, which is linked to a romantic story. If you're looking for a new experience in this "tea land", consider visiting Ba Van Horse Farm in Thai Nguyen. Ba Van Horse Farm is located in Binh Son, Song Cong City, Thai Nguyen Province.|||The farm usually lets the horses roam free for a few hours a day (from 10am to 3pm), which is considered the best time to visit. If possible, plan your visit during this time.|||During this time, the horses roam freely, grazing and running, making the farm feel like a mini grassland. You don't need to go to Mongolia to see the majesty of "steppe horses"; Ba Van Horse Farm offers a similar experience. The scene of horses grazing around hills and lakes creates a breathtaking view.|||The farm is a center for research, conservation, breeding, and crossbreeding of various horse breeds, including racing horses and white horses, which are considered the rarest. Visiting Ba Van Horse Farm, you'll see many horse breeds with different characteristics, making for an interesting experience in Thai Nguyen.|||Ba Van Horse Farm is a new tourist spot where visitors can explore, learn about horse breeds, feed horses, and take photos in the vast and romantic scenery.

title: Thai Hai Stilt House Village
description: Thai Hai Stilt House Village is located in My Hao hamlet, Thinh Duc commune, Thai Nguyen city. It's an oasis situated between two major cities of Thai Nguyen, only about 10km from the center of Thai Nguyen city and Song Cong city, and 3km from Ba Van Horse Farm.|||Thai Hai Stilt House Village, also known as the ecological Thai Hai stilt house village conservation area, spans approximately 25ha and features over 30 stilt houses, nearly a century old, which were relocated from the ATK Dinh Hoa Thai Nguyen area and reconstructed in their original form to preserve and conserve.|||The village is surrounded by hills and trees, with a lake in the center and scattered stilt houses. It is home to Tay and Nung ethnic people, resembling a traditional village.|||The village is divided into several areas, including a conservation area, culinary area, resort area, entertainment area, and event organization area.|||The most impressive experience here is enjoying and learning about the culture of Then singing, a distinctive cultural trait of the Tay ethnic people.

title: Bac Trach Church
description: Bac Trach Church, also known as Mother of Perpetual Rosary Sanctuary, is located in Van Truong commune, Tien Hai district, Thai Binh. This is a magnificent and impressive church. Anyone who visits the church can't help but be amazed by its grandeur.|||The church is built in the classic Gothic style and combines with Greek architecture on both sides. This creates a unique and distinct feature compared to other churches in Thai Binh. The ornaments and motifs here are intricately and delicately crafted. The church's architecture is a one-of-a-kind 'golden interior, green exterior' style.|||Visitors are amazed to learn that the church was built with over 460,000 bricks and stones, 350 tons of iron, 500 tons of lime, and nearly 3,000 tons of cement, using over 15m³ of lim wood and 1000m² of paint inside and outside the church... and many other materials. This is indeed a monumental and proud work of the people of Thai Binh. Bac Trach Church is 92m long, 45m wide, and its bell tower is 60m high. With such a scale and size, Bac Trach Church is considered one of the largest churches in Vietnam.|||Inside the church, there are nearly 100 statues and reliefs, along with hundreds of painted glass panels, creating an overwhelming space, similar to being in a French church. The interior details are meticulously and intricately crafted. The golden-painted columns add to the church's splendor, making it even more impressive.

title: Ham Rong Mountain
description: If you're a fan of exploring majestic beauty, Ham Rong Mountain is a must-visit destination. For any traveler who has visited Gia Lai, specifically Ham Rong Mountain, they share a common impression that its beauty is a blend of grandeur and serenity, with a touch of mystical charm. Standing atop the mountain, you can gaze out at the panoramic view of the city. The vast coffee fields, lush tea hills, and more, all unfold in a breathtaking way.|||You can also 'hunt for clouds' and capture stunning photos from an altitude of over 1,000 meters above sea level. Ham Rong Mountain embodies the characteristics of a dormant volcano, rising prominently from the ground with a crater-like depression, and despite having no lakes or ponds, the vegetation remains lush year-round. During wartime, it served as a US military base, but in peacetime, it was chosen for telecommunications.|||From a distance, Ham Rong Mountain appears in various shapes, sometimes resembling a trapezoid, other times a semicircle, and from above, it looks like a giant funnel. If you reach the summit, you'll be able to admire the cityscape, coffee gardens, rubber plantations, tea fields, and pepper farms stretching across the hills. With an elevation of over 1,000 meters, the air is crisp and clean, often shrouded in mist and fog, creating a romantic ambiance. The road to the summit is also adorned with beautiful golden daisy flowers. The winding paths make it an ideal spot for young travelers' adventures. This place is not only stunning but also steeped in the legend of Chư H'Drông and Rơ Ran Ly, attracting numerous domestic and international tourists to explore.

title: Bau Can Waterfall
description: Bau Can Waterfall is located in Team 3, Bau Can commune, Chu Prong district, about 20km from Pleiku city|||The road to Bau Can Waterfall is easy and extremely beautiful with tea hills and green grasslands, gentle slopes.|||To admire the full beauty of the waterfall, you should come here during the rainy season. At that time, the large streams upstream flow down, meeting the rocky rapids cascading from high above, creating a giant and majestic 'water mountain'.|||During the dry season, the waterfall's flow is narrowed to the point where visitors can clearly see the rocky ledges of the waterfall. With a diverse ecosystem, having been explored by humans for a long time, especially the natural and artificial lake system currently existing, Bau Can has a unique appearance that can be exploited into an attractive tourist destination.

title: Chin Tang Waterfall
description: Chin Tang Waterfall is located in Ia Ba commune, about 16 km from Ia Grai district center and 20 km from Pleiku city, following provincial road 664 - National Highway 14C.|||Unlike other waterfalls with water pouring down from a towering cliff, Chin Tang Waterfall stretches through rugged cliffs, each tier ranging from 5-10m high, with the last two tiers standing approximately 10-15m tall, creating a strong flow and swirling water.|||The surrounding area features a relatively pristine forest ecosystem, contributing to the waterfall's wild and majestic beauty. The gentle stream winds around the cliffs, accompanied by a soothing rustling sound, making it an ideal and interesting weekend getaway for tourists who want to explore and experience the raw, enchanting beauty of the waterfall and the Central Highlands forest.

title: Le Kim Waterfall
description: Le Kim is the name of a waterfall on the Blang-ranh stream, located on the border between Ia To commune (B14), Ia Grai district, and Ia Dok commune (B9), Duc Co district.|||The name Le Kim has only been used since the late 1950s, when the Saigon government brought Kinh people from Quang Ngai to establish the Le Kim settlement. For the local Jrai people, they have long called this waterfall Ia Grai Glong Blang, which means the high waterfall on the Blang stream.|||The waterfall is about 30m high. Since the Blang stream never dries up, the waterfall roars all year round. From a distance, the waterfall looks like a white silk strip draped over the shoulder of a mountain forest maiden. Up close, the misty veil creates a refreshing and cool atmosphere, even in the sweltering summer heat.|||From the sandy beach at the foot of the waterfall, follow the right bank or swim through the calm water about 200m to reach the base of the waterfall. Local people say that previously, there was a large rocky outcrop on the west side of the waterfall, creating a wide hang about 20m2. Under the hang is a flat rock surface like a chessboard, perfect for picnics.|||About 500m downstream from Le Kim waterfall, there is another waterfall. This second waterfall is not as high as Le Kim, but it has its own charm.|||The Jrai people in the area have a legend explaining the origin of these two waterfalls: Long ago, a Jrai village lived by the Blang stream. The men and women in the village constantly argued over who was stronger. Finally, they agreed to hold a competition: the men would dig the stream from the lower section, while the women would dig from the upper section. The side that dug deeper in one night would win.|||On the night of the competition, the men worked hard but heard the roar of the waterfall from upstream. They ran to see and, realizing they had lost, did not return to continue digging. The story may be just a legend, but it adds to the mystique of these waterfalls.

title: Phu Cuong Waterfall
description: Located in the Phu Cuong stone mine area, in Dun commune, Chu Se district, Gia Lai province; about 3 km from Chu Se town and 45 km from Pleiku city to the southeast.|||To get to Phu Cuong waterfall, you have to go through a long, sturdy staircase system made of iron. Underneath are many large and small stone slabs stacked on top of each other, creating diverse and interesting shapes. The space becomes even more magical when the sound of the waterfall blends with the sound of the stream and the singing of birds on large ancient trees|||During the rainy season, the water flows abundantly, creating a white foam that looks majestic. In the dry season, the stream water flows gently through the rocks and large and small stone slabs, making you feel comfortable and relaxed, merging with the peaceful nature.|||Young adventurers can follow the trail into the depths of the cliff to have the opportunity to admire the majestic and magnificent beauty of this waterfall.

title: Hai Luu Stork Garden
description: Hai Luu Stork Garden is considered one of the 5 famous ecological forests in Vinh Phuc. Not as vast as Tam Dao National Park, not as wild as Dai Lai Lake... Hai Luu Stork Garden has its own charm, a poetic and peaceful beauty. Coming to Hai Luu Stork Garden, visitors will be immersed in a beautiful natural scenery.|||Hai Luu Stork Garden is located in Dua Le village, Hai Luu commune, Song Lo district, Vinh Phuc province, 110km from Hanoi city center. The garden is surrounded by the gentle and calm Song Lo river. The garden is a remaining ecological area on the foundation of Hai Luu forest. The garden covers an area of about 15ha, of which 7ha is where storks and birds gather and live. The annual temperature of Hai Luu Stork Garden changes with the seasons, with an average temperature of 28ºC and an average annual rainfall of 1650mm.|||Here, visitors will discover numerous rare species of birds and storks. Some species can be mentioned such as: flycatcher, fire stork, green stork, white stork, dwarf stork... and some bird species such as myna, sáo sậu... Moreover, Hai Luu Stork Garden is also rich in different types of trees such as bamboo, xoan, trẩu, sung, nhãn... These are the trees that birds and storks often come back to build their nests.

title: Huynh Thuy Le Ancient House
description: This house was the residence of Mr. Huynh Thuy Le's family, who was the first love of French female writer Marguerite Duras. This love story later became a memoir for her to write the famous novel 'The Lover' in 1984, which was adapted into the film 'L’Amant' by French director Jean-Jaues Annaud in 1992.|||The house was built in 1895 by Mr. Huynh Thuan, the father of Huynh Thuy Le, using wood, and in 1917, it was renovated, with the wooden walls being replaced with lime and oyster shells, giving it its current appearance.|||The Huynh Thuy Le Ancient House is a harmonious blend of Eastern and Western architecture. The entire house, covering an area of 258 square meters, is built in the traditional Vietnamese style, with a yin-yang tiled roof and curved gables resembling a boat, typical of North Vietnamese temples and communal houses, creating a soft, elegant look. However, the interior architecture is tall, airy, and modern, with thick brick walls (30-40cm) enclosing a wooden frame structure, increasing its load-bearing capacity in the traditional French architectural style.|||The house has three rooms, decorated inside in the Chinese style. The balconies and railings are painted with vermilion and gold leaf, featuring intricate carvings similar to those found in Chinese temples. The central balcony frame features a pair of Phoenixes, symbolizing 'the union of the Phoenixes in harmony and happiness,' signifying eternal happiness. The two side frames feature carvings of birds, animals, flowers, and leaves, depicting the family's prosperity. Notably, a shrine to Quan Cong, a traditional deity in Chinese culture, is located in the main room, reflecting the strength and prosperity of the family. All the wooden doors, cabinets, beds, and altars are intricately and finely carved.|||The Huynh Thuy Le Ancient House has been recognized as a provincial cultural historical relic and is proposed as a national relic; it is an attractive tourist destination for visitors to Dong Thap.|||Additional information:|||

title: Sa Dec Flower City Tourist Area
description: Planning a weekend getaway? We recommend visiting Sa Dec City in Dong Thap Province to admire roses and watch jumping carp. Sa Dec City, known as the Flower City in the Mekong Delta, has recently opened the Sa Dec rose field tourist site in Tan Hiep Hamlet, Tan Quy Dong Ward.|||The Sa Dec rose field was built with an investment of 30 billion VND, covering over 2.5 hectares. The site features 6,000 rose plants of more than 20 different species, along with various scenic spots such as an infinite staircase, sunflower field, flower boat dock, hidden bamboo bridge, lotus pond, leaf hut, and fishing basket.|||What sets this place apart is the spectacular jumping carp performance and the opportunity to observe the rose perfume extraction process.

title: Gao Giong Eco-Tourism Area
description: Gao Giong eco-tourism area is located in Gao Giong commune, Cao Lanh district, and is a typical land of the Dong Thap Muoi ecosystem, with heavily acidic water and soil. Through human labor, Gao Giong has become a protective forest - the green lung of the Dong Thap Muoi region, creating a habitat for many species of birds, fish, and plants to thrive, covering an area of 1,670ha, including 250ha of primeval forest with various plants and a 36ha bird sanctuary, featuring diverse species, including the rare and precious Nhạn Điền, listed in the Red Book.|||Here, visitors will be amazed by the over 36ha bird sanctuary with numerous bird species flying overhead. In the vast forest, dozens of water bird species live and nest throughout the year, such as the Red-crested Pochard, Pied Kingfisher, and White Egret. The area is particularly known for its large White Stork population, with tens of thousands of birds, making it the largest stork garden in the Dong Thap Muoi region. During the flooding season, thousands of white storks fly over the green tram forest, creating a breathtaking scene. The sen lakes are a gathering place for thousands of Red-crested Pochards, which come to feed on fresh reeds.|||Visiting Gao Giong, visitors not only hear birds singing in the trees but also the sound of fish swimming in the water, as expressed in the poem:|||“Come and visit my homeland|||My homeland is beautiful and lovely|||Fish swim in the river, birds fly in the sky”…|||Visitors to Gao Giong will feel peaceful and enjoy leisurely boat rides through the canals, cycling through the tram forest, resting in the leaf huts of the locals, and savoring unique Mekong Delta delicacies during the flooding season, such as grilled snake, green leaves, and water lily shoots.

title: Phuoc Kien Pagoda (Lotus Leaf Pagoda)
description: Phuoc Kien Pagoda, also known as Lotus Leaf Pagoda, features a unique architectural design that reflects Buddhist influences. The highlight of the pagoda is its giant lotus leaves, measuring 1.5 to 2 meters in diameter, with thick veins and 4-5 cm high edges, resembling a large basket.|||These lotus leaves can support the weight of a 70kg adult. Without seeing them firsthand, one might suspect that they have a steel frame.|||Visitors can enjoy a peaceful and serene experience in the pagoda's tranquil atmosphere, lighting incense for good fortune and blessings for their family and loved ones.

title: Go Thap Relic Site
description: The Go Thap relic site is located in Ap 1, Tan Kieu commune, Thap Muoi district, Dong Thap province. It was recognized as a National Historic Site by the Ministry of Culture and Information in 1989 and ranked as a Special National Historic Site by the Prime Minister in 2012. Besides its archaeological, historical and architectural value, the relics in Go Thap are mostly spiritual and cultural works that worship national heroes, forefathers who reclaimed land and founded villages, and religious establishments. They all contribute to building the spiritual and cultural life of people in the Dong Thap Muoi region.|||Over the years, archaeological and historical research results have shown that Go Thap is a place of convergence of many outstanding values in archaeology, history, culture, ecology and most clearly expressed in spiritual cultural values through religious and belief monuments such as the Temple of Thien Ho Vo Duy Duong and the Temple of Doc Binh Nguyen Tan Kieu, which commemorates the great achievements of two national heroes who selflessly saved the country and led the patriotic army against the French (1862-1866). The battles organized by them have repeatedly made the French colonizers lose sleep, suffer heavy losses.|||This is a profound work, imbued with the traditional morality of "drinking water, remembering its source", aiming to remember the great merits of the ancestors who contributed to the country and educate the love for the country of Vietnamese people in the cause of anti-foreign aggression.|||Along with the relics of national heroes, in the complex of historical and cultural relics in Go Thap, there is also a shrine to Ba Chua Xu, bearing a strong imprint of folk beliefs. The Go Thap Ba Chua Xu shrine was built by local residents to worship Ba, the Mother of Dong Thap Muoi, to show respect for the female deity who gave birth and nurtured the people, providing them with food and clothing. This also serves as a place for people to visit and pay homage to Ba. Through this, it reflects people's aspirations for a prosperous life, abundant growth, and happiness, while demonstrating the traditional cultural values and ethics passed down through generations. Besides the worship of Ba Chua Xu, Go Thap also has a folk belief in worshiping Hoang Co. According to folklore, Hoang Co is the younger sister of King Gia Long. In the 18th century, Nguyen Anh went into exile in the South and occasionally hid in Go Thap. Hoang Co passed away here, was buried by the people, and a shrine was built in her honor. In addition to the temples and shrines, Go Thap also features the Linh Thap Pagoda, also known as the Ancient Pagoda. The pagoda was initially built by Vietnamese residents during the reign of King Thieu Tri (1841-1847) to worship Buddha and pray for peace and prosperity for the people. The pagoda was severely damaged during the war. After the South was liberated, in 1992, the Provincial People's Committee allowed the Ban Hoi Huong to mobilize the reconstruction of the pagoda into its current majestic form, providing a sacred place for Buddhists to worship and practice their faith.|||In parallel, every year at Go Thap Relic Site, there are two traditional festivals: the Via Ba Chua Xu ceremony on the 15th day of the 3rd lunar month and the memorial service for two national heroes, Thien Ho Vo Duy Duong and Doc Binh Nguyen Tan Kieu, on the 15th day of the 11th lunar month. The Go Thap Festival reflects a deep sense of gratitude to ancestors and spiritual beliefs. Through the festival, people express their aspirations and sincere wishes. The festival has become a traditional characteristic in Nam Bo. During the festival, the local people's lives become bustling and vibrant with visitors from everywhere coming to pray for wealth and fortune. They immerse themselves in the folk festival atmosphere, enjoying diverse cultural and artistic activities such as singing, dancing, folk games, and rich cultural performances. These activities help people forget their daily struggles and come together in a shared sense of direction towards goodness and beauty.|||Through the religious and spiritual relics in Go Thap, we can see the precious values of Go Thap land, which is a place of great sacrifice by national heroes during the resistance war against France. The land provides a bountiful harvest and national peace. There is a new belief in a prosperous life, happiness, and the assistance of Buddha... All of these have created a traditional cultural value in Go Thap, characteristic of the Dong Thap Muoi region and Southern Vietnam. Along with historical development, the spiritual cultural value through historical relics in Go Thap has been passed down from generation to generation, contributing to building precious moral values, raising awareness and responsibility of people in today's life.

title: Southern Cultural Tourism Area - Nam Phuong Linh Tu
description: The Southern Cultural Tourism Area is located in Long Hung A commune, Lap Vo district, Dong Thap province. Covering an area of 17 hectares, it consists of 5 main items: Nam Phuong Linh Tu, Dang family Nam Phuong Linh Tu, Dang family museum, Southern museum and surrounding courtyard. The highlight is Nam Phuong Linh Tu, which honors 125 historical figures who contributed to the reclamation and preservation of the southern land. Nam Phuong Linh Tu covers an area of 509m² and holds two Vietnamese records: The first temple dedicated to the national heroes who reclaimed and preserved the southern land; The temple with the largest number of bronze statues of national heroes.|||Here, visitors can explore the monuments commemorating historical figures who reclaimed the southern land and admire a vivid picture of the old Southern countryside.|||The Southern Cultural Tourism Area was started on October 30, 2009, and officially opened to visitors on December 24, 2017. It covers an area of 17 hectares, consisting of 5 main items: Nam Phuong Linh Tu, Dang family Nam Phuong Linh Tu, Dang family museum, Southern museum and surrounding courtyard (representing 5 regions).|||The Southern Cultural Tourism Area was started on October 30, 2009, and officially opened to visitors on December 24, 2017.

title: Huong Canh Pottery Village
description: Huong Canh Pottery Village is located 12km from Vinh Yen City and 42km from Hanoi capital, in Lo Cang village, Huong Canh town, Binh Xuyen district, Vinh Phuc province. It's close enough for short day trips or one-day excursions.|||Visiting the pottery village, tourists can observe and touch traditional pottery products such as pots, vases, jars, and urns. In addition, to diversify and meet aesthetic demands, the village also crafts pottery art, including unique ceramic sculptures and reliefs.|||The clay used for pottery here is green clay, rich in nutrients, making products thick, beautifully colored, and highly functional. G pottery products, such as teapots, keep the tea warm for a long time, and when used for wine, the alcohol content doesn't decrease, and the taste improves over time. Notably, due to the material characteristics, when tapped with hands, pottery products produce a pleasant, metallic sound.|||Today, to meet consumer demands and aesthetic preferences, local artisans have innovated while preserving traditional products. Currently, Huong Canh pottery is not only beautiful but also diverse, providing a stable income for local residents.

title: Xa Huong Lake
description: Nestled in the valley of Con Trau mountain, in Minh Quang commune, Tam Dao district, Vinh Phuc province, Xa Huong Lake is about 60km from Hanoi's center, making it an easily accessible address for a motorbike trip.|||Xa Huong Lake covers over 83ha, an artificial freshwater lake started construction in 1984. The lake is surrounded by majestic mountains as per the original design concept of a lake on the back of mountains.|||Xa Huong Lake has two distinct water seasons: a flooding season and a dry season. However, the lake has its own charm and romantic beauty in every season. After over 30 years, the lake still retains its breathtaking beauty, and the natural scenery around it remains like a picturesque landscape painting, mesmerizing visitors who come here.|||Every time the seasons change, Xa Huong Lake takes on a different enchanting beauty. In the spring, new buds begin to bloom, and Xa Huong Lake blends with the mountains and forests as the trees regain their vibrancy after the cold winter months. The dreamy natural scenery, with sim flowers blooming on both banks, calm waters, and trees full of life, makes the muse of Tam Dao land incredibly beautiful.|||Summer arrives with dazzling sunshine, making the surface of Xa Huong Lake sparkle in response. The scorching heat of summer seems to yield to the cool atmosphere and gentle breeze rustling through the trees and over the water. This is a perfect time for adventurers to camp in Tam Dao.|||Autumn arrives, and the scenery of Xa Huong Lake is at its most stunning. The clear blue sky with floating white clouds reflected on the crystal-clear water. The poetic beauty of Tam Dao is enhanced by the majestic mountains adorned with golden and red hues. The serene and dreamy landscape makes any traveler feel like they have wandered into a European paradise.|||In winter, the cold makes Xa Huong Lake become beautifully enchanting. Blending with the white frosty mist, the mountains and forests seem more solemn. On winter days, the lake evokes in someone's soul a truly indescribable feeling.|||Visit the lake in any season, and don't forget to try sitting on a small boat, letting yourself drift into nature. On a simple wooden boat gently floating on the calm lake surface, you'll find your soul at peace, and the fatigue and hustle and bustle of city life seem to fade away. Gaze into the clear water, admire the majestic mountains surrounding, breathe in the fresh forest air – these small things are enough to make you feel truly comfortable.|||Fishing is a favorite activity of most tourists when visiting Xa Huong Lake. Many visitors also consider it a challenge of patience and perseverance. Sitting fishing in the poetic scenery of Xa Huong Lake is a wonderful feeling.|||Xa Huong Lake is also an ideal spot for young people to organize camping and outdoor barbecues. With the cool, harmonious space of the mountains and forests, it's wonderful to record memorable moments of youth here. Let's stroll around the lake, through the streams and rocky streams, winding through the forest canopy and decoding the mysteries of endless nature. Then, at night, look up at the starry sky and release your dreams, aspirations, and youth on it.

title: Kon Tum Museum
description: Located at the entrance to Kon Tum city center, by the tranquil Dak Bla river, the museum is built with a unique architectural style inspired by the art of the Central Highlands.|||The museum was officially constructed in 2007 on an area of approximately 16,000m2 and opened in August 2012. Kon Tum Museum preserves and exhibits over 2000 artifacts, documents, images, and cultural heritage of the local people. The museum serves as a living history book with evidence of the formation and development of Kon Tum and the traditional culture of the Central Highlands.|||The museum has three floors: The first floor is used for temporary exhibitions and documentaries during special events and holidays. The second and third floors feature permanent exhibitions.|||The second floor includes an introduction to Kon Tum's geography, natural conditions, geology, and the culture of ethnic groups. Here, visitors can see a rich collection of ceramics, jewelry, and ancient tools. The museum also showcases artifacts from the Lung Leng archaeological site.|||The third floor takes visitors back in time to recall the heroic traditions of the nation and the contributions of Kon Tum's people during the two resistance wars against French and American colonialism. The exhibits evoke strong emotions and pride in the long and brave struggle of the people of Kon Tum.|||The museum is a must-visit destination in Kon Tum, not only for preserving cultural and historical values but also for entertainment, research, and education. It attracts and retains the emotions of tourists. Through the artifacts, the museum helps people appreciate traditional values and understand their responsibility to preserve and promote the nation's cultural heritage.

title: Kon Klor Suspension Bridge
description: Kon Klor Suspension Bridge is located in Kon Klor village, Kon Tum city, Kon Tum province. It is the largest and most beautiful cable-stayed bridge in the Central Highlands, spanning the Dak Bla river. The bridge is 292m long, 4.5m wide, designed and constructed on February 3, 1993, and completed on May 1, 1994, with a striking yellow-orange color.|||The area around Kon Klor is surrounded by mountains covered with green mulberry fields. Kon Klor Bridge has connected the two banks of the river, making it easier for people to travel and ending the use of wooden boats that had been used for years.|||Visitors can visit the Bah Nar ethnic village - Kon Klor, enjoy a cup of rice wine, and cross the suspension bridge to a fertile land with banana gardens, coffee plantations, and fruit trees. After a 6km winding road, visitors can reach Kon K'tu village, a Bah Nar ethnic village that still preserves its primitive lifestyle and natural scenery.|||Kon K'tu cultural tourism village has a tall and beautiful communal house, where visitors can spend the night, participate in cultural exchange activities, drink rice wine, and listen to Khan stories by the fire. When leaving the village, visitors can take home souvenirs made by the local people from natural materials.|||Kon Klor Suspension Bridge, spanning the Dak Bla river, is the largest suspension bridge in Kon Tum province, facilitating transportation and trade for the local people. During the dry season, visitors can walk down to the riverbank and admire the bridge from below.|||Today, Kon Klor Suspension Bridge is a source of pride for the people of Kon Tum and a must-visit destination for tourists traveling to the Central Highlands.

title: Dak Ke Lake
description: Dak Ke Lake, locally known as Toong Ro Pong Lake, is located in the Mang Den eco-tourism area. Covering approximately 3 hectares, it is the largest of the 7 lakes in the area, situated in Kon Plong district, Kon Tum province. The lake is about 54km northeast of the city center, following National Highway 24.|||You will be captivated by the crystal-clear water, surrounded by majestic mountains and lush forests, with flowers blooming all year round. All of this creates a breathtaking landscape. Additionally, you will hear fascinating stories that have been passed down through generations.|||In Kon Tum, visitors often hear tales about the legend of 7 lakes and 3 waterfalls. It is said that these lakes and waterfalls are manifestations of heavenly spirits.|||In the past, Mang Den was uninhabited, so the god Yang Plinh sent his 7 sons to establish villages. Their wives had to transform into animals to protect them. The god instructed his sons not to eat the animals their wives had transformed into, warning them of severe punishment if they disobeyed.|||The 7 villages in Mang Den prospered, but one day, the 7 young men forgot their father's warning and ate the animals their wives had become. Enraged, Yang Plinh punished them by setting up 7 columns of fire. These columns turned into 7 lakes, and 3 of them created 3 majestic waterfalls. Dak Ke Lake is one of these 7 lakes.|||Kon Tum has a mild climate, making it suitable to visit any time of the year. However, the best times are April, May, October, November, and December. In April and May, the weather is cool, and the air is crisp, with the sweet fragrance of forest flowers and pine trees.|||The sound of dew drops on leaves creates a mesmerizing melody. From October to December, you can admire the golden rice fields and stunning scenery.|||The lake offers various entertainment activities such as fishing, duck boating, and dining services. You can rent horse-drawn or ox-drawn carriages to explore the lake and surrounding landscape.|||Here, you can enjoy familiar dishes prepared in a unique local style, especially grilled foods, which are characteristic of mountainous regions. Some notable dishes include Mang Den grilled chicken, Mang Den roasted pig, rice wine, and grilled chicken with bamboo rice.

title: Dam Vac Tourist Area
description: Located in the south of Yen Vinh Town, Dam Vac tourist area is likened to the "green lung" of the town and is a highlight of Vinh Phuc tourism.|||Dam Vac is a natural lagoon that has existed for thousands of years, with 23 main branches creating small lakes and streams with a perimeter of 14km, an average width of 1km, a water surface area of nearly 500ha, a deepest point of 4.5m, and an average depth of 3.8m.|||This was a tourist spot previously covered by natural forests, with a rich ecosystem, and is home to many species of birds, fish, and other wildlife such as storks, egrets, herons, and spoonbills. The area was named Dam Vac due to the abundance of storks and egrets. Nature has gifted Dam Vac with an endless water source flowing from Tam Dao mountain, creating a harmonious landscape of "mountain and water".|||The Dam Vac eco-tourism area offers good services that can provide visitors with moments of relaxation. Here, visitors can admire the scenery, participate in outdoor activities, and especially play golf on the weekend.|||With a great location near Dai Lai, Tam Dao, and Tay Thien tourist areas, beautiful scenery, good climate, fresh air, and hundreds of modern and luxurious tourist facilities surrounding it, this scenic spot in Vinh Phuc has captivated many generations of tourists and attracts thousands of domestic and international visitors each year.

title: Chư Hreng Mountain
description: The Chư Hreng mountain range is located south of Kon Tum city, stretching approximately 11km in a northwest-southeast direction, starting from Kon K'Tu village, Đắk Rơ Wa commune, and ending at Sao Mai pass, Hòa Bình commune, Kon Tum city, where it borders the Chư Pao mountain range of Ia Khươi commune, Chư Păh district, Gia Lai province. The mountain range serves as the administrative boundary between Gia Lai and Kon Tum provinces. The highest point of Chư Hreng mountain is about 1,152m above sea level.|||From a tourism perspective, Chư Hreng mountain is very impressive and majestic, embracing Kon Tum city like a southern shield. Every morning, the mountain is often shrouded in mist, creating a mysterious and beautiful scene. It takes only about 30 minutes to reach the summit from the city center by motorbike.|||From the top, you can see the entire Kon Tum city to the north and the rugged mountain ranges of Chư Păh district, Gia Lai province to the south. This is considered one of the highlights for developing Kon Tum's tourism, suitable for trekking, camping, and cloud-watching.|||The Chư Hreng mountain range resembles a wall protecting Kon Tum city, with its rocky outcrops on the summit seemingly gazing at the city day and night, alongside the gentle Đăk Bla river.

title: Pa Sy Waterfall
description: Pa Sy Waterfall is one of the beautiful landscapes gifted by nature to the Kon Tum mountains and forests. The Pa Sy waterfall eco-tourism and cultural site was put into operation for tourism in 2014. With a total area of nearly 25 hectares, this is one of the tourist attractions that still preserves its pristine beauty with little human impact, attracting visitors who love to experience and explore.|||The Pa Sy waterfall tourist area belongs to the Măng Đen eco-tourism area, next to the Kon Tu Rằng village of the Mơ Nâm ethnic group in Măng Cành commune, Kon Plông district, Kon Tum province. Pa Sy Waterfall is located at a height of 1,500m (above sea level) and is a waterfall formed from three large streams in Măng Đen.|||The tourist area is located in the south, about 55km from Kon Tum city. To get to Pa Sy Waterfall, you have to travel along National Highway 24 and it takes over an hour (if traveling by car).|||Along the way to the waterfall, you will pass through and visit the wooden statue garden. With the hands of craftsmen living in Kon Tum, many wooden statues are created vividly and beautifully, carrying many meanings of life, closely associated with the cultural identity of the local people. The wooden statues are shaped like: mother carrying child, family gathering around a jar of rice wine, weaving, going to the field, buffalo stabbing festival, horse sacrifice… These are traditional cultural features of indigenous ethnic groups living in Kon Tum such as Ba Na, Ê Đê…|||Passing through the primeval forest, after visiting the wooden statue garden, we continue to learn about the main character of the tourist area – Pa Sy Waterfall. The waterfall lies at the foot of the valley, appearing vividly and realistically before your eyes.|||Listen to the warm sound of the guide's explanation about Pa Sy Waterfall, admire the white waterfall appearing amidst the green background of the mountains and forests, making your senses full and your feelings overflow. Standing in the majestic scenery gifted by nature, all worries, sadness, and burdens are set aside. Just in this moment, you allow yourself to immerse and dream.|||Inside the 25-hectare Pa Sy tourist area – there are many interesting things. Walking under the shaded trees, admiring the wooden statue garden, shrinking before the majestic waterfall, you can also visit the village of the Mơ Nâm people. Here, you can exchange, visit, and listen to the elderly tell stories; you can exchange gongs with artisans; sleep in traditional stilt houses. On harvest occasions (flowers, vegetables…), visitors will have the opportunity to experience a real day of farming, meaningful and authentic.|||Along with the mentioned highlights, inside Pa Sy there are still many, many interesting things. In the end, you will not regret choosing the waterfall as a destination in your exciting trip. The experiences when coming to Pa Sy Kon Tum will be a mark, a beautiful memory of yours.

title: Suoi Giang
description: Yen Bai is a mountainous province blessed by nature with many scenic spots. One of the places with hidden beauty, suitable for eco-tourism, relaxation, and exploring local culture, has attracted many tourists from afar, and that is Suoi Giang.|||Suoi Giang is a highland commune in Van Chan district, Yen Bai province, located 12km north of the district center. It covers a natural area of 5,922ha and is home to 4 ethnic groups: Mong, Kinh, Dao, and Tay. The Mong people account for 98.5% of the population. Therefore, the traditional folk cultural values of the local Mong people still retain many unique ancient features. This is the difference that makes Suoi Giang have the potential to become a resort and eco-tourism site in the western region and Yen Bai province.|||Suoi Giang is located at an altitude of over 1,371m above sea level, so it has a cool climate all year round. The average temperature is usually 8-9 degrees Celsius lower than in Van Chan district and Nghia Lo town. In Suoi Giang, you can clearly experience four seasons in a day. At night, the weather is cold; in the morning, fog covers the villages and mountain slopes; at noon, the sky is clear and windy; and in the afternoon, golden sunshine spreads smoothly. Therefore, the climate in Suoi Giang can be compared to Sa Pa and Da Lat.|||Suoi Giang not only boasts a cool climate but also features majestic natural scenery, with terraced fields winding along the mountain slopes. From here, you can gaze out at the golden sea of rice in Muong Lo, the second-largest rice granary in Northwest Vietnam, and the dynamic town of Nghia Lo. The area is also home to unique cultural traditions of the Mong, Dao, and Thai people, preserved in Van Chan. Visitors can explore the primeval forest with its enchanting landscapes, pick tea with friendly Mong girls, experience the mystical Level of Initiation ceremony of the Dao, and join in the vibrant spring festivals and warm New Rice celebrations of the Thai people.||||||Head back to Tap Lang primeval forest which remains largely intact with rich vegetation and diverse fauna; or drift along Tap Lang waterfall with its cascading white water. In the distance, the Ma Vy pine forest appears to be floating in white clouds, evoking a dreamy Da Lat.|||When visiting Suoi Giang, tourists are amazed by centuries-old tea forests with a famous fragrance that attracts visitors from near and far. The old Shan tea trees in Suoi Giang have white, sturdy trunks that stand proudly against the elements, becoming a source of pride for the locals.|||Ancient tea trees in Suoi Giang live at an altitude of 1,400m, with the youngest being over a hundred years old and the oldest over 300 years. The young buds still grow green on the rugged, weathered tea tree trunks, which have white, moss-covered surfaces and roots that cling tightly to the steep mountain slope, creating a unique landscape of ancient tea trees. The tea leaves are harvested and dried using the experience and skillful hands of the Mong people, resulting in a white, misty coating on the firm tea buds, known as 'snow tea'. People say this tea has 'five extremes': 'extremely difficult' to plant and harvest; 'extremely clean' due to the climate, environment, and careful maintenance by the growers; 'extremely rare' with a limited yield of only about 200 tons of tea buds per year; 'extremely delicious' with all the high-quality characteristics of good tea, including fragrance, rich flavor, and green water; and 'extremely expensive'... Suoi Giang Shan snow tea is very unique. A cup of green tea contains eighteen of the world's top flavors, with a pure fragrance, a refined elegance suitable for intellectuals and artists, but also a rustic simplicity characteristic of the genuine, friendly, and hospitable people of the mountainous region. These unique tea forests have a special attraction for tourists and are an endless source of inspiration for the country's artists and writers.|||Notably, Suoi Giang is famous for its landscape stones (purple flower pattern, green flower pattern) mainly distributed in the Monkey Mountain range in Giang A, Vang Rock and Suoi Lop village. This type of stone is only found in Suoi Giang, it not only possesses aesthetic beauty but also has high economic value.|||Based on these advantages, Suoi Giang has been planned by Yen Bai Provincial People's Committee as Suoi Giang Eco-Tourism Site, divided into functional areas including hotel construction, single and semi-detached family house construction, scenic lookout construction, internal road construction, square... and infrastructure network of traffic, electricity, water, and telecommunications.|||Every year, Suoi Giang still attracts tens of thousands of domestic and international tourists to visit and travel.|||Suoi Giang - a hidden gem, perfect for eco-tourism, relaxation, and exploring local culture.|||The Suoi Giang tourist area, with its four seasons wrapped in floating white clouds, attracts visitors with its climate, the sweetness of ancient Shan tuyet tea, and the sounds of flutes, whistles, and mouth harps accompanied by the singing of young Mong men and women, full of life, calling out to tourists and investors.|||Giang Stream offers an ideal setting for relaxation.|||The experience of local life and biodiversity will satisfy visitors. Suoi Giang is a charming destination with stunning natural scenery and climate, making it a popular retreat for many tourists.

title: Pu Nhu Waterfall
description: Pu Nhu Waterfall is located in Pu Nhu village, La Pan Tan commune, Mu Cang Chai district, Yen Bai province. The waterfall is about 10km west of the district center. It originates from streams in the upstream forests of Lao Cai and Son La.|||The waterfall has a water column of about 20m, divided into multiple tiers. On sunny days, the water mist creates a white veil effect.|||Pu Nhu Waterfall boasts a poetic and lyrical beauty with a unique climate. Visitors can experience a mix of Da Lat's and Hanoi's autumn atmosphere.|||The waterfall is 1.5km from National Highway 32, but nature has cleverly hidden it from view. The path to the waterfall is easy, crossing a small stream and a cornfield.|||The waterfall is surrounded by tall stone cliffs. There's a large and cool lake called Rong Lake at its base. The area has a maximum temperature of 26ºC, making it ideal for day trips. Pu Nhu Waterfall is an eco-tourism spot for nature lovers.|||Visitors should spend a day exploring the area, enjoying the gentle streams, and experiencing local culture. The waterfall offers a chance to connect with nature and escape the hustle and bustle.

title: Hang Te Cho Waterfall
description: Hang Te Cho waterfall is located in Lang Nhi commune, on the border between Yen Bai and Son La provinces. The waterfall is nestled against the Ta Xua forest, making it a mysterious and thrilling destination for many adventure-seekers.|||The waterfall stands at a height of approximately 50m and is situated at an altitude of around 1800m above sea level. It is located in the remote De Cho hamlet of Lang Nhi commune, Tram Tau district, Yen Bai province. Considered the most majestic and treacherous waterfall in Northwest Vietnam, Hang Te Cho is a stunning and untouched land with its pristine beauty largely untouched by human impact.|||To reach the hamlet of Hang Te Cho and witness the breathtaking waterfall in its natural state, visitors must endure a 3-hour journey and traverse four challenging sections.|||The reward for this arduous journey is the breathtaking natural scenery along the way, including the majestic Northwest mountains, rolling hills, and terraced fields stretching as far as the eye can see, creating a serene atmosphere with the sweet songs of birds.

title: Cồn Đen Tourist Area
description: Cồn Đen is located 3km off the mainland in Thai Do commune, Thai Thuy district, Thai Binh province. It is 15km south of Diêm Điền town and about 40km west of Thái Bình city center. Visitors can easily reach here by public or private transportation.|||Cồn Đen has a relatively flat terrain with a 3km long sand strip, up to 700m wide and 450m narrow. It was formed by the accumulation of alluvial and muddy sand from the Trà Lý river. On hot days, walking along the 3km length of Cồn Đen, visitors will feel cooler watching the waves and green pine trees swaying in the sea breeze.|||Recognized by UNESCO as a world biosphere reserve in 2004, the natural scenery on the island remains pristine. Many people consider it the most beautiful sea island in the North, with a landscape including fine sand beaches and clam farming areas.|||With its long sandy beach, gentle slope, and calm waves, Cồn Đen is perfect for swimming in the summer. It's also ideal for picnics, fishing, and beach volleyball.|||Strolling through the green pine forest along the sand dunes, exploring the primeval vegetation and unique coastal mangrove ecosystem, visitors feel like they're in an open sea space, experiencing the salty flavor of the sea.|||The island's sand dunes, with a 'green wall' of coastal mangroves, host 500 species of aquatic animals and seaweed.|||Cồn Đen Eco-Tourism Area has become a beach resort with a variety of services, including a recreational area, cultural tourism site, shopping center, and a place for picnics and water sports like fishing, surfing, and beach volleyball.|||Besides swimming, exploring the flora and fauna, and picnicking, visitors can take a boat trip and enjoy water sports or visit temples and pagodas in the area.

title: Hoi Weaving Village
description: Hoi Weaving Village is one of the traditional craft villages that has existed for a long time in Hoi Village, Tan Le Commune, Hung Ha District, Thai Binh Province. Even the locals don't know when the weaving craft appeared in the village or who the ancestor of the craft is.|||According to legend, in the 10th-11th century, during the Dinh and Ly dynasties, weaving began in the village and developed strongly during the Later Le dynasty. The person with the greatest merit at that time was Pham Don Le, a talented scholar.|||The technique of making mats in Hoi Village is one of the most sophisticated, with a perfect combination of frames, materials, and skilled weavers. All of these come together to create a traditional product that is hard to match.|||The main materials used to make mats are reeds and jute fibers, which are commonly grown in areas near rivers and streams with rich alluvial soil. Fortunately, Hoi Village is located between two large rivers, the Red River and the Luoc River, making it ideal for growing these plants.|||The plants are harvested and go through many meticulous and careful stages to meet the requirements for making mats.|||Depending on the type of mat to be woven, the reeds and jute fibers are dyed in different colors. To weave a mat that meets the standards, one needs skillful hands, rich experience, and creative techniques.|||Hoi mats come in various types, including embroidered mats, smooth mats, and woven mats. The weavers often create diverse patterns, such as flowers, longevity symbols, and intertwined letters. On average, a day, the villagers can weave 20 mats using machines. The output and income of the villagers have increased significantly. Usually, the weaving season lasts about 8 months, and the rest of the time is spent on farming.|||Visiting Hoi Weaving Village, tourists can experience an interesting and new space, not only from the steps of selecting materials but also witnessing the locals making mats. Each stage, from meticulous and diligent steps to the skilled hands of professional weavers, creates perfect mats. Tourists can also experience the process of making a mat with their own hands.

title: Dak Lak Museum
description: The Dak Lak Museum is located in Buon Ma Thuot city, built in 2008. It has a length of 130m and a width of 65m, with a total area of 9,200m², featuring 2 modern floors that blend with the traditional culture of the Western Highlands.|||With its scale, the Dak Lak Museum is one of the largest and most modern museums in the country. The museum has around 1,000 artifacts and images, organized into 3 main display spaces (biodiversity, ethnic culture, and history). The museum's display work reflects advanced museum studies and modern display methods.|||Notably, the Dak Lak Museum is a pioneer in using the native languages of ethnic minorities in its displays. Besides Vietnamese, French, and English, the museum also uses the Ede language and other ethnic languages to name artifacts. The completion of the Dak Lak Museum is a significant event in the cultural and social life of the province, demonstrating the dynamic policy on ethnic affairs and the commitment to preserving and promoting the cultural values of the Western Highlands and the whole country.

title: Lac Giao Communal House
description: Lac Giao Communal House is the first communal house of Vietnamese people in the Central Highlands. It is located at 67 Phan Boi Chau, Thong Nhat Ward, Buon Ma Thuot City. The house was built in 1928 by the people of Lac Giao Village as a cultural and religious activity center and to worship the village god. The name 'Lac Giao' signifies the solidarity and pledge of the Kinh and Thuong people to fight against colonial oppression.|||The communal house is built in the Mon style with an area of 100m2 in a 700m2 compound, including the main house, Tien Hien house, meeting room, kitchen, and restrooms. The construction cost was contributed by the villagers. The Nguyen Dynasty granted a royal decree to worship the village god Dao Duy Tu.|||After the August Revolution, Lac Giao Communal House was the venue for the revolutionary government to make its debut. The sons and daughters of Lac Giao Village became national defense soldiers or joined the revolutionary government. The house also witnessed the establishment of the Buon Ma Thuot Town Military Committee on March 18, 1975.|||In 1990, the Ministry of Culture and Information recognized Lac Giao Communal House as a National Historical Site.|||Every year, during the spring and autumn festivals, the villagers organize rituals: Spring Festival (on January 17th of the lunar calendar), Autumn Festival (on August 16th of the lunar calendar) to pray for favorable weather and national prosperity. They also hold the Hung Kings' Temple Festival (on March 10th of the lunar calendar) and a memorial service for 100 soldiers and compatriots who died in Buon Ma Thuot on December 1st, 1945 (on October 27th of the lunar calendar).

title: Dray Nur Waterfall
description: It is one of the symbols and pride of Dak Lak people. Dray Nur waterfall possesses majestic beauty with a romantic touch of the Central Highlands forest.
