Who comes once will remember, who meets once will love it…|||Located 25km from Buon Ma Thuot city on National Highway 14, winding roads take you through the mountains to the Buon Kuop hydroelectric dam and to the foot of Dray Nur waterfall.|||The scenery is vast and breathtaking on the way to conquer Dray Nur, with mountains on one side and lush green forests on the other, a truly mesmerizing sight.|||This is one of the rare waterfalls with a pair in Vietnam.|||It is accompanied by the romantic stories of the mountains and forests that have been passed down for thousands of years.|||Dray Nur is the pride of the people of Tay Nguyen. Those who travel far away will remember it, and those who return will love it. The sound of the waterfall pouring day and night like the strength of the great forest is majestic and wild.|||From a height of over 30m, Dray Nur waterfall pours down into the deep river, creating a magical natural scenery.|||Unlike other waterfalls on this plateau, Dray Nur Waterfall is associated with two different legends, with two completely different explanations of its name. According to one explanation, Dray Nur means the main waterfall, or the wife's waterfall, and is linked to a Romeo and Juliet-style love story of the mountains and forests.|||The story goes that a young couple from two different villages fell deeply in love, but their love was forbidden due to conflicts between the villages. Unable to find understanding from the villagers and reconcile the conflicts, one moonlit night, they jumped into the river to be together forever. Angered by the selfishness of the villagers that led to the young couple's tragic decision, a stormy weather erupted, and the river surged, splitting into two branches, separating the paths of the two families.|||Another legend originates from a cave behind the waterfall, believed to be the residence of King Thuy Te. The king's son, Nur, was a handsome prince who loved to travel and admire the scenery. One day, he met two princesses, the daughters of a king from a neighboring land. They were very beautiful but had become poor after their father's early death and were struggling to make ends meet by digging for roots to eat.|||Feeling sorry for their hardship, Nur accompanied them home, performed magic to fill their house with abundant rice, and lived happily with them. After some time, Nur missed his father and wanted to return to the underwater palace to visit him. However, his wife feared that if he left, he might not return for a long time, so she tried every way to keep him by her side. With no other option, Nur transformed into a golden mole, crossed the water screen to visit his father in the cave, while his wife waited outside, waiting and waiting but never seeing Nur return.|||From then on, the locals called this waterfall Dray Nur, which means the golden langur waterfall. Two different legends but the streams of water rushing from the vertical cliff, breaking into drops, splashing into each other, pushing each other of the waterfall are similar in one point, that is like the tears of crying for the people who leave.|||Dray Nur Waterfall is a middle course waterfall in a system of 3 waterfalls: Gia Long - Dray Nur - Dray Sap of the Serepôk river system, formed by the confluence of the Krong No river and the Krong Ana river.|||Around Dray Nur waterfall are small streams flowing gently through rocky outcrops. Occasionally, purple water hyacinths sway in the breeze. Visitors can explore the surroundings and then take a break to have lunch on the large rocks beside the waterfall or stop by the scattered huts along the way.|||Coming to Dray Nur Waterfall, the first feeling is a majestic waterfall with white foam, mist surrounding, making the scenery poetic. The waterfall is over 250m long, over 30m high, and 150m wide, spanning across Dak Lak and Dak Nong provinces.|||But the most appealing part is not admiring the waterfall, but exploring and seeking an adrenaline rush in the nearly 3,000m2 cave behind the waterfall. Watching the powerful water screen, pouring down from above, many people get goosebumps.|||Besides, the waterfall is special because behind the falling water is a large cave. So people can walk through the waterfall from one side to the other without getting wet. Standing inside the cave, looking out at the long wall of water, the dim light shines on the strange-shaped rocks. This is one of the unique experiences that only Dray Nur can offer to tourists exploring the vast and majestic Tay Nguyen, a place that once visited is remembered, and once encountered is cherished.

title: Thuy Tien Waterfall
description: Located in Giang Tien village, Ea Puk commune, Krong Nang district, about 56 km east of Buon Ma Thuot city center.|||Originating from streams deep in the forest, it flows out with 4 main waterfalls, each with its own unique beauty.|||Thuy Tien seems like a fairy hiding in the mountains and forests with gentle waterfalls winding through the vast wilderness.|||Come to Thac Thuy Tien and let your spirit wander to the sound of the stream. You will admire a mystical natural scenery with towering cliffs rising to the sky and a variety of flowers, butterflies, birds, and animals.|||This place is not only known for its picturesque waterfall but also associated with an ancient folk tale of the Ede people.|||The story goes that a long time ago, in an Ede village, there lived a young man named Dam Ji, who had an extraordinary appearance and a strong physique.|||He was skilled at hunting, and his sword was feared by all animals, but he had a hot temper and was very violent.|||If anyone disagreed with him, he would immediately punish them.|||Despite being very talented, Dam Ji was not respected by the people.|||On the contrary, his younger brother was kind and gentle, so he was loved and cherished by everyone.|||One day, the two brothers went into the forest to hunt, but they had not caught any animals and were thirsty.|||There was no water to drink in the forest.|||In desperation, Dam Ji, still holding his sword, got angry and swung it down to the ground.|||The earth shook, and a stream appeared before him.|||He was overjoyed and swung his sword six more times.|||Then, not far from the stream, rocks fell, and many animals panicked.|||Dam Ji saw another stream appear.|||From then on, in the forest where the young man often hunted, there were two streams: the western stream was named Ea Dah, and the eastern stream was named Ea Puk.|||However, these two streams have different characters, just like the Dam Ji brothers. The Ea Dah stream in the west has a strong and fierce character like the older brother. People in the region are afraid of its name. When coming here to catch fish or fetch water, they must be very careful not to be swept away by the stream. Children in the area often get swept away while bathing. If someone praises the stream for having a lot of fish, they will catch some. But if they say it has little or no fish, the stream will not yield any fish, and they will catch nothing even if they fish all day. When the stream gets angry, it will flood and sweep people away.|||On the other hand, the Ea Pu stream in the east is very gentle and harmless. Anyone who comes here to fish will leave with a basket full of fish. Therefore, people call Ea Pu stream the gentle stream. This stream is like the younger brother, kind, generous, and often helps others, unlike the fierce Ea Dah stream.|||Besides, Thuy Tien waterfall is also associated with a beautiful love story between a Vietnamese soldier and a beautiful E De ethnic girl. They bravely fought against the enemy until their last breath to protect their village and revolutionary base, contributing to the victory of the national resistance war against America.|||On March 3, 2009, the Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism decided to rank Thuy Tien waterfall as a national scenic site.

title: Yang Prong Tower
description: This is the only tower in the Central Highlands built in the late 13th century to worship Shiva in the form of Mulkhalinga, praying for prosperity and happiness. The tower's architecture is a harmonious blend of ancient Cham culture and Indian art influences.|||The tower is a brick structure built with red bricks, widening and tapering upwards like a flower bud. It stands 9m high, with a base 0.08m above the ground. The exterior walls feature fake windows for decoration. The tower has a square base, each side measuring 5m, with a single entrance facing east. The foundation consists of large stones of varying sizes, polished smooth. As you ascend, the tower's interior narrows, covered with a layer of plaster.|||Yang Prong is situated among ancient trees in a sparse forest along the Ea H'leo river, which flows with water all year round. The forest is nourished by the Ea Nao stream, providing a refreshing source of water. The tower is surrounded by lush greenery, creating a serene and picturesque natural setting.|||Every year, during festivals and holidays, local ethnic groups come to make offerings and pray for good fortune.|||Yang Prong Tower holds significant archaeological, historical, and cultural value. On August 3, 1991, it was ranked as a National Architectural Monument.

title: 722 Hill Relic
description: The 722 hill - Dak Sak was a US - Ngụy special forces base established in 1965. This was where fierce battles took place between the main force and local military forces attacking and destroying the special forces base on August 22 and 23, 1968. The 722 hill is 722m above sea level in Tho Hoang 4 village, Dak Sak commune, Dak Mil district.|||In May 1965, the US - Ngụy and Saigon authorities built the 722 hill military base (also known as Duc Lap special forces camp) about 10 km east of Duc Lap district center to increase forces and military activities.|||To counter the enemy's plot, in 1968 the Politburo and the Western Highlands battlefront command decided to destroy the enemy at Duc Lap district military zone with the 722 hill - Dak Sak as the core, one of the key enemy strongholds in the Western Highlands. From 1968 to 1975, our main forces coordinated with local military and people to organize many attacks on this stronghold, wearing down the enemy's forces and destroying their fortified positions that were threatening the Ho Chi Minh trail in South Western Highlands.|||After 1968, through many heavy defeats in South Western Highlands, the enemy retreated to fortified strongholds, including 722 hill - Dak Sak. From here, they continued to implement forced relocation policies. In response, Quang Duc provincial party committee directed Dak Mil district party committee to overcome difficulties and implement 'three attachments' (cadres attached to people, people attached to land, and militia attached to enemy) to continue fighting against the enemy and building rear bases. By 1975, Dak Sak and Duc Lap strongholds were completely eliminated.|||After the liberation day, to commemorate the great sacrifice of our cadres and soldiers at 722 hill - Dak Sak, Dak Nong province built a memorial for heroes and martyrs. On October 24, 2012, 722 hill - Dak Sak relic was recognized as a national historical site by the Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism.|||This historical relic has great significance in educating young generations about tradition and political awareness, and honoring the great merit of our predecessors. It is one of the historical milestones in the struggle for national liberation of Dak Nong province and Vietnam.|||Currently, the 722 hill - Dak Sak historical relic covers nearly 4 hectares, with some remaining artifacts and military equipment. In 2010, the State invested in building a memorial stele, a green area and a fence with a total construction area of 2485m2. Annually, the relic welcomes over 1,000 visitors.

title: Tay Ho
description: Located in the heart of Dak Mil town (former Duc Lap district), Tay Ho is like a giant mirror, deep and mysterious, with clear and blue water. This semi-natural lake was created by French plantation owners 45-50 years ago to supply water for coffee plantations. In 1982, Dak Mil district invested in upgrading and expanding the lake to its current appearance.|||Tay Ho has a surface area of 108 hectares, a perimeter of over 10km, and a maximum depth of 15-17m. Since it has no inflow from rivers or streams, but only groundwater and rainwater accumulation, the lake's water remains clear, clean, and never dries up.|||To the east of the lake lies the town center of Dak Mil, while to the south and southwest are vast coffee and cocoa forests. In the lake, there is a romantic 120-hectare peninsula. From a satellite view, Tay Ho resembles an open hand supporting the lush coffee forests.|||Today, Tay Ho is invested with a park and fountain system around its shores, a stone dike, a walking path, and trees planted for shade. Surrounding the lake are restaurants, cafes, and beautiful villas in French, Thai, or Gothic architectural styles, giving it a resemblance to Da Lat's Xuan Huong Lake.|||Located 67km northeast of Gia Nghia town and 60km southwest of Buon Ma Thuot city, right on National Highway 14, Tay Ho is an ideal location for investing in resorts, hotels, entertainment, and sports complexes. It is also close to several scenic spots and the border with Cambodia.|||Stopping or staying by the lake, visitors can enjoy the vast sky, fragrant coffee flowers, and serene lake atmosphere. They can also explore the Dak Mil prison historical site, meet the friendly locals, visit cute gardens hidden among lush trees, and taste specialty coffee and fruits of Dak Mil.

title: Dak Mil Historical Prison
description: Located in village 9, Dak Lao commune, Dak Mil district, about 1km from Dak Mil town center. This was a harsh prison for hundreds of Vietnamese patriotic fighters during the 1940-1943 resistance against France. Many prisoners escaped and became key leaders: Ybih Aleo - Vice Chairman of the National Liberation Front of South Vietnam, Major General Le Nam Thang - Commander of Hanoi Capital Military Zone, Deputy Minister of National Defense; Nguyen Tao - Minister of Forestry (now Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development); Lieutenant General Tran Sam, Lieutenant General Tran Van Quang, etc.|||The Dak Mil prison had 9 rooms, wooden walls, thatched roof, surrounded by barbed wire, with 2 wooden floor rows for prisoners to sleep, shackles and handcuffs, isolated from the outside. Over time, only the foundations remained. With efforts from the Culture, Sports and Tourism Department, and care from authorities and former political prisoners, on March 17, 2005, the Dak Mil prison was recognized as a national historical site by the Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism. On December 30, 2010, a memorial site was inaugurated on a 2000m2 area. Visitors can explore exhibits, memorial stones, and a recreation of scenes from the prison.

title: Băng Mo Volcano
description: Located on the tourist route 'Symphony of New Breezes', Băng Mo Volcano is a geological experience point to explore the imprints of Earth's geological history on the M'nong plateau.|||Băng Mo Volcano (previously known as Ea T'Linh Volcano) is situated in Ea T'Linh town, Cu Jut district. It's a young volcano, typical of central eruptions, dating back 200,000 to 600,000 years.|||The Băng Mo crater is well-preserved with a relatively round and clear shape; about 242m in diameter, 40m high, 15o slope and at an altitude of 407m above sea level. Around the area, you can find scattered lava, ash, rocks and volcanic bombs.|||From the foot of the volcano, it takes about 30 minutes to climb up to the crater. The gentle slope makes it suitable for tourists of all ages. From the viewpoint on the peak, you can gaze out and see the tranquil and fertile Ea T'Linh town. Băng Mo Volcano promises to be an interesting and new destination for visitors.

title: Granite Waterfall
description: While Dak Nong province is mainly covered in sedimentary soil and rocks formed in an oceanic environment and basalt soil and rocks formed during volcanic activity, Ta Dung National Park boasts granite intrusive rocks. This shows a very diverse and complex geological process of the UNESCO Global Geopark Dak Nong.|||Granite is a light-colored rock originating from magma with grains large enough to be seen with the naked eye. This rock is formed from the slow crystallization of magma under the Earth's surface. Granite is primarily composed of quartz and feldspar with a small amount of mica, silicate minerals, and other minerals.|||Few people know that here, there is a very special and unique waterfall with a stream flowing over granite rocks, scientifically named Granite Waterfall. Meanwhile, locals call this waterfall "Truot" due to the slippery and shiny surface of the rocks in the waterfall. There are very few UNESCO Global Geoparks worldwide that have a similar granite waterfall.|||The Granite Waterfall is hidden in the old forest in Dak Som commune, Dak Glong district. From National Highway 28, to get to the waterfall, visitors need to walk about 1 km following the signposts of the UNESCO Global Geopark Dak Nong. Along this walking route, tourists can enjoy the cool and fresh air and admire the pristine and beautiful natural scenery along the way. The district has also invested in building an observation pavilion for tourists to observe the picturesque beauty of the Granite Waterfall area.|||Although it is a small waterfall, it is a sacred site where local people conduct community activities, such as ceremonies to worship spirits, which have been practiced by the Ma ethnic group for generations to pray for favorable weather and a good harvest.|||As a tourist destination on the "Echoes from the Earth" route, the poetic granite waterfall standing out against the majestic natural scenery of Ta Dung mountains and forests is definitely an attractive destination for adventure-seekers.

title: Tra On Floating Market
description: To experience the unique culture of Vĩnh Long residents, visit Tra On Floating Market. Located 250m from Tra On riverbank, the market stretches over 300m downstream of the Hậu River and operates according to the tides, so it's busier during high tide.|||Tra On Floating Market serves as a wholesale market distributing agricultural products to many smaller markets in the province. Therefore, the market is always bustling with boats and ships, regardless of the time of day you visit.|||Among the numerous fruit boats in various colors, there are also decorative flower boats with vibrant colors, creating romantic moments amidst the lively trading atmosphere.

title: Ancient Long An Pagoda
description: The ancient Long An Pagoda was built in the late 19th century, constructed by the Lam family who donated 30 plots of land for the pagoda and its fields. For centuries, this pagoda has been a stop for renowned monks in Southern Vietnam, such as Khanh Anh, Hue Quang, Khanh Hoa, and Phap Hai, who established the Lien Doan Hoc Xa to promote Buddhism and propagate the national language.|||Monks, Buddhists, and visitors to the ancient Long An Pagoda feel as though they have entered a peaceful, happy, and serene realm, with the chanting of sutras helping people escape worldly worries.

title: Hoang Hao Eco-Tourism Area
description: For those who want to return to a peaceful and serene countryside setting, breathe fresh air, and enjoy traditional folk dishes, Hoang Hao Eco-Tourism Area is an ideal choice.|||Located on National Highway 57, 2 km from Dinh Khao Ferry, Hoang Hao Ecological Tourist Area is in Thanh Duc Commune, Long Ho District, Vinh Long Province. Hoang Hao is a brand new and extremely beautiful eco-tourism site in Vinh Long. It boasts not only a cool and green landscape but also a very fresh atmosphere.|||Although it only started operating in 2019, it quickly became an ideal place for entertainment, leisure and relaxation for people in Vinh Long and tourists coming to the Mekong Delta region.|||The entire grounds of Hoang Hao are surrounded by a vast lush forest. When viewed from above, it feels like a small oasis deep in the forest. Coming to Hoang Hao, you will fully experience the peaceful and serene atmosphere of the Mekong Delta.|||The space at Hoang Hao tourist site is designed with a rustic Mekong Delta garden feel, featuring small streams that flow like mini rivers throughout the site. The two banks are connected by a unique and interesting monkey bridge.||||||With a total construction area of nearly 68ha, Hoang Hao Vinh Long eco-tourism area offers a variety of attractive entertainment services, suitable for both adults and children.|||At Hoang Hao eco-tourism site, visitors can immerse themselves in a fresh natural landscape and experience rustic services typical of a countryside garden, such as fishing, canoeing, pond-draining to catch fish, duck and frog catching... For those who like adventure, they can try biking over a wooden bridge, crossing a monkey bridge or participating in many other games at a complex playground.|||Notably, two popular games that many tourists love at the tourist village are Zorbing ball - a game that makes the ball roll from a hill with a moderate slope, and colorful water ball rolling game.|||Moreover, with its large area and spacious landscape, Hoang Hao eco-tourism site is also an ideal and convenient location for team building, camping, picnics, outdoor activities, and life skill experiences.|||At Hoang Hao, there is a mini house area to serve the overnight needs of tourists. The mini houses are covered with tile roofs or metal roofs, and below are vibrant colorful walls.|||Next to it, in front of the mini house row, is a very large lotus pond. The lotus plants cover the entire surface of the lake. During the lotus blooming season, this place will be covered with a soft pink color and a romantic fragrance.|||After a long day of participating in sports activities at Hoang Hao, you can choose a mini house within the resort to rest. Each morning, you will breathe in the fresh air, watch the lotus flowers bloom, and listen to the distant birdsong. It's a life in harmony with nature that's hard to imagine.|||When visiting Hoang Hao tourist area, dont forget to stop by the super spacious restaurant located within the Hoang Hao ecological tourist area to try some signature dishes from the Mekong Delta.|||The space here is very airy and harmoniously designed with nature. You can try signature dishes such as grilled chicken rice, banh xeo, Nam Bo fish hotpot, fried crocodile fish, pickled lotus root, lotus root cake, etc. All of them have a riverine flavor that is incredibly delicious and memorable even after just one try.|||Especially, adventure-seekers will have thrilling and refreshing moments watching schools of snakehead fish jumping out of the water to catch prey. You can also make traditional Southern Vietnamese cakes like banh xeo, banh khot, or banh la.

title: Vinh Sang Tourist Area
description: If you're looking for a collective entertainment spot in Vinh Long, many people would point you to Vinh Sang eco-tourism area. Vinh Sang farm is triangular in shape with a strategic location, one side along the Co Chien river, facing Vinh Long city.|||This tourism area is perhaps the only place where you can admire many rare animals such as bears, goats, pelicans, pythons, monitor lizards, deer, wild boars, red-faced monkeys, monkeys, peacocks, and guinea fowl. Especially at Vinh Sang, the 200m2 crocodile farm is a paradise for those who love adventure.|||Despite its unique features, the tourism area still offers a cozy and intimate atmosphere like a real Nam Bo garden. The spacious and airy environment is perfect for lively activities: grass sliding, shooting games, cockfighting, ball tossing, blindfolded ostrich racing, and fishing with prizes. For solo travelers who prefer a quiet experience, they can enjoy a peaceful atmosphere in the fishing huts.|||The entrance fee to Vinh Sang tourism area is very reasonable: 50,000 VND/adult and 35,000 VND/child (from 5 to 11 years old or height < 1.2m). If you buy a ticket on Thursday, you will get free admission to: crocodile fishing, ostrich riding, and duck riding.

title: House of Ancient Ecology
description: The House of Ancient Ecology is a nostalgic tourist destination in Vinh Long. It's called an ecological site because, besides the ancient house that has been tinted with time, it's surrounded by ornamental plants and fruit trees, creating a harmonious green atmosphere.|||Even those unfamiliar with architecture can't help but be impressed by the intricate carvings of birds, flowers, and leaves. The entire ancient house is made of precious wood and has a long history that surpasses the total age of a group of tourists.

title: Bung Binh Thien
description: Bung Binh Thien is a clear blue lake with picturesque scenery in An Giang, perfect for camping, picnics, and fishing.|||When visiting Bung Binh Thien, you can take a boat around the lake, along with fishing shacks and food stalls if you want to stop and rest.|||This pristine tourist spot in An Giang is ideal for couples on dates.

title: Thua Duc Binh Dai Beach
description: One of the unexplored attractions in Ben Tre is Thua Duc Beach in Binh Dai. This place still retains its pristine beauty with fine white sand and lush green trees swaying gently in the wind. Visitors are sure to have wonderful and interesting experiences here.|||Thua Duc Beach is known for its peaceful and serene atmosphere, with untouched natural beauty. The beach is lined with shady trees, and the sound of waves crashing against the shore and the wind rustling through the trees creates a soothing melody that is hard to resist.|||Thua Duc Beach is a natural beach located in Binh Dai district, Ben Tre province. It stretches for about 8km and is approximately 60km from Ben Tre city. The beach has a fresh and cool climate, attracting many tourists every year.|||Thua Duc Beach boasts a pristine and attractive beauty. The sea water has gentle waves, and the shore is lined with fine sand. The sounds of the wind, trees, and waves blend together in a symphony of sounds. The melody is enchanting and captivating, drawing visitors in.|||The beach has a cool and refreshing climate, making it ideal for sightseeing and relaxation. Over 12,000 tourists visit here every year, and Ben Tre province is striving to develop Thua Duc Beach into a prominent tourist destination, aiming to attract 50,000-70,000 visitors annually.|||The beach is not only beautiful and attractive but also a fertile region for various seafood such as clams, mussels, snails, and crabs. It's also famous for its delicious Banh Xeo. Visitors can truly experience the flavor of seafood and the rich taste of this local specialty.|||The unique flavor of the local cuisine is a special feature that makes Thua Duc Beach leave a lasting impression on visitors. This beautiful and romantic beach offers a range of activities, including sightseeing, swimming, relaxation, and indulging in the local culinary delights.|||Thua Duc Beach in Binh Dai promises to provide visitors with the most interesting experiences. With ongoing investment and development, it's sure to become a fantastic destination for tourists from near and far.

title: Lan Vuong Tourist Area
description: Located about 5km from Ben Tre city center, Lan Vuong tourist area is an ideal resort and entertainment spot for many people. Here, visitors can immerse themselves in a cool natural space and experience exciting games like: swinging bridge, rope climbing, monkey bridge biking,...|||In addition to interesting games, Lan Vuong tourist area also offers various tourism services such as restaurants, farmstay, camping,... If you are looking for a Ben Tre tourist spot to travel with family and friends, Lan Vuong tourist area is a great choice.

title: Khu du lịch Làng bè
description: The road to Khu du lịch Làng Bè is quite simple. Starting from Saigon, just cross Rach Mieu bridge, turn left about 700m to Ca Chuoi bridge. Crossing this bridge brings you to this famous eco-tourism site.|||Visitors to Làng Bè eco-tourism site will be excited and interested in the natural scenery of the Mekong region. With its unique organization and service, this site is a memorable Western tourism destination.|||The interesting part is that when you come here, you will wear bà ba dresses. Together, you will participate in folk games like monkey bridge, coconut tree climbing, balancing bike on the bridge, fishing in the pond, rope crossing, …|||In addition, if you want, you can experience blowing clay balls. Try cooking garden dishes with your friends. What a fun and exciting experience!|||When visiting Làng Bè eco-tourism site, you will be impressed by the beautiful and poetic natural scenery. A highlight of this place is the traditional villages associated with local people's professions. The space of Làng Bè is peaceful and quiet, making anyone who visits feel calm and relaxed.|||Try sitting on a small boat, drifting through winding rivers. Or let your soul merge with the rivers and waterways of the Mekong Delta, enjoying delicious fresh fruits. These are moments you won't want to forget.

title: Phu Da Islet
description: Phu Da Islet is about 100km from Ho Chi Minh City, making it a perfect weekend getaway for city dwellers. To get there by motorbike, take the following route: from Ho Chi Minh City, head towards National Route 1A to the Mekong Delta. When crossing My Thuan Bridge, turn onto National Route 53, then continue on Pham Hung Road to An Binh Ferry. From there, take a boat to Phu Da Islet.|||Phu Da Islet is an eco-tourism spot with a romantic and peaceful natural landscape, featuring Phu Da Temple for spiritual worship. Don't miss trying the islet's specialty - Phu Da rice snail.|||Rice snails are sold in all markets on the islet|||According to Ba Ngói, a local, rice snails are fattest and tastiest in May of the lunar calendar. They are large and have a sweet, rich flavor. After being caught, snails are processed into dishes like sautéed snails with lemongrass and chili, boiled snails, or used in salads, and as a filling for bánh xèo. Rice snails are sold in all markets on the islet, and it's best to try them there for cheap.|||After enjoying the specialty, continue exploring the islet with activities like boat rides, fishing, and visiting fruit orchards. Visit Phu Da Temple and the famous Ba Chua Xu Temple, known for granting wishes.|||Take a boat trip to explore the islet|||In Ben Tre, besides Phu Da Islet, you can also visit Phung Islet, Tien Ben Tre Islet, or Thoi Son Islet to discover the unique beauty of the Mekong Delta.

title: Tua Hai Historical and Cultural Victory Site
description: Located in Tua Hai hamlet, Dong Khoi commune, Chau Thanh district, Tay Ninh province, on 22B road axis, 7km northwest of Tay Ninh city.|||Tua Hai was the name of a French-era watchtower, later expanded by the US and South Vietnamese into a major strategic military base. In 1960, Tua Hai served as a reserve arsenal for three tactical zones of the South Vietnamese army. The base housed the 32nd Battalion of the 13th South Vietnamese Division, a special forces training school, a standing battalion, and two scout companies embedded in the local population.|||On the night of January 25-26, 1960, local forces and armed units from the Mien secretly approached and launched a surprise attack on the enemy's regimental headquarters at Tua Hai. This battle marked the beginning of the armed Dong Khoi uprising across South Vietnam.|||The site was recognized as a historical relic by the Ministry of Culture and Information (now the Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism) through Decision No. 937/QD-BT on September 23, 1993.|||

title: Long Dien Son Tourist Area
description: Located about 5km from Tay Ninh city center and 3km from Nui Ba Tourist Area, Long Dien Son Tourist Area is a must-visit destination when visiting Tay Ninh. It stands out with a vast, airy space and scenic landscapes, along with a water park offering many exciting games for relaxation with friends and family.|||Long Dien Son Water Park covers an area of over 2 hectares and is currently the largest and only water park in Tay Ninh province. Here, you can experience thrilling games like water slides, artificial wave pools, or areas for kids, making it an ideal spot for family outings.

title: Ma Thien Lanh Tourist Area
description: Located in Thanh Tan commune, Tay Ninh town, Ma Thien Lanh is formed by 3 mountains: Ba Den Mountain, Heo Mountain and Phung Mountain.|||This place has hundreds of hectares of primeval forest and streams flowing with a mysterious, wild and romantic atmosphere.|||To get here, you will travel on a 3km asphalt road from provincial road 785 to Phung Mountain and then to Ma Thien Lanh. However, as its name suggests, the road to this place is quite steep and treacherous. Therefore, before going, you should prepare well in terms of both material and mental to safely reach Ma Thien Lanh.|||After overcoming the difficult journey, Ma Thien Lanh will be worth your effort as you immerse yourself in the pristine, beautiful and peaceful scenery of this place, which has not been much impacted by human hands.

title: Sala Entertainment Complex
description: Located in a prime spot in the city center, right on a bustling boulevard, you'll get lost in the excitement. Sala is a complex that includes an entertainment area, a culinary area, and accommodations. It's perfect for a vacation or gathering with friends, colleagues, or family.|||The Sala amusement park is super large, with full services to keep you entertained all day. The modern, youthful design is also elegant and traditional, with delicate lines, A-shaped roofs, and bright, harmonious colors.

title: Visit the Southern Central Committee Base
description: The historical site of the Southern Central Committee Base is located in the north of Tay Ninh province, near the Vietnam - Cambodia border, about 60km from Tay Ninh town.|||The relic site is also known by other names, such as: R (code name of the Southern Central Committee); Chiec Riec Base (named after the forest where the base was located); Pham Hung Base (comrade Pham Hung once held the position of Secretary of the Central Committee for a long time); Bac Tay Ninh Base. During the two resistance wars against France and America, the Eastern South region in general and Tay Ninh in particular was a strategically important area. The Bac Tay Ninh base was the location of the revolutionary headquarters of Southern Vietnam for a long time and directly guided and led the Southern revolution until the day of complete liberation.|||The historical site of Central Office for South Vietnam consists of three sub-zones: Central Office for South Vietnam, Base of the National Front for the Liberation of South Vietnam, and Base of the Provisional Revolutionary Government of the Republic of South Vietnam.|||1. Central Base of the Southern Regional Committee|||In March 1951, at its first central conference (term II), the Party decided to establish the Central Southern Bureau with comrade Le Duan as Secretary and comrade Le Duc Tho as Deputy Secretary. Later on, comrade Le Duc Tho was assigned as Secretary and comrade Pham Hung as Deputy Secretary. On September 6, 1954, the Politburo decided to dissolve the Central Southern Bureau and re-establish the Southern Provincial Party Committee and district committees.|||On January 23, 1961, the 3rd Conference of the Party Central Committee (term III) decided to re-establish the Central Office for South Vietnam. At the beginning of 1965, the Central Office was assigned to lead Nam Bo and the southernmost part of Trung Bo. Comrade Nguyen Van Linh, Secretary of the Nam Bo Party Committee, took on the important responsibility of Secretary of the Central Office.|||From 1967 to 1975, Comrade Pham Hung served as Secretary; Comrades Nguyen Van Linh, Phan Van Dang and Hoang Van Thai served as Deputy Secretaries of the Central Committee.|||The base was built in the Chang Riec and Rum Duon forest, a primeval forest with multiple layers of trees. The system of houses and offices in the base are elevated, with all columns, beams and supports made of wood and roofs covered with trung quan leaves. The bunkers are usually built next to the houses and offices, sunk into the ground.|||This relic is currently planned into two main areas:|||Historic site: restored buildings include the permanent office, large and small meeting halls, guard house, administrative office, Hoang Cam kitchen, residences and workplaces of Nguyen Van Linh, Nguyen Chi Thanh, Vo Van Kiet, Pham Hung..., a system of traffic moats, combat bunkers and frog hole bunkers, spread throughout the area.|||The memorial area consists of a reception house, an exhibition house, and a memorial area for heroes and martyrs. The total construction area of this zone is 750m2.|||2. Headquarters of the National Front for the Liberation of South Vietnam|||On December 20, 1960, in Trang Chieng, Tan Lap commune, Chau Thanh district (now Tan Bien district, Tay Ninh province), the National Front for the Liberation of South Vietnam was established and a provisional Central Committee was formed. The National Front for the Liberation of South Vietnam went through the following congresses:|||The First Congress of Delegates of the National Front for the Liberation of South Vietnam (February 16 - March 3, 1962), the second congress (November 11 - 18, 1964).|||From August 15 to 20, 1967, at the base in North Tay Ninh, the extraordinary congress of the Front approved the political platform as the basis for the establishment of the Provisional Revolutionary Government of the Republic of South Vietnam. This was the third and final congress.|||This relic site is located along the Suoi Cho stream, consisting of 3 different functional areas:|||The original relic site includes: guard house, communication house, guest house, houses of comrades Nguyen Huu Tho, Phung Van Cung, Vo Chi Cong, Hoang Cam kitchen, meeting hall and some sections of traffic moat, shelter tunnels…|||The memorial area consists of: a stele house, a reception house, and an exhibition house.|||Conservation area: associated with natural landscapes.|||Based on the Provisional Revolutionary Government of the Republic of South Vietnam|||From June 6 to 8, 1969, in Ta Not forest, Chau Thanh district (now Tan Bien district, Tay Ninh province), the Provisional Revolutionary Government of the Republic of South Vietnam was established.|||Architect Huynh Tan Phat was the Chairman of the Provisional Revolutionary Government of the Republic of South Vietnam, while lawyer Nguyen Huu Tho was the Chairman of the Advisory Council.|||The Provisional Revolutionary Government of the Republic of South Vietnam base covers an area of 60ha and is divided into three areas:|||The original relic area includes: office house, dining house, Hoang Cam kitchen, bomb shelter, and communication trench.|||The conservation area includes: a reception house, an exhibition house, a living room, a working house, and a stele house.|||A conservation area: associated with natural landscapes.|||The historical relic site of the Central Office for South Vietnam has special value. Over 15 years (1961 - 1975), the Central Office concretized many guidelines and policies of the Party and President Ho Chi Minh into revolutionary practices in South Vietnam. This led to the issuance of many directives and resolutions that shaped the strategic direction of the revolution in South Vietnam.|||The history has proven that the decision to establish the Central Office for South Vietnam was a correct and creative initiative of our Party. The Central Office has provided valuable lessons on building a base area and revolutionary movement closely connected with the people.|||These lessons are particularly important for building the Party.|||The Central Southern Region Base became the capital of the Southern revolution, a place storing memories and historical evidence of the extremely difficult and sacrificial revolutionary activities of many high-ranking Party leaders and officials during the sacred national anti-American war in Southern Vietnam, especially in the Mekong Delta battlefield. This relic not only holds special value in traditional education but also is an attractive destination for domestic and international tourists, particularly for young Vietnamese generations.|||With its special values, on May 10, 2012, the Prime Minister decided to rank the Historical Site of the Southern Central Committee's Base as a Special National Historic Site (Decision No. 548/QD-TTG).

title: Chop Mat Tower
description: Chop Mat Tower is a historical and cultural relic recognized by the Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism. It is one of the three remaining ancient towers in the South of Vietnam. The tower is built entirely of brick and slate stone with a pointed top, estimated to be 10m high.|||The bricks are stacked on top of each other, impressively fitting together with hardly any gaps. The main wall faces East, while the other three walls face West, South, and North. This is a testament to the sophistication and skill of the ancient Oc Eo people.|||Located on a high mound in the middle of a field, the tower resembles a pen rising high into the air. This is a very worthwhile tourist destination to explore.

title: Nha Mat Tourist Area
description: Nha Mat Tourist Area is the most famous tourist spot in Bac Lieu. With a large artificial beach, many exciting games such as sky roller coaster, electric car collision, 6D cinema, massage rooms..., it promises to be a destination to dispel the sweltering heat for tourists this summer.

title: Tan Lap Floating Village
description: Tan Lap Floating Village is located deep in the heart of Dong Thap Muoi, a region mainly covered with flooded forests and ecosystems characteristic of Southeast Asia. The presence of trams, lotus, water lilies, and floating plants, along with a rich variety of birds and fish, creates a unique color palette for this area. The Long An land seems to pamper its people with such simple and gentle scenery.|||Tan Lap Floating Village is an ecotourism site situated in Tan Lap commune, Moc Hoa district, Long An province. The village is intertwined with Rach Rung canal and the Western Vam Co River.|||Inside Tan Lap Floating Village, there are not only tram forests and diverse flora and fauna but also a nature reserve, a botanical garden, a wildlife sanctuary, a boat dock, etc. This is why spending a day touring Tan Lap Floating Village doesn't feel boring; instead, it offers a lot to explore.|||As an ecotourism site in a flooded forest, surrounded by lush green tram forests stretching far and wide, you can visit at any time of the year. However, based on the experience of traveling to Tan Lap Floating Village, if you want to capture breathtaking photos, visit during the right season. If you visit during the off-season, it might not be as interesting. People often say that to travel to Tan Lap Floating Village, you should go during the flooding season because that's when the animals and plants develop most vigorously. You'll have the chance to admire a miniaturized version of the Mekong Delta in Long An, which is Tan Lap Floating Village. The flooding season in the Mekong Delta takes place from August to November of the lunar calendar, which coincides with the rainy season in the Central provinces.|||During the flooding season, many bird species return here to build nests and find food, mainly fish. In this season, Tan Lap also offers an abundance of typical riverine delicacies. Lotus and water lilies bloom extensively, making it perfect for photography.|||Tan Lap Floating Village is ideal for those who love nature, animals, and seek tranquility. To enter the site, you need to buy a ticket for 60,000 VND/person, and if you want to explore further, it's 30,000 VND/person. The boat drivers also act as guides, taking you on a tour and providing insights into the vast marshland with its green carpet-like vegetation. If you visit during the lotus blooming season in October and November, the boat will navigate through the beautiful lotus pond, allowing you to live your best moments.|||Tan Lap Floating Village remains a relatively untouched ecotourism site, not as heavily invested in as other tourist spots, so the culinary options are not diverse. However, they serve some rustic dishes typical of rural riverine areas. You can bring your own food to enjoy collectively to save costs. Nonetheless, trying the local cuisine while here is recommended.|||

title: Endless Field Tourist Site
description: This tourist area is a biodiversity conservation area, home to many plant species with precious genes and rare medicinal herbs.|||It was also the backdrop for the famous movie 'Endless Fields'.|||After the film's resounding success, it became a popular tourist destination in Long An province.

title: The Royal Betel Nut Tree Road in Tan Tru
description: About 40km south of Ho Chi Minh City, there's a road affectionately known as the "happiness road". For years, the royal betel nut tree road in Tan Tru, Long An has been an ideal check-in spot for many tourists on weekends.|||A nearly 30-year-old symbol|||Tan Tru district is nestled between the Dong Vam Co and Tay Vam Co rivers, with fertile soil and lush trees. Visitors to Tan Tru town will surely know about the royal betel nut tree road, a local symbol. The road is a source of pride for the locals, with over 2km of straight, green betel nut trees, alongside lush rice fields and dragon fruit gardens.|||The concrete road with two rows of majestic betel nut trees offers a serene experience, living up to its name, "happiness road".|||Tan Tru town in Long An is not only known for its socialized rural traffic but also for its beautiful roads planted with flowers and trees. The rural concrete roads are surrounded by rice fields and adorned with flowers and green trees.|||The Royal Betel Nut Tree road near the town's secondary school is a familiar sight for those who have visited Tan Tru, Long An. Stretching nearly 1km with over 300 large betel nut trees, the road is a source of pride for locals.|||Check-in and capture memorable moments|||The road is a popular spot for tourists to take photos and for couples to shoot their wedding pictures. Visitors can experience unforgettable moments at any time of day. In the morning, the misty atmosphere creates a romantic ambiance, while in the afternoon, the road is filled with students on their way home from school.

title: Bac Lieu Bird Garden
description: If you're planning a trip to the Mekong Delta, don't miss the Bac Lieu Bird Garden, a natural reserve that offers a refreshing escape into the wild.|||The garden is a remnant of the coastal mangrove forest, which has gradually moved away from the East Vietnam Sea due to natural sedimentation. Spanning 385 hectares, including 19 hectares of primeval forest, it's home to around 46 bird species, including the giant ibis and the small egret, listed in the Red Book. The garden also hosts 150 animal species, with 58 fish, 7 amphibians, 10 mammals, 8 reptiles, and numerous other creatures, along with 109 plant species from 90 genera of 46 families, forming a rich and diverse ecosystem.|||Visiting at sunset, you'll witness a spectacular sight as birds return to their nests. They fly in an orderly manner, separated by species and plumage. Some fly in a V-formation, while others scatter in a loose formation. When they arrive at their 'homes', the forest comes alive with their chirping.|||In the afternoon, the forest appears as a soft, green silk ribbon, dotted with the colors of birds rushing back to their nests. They fly in separate flocks, each species seemingly following its own route. It's as if there's an unspoken agreement among the species, with each having its own territory. The scene is dotted with the black birds perched on tall trees and the white egrets resting on mid-level branches.|||The air is filled with a variety of sounds: the rustling of leaves, the flapping of wings, and the chirping of birds calling out to their young. It's like a symphony composed for visitors from afar.|||As night falls, nocturnal birds begin to stir, breaking the silence of the forest. These sounds are like the forest's breath, reconnecting humans with nature. Thanks to the province's investment, a canal was dug around the garden, and a water body and fish ponds were created, providing a food source that has helped restore the natural environment. As a result, the bird population has grown and diversified.

title: Cao Van Lau Memorial Zone
description: In 2008, this place was renovated and expanded over an area of approximately 2800m2 with structures including a three-gate entrance, a covered area for the musician's tomb, a bust of Cao Van Lau, a display house for documents and artifacts, an outdoor stage, and a reception house.|||The Cao Van Lau Memorial is located in Ward 2, Bac Lieu City. Initially, it was the musician's family tomb. Later, it was restored and additional structures were built to host important events and welcome visitors from afar.|||The memorial of musician Cao Van Lau was added to the National Intangible Cultural Heritage list by the Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism in 2012.|||The Cao Van Lau Memorial Zone in Bac Lieu consists of several structures. These include the musician's tomb along with those of his family members, and a bust of Cao Van Lau. There is also a display area featuring images and artifacts of the forefathers of Cai Luong in Southern Vietnam. Notably, there is also a symbolic khuong (bamboo) tree, an outdoor stage, …|||As soon as visitors pass through the main gate, they will encounter the bamboo tube monument located in the memorial area. This monument is the Kim Dam - a symbol of traditional Don Ca Tai Tu music of Southern Vietnam. The Kim Dam is stylized from bamboo sections, with the body of the instrument carved out to create a mystical and sacred atmosphere. It also evokes nostalgia and remembrance for those who have passed away. This is also a place where visitors can light incense for remembrance.|||The mystical and sacred aspect here is the staircase to the tube bamboo stage, which is arranged with a specific number of steps. Such as 2, 4, 8, 16, 32, and 64, symbolizing the tones and rhythms of Cai Luong classical singing. Also corresponding to each artisan's creation: Cao Van Lau's 2-beat, Trinh Thien Tu's 4-beat, Lu Hoa Nghi's 8-beat, Mong Van's 16-beat, Tran Tan Hung's 32-beat, and Ly Khi's 64-beat.|||The staircase is adorned with a green Thanh Hoa stone railing carved with dragon shapes. The dragon's posture follows the staircase, combining with cloud patterns to create a meaningful combination. Because Bac Lieu is considered the cradle of cai luong, a traditional form of music, which developed strongly in the southern region. The development and strength of this traditional music are likened to a dragon.|||Around the bamboo pipe monument, 20 poems are engraved on stone. These include 3 Southern poems, 6 Northern poems, 4 Lament poems, and 7 large Northern poems. Behind the Kim lute symbol is a monument of musician Cao Van Lau. The song "Dạ cổ hoài lang" by Cao Van Lau is engraved right behind.|||Behind the harp symbol is a park with musical instrument symbols. These instruments are part of the art of traditional folk music in Southern Vietnam. They include flute, co guitar, tranh zither, dan bau monochord, tumba guitar, etc.|||The unique feature of this music garden is that the instruments are entirely carved from green stone. They look very solid and soulful, and the stone color harmonizes with the green of the surrounding trees.|||To the left is a memorial house for the late musician Cao Van Lau. To the right are the service blocks. At the back is a performance house for the traditional Don Ca Tai Tu music form, situated on a lotus pond.|||If visitors want to admire precious art materials about cai luong singing. Or admire images of typical cai luong artists and artisans of Bac Lieu, the display area is a must-visit. Inside, there are stage costumes of many famous cai luong artists.|||And recreated scenes of cai luong singing with wax figures or ancient musical instruments of artisans.|||Visitors will learn about the golden age of traditional Vietnamese music and Cai Luong opera. They will also discover the historical context behind the song 'Dạ Cổ Hoài Lang' (The Sound of the Night Drum Reminds Me of My Husband).|||After over 100 years since its creation, the timeless song 'Dạ cổ hoài lang' by musician Cao Van Lau continues to touch the hearts of millions of Vietnamese people with its deep emotions and conjugal love.

title: Phu An Bamboo Village
description: From an ecological bamboo conservation project, Phu An Bamboo Village (Phu An commune, Ben Cat town) has become a "green tourism" destination, welcoming around 10,000 domestic and international visitors annually. The provincial and local tourism industries are currently promoting this site to attract more tourists from within and outside the country.

title: Thuy Chau Tourist Area
description: Thuy Chau Tourist Area is a new and popular destination near Ho Chi Minh City, chosen by many young people and families for weekend getaways. Located about 25km from Ho Chi Minh City, in Binh Thang commune, Di An town, Binh Duong province,|||Thuy Chau is an ideal place for those seeking a peaceful escape from the hustle and bustle of city life in Saigon, or for a short trip to strengthen family bonds.|||This eco-tourism area, built as an artificial entertainment complex spanning 18 hectares, boasts natural scenery, from trees and streams to forests,|||The moment you step foot here, you'll be captivated by its beauty. The pathway is lined with tall trees that seem to stretch on forever, leading you to the largest artificial waterfall in Binh Duong province.|||Occasionally, leaves fall to the ground, creating a romantic scene reminiscent of Korea. Be sure to capture these moments on your phone.|||In Thuy Chau, you can immerse yourself in nature: lush greenery, gentle streams, and birds singing.|||All these elements combine to create a breathtakingly beautiful scene, making you forget that this is an artificial tourist area. Many visitors have praised it as a mini Dalat, with its lush greenery, fresh air, and peaceful atmosphere.|||At Thuy Chau Tourist Area, you'll have an unforgettable experience swimming in the clear, cool waters of the artificial waterfall. Invite your friends and family to let the strong currents wash away your worries.|||Although it's an artificial waterfall, it looks like a natural creation. The water flows gently over the rocks, creating a beautiful landscape like a painting.|||Thuy Chau Tourist Area is an ideal spot for a day trip, offering a serene beauty that's hard to find elsewhere. Not only can you enjoy the majestic natural scenery like in Dalat, but you can also take beautiful photos like in Korea, and experience the modern European-style swimming pool, covering 1,200m2, where you can relax and unwind with your loved ones.

title: Dau Tieng Lake Tourist Area
description: Dau Tieng Lake is located on the border of three provinces: Binh Duong, Binh Phuoc, and Tay Ninh. It plays a crucial role in the economic development of this region, particularly in terms of irrigation.|||This lake is the largest man-made lake in Vietnam, covering an area of 27km2 and holding approximately 1.58 billion cubic meters of water.|||In addition to supplying water to the Saigon River and surrounding areas, the lake has also been developed for tourism services in recent years, attracting thousands of visitors annually.

title: Thanh Le Water Park
description: The park features a children's lake for kids. Children can play games with steam trains, small slides, and water-spraying mushroom, turtle, and crocodile statues…suitable for young children.|||The park also has a wave lake with many exciting wave programs: 0.9m high waves, short waves, single waves, double waves, and intersecting waves…|||After playtime, visitors can relax on the lazy river. The lazy river creates whirlpools, giving a new and thrilling feeling.|||In addition to the swimming lakes, there is a system of slides, including a three-lane slide 6m high, and closed and open spiral slides 9m high, creating a strong sensation, dropping from above into the lake.

title: Cafe Gió & Nước Bình Dương
description: Designed by renowned architect Vo Trong Nghia, the cafe's main concept is to utilize natural water and ventilation to cool the building, creating a spacious and natural atmosphere.|||In 2016, Cafe Gio and Nuoc (wNw Cafe) by architect Vo Trong Nghia and his team made a breakthrough in Binh Duong with a unique design that won the second prize at the Vietnam Architecture Award in 2006. Later, architect Vo Trong Nghia became the first Vietnamese to win the Golden Medal at the Arcasia Awards in 2007-2008 for the 'Cafe Gio and Nuoc' in Binh Duong. The cafe continuously gained success with international awards, including the second prize at the international bamboo architecture competition organized by Bamboo Technologies Maui (USA) in 2007 and the International Architecture Award (IAA) in the US in 2009.|||The cafe immediately attracted modern and nature-loving customers, showcasing its unique appeal. The owner shared that 'Binh Duong is changing, and we will attract customers from in and out of the province and foreign tourists who love Vietnamese culture.'|||The new wNw maintains its closeness to nature and people, with an open space and the use of natural materials like bamboo, wood, and stone. The cafe's design aims to convey traditional Vietnamese values, symbolized by the purity of the lotus flower. The tre garden represents the community and bonding between family and friends, providing an ideal spot for relaxation and gatherings. The building uses wind and water to create a natural air conditioner. The bar area has been adjusted to serve groups and families for events and celebrations.|||In the new plan, wNw will feature entertainment programs, prize draws, music performances, and exchanges with singers from Ho Chi Minh City and Binh Duong. The prices of drinks and snacks will be suitable for both local and international customers.

title: Phuoc Loc Tho Ancient Village Tourist Area
description: Phuoc Loc Tho ancient village is located in Huu Thanh commune, Duc Hoa district, Long An province, a unique attraction of Long An tourism. The entire ancient village covers an area of about 10 hectares, constructed in 2006. Some main activities in the village include: Visiting the complex of ancient houses; exploring the orchid garden, ancient trees, and bonsai hills; visiting the petting zoo…

title: Binh Thanh Ancient Tower
description: Located on the right bank of the Vam Co Dong River, Binh Thanh ancient tower is an ancient land of Oc Eo culture existing from the 8th century to present. The tower is 10m high, each side is 5m long and faces the four directions of East-West-South-North.|||The main door of Binh Thanh ancient tower faces East, while the other three sides have fake doors with intricate carvings.|||The tower is considered a very solid architectural work, which has survived from the 8th century and remains largely intact. The Indochina Research Institute discovered the tower in 1886. The site was ranked as an architectural and artistic relic in 1993 and restored in 1999.|||The number of tourists visiting this place is increasing, and if you visit Tay Ninh, don't miss this site!

title: Go Chua Fruit Garden
description: Mentioning the Southern region, everyone thinks of the freshest and most delicious fruit gardens, and Tay Ninh is no exception. Go Chua Fruit Garden is a popular destination where you can visit vast fruit orchards and taste the fresh and delicious fruits right on the spot.|||The hospitality and warmth of the people in these fruit gardens will make you remember the delicious fruit gardens forever. You can also pick and choose fruits to buy as gifts for your loved ones at home.

title: Eco-Tourism in Tan Tuyen Tram Forest
description: An Giang is a land that makes a strong impression on many tourists not only because it is a place where many distinctive cultures of Kinh, Hoa, Cham, and Khmer communities converge, but also owns the characteristic gentle beauty of the Mekong delta. It also boasts diverse natural scenery, from vast green rice fields, mystical Co To Mountain, towering thot not trees in Tinh Bien, the mysterious That Son range, to numerous historical and cultural relics.|||However, perhaps the most memorable destination when traveling to An Giang is the vast and lush Tram forests. Besides the poetic and picturesque Tra Su Tram forest, which has become a top check-in spot in the Mekong Delta, the Tan Tuyen Tram forest has recently become a popular tourist attraction. Let's explore this appealing An Giang tourist spot with LuhanhVietNam!|||Tan Tuyen Melaleuca Forest is located in Tri Ton and Tinh Bien districts. This famous An Giang tourist site covers an area of 1752 ha out of a total of 1928.4 ha in the district.|||The An Giang tràm forest in general, and the Tân Tuyến forest in particular, have great potential for eco-tourism development. Most importantly, they boast an incredibly diverse system of flora and fauna. People often mention famous An Giang eco-tourism sites like the Keo Thien Tue forest, Vo Ba at Cam Mountain, O Tuk Xa keo forest in Chi Lang, Soai So mango forest in Tri Ton district, the ancient Thien Tue forest on Co To Mountain in Tri Ton, and now the Tân Tuyến tràm forest in An Giang.|||This place not only has vast areas covered in lush green tràm forests, but also boasts a thriving algae ecosystem with many different species, including green algae, diatomaceous algae, blue algae, golden algae, eye algae, yellow algae, and armored algae. Many of these species serve as nutritious food sources for fish and shrimp in the tràm forests.||||||This is a significant advantage of this tram forest, as it creates favorable conditions for building a complete tourism service to recreate the activities of a military zone. This allows tourists to experience the appealing and captivating life of soldiers. If you're a fan of the 2020 military service program that's currently trending on social media, you shouldn't miss this forest.|||The Tan Tuyen tram forest has a system of military huts, watchtowers, and Hoang Cam stoves. Photo: Lang Thang An Giang|||While Tra Su Cajuput Forest boasts a long wooden bridge and a beautiful birdhouse pier reminiscent of European scenery, Tan Tuyen An Giang Cajuput Forest features a 5,000m-long wooden bridge from the main axis to the sub-camps, winding through the forest, allowing visitors to experience a more authentic and intimate connection with nature.|||You can take a motorboat ride around the melaleuca forest to admire the trees, birds and egrets or walk on the bridge under the shade of the melaleuca forest to explore the pristine scenery around. Don't forget to check-in with poetic photos at this new destination in An Giang.|||In addition, Tan Tuyen An Giang tram forest offers various eco-tourism activities that promise to bring new experiences of flood season tourism in the Mekong Delta. You can join together to set up a net, cast a fishing basket to catch fish, shrimp, crab and enjoy rustic cuisine with many delicious dishes from Chau Doc, Tinh Bien, Tri Ton,...|||Another exciting update for travelers who love exploring the Mekong Delta region: a rest stop with food and beverage services is currently being completed. The project is expected to be finished before the 2021 Lunar New Year.|||Explore Tan Tuyen An Giang melaleuca forest - a conserved wetland forest|||This area is being planned for eco-tourism development|||With a total area of 1,672ha, Tan Tuyen An Giang Tram Forest is currently being listed as a natural wetland forest conservation area. Of which, 250ha in Zone A is currently zoned for tourism development and exploitation. The Tram Forest landscape protection area will consist of 3 functional sub-zones, all located in plot 1, section 30B. Notably, the strictly protected sub-zone covers an area of 81.85ha with lots 6, 10, 11, 12, 13, 14, 15 (adjacent to An Giang Provincial Military Farm).|||The ecological restoration sub-area covers approximately 94.06ha, including lots: 7, 8, 9 and 16 (belonging to plot 1, small zone 30B).|||The administrative - service sub-area has a total area of 80.48ha, including lots: 1, 2, 3, 4 and 5.|||In addition, according to the above regulations, the buffer zone of Tan Tuyen An Giang Tram Forest Landscape Protection Area has an area of approximately 380.9ha, located in Tan Duc, Tan An and Tan Loi hamlets, Tan Tuyen commune, Tinh Bien district, An Giang province. With these planning and special investment regimes, this pristine tram forest promises to be a new destination in An Giang in 2021, let's plan to explore this place with your close friends right away.

title: My Khanh Mulberry Garden in An Giang
description: This mulberry garden is worth the trip. From Long Xuyen direction, cross Ton Duc Thang bridge (parallel to Cau Quay), there will be a sign directing you to turn left to My Khanh. After nearly 30 minutes, you'll arrive|||It's best to visit in the early morning when the garden hasn't been harvested yet, so you can pick the ripe ones. The ripe ones are purple, while the red ones are still unripe. The garden owner is very friendly and welcoming, allowing you to pick mulberries freely, but be reasonable. You can buy them for 30-40 thousand dong per kilogram. They also offer mulberry jam and smoothies for 15k. Additionally, you can find boiled snails with lemongrass and a dipping sauce made with a type of citrus fruit. Overall, it's delicious, nutritious, and affordable. A great eco-tourism spot!

title: Yen Tu Historical and Scenic Site
description: The Yen Tu Historical and Scenic Site stretches nearly 20 km in Phuong Dong ward and Thuong Yen Cong commune, Uong Bi city, Quang Ninh province. It was ranked as a national historical site by the State in 1974 and recognized as a Special National Historical Site in 2012.|||Yen Tu Mountain is 1,068m above sea level, the highest peak of the Yen Tu Mountain Range in the Dong Trieu Arc. Since ancient times, Yen Tu has been considered a sacred land, a land of blessings. This place has majestic natural scenery, preserving ancient historical and cultural values of the Vietnamese nation.|||Yen Tu Mountain has been known by various names, including Phun Van Son (Cloudy Mountain), Tuong Son (Elephant Mountain), Yen Son (Yen Mountain), Bach Van Son (White Cloud Mountain), and Linh Son (Sacred Mountain).|||The name 'Yen Tu' is associated with a legend about a hermit named An Ky Sinh from the North who came to this mountain to cultivate and practice alchemy. He built a hut on the mountain, picked herbs to make medicine, and helped the local people.|||The locals loved and respected him, calling him Thay An (An Tu in Chinese), and the mountain became known as An Tu Son (Thay An's mountain).|||Over time, the name evolved into Yen Tu due to a taboo on using the title of An Do Vuong Trinh Cuong during the Le Trung Hung period.|||Yen Tu is the birthplace of the Truc Lam Yen Tu Zen sect. This place is associated with the extraordinary name and career of King Tran Nhan Tong, who became a Buddha. After leading the army and people of Dai Viet to victory against the Mongol invaders twice (1285-1288), he abdicated, became a monk, and went to Yen Tu to practice Buddhism (August 1299) with the dharma name Huong Van Dai Dau Da and the title Truc Lam Dai Sy. He then established the Truc Lam Yen Tu Zen sect, which carries a distinct Vietnamese identity and profoundly influences the later development of Vietnamese Buddhism.|||The Yen Tu Historical and Cultural Heritage Site is a complex of Buddhist architecture, comprising 10 temples: Bi Thuong Temple (Trinh Temple), Suoi Tam Temple, Cam Thuc Temple, Lan Temple - Truc Lam Yen Tu Zen Monastery, Giai Oan Temple, Hoa Yen Temple, Mot Mai Temple, Bao Sai Temple, Van Tieu Temple, and Dong Temple; numerous ruins of hermitages such as Lo Ren Hermitage, Thien Dinh Hermitage, Diêm Hermitage, Hoa Hermitage, Duoc Hermitage; and many tomb towers dedicated to Zen masters from the Tran - Le dynasties, concentrated in tower gardens: Hue Quang, Hon Ngoc, Lan Temple, Vong Tien Cung, or located in front of temples like Bi Thuong, Giai Oan, Mot Mai, Bao Sai... along with thousands of ancient artifacts within a 2,783ha area of Yen Tu National Forest, featuring a rich and diverse flora and fauna system, with many species listed in the Vietnam Red Book. Yen Tu can be likened to a living museum of historical, cultural, and spiritual values, and a museum of biodiversity.|||Currently, Yen Tu historical and scenic site has been completed by Quang Ninh Province in coordination with Hai Duong and Bac Giang provinces to submit a dossier to UNESCO for recognition as a world heritage site.|||[1] This is the general name of two large mountain ranges forming a bow-shape, namely Nam Mau (Yen Tu) and Binh Lieu along with the rocky hills in between. The Dong Trieu Arc is located in the east of the Northeast region of Vietnam, spanning across Quang Ninh, Lang Son, Bac Giang, Hai Duong and Hai Phong provinces.|||[2] According to the Complete Historical Records of Dai Viet

title: Ba Vang Pagoda
description: The pagoda is located on Thanh Dang mountain, part of the Dong Trieu mountain range, in Quang Trung ward, Uong Bi town, Quang Ninh province. The pagoda's name in Chinese is Bao Quang Tu, which means 'temple of precious light'. It is also known as Ba Vang, referring to the three precious jewels of Buddhism: Buddha, Dharma, and Sangha|||The pagoda was originally built in 1705 during the reign of King Le Du Tong. After centuries, the old pagoda no longer exists, leaving only some remains such as stone steles, stone turtles, and broken tiles. In 1988, a new pagoda was built using wood and bamboo, and in 1993, it was rebuilt with stone, bricks, and cement on a small scale|||In 2007, the pagoda was recognized as a provincial historical and cultural site by the Quang Ninh provincial government, and monk Thich Truc Thai Minh was appointed as the abbot. On October 30, 2009, the provincial government approved a plan to preserve and restore the pagoda. On January 1, 2011, the pagoda began its reconstruction project, and by 2014, the first phase was completed, featuring a large main hall, bell tower, drum tower, and other facilities. The pagoda received a record for having the largest main hall in Indochina|||The pagoda continues to expand with a second phase, including a grand lecture hall, dining hall, and other buildings. With its impressive architecture, Ba Vang Pagoda has received records for having the largest Buddhist lecture hall on a mountain worldwide

title: Den Cong Temple - Long Khanh Pagoda - Co Linh Shrine
description: Den Cong Temple, originally named 'Den Cong Dinh' in Chinese, is located in the Den Cong 2 area of Trung Vuong ward, Uong Bi city, Quang Ninh province. The temple is a special national historical site and part of the Bach Dang historical complex.|||The temple honors the village's tutelary deity, Tran Hung Dao, and five generals who helped him win the Bach Dang battle: Cao Son, Quy Minh, Nam Hai Ton Than, Phi Bong, and Bach Thach. These deities were believed to have guided Tran Hung Dao to choose the ancient tree near Den Cong as the signal fire location for the battle against the Mongol invaders in 1288.|||The temple was built to commemorate the victory and express gratitude to national heroes. The name 'Den Cong' reflects the people's wish to repay the debt of merit to their heroes.|||Den Cong Temple has a close relationship with Co Linh Shrine, about 1km away. According to legend and historical records, Co Linh Shrine was built in the early 14th century but was damaged in 1954. The artifacts were moved to Den Cong Temple for worship. The shrine was rebuilt in 2014 and expanded in 2017.|||Every year on the 13th, 14th, and 15th of the first lunar month, the temple holds a festival to honor the deities and pray for favorable weather and a good harvest.|||Long Khanh Pagoda, located next to Den Cong Temple, is a place of Buddhist worship and cultural activities for locals.|||Den Cong Temple, Long Khanh Pagoda, and Co Linh Shrine are among the key sites in the Bach Dang Victory Relic Site, along with other historical sites like Bai Coc, Vua Ba Shrine, and Yen Giang Temple.

title: Pho Am Pagoda
description: Located at the foot of Duat Van mountain in Bac Son ward, 4km from Uong Bi city center, Pho Am Pagoda is also known as Am Pagoda (or Am Van Tu in Chinese characters). The name Pho Am can be interpreted as 'broad understanding', with 'Pho' meaning 'wide' and 'Am' meaning 'understanding'.|||According to the inscription on the stone incense burner, one of the ancient artifacts still preserved today, Am Pagoda was built in 1705 during the reign of King Le Du Tong, under the Vinh Thinh era. Pho Am Pagoda was constructed on a high, airy, and bright plot of land, with its facade facing southeast. A small stream runs in front of the pagoda, with the gentle Uong River in the distance. This stunning location creates a serene and peaceful atmosphere.|||Over its 300-year history, Pho Am Pagoda has undergone several restorations. The first renovation took place in 1802 during the reign of King Gia Long. In 1979, the pagoda underwent major repairs. In 1994, the worship hall was rebuilt, and in 2002, the entire Main Hall, ancestral house, and other structures were restored.|||Today, Pho Am Pagoda showcases the architectural style of the Nguyen dynasty. The main hall, designed in the shape of the Chinese character 'Cong', covers an area of 350m² and features 3 front chambers, 2 side chambers, and 3 rear chambers. The pagoda serves as both a place of Buddhist worship and a hub for cultural and spiritual activities for the local community.

title: Lung Xanh Waterfall
description: Located just over 2km from Uong Bi city, in Quang Trung ward, Lung Xanh is nestled in a sacred area connected to Yen Tu Mountain, Trung Yen Lake, and shares the same water source as Ba Vang Pagoda.|||Lung Xanh boasts a rich natural vegetation, with many gentle streams and waterfalls meandering through the forest canopy, creating a breathtaking natural landscape with three consecutive waterfalls cascading down, cool and beautiful like a natural painting gifted to Uong Bi city. This is why it's called Lung Xanh, meaning “green-blue water”, surrounded by lush trees, consecutive waterfalls, and scattered rocks of various shapes and sizes along the winding stream that flows through the green forest. Each waterfall has clear and calm pools, reflecting the sky and forest, creating a fresh atmosphere and beautiful scenery.|||In addition to its natural beauty, the Lung Xanh area is closely linked to the Yen Tu historical site and connected to Yen Trung Lake, making it a special ecological area in Uong Bi that attracts tourists from near and far.

title: Museum - Library of Quang Ninh Province - October 30th Square
description: The Quang Ninh Museum and Library is a key project celebrating the 50th anniversary of the province's establishment (October 30th, 1963 - October 30th, 2013).|||With its unique architecture, beautiful space, and numerous valuable exhibits, the Quang Ninh Museum and Library has become a new tourist attraction, drawing large crowds of locals and visitors. The complex has a total investment of over 900 billion VND, comprising three interconnected buildings via elevated walkways, including the museum, library, and conference areas. The library building, adjacent to the museum, is designed in a modern style, with the ground floor storing over 100,000 books, newspapers, and magazines across various fields. However, the museum still has many empty spaces that have not been utilized for exhibits, such as the first-floor area featuring natural wonders, the third floor showcasing coal and a special exhibit on President Ho Chi Minh's connection to Quang Ninh, as well as the ethnic groups of Quang Ninh; the conference block only has an exhibit on artifacts on its second floor.

title: Ha Long Market 1
description: Located in the heart of Ha Long city, this market is the main commercial hub of Quang Ninh province. Stalls selling coal souvenirs, seafood products, wooden items, and fresh seafood, including squid cakes, attract many tourists. The market offers a wide range of goods, from everyday items to high-end products, with a significant portion being Chinese-made. The seafood here is fresh and affordable. Notably, Ha Long Market is famous for its squid cakes, which are grilled to perfection, emitting a tempting aroma that makes it hard for visitors to resist trying some and remembering the taste forever.

title: Vincom Ha Long Center
description: Designed in luxurious European royal style, this complex features a high-end shopping center, educational and health consulting services for children, a dining area, ice skating rink, cinema, and game zone. As the largest commercial center in Quang Ninh Province and one of the biggest in the northern region, Vincom Ha Long Center will be a landmark in the heart of Ha Long City, offering a comprehensive range of services and a must-visit tourist destination for travelers to Quang Ninh

title: Marine Plaza Shopping Center
description: The Ha Long Marine Plaza complex, invested and developed by Syrena Vietnam, features a range of unique services including entertainment zones, traditional craft villages, water parks, shopping centers, food courts, seafood night markets, and international standard cinemas. Ha Long Marine Plaza is a must-visit destination for tourists traveling to Ha Long Bay. Strategically located between Tuan Chau and Bai Chay, the complex welcomes a large number of tourists, around 2000-2500 international and domestic visitors daily. With synchronized planning, smooth transportation, and new developments since 2013, including the annual Carnaval festival and a new financial center, Ha Long Marine has become an ideal choice for tourism and hotel investors.|||

title: My Ngoc Pearl Center - Ha Long Pearl Joint Stock Company
description: This center showcases and sells pearl jewelry and souvenir products made from oyster shells, all of which are cultivated directly in Ha Long Bay using Japanese technology. The products are diverse and fashionable, attracting many tourists. Currently, My Ngoc Center has drawn in numerous tour groups, with the main clientele being European tourists, averaging around 1000 visitors per day. The center also offers a beautiful view of Ha Long Bay, a green tree system, and recreational activities for tourists, including fishing, lake viewing, and countryside photography.

title: Cai Lan Temple
description: Today, Cai Lan Temple (Temple of Cai Lan) no longer holds any historical evidence that can clearly tell its story. Legend has it that the temple dates back to the Tran Dynasty. Strategically located where six rivers meet the sea, Hung Dao Vuong had a temple built here to oversee the waters, and he brought incense from Mau Thac Han Son Temple in Ha Trung district, all the way from Thanh Hoa, to bless the temple.
